seconde tome volume paraphrase erasmus vpon newe testament conteynyng epistle paul apostle wherunto added paraphrase vpon reuelacion iohn impriented london fletestrete signe sunne edwarde whitchurche xvi daye august cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum anno excellent prince moste deare soueraigne lorde kyng edwarde sixte grace god kyng england fraunce irelande defender faith erth vnder christe churche englande irelande supreme head mercyfully dyd almightie god poure manifolde benefites vpon hys people israell tyme theyr deare soueraigne moses consideracyon gracyous god louynglye chosen himselfe afore people done greate thinges euen myddes amonge enemy wonderfully deliuered tyrannye egipte fatherlye noryshed wildernesse yea gaue deare lyght knowlege openyng vnto holy lawe also sent suche gouernor aboue al prince erth time scripture witnessing bare name faithfulnesse louyng kyndnesse mostenum xii eccle xlv hebr iii feruente erneste cause god also moste gracyous toward hys subiectes saye considering euident demonstracyons god inestimable loue fauor toward thought themselues moste bound trueth euen veray loue serue hym agayne whiche thing notably declared whan commaundement geuen theyr soueraigne shewed selues willing glad cherefull fre harted worke settyng vp tabernacle whiche worke brought though brasse fyrre tre suche thynges farre vnder estymacyon golde siluer precious stone yet welcome accepted vnfained hert good willes sake also poore wedow twomarke xii lu xxi cor viii mytes holy apostle paul witnesseth yf mynde willynge accepted accordynge manne hathe accordynge hathe whiche cherefull readynes minde subiectes came onely thorowe mocion holy gooste euen dyd greately reioyce heart noble moses muche texte sayeth whan sawe vniformely brought theyr gyftes endeuored selues perfourme euery thing tabernacle according comaundement lorde blessed saye commended praised theyr labor well lyked theyr doynges well pleased withall suche godly prynces wedded almighty god feruent settinge forthe honor ready take paynes redressing thinges amysse desyrous haue house god repayred hys tabernacle set vp trewe seruice worship restored people brought vnitie faythe loue hym amonge selues theyr onely studye delyte pleasure haue suche louyng sorte subiectes beholding consideringe greate godlynes gracious di posicion theyr soueraigne muste nedes onely aknowlage suche infinite kyndnesse god also remembraunce thereof laboure studie theyr vocacion shewe selues agayne gladlie aswell thankefull mercifull god obedient louynge prynce consequently veray loue serue charitably disposed theyr neghbours yea moste willynge brynge haue furtheraunce god honoure repayringe house edifiyng true congregacyon church though laboures true subiectes rude homely vnperfecte yet proceade mynde willing geue hathe de irous also yet able highnesse high chiefe admirall great nauy lord hoostes amongst v principall captaine gouernour v vnder hym moste noble ruler shippe euen comfortable noah eternal god hath chose bringer v vnto rest quietnesse royall maiestie say going imperiall office hauyng intierly beloued vncle lord protectours grace residue highnes worthy counsailours nobilitie clargie deputy officer estate al youre louyng subiectes hath set vp sayle already well forward godlie iourney gracious winde holy gost seruing maketh many faythfull subiecte youres according calling requireth come good pase yea aswel occupied canne good seruyce vnder possible within feare god grace obedience royall maiestie whome high gouernaunce youre realmes dominion committed godly occupied prudent wholsome aduyce ministerie noble vncle counsail continueth stil stopping vp gappes antichriste false doctryne hath made byneyarde lorde buyld agayne walles hys house whiche thorowe ydolatrie superstycyon euel custome horryble abuse hathe bene broken downe truly youre noble actes statute proclamacions iniunccions testifie godly homelies notable worke erasmus paraphrasis vpon holy euangelistes distinctelye red practised suche discrecion youre highnesse hathe commaunded worthy compared ryche iewels moses vsed pleasaut garnishing tabernacle sacred byble volume god holy boke set forth maiesties appoyntment dewly practised holy exercyses within church like fayrest floure garden precious perle god iewel house eue maiestie god high minister behalfe hath graciously made v partaker therof thorow vertuous proceadinges againe acknowlege selfes lesse boud maiesty trueth dede israelite first soueraigne moses briging egipt c setting vp tabernacle afterward noble king iosias restoring againe boke law cast aside also abolishing great ydolatrie sinne among would veray loth bryng nothing moste excellent worke wherin youre maiestie godly proceadeth like youre moste noble father moste famous memory moste valeauntly begonne certes whan loke behinde call remembraunce euen shorte day tyme sore haue bene blynded seduced hindred true waye christes doctrine strongly wicked delusion antichriste according paules prophecie hath preuailed sectes perdicion deuelishe doctrine straunge inuencions corrupte menne vayne pylgremages offerynges lyghtes stockes stone costly deckyng lyckinge censinge worshipping ymages horrible abusing god holy sacramentes good creature thousandes moe inconueniences moste wicked beast rome hathe brought specially thys youre realme howe shamefully presumtuously euen nature proude lucifer hathe vsurped imperiall power therof horryblye hathe abused maiestie kynges highnesse moste noble progenitours realme englande howe cruelly also vnreuerently hathe dealte theyr moste royall personnes yea howe ishlye vnder colour god seruyce hath robbed theyr good herted subiectes theyr substaunce goodes thus moste deare soueraigne whan remembre moste lamentable case wherein grace realme hath bene considre againe syde moste pleasaunt shape bewtifull face conce nynge deare knowlege god maiesties gracious proceadinges moste like vnto prosperous raigne blessed kinge iosias fynde myselfe dette bound doe youre grace trewe subiectes esteme selues without doubte onely thankefulnesse moste humbly embrace suche inestymable kyndnesse god also sprede abrode suche godly quyet sorte maye serue moste sainctifiyng halowing hys holy name furtheraunce hys kingdome encoraging men increase knowlage good pleasure gladly obeye considering maiestie saide godlie worke lordes tabernacle ready youre worthy counsaillours officer seruauntes heauenly endewed subiectes bothe clargie laitie bringing gold siluer brasse sum presentes c according measure giftes almightie god hath richely reposed youre trew faithfull subiectes translatours printer right fruteful volume coteining paraphrasis famous clarke erasmus vpon epistle holy apostle moste humblye offre vnto highnesse trewe faithfull diligence herein chereful hertes glad good willes trust youre royall maiestie ensample noble moses bothe blesse graciously accepte according pryncely benignitie fauoure desyre none wyse spende theyr time saue onely may moste glory god discharge duty vnfayned loue obedience within hys feare owe grace comfortable remembraunce whiche moste vertuous disposicion royall maiestie hathe greatly encoraged desyred moste humblye wryte thys litle epystle vnto muche afrayed thus doe respecte myne owne greate vnworthynesse moued therto thorowe plentifull grace almightie god incomparable clemencye whiche notablye placed highnesse grace trewe faythfull louynge subiectes beholde se lyke ye vnto auncient kynges prince moses iosua dauid iosaphat ezechias iosias moste rightfull wholesome administracion highe imperiall office oure greate comforte finde ready euen still loke like prosperous successe welth felicitie increase contynuaunce whiche dede muste nedes ensue folowe amongst v yf thorowe wicked perswasyon sathan corrupte example world selues increase vnthankfulnesse moste royall maiestie like called god thys supreme office gouernyng people enclyned moste blessed mocion holy spirite still excute al gracious wise euen proceading therin highnesse may assured haue gracious defence god like prosperous increase moste excellent giftes sayd noble kinges partaker eternall euerliuing god possessor heauen erthe strengthen establish highnesse suche sorte maye moste glory holy name increase kyngdome cherefull perfourmynge hys wyll honour quietnesse maiestie fynallye comforte welthe youre louynge subiectes maiesties humble faithfull subiecte myles couerdall amen prologe vpon epistle sainct paule romaynes much thys epistle principall moste excellente parte newe testament moste pure euangelion saye glad tydinges call gospell also light waye vnto whole scripture thinke mete euery christen man know rote without boke also exercyse hym selfe therein euermore continually dayly breade soule man verely rede ofte studye well studyed easier shewed pleasanter groundely serched precyouser thynges founde greate treasure spirituall thynges lyeth hyd therin therfore bestowe laboure diligence thorow lytel preface prologue prepare waye vnto farforth god shal geue grace maye better vnderstande euery man hathe bene hetherto euyll darckened gloses wonderfull dreames sophisters man coulde spie entent meaning neuerthelesse yet selfe bryght lyght sufficient geue light vnto scripture fyrst muste marke diligentlie maner speaking apostle aboue thing know paul meaneth wordes law syn grace faith righteousnes flesh sprite like el rede thou neuer ofte thou shalt lose thy labour word law may vnderstand comune maner vse paules terme maner men man way thou wouldest say law place wer nothing learning teacheth ought done ought done goeth man lawe law fulfilled outward workes though herte neuer farre god iudgeth grounde heart yea thoughtes secret monynges mynde therfore lawe requyreth grounde herte loue botome therof contente outwarde worke onely rebuketh workes whiche spring loue ground low botome herte though appere outward neuer honest good christ gospel rebuketh pharises aboue al open sinner calleth ypocrites saye simulars painted sepulcres pharises yet lyued men pure perteyning outewarde dedes workes lawe yea paul thyrd chapter hys epistle vnto philippian confesseth hym selfe touchynge lawe suche one man coulde complayne withstanding yet murderer christen persecuted formented sore compelled blaspheme christ together mercilesse many fayne outwarde good workes cause cxv psalme calleth men lyars anne kepeth lawe grounde herte nether kepe though appeare outward full good workes men naturally enclyned vnto euyll hate lawe fynde oure selues vnlust tediousnes good lust delecracion euyll nowe fre lust good botome hert fulfilleth lawe doubte also sinne wrath deferued god though neuer greate outwarde shew appearaunce honest liuinge cause concludeth saynte paule seconde chapter iewes al sinner transgressor lawe though thei make men beleue thorow ypocrisy outwarde workes fulfil law sayeth onely whiche doeth lawe righteous god meanyng therby man outward workes fulfilleth lawe thou ayeth iewe teachest breake wedlocke yet breakest wedlocke thy selfe wherin thou iudgest man therin condemnest thou thy selfe thou thy self doest euen thinges thou iudgest though woulde saye thou liuest outwardly well workes lawe iudgest liue thou teachest menne seest moote mannes eye art ware beame thyne owne eye though thou kepe lawe outwardly workes feare rebuke shame punnyshment eyther loue rewarde vauntage vayne glory yet doest thou without luste loue towarde lawe haddest leuer greate deale otherwise yf thou diddest feare lawe yea inwardly thine hert thou wouldest lawe yet god auctor vengear lawe yf possible paynefull vnto haue thyne appetite refrayned kepte downe wherfore plaine conclusion thou ground bo ome thine hearte arte enemy lawe preuayleth thou teacheste man steale thou thyne owne selfe arte thefe thyne hert outwardly wouldest faine steale yf thou durst though outward dedes abyde alwaye behinde suche ipocrites dissimulars breake forth amonge euen euyll scabbe pocke cannot allwayes kepte violence medicine thou teachest man teachest thy selfe yea thou woteste thou teachest thou vnderstandest lawe right howe cannot fulfilled satisfyed vnfained loue affeccion greately cannot fulfylled outwarde dedes workes onely moreouer lawe encreaseth synne sayeth fyfte chapter man enemye lawe muche requyreth many thynges clene contrarie nature whereof able fulfyll one pointe title lawe requireth therfore prouoked haue greater lust breake whiche cause sake sayeth seuenth chapter law spirituall though woulde saye yf lawe fleshlye man doctrine myght fulfylled satysfyed stylled outwarde dedes nowe lawe gostly man fulfilleth excepte doeth springe loue botome hert suche newe herte lusty corage vnto lawe warde canste thou neuer come thyne owne strength enforcement operacion workinge spirite spirite god maketh manne spiritual lyke vnto lawe henceforth doeth nothinge feare lucre vantage sake vayne glory fre hert inwarde lust law spirituall wil bothe loued fulfylled spirituall hearte therfore necessitie requireth spirite maketh mannes fre geueth lust courage vnto lawe ward spirite remayneth synne grudginge hatred agaynste lawe lawe neuerthelesse good righteous holy acquaynte thy selfe therfore maner speaking apostle let sticke faste thyne herte bothe one dedes workes lawe fulfyll lawe worke lawe euer manne doeth owne free wyll owne proper strength enforsyng withstandyng though bee neuer greate workinge yet longe remayneth hearte vnluste tediousnes grudgynge grife payne lothsumnes compulsion toward law long workes vnprofitable lost yea damnable sight god meaneth paul thirde chapter sayeth dedes lawe shall fleshe bee iustyfyed sight god hereby perceauest thou sophisters deceauers teache manne maye muste prepare selfe grace fauoure god good workes haue spirite true faithe christe howe prepare selues vnto fauoure god whiche good selues good cannot thinke good thought consent good deuyl possessing hertes myndes thoughtes captiue pleasure canne workes please god thynkest thou whiche done gryfe payne tediousnes euyll wyll contrary grudgyng mynde holy sayncte prosperus myghtely scripture paul dyddest thou confound heresie aboute trowe twelue hundred yeares goo vpon fulfill lawe workes therof soeuer lawe commaundeth loue lust inwarde affeccion delectacion lyue godly wel frely wyllingly without compulsyon lawe euen though lawe lust free libertie lawe cometh onlye workynge spirite herte saieth fyrst chapter nowe spirite none wise geuen faithe onely beleue promise god without wauering god true wyll fulfyll good promyses towarde v christes bloudes sake playne chapter ashamed sayeth paul christes gladde tydynges power god vnto saluacion many beleue attonce together euen beleue glad tydynges preached v holy goste entreth hertes lowseth bondes deuyl whiche possessed e hertes captiuitie helde coulde haue lust god lawe spirite commeth fayth euen faythe commeth hearygne page duplicate page duplicate worde glad tydynges god christe preached god sonne man also dead risen sake saieth iiiiiii x chapter iustifying commeth fayth fayth spirite come god v saye faythe bringeth spirite bee vnderstande faith deserueth spirite spirite present v fayth spirite euer v faythe gyfte workyng spirite thorow preaching spirite beginneth worke v preachinge lawe worketh feare god preachynge glad tydinges worketh faythe nowe beleue come vnder couenaunt god sure spirite promyse god spirite accompaineth fayth inseperablie begynne fele workinge faythe certifyeth v spirite also bringeth spirite vnto workynge gyftes grace working oure rest oure saluacion vntill haue gether ouercome synne death hell satan come vnto euerlastynge lyfe glory thys cause saye faythe bryngeth spirite hereof commeth faythe onely iustifieth maketh righteous fulfilleth law bryngeth spirite thorow christes deseruynges spirite bryngeth luste looceth hert maketh free setteth libertie geueth strength worke dedes lawe loue euen lawe requireth last faythe workynge herte springe good workes owne accorde meaneth thyrde chapter hath cast awaye workes lawe soundeth though woulde breake disanull lawe thorow faythe aunswereth myght layde agaynste saying destroy lawe thorow faythe mayntyene stablyshe lawe thorow faythe saye fulfyll lawe thorow faythe synne scripture called outwarde worke onely committed body whole busynes soeuer accompanieth moueth stereth vnto outwarde dede whence workes springe vnbelefe pronenes redines vnto dede ground herte power affeccions appetytes wherwith synne saye man sumeth caried awaye hedlonge synne gether muche poyson inclynacion corrupte nature wherin conceyued borne none outwarde synne committed excepte manne caryed awaye together lyfe soule herte bodye luste mynde therunto scripture loketh singularly vnto herte vnto rote originall fountayne synne whiche vnbelefe botome herte faythe onely iustifieth bryngeth spirite luste vnto outwarde good workes euen vnbelefe damneth kepeth spirite prouoketh fleshe stereth vp luste vnto euyll outwarde workes happened adam eua paradise genesis iii cause christ calleth synne vnbelefe notably xvi chapter sainct iohn spirite sayeth shall rebuke worlde synne beleue iohn viii sayeth lyght world therfore xii iohn byddeth haue light beleue light ye may chyldren light walketh darkenes woteth whither goeth nowe christ light ignoraunce christ darkenes wherof speaketh whiche walketh woteth whither goeth knoweth howe worke good worke syght god good worke therefore ix sayeth longe worlde lyght worlde cometh nyght manne worke nyght ignoraunce christ man se worke pleaseth god paul exhorteth ephesi iiii walke hethen whiche straungers lyfe god thorow ignoraunce agayne chapter put saieth olde man whiche corrupt thorowe lustes erroure saye ignoraunce rom xiii let v caste away dedes darckenes say ignoraunce vnbeleue pet fassion selues vnto youre olde lustes ignoraunce iohn ii loueth brother dwelleth light hateth brother walketh darckenes woteth whither goeth darcknes hathe blynded eye lyght meaneth knowledge christ darckenes ignoraunce christe impossyble knoweth christe truly shoulde hate brother furthermore perceaue thing clearly thou shalt vnderstande impossible sinne synne excepte man breake first commaundemente nowe first commaundement deuyded two verse thy lorde god one god thou shalt loue thy lorde god al thine heart al thy soule al thy power al thy might whole cause synne inferiour precepte loue mine hearte wer loue wrytten heart full perfecte soule would kepe mine heart consentinge vnto synne whole onely cause thys loue wrytten heartes beleue fyrste parte lorde god one god wist wordes one lorde one god meaneth saye yf vnderstode made ruleth soeuer done whether bee good bad yet onely lorde ruleth doeth wist thereto worde myne meaneth saye yf myne heart beleued felte infinite benefytes kyndenes god warde vnderstode ernestly beleued manyfolde couenauntes mercy wherwith god hathe bounde selfe mine wholy together power loue mercye might shoulde loue myne heart soule power myght loue euer kepe commaundementes se ye faythe mother al goodnes al good workes vnbelefe grounde rote euyll euyll workes finally yf man hath forsaken sinne conuerted put hys trust christe kepe lawe god doth fall time cause fleshe thorowe negligence hathe choked spirite oppressed taken foode strength whiche fode meditacion god wonderfull dedes manyfolde couenau te mercye wherfore good workes good frutes muste nedes faythe heart whence springe al bad dedes bad frutes muste vnbelefe hearte ro e fountayne pith strength synne vnbelefe ignoraunce called head serpent olde dragon woman seed christ must treade vnder fote promysed vnto adam grace gyft haue difference grace properly goddes fauoure beneuolence kinde mind owne selfe without desecuyng v beareth v wherby moued enclined geue christ vnto v gyftes grace gyfte holy goost working whome powreth heartes whome hath mercy whome fauoureth though gyftes spirite encrease v daylye haue yet full perfeccion yea though remayne v yet euyil lustes synne whiche fight spirite sayeth vii chapter v galathians spoken iii chapter gene debate betwene woman seed sede serpent yet neuerthelesse god fauoure great strong ouer v christes sake counted full whole perfecte god goddes fauour towardes v deuydeth selfe encreasinge lytell lytell gyftes receaueth v whole al together full loue christes sake intercessor mediatour gyftes spirite batayle betwene spirite euyll lustes begonne v al ready vnderstandest thou vii chapter paul accuseth selfe synner yet viii chapter sayeth damnacio christ spirite giftes spirite begonne v sinner fleshe full kylled mortified neuerthelesse muche beleue christ haue earnest beginning spirite woulde fayne perfecte god louinge fauourable vnto v loke suche synne nether counte sinne deale v according oure belefe christ according promyses hath sworne v vntyll synne full slaine mortified deathe faythe man opynyon dreame ymagin fayne heare storie gospell se folow good workes mendement liuing though heare yet bable many thinges fayth fall right waye saye fayth iustifyeth manne must haue good workes also yf righteous safe cause heare gospell glad tydinges fayne theyr owne strength certayne ymagynacyons thoughtes theyr hertes saying haue hearde gospell remembre storie beleue counte righte faythe neuerthelesse man ymaginacion faininge euen profiteth nether folow good workes mendement liuyng right fayth thinge wroughte holy gooste v whiche chaungeth v turneth v newe nature begetteth v newe god maketh v sonnes god thou redest fyrst iohn killeth olde adam maketh v altogether newe hearte mynde lust al oure affeccions power soule holy gost euer accompanying rulinge hearte faith liuely thing mightie working valiaunt stronge euer euer frutefull vnpossible whiche endued therewith shoulde worke alwayes good workes without ceasing axeth whether good workes done hathe done redy ye mencion made waye doinge suche nature nowe quicke faithe herte liuely mouinge spirite driue stere therevnto whosoeuer doeth good workes vnbeleuynge person faythlesse loketh round gropinge fayth good workes wotteh fayth good workes meane though babil neuer many thinges fayth good workes faithe liuely stedfast truste fauoure god wherewith committe oure selues together vnto god truste surely grounded stycketh faste heartes manne woulde doute though shoulde dye thousande tymes therfore suche trust wrought hooly goost throughe faith maketh man glad lusty cherefull true herted vnto god creature meanes whereof willingly without compulcion glad redy good euery man seruice euery man suffer thinges god may loued praysed hathe geuen suche grace impossible separat good workes faithe euen impossible seperate heere burninge fyre therfore take hede thy selfe beware thine owne fantasy ymaginacions whiche iudge faith good workes wyse dede starke blinde al thinges folysshe praye god wyll witesafe worke faith thyne herte else shalt thou remaine euermore faithlesse fayne thou ymagin thou enforce thou wrastle thy selfe thou wilt canst righteousnes euen suche fayth called goddes righteousnes righteousnes valoure god goddes gyfte altereth man chaungeth newe spirituall nature maketh fre liberall paye euery manne duetie thorow faith manne purged sinnes obteineth luste vnto lawe god wherby geueth god honour paieth oweth vnto men doeth seruice willingly wherwith soeuer payeth euery man dutie righteousnes nature fre owne strength neuer bring passe geue selfe fayth take away vnbelefe howe take awaye thyng wherfore false ypocrisy syn soeuer done without faith vnbelefe euident xiii chap vnto romains though appere neuer glorious beautifull outwardes flesh spirite mayst thou vnderstand though flesh pertaineth vnto vnchastitie spirite whiche inwardly pertaineth hearte paul calleth flesh christ doth iohn iii al yt borne flesh ye whole man life soule body witte wil reason whatsoeuer doth within without al man study worlde fleshe call fleshe therfore whatsoeuer longe without spirite god thinke speake god fayth good workes spirituall matter call fleshe also workes whiche done withoute grace without workynge spirite howsoeuer good holy spirituall seme bee thou mayest proue v chap vnto galathians wher paul numbreth worshipping ydols witchecrafte enuy hate amonge dedes fleshe viii vnto romaynes sayeth lawe reason fleshe weake whiche vnderstande vnchastitie onely sinnes moste specially vnbelefe whiche vice moste spirituall ground sinnes thou callest renewed spirite borne againe christ flesh dedes euen mocions heart minde learning doctrine contemplacion hie thinges preachinge teaching study scripture bildinge church foundinge abbey geuyng almes masse mattence whatsoeuer doth though seme spirituall lawes god contrary wyse call spirituall renewed christ al dedes springe faith seme neuer grosse washynge disciple fete done christ peter fishing resurreccion yea dedes matrimony pure spirituall yf proceade fayth whatsoeuer done lawes god though wrought body wiping shoe lyke soeuer grosse appeare outward without suche vnderstandyng wordes canste thou neuer vnderstande epistell paul nether place holy scripture take hede therfore whosoeuer vnderstandeth wordes otherwise vnderstandeth paul whatsoeuer bee nowe prepare oure selues vnto epistle muche becometh preacher christes glad tydynges fyrst thorowe openinge lawe rebuke thinges proue thinges synne procede spirite fayth christ proue men sinner child wrath inheritaunce synne theyr nature nature cannot otherwise synne therwith abate pryde man brynge hym vnto knowledge selfe miserye wretchednes might desyre helpe euen doeth saynct paul beginneth fyrst chapter rebuke vnbelefe grosse synnes whiche men se ydolatrye grosse synnes hethen synnes nowe whiche liue ignorance without fayth without fauoure god sayeth wrathe god heauen appereth thorow gospell vpon men vngodlynes vnholye liuynge though knowen dayly vnderstande creature one god yet nature selfe without spirite grace corrupt poisoned men nether thanke nether worshippe nether geue due honour blinde selues fall without ceasing worse case euen vntyll come vnto worshyppyng ymages workyng shamefull synnes abominable agaynst nature moreouer suffre vnrebuked hauing delectacion pleasure therin ii chapter proceadeth rebuketh holye people also whiche without luste loue lawe lyue well outwardly face worlde condemne gladly nature al ypocrites thinke selues pure respecte open sinner yet hate lawe inwardly full couetousnes enuye vnclennes mat xxiij whiche despise goodnes god according hardenes theyr heartes heape together selues wrathe god furthermore saynct paul true expounder lawe suffreth man without sinne declareth al vnder synne whiche fre wil nature liue well suffreth better open synners yea calleth harde herted suche cannot repente iii chapter mingleth together iewes gentile sayth one sinner difference betwene saue onelye iewes worde god committed vnto though many beleued theron yet goddes trueth promise thereby nether hurte minished taketh hys waye allegeth sayinge l psal god myght abyde true hys woordes ouercome iudged returneth hys purpose agayne proueth scripture men without difference excepcion synners workes lawe man iustified lawe geuen vtter declare synne onely beginneth sheweth righte waye vnto rightewesnes meanes men must made righteous safe sayeth synners without prayse god muste without deseruinges made righteous thorow faith christ whiche hathe deserued suche ryghteousnes v become vnto v goddes mercy stole remission synnes paste therby prouing christes righteousnes commeth v thorowe fayth helpeth v onely whiche righteousnes sayeth declared thorow gospell testified lawe prophetes furthermore sayeth lawe holpe furdered thorow faithe though workes therof al theyr boste brought nought proued iustifye iiii chapter iii fyrste chapter sinnes opened waye faythe vnto rigteousnes layde beginneth aunswere vnto certayne obieccions cauillacions fyrste putteth forthe blynde reason whiche commonlye wilbe iustifyed owne woorkes wont make heare faythe onelye without woorkes iustifyeth sayinge shall menne good woorkes yea yf faythe onelye iustyfye nedeth manne studye good workes putteth forthe therfore abraham ensample sayinge dyd abraham hys woorkes al vaine came hys workes profyte cocludeth abraham without workes iustified made ryghteous muche worke circumcysion praysed scripture called ryghteous fayth onely genelis xv dyd worke circumcision holpe therby vnto ryghteousnes yet god comaunded good worke obedience lyke wyse doute none workes help thing vnto man iustifyinge abraham circumcysion outewarde signe whereby declared righteousnes faith obedience redynes vnto wyll god euen good workes outwarde signes outewarde frutes fayth spirit iustifye man man iustifyed alredy god inwardly herte thorowe faythe thorowe spirite purchased chrstes bloud herewith nowe stablysheth sayncte paul doctryne fayth afore rehearsed iij chapter bringeth also testimony dauid xiij psalme whiche calleth manne blessed workes hys synne reckened faythe imputed ryghteousnes though abyde afterwarde without good workes iustifyed iustifyed receaue spirite good workes nether otherwyse possible good workes except fyrste spirite possible thynge well sight god yet captiuitie bondage vnder deuyll deuyll possesseth v together holdeth hertes cannot one consent vnto wil god man therfore preuent spirite good spirite must fyrste come wake hym hys slepe thunder lawe feare shewe hys miserable estate wretchednes make abhorre hate selfe desyre helpe comforte hym againe pleasant rayne gospell saye swete promyses god christe stiere vp faithe hym beleue promise beleueth promise god mercifull promyse true fulfyll geue hym spirite strength bothe loue god worke thereafter se god onelye whiche according scripture worketh thinges worketh man iustifyinge saluacion healthe yea powreth faithe belefe lust loue goddes strength fulfill v euen water powred vessell good purpose deseruinges merites goddes mercy promisinge trueth fulfilling promise saueth v selues therfore al laude praise glory bee geuen vnto god hys mercy trueth vnto v oure merites deseruinges stretcheth hys ensample agaynste good workes lawe concludeth iewes cannot abraham heyres bloude kynred onely much lesse workes law must inheryt abraham fayth wilbe right heires abraha much abraha law moses also circumcisio thorow faith made righteous called father beleue worke moreouer law causeth wrathe much man fulfil loue usie longe suche grudgynge hate indignacyon agaynst lawe remayneth herte taken awaye spirite commeth fayth longe doute workes lawe declare euidently wrath god vpon v fauoure wherfore faythe onely receyueth grace promysed vnto abraham ensamples written abraham sake onely sayeth ou e also yf beleue faythe shalbe rekened lykewyse righteousnes sayth ende chapter v chapter commendeth frutes workes faythe peace reioysing conscience inwarde loue god man moreouer boldnes trust confydence strong lusty mynde stedfast hope tribulacion sufferynge suche folowe ryghte fayth aboundaunte grace sake gyftes spirite whiche god hathe geuen v iesu christe gaue dye v yet enemyes nowe haue faythe al workes iustifyeth foloweth yet therfore man shoulde good workes righte shapen workes abyde behynde accompanye faythe euen bryghtnes doth sunne called paul frutes spirite spirite alwaies somer alwaies good frutes say good workes paul order good workes springe spirite spirit commeth faith fayth commeth hearing worde god glad tydinges promise god hath made v christ preached truly receaued grounde hearte without wauering doutynge law hath passed vpo v hath damned oure conscience word god preached purely receaued hert faith spirite god also good workes necessitie soeuer occasion geuen goddes worde purely preached men dreames tradicions ymaginacions inuencions ceremony supersticion faythe consequentlye spirite commeth god goddes spirite good workes euen apple tre growe apple vnbelefe deuels spirite euyll workes thys goddes spirite hys frutes haue oure holy ypocrites knowen nether yet tasted howe swete though fayne many good workes theyr owne ymaginacions iustyfied whiche one crum true faythe spirituall loue inwarde ioye peace quyetnes conscience muche haue worde god woorkes please god euen rotten frutes rotten tre breaketh forth runneth large sheweth whence bothe synne righteousnes deathe lyfe come compareth adam christe together thus wyse reasonynge dysputynge christe muste neades comme seconde adam make v heyres hys ryghtewesnes thorowe newe spyrytuall byrthe without oure deseruynges euen fyrste adam made v heyres synne thorowe bodely generacyon without oure deseruing whereby euidently knowen proued vttermost man bring self synne vnto righteousnes nomore coulde haue withstande borne bodely proued herewith muche lawe god whiche right shoulde haue holpe yf thinge could haue holpen onely came brought helpe also encreased synne euyll poysoned nature offended vtterly displeased lawe forbyd lawe prouoked set fyer fulfill satisfye lustes lawe se clerely must nedes haue christe iustifye v grace helpe nature vi chapter setteth forth chiefe principal worke faith battaill spirite fleshe howe spirite laboreth enforseth kyll remnaunt syn whiche remaine fleshe iustifiyng chapter teacheth v free synne thorowe faythe shoulde hence forth go vp downe ydle carelesse sure selues though nowe synne v yes ther sin remaining v rekened faith spirite fight wherfore haue ynough oure life longe tame body compell membres obey spirite appetite thereby myght like vnto christes death refurreccio might fulfil baptisme signifieth mortifyinge synnes newe life grace battayle ceaseth v vntill last birthe vntill sinne vtterly staine death bodye thing meane tame body forth able sayeth seyng vnder grace vnder lawe vnder lawe hym selfe expoundeth vnder lawe vnderstande euery manne maye lusteth vnder lawe haue free hearte renewed spirite thou hast lust inwardly thyne accorde law commaundeth without compulsion yea though lawe grace saye goddes fauoure bryngeth v spirit maketh v loue lawe synne neyther lawe nowe agaynst v one agreed v vnder lawe deale workes lawe worke without spirite grace longe doubte synne raygneth v thorow lawe saye lawe declareth vnder synne synne hath power dominion ouer v seynge cannot fulfyll lawe namely within hearte muche man nature fauoreth lawe consenteth vnto delyteth therein thyng exceading great synne cannot consent law lawe nothyng el saue god ryght fredome libertie sinne lawe wherof writeth vnto ende thys chapter fredome good onelye luste lyue well without compulcyon lawe wherfore thys fredome spirituall fredome whiche destoyeth lawe ministreth whiche lawe requyreth lawe fulfylled vnderstande luste loue wherwith lawe stylled accuseth v compelleth v nether hathe ought craue v euen though thou dette man able paye two maner wayes myghtest thou lowsed one waye yf woulde require nothyng breke thyne obligacion waye yf good man woulde paye geue much thou myghtest ar ie thyne obligacion wyse hathe christe made v fre lawe therfore wylde fleshely libertie shoulde nought doeth thinges fre crauyng decre lawe vij chapter confyrmeth similytude state matrimony husband dyeth wyfe libertie one looced departed woman haue power mary vnto man rather fyrst fre hath power mary vnto man coulde tyll looced fyrst housband euen conscience bound daunger law vnder old adam flesh long liueth v law declareth hertes bounde cannot disconsent mortifyed kylled spirite conscience fre lybertye conscience shall nowe nought fyrst al cleueth vnto another christ bringeth forthe frutes lyfe ow vnder lawe able fulfyll lawe detter able paye whiche lawe requyreth looce lawe fulfyll pay lawe demaundeth nowe hence forth thee nought consequently paul declareth largely nature synne lawe thorow lawe synne reuiueth moueth hir selfe gathereth strength old man corrupt nature forboden kepte vnder lawe offended dyspleased therewith muche cannot paye whiche requyred lawe synne nature hym selfe cannot synne therefore lawe death torment martyrdome law euill euyll nature cannot suffre good cannot abyde law require good thinge lyke sicke man cannot suffre man desire run lepe dedes whole manne whiche cause paul concludeth lawe vnderstande perceaued beste wise doeth vtter synne bring v vnto knowledge selues thereby kyll v make v bonde vnto eternall damnacion detters euerlasting wrathe god euen wel fealeth vnderstandeth whose conscience truely touched lawe daunger yer law came knewe synne ment nether yet knewe wrathe god vpon synners tyll lawe vttered seest thou man must haue thing yea greater myghty thinge lawe make hym ryghteous safe vnderstande lawe wise blinde go worke presumptuously supposyng satisfie lawe workes knowe lawe requireth fre willinge lusty louynge hearte therfore see moses ryght face vayle hangeth betwene hydeth hys face cannot beholde glorye hys countenaunce lawe spirituall requyreth hearte may myne owne strength refraine mine enemy hurte loue hi al mine heart put awaye wrathe cleane mynde myne owne strength maye refuse money myne owne strength put awaye loue vnto rich myne hearte mine strength abstayne adultery concerning outward dede myne owne strength desyre mine hearte vnpossible vnto chose whether honger thurst yet lawe requyreth wherfore man owne strength lawe neuer fulfilled muste haue thereunto goddes fauoure hys spyryte purchased christes bloude neuerthelesse saye man maye many thynges outwardly clene againste hearte muste vnderstande man dryuen diuers appetite greatest appetite ouercommeth lesse carieth man awaye violently desire vengeaunce feare also inconuenience lyke folowe yf feare greater absteyne yf appetite desireth vengeaunce greater cannot prosecute dede se experience many murtherers theues though bee brought neuer great perill death yet haue escaped euen againe commen wemen prosecute lustes fear shame awaye whiche haue appetite theyr heartes abstayne lestewaye outwardly worke secretly ouercome feare shame lykewyse al appetite furthermore declareth spirite flesh fight together one manne maketh ensample selfe myght lerne knowe worke aright meane kyll synne oure selues calleth spirite also flesh lawe lyke nature goddes lawe dryue compell craue euen fleshe dryueth compelleth craueth rageth agaynste spirite haue lustes satisfied syde dryueth spirite cryeth fighteth agaynste fleshe wyl haue luste satisfied strife du eth v longe lyue lesse spirite fleshe stronger man owne selfe spirite flesh fyghteth owne selfe vntyll synne bee vtterly slaine together spirituall viij chapter comforteth fighter dispaire suche flesh either thinke lesse fauour god sheweth synne remaining v hurteth daunger christe whiche walke fleshe fyght agaynste expoundeth largely nature flesh spirite spirite cometh christe spirite maketh v spyrituall tameth subdueth mortifieth fleshe certyfieth v neuerthelesse sonnes god also beloued though synne rage neuer moche v long folowe spirite fyght synne kyll mortifye nothynge good mortifiynge fleshe crosse tribulacion comforteth v passion affliccions assistens spirite maketh intercession god v myghtely gronynges passe man vtteraunce man speche cannot comprehende mourning also creature v greate desire haue looced synne corrupcion fleshe se thre chapter vjviiviij none thing muche dryue v vnto right worke faithe kil olde man mortify fleshe ixx xi chapter treateth goddes predestinacion whence springeth together whether shall beleue beleue looced synne bee looced whiche predestinacion oure iustifying saluacion clene taken oure handes put handes god thinge moste necessary al weake vncertaine stode v would truth manne saued deuyll doute would deceaue v god sure predestinacion cannot deceaue nether man withstande let therefore haue hope trust agaynst synne must marke set vnto vnquyet busye hie clyming spirites howe farre shall go whiche fyrste al bringe hither hye reason pregnant wyttes begyn fyrst hye serch botomlesse secretes goddes predestinacion whether bee predestinate muste nedes ether caste selues doune headlong desperacion else comit selues fre chaunce carelesse folow thou order epistle noosell thy selfe christe lerne vnderstande lawe gospell meane office two thou mayest one knowe thy selfe thou hast thy selfe strength sinne grace christ se thou fight agaynste sinne fleshe vii fyrst chapter teache thou art come viij chapter arte vnder crosse suffring tribulacion necessitie predestinacion waxe swete thou shalt well fele preciouse thinge except thou haue borne crosse aduersitie temptacion haste felte thy selfe brought vnto brymme desperacion yea vnto hell gate thou canst neuer medle sentence predestinacion without thine owne harme without secret wrathe grudging inwardly agaynst god otherwise shal possible thinke god righteous iuste therfore muste adam well mortifyed fleshely witte brought vtterly nought yer thou mayest awaye thinge drynke stronge wyne take hede therfore vnto thy selfe thou drinke wyne whyle thou art yet suklinge euery learnynge hath tyme measure age christ certayne chyldehod man must content mylke season vntil waxe stronge growe vp vnto perfecte manne christ able eate strong meate xii chap geueth exhortacion maner obserueth paul epistle fyrst teacheth christ faythe exhorteth good workes vnto contynuall mortifyinge fleshe teacheth good workes dede true seruynge god maketh al priestes offre vp money beastes maner tyme lawe owne bodyes kyllynge mortifyinge lustes flesh describeth warde conuersacion christen men ought behaue selues spirituall thinges teache preach rule congregacion christ serue one another suffre thinges pacientlye commyt wr ke vengeaunce god conclusyo christen man ought behaue selfe vnto al men frende foo soeuer right workes christen man whiche springe faithe faythe kepeth holy daye nether suffereth anye man yd e whersoeuer dwelleth xiii teacheth honour worldly temporall swearde though man lawe ordinaunce make man good god nether iustify hi hert yet ordeyned furtherauce commune welth mayntene peace punish euyl defend good therfore ought good honoure temporall swerde haue reuerence though concerning selues nede woulde absteyne euyll theyr owne accorde yea good ma law law spirite gouerneth herte gideth vnto wyll god fynally comprehendeth knitteth vp loue loue owne nature bestoweth al hath euen owne selfe whiche loued thou nedest byd kynd mother louyng vnto sonne moche lesse spirituall loue hath eye geuen god neadeth man lawe teache dutye begynnynge dyd put forthe christe cause auctor ryghtewesnes saluacion euen setteth forth ensample counterfayte hathe done v euen shulde one another xiiii chapter teacheth deale soberly conscience weake fayth whiche vnderstand yet libertye christe perfectly ynough fauer christen loue vse libertie fayth vnto hynderaunce vnto furderaunce edifyinge weake suche consyderacion ther foloweth debate despising go pell better therfore forbeare weake whyle vntyll waxe stronge learnynge gospell come al together vnderfote worke singular worke loue loue perfecte must nedes respecte vnto weake thynge christe commaunded charged aboue thinges xv chapter setteth forthe christe againe folowed also hys ensample shoulde suffre yet weake fraile open sinner vnlerned vnexperte lothesome maners caste awaye forthwith suffre tyll ware better exhorte meane time dealte christ gospell dealeth v dayly sufferyng vnperfectnes weaknes conuersacion maners yet fassioned doctryne gospel smel fleshe yea sometime breake forth outward dedes conclude withal wysheth encreace faith peace ioye conscience prayseth committeth god magnifyeth office admynistracyon gospell soberly greate discrecion desyreth succoure ayde poore saynctes ierusalem al pure loue speaketh dealeth al fynde epistle plenteously vnto vttermost whatsoeuer christen man woman ought know lawe gospell synne grace faith righteousnes christ god good workes loue hope crosse euen wherein pythe pertayneth christen fayth standeth christen manne ought behaue selfe vnto euery man perfect synner good bad stronge weake frende foo conclusion behaue oure selues toward god toward selues also thinges profoundely grouded scripture declared ensamples hi self father prophetes man desyre nomore wherfore appereth euydently paul mynde comprehende brefely thys epistle whole learnyng christes gospell prepare introduccion vnto olde testamente without doute whosoeuer hath pistle perfectly herte hath lyght effecte olde testamente wherefore let euery man without excepcion exercyse selfe therin diligently recorde nyght daye continually vntyll full acquaynted therwith last chapter chapter recomendacio wherin yet mingleth good monicion shulde beware tradicions doctryne men begyle simple sophistry lernynge gospel drawe christ noosell weake feble paul calleth pistle galathyans beggerly ceremonyes entent would lyue fatte pasture auctoritie taken christ yea aboue christe syt temple god wit conscience god worde christ ought sytte compare therfore maner doctrine men vnto scripture se whether agre commytte thy selfe whole together vnto christe shall holy spirite fulnes dwell thy soule summe whole cause wrytynge thys epystle proue man iustified fayth onely proposicion soeuer denyeth onely epistle al paul wryteth also whole scripture locked vp shall neuer vnderstande hys soules health bringe man vnderstandinge felynge faith onely iustifyeth paul proueth whole nature manne poisoned corrupte yea dead concerning godly liuing godly thinkinge impossible kepe lawe sight god saye loue loue lust naturally man eateth drincketh vntill quickened healed thorow faith iustifying vnderstand none thing reconciled god restored vnto fauour haue thy sinnes forgeuen whe say god iustifieth v vnderstad therby god christes sake merites deseruinges receaueth v vnto hys mercy fauour grace forgeueth v sinnes say christ iustifieth v vnderstand therby christ onely hath redemed v bought deliuered v wrath god damnacio hath workes purchased v mercy fauour grace god forgeuenes sinnes whe say faith onely iustifieth vnderstand therby faith trust truth god mercy promysed v christes sake deseruing workes doth quiet coscience certify sinnes forgeuen fauour god furthermore set thyne eye christes workes thine owne workes christes workes iustifie make satisfaccion thy sinne thyne owne workes say quieteth thy conscyence make sure thy synnes forgeuen thine owne workes promise mercye made christes workes sake thine owne workes sake wherfore seinge god hathe promysed thyne owne workes shall saue therfore faithe thine owne workes neuer quyet thy conscience certifie god whe god cometh iudge take reconing thy sinnes forgeuen beyond mine owne workes ca neuer satisfie law pay owe owe law loue wt mine heart soule power might whiche thing paye neuer able whyle compassed fleshe cannot beginne loue lawe excepte fyrste sure fayth god loueth forgeueth finallye saye fayth iustifieth ought offende man trewe christ redemed v christ bare synnes made satisfaccion purchased v fauour god must nedes true trust christes deferning promyses god father made v christes sake doth onely quiet conscience certifie sinnes forgeuen say man must repent forsake sin haue purpose sin nye loue lawe god ergo fayth alone iustifieth aunswere al like argumentes nought like must repent forye gospel must preached must beleue el cannot partaker mercye christe hath deserued ergo christ iustifieth christ onely hathe made satisfaccion sinnes naughty argumet go reader according order paules wryting eue thou fyrst behold thy selfe diligetly lawe god se thy iust damnacion secondarely turne thyne eye christe se exceading mercy thy kynde louinge father thirdly remembre christe made thys attonement thou shouldest anger god againe nether dyed thy synnes thou shouldest lyue styll nether clensed thou shouldest retourne swyne vnto thyne olde puddell againe thou shouldest newe creature lyue newe lyfe god fleshe diligent least thorowe thine negligence vnthankfulnes thou lose fauoure mercy againe p fare well vvhole matier argument sainct paules epistle romaine era mu roterodame al beginnyng make matier plaine shalbee briefely declare summe contentes presente epistle fyrst beginne author name albeit knowe sainct hierome commentary wrote vpon epistle philemon minde paul fyrst called saule afterwarde called self paule remebraunce great victorious acte wherby wonne vnto christ sergius paule lieuetenaunt paphos cipres wryten xiii chapiter actes thapostles though againe knowe mynde paule tyme wherin liued vnder iewes lawe called saule fyrst beginnyng newe religion chaunged name yet one opinion semeth vnlikely forsomuche luke chapiter rehersed saule vvhiche also called paule beyng full holy goste plainly wordes declareth two name sergius paules conuersion opinion semeth vnlikely appeareth well el especially chapiter euen tyme preached christes gospel called saule holy gooste speakyng wordes deuide barnabas saule thinketh therfore origen opinion point nigher trueth bookes olde testament fynde whiche diuers name exaple one one place called idida whiche called salomon likewyse place called ozias scripture elswhere calleth azarias gospel luke called leui whiche owne gospel calleth selfe mathewe supposed paule two name though epistle neuer vseth call selfe saule euerye place paule peraduenture name paule familiar among wrote vnto meane romaine grecian latine worde saulus like sorte deriued hebrue worde saul grecian fourme iosephus ioseph name paule vnderstande heorue toungue signifieth marueilous may suffered searche interpretacion latine greeke worde straunge laguage whiche enterprise albeit matiers sainct hierome semeth scrupulous yet herein beareth selfe wene matter earneste muche weightie dede grecian name soundeth quiet latin menne litle saul hebrues signifieth required geue redence sainct ambrose vnquietnes doeth signifie deede ambrose sayth grecian worde saulos muche haue sayd paules name large wene tha nature argument doeth wel beare epistle endited paule tertius beyng scribe tertius selfe thende epistle sayth tertius salute also vvhiche vvrote epistle lorde appeareth sent rome fro corinthe phebe woma cenchris cenchris corinthian porte standeth farre fro citie desirous know tyme wryten suche weigh matier diligently may seme wryten bothe epistle corinthian wherof gather aboue epistle coprised taught ful perfite rule christia religion wryten aboute tyme preached throughout whole coutrey achaia wherin citie corinthe stadeth also countrey macedonia borderyng nigh thervnto euen vntil coste slauone teachyng euery christes gospel suche place none ye apostle el gatheryng also peter warned money hearer reliefe poore people made selfe ready repayre vnto ierusalem thence yt bestowed whiche receiued mynded goe spayne way go rome salute christia men whose fayth godlynes onely heard dede yet sene state somethyng vnlike galathians galathians beyng fyrst well taught sainct paule fraude false apostle deceiued brought backewarde iewishnes againe romaine cotrariwyse beyng fyrst misse taught false preacher deceiued assone according theyr wisdome perceiued ameded theyr fault faste stedfastly continuyng suche trade well wyst good infancie fyrst chyldhod christes churche wer whiche thought grace promised ye gospel foorthwt preached vnto ye cursed panymes geuen al ye worshippyng idol deuils forsomuche semed especially pinised abraham posteritee stocke iewes mynde appeareth sainct peter whiche would haue receiued capitayne cornelius christes religion warned vision whiche dede troubled ierusale tyme iewes conuerted christ layde vnto charge company among wer circumcised likely whiche accused peter thapostles selfe xi chapiter actes wryten apostle brother iurie heard heathen also receiued worde god peter come vppe hierusalem circumcision contended saiyng wentest thou suche circumcised diddest eate againe mynde albeit thought panyms felowship gospel vtterly excluded yet thought therwith also suche receiued vnlesse wer like iewes circumcised though christ nede moses lawe therby appeareth laboryng transpose alter glory christes gospel glory theyr owne nacion agreable whiche wryten xi chapiter thactes sayd suche persecucion ensewyng shortely vpon stephen death fledde phaenicia cipres antioche preached christ none jewes onely againe xv chapiter certaine jewes came antioche whiche openly preached paule barnabas men without hope saluacion moses lawe teacheth circumcised meane whereo luche commocion stirred vp commen counsail decreed appointed paule barnabas theyr aduersaries repayre vnto ierusalem entent contencion might apostle elder arbitrement determined againe vehement contencious labour suche specially phariseis become christian whiche secte paule called cousel apostle elder wherin authoritie peter james decreed gentile burdained obseruaunces moses lawe onely abstaine eatyng strangled beastes bloud fleshe offered idol fornicacion whiche pointes tyme onely condescended vpon reason great stubburne scrupulositie iewes doeth wel appeare see thre dayes vtterly taken away abolished vpon occasion arose also notable famouse cotencion antioche betwene peter paule tyme paule gentile apostle seyng flocke peter dissemblyng ieopardye reproued openly himselfe seconde chapiter epistle galathians wryteth againe ierusalem counsel iames pourge rumour spread among iewes semed drawe men backe fro moses law company shaued self beyng purified iewes custome made oblacion temple luke xxi chapiter thactes reherseth whiche place appeareth iames albeit enfraunchised gentile welnigh burdaine moses lawe abode styll yet opinion iewes bounde obseruacion whole lawe nothyng el appeace suche yet far profited truth gospel could content despise theyr auncestres rite vsages speaketh iames shall knowe thinges whiche haue heard concernyng false thou thyselfe also walke kepest lawe cause wene shaued head cenchris accordyng vnto vowe appeareth xviii chapiter like consideracion caused timothe circumcised reade xvi chapiter whiche yet deede iewe mother father gentile suche difficultie make iewe christian nacion beyonde hadde speciall vntowardnes euer founde stiffely abode theyr religion iosephus wryteth boke defence iewes antiquitie moreouer iewes especially hated al people world theyr syde abhorred againe al nacions vncleane cursed deuilishe farrefoorth disdained talke thought also temple vtterly suspended vncircumcised entered suche proude lookes lytle skynnes paryng forasmuche therefore likelyhode grecian romaine would receiue suche odious lawe iewes theyr side helde styl paule fearyng lest suche deadly contencion strife great parte fruite gospel might perishe lost lest also glory christ might minglyng moses name darkned defaced euery place specially laboreth vtterly abrogate abolishe ceremony lawe persuade assuraunce attainyng saluacion christ onely sharpely yet louyngly rebuketh galathians fell backe iewishnes againe doeth prepare fortifie romaine lest might elswyse vnware false apostle snared wel wyst neuer ceassed eftsones encouragyng styl continue doctrine whiche begunne heartely enbrace fauor rome great noumbre iewes whether brought thether pompeius magnus spoyled hierusalem made captiues orels whether prouince iury appertained romaine vncertaine sure theyr supersticion horace iuuenale senec oftymes reproued also paule comyng rome muche troubled last chapiter thactes apostle doeth plainely appeare paule therfore like runnyng craftesman wonderfull discrecion tempereth tale betwene two people iewes say gentile labouryng meanes possible allure vnto christ muche lay procuryng noman al perishe capitaine whose souldiar one whyle therfore chydeth one sorte another whyle another anone againe comfortably encourageth bothe gentile pride abated declaryng neither lawe nature philosophie wherof proude auayled fell nethelesse kyndes mischief checkyng againe reprouyng iewes arrogant myndes whiche theyr affiaunce law lost chiefe grounde therof wete fayth iesus christ teacheth ceremony moses lawe abolished bright beames gospell christ shadowes lawe rudely represented diuers thynges reste sabboth day displeasure paine circumci ion comyng calendes holy dayes whiche thrise yerely came againe theyr choyse meates makyng foule agayne bathe euerie daye boucherye hurtles beastes religion temple polluted continuall slaughter beastes darke shadowes lyght truthe appearing vanished awaye suche onlye abraham chyldren expresse abraham fayth suche righte trewe iewes professe christes name verelye circumcised whose myndes clensed filthy desyers true iustice also perfite blisse equally gyuen al people gospell onlye faythe christe wythoute helpe lawe notwythstandyng saluacyon specially promysed vnto iewes yet promysed vnto theyr owne prophetes letted prophecye saluacion beyng refused iewes preachyng christes gospell spreade abrode among gentile man throughe moyses lawe iewes carnally obserued obtayned ryghteousnes throughe faythe proueth well example abraham also diuerse testimony lawe hath meanes abated pryde partes taking away theyr vayne confidence profession gospel maketh equalle suche sorte ioyous gentile saluacion yet lyke tender father bewayleth blyndnes hys owne countreye men whome toward hym alwayes founde moste spitefull doeth mitigate matier whyche selfe harde sayeth blynded promisyng tyme come better mynde amend beyng faith gentile prouoked way toucheth paul manye highe dyuerse poyntes doctrine predestinacion foreknowleage vocacio grace merites fre wyll vnsearcheable counsell god lawe nature moses lawe law synne lykewyse herein sondrye allegory maketh two adam one whome borne dye another whome regenerate borne agayne lyue euerlastyngly whe maketh also two men inwarde outwarde man inwarde obedient spyryte reason outwarde subiecte thrall vnto lustes desyers whyche two fyrste calleth sometyme body membres sometyme fleashe sumtyme lawe synne sometime calleth spirite also maketh two deathes wytte deathe soule bodye thryde deathe wherein dye vnto synne synfull desyres maketh three kyndes lyfe bodyly lyfe spirituall lyfe lyfe wherin lyue eyther iustely synfully agayne maketh two kyndes bondage libertie one wherewith beyng made free synne lyue godly lyfe el forsakyng ryghteousnes seruyce synne maketh two sortes iewishenes two kyndes circumcision two degree abrahas posteritie two partes moyses lawe one lyke vnto body carnall another whiche spirituall lyfe lawe two baptismes also whiche fyrste fontstone washed fro oure olde synnes seconde whe renouncyng worldly pleasure dye christe two kyndes buryinges bodely sepuiture wherin christe laye thre dayes buried spirituall wherin sequestring withdrawyng selues worldly busines reste hym two maners resurreccion one paste alreadie christe shall folowe v wherin beyng quickened agayne death sinne walke furthe vertue vertue presente lyfe begynnyng lyfe without ende death asmuche v lyeth righteousnes also two kyndes god yt saye man iudgemente god manne double prayse god manne al whiche pointes disputed passeth ouer commen place belongyng good maners example partes mannes bodye especiallye exhortyng romaine concorde peace vnitie canne whereas pryde malice raygneth besecheth ready myndes eche one beare nourishe mayntayne mutual loue good wil desyreth romaine season beare iewes infirmitie whiche reason long custome lawe rooted syde requireth iewes enuye gentile called grace gospell rather godly mynde folow fayth christia libertie wyllyng synce one god al one christe one grace one rewarde growe one bodye none arrogantlye presume take vpon hym yf haue anye gyfte wherin surmounteth applye helpe neighbour place handleth saincte paule diuerslye instructyng theim howe vse themselfe towarde supersticious christian calleth weake feble howe towarde theyr superioures howe inferioures felowes towarde heathen prince magistrate sorte yet doyng theyr duty shorte howe behaue themselfe prosperitie howe aduersitie whiche sharpe monicion apeaseth matier romaine prayse auaunceth authoritie doth witte muche promoted ghospell shewyng desyer hadde see promising woulde come thither lette compelled differ praysing fre liberalitie macedonian corinthian bestowed vpon poore deuoute people couertlye wer reuerence prouokyng romaine lyke laste chapiter almoste spendeth commendacions yet doth name vnsauerly auenture heaped together euery mannes prayse maruaylously ioyned hym finally throughly knewe aswell malapert wylynes false apostle also readie simplicitie romaine eftesones biddeth beware fayre speache albeit moste parte matiers entreated present epistle specially apertayne tyme wherin churche beyng young secretly encreased myngled iewes gentile together subiect heathen ruler yet euery place somwhat wherof holsome doctrine maye learned present tyme necessarie beware supersticion roote originall dissencion whiche hauyng colourable apparence godlynes moste repugnante contrarie herein also sumwhat vayne assurauce whiche men haue worldly wysedome theyr owne actes desertes deserte fayth auoydyng hyghnes mynde bearyng sumtimes weakenes suche yet fully learned nouryshyng mutuall concorde throughe eche one diligent seruice towarde another suffering poyntes euyll ruler vngodlye byshoppes leste resistence comen order myght disquieted troubled ouercomyng euyll dedes good charitable meanes beware iudgyng thynges belong vnto v take well worth al suche thynges maye done good minde right cosciece beware craftie flaterie wt suche lyke pointes wherwith come lyfe ful profitable epistle yet hath asmuche welnygh difficultie profite whiche principally happeneth thre cause either confoundyng right order speache el reason long sentence well hangyng together finallye oftetymes maye saye entriked entangled fully finished imperfect therupon origen expoundyng epistle many tymes complayneth laboryng wrastlyng wt suche difficulty whether happened throughe tercius sainct paules scribe el paule hymselfe throughe interpreter let therin men iudges certaynly paule hymself confesseth rudenes speache albeit denie ignoraunt touching knowledge besyde far sekyng suche piked speache parte sauered worldly curiositie thought diligetly forborne auoyded leste parte glorie christes crosse myght therby deminished cause origen thinketh labour loste man wrytinges loke eloquence hierome place graunteth arte craftie setting wordes sentence together place denieth agayne saiyng affirming plainly language greatly corrupted rude people cilicia brought vp austen paules epistle gathereth floures ornamentes rhetoricke yea actes apostle called chiefe capitaine vvorde fyrst epistle corinthian sayeth hymselfe spake vvith language aboue albeit sainct hierome sayeth tyme easte parte worlde vsed greke toungue lykely yet frenche men suche puritie latine speache vsed citie rome might well great difference betwene one cilicia another athens speakyng wrytyng greke besyde difficulty another arysyng hebrue speache whose property paule almoste euery place vseth wrytyng greke yet man maye wrytyng know iewe second cause difficultie darkenes suche matiers cannot clearely expressed none epistle tricate entermedled deeper priueye misteries insomuche paule hymselfe sometyme leauyng purposed matier compelled make exclamacion saye deapnes treasure yea nonce sometyme toucheth misteries sheweth far temperyng oracio accordyng tymes theyr capacity serued whome wrote lawe knewe certayne thynges whiche myghte tolde noman knowyng well farfurth disciple nede lyght meate mylke strong foode therwith also knew degree age christe euerie age meete dyd apostle peter also shoulde preache rude people christe whome without mencion makyng godhed calleth man thyrde cause difficultie maketh weene often soden chaunge persones whyles one whyle hath regard iewes speakyng person another gentile sutyme bothe party nowe ryght beleuers faythles takyng vpon sumtyme weake sumtyme strong persones parte sumtyme godly sumtyme vngodly meane wherof cometh passe reader wandering vppe downe wer wrench call mismase diuersly tournyng wyndyng neither seeth came yet wel knoweth waye go insomuche origen truly properly seameth lykeneth paule man bryngeth frende riche prince palace tournyng wayes secrete chamber doubtfull cumberouse sheweth hym great treasure heapes goodes sumwhat farre thinges setteth iyen would haue sum thinges sene oftetymes went one doore goeth another straunger frende maruayleth whence came whiche waye get knew also sainct peter seconde epistle saying wer paules epistle certayne pointes harde vnderstanden vnlearned vnstable peruerted theyr owne destruccion herein haue asmuche v laye labored exclude suche difficulty sauyng sumthynges peculiarly belong paules tougue place could chauged whiche sorte fayth grace body fleshe member spirite mynde sence edifie suche lyke whiche vtterly chauged haue labored molifie hardnes asmuche myght let v heare paule hymself speakyng romaynes rather grossely playnlye v paraprase vpon epistle apostle sainct paule romaine de erasmus roterodame first chapiter texte p paule seruaunt iesus christ called office apostle put aparte gospel god whiche promised afore prophetes holy scripture sonne whiche borne vnto seede dauid fleashe hath bene declared sonne god power spirit sanctifieth synce tyme iesus christ lorde rose againe death haue receiued grace apostleship obedience might geuen vnto fayth name among heathen whose numbre electe iesus christ paule euen becomen saule say vnquiet person peacemaker late subiect moses lawe made fre therof becomen seruaunt iesus christ like false souldiar falleth capitain one like truant forgoeth olde profession called foorth message muche cotentacion deuided tyme wha mainteiner deuided pharisaical secte vpo vngodly zeale light persuasion wanderyng right way neuer meete called surname vnfained diuision one deuided chosenput aparte gospel christ self labour trauaile muche weyghtie mat er preache say ioyfull tidynges god whiche new found phatasie promised many yeres synce owne prophecy whiche remayne still bookes smal credence suche holy moste vndoubted trueth sonne whiche touchyng frayle manhed borne tyme seede dauid neuerthelesse declared euerlastyng sonne god euerlastyng holy gooste well appeared bothe diuerse profes moost specially ouercame death rose againe dead becomen al suche borne againe prince chiefe authour resurreccion meane iesus christ lord haue obtayned onely suche fauer kepyng lawe could helpby haue receiued grace apostleship c v also suche sorte messagier apostle christes gospel hath bene spread abroad among iewes may likewyse set foorth among heathen whatsoeuer trouble burdaine lawe make yelde submit selfes obediently doctrine christes fayth stedfastly cleauyng therto vaine wysedome philosopher whiche noumbre heathen ye romaine also touchyng nacion adopcion fatheryng called right title inheritaunce surname iesus christ whiche point incidently geue warnyng leste either sectes name countreys put square whiche fauorable gentle fatheryng made one man child texte p rome beloued god called sainctes grace peace god father lord iesus christ al therfore many rome dearely beloued child god suche former synful life called godlynes grace peace wyshe vnto suche worlde co monlygrace c wysheth substancial new grace wete fre gift fayth taught gospel perfectly iustifiyng vtter abolishement al offeces former life quiet peace conscience stedfast peace frendship god whiche twoo neither gotten helpe worldly wysdome yet keapyng moses lawe obteined al menne free gifte god father sonne iesus christ lord texte first verely thanke god iesus christ fayth spoken worlde god wytnes serue spirite gospel sonne without ceasyng make mencion praiyng alwayes prayer besechyng meane laste one tyme prosperouse iourney wyl god might fortune cum vnto long see might bestowe among spiritual gifte strength withal might haue consolacion together common fayth whiche bothe ye haue fyrst verely name rendre thankes god father whiche christ sonne hath geuen ye whiche heretofore wer faythles fayth great renoume worlde muche spoken whiche reporte certaynly loue beare towarde vnto pleasant god father wytnes beyng deliuered moses law seruice vnto grosse carnall ceremony therof spiritually preachyng gladsome tidynges sonne seruice pleaseth beste alwayes without ceasyng remembre prayer besechyng goodnes maye meane long desyre made vnto may last ous take effect whiche pleasure may may prosperously meryfor loue see might c iourney cum surely great longyng haue see aduauntage myne doyng bestowe gifte among grosse gifte moses lawe spiritual gifte christ establishe surely ye haue already begunne orels speake better euery one v maye comfortable whyles shalbe ioyfull fayth ye likewyse agayne reioyce myne meane wherof wyll insue bothe faythes shal mutual cofortyng ayded strengthned cause hath hitherto bene done rose texte would ye knowe brother haue often tymes purposed cum vnto haue bene leat hitherto haue also sum fruite among among getiles debter bothe grekes vngrekes lerned vnlearned muche ready preache gospel rome also ashamed gospell christ power god vnto saluacion euery one beleueth iewe first also gentile muche rather assure selfes brother oftetymes purposed see vntil tyme one lette hath chaunced could cause desired muche see might among also sum good haue heretofore done among nacions bounde bestowe labour preachyng gospel wherwith god putte truste peculiarly vpo nacion indifferently god worlde christes gospel equally due people cal gospel meane wherby man made righteous fayth iesus christ sonne god lawe promised figure represented debter therfore herein onely grecian also toi debter bothe grekes vngrekes barbarous nacions learned eloquente onely rude also vnlearned whosoeuer renounceth disdayneth asmuche ioyful readynes preache gospell euen vnto also rome neither maiestie thempier rome maketh afrayde thinke preachyng christes gospel suche thyng wherof ought tofor ashamed gospel ashamed wicked vnfaythfull gospell seameth matier laughed vaine whoso beleueth mightye power god effectual saluacion perfecte quietyng mennes cosciences whiche thynges neither iewes tradicions philosophie yet dominion able bryng aboute albeit mightie power gospel like condicion auailable al men yet goddes pleasure honoures sake fyrst offered iewes streight preacher gospel spread abroade among grecian al nacions worlde ende al men bothe knowledge owne vnrighteousnes also seeke made righteous god whither englishman frenchemen farre man fro saluacion whiche neither knoweth owne disease woteth seeke remedy texte p righteousnes god opened fayth fayth writen iuste shal liue fayth whereas tyme sondrie men thought righteousnes stande sondrie pointes preachyng christes gospel men knowe righteousnes moses say god selfe whiche standeth supersticious worshippyng idolles iewishe ceremony wonne fayth while men knowledge consent god nowe perfourmeth whiche long synce mouth prophetes promised euen abacu also prophecied sayingabacu righteous shal liue fayth texte wrath god appeareth heauen vngodlynes vnrighteousnes men whiche withhold trueth vnrighteousnes seyng whiche may knowen god manifest among god hath shewed vnto yea inuisible thinges say eternall power godhead sene asmuche vnderstand workes creacion world without excuse knewe god glorified god neither wer thankefull wa ed full vanity imaginacions folishe heart blynded coumpted selues wyse became fooles turned glory immortal god vnto image made onely similitude mortall man also birdes foure footed beastes crea yng beastes wherfore god gaue vppe vncleanes lustes owne heartes defile owne body among selues whiche turned trueth lye worshipped serued thynges made made whiche blessed euer euer amen wheras tyme people maner without al punishement correccion though god bare fauoured men synnes fell mischiefe declareth openly sonne sent heauen wrath good cause sette fyer ready take vengeaunce vpon al men sorte soeuer vngodly vnrighteouse yea euen vpon moses lawe straungers trueth maner knowen vnto applied godlywhich withhold truthe n vnrighteousnes c vertuouse conuersacion helde neuertheles theyr synfull lyfe styll also knowyng muche god rude ignoraunt people wer yet lesse deuilishe god dede wholly perfitely wyse mannes wytte knowen yet asmuche might vnderstanden men haue obtayned albeit muche neither without great goodnes neuer gotten somuche god opened vnto dede albeit bookes prophetes men thought onely spake vnto iewes lestewyse yet wonderfull creacion whole world notwithstandyng god selfe seen yet man wytte knowen beholdyng worlde wrought wonderfully gouerned also meruailously wherof albeit beginnyng hereafter ende shal folowe yet workemanshippe vnderstanden power maker whiche neither hath beginnyng endyng yea moreouer godhead also wherin alwayes selfe moste perfeccion euen worlde made whiche god done haue none excuse left cloke theyr wickednes withal knewe well godbecause whan knew god c yet neither honoured god chiefe ruler gouernoure yet gaue thankes geuer al goodnes doubtles wer yet dutie bounden laude praise knowledge wherof wer proude swellyng blast vaynglory became vayne wer theyr imaginacions deceiued theyr folishe vnderstandynges also darkened mistie cloude arrogancie became vnlearned fooles bosted selfe wise men eloquent marke nowe blindnes foolishenes fel theyand regarded knowe god c turned counterfaited maiestie god immortall onely image mortal man also image byrdes fourefooted beastes crepyng beastes punishement suche monstrous honouryng god suffered runne headlong folowyng theyr owne desyres fell suche filthy vncleanes eche one abused dishonoured others bodyes doyng shameful vilanie therunto surely well worthy wer fall suche horrible synnes pride vnordrely fashion honoured god knewe whiche steede god selfe worshipped false maumet made mannes hande frowardly stouped vnto creature worshippyng euen aboue made thynges therin wrongful god onely praise geuen onely among men worthy therof euer amen texte wherfore god gaue vppe vnto shamefull lustes euen wemen chaunge naturall vse whiche nature likewyse also menne lefte natural vse woman brent lustes one another men menne wrought filthynes receiued selues rewarde errour accordyng meanes saye god beyng displeased suffered runne furth headlong filthye beastely lustes somuche onely menne also theyr woman forgeatyng theyr kinde chaunged natural vse woman body whiche nature therin doubtles folowyng men whiche leauyng sayd natural vse woman brent foule abominable lustes one vpon male vpon like committed detestable vncleanes suche vilanouse wayes done iniurye spyte god rewarde geuen vnto meete suche madnes texte p regarded knowe god euen god deliuered vp vnto leude mynde thinges whiche wer comely beyng full al vnrighteousnes fornicacion wickednes couetousnes maliciousnes ful enuye murder debate deceyte euil condicioned whisperer backbiter hater god doer wrong proude bosters bringers vp euil thinges disobedient father mother without vnderstandyng couenaunt breaker vnlouyng truce breaker vnmercifull whiche men though knewe righteousnes god considered howe whiche committe suche thynges worthy death onely also whiche haue pleasure coulde neither content acknowledge honoure god sufficietly knew againe god suffered beyng blinded wt theyr owne darkenes walke foorth leudenes minde farre committed suche detestable actes beseamed reasonable man whiche wer elswyseful al naughtynes fornicacion couetousnes wickednes enuye murder debate deceipte maliciousnes euil codicioned whisperer back biter hater god doer wrong proude bosters bringers vp mischiefe disobedient father mother without vnderstadyng inordinate couenaunt breaker vnlouyng trucebreakers vnmerciful people wheras right well knewewhiche men though knewe righteousnes god c god knowe also exactly euerye point iuste auoyded suche outragious offender worthy death onely suche deedes selfe also consentyng like doer vnlerned occasion stumblyng ruine ii chapter texte therfore art thou inexcusable man whosoeuer thou iudgest wherin thou iudgest another thou condemnest thy selfe thou iudgest doest euen self thynges sure iudgement god accordyng trueth whiche comit suche thinges thinkest thou thou iudgest whiche suche thynges doest euen thy self thou shalt escape iudgement god either dispisest thou rich goodnes pacience long sufferaunce knowyng kyndenes god leadeth repentaunce maketh greatly theyr excuse say wyse men wordes abhorre suche enormity yet allege magistrate lawes inhibite punishe whatsoeuer manne trade lyfe foloweth thyng approueth nothyng therefore hast thou excuse thy selfe withal whosoeuer thou whiche winkyng thyne owne faultes condemnest muche rather assure while thou geuest sentence vpon doyng thou condemnest thy selfe forasmuche thou takyng vpo office iudge doest euen thynges whiche thou condemnest another synce thou art thyng faultie surely whyles thou geuest sentence therin pronouncest thou sentence thy selfe men mayest thou deceiue theyr iudgementes escape parauenture vpon coniectures onely likelyhodes geue sentence able see secretes mannes heart god whiche seeth knoweth thynges shall suche haynouse offendersbut sure iudgement god c spoke geue sentence iuste damnacion vpon slender apparent profe euen trueth doest thou farfoorth man stande thine owne phantasie speake euery suche herein knoweth selfe giltie thynke while thou iudgest suche offender thou canst escape goddes iudgemente thy self doyng lookest thou escape goddes handes transgressor escape thyne auoyde goddes se tence men auoyde thyne doeth goddes sufferaunceeither dispisest thou thryches goodnes put hope escape vnpunished exceadyng bounteouse goodnes long bearyng deferryng thy punishement dispised though wer suche one woulde either wynke offence fauored euyll dedes vnderstandest thou goddes long sufferaunce shewed vpon putteth offender hope escapyng punishment fauorably leadeth penaunce amendment ende vpon remembraunce great benefites towarde thou shouldest laste begyn shame thy selfe displeased texte thou thy stubbernes heart repent heapest vnto thy selfe wrathe agaynst daye vengeaunce shall opened righteouse iudgement god whiche wyl rewarde euery manne accordyng dedes saye prayse honoure immortalitie whiche continewe good doyng seeke immortalitie vnto rebelles dothe obeye truth folowe vnrighteousnes shall come indignation wrath tribulation anguyshe vpon soule euerie man doth euell iewe fyrst also gentile euerie man doeth good shall come prayse honoure peace iew first also gentile respecte personnes god whosoeuer hath synned wythout lawe shall also peryshe without lawe many haue synned lawe shall iudged lawe syght god righteouse whiche heare lawe doer lawe shalbe iustified gentile whiche haue lawe doe nature thynges contayned lawe hauyng lawe lawe vnto themselfes whiche shewe dedes lawe wrytten theyr heartes whyle theyr conscience beareth wytnes vnto also theyr thoughtes accusyng one another excusyng daye lorde shall iudge secretes men iesus christe accordyng gospell thou thy selfe tournest goodnes god towardes encreace thy damnation whyles thou suche stubberne mynde canne meanes mollified repetaunce refusest forsakest god prouokyng amendment nothyng el therin doest thou procure laye vp treasure goddes wrathe agaynste albeit wrathe vengeaunce god nowe presentlye seene perceyued yet shall tyme come founde doubtles inagaynste daye vengeaunce fearefull daye without al fauour synful people shall muche earnestly punished muche stubbernlye refused goddes gentle callyng amendement worlde exacte sentence god shalbe opened whiche shall neither erroniously parcially pronounce men wont doe vprighte iudge one knoweth thinge shall mennes desertes gyue rewarde lyfe euerlastyng saye whiche hauyng confidence promyses ghospel continewe styll godlye lyfe withoute desyre transitorye thinges vayne pleasure present lyfe desirouse lyfe euerlastyng heauen theyr shorte reproche wyll gyue glorie without ende despite suffered honoure regardyng theyr temporall lyfe immortalitie agayne whiche frowarde rebellyon rather obeye vnrighteousnes falshed truthe rewarde shalbe gyuen meete suche desertes without doubt indignation wrath god therby tribulation anguyshe mynde whiche punishment shall indifferently layed vpon synfull offender
