specially vpon iewe gretian ende fyrste punyshed whome god fyrste offered mercifull fauer syde euerie suche throughe fayth hath lyued godlye shall prayse honour peace glorie equally gyue iew first gretian al wylde barbarouse nation god ther person suche respect ther among men syttyng iudgement one men equally iuste wherfore whosoeuer haue without lawe synned shall also without condemnacionfor whosoeuer hath sinned without lawe shall also c lawe peryshe suche shall lawe iudged receyuing lawe haue agaynst transgressed syght god coumpted righteouse sufficient haue ben onlye hearer lawe whiche saye thou art iewe shouldest thynkyng deceyue thy self suche workes godly lyfe expresse putte lawe vre suche saye none elles shall iudgement god taken righteouse god suche one embraceth maketh good workes albeit law al muche abhorreth suche hauyng lawe yet obedient therto howbeit dede manne vtterlye without lawe gentyles beyng without moses lawe euen course nature suche workes lawe commaunded notwithstandyng put remembraunce rule moses lawe yet selfe stede lawe well appereth theyr lyfe expresse substaunce therof wryte table theyr heartes insomuche whatsoeuer courte iudgement amonge iewes customablye wonte done done theyr heartes whyles thy conscience beareth wytnes either agaynste thy alteryng thoughtes either accusewhan lorde shal iudge secretes c excuse tyme come herafter lawe shall god iudge whiche daye shalbe opened playnlye syghte men whiche nowe mennes heartes secretly wrought shal gyue sentence whome nothing vnknowen yet iudgement shall god execute christe sonne presente tyme lorde sauioure whiche shall iudge worlde leste anye thinke nowe tel fable dreame assure self parte ghospell whiche preache vnto texte pbeholde thou arte called iewe trustest lawe makest thy boaste god knowest wyll allowest thynges excellente arte infourmed lawe beleuest thou thy selfe arte guyde blynde lyght darkenes infourmer whiche lacke discrecion teacher vnlearned whiche hast ensample knowledge truthe lawe thou therfore whiche teachest teachest thy selfe thou preachest man shoulde steale yet thou stealest thou sayest man shoulde commit aduoutrie breakest wedlocke thou abhorest ymages yet robbest god honour thou makest thy boste lawe breakyng lawe dishonourest god name god euyll spoken among gentile wrytten cause hast thou arte iewe glorie lawe beholde thou whiche called iewe thynkest great matier vpon priuilege lawe gyuen vnto god bearyng thy selfe boldly bostest god author thy religion whose mynde pleasure thou knowest holy wrytynges whiche came hym whiche arte also infourmed lawe onlye thy self art learned knowe desyred thynges auoyded best done standest also confidence thou art able guydea light whiche wander darkenes suche blyndnes gyue lyght wander darknes teacher vnlearned infourmer lacke discrecio lawe hath brought passe know fourme order lyfe rule truthe thinkest thou grace gospel preferred gentile thinke rather thynke knowledge lawe wherof thou makeste suche boste shal iudgement seate god make thy matier worse vnles thou frame thy lyfe therafter knowledge wherof thou makest suche boste shall sharpely layed thy charge thou bragger vpo lawe crakest thou thou saye whiche teachest teachest thy selfe whiche preachest man shoulde steale thy selfe doest commit robbery whiche tellest aduoutrie muste done thy selfe breakest wedlocke whiche abhorrest ydolatry thy selfe takest goddes honoure hym whiche among men crakest gloriest lawe gyuen vnto god breaking dishonourest shamest god author therof tournyng amog thou sekest glorie reproche onely al prayse dewe wyse el far lyeth dishonoure god saye farre lyeth dede vpon hym reproache atfor name god euil spoken among ge tyles falleth suche long synce complayned holy prophetes god namely esai ezechiel sayinge name god euyl spoken reuiled faulte coupted reprocheful eue among gentile gyuen ydolatrie whyles ye bostyng youre selfes vpon tytle god lawe leade vngodly lyfe texte pfor circumcision verelye auayleth yf thou kepe lawe yf thou breaker lawe thy circumcision tourned vncircumcision therfore yf vncircu cised kepe right thynges contayned lawe shall vncircumcision cou ted circumcision shall vncircumcision whiche nature yf kepe lawe iudge whiche beyng vnder letter circucised doest transgresse law iewe whiche iewe outwarde neither circumcision whiche outward fleshe iewe whiche hyd within circumcision hearte true circumcision whiche consisteth spirite letter whose prayse men god neyther sufficient onely iewe borne yet taken theyr religion ende auayleth circumcision yf thou put thyng vre practise whiche circumcision gyuen trade ly e exercise whiche thou ceremony takeste vpon yf thou transgresse lawe thy circumcision wyll nothyng auaylebut thou breaker lawe circumcision c forasmuche god though thou wer circumcised al nowe thy circumcision tourned vncircumcision excepte thou therwith kepe rule lawe whiche make good manner shall gentile lacke circumcision take hurte god accoumpted circumcised yf beyng ignoraunte regardyng ceremony lawe perfourme suche thynges wherin whole perfetcion ende lawe standeth saye pure innocent lyfe haue therwith sure confidence christe obedient vnto hym whiche ende lawe yea saye gentile shall behalfe good state thou arte also set therin better case thou arte knoweth circumcision therfore hurtles lyfe shal declare thy lyfe damnable forasmuche professyng lawe order lyfe expresseth yet ende meanyng lawe wheras thou lenyng exactly bare wordes small poyntes therof professing also marke circumcision refusyng christ breakest whiche law chiefest god iudgeth men bodely markes theyr godlye myndes loste hast thou name iewe onles thou lyue thy profession neyther iewe whiche beareth vpon hym iewyshe outwarde markeneither circumcision whiche outwarde fleshe c circumcised hath lytle skyn pared secret parte none elles verye iewe whiche inwardly conscience iewe whome god onlye regardeth therbye iudgeth euery briefe circucised whose heart circumcised rather tha whose priuie meber hath parte pared trusteth somuche vpo law graue stone vpon spiritual meanyng whose fleshe circucised among may dede glorie iew iewe dede whose conscience pourged synne hath wholly gyuen hymself christ man albeit among men defrauded prayse yet doeth god acknowledge approue hym whose approbacion perfite blysse saluacion iii chapter texte preferment hath iewe auauntageth circucision surely muche vnto wer committed wordes god though sum beleue shall theyr vnbelefe make promise god effect god forbid let god trewe euery man lyar written thou myghtest iustified thy sayinges ouercum thou art iudged bvt one wyll saye yf whole matier stande godly lyfe hurtles maners ioyned fayth christe preferment hathwha preferm nt c iewe gentile aduauntageth circumcision al yf faythe godlye lyuyng make circumcised say vncircumcised equall yea yf circumcision make iewes matier worse yf transgresse law offend truely touchyng free gyft goddes grace offred ye ghospell poynte better iewes state condicion gentile yet consideracion surely great preeminence iewe borne herin fyrst maye lawfully glorie among nation vnto onelye delyuered wordes god maye appere eyther aboue committed law prophecy god vouchesaued speake whiche bothe fyrst coulde without great bounteousnes god whome pleased magnifie nacion agayne muche semeth prepared faythe offered ghospell whiche knoweth promyses lawe nygher truthe whiche hath sumwhat therof albeit shadowe knowledge moyses lawe darke sayinges prophetes steppe onwarde furtheraunce doctrine christes ghospel albeit sum iewes beyng muche stubbernely gyuen thewhat though sum dyd c carnall letter lawe woulde gyue credence ghospell yet hurteth theyr vnbelief suche vnfaynedly credit shall vnbelief suche thinke cause faythfull promise god shall take effecte beyng therwith displeased wyl men comenly wont breake promyse disapoynt men hath equally indifferently promysed euerie man god forbid shoulde rather looke surely god men kepe promise sauing suche refuse take offer whiche doth lest manne myght tyme reproue fidelitie promyse maker leste appere sufficiently god trew trew dede cannot lye ready perfourme whatsoeuer promised falsehod lying cum men theyr faultes promise god disapoynted god faythful neither canne deceyued deceyue man asmuche manne maye bothe promyses god ben moste certayne witnesseth also misticall heauenlye psalme dauid saying intente thou thy sayinges myghteste appeare righteouse trewe dede ouercum often menne shall accuse suche one maketh vayne promise falsely leudly thynking themself myne offence sake thou wylte perfourme thy promise made stocke dauid dede cannot denye well deserued disapoynted thy promyse yet muche matier maketh thy fidelitie truthe shoulde throughe synnes amog men commended spoken wil whe shal see holde styll chaungyng thy sentence notwithstandyng myne vnrighteousnes texte p yf vnrighteousnes make righteousnes god excellent shall saye god vnrighteouse taketh vengeaunce speake manner men god forbid shall god iudge world yf truthe god appeare excellent ly vnto prayse hecefurth iudged synner rather men speake euyll v sum affirme saye let v euell good maye cum therof whose damnacion iuste sum man wyll peraduenture thynke yf mennes vnrighteousnes righteousnes god aduaunced set furthe shall thynke shal thynke god vnrighteouse suche would haue synne continewe iustice maye clearly appere praysed speake myne owne name name vngodlye people god forbid suche thought shoulde tyme enter good mannes mynde yffor trueth god appere excellent thorough ly god vnrighteouse reason semeth hyghe iudge worlde yf goddes ordinaunce sinfull lyar intent lying fidelitie truthe might better knowen set furth reprochefull lyfe also auauce glory sinful lyfe layed vnto charge thynk rather foule tounged people falsly reporte takyng v though sayed let v vnhappely good maye cum therof yf vnrighteousnes righteousnes god magnified praysed god kepe good folke farre fro suche frantyke imaginacions al suche men theyr vnbelefe iuste lawfull cause goddes sentence condemned laye goddes charge synnes wherof themself wylful worker tha kes shoulde none gyuen vnto yf god goodnes turne theyr offence glorie texte better wyse haue redy proued howe bothe iewes gentile vnder syn written none righteouse one none vnderstandeth none seketh god gone waye al vnprofitable none doth good one theyr throte open sepulchre theyr tongue haue deceyued poyson aspes vnder lyppes whose mouth full cursyng bitternes theyr foot swyft shed bloude destruction wretchednes theyr wayes waye peace haue knowen feare god theyr eye agayne purpose shall saye iewes better case tha paynyms whyt meane touching god grace promysed gospell though prerogatiue lawe gyuen vnto v god seme passe nowe haue already playnly proued iewes getiles subiect thral vnto synne getiles matier plaine denied iewes like case theyr owne scripture beare euidet witnes xiii psalme dauid wyse wryten none righteous none vnderstadeth seketh god wandered waye therewith also becomen vnprofitable man doeth well say somuche one againe v psalme theyr shrote open sepulchre theyr tonges haue deceiued poyson ye serpent aspis vnder theyr lippes ix psalme likewyse whose mouth ful bitternes cursyng whiche testimony prophete esai agreyng saieth theyr fete swift shed bloud destruccion wretchednes theyr wayes way peace haue knowen feare god theyr yies texte know whatsoeuer thyng lawe sayeth sayeth whiche vnder lawe mouthes may stopped worlde may subdued god dedes law shal fleshe iustified sight lawe cummeth knowledge synne cauel say suche sayinges touche ne belong iewes synce whatsoeuer lawe sayeth properly appertaineth vnto suche geuen vnto therfore bounden whiche god none purpose done generally stoppe euerye mannes mouthe proudethat al mouthes may stopped worlde c auauncyng selues eftsones declare whole worlde endaungered god synce moses lawe carnally kept able make man righteous innocent sight god without whose commendacion among men accoumpted righteous vaine trifle wyll one say men kepyng law become righteous good doeth certainly end auailed lawe eche man knewe faulte surely towarde recouery health smal furtheraunce man knowe owne disease texte nowe righteousnes god declared without lawe forasmuche alowed testimony lawe prophetes righteousnes god cometh fayth iesus christ vnto vpon beleue hitherto specially apperteined lawe shewe menne theyr offence whiche lawe geuen knewe wel nowe preachyng gospel righteousnes declared whiche nedeth helpe moses lawe whiche righteousnes yet lawe prophecy spoke iustice say declared law iustice god obtained neither circucision iewishe ceremony fayth sure trust iesus christ alone geueth true perfite iustice onely iewes special nacion without percialitie euery man whiche hath sure trust confidence texte differece haue sinned destitute glory god iustified freely grace redempcion christ iesu god hath sette foorth obteiner mercye fayth meanes bloud declare righteousnes forgeueth sinnes passed whiche god suffre shewe tyme righteousnes might coumpted iuste iustifier whiche beleueth iesus disease general farre gone god theyr owne iustice nothyng glory must god haue offended seke made righteous whiche righteousnes geueth wage due kepyng moses law lawe nature either frely great mercy god procured moses iesus christ whose bloud redemed tyranny synne iewes cannot denied tymes past theyr mercy table shadowe figure whiche shouldwho god hath et f rth obteiner mercy c afterward folowe hath god declared christ vnto people propiciatory mercie table sacrifice entent vpo displeasure coceiued fyrst synnes might made one god bloud beastes iewes wer blessed bloud christ selfe whiche washeth awaye synnes men therby declaryng righteousnes al world while sone suche sorte forgeueth sinnes former life would yet haue v nomore hensfoorth fal vnto yet doeth men haue deserued much ise supposed god hath vntil time suffred people runne ryote lawes continue synne either wyst fauoured theyr doynges rather tyme long appoineted shewe righteousnes might clearely appeare throughly pointes righteous self onely author iustice whiche indifferetly geueth al suche beleue gospel iesus christ texte thy reioysyng excluded lawe workes nay lawe fayth answere thou whiche art iewe thy crake become vndoubtedly taken dispatched arte thou synce tyme hath pleased god gospel christ make nacions equal euen gentile haue helth saluacion offered vnto law pray excluded excluded olde ceremonial lawe moses newe lawe suche nothyng el requireth liuyng fayth sonne god texte therfore holde man iustified fayth without dedes lawe god iewes onely also god gentile yes euen gentile also god onely whiche iustifieth circumcision fayth vncircumcision fayth destroy lawe fayth god forbid rather mainteine lawe hold dede trueth euery man may hensfoorth fayth made righteous though kepe workes ceremony moses lawe lawe righteousnes therof peculiarly heretoforetherfore holde man c appertained iewes benefite god mercy offered ye gospel god generally offereth al men trowe ye god iewes aswel god also gentile doubt none god al nacions aswel say gentyles iewes sythe one god ouer good reason gifte likewyse commen whervpon foloweth againe one god whiche iustifieth circucised iew callyng affiaunce lawe whiche promiseth sauiour fayth gospel whiche perfourmeth another god whiche iustifieth vncircumcised paynym callyng fro idolatrie fayth euen one god whiche worketh righteousnes bothe wyll iewe say sayest thou paule fayth thou sayest thynges geue v makest yu destroy law fayth c moses lawe vaine thyng none vse profite geue ye iewes god forbid rather farre fro thabolishement thappayryng authoritie lawe muche maintaine establishe while preache teache thing doen dede whiche law promised tel marke lawe appointed directed abolished whiche chauged better nomore say floures abolished theyr steade fallyng fro tree groweth fruit steade shadowe placed body iiii chapter texte say abraham father pertainyng fleashe fynd abraha wer iustified deedes hath wherin reioyce god sayeth scripture abraha beleued god imputeth righteousnes dedes blessed whose vnrighteousnes forgeuen whose synnes couered blessed man lorde impute synne yet stubbernly maintein defend preset state moses lawe grosse carnal onely defed also vpo cofidece therin put hope saued exaple reherse meane iewe eue abraha selfe first chief al circumcised father beginner theyr stocke whole nacion iewes wont specially crake glory yet abraha dede gotte suche externe bodily meanes menne vse iudge god certainly obtained faythes sake wherby brought fauer god abraha euen god page duplicate page duplicate owne hand obtained praise righteousnes whervpon foloweth got kepyng prescripte ceremony lawe fayth wherby men iewes gentile must seke like praise meane al suche true child abraha require ye herein beleue wordes vnlesse scripture clerely self yet none heire yet vnlikely without delay beleued promise maker cosideryng possibilitie thing whiche promised rather promise maker yt sure cofidences sake foorthwt coupted righteous circucision time receiued faythes sake dede couted men god onely witnes mystery wrought fayth couted righteousnes long done good dedes suche meane moses lawe comauded call properly counted taken payed whiche beyng paied dede special goodnes taketh rekened payed euen patriarche abraha self circucisions sake coupted righteous log circumcisio faythes sake accepted god iewe ceremony law put affiauce geue season surely muche lesse gentile therin haue trust geue vnto iew subiectto worketh rewarde reakened fauer duetie c vnto ceremony law reward geue keping semeth payed vnto wage due couenaunt rather geue fauer mercy geuer otherside tragression law suffre punishmet wel worthy therof seruaut whe hath throughly finished taske receiueth wage forget duetye wt si ipes punishmet sharply corrected getiles ceremony law vnknowen iewes either whiche hauyng forsake bondage lawe become christian men worke loger wer tasque vnfainedly purely put theyr trust whiche frely geueth perfite iustice euen wicked al whose synnes hath death taken away suche say geueth fayth vnto abraha whiche accoupted righteous kepyng lawe theyr onely faythes sake whervnto copelled rather getely prouoked allured whiche god doth entent fayth christ thyng v frely wrought copulsion deliuerauce restoryng v nubre righteous people shuld thyng god fre gifte mercy debte purpose likewise maketh dauid kyng prophete chiefe glory iewes next abraha christ thonly fountaine welth saluacion specially promised vnto v xxxi psalme describeth also blessedfull state man declared gospel shewyng geue receiued due vnto v workes moses law fre goodnes god wherby moued drawen beleue blessed sayeth whose vnrighteousnes forgeuen whoseblessed thei whose vnrighteousnes forgeuen synnes couered blessed lorde wyll impute synne whiche testimony ye se vnrighteousnes forgeuen done moses lawe also sinnes done lawe nature couered briefely ye heare perceiue suche christ haue attayned blisseful state haue kynd sinne layed vnto theyr charge al whiche saying yet prophete kepyng lawe mecion made cause none therfore though iewes neuer somuche desceded men stocke peculiarly chalenge theyr owne either blisseful state spoken dauid praise righteousnes geue vnto abraha excludyng gentile fro texte came blessednes vpon vncircumcision vpon circumcision also say fayth rekened abraham righteousnes howe rekened circumcision vncircumcision tyme circumcision yet vncircumcised receiued signe circumcision seale righteousnes fayth whiche yet beyng vncircumcised father al beleue though circucised righteousnes might imputed also might father circumcision vnto onely whiche came circumcised vnto also walke steppe fayth father abraha tyme circumcision reasonable let answer question whether blessednes promised god appertaine suche circucised therby boude law el suche also ignorant circucision ceremony lawe meane thus muche must lest graunt abraha fayth coumpted righteous abraham title fyrst father beginner iewes stocke must al ofspryng estemed coupted righteous vnmete thyng reason neuewes shuld meanes chalege right tha suche wherby theyr fyrst paret put possession knowen matier abraha called righteous let tel cause called paryng ahow rekened lytle skynne fro fore parte yarde rather faythes sake without cosideracion circucision say iewishe circumcision obtained praise righteous man cannot defended forasmuche time abraha coupted neither circumcised yet comaunded long leued e sede christ borne nacions world obtaine blessednes fatherly praise righteousnes fayth couted righteous whiche tyme folowed circumcision meane wherby make righteousand receiued signe circumcision seale c marke token among men onely god wherby iewes knowen child whiche beyng circumcised beleued god yet vncircucised onely fayth pleased god abraha fyrst circumcised tha beleued consequently called righteous would appeare holy name righteousnes appertained onely circucised cotrary whiche faythes sake god pronounced righteous circucised comaunded afterwarde ensued circucision meane makeand receiued signe circucision righteous alredy partely certain figure true circucision say pure godly life whiche afterwarde suche would perfitely beleue christ whiche kinde circumcision ministred sharpe flynte stoone cuttyng lytle skynne fro fore parte yarde wrought spirite god rootyng men heartes naughty desyres partely also certaine seale bonde wherby abraham promise assured whiche yet foorthwt accomplished isaac whiche onely figured christ due season perfourmed sonne god finally abraham fyrst example fayth might knowen father vnto suche would beleue christ though carnally circumcised fayth coumpted righteousnes fayth al suche true lawfully begotten child abraham god likewyse accepted also suche sorte knowen father gentile yet iewesthat father em beleue excluded onely stande muche theyr owne phantasie lineally descended circucised abraham stocke haue nothyng el proue theyr kynred onely bare bodely marke haue rather fayth wherby beyng yet circu cised god coupted righteous nothyng father maketh surer profe theyr childre theyr owne lawfully begotten folowe theyr father vertues men vse disenherite euen theyr owne child deniyng suche growe kynde good condicions maners theyr auncesters theyrs surely muche wyll god like markes seauer bastardes lawful child texte promise heire worlde happened abraha sede law righteousnes fayth whiche lawe heires fayth vayne promise none effect lawe causeth wrath lawe transgression therfore fayth inheritauce geuen might come fauoure promise might sure sede onely whiche lawe also whiche fayth abraham whiche father v written haue made father many nacions euen god beleued restored dead vnto life calleth thinges whiche though abraha deserued neither kepyng moses law whiche tyme geuen circumcision sake whiche sayd yet receiued god make suche honorable promise wete dominion whole worlde shuld inheritauce fal vnto posteritie fayth wherby deserued called righteous shuld iewes loke enioye sayd right goddes promise either onely title right circumcision lawe either title ye knowe none wayes conueied posteritie suche fyrst authour beginner stocke came possession enheritaunce whole worlde promised vnto abraham posteritie generally belong vnto iewes title lawe therby becu heyres tha preachyng christes faith vaynefor yf whiche lawe bee heyres tha faythe vayne c thing god promise none effecte synce certayne benefite lawe noman receyueth blessyng god promysed abraha yea saye vnable moses law bryng men ioyfull welthy state rather worketh wrath goddes displeasure while therby occasion ministred greuously offend hym wheras faith contrarywyse wycked vngodly maketh men righteous offence displeasure borne vnder lawe chyldren inheritaunce dew nowe yf man aske lawe rather worketh god displeasure wrathe righteousnes beholde wyse experience sheweth vnlawfull condemne another man gyltye vnles law fyrste made penaltie condenacion proclamed appoynted moses lawe diuerse thynges commaunded done done example circumcision sabboth daye kepyng feastes newe moone difference meates touchyng deade bodyes strangled beastes bloude washynges al sorte though neuer diligentlye obserue yet make v righteouse yet suche one dothe offende endaungered subiecte punyshment law man bounde suche iewes forasmuche abraham promysed enheritaunce nacions well foloweth ryght kepyng carnal law promise god deriued nation foloweth fayth inheritaunce obteined goddes pleasure thentent men knowe gyfte gyuen goddes free mercy fauour debte thus shall goddes faythful promyse wherbytherfore fayth thinheritaunce geuen c abraham posteritie put hope glorious state certayne effectuall call abraham posteritie suche reason one common lawe giuen vnto one stocke rather suche fayth resemble theyr fyrst parentes agreable vnto reason spirituall kynred knytte together thorow fayth wherby abraham deseruyng promyse became goddes frende thyng muche effectuall carnal kynred thorowe lawe prouoketh goddes displeasure also condemneth v vayne crake therfore saye iewes abraham onelye theyr father dede father v nation soeuer humbly receyue embrace christes gospell true god himselfe xvii chapiter genesis witnesseth time encreased name stede abram callyng hym abraham sayed hauei haue made father manye nacions c made father many nacios certaine must god spake yf abraham father circumcised people mo standeth wt father many nacions perswaded rather god one al suche trust vpon god wyl pleasure abraha whiche figure god euen isaac fygured christ father nation whiche lyke fayth ioyned vnto hym coulde abraham belief deceyued confidence promyses whiche able make barayne fruytfull also restore deade lyfe agayne farfurthe afterwarde commaunded sacrifice sonne isaacand calleth thynges thoughe wer whome alone hope posteritie rested yet nothyng doubted fidelitie promise maker abraham wel wyst sonne myght restored lyfe agayne knewe also god able call parte blessed inheritaunce suche thynges comon opinion men vetterly nothing thoughe wer somwhat iewes iuge theselfes lyue somewhat worth abhorryng getyles vnmete good thyng abiectes whome yet auayled merciful fauourable callyng god carnall kynred auayled iewes texte p abraha contrarie hope beleued hope father many natios accordyng spoken eue shal thy seede starres heaue sande sea faynted fayth yet considered owne bodye whiche deade euen almost hundred yere olde neither yet sara paste chyld bearyng staggared promise god vnbelief became strong faythe gaue god prayse beyng full certified whiche promysed able also make good therfore reckened hym righteousnes dede wel worthy strong constante fayth good olde man haue god fauour whiche vpo trust goddes promise inwhich abraham contrary hope beleued hope suche thynges coceyued sure hope wherin course nature hope coceyued aswell knowleging faythfulnes god promise maker also great almighty power thoughe hymself feble wyfe lykewyse passed temyng yet nothyng doubted shoulde father many nation beginner suche infinite posteritie number sterres heauen euen god sayde vnto hym broughte hym fieldes shewed hym firmament et thycke replenished sterres saying thou art able number sterres shall thyne ofspryng innumerable albeit tyme promyse reaso feble age semed neither apparent lyke trew yet weake feble bodely strength faynted stregth fayth mistrusting people sought profes thinges myght done done cosydered dry barayne body eue worne ableaccordyng whiche spoken euen shall thy seede haue issue wel nighe hundred yeares olde yet consydred wyues age neither whose floures reason age dryed vp suche sort though ben past al stregth beget chylde yet passed chyld bearyng vnable coceyue suche thyng saye remebred nothing mistrusted nothing staggered surely al heart leaning trustyng vnto promyses god strong fayth body weake despayre power conceiued sure trust vpon power made promyse al matier chalengyng nothyng hymselfe gaue ouer whole prayse glorie god whome sure constant fayth testified true promise whiche woulde deceyue man lykewyse almightye thoughte able perfourme promise neuer somuche passyng worldly strength glorie wherwith god chieflye delighted whiche nedeth seruice therfore scripture sayeth reckened vnto hym ryghteousnes texte p neuerthelesse wrytten hym onelye reckened hym ryghteousnes also v shalbe coumpted ryghteousnes beleue hym raised vp iesus lorde dead whiche deliuered synnes raised agyue iustification supposed wryten onely abraham sake sayd faith reckened vnto hym righteousnes scripture laboreth muche auaucemet abrahas glory rather gyue v abrahas posteritie example wherbyneuertheles written hym onlye al world might vnderstande abraham faythes sake without healpe ayde lawe obteyned god coumpted righteouse none v kepyng law thynke haue abraha called righteouse beleued god surely entry haue none ryghteousnes vnles lykewise beleue god whiche v hath brought passe iesus christ oure lorde whome raysed death lyfe euen promised abraham fygure isaac therby declaryng fayth abraham vayne fayth whiche beleued god suche one coulde geue lyfe euen deade call agayne suche thinges thoughe let v therfore righteousnes cleannes lyfe thanke moses christ whiche gaue hymselfe death entent would freely fayth forgyue synnes whiche also rose agayne death entent shoulde abstayne deadly synne displease hym committyng agayne suche thynges pleasure dye dyed saye kyll synne v rose agayne death thentent hym fyrst dying oure olde synnes furthe hym hym beyng brought restored newe kynde lyfe may hereafter lyue vnto ryghteousnes haue goodnes receyued v chapiter texte therfore iustified fayth peace god lord iesus christe whome also chaunced vnto v brought fayth vnto grace wherin stande reioyse hope glorye chyldren god also reioyse tribulatio knowyng tribulatio bryngeth paciece pacience bringeth experience experience bringeth hope hope maketh ashamed loue god shed abrode heartes holy ghost whiche geuen vnto v consyderyng syn causeth variaunce betwixt god man certeynly peace god wicked synful people made ryghteous therfore iustified fayth peace wt god neither moses law whiche rather encreased oure offeces workes father abraha oure faythes sake reconciled vnto god father whose frende also fayth abraham became neither moses sonne god lorde iesus christ bloud washed away offence death reconcilyng v vnto god beyng tyme displeased v opened v entrye lyke fayth without either lawe circumcision mighte brought grace god promysed ghospell whiche fayth stande stedfaste stande good wyll couragiouslye also reioyce peace wt god also pute sure hope oure stedfastnes fayth shal tyme come enioye glorie heauen enuye iewes glory circumcision enuye mislike fayth brynger furthe suche plentifull fruicte yet repent glory hope wherof present tyme aduaunced vnderpyght whiche glorie albeit suche cannot yet seene thoughe without sufferyng aduersities trouble attayne therunto yet eue trouble meane season recken thyng reioyce glorye whiche suffer hyghe prayse also suche open vnto v gate life euerlasting new example hath christ geue v also taught excellent doctrine sufferyng tribulatios vertue pacience strengthened fyer tryeth golde throughe pacience become better tryed proued god man agayne tribulatios suffer surer hope rewarde standeand reioyse hope glorie chyldren god feared leste hope mysse disapoynt v belief make v ashamed wicked people haue eue therof hande moste sure pledge earnest penye whiche meruaylous vnspeakeable loue god towarde v onlye externally shewed vnto v pletifully printed heartes manier co pellyng v loue hym agayne wrought holy ghost steade watryshe letter lawe gyuen vnto v gage assuryng v promise herafter surely perfourmed texte yet weake accordyng tyme christ dyed v wer vngodlye yet scarce wyl man dye ryghteouse man peraduenture good man durste man dye god setteth loue towarde v seyng whyle yet synners according tyme christ dyed v muche nowe iustified bloude shalbe saued wrathe hym god great mercy singulerly loued pitied v iesus christ sonne neuer wyl father descendedfor yet weake accordyng tyme christe died v earth haue taken oure mortall fleshe vpon hym haue dyed namely tyme weake thrall subiecte beastlye desyres whiche lawe lyke prouoked brydel suppressed bad yet loued v hope saluacion yea loued v beyng wycked people deuilyshe ydolaters loued v sake wyllyngly suffered death whiche greatest euident moste singuler poynt loue euer could shewed among men scarcely shal man fynde another frendlye wyl good wel deseruyng frendes sake suffer death graunt suche maye founde approued frende wyl paraduenture contented dye yet hath god shewed example passyng example suche earthly loues pleased euen wycked vnworthy person delyuer onlye sonne death god haue v beyng wycked people offender done thus muche muche rather wyl v beyng nowe purged chastised bloud sonne reconciled vnto hym sinne fall displeasure therby stande ieopardy greuouse danation synful lyfe also vnthankefull christe dyed v season rose agayn euer dyed v arose agayne sake texte p yf enemy reconciled god deathe sonne muche seyng reconciled shalbe preserued lyfe onlye also ioye god meanes oure lorde iesus christe whome haue nowe obtayned attonement yf death haue muche done v tyme god v highly offended displeased haue hym nowe gratiouse merciful muche rather shal lyfe preserued nomore fall displeasure death deliuered synne lyfe shal preserue v innocecie death hath delyuered v power deuill lyfe shall towarde v continew loue father suche euident sygnesnot onelye also ioye god c goddes loue towarde v put v quyet assuraunce sure hope saued vengeauce god come also gyue v lustye courage euen glorie oure deseartes thankes geuyng god father whose bountefull mercy haue receyued welthy state promysed hym geuen vnto v neither lawes circumcision sake iesus christ sonne whose meanes restored fauour agayne thentent benefite thankes gyuen noman god hymself sonne al whiche done meruaylous secrete counsel god ende waye meanes oure restoryng shoulde agree waye oure damnation texte wherfore one man syn entred worlde death meanes syn euen death also went ouer al men insomuche men synned euen vnto law syn worlde synne imputed lawe neuerthelesse death raigned adam moses euen ouer also synned lyke transgressio dyd adam beareth similitude hym come wherfore adam whiche fyrste transgressed commaundemente god synne entred worlde meanes synnewherfore one man syn entred world death syn poyson mannes soule whose occasion synne whiche begynning fyrst stocke issued furthe posteritie whyles eche man folowed exaple fyrst parente christe alone whome fayth al borne agayne receyue innocencie therwyth lyfe whiche blessednes lykewyse hauyng begynnyng one fyrst new authour generacio christe spread abrode amonge whiche throughe faythe knyt vnto hym hurtlesse lyfe folowe steppe synne ouergone world poysoned mankynde suche strength therof coulde meanes neyther lawe nature yet moses lawe vanquyshed lawe nothyng done suche hadde offended knewe gylty worthy damnation chyldren lawe nature hath place reason theyr teder age able yet discerne good syn yet imputed wasbut synne imputed ther lawe layde vnto paynyms charge yf ought dyd agaynst moyses lawe therfore lawe gyuen whiche shewed men theyr synnes reason law nature world dede vtterly without synne yet bare men tyme themselfes wer without correctio fell licenciousnes though ben vtterly lawles forasmuche therfore yet comen whiche take awaye synnes world vanquyshe tyrannye death death enteryng adam offence raygned without resistence euen vpon also whiche maliciously offended agaynst co maundement god adam dyd euen bare ymage fygure christ whiche come log yet meane euery poynte vnto christe lyke poyntes bare ymage christ poynt lyke begynners generation one earthly heauenly lyke also certayne thyng frome begynners deriued theyr posterity difference earthly adam begynnyng vnrighteousnes synne heauenly adam gyuen grace goodnes texte gifte like synne f synne one many dead muche plenteous vpon many grace god gift grace whiche gyuen one man iesus christ two partely like wer equal besides elswyse selfe thing effectual saue destroybut gifte lyke synne muche strong mightye christ saue adam condempne muche effectual christes obedience geue life trasgression adam worke death pointes christes goodnes ouerwaigheth offence adam thyng monishe say leste man might thynke synne fyrst parent outragious dispaire restoryng saluacion one mannes synne suche power made great numbre people thral vnto death muche power plentyfulnes general shal benefite god mercyful gift hath gyne v one man lykewyse meane iesus christ author godly innocent lyfe whome hath onely taken awaye tyranny death syn hath also steade syn gyuen righteousnes steade tyranny death kyngdo life offece adam great mercy god tourned weale aduauntage texte p gyfte ouer one synne death came one sinne one synned damnation came one synne vnto condemnation gyfte came iustifie many synnes yf synne one death raigned meanes one muche whiche receaue aboundaunce grace gyft righteousnes shall raigne lyfe meanes one saye iesus christe agayne thoughe throughe adam onlye offence damnation entred innocet christe saluation yet one equal another suche sorte damnacion begynnyng synne one man issued al posteritie meane wherof might continuauce tyme last haue made whole world thrall synne benefite god cotrarywyse suche sorte gyuen sinnes al world gathered together growen strong christes death wyped awaye also righteousnes gyuen therforefor synne one death raigned meanes one muche c albeit synne onlye one man suche power brought men vnder tyranny death suche offended adam could vnder yoke yet muche receaue bountifull ouer flowyng mercy god whiche suche folowyng example christ liue iustlye innocently shall free tyranny synne death also whiche onely authour felicitie welthe raigne themselfes lyfe euerlastyng texte p lykewyse synne one sprang vp euell men cond nation euen righteousnes one spryngeth good vpon men righteousnes lyfe one mannes disobedience many became synners obedience one shall many made righteouse lawe meane tyme entred synne shoulde encrease neuerthelater aboudaunce sinne plenteousnes grace synne raygned vnto death eue myght grace raigne righteousnes vnto eternall life helpe iesus christe herein therfore bothe lyke offence one man syn came worlde meane wherof became thrall vnto death ryghteousnes one whiche deriued al suche beleue submyt themselfe vnto kyngdom lyfe men god made righteouse partaker kyngdom life ada throughfor one mannes disobedience many became synners obedience c disobedience goddes commaundement many became synners while folowed theyr fyrst father trasgression shal christ euen vnto death crosse obeyed god father make many righteouse suche saye folowers obedience returne agayne vnto former purpose yf suche meanes spake pleased god take awaye synne also geue righteousnes lyfe purpose geue law vnable good whervnto answer vnderstanden lawe dyd good therby great mercy god toward v became euident better knowe great outragious power synne notable benefite whiche deliuereth v synne lawe tyranny synne set foorth while albeit vaine resisteth strong mightie tyranny muche mightie mercye god wherof haue muche perfite experience greater dauger sayd tyrany haue hitherto andthat syn raigned vnto death euen c certainly also bounden thanke lawe therby perceiue greatnes god benefite meane wherof deuil synne winnyng dominion destroyed mannes soule whiche death dede godly life god gifte obteinyng kyngdome vpper hande geue life vnto men help iesus christ vnder lorde capitaine reioyce beyng deliuered bodage death vnder whose baner wer long ago souldiars vi chapter texte p shal say shal continue synne may aboundance grace god forbid shall dead touchyng synne liue longer therin knowe ye whiche baptised iesus christ baptised dye buried baptisme dye likewise christ raised vp fro death glory father euen also walke new life graft death like vnto euen shal partaker resurreccion knowyng olde man crucified also body synne might vtterly destroyed hensfoorth seruauntes vnto synne dead iustified synne bvt sayd lawe sinne encreased sinne good came thatshal continue sine god forbid grace god encreased lest saying take occasion continue synne wyse thynke selfe synne auaunce encrease god grace towardes well done wer synne often fre gifte may encrease herevnto answer pitie man thinke sayd ment spake synnes former life whiche god goodnes turned weale profite ons brought fro tyrany synne kyngdome innocencie god forbid againe departe redemer fall againe headlong olde tyrannous subiection lyfe death quite contrarye one another eche one destroyeth like consideracion stande together therfore soone begynne liue christ warde dead towarde deuil reason standeth still liue warde already dead liue christ liue deuil sinne liue vnto deuil christwarde dead nowe forasmuche liue christ foloweth dead synne whiche hath death vaquished mete ye know since ye haue receiued baptisme christ sayd baptisme v doth bothe worke signifie tyme christes name baptised dye ye whiche baptised iesus christ baptised dye touchyng synnes former life synnes death abolished onely buried also baptisme whiche neuer liued synfully diyng yet synnes raised vppe life euerlastyng worldely power mightie power father beyng raised death synne becomen dead former life leadyng hereafter newe life walke trade godly conuersacion continually encreasyng vpwarde better better seyng baptisme planted christes bodye maner altered mete whatsoeuer see done whiche oure head v whiche membres either life expressed el loked tyme come rysen againe ascended heauen setteth glorye theeuen shall partaker resurreccion right hande father whiche thynges alreadye done christ maye oure selues finally trust enioye present tyme muche v lyeth folowe diligently put vre therfore baptisme dye vnto former synnes fleashely lustes therin may resemblyng christes death euen mete conuenient hensfoorth forsakyng filthynes synne diligently exercisyng selues godly workes expresse liuyng holy resurreccion folowe christes death neither kyl selfes yet hurt oure bodyes ye well knowe dye oure old frowarde appetite haue suche dull desyre seame dead accordyng double generacion must selfes co ceiue two menne thone olde grosse like vnto yearthly adam thother newe desyrous heauenly thynges whiche hath christ sent heauen beginnyng olde man therfore wer destroyed tyme christ fastened vpon crosse whervpon also extinguished oure desyres transitorye pleasure whose whole rable maye well called body synne bodye ofthat hence foorth seruantes vn synne c synne v effectually holsomely slaine hurtefull desyres suche sorte destroyed v seruice vnto synne sorte haue expressed foloweth christes death euen become righteous man longer subiecte vnto synne whose tyranny already deliuered texte wherfore dead christ beleue also shall liue knowyng christ beyng raised death dyeth nomore death hath nomore power ouer touchyng dyed dyed concernyng synne touchyng lyueth liueth vnto god lykewyse cosider ye also ye dead touchyng synne aliue vnto god iesus christ lorde let synne raigne therfore mortal bodye ye thervnto obeye lustes therfore haue oftentymes sayd christ dead deliuered fro former synnes trust hereafter innocent holy life liue liue shall neuer dye also farre possible resemblyng christ submitted selfe suche sorte death death haue power rose againe liue euerlastyngly touchyng dyed vnto synne dyed touchyng thatfor touchyng dyed dyed concernyng synne nowe liueth liueth god father whose might death raised life euerlastyng christ thynke selfes dead synne olde v cious desyres destroyed ye nowe becomen newe men thoughe ye raised againe death liue heauenly immortall life godwarde whose benefite nowe made innocent holy ye ye liue godwarde god noman lyueth suche liue godly righteously vertues synce planted christes body becomen one mete membres like vnto head whiche christ synce yt nowe lyueth godwarde euermore reason likewyse liue vnto iesus christ lorde beyng raised fro deathlet sinne raigne therfore mortalbodies suffereth nomore ye tyrany death must ye take hede lest synne beyng nowe banished soules recouer againe tyranny whiche hath loste renewe olde title death surely wyll ye folowe suche beastly desyres whiche deuil wont allure bryng v olde bondage texte neither geue ye membres instrumentes vnrighteousnes vnto synne geue ouer selues vnto god dead aliue geue ouer membres instrumentes righteousnes vnto god sinne shal haue power ouer ye vnder lawe vnder grace see membres beyng nowe consecrate vnto christ hencefoorth nomore seruice deuils mocion christ hath subdued worke vnrighteousnes rather hereafter vse selues life may appeare ye christ haue forsaken deadly synne workes death altered new life shal ye dede hencefoorth membres isand ge e ouer bres instrumetes righteousnes vnto god c say power bodyes soules applyed vice deuils seruice righteousnes seruice god reason requireth wholly belong haue boude selues haue nothyng departed whose yoke haue shaken feared leste synne wyll nil bryng v backe againe olde bondage ye nowe longer vnder lawe whiche rather prouoked wylfull desyres suppressed vnder goddes grace whiche able deliuer v bondage synne able kepe preserue v nomore falle thervnto texte shal sinne vnder law vnder grace god forbid yet nowe god forbid meane season manne wyse take wordes sayd ye free lawe either thynke forasmuche lawe abolished ye may ye liste goddes free goodnes whiche hath pardoned olde offence hath also therwith frely geuen v libertie euil rather muche ought abstaine synne nomore like slaues copelled wel law childre wont wt desertes loue prouoked therto bondage chaunged vtterly taken away suche sorte haue ye geuen ouer seruice lawe ye nowe become christes seruauntes whose seruice weale blisse texte knowe ye howe soeuer ye commit selues seruauntes obey seruauntes ye ye obey whether synne vnto death obedience vnto righteousnes ye knowe kyndes seruice partly power chose whiche ye wyll together ye tyme thou stodest fredome kepe thy selfe bondage synce thou hast freely made thy selfe another mannes hast begunne obedient vnto must thou onely obey whose seruaunt thou art become therfore whiche geue selues vnto synne synnehis seruauntes ye ye obey c become bondeslaues fruite theyr bondage death othersyde suche christ haue dedicated geuen selues must obeye whiche shal owne great comoditie theyr obedience nothyng shall christ wynne therby get slues righteousnes wete wel agreyng pleasant company vertues knitte together texte god thanked though ye wer seruauntes synne ye haue yet obeyed heart vnto rule doctrine ye brought vnto ye made free synne becomen seruauntes righteousnes speake grosly infirmitie fleshe glad sake geue thankes vnto god wheras heretofore ye moste miserable bondage wholly geuen idolatrie filthy lustes ye nowe departed tyrannyye haue yet obeyed heart vnto rule doctrine ye brought vnto deuil frely gladly submittyng selues christes kyngdome gouernaunce purposyng hencefoorth liue ye either wylful desyres law moued new rule ye gospel whervnto ye brought olde errours brought ye become vnder another lawe enfraunchised dominion synne thence conueied serue righteousnes behestes thynke harde paynefull ye commaunded serue righteousnes synne godly life farre differ one another theyr fruites quite cotrary fruites godly life infinitely excellente weighe consider euen thyng selfe muche cause men shuld diligently serue god deuil whoso serueth synne serueth deuil serueth innocencie serueth god yet wyll whyle muche require might lawfully rather temper measure writyng weakenes spirite god yet fully ripe rather suche yet olde naughtie desyres labour growe vp againe onely require righteousnes like condicion synne texte ye haue geuen membres seruauntes vnclennes iniquitie one iniquitie another euen geue ouer mebres seruautes vnto righteousnes ye may sanctified ye seruauntes sinne ye voyde righteousnes tyme gaue membres serue vnclennes iniquitie blynd desyres led ye fel fro one iniquitie another euery day filthy euen see ye likewyse geue membres obey righteousnes whose seruauntes ye haue frely made selfes therin styl encreasyng fro vertue vertue euery day pure holy muche againstfor wer seruauntes sinne ye wer voyde righteousnes al reason christ lestwyse haue somuche seruice deuil vnreasonable ye begynne good seruice vnder lady maistres righteousnes ye another sorte vnto tyranny synne touchyng former synful life excuse sorte thing may sayd whiche long ye heathen ye wer bonde seruauntes synne ye might seme righteousnes haue thing thyng bounde vnto ye yet bounde yelded selues haue ye nothyng lay defence yet excellent nature righteousnes selfe moue consider weigh yet diuerse fruites profite bothe seruices speake vnto whiche haue bothe seruices experience texte fruite ye thinges wherof ye ashamed end thinges death ye deliuered sinne made seruau te god haue fruit sanctified ende euerlastyng life rewarde synne death eternall life gifte god iesus christ lorde cal remembraunce tyme ye seruauntes vnto sinne vile bonde slaues folowed wanton desyres rewarde pray ye laste euen synnes selfe haue theyr punishement ioyned vnto foorthwith defile corrupt whole man vilanously reprochefully defacyng since tyme ye ameded men awaked dronkenes syn ye ashamed selfes mindes abhorre thinke vpo olde noughtie pleasure though wage ye see notfor ende thinges death desyred yet besyde last stipend hyre whiche deuil payeth suche seruice death euerlastyng howbeit dede life whiche meane leason sorte ledde shameful death dede life nowe consider happye chaunge ye haue made whiche beyng deliuered tyranny deuil becomen seruautes god ye see sure vnlike maisters yf content ye loke rewarde also fyrste offor rewarde syn death eternal life gifte god c wheras ye lyued fylthy wycked ye lyue innocent pure holy whiche verye lyfe besyde shorte tyme seruice finished ye shall receyue laste wage saye lyfe euerlastyng copare nowe god ye deuil vncleannes holynes euerlastyng death lyfe euerlastyng euen nowe tolde rewarde deuyll death whiche geueth vnto menne fylthy miserable seruice contrarie suche accordyng theyr ability serue god layde vp lyfe immortall hyre wage due free gyfte gyuen god moste mercifull father moses iesus christes sake oure lorde whome father would haue thanked gyftes geuen vnto v rather lawe circumcision vii chapiter texte knowe ye brother speake knowe lawe howe law hath power ouer man long endureth woman whiche subiection man bounde lawe man long lyueth yf manne dead losed lawe manne yf whyle man lyueth couple selfe man shalbe coumpted wedlocke breaker yf man dead free lawe husbande wedlocke breaker thoughe couple selfe man good reason doe christe hath onely deliuered v bondage syn death also bondage lawe whiche giuen season hath deliuered gentile whiche wereknow ye c howe lawe hath power ouer c lawe subiecte euen iewes selfe haue hitherto ben vnder moses lawe whiche haue sayed trewe maye proued euen wytnes lawe selfe fyrst saye ye iewes whiche reason knowledge ye haue lawe well perceaue vnderstande man bounde obseruance kepyng lawe euen ye example long synce bounde moses lawe longe lawe lyueth saye long endureth ful power strength yf either growen vse el abrogate man longer bounde therunto iewes bonde towarde lawe ought nofor woman subiection man c kept bonde wyfe husbande lawe requyreth kepte nowe maried woman whiche vnder husbandes dominion bounde vnto husbande long lyueth sone dead deliuered bonde matrimony death former husbande straightway hyr owne libertie wherfore yf duryng husbandes lyfe whome belongeth goso liueth couple herselfe wt c mary another shalbe coupted wedlocke breaker whiche hath forsaken husbande whome myght meanes saue onlye deathe departed contrary wyse yf cotinew badevntyl husbandes death leger bound vnto hym suche sorte become owne woman may lawfully mary wyll supposed maisters title descendeth heyre suche sorte seruaunt death maister chaungeth state maister lyke wyse righte husbande vpon wyfe falleth death title mariage reacheth mannes owne lyfe yf husbande immortall woman shoulde euer continew bond moses lawe figure ceremony shadowe christ come gyuen force effectual vntyll tyme bryght lyght shadowes shoulde gyue place vntyl truthe shadowes truth shoulde gyue ouer vanyshe awaye therfore synce moses lawe man might saye mortall thyng meruayle none thoughe nowe dead dede cause long tyme lawe continewed stode full power full authoritie vpon whiche bounde selfe vnto texte p euen ye also brother deade concernyng lawe bodye christe ye shoulde coupled another meane hym rysen agayne fro death shoulde bring furth fruite vnto god fleshe iustes synne whiche stered vp lawe raigned oure membres bryng furth fruite vnto death deliuered lawe dead vnto vnto bondage shoulde serue newe conuersation spirite olde conuersation letter nowe haue ye moses lawe nothyng synce become warde dead yf lyued styll doth yet areeue ye also brethre dead concerning lawe c ye least dead synce christ whiche truthe hath shewed glisteryng beames gospell abrogate abolished moses lawe leaste touchyng carnall meanyng therof forasmuche ye planted christes body coupled vnto hym wyfe husbande beyng made free fro former bonde ye belonging newe husbande suche one saye immortal whiche rose death lyue hereafter euer insomuche ye cannot tyme come either loke maried agayne deuorced shamefull vilanye reproche suche new husbade ye haue gotten poynt hang vpon olde forasmuche saye ye case diligently labour lawe whiche tyme husbande ye brought furth certayne sorte fruite vnlike husbande endeuour ye bryng furth nowe beyng muche better maried ye fruite suche conueniente god youre father lawe christe youre spouse husbande long subiecte grosse carnal law wer husbande seamed husbandes beare rule ouer v carnall lustes beyng reason lawe prouoked suche power oure membres euen lyke slaues wer drawen synne vnhappy mariage vnhappy chyldren whiche borne nothyng good destroyed dye nowe synce delyuered bondage lawe vnderbut delyu f om th de whome lyued rather oure lyfe synfull lyued dead yet vnder vntyll certayne time appoynted agaynst reason shoulde anye longer obeye carnal husbande wete letter law rather serue oure newe spouse whiche heauenly spirituall seruyng hym olde conuersacion letter newe conuersacion spirite whiche spirite haue hym receyued mariage token texte p shall saye lawe synne god forbid neuerthelesse knewe synne lawe knowen luste meante except lawe sayde thou shalte luste synne toke occasion meanes commaundemente wrought maner concupiscence verelye without lawe syn dead lyued without lawe commaundement came syn reuiued dead commaundement whiche ordayned vnto lyfe found vnto occasion death syn toke occasion meanes commaundement deceyued slew wherfore lawe holye commaundement holye iust good nowe feare leste captious persone thynke condemne lawe authour synne sayed whyles vnder lawe ranne forwarde euen synne death suche one wyll let reason matier saye righteousnes worketh lyfe sinne properly appertayneth worke death yf law v worketh death either semeth lawe synne leste ioyned synne god forbid anye man thinke lawe authour synne vttererneuertheles knewe synne lawe apeacher therof wherof lawe gyuen wer manner ignoraunt eche man fauoured owne folye thynking might lawfully hym lusted thinking also wel done good desyre thyng whiche haue semed pleasaunt wyse therfore fauoryng selfe manner ignoraunt desyre mannes goodes synne law sayd vnto thou shalt luste dede law gyuen suppresse synne folye chaunced otherwise whyles lawe shewed man sinnes gaue power resist vpon occasion folowed ne desyre syn prouoked euen propertie menne prouoked suche thynges forbidden therfore forasmuche lawe gyuen certayne synnes knewe certayne knewe yet suche sorte thoughte myghte lawfully vse forbydden mynde houerly fayntlye moued synne euen wonte sklenderlye loue suche thynges wherof maye luste haue pleasure lawe many wayes manner synne declared whole rable naughtie desyres beyng prouoked throughe prohibition begonne vehemently allure synne occasion synne toke strength power whiche thefor sinne loke occasion meanes commaundement c lawe geuen dull manner dead meane season lyued without lawe rather thought lyued one might freely sinne lusted commaundement law forbydden syn synful vsage onely restrayned also seemed quyckened take strength sone synne sorte quyckened whiche thoughte selfe lyue deade lawe knowyng synne yet neuertheles continewyng stil whervpon folowed meane whiche prouided ordeyned healpe oure lyfe tourned death throughe anye faulte whiche lawe throughe myne owne faulte whereas selfe gyuen synne sycke diseased mynde takyng occasion sinne reason prohibition law became desyrous synne thus deuill abusyng good instrument occasion ministred throughe law enticed synne synne slewe knewe selfe gyltiewherfore lawe holye commaundement holy thrall vnto another cause therfore shoulde reproue law gyuen good god layeth v good lawful holy commaundementes nedes muste good whiche forbyddeth euell texte good made death vnto god forbid naye syn syn myght appeare whiche good worke death synne commaundement myght measure synfull knowe lawe spirituall carnall solde vnder synne allow whiche doe woulde hate yf whiche would consent vnto law good nowe doe syn dwelleth knowe saye fleshe dwelleth good thinge one againe encounter saye synce lyke bryngeth furth lyke yf lawe good hath wrought death whiche euell wonte engendred synne wherunto aunswer easye reason stronge lawe wrought oure death nowe sayed farre otherwyse supposed lawe authour death rather thatnaye synne syn might appere whiche good c synne cause destruction whiche thing suche infeccion full poyson turned whiche selfe good oure vndoyng euery man maye euidently perceyue pestilent thyng syn whose contagion suche thynges best tourne worste wherof law gaue occasio yet fault lawe knowe spirituall prouoketh v goodnes cause commeth passe wherabout lawe labourethbut carnall solde vnder synne saye example speake selfe whiche carnal gyuen synne reason long custome continuaunce synne thral bonde therto euen bondslaue bought money boud maister farfurthe reason blyndnes synne whiche wote ought whiche minde reason telleth honeste though heart desyre rather whiche contrarye honestie hate vnhonest beyng vndoubtedly ouercume naughtie desyres maye euenif would consent c offender hurtefull person vnderstande lawe reproued yf fleshlye desyres mouyng suche thynges mynde reason condemneth abhorreth withoute doubte consente lawe good whiche forbad suche thynges done vsed better parte reason condemned disalowed nedes muste good whiche dothe forbid suche thynges whiche though folowyng fleshe yet knowe well euyll nought one wyll saye doest thou obeye thyne owne reason beyng suche doth consent honestie feare dishonestie syn nowe forasmuche playnes teachyng vsed haue taken vpon person suche one yet subiect vice noughtie desyres ye muste onely ymagination conceiue two men one carnal grosse pure grosse whiche two one maye called outwarde manne inwarde one beyng subiecte vnlawful desyres wholly gyuen synnefor know c dwelleth good thyng hauyng yet sparkes goodnes remaynyng maye laboureth honestiewarde myddes oure synfull lyfe asmuche maye relisteth withstandeth nowe estemyng rather according vnto better part v often therfore mynde agreyng vnto lawe endeuoureth towarde honestie doth yet dede contrary thynketh whiche doth whiche would grosser parte forwardnes synne certayne aptnes therunto meanes wherof cummeth passe thoughe would well godly yet contrary yf parte wit sensuall parte men esteme measure graunt ther goodnes texte wyll pre ent fynde meanes perfourme good good woulde euyll whiche would yf would hen synne dwelleth fynde lawe would good euyll present delyte lawe god inwarde manne ut se law member rebellyng agaynst lawe mynde subduyng vnto lawe syn whiche member wretch man shall delyuer fro body subdued vnto death thanke god iesus christe lorde wt mynde serue lawe god fleshe lawe synne albeit inclination reason desyre honestefor wyl presente fide meanes perfourme c yet haue power bryng passe good desyer whyles fleashly luste pluckyng euyll fylthy lyfe hath greater stroke preuayleth tha doth reason prouokyng goodnes happeneth good whiche desyre rather disalowe condemne saye euyll nowe yf man thought thyng whiche dothe agaynst wyll synce thing better parte man would seme authour rather readines synne grocer parte towardnes readynes synne taken lawe yf anye tyme purpose folowe obeye motion lawe causeth vnderstande gryef throughly rooted fastened soule dede delyghted ifor delyghte lawe god c honestie goodnes whiche see know lawe syde fynde member myne outwarde man another law whiche lawe reaso quite contrary continuallye rebelleth agaynst thoughe reason call one waye wylful desyres another waye yet beareth rule whiche worse ouercommen better depelye rooted fleshe towardenes inclination synne suche power custome therof beyng altered nature whyther wyl drawen synne wretched man vnder suche miserable painfull bondage shall delyuer fleashe endaungered many synnes contencions whereby continuallye drawen wretched man shal deliuer c death maye manne whiche vnder suche violent harde necessitie well lawfully make suche exclamation certaynely greater vnlucky bondage bounde goodnes god whiche hath suche misery deliuered v neyther lawe yet circumcision iesus christ lord god thus muche done v euen one man shoulde continually haue bene lykewyse pluckte sunder deuided mynde haue serued lawe god desyrous good thynges fleshe lawe synne beyng ouer commen wanton desyres temptacions therof viii chapiter texte damnacion whiche christ iesu whiche walke fleshe spirite lawe spirite life iesus christ hath made free lawe synne death lawe could forasmuche weake fleshe perfourmed god sent sonne similitude sinneful fleshe sinne damned sinne fleshe righteousnes lawe might fulfylled v whiche walke fleshe spirite wherfore though yet leauynges dregges former bondage stil remaine christian men yet shal godly endeuour wel suppresse theyr wylles drawen suche haynous offence reason wherof suche might deserue dampned fayth baptisme graffed christes bodyfor lawe spirit life iesus christ hath made fre law synne death haue intended purposed liue longer wanton carnal desyres moued ruled syth christes lawe spiritual authour life effectual subduer death hath deliuered v fro synne also death ioyned thervnto whiche moses lawe could inasmuche carnal therfore effectual god meruailously prouided saluacio therfore tolde one two men carnal spiritual man moses lawe wer two lawes one grosse carnal heauenly spiritual fyrst part law moses maker whiche endured season strength power sufficient worke saluacion parte lawe spiritual effectual mightie suche wyl neuer dye christ beyng seconde moses made pointes perfite truely mete wyse fleshe shuld abolishe fleshe synne synne ouercomen also death subdue death whiche entent god mercyfullyand sent sonne similitude sinfall fleshe beyng man saluacion desyrous sent sonne though dede farre corrupcion synne endued yet suche fleshe synners haue toke comen nature menne vpon though bene synner among synners conuersaunt yea euen fastened vpon crosse among heynous transgressours though selfe suche one also insomuche maner toke vpon person synne end likenes synne might fyrst ouercome synne foorthwith abolishe beyng made sacrifice synnes diyng touching fleshe whiche taken subdued death whiche desyres fleshe fleshely lawe bare rule vpon v caused hencefoorth abolishyng carnal meanyng lawe better parte therof whiche call spiritual sence spirite steade take place worke god displeasure fyrst geue perfite righteousnes whiche lede theyr life lawe carnally vnderstaden iewes spiritual heauenly meanyng therof men renued christ new borne iewes nothyng drawen painted shadowe righteousnes vndoubted perfite righteousnes v iesus christ throughly perfitely wrought texte carnal carnally minded spiritual gostly minded carnally minded death spiritually minded life peace fleshely minde enemy god obediente lawe god neither fleshe cannot please god loue good wyll borne thinges v beyng greatly chaunged make plaine profe newe kynde profession se suche styl holde theyr iewishe supersticion yet carnal carnal vsuages muche delited cotrary suche graffed christ haue begunne lede spiritual life renouncyng fleshely desyres rauished enamoured like conuersacion godly spiritual comenly see euery man fauour suche thinges selfe bent vnto mortall touchyng fleshe yet hath christ immortal called v life self life carnal lawe iewes onely litterally obserued euen againstto carnally minded death spiritually minded life peace christ reason therof worketh death kylleth forasmuche whiche onely authour life iewes selfes well appeared fauour zeale borne therto put death author life righteousnes syde whiche despisyng carnal lettre lawe folowen spiritual mocions god fynde christ life striue waterishe ceremony law gladly folowyng inclinacions charitie al men peace concorde supersticion ful ianglyng true godly pytie quiet peaceable meruaile none suche men dissecion whiche peace wt god nothing el cleaue stike fast carnal law god would christ shuld abolished steade therof spiritual law might ensue take place rebel agaist god whiche froward minde synce squareth fro god pleasure cannot whiche calleth v farre vnlike co trary rule actes let noman therfore thinke smal peril ieopardy stubbernly hang vpo lettre law therin cotinue let v assure selfes vayne thyng please men vnles please god also suche stubbernly mainteine moses law litterally carnally vnderstaden except forsaking carnalnes therof falso fleshe please god spirite neither please god let iewes exacte requyre theyr feastes new moone theyr sabboth day kepyng neuer somuche shal attaine loke texte ye fleshe spirite spirite god dwell man haue spirite christ none christ body dead synne spirite aliue righteousnes sake wherfore spirite raised vp iesus christ fro death dwel euen raised vp christ death shall quicken mortal bodyes spirite dwelleth whiche haue wt carnal law nothing thinges nothing belong since ye becomen spiritual ye suche codicion lede life please ye holy spirite god dweller heartes whoso nothyng el baptised styl belongeth carnalif man haue spirit christ none h c kyngdome fleshe excepte taste also christ blessed spirite inspired coupled vnto christ ceremony spirite whoso lacketh christ straunger christ syth nothyng el chastitie trueth teperauce vertues synne haue place whoso hath receiued christ must nedes suche vertuous pointes expresse sayd dyed touchyng fleshe mahed yet liueth life euerlastyng fruitfully expresse reseble ye body say grosse part whiche wt pleasaunt lustes allureth v vnhappines dead without al desyre synne therwith spirit also say better part v alway moueth goodnes mightie power draweth v suche thinges good righteous quicke aliue therfore spirite god whiche raised iesus christ fro death vnfainedlywherfore spirite raised vp iesus christ death c dwel wyll idle liuely effectual thyng spirit god wyll accordyng vnto capacity likewise worke christ raised death suffereth dye againe wyl ye raise fro sinne death dede life extynguishyng froward desyres appetite al whiche wil blissed spirit ye author life dwelleth texte therfore brother detters fleshe liue fleshe ye liue fleshe ye shal dye ye spirite mortifye dedes body ye shal liue many led spirite god sonnes god ye haue receiued spirite bondage feare ye haue receiued spirite adopcion wherby crye abba father spirite certifieth spirit sonnes god sonnes also heires meane god heires annexed christ suffre may also glorified together vnder spirit therfore liue subiectes must obey fleshe whervnto deade assone begunne one christ cast bondage wherwith fleshe endaungered syth god forbid hereafter liue fleshe ruleth whiche fleshe rather spirite obedient remebre ye called life ye liue carnally runne ye headlong deathwarde contrary power spirit yefor ye liue flesh ye shal dye c suppresse al fleshely desyres suche mortifiyng ye shal liue liue gouernaunce spirite god paynefull profession albeit call foorth great weightie enterprise yet ye glad willyng vndertake enkienled feruent charitie nothyng hard nothyng swete pleasaunt body liueth bodily spirite eth soule heauenly bodily spirites natural power weake faint wholle body made dul heauye quicke lustie wholle bodye full courage likewyse al suche spirite god ledde moued childre suche towarde childre resemble theyr father goodnes mery chere frely doyng al suche thinges shal suppose wyll please bondslaues betwene theyr maisters natural knotte feare punishement abstaine fro euil beyng violetly copelled theyr duty iewes whiche bondage lawe delited wyse ye whiche deliueredbut ye haue receiued spirite adopcion c fro bodage wyl nomore fal feare nedeful compel endued ye spirite god ye adopcion receiued nubre seruautes god owne child spirit putteth v suche sure trust cofidence distress may boldly speake vnto god wordes whiche father gentilly fauourably wont geue eare vnto callyng vpo father father whiche worde durst bold trouble lametably speake vnto assurauce child also merciful father log liue comaundement copulsion saye freethis spirite certifieth spirit ye sonnes god wyl gladly accoumpted v childre neuer would haue geuen v holy spirit benefite god therfore whether ye cal pledge token fatherly loue wel assureth conscience child whiche gaue v pledge child seruauntes also heyres heyres say god author begynner al thinges come ioynte inheritor christ whose body beyng graffed haue father hath enioy one comen enheritaunce shal yet none otherwyse possesse goyng pathe waye whiche pleased christ selfe walke sufferauce misery came possession glorious inheritauce obedience came kyngdome reproche came glory death attained life euerlastyng suffer must therfore may ioyes partaker obedient must may wt raigne euerlastyngly suffre must also worldely shame vilany heauen may glorifyed finally season dye also may kyngdome liue euer texte suppose affliccions life worthy glorye whiche shalbe shewed vpon v feruent desyre creature abideth lokyng sonnes god shal appeare creature subdued vanitie wyl therof wyl whiche subdued hope creature shalbe deliuered fro bondage corrupcion glorious libertie sone god knowe euery creature groneth v also trauaileth paine euen vnto tyme wayes condicions wynne inheritaunce wherof since shal neuer ende thyng selfe great itfor suppose affliccions life notworthy c passeth al men capacity estimacion surely al affliccions life put vpon one mannes bodye yet weight euen trifle beyng weighed compared reward glory come whiche men gette maner bye suche great displeasure calamity though already haue ernest peny welthy life come therof noma shuld dispayre yet reason oure bodyes subiecte paynes death euery point perfite full meane tyme spirite god haue therof inwardly secrete taste geuen v shall haue fully wholy body restored life misery mortal state shaken tyme shall euerlastyngfor ferne desyre creature abydeth lookyng sone god shal appeare c christ raigne euerlastyngly whiche ioyful tyme meane season whole engyne worlde ernestly loketh maner wishyng day wherin numbre god child fulfilled restored theyr glory shal plainly appeare whiche beyng yet burdened theyr mortal body huger thryst disease diuers paynes misery punished yea euen world selfe sorte semeth mannes careful estate partaker yearth water ayre heauenly bodyes briefe euen angel selfe god especially made helpe mannes necessity therfore muche verye worlde selfe shal suche misery free vntyl goddes child sette perfite fredome yt meane season bodage vnwillyngly euen dead creature haue life natural desyre ther made perfite yet abide nethelesse bodage therin obeiyng whose pleasure became subiecte enduryng muche paciently knoweth selfe bonde euer vnder co dicion sone child god fully deliuered al infeccion death shal ye worlde lenger thral vnder displeasure corrupcion syth see al ye elemetes world diuersly altered vnder many corrupcions see sunnefor know euery creature gr neth v also c moone besyde almost seme theyr continual renewyng corruptible creature labor vayne haue also theyr eclipse synce one starres power also contrary another synce doubt also whole copany angel fro heauen beholdyng wretchednes reason pitiful loue borne towarde v greatly moued farre may stade theyr blessed state sory misery appeareth al natural thynges mourne v like woman trauailyng chylde wyshe ende labor sorowes texte onely also whiche haue fyrst fruites spirit mourne selues also wayte adopcion child god euen deliueraunce body saued hope hope seen hope manne hope whiche seeth hope see pacience abide seme muche lesse meruaile suche sorowe befal vnto creature syth euen also whiche sauiours commyng fyrst al replenished spirit christ meane sorte fully yet styl vnder many misery partely diuerse necessity life partly obstinacie vngodly people oftetymes mourne selfe dayly compelled sorye euen mennes calamity also desyryng co tinually prayer made god day wherein whole body christ ful perfite al membres shal deliuered noysomnes grosse carnal become spiritual heauenly immortal meane season al calamity chaunce vnto v abyde suffre hope blisse whiche promised christ albeit haue receiued earnest penye assuryng v saluacion come yet hath presently geuen v full saluacion would haue v looke tyme come christian mennes perfite weale thinges come wherof hauefor saued hope hope seen hope sure hope hope suche thynges already present seen iyen suche yet appeare pray tel euer sayd hoped see whiche sawe iyen already life commendacion fayth hope euen presetly put possession suche thynges christ hath promysed vnto v fayth well worthye prayse clearenes therof see suche thynges carnal iyes cannot perceiued meane season continuyng styl sufferyng paynes ful hope lookyng whiche promised though meane season suche bodily affliccions heauy payneful yet perhapse expedient v punished texte lykewyse also spirite helpeth infirmity knowe desyre ought spirite maketh intercession v grouynges whiche cannot erpre sed sercheth heartes knoweth meanyng spirit maketh intercession saintes accordyng pleasure god trouble spiritual inwarde dede taketh good worth striueth bodily infirmity spirit god stayeth grace aydyng weakenes fleshe hope encouragyng v suffer al thinges euermore hand shewyng v ought desyre refuse owne might inclina ionfor know desyre ought wote desyred ought desyre meanes wherof oftymes cometh passe steede holsome thinges pray hurteful euen fortuned vnto self whiche beyng content myne affliccions bodily desyred importunely god helpe thrise makyng prayer vnto satan tyme troubled might nomore tepte wherin desyred god whiche expedient attaine tequest toke effecte therfore stede pleasure receiued holsome giftes dede god heareth peticions child yet make carnal prayer pray vnto accordyng vnto mocion blessedbut spirit maketh intetcession c spirite secretely mouyug heartes spirite also though hold peace yet peticioner meane god praiyng v men wont sighes vnspeakable spirite man sometyme great mournyng desyreth god preserue hym bodely trouble affliccion el desyreth worldlye pleasure commoditeis muche esteming thinges dede trifle heauenly spirite graffed planted godly ne heartes desyreth god suche perticions whiche lacke desyred god syghes vnspeakeable forasmuche obteyned bryng verye trew perfit weale blysse ofand search hertes knoweth meanyng spirite men must thou wordes outwardely pronounced spoken desyre yu myndest obtayne whiche neither know would haue except heare yet sufficiently vnderstande best v asked god whiche searcheth euen moste secret parte mannes harte throughly loketh knoweth though holde oure peace oure spirite desireth pitiyng mannes misery often maketh intercession suche godly prayeth man woulde haue goddes holy wil pleasure desyreth nothing suche apertayne euerlastyng saluatio suche thynges encrease god honor glory whosoeuer desyreth thinges albeit per adueture erre choyse electio yet intet purpose good wherfore god graunteth alwaye whiche hym desyred rather profitable ende wherunto yu directedst al thy peticions texte know al thynges worke best vnto loue god also called purpose whiche knewe also ordayned shoulde lyke fashioned vnto shape sonne myght fyrste begotte sonne amog many brethre moreouer appoynted also called hath called also iustified iustified also glorified ought feare leste beyng ouercome weight ne outragious persecution vtterly fal fro hym since know certayne affliccion soeuer chaunce vnto deuoute godly people al ye shalbe ye best suche god fauer towardes hath purpose chose called welthy lyfe endeuour must v lyeth thende al hangeth god ordinaunce god without cou el vnaduisedly choseth none wel knoweth al long cal knoweth hefor w che knewe also ord ned calleth also euen tyme surely purposed himselfe graffe plante bodye sonne iesus yea transfourme lykewyse lykenes shape hym whiche ouercomyng fleshe death triumphantly went immortalitie teache al member bodye themself loke haue see alreadie done head waye meanes onely sonne myght hymselfe geat manye chyldren amonge whome iesus christe head capitayne fyrste begotten departyng yet inheritaunce put v assuraunce lykewyse god wyll fully perfourme thyng purposed moreouer al tyme knew chose suche whome already prophetes darke sayinges shewedand whome hath called also iustified c minde called also gospel vaine goodnes fauer made wer called vngodly godly hurtful hurtlesse remayneth glorifying wherof great deale haue already except thinke glorious preeminence without syn floryshe renoume innocent lyfe without corrupt desyers planted christ thou arte become one hym haue holy spirite earnest peny therof enheritour god ioynte enheritour christ reste wyse doubt shall dewe tyme fulfylled texte shal saye thynges yf god syde v spared owne sonne gaue hym v hym gyue v thinges also shall laye thyng charge goddes chosen god iustifieth codemne christ dyed yea rather whiche rysen agayne whiche also right hand god maketh intercession v syth wherfore shoulde man mistrust namelye synce god hath many euident wayes shewed vnto v specialif god side ca againste v loue great fauer standing oure syde anye aduersarie able mennes malice preuayle yf god defender maye boldly looke handes beyng reconcyled vnto hym whiche tyme fauer oure sake spared sonne sent hym downe world v yea saye brought hym maner nought deposed hym al exalte v makyng hym wel nyghe syn deliuer v syn deliuered hym death thentent myght lyue therfore syth hath v delyuered sonne al goodnes foloweth gyfte hath gyuen v rightes belong sonne v saye whome hath put lyke state enheritaunce wyll gyue v synce hath gyuen hym whiche infinitely passeth creature ieopardye ther none least god thorough crafty sleyghtes temptacions deuill chaunge withdrawe especiall fauer v durst commense anye action agaynste whome god purpose sure determinacion mynde hath chosen taketh owne wyl heare thynke anye accuser capciouse complayntes agaynst whose synnes hath freely forgeuen god hymselfe whiche iudge hath forgeuen vsit god iustifieth condene c offence oure olde lyfe taketh v nowe ryghteous condemne v beyng quited take hede nomore fall oure olde lyfe agayne christe loued v tenderly welthe pleased hym dye yea lykewyse rose agayne sake would healp succoure v people great procter iudge syttyng also right hand god father whome poyntes egall entreateth matier maiestie texte shal seperate v loue god shall tribulacion anguishe persecucion hunger either nakednes either perill either swearde written thy sake kylled daye long coumpted sheepe appoynted slayne neuerthelesse thynges ouercome hym loued v sure neither death neyther lyfe neither angel rule neither power neither thinges present neither thinges come neither height neither loweth neither creature shalbe able depart v loue god christ iesu lorde synce therfore father hath thorough death sonne forgiuen v al oure gyltes offence sythe sonne tenderly loueth v shoulde men hencefurthe feare deuyll man diuels minister either accusyng v condemnyng considering also howewho shal separate v fro loue god many benefites speciall gage loue bounde god christ
