shal plucke withdraw v awaye louyng agayne whiche tenderly loue v shall storme worldly aduersitie shall affliccion distresse shal hunger nakeones shal ieopardy drownyng lyke peryl chaucyng lyke sort shal persecucion wycked bloudy swearde death suche thynges worlde happe innocentes holy psalme wryter dauid lightened spirite god long sawe tyme sayde thy sake lorde kylled al daye long coumpted sheepe appoynted slayne al trouble thoughe seme greuouse cause yet none ought make v frayd chaunce maye v dede yet oppresse v notneuertheles al e thi ge w ouercum hym loued v yea saye vehemetly trouble v shal bothe strengthen oure burnyng charitie christward christes also v al tymes departe hauyng vpper hand strength power oure owne defence whome bounde thanke altogether wil whiche suche sorte loueth v suffer v ouerthrowen vpon remembraunce goodnes towarde v assaultes aduersities shrinke louyng hym agayne yet haue rehearsed vnto lyghte common mattiers harken bolder saying suche wherof selfe moste certaine moste certaynly persuaded cause feare suche ieopardies hang ouer oure heade reason creature whiche seene euil spirites whiche yet neuerthelesse assault mennes soules body yf regarde despise ieopardies make v aneyther heighte loweth c fearde haue cause feare seyng neither meane power aungels muche myght yet man neither chief aungels whiche order called rule power neither anye heyght depnes saye whether inuade v fro aboue beneth whither coloure honestie yea though wonder shewed heauen el threatnynges hell put v feare neither thinges present neither yet come whether put feare present ieopardyes ieopardy life come briefly soeuer el befall anye earthly thinges whether maye sene neuer strong mightie yet shal able deuide v charitie wherbye knyt god throughe iesus christe sonne ix chapiter texte saye trueth christ lye conscience also bearyng witnes holy ghost haue greate heauines continual sorow hearte haue wyshed selfe cursed christe brother kynsmen pertaynyng fleshe whiche israelite whome pertayneth adoption chyldren glorie couenauntes law gyuen seruice god promise whose also father concernyng fleshe christe came whiche god al thinges praysed euer amen whome would god iewes conuerted forsakyng theyr moses iewes saye yet styll continewe mynde thynke thattaynyng saluation sufficient abraham chyldren theyr handes haue lawe gyuen vnto god whome yet deede suche thyng shall auayle profite vnles faythe make themselfes worthy drawen loued god christe promised lawei say truth n christ l e co science also bearing witnesse c stubbernly refused gentile receiue knowledge yet speake displeasure conceyued borne agaynst contreye men withstandyng theyr spitefull myndes toward christe nothing vnknowen witnes witnessyng wt hym also myne owne conscience whose gouernoure ouerseer holy ghost wyl saye truthe lye troubleth mynde exceadynglye aboue measure continuall sorowe euen weareth awaye seefor haue wish dde self cursed fro christ c owne folye vtterly perishe myne owne parte ferte hatyng iewes yf myghte waye would euen myne owne destruction procure theyr amendment weale would refuse euen selfe christe forsaken countrey aliaunce ioyned fayth christ lykewyse ioyned stocke bloud israelite lykewyse knowledge trueth perfite israelite whome nacions moste besemed receyue hym lawe promised specially sith nation whome god al many hudred yeares past specially chose hym self coumpting nation bastarde child nouryshed brought vp naturall trew begotten sonnes moste aboue honoure dignitie maye speciallye glorie theyto whome pertayneth adopcion chyldren glory c dispising idolatrye worshipped verye trewe god theyr handes possession prerogatyue lawe gyuen vnto god made god god couenauntes promise theyr handes right fourme maner dewe honouryng god euen hym self commauded theyr handes prophecy wherin long christes commyng spoken welthy state wherof dyd litle glorye promysed also lineally descended moste famouse chief lanterneswhose also ye father co ce nyng fleshe christe came lyght fyrste begynners nacion meane abraha isaac iacob christ hymself touchyng humanitie vouchsaued borne behalfe wyll aliaunce kynred muste nedes christe hymself ferre ferre excelleth passeth father whose title holines greatly auaut themselfe theyr father neuer good holy yet wer nothyng el men nowe christe suche sorte man therwith also god nacion onlye al one equall father whiche ruleth al thinges whose vnsearcheable wysedome geare wrought onlye suche vnspeakeable loue borne towarde mankynde al prayse thankes dewe euer amen texte p speake thinges though wordes god take none effect al israelite israel neither chyldren straighte waye seede abraham isaac shall thy seede called saye whiche chyldren fleashe child god whiche chyldren promise coumpted seede worde promise tyme wyll come sara shall haue sonne surely detestable wickednes iewes whiche vnreuerently gaynsaying blasphemyng christe therin dishonour god father whiche woulde haue gloryous name set furth sone yet al theyr wyckednes outragiouse caused god neuertheles al poyntes perfourmed muche prophetes sayinges promised people israel whiche abraham posteritie blysseful lyfe promysed yet neither truly vnfaynedly ofspryng supposed al suche israelite asthey israelite whiche israel c descended stocke israel suche rather strong mightie fayth wyll worldly tribulation ouercomen yet trouble wherwith god tryeth oure stedfastnes religion suche saye worthely none el ought called israelite saye mighty strong godwarde al come abraham bloude therfore fer abraham chyldren bare title may chalege promised inheritauce rather suche reseble fayth abraham wherby deserued blessed inheritauce deriued giue vnto al posteritie make euidet playne marke whyther worde god made promise whiche saythe isaac thy sede shalbe called seede abraha promyse made al nation world shoulde famouslybut isaac shal thy seede b called c spoken blessyd nowe god wyl al abrahas posteritie called abraham seede vnles isaac chylde fayth figure represented christe nowe isaac borne chyldren comenly wont father whiche dede drye barayne full yet truste god olde woman vnmete lykewyse conceyue chylde muche rather therfore begotten mightye power ofthey whiche chyldre fleshe chyldren god c god father faythe power man carnall acte el meaned god sayde isaac thy seede shall haue name playnlye declare whiche abraha carnally begotten therfore chyldren god therfore righte inheritours goddes promyses suche onlye apertayne belong abraham seede whiche haue lyke fayth wherby abraham deserued receyue promyse god mary yf god vnder fourme wordes made promise manye shalbe begotte shall promyse belong dede myghte suche abraham carnall stocke lawfully clayme glorious inheritaunce nowe god wyse sayde time wyll come sara shall haue sonne ment onlye chylde whiche shoulde chylde fayth whome god inheritaunce chosen furthe many circumcision sake whiche tyme borne father faythes sake abraham tyme wyues chyldren yet abraham blessyng promised vnto hym isaac name texte p also rebecca childe one euen oure father isaac yet chyldren borne neither done good neither bad purpose god election might stande sayde vnto reason workes caller elder shal serue yonger wrytten iacob haue loued esau haue hated shall saye anye vnrighteousnes god god forbid sayth moses wyl shewe mercie whomsoeuer shewe mercie wyll haue compassion whomsoeuer haue compassion lyeth mane wyl running mercie god scripture saith vnto pharao euen purpose haue stiered vp shewe power name might declared worlde hath mercie whome wyll maketh hard harted isaac chyldren abraham lyke sorte condicion iacob esau yf glorious enheritauncerebecca child one euen father isaac goddes blessyng onely throughe carnall kynred befel vnto shoulde muche rather belong esau elder sonne iacob yonger isaac father one mother one time conceyued bothe bothe one time borne mother woumbe one time delyuered yet dyd god knowledge one natural chylde disinheriting bastarde vnlawfully borne saying iacob haue loued esau haue hated thus seuered made difference betwixt twinnes surely neyther carnall kynred kepyng lawe yet circumcision beyng yet borne thing al done either lawe agaynst sayde elder shal serue yonger pleased god intended deede declare vnto v surely nothyng el noman shoulde either vpon hopethat purpose god election might stande circumcision lawe chalenge righte goddes promise vnles faith make hymselfe worthye taken among chosen chyldren god suche isaac iacob carnal kynred maketh abraham child choyse god god refuse reiecte iewes reiected esau certainely descended abraham stocke nothyng auaileth syde god desert fayth receiue gentile inheritaunce hurte none though abraham carnal aliaunce forsomuche god another way title adopcion say doth acknowledge owne child let deuilishe person wreste haue sayd thiswhat shal say vnrighteousnes god purpose though men wer fault al faulte god pleasure receiueth refuseth suche haue either payne pleasure nothyng deserued god forbid man conceiue suche phantasye let manne take whiche boke exodi god spoken wyl shewe mercy soeuer shewe mercy wyll haue compassion soeuer haue compassion forasmuche lyeth man wyl runnyng goddes mercy attaine vnto saluacion whiche bothe desyre vayne al vayne labor vnlesse god goodnes drawe v deede doeth suche pleaseth though nothing deserue refuseth suche haue nothing deserued yet al foloweth god wrongfull rather mercyfull many noman condemneth god owne offece man saued without god benefite whiche benefite vouchesaueth geue vnto suche pleaseth yet suche sorte leaueth occasion men merciful drawyng thake thou nethelesse without occasion complayne thou geuen ouer thyne owne leudenes god doeth harden men heartes therby men caused discredite gospel christ suche malice stubbernes refuse beleue vseth god instrumentes magnifiyngfor scripture sayth vnto pharao euen purpose haue stered vp c great benefite settyng foorth mightie glorious power must whiche exodi spoke pharoa vnderstaden euen purpose haue stered vp shewe power name might declared throughout al worlde texte thou wylte say vnto blameth v yet hath able resist man art thou whiche disputest god shal worke say workeman hast thou made fashion hath potter power ouer clay euen lumpe make one vessel vnto honour another vnto dishonour euen god willyng shewe wrath make power knowen suffered long pacience vessel wrath ordained damnacion declare rich glorye vessel mercye whiche prepared vnto glory also called iewes onely also gentile sayeth also osee wyl cal people whiche people beloued whiche beloued haue obtained mercy obtained mercy shal come passe place sayd vnto ye people shal called child liuyng god suche saiynges deuilishe disposed person taketh occasion sayeth soeuer wyl haue mercy wyl maketh hard hearted hath wherin blame v syth wyl pleasure noman able resist let laye selfe v sinne comitted heare otherside may sayd noman withstadeth wyl graunt yet therfore goddes wyll cause thy danacion god suche maner harde heart pharao wrought vice stubbernes therin rather wheras wel knew arrogat tyran wel worthy sodenly destryed yet vsed god toward litle litle suche encrease punishment might therwt haue ameded malice impediment god gentle fauor vsed punishyng wicked mynde became worse worse therfore man frowardnes god turned glory matter defece god righteousnes many thinges might answered briefly say god hateth hautnesbut man arte whiche disputest god shal work say workm n c arrogancie greatter point arrogancie man vile abiecte god reason matter encoutryng though felowe pray could abide heare yearthen vessel quarel maker say hast thou made fashion clay hade potter euen god hades prophet esai lord selfe sayeth potter mynde standeth worketh vessel serue vile vncleanly v also appointeth honest seruice whiche acte reason soeuer workeman folowe therin doeth lawfully doeth vnmete clay requyre cause clay selfe nothyng el clay wherof potter worke comly welfauored cup fayre shape ought geue thanke craftes man yet vile filthy clay therhath potter power ouer claye euen lupe c wrong done al made chambre potte vessel vile vse lykewyse god whiche leauyng sinne borne doeth wrong callyng man rightwyse life therin sheweth bounteous mercy goodnes forsaken person pleaseth god shewe iustice thentent would feared approued thentent would loued sheweth fre mercy besemeth god doyng exacte requyre reason calleth one lately tymely draweth one whiche hath deserued forsaketh another whiche hath deserued better muche base creature beyng compared god clay compared potter vnsene hiddeous presumpcion clay potter pratle reason matter muche greatter arrogancie man talke god counsel whiche farre passe capacity therof haue euen shadowe dreame begyn beleue leaue thy reasonyng shalt muche rather vnderstad besides remebre potter may deceiued god none error foud ynough beleue god reason almightie power may pleasure liste forasmuche wtout coparyson beste wyl nothing whiche beste vngodlines turneth honor therfore v blamed rather shuld take sure profe exceadyng goodnes suche mischief turneth good god whiche made vncleane vessell thou thy selfe art whiche hast made thy selfe filthy appliyng thy selfe vngodly exercise beside god accordyng wysdome saluacion good glory name abuse thy frowardnes cause hast thou none complayne lawfully art thou thy sinne punished thine example good people wil better take hede while thy blindnes destruction better perceiue greatly bound goodnes god wt mery chere encouraged geue thankes nothyng pharao wyte god withal owne naughtynes perished yet stubberne malice among hebrewes highly auaunce glory god reproue godeuen god willyng shewe wrath make power knowen suffered long pacience vessel wrath c tyme deferred destruccion pharao likewyse season without great fauour beare suffre vnbeleuyng sturdy iewes beyng vessel whiche haue right well deserued euen hand crushed piece thentent worlde shall clearely perceiue well worthy damnacion whiche beyng many wayes prouoked amende thende bothe theyr punishment feare almightie god may continuaunce synne prouoke sure vengeaunce also plentifully shewe greatnes might glory towarde good people hath purged beyng vncleane vessel reserued holy v theyr circucision lawes sake deserte fayth whose onely sake called honoure called say iewes also getiles herein byrthe whiche maketh inheritor choyse god ought iewes meruaile gentile whiche tyme heathen straungers god adopcion receiued numbre god child syth selfe long synce wer theyr offence done god dispised reiected disinherited yet afterwarde beyng sory theyr synnes amendyng wer great bountyfulnes god receiued fauor witnesseth theyr owne prophete osee sayingi wyl cal people whiche people c wyll call people whiche wer people beloued whiche beloued haue obtained mercye whiche obtained mercye shall come passe place heretofore sayd ye people shal called child liuyng god grudge reproue thyng whiche selfe haue already assayed stande rather watche take hede lest theyr owne foly become againe wer enuy might folowe wer pleasure striue obeye texte esai crieth concernyng israel though numbre child israel sande sea yet remnaunt shal saued finisheth worde verely maketh shorte righteousnes shorte worde wyll god make yearth esai sayeth excepte lorde sabboth left v seede made sodoma likened gomorra men owne stubbernes greatest parte worlde perishe yet fewe wyl beleue wyl god perfourme muche promised whole numbre neuer shal tyme inheritaunce shal haue successor prophete esai speakyng people israel without al colouryng clearely testifye page duplicate page duplicate saiyng numbre israelite wer many sand sea though theyr owne foly many also perished yet shal alway remaine whiche shal fayth saued numbre falleth god neuer great yet shal theyrthough numbre child israel sand sea c fal make promise god vaine men promise wont breake theyr credence god whiche wyl fully perfourme al promised briefely copendiously deceite falsely iustly truely prophete esai sayd lord yearth wyl make shorte worde shadowes seme cleare without suspicion deceite law selfe ful wordes promisyng grosly represetyng comaundyng threatnyng sometimes sometimes coforting christ beyng sent worlde euen gaue al perfourmed promised opened al hidden figure brought great multitude rule contained law onely comaudement charitie ofa short word wyll god make yerth gospel thus spread abrode seede heauenly doctrine gospel whiche albeit many countreymen vnfruitful yet brought foorth fruit againe prophet litle sayeth lord sabboth left v sede ben made sodoma likened vnto gomorra wherfore though part iewes fal christ yet wyl christ suffre true natural sede abraham vtterly perishe texte shal say say gentile whiche folowed righteousnes haue ouertaken righteousnes euen righteousnes whiche cometh fayth contrarywise israel whiche felowed lawe righteousnes could attaine lawe righteousnes wherfore euen sought fayth wer workes lawe haue stumbled stublyng stone written beholde haue put sion stumblyng stone rocke men shal offeded whosoeuer beleueth shal confounded synce shal say surely nothyng truth wete gentile whiche semed farre righteousnes without ceremony lawe haue yet attained true perfite righteousnes iewishe whiche standyng bodily thinges nothing shadowe onely christian perfeccion holsome effectual iustice whiche suche haue workes lawe stande muche theyr owne conceite suche vnfained fayth submit yelde selfes vnto god may likewyse othersyde saye while people theisrael folowed law rightousnes coud attaine law righteousnes c iewes theyr power folowyng iustice lawe carnally vnderstanden stifly cleaue theyr labour came vnto law iustice forasmuche fel christ whervnto marke al darke sayinges moses law principally directed wyl say fortuned ended purpose diuersly without al doubte god abhorreth suche high minded geueth selfe righteousnes suche sobre lowly therfore gentile vpo acknowledgyng theyr owne disease huble submission selfe god god receiued proude iewes thothersyde whiche falsly vsurped title righteousnes theyr owne bearyng selfe bolde vpon theyr sabboth day kepyng washynges circucision suche small obseruaunces disdainyng receiue yoke fayth hath god set naught refused denied christ deliuered author lifefor thei haue stumbled stumblyng stone c death whiche thyng esai long knowyng prophecied vnder fourme christ law promised sauior reason vnbeleif vnto iewes occasion stumlyng stone whiche good sure strong defece shuld theyr vtter vndoyng while rather resistyng stumble beleif rest vpon prophete esai speaketh god father christ beholde putte sion stumblyng stone rocke men shalbe offended whoso beleueth shall neuer confounded put shame one disapointed loketh x chapiter texte brother hertes desyre praier god israel might saued beare record haue feruent minde god warde accordyng knowledge beyng ignorant god righteousnes goyng stablishe theyr owne righteousnes haue obedient vnto righteousnes god christ fulfillyng lawe iustifie beleue whiche thinges brother speake great heauynes heart fauer would well wyse able good beyng ieopardie euerlastyng da nacion whiche onely thyngbrethren heartes desire praier god israel c dayly praiers made vnto god desyre peticion may yet amend alway continue suche blyndnes vtterly excuse theyr vnbeleif yet defence theyr fault coloure may made preteded pointes suche sorte straungers god gentile muche wishe theyr rude beginnynges may made perfite whose shadow haue season borne theyr bodyes may come trueth forthey haue feruentminde godward accordyng knoledge c albeit extreme deuilishnes fastened crosse lord foutayne al glorye yet say deny godwarde certaine zeale loue haue yet accordyng knowledge right iudgement deceiued lacke godly minde purpose choyse practise life rune farre awry better haue minde religion al without god wel worthy wer minde theyrs goodnes encreased grosse beginnynges godly life stubbernly cleaued refused true perfite religion wer also vehemently requyred auaunced euen shadowes picture trueth verye fountayne trueth vtterly dispised while busyly dede yet vndiscretely defende kepe moses lawe resistyng lawe principally ordained vtterly fal euen whole lawe selfe kepyng sabboth day circumcision abstinence fro certayne kyndes meates shonnyng dead carkasses fastyng dayes keapyng highthey goyng aboute stablishe theyr owne righteousnes haue obedient righteousnes god c feastes purpose made decreed time fro suche rude beginnynges men might litle litle growe vpwarde true perfite righteousnes certaine worldly righteousnes encrease growe vppe whiche pointes godly perfecte ordinaunce purposed made better ende vnseamyng loue suche meane dispise ende whiche sayd meane appointed frowardely yet iewes albeit publishyng righteousnes god besemed forgoe carnal iustice lawe yet farrefoorth bolster defende theyr olde tyme hurteful onely superfluous iustice lawe onely wyll knowledge heauenly righteousnes god also hauyng confidence theyr ceremony withstande resist gospel christ wherevnto ought fayth submitte selfe euer minded truely righteous must imaginacion conceiue twoo kyndes iustice thone wherof moses author wherof christ beginner one standeth ceremony fayth obedience rude piece timbre matter wherof image wrought bloud beginning liuyng creature brought foorth generacio iustice lawe rude grosse beginnyng thother whiche perfite certainly extreme folishenes man come perfeccion curiously sticke styl rudimentes allchrist fulfillyng lawe iustify al beleue c moses law whiche selfe rude vnperfite christ fulfillyng perfeccion fayth circumcision attaine righteousnes whiche way righteousnes onely open iewes entre therinto also true faythful beleuers texte moses writeth righteousnes whiche commeth lawe whiche doeth thinges law shal liue therby righteousnes cometh fayth speaketh wyse say thou thine heart shal ascende heauen euen fetche christ doune aboue either shall descende depth euen fetche vp christ againe death sayth worde nigh euen thy mouth thy heart kyndes iustice moses clearely expresse temporal iustice whiche rested ceremony kept season plainly setteththe monne whiche doeth thinges law shal liue therby c boke leuites saiyng kepe lawes decree doeth shal liue therby true euerlastyng iustice whiche christ liuely fayth obtaine boke deuteronomi expresseth sayth neither say thou thine heart shall ascende heauen euen fetche christ doune aboue yet say thou shal descende goe doune deapth yearth euen fetche vppe christ againe death whiche bothe sortes questioner forasmuche require fayth haue experiment neither semeth beleue well whosoeuer vnfaynedly beleueth suche poyntes surelysaye thyne hert shall asced heauen c better persuaded one nedeth suche meanes taught either saye christe descended heauen el nowe sytteth father ryghte hande thoughe nomore shewe neither bothe mennes iyen though men sene nomore yet beleueth also christ went downe hell thyrde daye rose agayne lyfe sufficient v beleue done remayneth gyue credence vnto suche sawe beleue nede seke ferre iewes sawe yet beleued heard whiche sawe yet gaue credence scripture recordeth whiche streight saythe worde nyghe euen thy mouthe thy hearte texte worde faythe whiche preache yf thou knowledge thy mouth iesus lorde beleue thy heart god raysed hym vp fro death thou shalte saued beleue hearte iustifieth knowledge mouthe maketh man safe scripture sayth whosoeuer beleueth hym shal confounded worde whiche scripture speaketh withoute doubt worde gospel beyng publyshers righteousnes preache worketh mennes soules present saluacion menne faythe onely apply theyr myndes therunto howe thisyf yu knowlege thy mouthe iesus lorde c worde gospell thy mouthe howe thy hearte yf thou thy mouthe confesse knowledge lorde iesus thy heart vnfaynedly beleue god death raised hym agayne lyfe hym beyng restored lyfe death syn shoulde hereafter lyue cleannesse lyfe shalt thou saued hert beleue whiche ryghteousenes entrey asmuche nede requyreth men bounde glorifie christe euerlastyng saluacion sufficient heart onlye beleue excepte thou thy mouthe confesse seeye matter hangeth vpon ceremony vpon fayth whiche thyng esai also speakyng christe recordeth saying whosoeuer beleueth hym shall confounded texte difference betwene iewe gentile one lorde whiche riche vnto cal vpon hym whosoeuer dothe call name lorde shalbe safe howe shall call hym whome haue beleued howe shall beleue hym whome haue hearde howe shall heare withoute preacher shall preache except sent wrytten howe beautiful feete whiche bryng tydynges peace bryng tydinges good thinges haue al obeyed gospel esai sayth lord hath beleued sayinges fayth commeth hearing hearing cummeth worde god aske haue hearde doubt sounde went landes theyr wordes endes worlde prophet sayeth whosoeuer taketh away al differece betwixt iew getile sayth beleueth wtout mecion making circumcision suche lyke abolysheth vtterlye ceremony law fayth requyred euery man maye equallyefor one lorde riche vnto call vpo enioye haue god lykewyse whiche onely lorde iewes indifferently whose bounteousnes narrow straite ferther reache onlye iewes amog vtterly worne wtout ende goodnes pletifully flowyng furth vpon nacion vpon people coutrey soeuer sure trust god desyre helpe prophete micheas also affirmeth saying whosoeuer cal vpon name lord shalbe saued prophetes laying kynde men excepted euery whatsoeuer either iewe grecian nacion el yf sure confidence call vpon name god shalbe saued syde whoso calleth vpon name shall vtterly peryshe nowe vpon hym vseth man cal desyre help hath conceyued truste wyll hym put trust neuer erste heard speake againe ca heare speake vnles ther preachehowe shal beleue whome haue heard name hym whiche suche sort unknowen apostle howe preache vnles hym gospell apertayneth sent whome prophet esai makyng mencion sayeth howe beautiful feete whiche preache tydynges peace bryng tydynges good thynges whiche wordes ye heare perceiue christes messenger commaunded preache neither circumcision ye see yet kepyng iewyshe sabboth day peace whiche oure synnes fayth forgyuen mutuall charitie ioyneth v together christ preache suche good thynges themselfe naturally good tymes euery place good yet notwithstandyng wonderfull benefite god hath vsed meanes call euery nacion euerlastyng blysse none ther hath hearde ioyfull tydynges gospell yet beleue gospel prophet esai long sayde speakyng person apostle lord hath beleued oure sayinges euen among gentile beleue gospel copared multitude suche beleue briefnes matier shortlye comprised yf calling vpon name lorde worke oure saluacion yf suche beleue cal vpon hym playne profe fayth specially required circumcision nowe fayth mannes soule conceyued experience preachyng apostle saye iyesso tha faith cummeth hearyng hearing cummeth word god eares throughe meanes gospell christ powred obedient soule syth bryght beames gospell hath lyghtened worlde christes name throughlye knowen meaneth fewe iewes gyue credence thereto canne saye theyr excuse christe haue heard nothyng nowe se fulfilled whiche dauid prophecied whe saide sounde went al landes theyr wordes endes worlde texte demaunde whether israel knowe fyrst moses saythe wyll prouoke enuye people folyshe nacion wyl anger esai bolde sayth founde sought manifest vnto asked agaynst israel sayth al day long haue stretched furthe handes vnto people beleued speaketh agaynst sythe christe many hundred yeares gone prophecy promysed nowe throughout worlde apostle mete conuenient witness preached theyr preachyng many miracle confirmed iewes themselfes colourably saye knowe christe sawe lyght malice blynded theyr iyes hearde gospell rancour enuy stopped theyr eares rather beare malyce displeasure agaynste gentile called euerlastyng saluacion folowe theyr fayth twoi wyl prouoke enuye people thynges wytte iewes reiect ioyful tidynges god worde getiles receyue wer long prophecied moses also esai two fyrst boke deuteronomi song maketh lorde beyng displeased vnbeleuyng iewes wyse speake wyll prouoke enuye vile nacion whiche heretofore comparison hath bene acoumpted nacion somuche ye thynke selfes wyse wyl anger kynde people iudgemet folyshe beastlye therby make enuious esai whiche prophecied moses tyme without feare playnly sayeth god accepted gentile obedience iewes stubbernes wyse speaketh person christe found sought playnlye appeared vnto asked suche gloriousi founde soughte manifeste vnto asked witnes beareth god vnto gentile fayth agaynst people israel muche rather besemed embrace fayth gospell sayth streyght esai al daye long haue stretched furth handes vnto people beleued sente prophetes murdered vp selfe sundry miracle prouoked goodnes stede thankes saied deuil hym power beelzebub chief deuyll worketh wunders humblenes despised myghtie power toke wrong sence xi chapiter texte pi saye hath god caste awaye people god forbid euen also israelite seede abraha tribe beniamin god hathe caste away people whiche knewe wote ye scripture sayeth helias maketh intercession god agaynste israel saying lorde haue kylled thy prophetes haue digged downe thyne alters lefte alone seeke lyfe sayth aunswer god vnto hym haue reserued vnto self seuen thousand men haue bowed knee image baal euen also tyme remnaunt left accordyng eleccion grace yf grace nowe workes grace grace yf workes nowe grace deseruing deseruing israel hath obtayned whiche seeketh eleccion hath obtayned renaunte blynded accordyng written god hath gyue spirite vnquietnes iyes see eates heare euen vnto daye dauid saithe let table made snare take occasion fall rewarde vnto let theyr iyes blynded see bowe thou downe theyr backe alwaye bvt ende drawe wordes teache gentile whiche tyme god straungers thoroughe fayth taken goddes familie people iewes whiche god fyrste chosen oute vnbelief vtterly refused noti saye hath god cast away people god forbid vnlykely god hath nowe vtterly refused nacion hath hitherto gentely gladly knowledged chosen people god throughly refused whole nacion selfe kinred israelite lineally descended stocke abraham appertaynyng tribe beniamin tyme preache christe ferre god hath refused v euen zeale law persued good people god called furth preache gospel lestwyse ye forget whiche red thirde booke thewote ye scripture sayth helias howe maketh intercession kynges prophete helias speaketh vnto god complayning vpo blamyng iewes wickednes sayinge lorde haue kylled thy prophetes ouerthrowen thyne aulters left alone seke lyfe whiche vnmercifull crueltie myghte seme god would vtterly haue caste people desperate paste amendmente god aunswered helias haue reserued vnto self seuen thousande men whiche haue bowed theyr knee vnto ydoll baal tyme god refused al people many euyll left certayne noumber honour sorte happeneth nowe whole people iewes hath god suffered estraunged hath suffered reste besyde peryshe theyr synnes albeit bothe people fewe whiche belieue comparison refuse yet goodnes hath god saued neither iewes borne yet kepte moses lawe manye hath chosen furthe vpon whome pleasure sheweif grace workes bountiful grace mercye nowe yf dyd owne bountiful mercy theyr desertes let imputed vnto theyr workes whiche gyuen man labor rather hyrewages free gyfte whiche gyuen suche deserue none el free gift yf desertes workes accoumpted benefite lenger benefite muche calledisrael hath obtayned seketh eleccion hath obteyned rewarde happened surelye happened whiche people israel vpon confidence lawe intended obtayne lacke belief went without suche onlye obteined goddes eleccion whiche belonged circumcised stocke suche chosen god neither circumcisio kepyng lawe auayled wt malyce far furth blinded vpon syghte many miracle gaue credence leyng theyr bodely iyes christ whome long loked yet iyes theyr harte seyng hym al see done sorye prophet esai long prophecied refused holy humble spirite christ therfore hath god gyuen spirite vnquietnes bothe roughe boysteouse vnrulye wonder behelde theyr iyes deny styl thoughe sawe heare theyr eares moueth yf hearde suche tyme paste prophetes suche christe hymselfe suche vntil daye towarde preacher gospell also dauid replenished spirite prophecie sawe longand dauid sayd let table made snare c theyr great stubbernes behalfe agaynst wyll god prophecieth destruccion mete suche frowarde people let theyr table sayeth become snare take withal occasion fall punishment dewe suche dedes let theyr iyes blynded see alwaye bowe downe theyr backes woulde pleasauntly vse whiche layd refused suche thynges presently sawe hearde without al godly regarde loke vp heaue warde knowledge toward maker benefite gyuyng themself wholly grosse meaning lawe disdayne heauenly doctrine regarde thynges transitory despisen euerlasting iewes cary handes bokes moses vnderstande reade prophecy denie promised wherto maketh man saye blyndfolded snared bowed downe become deafe texte pi saye haue therfore stumbled vtterly fall awaye together god forbyd theyr fall saluacion happened vnto gentile prouoke withall wherfore yf fall rich worlde minishyng rich gentile howe muche theyr perfitenes speake gentile asmuche apostle getiles wyl magnifie myne office yf meanes maye prouoke whiche fleshe might saue yf casting away recocilyng world shall receiuyng lyfe agayne death yf one piece holy hole heape holye yf roote holy braunches shalbe holy also fallen god hope rysyng agayne passedi saye haue thei therfore stubied shoulde vtterly fall away together rather fall theyrs chaunced tyme whiche gentile luckelye chaunced theyr fall occasion called lyfe euerlastyng example agayne iewes ende world myght moued godlye religion theyr fallyng christe opened waye gentile come christe shoulde fayth yf nothyng enuye prycke yet iewes forwarde beleue ye nowe yf theyr fall occasionally greatlye profyted iewes forsakyng fallyng christe caused onlye hurte rather doctrine gospell preached among many while steede fewe fallyng awaye gospel spred abrode amog al losse one nacion got vnto christ many nacios muche shal worlde enryched nacion also beyng throughe godlynes prouoked shalbe ioyned speake vntoi speake gentile asmuche apostle gentile gentile myne owne disciple somuche sente preache vnto though self iew borne albeit sake leaue nothyng vndone yet endeuoure auaunce office comited vnto allure many christe also make worthye christes seruice yf suche meanes maye prouoke contrey men touchyng carnall aliaunce maye cal albeit faythe vnlyke folowe godlynes though euen enuie malice propertie gyuen ialowsye yf bryng home goodnes yet maye saued desyrouse amendment knowe ye also desyre yf thoccasion iewes castyng al worlde el brought goddes fauer whyles fell fauer god gentile goddes goodnes receyued therinto say yf theyr great hurt losse became good worlde howe muche good yf beyng estraunged god fayth receyued vnto hym lyke men restored death lyfe agayne finally number faythfull throughly fulfilled remayne nothyng resurreccion body though iewes vngodlye maye therfore despayre al yf gentile far god myght throughe goddes callyng broughte perfite religion let shoulde ther acio holie father beginner maye likewise called brought faythe agayne muche reason agreable good good borne forsomuche al moste partefor yf one piece holye whole heap holy resemble begynnyng whence descended yf leauen holye nedes muste whole bache whiche therwith seasoned holy cleane yf roote tree holy likely brau ches lykewyse holye iewes haue bothe kynred nacion abraham theyr begynner whose fayth god allowed let maye resemble theyr fyrste parentes fayth yf neuewes nomore tha braunche plucked stocke lenger nourished sappe roote texte though braunches broken thou beyng wylde oliue tree grafte among made partaker roote fatnes oliue tree boste thy selfe braunches thou bost thy selfe thou bearest roote roote thou wylt say braunches broken might grafte thou sayest wel vnbeleif broken thou stodest stedfast fayth high minded feare seyng god spared natural braunches take hede lest come passe spare also see braunches plucked stocke whervpon naturally growe muche lesse meruaile suche plucked graffed vpo another thou see iewes whichthou beyng wyld oliue tre wastgraft among made partaker roote fatnes oliue tre sprong rote true oliue lacke beleif broken doune plucked fro theyr stocke roote doth good thy selfe contrary wyse wheras thou sprongest wilde oliues roote graffed right oliue nature wyl kunnyng workemanship god sette planted among verye braunches yu beyng take thyne vnfruitful stocke art becomen felowe partaker straunge roote wheras diuers boughes whiche tree growed cutte withered awaye thy selfe newe iuice lusty plentiful take hede beware thou therfore folishly rise thine owne conceite disdaine braunches thou seest cutte thou vnorderly rise thine owne phantasy thou growe proude therewith puffed vppe haue mynde roote beareth thou roote beware fonde imaginacion come thy head thinke wt thy selfe natural brauches wer broken graffed theyr stocke thinke wer thi sake broke thervpon dede folowed thou graffed yet herein sayestthe brauches broken might graffed thou wel broken wheras growed roote marke suche sorte broken without doubt lacke fayth lye grounde tredde vnderfoote thou fayth abidest fast vpon tree reioyce men miserie theyr euil chaunce rather learne lowely sobre theyr punishement learne feared thou likewyse offende thou well see yt god spared natural brauches nothyng auauntaged beyng descended good holy father peculiarly belonged people god great cause hast thou feare leste spare thou arrogancy vnkyndnes displease learne theyr fal thou must beware lette thy state cast pride rather put remebraunce goodnes god shewed toward good cause hast thou thy welth glad good cause hast thou also rendre god thankes without cause art thou reioyce theyr fal theyr deserte cut theyr stocke thou without thy deseruyng art graffed texte beholde therfore kindnes rigorousnes god whiche fel rigorousnes towardes kyndnes thou continue kindnes el thou shalt hewen againe abide styl vnbeleif shall graffed againe god power grafe againe thou wast cutte natural wylde oliue tree waste graffed contrarye nature true oliue tree much shal natural brauches graffed theyr owne oliue tree considre god bothe mercye exacte iustice one learne thankefull god forget proude disdaineful goddes exacte iustice iewes felte example whiche theyr fyrst state fel suche blyndnes christ many yeares loked maliciously cruelly persecuted goddes great goodnes hast thou whiche arte gentile playne experiencetowardes kyndnes cotinue kyndnes goodnes made blissefull life partaker neither thy heathen stocke neither thy wicked life wise deserued hath god freely forgeuen offence thy former life art thou goddes fauor receiued numbre childre yet art thou receiued thou without thy deserte wert called vnto thyne owne foly thou mayest againe fal god wyll fro beyng vnthankeful withdrawe gifte vnlesse thou knowledge goodnes vnlesse thou mekely vse benefite thy vnkindnes wyl lose al goodnes gaue thy pryde wyl destroye thy obedience wonne whiche pointes thou ware thou shalt fro true oliuethou shalt hewen abyde stil vn beleif thou art planted againe cutte lykewyse iewes chaunge forsake deuideth god say theyr vnbeleif shall tree new planted whence cutte fayth shall place restore againe whence vnbeleif wer deposed thou whiche wast prophane cursed beyng cut wylde oliue contrarye nature graffed true oliue muche rather wyll done iewes whiche came good paretes come theyr kynde planted good stocke againe whence cut texte would secrete hid brother lest ye wyse owne conceiptes partly blindnes happened israel vntyl fulnes gentile come al israel shalbe saued written shal come sion doeth deliuer shal turne away vngodlines iacob couenaunt vnto shal take away synnes co cernyng gospel enemy sake touchyng eleccion loued theyr father sake wyll brother open vnto hidden mistery whiche parauenture spoken al wer expedient knowen lest ye proudly take muche vpo forsomuch ye thinke selfes sette iewes blyndnes spake whervnto iewes fallen neither fell vpon whole nacion shall continue styl many knowledge christ rest shal long cotinue theyr blyndnes vntyl numbre gentile throughly filled vp whiche iewes fal haue entryvntil fulnes gentile come condicion long tyme shal see whole worlde florishe fayth christ vaine looke theyr messias theyr cytie theyr temple theyr sacrifice theyr whole nacion dispersed scatered abrode light vnderstandyng wyll last begyn knowledge theyr errour wel vnderstande christ true messias albeit growen kinde yet shal whole numbreand shal israel saued israelite saued shal good skil called right israelite light fayth shal begyn se christ bothe god sonne god theyr strength fayth vpon confidence workes wreste strong hande benediccion god ye shal beleue better also prophete esai long sayd bothe prophecied wete bothe fall also rise againe amende one see already done thyng self cofirmeth establisheth prophecie thother like fayth loke hereafter ensue prophecie shal come sio shal deliuer shal turne away vngodlynesthere shall come sion doth deliuer fro iacob couenaunt shal take away theyr sinnes nacion made god couenaunt whiche beyng surely made decreed though make self vnworthy goddes promise yet theyr vnworthynes god wyll suffre promise vtterly vayne shal yet remaine shal receiue whole stockes right notwithstandyng fallen grace god yet fallen recociled many receiue gospel christ cleaue styll faste letter law eue enemy god proud turned good vpon theyr refusal forsaking gospel muche rather offered yet asmuche descended godly holy parentes nacion among god chose peculiarly selfe theyr sake god greatly regardeth amende shall rather receiued fauor whiche preache god long synce promised theyr fore father texte verely giftes callyng god suche cannot repent lyke ye tyme passed haue beleued god yet haue obtained mercy vnbeleif euen haue beleued mercy happened vnto also may obtaine mercy god th wrapped al nacions vnbeleif might haue mercy al god doth suche sorte promise thyng suche sorte fathereth child forthinkyng self wyl chaunge purpose men wont god cannot chaunged ratherthe giftes callyng god canot repent cannot deceiued wyl sory hath done sone iewes lenger refuse wyl syde remembre promise chauge al thinges theyr fal therfore thou shouldest reioyce thou therby wone shouldest thou glad theyr amendment ye al iewes welnigh say vnfaythful god yet god refuse euer synce mercye see done vpon theyr refusall made ye receiued suffereth god tyme faithful houshold congregacion while ye receiued tyme come callyng god amendyng theyr life may ye obtaine god mercy whiche god doeth neither reuile eche gladde findyng like mercye goddes hande doeth god vnspeakable wysedome rule ordre thinges kynde men fre synne isgod hath wrapped nacios vnbeleif might haue mercy author season suffereth men theyr owne faultes fal synne know theyr owne offence may wel perceiue saued theyr owne desertes fre mercye god leste otherwyse might waxe proud while doth farre fro puttyng euil men mindes goodnes meruailous sorte mennes euil turneth good texte depnes rich wisdome knowledge god vnsercheable iudgemetes wayes paste findyng hath knowen minde lorde hath cousailour either hath geuen vnto first shalbe recompensed againe thinges glory euer amen secrete pointe happely entre deapely mete manne among men consideracion vnspeakable way counsel god one astonned whereas cannot expresse exclamacion make depenes theo depenes rich bothe wisdome knowledge god aboundaunt ouerflowyng wysedome god vnable men wyttes searche conceiue iudgementes vnmete men wittes fynde wayes euer knewe minde lord tyme counsailour fyrst prouoked good turne suche sorte benefite god geuen againe may seme rewarde wage geuen well deseruyng suche sorte prouideth god saluacion suche meanes dede mennes wittes able finde yet wel cannot amended suche condicion pleasure benefite partaker parte therof thanke selues euil may thakeof al thiges selfe goodnes euer cometh fountaine author thinges geuen keper defender giftes manne praise presumptuously take vpo parte syth beginnyng mydle ende belong honour praise glory due euer whiche glory vnlawful man chalenge parte xii chapiter texte beseche therfore brother mercyfulnes god ye make body quicke sacrifice holy acceptable vnto god whiche reasonable seruyng god fashion selues like vnto worlde ye chaunged shape renuyng minde ye may proue thing good acceptable perfite wyl god say grace vnto geue euery man among man stande hye owne conceite becometh esteme selfe iudge selfe gentle sobre accordyng god hath dealte euery man measure fayth syth goodnes god ye olde supersticion brought perfite religion syth ye deliuered burdain moses lawe heartely beseche pray brother great mercy sake whiche god hath diuersly shewed styl sheweth towardes whose free goodnes ye thanke welthy state ye stande ye hencefoorth vnto offre suche sacrifice become professio gootes shepe ox whiche iewes paynyms custome chosen cleane beastes meete diuine sacrifice ye haue suche grosse sacrifice vntyll tyme sufficiently wyll hencefoorth requireth god youmake body quicke sacrifice holy acceptable vn god farre vnlike customes another kynde worshippyng newe sacrifice say ye vnto offre euen owne bodyes makyng lame subduyng naughtie desyres offeryng vnto dead beastes liuyng sacrifice al poinctes pure holy thankeful acceptable vnto god reasonable sacrifice sacrifice say soule brute beast long carnal lawe continued god contented corporal beastes offered vnto lawe became spiritual spiritual sacrifice worshippe must stede calfe kyl thy proude thoughtes stede ramme kyl thy feruent malice stede goote burne vppe thy fylthy lust stede dooues turtle sacrifice vnto god thy fraile wanton thoughtes none el mete sacrifice christian men sacrifice christ gladly receiueth god spirite spiritual oblacions fauor wonne requireth muche honouredbe chau ged shape renuyng mynde ceremony enbraced pure hearte mynde stede circumcision cutte thy mynde superfluous vnsemyng desyres stede kepyng thy sabboth kepe thy minde quiet fro troublous desyres christ sake offered selfe mete againe offre selfes wyl folowe ye take worlde haue betaken selfes heauely profession shall ye life myndes dissent together olde state asmuche maye altered newe heauenly men though body immortall yet lestwyse newe desyres myndes hencefoorth suche thyng shal please cursed people suche geuen transitory pleasure doe greatly esteme desyre onely suche thynges please god lenger vnder iewishe rule menne desyres doynges hang wyll gouernaunce god whiche regardeth grosse thyng whiche vnperfite whiche perfitely good acceptable goddes honour godly religion mete conuentent among sette world custome suche arebut say c euery man among ynu man stande high owne conceite c welthy disdaine poore poore enuyeth riche man commaunde euery one whosoeuer riche co mon sorte christian flocke taken felowshippe worlde pryde thynke nomore selfe besemyng sobre humble mynde fyrst take nomore vpon meere nexte remembre hath geuen god workes faythes sake geuen therwith please selfe euery man good god doeth sondrywyse bestow giftes lest either one disdaine lest man might thynke selfe sufficiente let brotherly charitie make eche mannes gifte comen texte haue many membres one body al membres haue one office beyng many one body christ euery manne among selues one anothers membres seyng haue diuerse giftes accordyng grace geuen vnto v man haue gifte prophesie let haue agreyng vnto fayth let hath office wayte office let teacheth take hede doctrine let exhorteth geue attendaunce e hortacion man geue let singlenes let ruleth diligence man shewe mercy let cherefulnes let loue without disstmulacion hate whiche euil cleaue vnto whiche good kinde one another brotherly loue geuyng honour go one another slouth full busynes whiche ye haue hande feruent spirite applye selues tyme reioyce hope pacient tribulacion continue praier destribute vnto necessitie saintes ready harbour blesse whiche persecute blisse say curse merye merye wepe also wepe like affeccion one towardes another hye minded make selues equal lower sorte vnmeete grace christ haue lesse power hath power nature euery beastes body body beastes partes among self certaine felowshippe betwixte suche people diuerse sectes sondrye nacions shaped felowship christ sensible bodye albeit one yet framed manye membres together nowe hath euerye membre like office forsomuche iyes haue one feete another stomacke handes another yet doeth iye see onely selfe whole body stomacke self prepareth foode member condicion office euery member bodye lyke sondrie gyftes diuerse sortes gyuen diuerse v lymmes whiche noble example iyesso many one body christ disdayne viler canne helpe succoure al el shoulde whole bodye vtterlye decaye lette euery manne gyfte singuler el meane parte bestowe weale whole bodye synce planted christe oure heade hym becommen one spirituall bodye one member another member bodye one christian manne another christian manne yet hath euery manne sayde sondry gyftes gyuen vnto hym gyuen vnto hym saye owne desertes liberall bounteousnes god whiche gyueth euery manne knoweth expediente let nomanne therfore gyfte proude discretlyeif anye man haue gift prophecie c soberly vse weale menne yf haue gyfte prophecie expounde vnknowen learnynges lette hym accordyng vnto perfeccion fayth onelye god regardeth desertes without disdayne vpon bestowe gyfte yf suche condicion place maye helpe brother therin let hym soberly dutie yf haue gyfte learnyng lette hym disdayne enstructe teache yf canne scriptureslet teacheth take hede doctrine preachyng rauyshe menne pitifull godlye lyfe condicions let hym sobernes vse gyft yf haue gooddes wher helpe poore nedie lette hym also gyue vnto suche haue neede therwith helpe neither glorye neither hope haue aduauntage therbye liberall free hearte yf god haue gyuen hym beare rule ouer therin canne well lette hym office anye thyng prouder carefull charge lette hym rule office theyr weale whose charge gouernaunce hath taken hande yf helpe wretched miserable lette done withoute sadnes louryng discouraging hym holpen beware thy benefite thou hyt teethe let thy thankeful gyfte encreased doubled mery looke cherefulnes whatsoeuer ye gyue seme gyue euen mannes youre heartes heathen people good deedes moost parte suche wayes corrupted yea thoughe elswyse seme liberallye done lette dissimulacion haue place lette among youlet loue without dissimulacio c raigne loue charitie whiche neither canne counterfaicte dissemble make euery mannes doynges accepted god beware also ye measure thynges youre desyre noughtie people wonte esteme measure thynges vertue vice abhorring lewdnes stedfastly cleauyng goodnes forasmuche ye brother daylye desyre commen father helpe synce ye appoynted one enheritaunce lette eche tobe kindeone another wt brotherlye loue brotherly charitie readye well wyllyng carnall men stryue preeminence honour stryue ye eche howe one maye prefer hymselfe let noman idely liue himselfwarde let euery man parte labour dutie slouthfull stuggyshe men infirmitie fleshe faynte spirite couragiouse feruent ye haue forsaken carnalnes begunne spirituall fleshly poynte flouthful spirite god thyng actiuitie lyuely withstande euell personnes tymeapply yourselues tyme requireth applying youre selfe whiche presente yf anye hurte chaunce auoyde yf ye well doe el suffer heauye heartes men wanhope aduersities mery ioyful hope rewarde come wise meane season thynke self yf ye thyng either beare forgyue another ye suffer goddes sake whiche wyll without doubte auauntage make recompence yf wicked vntollerably vexe thee go defende thy selfe yet seke reuenged ne call worldly socoure defence continuall hartye prayer desyre help god christian haue lacke let hath gyue hym thyng louryngly vnpleasantly one gyueth crauyng begger euen one rekeneth al hath commen vse suche liberalitie vpon present vpon also whiche absent suche come fer contreyes abrode lette haue harbroughe leste either shamefully lacke compelled amonge paynyms take theyr lodgyng besemeth oure handes liberall also conuenient oure tongue hurte nomanblisse whiche perstcute blysse say curse vpon suche hate christ gospel persecute trouble ye maye onely reuenge also somuche wyshe harme yea euen praye rather praye saye amende theyr life curse al suche ye cannot dede good vnto wyshe well vnto eche perfite frendeship assure hymselfe whiche maketh ioye sorowe commen youre gladnes sadnes teares alwayes ioyned together thynges one mynde one desyre whether vnto fall prosperouse lucky chaunce aduersitie proude disdaynful one towarde another let suche one superiour frame temper hymselfe suche inferiours vnderlynges texte wyse owne opinion recompence man euyll euyll prouide afore hande thinges honest god also sight men yf possible asmuche lyue peaceablye wyth men dearelye beloued auenge selues rather gyue place vnto wrathe wrytten vengeaunce myne wyll rewarde sayth lorde let none among stande conceyte hymself hisbe wyse opinion owne iudgement seme stoute felow one wondered whoso suche one wyll neuer lyghtly geue place yf man perhappes offende gyue checke checke ne one wrong though suche doynges among iewes panyms taken wel done yet euil euil afore christ deuilish noce folowe thou reprouest stryue ethe beste labour onely suche thynges ye vpo testimonie youre owne conscience please god see lykewyse men allowed offende weake person anye acte semeth euill let lyfe ferre great ences asmuche maye fer suspicion great offence euen noughtie packes fynde nothyng reproue shal ye doe yf asmuche ye peace christian men also suche christ straungers wonderful po r diuine heauenly vertue whiche euen compelleth ennemies loue also wonder yf euery labour reueged griefe peace cannot stedfastly cotinue iewes paynyms vse vengeaunce yf wrong done vnto de yre reuenged rather gyue place mennes malyce whicheas muche peaceablye wt men thy patience wyll better weare awaye yf thou lyke doyng reuengyng prouoke thou pacience ouercome furie therin thou gaynest yf rage styll continue let hym doubte shalbe surely punyshed leaue iudge hath v taken awaye authoritie reuenge reserueth hymself whiche deuteronomie speaketh wyse vengeaunce myne wyll rewarde sayth lorde texte p therfore yf thyne enemie hunger feede hym yf thyrste gyue drynke doyng thou shalt heape cole fyer heade ouercome euill ouercome euill goodnes yea saye fer hurting another thou art hurte euill turne loke thou good yf thyne enemie happen hungrye refreshe helpe hym thy meate yf thruste gyue hym drynke scarcely nature suche wyldnes beastlye benefites maye made tame namely synce suche meanes euen wylde beastes waxe getle herewith wyn thynein doyng yu shalt h ap cole head enemye vpon experience profe thy sufferaunce godlynes wyll peraduenture amend ashamed lothe repente outragiouse fiersnes beyng ouercomme thy charitie feruently loue agayne waye maye debate finished wheras lyke lyke withoute ende styll encreased good dedes godlye thyng stryue eche one passe excel lent poynte stryue worste beastly saying euen paynyms selfe graunt herin shall prayse specially stande yf good dedes ye ouercome euill yf wt ouercome euil ouercome euil wt goodnes sufferaunce ye ouercome mennes furye yf fayre speche ye ouercome euill toungued also wrong doyng youre duty great watche must thou stande lest euill noughtines ouercome thy goodnes farre thoroughe hym thou begyn vnlyke thy selfe folowe trade whome thou reprouest rather let thy goodnes vanquyshe wyldnes beyng ouercomen thyne example violently pulled thy parte xiii chapiter texte p let euery soule submyt hymselfe vnto authoritie hygher power power god power ordayned god whosoeuer therfore resisteth power resisteth ordinaunce god resiste shall receyue themself damnacion ruler fearfull good euyll wylt thou without feare power wel shalt thou praysed minister god thy welthe yf thou whiche euyll feare beareth swerde nought minister god take vengeaunce hym doth euyll wherfore ye must needes obeye onlye feare vengeaunce also conscience euen cause paye ye tribute goddes minister seruyng purpose bvt nowe yf prynces gouernoures commen weale christes religion sake persecute trouble suffer ye muste thoughe begun faulte youres anye case take heede ye neither moue prouoke therunto refusyng suche thynges seme theyr authoritie requyre maye v done without displeasure god euerylet euery soule submit hymself vnto authoritie hyer power common weale mayntayned order maye vnder pretence religion disquieted men beastly lustes desyres like enormity whome maye agre vnto agayne thynges ther wherin must quietnes common weale tyme serueth euen consente beare anims leste example become vnruly whome expedient kepte vnder feare suche thynges thre difference one suche poyntes godlye whiche thynges peculiarly belonging christ muste tymes place prefer sette kynde suche mattiers vtterly appertayne worlde vngraciouse desyres syn must ye condicion shonne beware thyrd kynde isther power god power ordained god suche theyr owne nature neither good bad yet good order commen weale mayntenaunce concorde necessarie kepte woulde haue suche lawes troubled albeit haue ryghteousnes coloure shadowe quite contrary iustice christe persecucion muste suffer subiecte worldly dominion thoughe somewhat vnlawful leste persecute vexe men thynke iudge iuste lawful cause ye among set nought refuse commen lawes receyued men christ made reproued one ignoraunt went vndoubtedly aboute matiers commen lawes therfore muste euery man obey obey also gouernoures earth beare certayn image god ponyshyng offender put god wyl execucion dede thus ferfurthe theyr power gyuen vnto god wherfore whosoe resisteth prynce magistrate albeit cursed wycked paynym yet office withstandeth man duetye resisteth god whome authoritie commeth shadowe moses lawe gyuen god tyme myght lawfully refuse god made iustice lawe tyme muste therof haue regarde goddes pleasure bodye member shoulde haue theyr order wherof spoke would commen weale wherin good badde order order selfe selfe good notwithstandyng peraduenture man abuse office wherfore whoso disquieteth order resysteth god maker therofthei resiste shall rec yue self damnacion resiste god shall well worthye receyue theyr damnacion nowe yf thou lothe endaungered magistrate lawes thynke stubbernes come therunto innocent hurtles lyfe good condicions officer nothyng lawfully vpon suche bene offender lyue vpryghtlye well lawe hath nothyng thou without cause feare magistrate yea rather theyr handes suche duty receyue rewardes honour wherfore ponyshing offence magistrate goddes minister certayne sorte minister whyles rewardeth suche well doer whoso well lyueth free daunger peryll lawe yf thou committe offence worthye correccion happeneth throughe thy fauit thou muste feare magistrate suche purpose bearethhe minister god take vengeaunce hym swearde ponyshe saye hurtfull personnes therin seruaunt minister vnto iustice god punyshyng naughtie packes vseth seruice suche euen themselues euell synce therfore commenweales state preserued vnles officer due reuerence comen weales sake obey also onlye leste prouoked youre stubberne disobedience seame euen right reason vse extremite agaynst yourenot feare vengeaunce also bycause conscience sedition ye christian also conscience sake whiche albeit ye feare punyshment telleth shoulde troubled whiche god woulde haue stablished forasmuche herin doe comen busynes synce whiche comen belongeth vnto al men reward doyng theyr office ye paye custome tribute though wicked yet minister commen iustice god hymself iustice goddes minister stede whyles applye iustlye thyng commen authoritie committed vnto texte p gyue euery man therfore duetie tribute tribute belongeth custome whome custome due feare whome feare belongeth honoure honoure pertaynethe nothing man ye loue one another loueth hath fulfylled lawe comaundementes thou shalt commit aduoutrie thou shalt steale thou shalt beare false witnes thou shalte luste furth yf anye commaundement comprehended saying namely loue thy neyghbour thy selfe loue hurteth neighbour therfore loue fulfyllyng lawe wherfore yf men forbid thyng selfe vnlawfull done obeye synce ye bounde folowe honestie though ye put feare punishement yf comaunde vngodlynes done remember ye muste rather obeye god men nowe yf theyr authoritie exacte thyng losse wherof putteth ieopardy breache youre religion matier great ye shoulde prouoke theyr displeasure paye vnto suche exaction though debte christe hym selfe whiche bounde noman payde cesar tribute owed anye would displease suffer defrauded theyr right yf anye require tribute paye tribute yf exacte custome paye hym custome yf requyre hadde reuerence forsomuche denied might thynke authoritie despised syght men reuerence vnto hym agayne yf commen office sake woulde honoure gyue hym dewe honour yf theyr office laudablye vse themselfes honour gyuen god yf otherwyse honour gyuen quietnes common weale leaue nothyng vnsayed soeuer suche parson shall demaunde therin thyng whiche commen weale necessarie amongowe nothig anye man ye loue one another beyng christian let authoritie debte ye eche owe mutuall charitie charitable man nedeth exaction compelled owne accorde preuenteth monicions ye paye vnto theyr requeste ye oute theyr daunger charitable man thoughe satisfie yet neu satisfieth hymselfe euermore heapeth vp one good turne vpon another charitie therfore enbrace ye breifly compriseth al lawes whosofor loueth hath fulfilled whole lawe pure christian charitie loueth neighbour obserueth whole effecte purpose moses lawe charitie lacke lawes neuer many sufficient neadeth none lawe charitie onely muche effectually commaundeth many innumerable lawes comprehended moses lawe forbiddeth men adultrye commit murder thefte beare false witnes desyre mannes gooddes lende mony vsury many suche like compendious rule charitie preceptes contayned wherin briefly sayd loue thy neighbour thy selfe charitie asmuche doeth good al men though euil hurteth man neede long tale special wordes forbid many thynges hurt say way way synce nature hurte man wyl man trow ye murder loueth wyll vnchastly vse mannes wyfe whiche loueth neighbour aswel selfe wyll robbe mannes gooddes ready succour owne wyltherfore loue fulfillyng lawe false witnes oppresse neighbour owne ieopardy would haue saued wyll lende mony vsurye thynketh hath commen wyll wyshe harme whiche wisheth another would selfe wyll way hurte displease whose sake knoweth christ dyed charitie therfore sayd shorte lesson containeth whole lawe rule shortly learne auoyded folowed texte also knowe season tyme awake slepe saluacion nerer beleued night passed day come nigh let v therfore cast away deedes darkenes let v put armour light let v walke honestly wer day light eatyng drinkyng neither chamberyng wantonnes neither strife enuiyng put ye lorde iesus christ make prouision fleshe fulfil lustes desyre charitie euen consideracion tyme exhorteth awake arisyng slepe darkenes oldeit tyme shuld awake slepe life night semeth tyme geueth occasion liceciously synne forasmuche tyme shame away suche yet night wantonly occupyed vse selfe lightly assone day appeareth euen shame sight menne fashion selfe better though becomen newe menne stede dronkardes come foorth abrode sobre steede lecherous chaste stede braulers moderate colde stede sluggardes heauye heades lusty quicke take therfore must tyme serueth whiche vse well weale farre vpon boldnes moses lawe kepyng thought euen hande night former life gone passed away day draweth nigh wherin mennes actes neuer secrete shalbe disclosed let v day cast away euil maners nightly acteslet v therfore cast away deedes darkenes suche wanton pointes ought ashamed day sunne riseth vse sette honest apparel leste lacke cumly aray mennes iyen offended muche nowe bright risyng gospel let soules garnished thapparel vertue meete suche light suche vncumly sight god hencefoorth let v frame life worlde may see walke light euen sight god angel menne shakyng darkenes former life geuyng selfe riottous bankettynges drunkennes beastly geuen foule fleshely lustes strife enuiyng vnsemely braulyng among selues vnto whiche vice ye thral while ye wandered darknes former life apparel belemeth man soule rather synce ye baptisme graffed christbut put ye lorde iesus christ put ye let appeare life ye haue professed expresse ye ye haue receiued chastitie peace charitie suche apparel mete light gospel suche thynges ye haue hitherto pleasure vsed hecefoorth vse bodily necessitie suche thynges heretofore ye haue filthyly geuen vnto wanton desyres moued hencefoorth let sobrenes vsed vse nature requyreth norishe bodye liue helth waxe wanton let meate drinke vsed driue away hunger thyrst suche sorte prouoke norishe vncleanly lustes xii chapiter texte weake fayth receiue vnto disputyng troublyng conscience due beleueth may eate thinges whiche weake cateth hearbes let cateth dispise cateth let whiche cateth iudge cateth god hath receiued iudgest man seruaut whether stand fal pertaineth vnto owne maister yea shalbe holden vp may stand god able make stand surely albeit vse suche thinges difference choyse among suche fayth christ throughly instructed vse themhim weake fayth recei e vnto pleasure neede tolde yet peraduenture suche among exaple iewe borne whiche reason long continued custome trade life sctupulous yet growen vp ripenes fayth forgoe al rule old law suche one may disdainfully reiected rather gentle courtise maners allured norished vntyl like wyse profite fayth growe stronger whervnto ye shal muche rather bryng fauourable meanes co tencious reasonyng disputacions considre suche matter vnmete thing suche actes may without offence done streight taken worse parte thentent peace cocorde may among maintained stedfastly abyde certaine thinges must wynked thinges must suffered thinges must gently take suche gentle fauorable takyng thinges vpholdeth preserueth felowship comen lite synce mennes mindes among selues sondry diuers surely multitude neuer wyl stedfast peace vnlesse diuersone beleueth map eat al thinges pointes one geue place without serupulositie thynketh lawfull without difference eate meate lust acte nothyng el regardyng nature requireth againe yet weake somewhat supersticious lest might chaunce either vpo fishe meates forbidden either iewes lawe offered vp idol liueth herbes suche thinges among ought regarded brotherly peace broken let strong eateth al meates vse strength yet helet eateth dispise eateth dispise weaker whiche feareth eate let againe whiche folowyng weakenes mynde abstaineth certayne kyndes meate neither judge condemne whiche without difference taketh whatsoeuer sette rather lette strong beare weake sence takyng errour conceiued gathered long custome former life cannot sodainly plucked minde wyll litle lytle weare away godlynes groweth supersticion wyll vanishe auoyde lykewyse scrupulous seeth eate kyndes meate let wyse thynke selfe matter maketh man doeth likely doeth good mynde synce god hath receiued taken vnto made owne whosefor god hath receiued pleasure heliueth onely offendeth suche thinges offence selfe cuil arrogant point dispise weakenes supersticious deceiued rudenes muche intollerable pride wyl thinke ye suche one fayth weake take vpo iudge condemne stronger euen rule custome vnlearned people whiche thinke nothing rightfulwhat arte iudgest ma seruaunt selfe thinke good allowe maye man wel say suche one art thou iudgest condemnest mannes seruaunt one lord maister al iesus christ stadeth strong fayth falleth offende thou thinkest doeth dede shall fall rather stablished continue strong fayth maister sufficiently able mete strengthen seruaunt stagger texte man putteth difference betwene day day coumpteth dayes alike let euery manues mynde satisfie selfe obserueth day doeth vnto lorde doeth obserue day doeth lorde also eateth doeth please lorde geueth god thankes eateth eateth please lorde withal geueth god thankes noue v lyueth selfe man dyeth selfe liue liue vnto lorde dye dye vnto lorde whether liue thefore dye lordes christ therfore dyed rose againe reuiued might lorde dead quicke haue tolde choyse meates kepyng sabboth day feastes newe moone like wyse vnderstande weake vnperfite fayth maketh athis manne putteth differece betwene day day difference betwixte day day though one holye thinketh vnlawful day eate certaine meates labor whiche man day might well lawfully done lyde perfite strong fayth conceiueth dayes suche difference rather thinketh al space life consectate halowed godly conuersacion breake suche pointes christian concorde among without condemnyng mennes cosciences let euery one herein iudgeth best specially synce bothe wayes without synne standeth chiefe point religion whoso estemeth iudgeth conscience euery day like pure holy doth lorde little belongeth well doeth lykewyse iudgeth betwixte day day difference deceiued doeth vnto lorde thou hast therwith nothyng lykewysehe eateth doeth please lord geueth god thankes without difference eateth kyndes meate eateth lorde forasmuche geueth thankes god whose benefite eateth whose free goodnes made thynges mannes vse againe whoso weakenes conscience abstaineth certaine meates abstaineth lorde nothyng haste thou therwith synce eatyug hearbes rootes geueth thankes god wel thou doest god allowe accepte thankes geuyng art thou bolde vpo geue sentence cause diuers matter one one mynde one lorde one geueth thankes libertie hath eat lust knowing gospel putteth difference betwixte mindes betwixt meates while shonneth occasion surfettyng reason abstinence kept within bondes temperaunce suche thinges equal besemeth defece doyng striue brother sufficient god approue iudgement thinges belogeth either vncertain el suche must tyme borne christian man hath power vpon eche one good another liueth man selfe whiche synne broughtnone v liueth seltr c v goodnes death restored v life therfore either liueth selfe dyeth selfe nomore man seruaunt doeth vpo whose life death maister hath ful power authoritie seruaunt liue liueth owne none man auauntage auauntage disauauntage maister dye gayne losse maister whereby appeareth point malapertnes one seruaunt entermedleth felowes matter namely meane season maister pleased among men seruaunt muche maisters christes seruauntes bought v neither golde siluer euen owne bloud whether fall fal stad stand liue liue dye dyewhether liue therfore dye lorde slaues peraduenture theyr maisters loger yt dead whether liue dye lordes thynges liue christ hath onely power vpon whiche aliue euen vpon also dead whiche saluacion gaue bothe life death cause became man dyed sake rose againe death nt might lorde bothe quicke dead liue godlynes bounde dye synne bounde lorde iudge texte doest thou iudge thy brother either doest thou dispise thy brother shal brought iudgement seate christ written truely liue sayth lorde knee shal bowe tongue shall geue praise god shal euery one v geue accoumptes selfe god let v therfore iudge one doeth seruaunt take vpon authoritie vpo felowe ouer onely god hath power thou art somwhat scrupulous boldnes say iudgest thou thy brother whiche stronger thou art frely eateth like sort vseth euery day doest thou whiche art stronger disdaine disp se thy weaker brother though thou maister rather felow doeth either vsurpe goddes authoritiewe shal al e brought iudgement seate christ preuent daye iudgement one must iudge onely iudge wyll geue sentence vpo al shal brought iudgement place christ ther sentece quited co dened throughly seeth hidden secrete partes heart vntyl day let one seruaunt play lorde vpon honoure hath selfe onely reserued selfe sayeth prophet esai truely liue sayeth lorde knee shal bowelet v therfore iudge one vnto tongue shal geue praise god meane season let euery man asmuche power endeuoure howe may selfe iudge make accoumpte take heede man iudge others actes worse texte iudge rather man put stumblyng blocke occasion fail brother way knowe ful certified lorde iesus thyng comen selfe vnto iudgeth comen comen thy brother greued thy meate walkest thou charitably destroye thy meate christ dyed cause treasure euil spoken kyngdome god meate drynke righteousnes peace ioy holy goost thinges serueth christ pleaseth god commended men may tyme iudge thyng let v tyme iudge deuise one v may helpe another neither man hurte geue occasion hurte asmuche may let v comforte stagger make desperate let vsiudge rather man put stumblyng blocke c brother way extinguishe smolderyng flaxe enkendle person dignitie worthynes wer cosidered weaker obey better learned christian charitie would learned sometyme geue place beare weaker yet consent fauor errour either thentent may amended el lest stayed offende greuously matter speake somewhat selfe moses lawe many yeres gon geuen vnto iewes noted certaine meates vncleane meates language calleth comen man would say cursed men might lawfully eat certaine meates calleth cleane whiche euery man might lawfully vse know spirite christ surely persuaded whose pleasure carnal part lawe abolished owne naturei know full certified c nothyng comen selfe meate vnpure choyse meate al vncleane vncleane iudgeth wete weake scrupulous vncleane suche one strong perfite christia nothyng vncleane cleane thynges likewyse pure yet perauenture somtyme well done abstaine fro whiche selfe good pure moses lawe commaudeth brotherly charitte whiche specially belongeth christian man requireth thy bodily foode thy brother conscience hurte greued thou shouldest tendrely loue thou louest thy selfe liuest thou thy self remembrest mutual charitie requireth whiche regardest disdainest fall ruine weake whiche thing thou mightest easly remedy pray great matter long abstaine fro lawful meates vntil suche tyme thy neighbor beyng ieoperdye holpen therby albeit thy brother weaker though ruder thou art yet coupt vile thy meates sake suffre destroyed whose saluacio christ died suche one lorde estemed greatly trifle dispised thynke sufficient thyng thou doest right wel done moreouer prouide must suspicion euil beware lest whiche good turne vnto mennes harme wyl menne among see debate strife meate drinke suche smal trifle world come kyngdome god say shalthe kyngdome god meate drinke c neither meate drinke whiche remedyes oure mortall state doctrine christes gospel perfite christian life standeth neither differece meates drinkes suche thinges godlines effectual rather must study haue minde vpo suche thynges may v conueied hence heauenly life thinges bene withoute doubte iustice peace ioye whichebut righteousnes peace ioye holye ghost gyuen obseruyng difference meates holy goost ianglyng meates worketh malice debate worketh sorowe worketh displeasure grudge spirite god stede dissecio worketh peace stede sorowe causeth gladnes displeasure wrog perfyte ryghteousnes belongeth iustice hurte noman peace belongeth stryue noman office charitie trouble greue noman spiritual giftes god serueth christe bothe pleaseth god whyles dothe suche thynges hym moste acceptable pleaseth also men while diligente wayes auoydeth suspicion occasion euyll carnall whiche stryuen eche one meates dayes serue spirite christe stande defence theyr owne actes rather suche charitably please eche one another chaunge themselfe euery sorte wynne christe fashionyng themselues mennes vsuages thentent maye please euery man texte let v therfore folowe thinges whiche make peace thynges wherewith one maye edifie destroye worke god litle meates sake thinges pure euyl man whiche eateth hurte conscience good neither eate fleashe neither thinge wherby thy brother stombleth either falleth made weake haste thou fayth haue thy selfe god happye condemneth hymselfe thing whiche alloweth maketh conscience damned yf eate eatethe fayth whatsoeuer fayth syn therfore spiritual leauyng suche contenciouse disputacions let v folow suche thynges make peace suche thynges nouryshe concorde suche thinges encrease mutuall loue briefe trade lyfe maye make v better one maye better helpe another suche maye therwith offeded chiefe principall poynte religion thou arte stronger beware thy meates sake thou destroye worke god muche rather lose thy meate occasion therof thing destroyed whiche god redemed ye death sonne meate thing belongeth man requisite ye ayde worldly necessitie charitie god matier ieopardy let rather gyue place whiche bearethall thynges pure euell man e eateth hurt conscience lesse weight meate eatyng synne one pure another vnpure iewes would haue offence eate euery kynde meate therby occasion stoumblyng misdeming giuen thou eatest throughe eatyng therof thou greuest thy weake feble brother meane wherof meate whiche nature cleane forsomuche thou vsyng regardest thy neyghbours ieopardye becommeth vncleane poynte muste greatly take hede vnto thynke better altogether abstayne fleashe eate hearbes yea altogether forbeare drynkyng wyne eating drynkyng gyue thy brother occasion sclaunder saye thou agayne vnto feareth nede myne owne fayth conscience condemneth saye thou haue mennes weakenes doest thou cousel leaue myne owne mynde folowe begynne folowe vse certayne choyse difference meates require thee folowe weakenes rather tyme condescende vnto vpon hope amendmente allowe confidence thine thou despiseste suche difference meates yet hide couer thy boldnes yf thou see thy brother lyke fall ieopardye therby contente god meane tyme knoweth approuethhaste thou fayth haue thy selfe god strengthe thy conscience yet muste tyme dissembled whyles thou auoydeste daunger weakenyng thy neighbour conscience leanyng fashionyng thy selfe weaknes meane tyme take hede thou sayest thou regardest suche choyse meates thy saying come furth procede strong coscience made colour maynteine pleasure whiche thou hast eatyng drynking wantones beware also leste while thou dispisest reprouest another supersticion abstaynyng meates thy self thy conscience doubte strong worde thou arte fayth blessed man whiche strengthe faythe acte amog men approueth maynteneth feele within hym conscience murmuring agaynst hearte secretly condemne face worlde approueth soeuer doubteth iudgyng wt hymself vnlawful eate euen owne conscience condened codemned acte doth cometh strog fayth vpright conscience conscience grudgyng agaynste doyng soeuer commeth fayth ioyned syn manne doubtyng acte whether euyll whiche selfe euyll dede doth yet nethelesse doyng declareth woulde verie euyll thyng dede yf occasion serued perfite godlynes whome surely auoydeth suche thynges haue euen apparence euyll whoso malyce doth synfully well worthyfor whatsoeuer fayth synne reproued yf suche one wyll refourmed euen company must auoyded also errour groweth reason infirmitie suche errour muche deserueth taught warned disdayned mocked xv chapiter texte pwe whiche stronge ought beare fraylnes whiche weake stande oure owne conceites let eu rie man please neighbour vnto welthe edifieng christe plea ed hymselfe written rebuke whiche rebuked fell soeuer thinges written af tyme wrytten learnyng pacience comfort scripture myght haue hope nowe yf stronger dedewe whiche strong ought beare fraylenes whiche ar weake somuche herein nede noma giue v counsel yet muste take hede lest whyle reproue mannes small erroure call supersticion selues fal fer haynous vice arrogancie rather stronger besemeth v beare weakenes eyther elder stronger body vse therfore throw downe trede vnder feete yogers suche strengthe able matche wt euen though god purpose geue stregthe hurte therwith whome wyll rather stronger de shame coumpte hurte tender youthe feable olde age iudgement learning haue somuche rather bounde temper oure selues weakenes rather whyles learnyng proude highly stande oure owne conceyte prouoke anger weake brother rather either suffer hym cure disease let noman therfore gyfte please hymselfe though w giuen hym brag therwith let hym rather dispysyng hymsefe please neyghboure shoulde euerye purpose hym good therwith make hym better waye curyng mennes erours christ hymselfe taught v whiche beyng fountayne al goodnes vsed one pleaseth selfe auauncyng owne glorie helpe suche waye weake feeble conscience onely despised glorie whiche worthy contented spitefully handled euen dauid inspired spirite sayde shoulde ix psalme rebuke whiche rebuked fell
