mewhatsoeuer thinges written afore tyme thei written learning pacience sentence wrytten psalmes thentent know folow also ensample learning paciently myldely neyghbour suffered borne vntyll suche tyme growe vp rype christes religion haue caste weake chyldyshnes therfore submitted hym self vilenes thend would lytle lytle exalt v hygher state meete also hym take example allure neyghbour true godlynes example wherof layde playnly oure iyes table holye scripture muste continually haue remebraunce bought v worldly meane sufferaunce redemed saued v humblenes sake finally exalted trewe perfite glorie lykewyse shoulde throughe sufferaunce weaker comforte holy scripture prouokyng v doe christe dyd truste receyue suche rewarde prepared suche folowe steppe texte god pacience consolacion graunt lyke mynded one towardes another ensample christ iesu ye agreyng together maye one mouthe praise god father lord y wherfore receyue ye one another christ receyued v prayse god saye iesus christe minister circumcision truthe god confirme promise made vnto father gentile might prayse god mercye written cause wyll prayse among gentile syng vnto thy name agayne sayth reioyce ye gentile people agayne prayse lord al gentile laude al ye nacios together agayne esai sayth shalbe roo e iesse shall ryse raigne ouer gentile hym shall gentile truste god hope fyll ioye peace belieuing ye maye riche hope power holy ghost general rule summe profession peace concorde therfore beseche god authour pacience hym whiche secrete wrytynges encourageth v sufferaunce withoute whose helpe nothyng vouchesaue graunte ye one mynde consent knyt together therin folowyng example iesus christe nothyng somuche praysed vnto v mutuall loue concorde waye shall well auaunce glorie ofthat ye agreyng together maye wt one mouthe prayse god father c god father christe iesus yf taught dyd towarde v lykewyse one another meane shall men also vnderstand vnfaynedly christes scholers ye one assente speake christe ye brotherly consente declare also ye knytte together one mynde among therfore whiche gentile called ydolatrie christe iewes called shadowes law perfite righteousnes let dissencion remayne labour rather gladly please eche one another receyue maynteyne eche healping hande euen maister christe gladly receyued coumptynge vpon offence former lyfe brotherly embracyng thentent would among men set furth glorie god father ye doyng one another owne glory myght also set spreade abrode christe pleased kyndes men fyrste iewes declare thatand saye iesus christe minister circision c god father trewe worde whiche perfourmed theyr posteritie eue thing prophetes sayinges promised theyr forefather gyue thakes whose good lucke receyue truthe thynges moses law figure shadowes represented christ pleased also gentile whiche suche promyse made vnto thentent beyng receyued welthy state withoute deserte yea without hope therof shoulde magnifie goodnes god thentent saye iewes shoulde glad haue laste attayned vnto haue long loked gentile also haue thei loked shoulde counsell god long decreed psalmes wyse speaketh christe father causefor cause wyll prayse among ge tile sing vnto thy name c wyll set furthe thy glorie among gentile vnto thy name syng song prayse agayne canticle deuteronomie sayde reioyse ye gentile people agayne cxvi psalme prayse lorde ye gentile laude hym ye nacions together agayne also long prophesied esaie saying ther shalbe daye roote iesse shall ryse raigne ouer ge tile hym shall gentile trust ferther beseche god whiche prophetes saying hath put hope maye please aboundantly perfourme thing long synce promysed heauines dissencion secluded maye please hym fulfyll ioye concorde faythe hope whiche ye haue already conceyued god maye dayly enriched encreased confidence good cleare coscience throughe mighty power holy ghost texte p self full certified brother ye also ful goodnes filled wt knowledge able exhorte one another neuerthelesse brethre haue sumwhat boldely wrytten vnto partly put remembraunce grace gyuen god minister iesu christe among gentile minister gospel god offering gentile might acceptable sanctified holy ghost haue therfore wherof maye reioyce christe iesu thynges whiche pertayne god dare speake anye thinges christ hathe wrought make getiles obedient worde dede mightie signes wonder power spirite god hierusalem coastes rounde vnto illiricum haue fylled countreyes gospell christe speake mistrust goodnes whomeneuertheles brother haue somewhat boldly wrytte vnto thus ferfurth persuaded ye youre owne good wyll ful charitie endewed suche knowelege without councell able gyue eche matiers good aduise yet haue sumwhat familiarly liberally wrytten vnto teache ignoraunte neither commaunde people ylwylled put remembraunce beste done thentent whiche ye well know muste done selfes frely doe ye plentifullye throughe myne encoragyng behalf duetie committed vnto god therof vnworthy folowyng wyl pleasure iesus christe whose worke labour vtterest power auauncyng glorie ghospell among whiche gentile maye vnto hym offer pure sacrifice thynke hym moste accepted sacrifice yf offer vnto hym suche cleannesse besemeth hym eue holy sacrifice pourged wyth carnall cerimonies holy ghost whiche onlye authoure perfite holynes synce see haue alreadye manye brought toi haue therfore whereof maye reioice christ iesu passe surely maye lawfully glorie bosting myselfe world reioysing god prosperouse preachyng whiche yet neither thanke selfe labour iesus christ whose deputie whose assistece execute office preachyng comitted vnto mynde abyde make rehearsall mennes actes leste doyng might seme take vpon prayse haue deserued speake wyl suche thinges christ hath ministerie done whiche wycked gentile gyuen ydolatrie nowe become obedient gospel moued therto partely wordes deedes partely great myracles wonderfullwith worde dede mightye signes wonder c workes shewed establyshment doctrine shewed saye muche power strength myghtie power spirite god whome nothyng el instrument minister whyles thus glorie luckie successe preachyng muche auaunce owne glorie glorie christe behalfe lawfullye glorie whiche suche sorte gyue prayse preachyng god yet therin gyue place manne texte p haue enforsed self preache gospel christ named leste shoulde haue buylte another mannes foundacion written spoken shall see heare shall vnderstande cause haue ene ofte let let yet coulde come vnto seyng haue nomore countreyes also haue bene desirouse many yeares come vnto whensoeuer take iourney spayne wyll come trust see iourneye brought waye thitherwarde haue somewhat enioyed aquaintaunce haue preached gospell commen sorte haue vntyl tyme preached suche countreies christes name yet hearde laboured busilye prayse goddes hande foundacions christian religion myght enlarged compasse dominio spread abrode mynded build vpon foundacions whiche apostle layde harder poynte sette vp begynnynges religion mayntayne set vp already thought acte belonged gospel specyally synce perceyued long sayde moste holy prophete esai whome sayth spoken shal see hearde hym shall vnderstande desyre enlarge faythe christe hathe greatlyeto spoken shall see yt heare shal vnderstande c troubled hitherto coulde see albeit verye desyrouse wheras oftentymes purposed come thither vnto busines styll hindered thinke spirite christ gouerning nowe haue gone ouer achaia macedonia whiche countreyes see place haue set foundacios christian fayth nowe manye eares great desyre see truste shall haue occasion satisfye desyer go spaine way thitherwarde shal see brought way thitherwarde yet haue taryed certaine day haue good copany partely satisfied desyre trust fauor christ shal shortly done texte goe ierusalem minister vnto saintes hath pleased macedo achaia make certaine distribucion vpo poore saintes ierusalem hath pleased verely theyr debters gentyles made partaker theyr spiritual thinges theyr duetie minister vnto bodily thynges haue perfourmed haue brought fruite sealed wyl come backe againe spaine sure come vnto shal come aboundaunce blessyng gospel christ present tyme purpose go ierusale deliuer vnto poore iewes christian men free almes macedonian dwel achaia deliuered vnto thought good sume mony indifferetly gathered suche disposed frely geue refreshe pouertie ierusalem whiche beyng poore substaunce yet godly religion riche noman copelled thought hath pleased macedonia c mynde therin thought well forasmuche bounden vnto religion sake deliuered fyrst vnto theyr cause synce people ierusale fyrst departed doctrine christ getiles reasonable depart part theyr mony suche vile reward recopensyng ye precious treasure whiche haue receiued thone sorte frely departed wt suche treasure belong helth soules frely wyllyngly geue whiche appertaineth bodily necessity therfore aswhe haue perfourmed c wil come backe spain sone haue herein done duetie deliuered mony purposed mynde deliuer selfe money sealed lest either part therof deceitfully take away el lest selfe might suspected one hath taken part therof labor man busines nothyng wil iourney spainward go though make hastie spede spain preache gospel vnto yet wil thinke paineful tary spende tyme among nothyng doubtyng shal come vnto shal come find suche comyng shalbe great glory praise christ while ye wt godly mindes receiue merily helpe god al pointes satisfie desyres texte beseche brother lord iesus christes sake loue spirit ye helpe busynes praiers god may deliuered whiche beleue iewry seruice whiche haue ierusalem may accepted saintes may come vnto ioy wyll god may refreshed god peace al amen meane season beseche lorde iesus christes sake vnfained charity sake whiche haue spirit receiued forasmuche yet presently haue cupany lest godly prayer peticions made vnto god ye wyl helpe labouryng trauailyng suche daugerous busines helpe may deliuered fro misbeleuers iury suche resist gospel christ theyr malice hinder part fruit preachyng myne office deliueraunce money whiche make ieru le may without lette pleasaut thakeful good deuoute people isthat seruice haue ierusalem may accepted c done would haue comyng wyl god may vnto ioyful may great labor taken whyle among refreshed finishe exhortacion begunne beseche god true peace father author mainteiner cocorde may alway abide among whiche resisteth goeth farre proud sedicious person gotten kept mutual cosent agrement xvi chapiter texte commende vnto phebe syster whiche minister congregacion cenchrea ye receiue lorde becometh saintes ye assist whatsoeuer busynes needeth ayde hath succoured many myne owne selfe grete prisca aquila healpers christ iesu whiche haue life layd doune theyr owne neckes vnto onely geue thakes also cogregacions gentile likewise grete cogregacion house salute welbeloued penetes whiche fyrst fruite achaia christ rete mari whiche bestowed muche labor ou v salute andronicus iunia cosyns prisoner also whiche well taken among apostle christ grete amplias beloued lorde salute vrba helper christ stachis welbeloued salute ppelles approued christ salute whiche aristobulus houshold salute herodian yusman grete houshold narcissus whiche lorde salute riphena riphosa whiche woman labor lorde salute beloued ersis whiche lab red muche lorde salute ufus chosen lorde mother myne grete asincritus phlegon herman patrobas mercurius brother whiche salute philologus iulia nereus sister olimpa al saintes whiche salute one another holy kysse congregacions christ salute bvt yet letter commende vnto sister phebe went hence vnto deliuered letter brought thither hath wt diligence succoured sustained christian congregacion cenchris desiryng receiue vse mete woman receiued asreceiue christ becommeth saintes good people hath done muche ayde al suche thynges shall neede haue healpe surely mete ye helpe forasmuche hath oftymes succoured many good people also grete name prisca husbande aquilla whiche iewe countrie pontus whiche holpe ieopardie iewes liyng watche lest naughtie people preachyng ofwhiche haue life layd doune owne neckes christes doctrine might setted farfoorth defence life put selues ieopardy theyr owne folke redy aueture theyr liues sauegarde myne whiche goodnes onely geue thakes al congregacions gentile partly likewyse haue done partly thynke benefite whereby saued generally belongeth men salute onely also theyr family grete epenetus laudable maners well worthy called specially beloued maye well call hym fyrste fruites achaia whome countrey fyrst brought christes religion greete maria whiche without ieopardye payne hath done muche greete ye andronicus iunia bothe cosyns also imprysoned somtyme whiche among apopostieswhiche well taken among aposties christ wel taken number lxxii famouse godly religion yea whiche go beyond tytle dignitie professed christ dyd yf lawfully honoure suche fyrst borne theyr parentes muche lawfully ought honoure fyrst borne agayne christe salute amplia whome singular godlynes sake loue hearte salute vrban felow helper labour suche thynges apertayne christes gospell stachis felowe tenderly loue salute apelles whiche hath many affliccions sufferyng christes sake bene well assayed tryed founde sure salute aristobulus housholde salute herodion kynsman greete house narcissus especially new borne christe salute tryphena tryphosa whiche woman theyr busye labour care promote gospell salute persis whome yngulerlye loue one hath taken muche payne auauncyng gospel christ salute rufus vertuouse religiouse man mother whome coumpte euen myne owne mother also salute asyncritus phlegon hermes patrobas herman brother salute philologus wyfe iulia nereus syster olympa al good people lyue salute eche one another holy kysse chaste kysse without dissimulacion suche one maketh playne profe perfite concorde cogregacions christ salute whose good wyll loue borne vnto well knowe andmarke whiche cause deuision gyue occasion eueil thyng desyre brother beware sowe deuision gyue occasion euyll among labouring bryng newe kynde doctrine contrarie ye haue receyued laboryng myngle christian religio iewyshe ceremony together knowe suche vpon ye maye auoyde hard know teache sincerely right doctrine go vnfaynedly aboute christes busynes go aboute theyr bealyes aduauntage whyles flatteryng pleasaunt wordes rather holsome deceyue simple mennes myndes easely deceyue vnder coloure holynes obedience euery place spoken abrode whiche glad fyrst step godly lyfe obedient yet muste euery man diligently take hede doth obeye simplenes thyng worthyi woulde haue wise vnto whiche good c prayse suspecteth nothyng oftetymes deceyued wherfore would haue suche sort simple ye neither hurt deceyue man yet wyse well aduysed folowe suche thynges good auoyde suche thynges corrupt godly lyfe ignoraunt many resiste gospell christ satan labour let mennes saluacion persecute vnder false coulour religion drawe men christ allure moses law ye nomore continue god wyl assiste endeuoures defeder cause haue ye feare mightier wyll trede downe breake piece satan mortal enemie wyth power ouercome bryng hym vnder feete within short time grace lord iesus christ alway wt al texte timothie worke felowe lucius iason sosipater kynsmen salute tertius salute whiche wrote epistle lorde caius hoste hoste al congregacions saluteth erastus chamberlayne citie saluteth quartus brother saluteth grace lorde iesu christe amen timothie derbe companion preachyng ye gospel greteth lucius iason thessalonica sosipater sonne pyrrhus beroe kynsmen tertius salute whiche charitable zeale borne towarde wrote epistle whyle paule endytedand tertius c caius also one among fewe baptized saluteth whose house nowe lodge onlye congregacion christia men gentill hoste nede erastus chamberlayne citie corinthe saluteth also quartus brother fauer lorde iesus christ alway al desyre god graunt establishe make sure texte hym power stablyshe accordyng gospel preachyng iesus christ vtteryng misterie whiche kepte secrete synce worlde began nowe opened scripture prophetes commaundemente euerlastyng god stere vp obedience fayth published among nacions god whiche alone wyse honour prayse iesus christ euer ame hym without helpe power able stablyshe confirme kind life ye haue ghospel learned wherinnow opened scripture hetes commau dement c preache iesus christe whiche gospell moses lawe vtterlye abolyshed secrete purpose god whiche many yeares paste hath ben hydden accordyng olde sayinges prophetes brighte lyght gospell spreade abrode opened ordinaunce commaundement god hathe put v truste preache declare secrete misterie secret point religion expressed gospell playnly shewed men wherby worshipping deuils abrogate ceremony moses law cease shoulde fayth obedient submit themselfe god hath true wysedo hym saye geue thankes iesus christ glorie prayse euer amen finis argument whole mattier first epistle thapostle saint paule corinthian erasmus roterodame corinthe chiefe citie achaia commodiouse hauens therof almoste iland moste famouse richest marte towne asia maners suche city commonly wonte verie corrupte bad partely reason resorte al nacions whiche bring rather exaumples vice good maniers partely also marchau men aboue take vpon lyue licenciously therfore albeit corinthian preachyng paule alreadye receaued gospelle yet remayned leauynges theyr former lyfe property insomuche feared leste mighte true christianitie withdrawen either philosopher disdayned preachyng christes crosse base vnlearned doctrine el false apostle prouokyng iewishnes suche harde matier alter chaunge one man newe bothe suche customes borne vnder suche man hath nozeled yea harde saynt hierome preface second booke comentaries vpon epistle galathians sayeth suche faultes paule layeth corinthian charge remayned people achaia euen vntil time time also suppose dipped litle water sufficient meane make perfect christian man paule therfore knowyng well great acte bolde whiche gotten conquere great laboure payne gotten child christe among yeare halfe like diligence calleth agayne christe establisheth doctryne ghospell sometyme vsyng apostolique authoritie reprouyng chiding thretning sometime like louing father speaking fayre encouraging mollifying vehemencie necessarie reprouing praysing maner wise phisician temperyng sower vnpleasaunt medicine swete suger eftsoues prouiding also euery maladie mete conuenient reamedies firste rich foloweth pryde vurulines among vnruly persones oftentimes arise sectes while neither geue place vnto eche man thinketh hymselfe beste besides welthines bringeth ryot delicate fare riot groweth leachery couetous thing geuen peculiarly marchante men corinthian proude onely reason welthe also learned grecian philosophy therfore dessoised suche learned therein rude barbarouse pride came euery auaunced hymselfe vpon singularnes apostle whome baptised therof rose sediciouse wordes holde apollo holde cephas hold paule pryde also came solene assembly meetynges disagreed amonge selfes euery manne thought spiritual gifte beste while one gyfte neither woulde gyue place suche disordre confusion euen theyr wemen open place spoke taughte ryot pryde also ofte came holye supper whiche paule calleth lordes supper wherin moste mete shewe christian concord ryche men without lokynge poore fell meate gorged selues vntill drounke while hungrye insomuche supper dissencion distemperaunce also certayne vnseemyng inequalitie accustomed bee vsed supper among dysdayned paule countyng hym poore rascalle lackynge eloquence rude vnlearned rose partlye pryde partlye philosophie wheras doubted resurrection dead whiche euen pryncipall article foundacion religion came philosophie intemperaunce riot came vsed indifferently eate suche meates offered ymages dyuelles without regardyng theyr conscience weake leacherye came whiche place lesse punished corinthe farre beside enormyties thys kynde one found among incestuouse aduoutrie abused father wyfe wytte owne steppe mother beyng giltie offence banyshed company corinthian kept company christian menne outragiouse liuers though thei euen fauered theyr wickednes like wantones came also men vnsemely long bush woman shamed church bare headed bodylye aparayle vtteryng lewed womannyshe wanton maniers couetousnes went lawe one another recouer good name auoyding anye bodyly ieoperdye money amog desyre money growen far christian men vowed despisyng suche thinges without great dyshonour christes name went lawe heathen wicked iudges farre fro despisyng losse litle money suche matiers went aboute wilfullye deceaue finallye stryued among selues matrimonye reason euen tyme christian men styflye defended wholy abstayne mariage sawe apostle abstayne wyues thus haue declared dyseases corynthians whome leste rest myght infected paule prouideth reamydies first al hath told trust would stedfastly contynewe gospel christ earnestlye reproueth byddeth beware contenciously glorie men one assent concorde glory christes name men bounde thanke haue waye declaryng verye welspryng al suche dissention pryde pride therfore worldly philosophie calleth backe mekenes crosse albeit symple without bragges yet sayth myghty effectual sheweth also beginner mischief false apostle whiche paules departure thrust themselues eftsones warning howe layed good sure foundacion thei take hede leste builded thing therupon afterward plucked downe say corinthian learne nothing anone fayne forgette like father reasoneth matter child reprouyng growen great despised firste teacher abiect person gospel sake suffred al maner trouble thesame thei much bound fauer encourageth child folow steppe father wilfully yelde selfe bounde newe scholemaisters poyntes intreateth paul specially firste secound third fourth chapter myne opinio end fourth chapter belongeth begynnyng fyfte wherein gyueth commaundement touchyng incestuouse aduoutrer willeth commen consent men auoyde company partly might amende shame partly leste company myght corrupted onely warning auoyde company also company suche beyng called sorte christian men lyue viciously slaunderously company paynim sayth nedeth muche auoyded eyther lytle belongeth christian lyfe leade el suche comen man would auoyde theyr company able company entreateth fyfte chapter thrydely sheweth mynde concernyng sutes lawe among suche accion rose shame among christian stryue money menne lytle sette suffer matter goe farre haue hearde heathen iugdes finishe among themselfes arbitremente suche thought mete entreateth sixt chapter whereof great parte myne opinion belongeth seuenth euen place aboute entreate matrimonie among vice condemneth fornicacion aduoutrye buggorie matter prosecuteth vntill beginnyng nexte chapter sayeth knowe ye membres temple christe fourthly instructeth touchyng matrimonie wydowhead vnequall mariage diuorces virginitie way warnyng christian religion sake goe aboute chaunge ciuile state theyr lyfe treatyse encourageth single lyfe chastitie yet denieth reamydie mariage suche haue nede therof doth seueth chapter fiftly declareth flesh offred idolles dede nothing differeth yet must abstayne ieopardy leste heathen weake christian present reason thyne eatyng lyke thynke thou fauourest idolatry suche lyke vice dissuadeth olde example doeth eight parte nineth chapter myddes entreth prayse himselfe couertly auauncyng authoritie aboue apostle euen aboue chiefe among rest freely taught corinthian doctryne gospell sixtly teacheth mete done comen metinges christian witte menne haue long heare woman bare headed also lordes souper thinges commen equall shewyng bealy matter hande whiche mete prouided home spirituall feast represented souper lorde furthermore warneth none proude spirituall gyfte euery bestowe gyfte comen weale churche exhortyng exaumple membres body soberly vse gyftes specially yet laboring gifte charitie without onely good also hurtful among gyftes spirite geueth chiefe preeminence charitie nexte prophecie name calleth gyfte expoundyng holy scripture biddyng vse gyfte auoyde vnquiet disordre confusion sayth fewe spake course chargeing wemen meane season holde peace somuche co gregacion suffreth aske learnyng speaketh xi xii xiii xiiii chapter seuenthly dyuerse argumentes proueth resurreccion dead declaring maner shalbe doeth xv chapter last chapter speaketh certayne familiar thinges wit geuyng money towarde reliefe poore cumyng agayne corynthe finally commendeth vnto timothe certayne saincte ambrose thinketh firste epistle saincte paul wrote corinthian coniecturing thinke written firste chapter wrote vnto epistle though written vnto matter letter albeit greke interpreter dissente thynke epistle sente tim othe mencion made twyes stephana fortunatus achaicus commendeth vnto againe wrytten latter ende tary ephesus vntill fiftyeth daye suppose sent ephesus againe thinke sent philippos title haue greke bookes yet canot coniecture reason ledde thought onlesse gather written waye paul sayeth wyll come go ouer macedonia go macedonia straight see passage p ende argument paraphrase erasmus vpon first epistle apostle paule corinthian chapiter texte paule called apostle iesus christe god brother sostenes vnto congregacion god corinthum sanctified christe iesu called sainctes call name lord iesus christ euery place ether grace bee vnto peace god father lord iesus christ thanke god alwaies behalfe grace god geuen iesus christ thinges ye made riche hym vtteraunce knowelage thynges testimony iesus christ confirmed ye behinde gift waityng apering lord iesus christ shall also strength vnto ende ye maie bee blamelesse daye commyng lorde iesus christe paule false apostle vsurper apostle auctoritie among called ambassadoure christe messanger menne called saye throughe myne owne deseruyng pleased god moste mercifull father ministerie spreade abrode honoure sonne whiche calling certifie leste ye shoulde either mislyke bee desyrouse haue paule therfore euen whome ye knowe well also sosthenes brother profession felowe office doe wryte epistle sediciouse sectes stryue one another congregacion churche whiche god goodnes whose commaundemente laboure embassie hathe steadfastly ioyned together one accorde mynde suche mutuall charitie beseemeth christian corinthe buyldyng olde citie newe heauenlye placyng steade earthlye heauenlye companye saye companye purged cleansed theyr olde vice beastelye lustes pryde throughe ryches worldlye learnyng disease meanes whereof among men debate dissencion oftetymes arise farre otherwyse shoulde whome one god one delyuerer christ one baptisme one religion one rewarde doeth dyuersly ioyne knyt together hath christe frelye taken sinnes former lyfe entente hencefoorth vertuouse exercyse ye shoulde preserue kepe godlye state hym restored vnto neyther gote ye throughe youre owne desertes ye thesame bounden thanke youre ryches philosophie keapyng moses lawe eyther iesus christe whiche bothe purged fyrste bloude called continuall perfeccion holynes lyfe belongen woordes onelye generally nacions worlde professe name lorde iesus christe whether bee among iewes among ye gentyles putte vayne truste theyr great ryches possession wholy leane haue confidence vpon helpe succoure one churche christian congregacion equallye bounde christe onelye bothe theyr delyueraunce moste vilanouse bondage synne also theyr callyng chusyng oute godlynes lyfe neither place countreye seuereth ghospell menne haue one christe gyftes free menne common grace peace therfore wyshe vnto also whiche bothe manne el canne geue geueth thinges meane god father whome fountayne oure weale commeth oure lorde iesus christe bygrace vnto peace god father c whome onely father pleasure geue thynges grace obtayned shall saue kepe vnharmefull innocente vnharmefull lyfe ioyned peace concorde grace excludeth synne bryngeth v goddes fauoure peace reconcyleth eche one another one ye suche sorte receyue goddes benefite ye forget chief gyuer declaracion made ye onelye name christiannes also christiannes deede grace partaker ye goodes heauenly benefit peace concorde according abilitie ye bestowe heauenly gyftes eche one vpon another thing goddes free gyfte whiche glad behalfe gyue god thankes thing againe mislyke would wyshe amended among lyue christian lyfe bee whome yet dregges fylthynes theyr olde synfull lyfe remayne styll coumpte youre weale myne owne yf ought among bee amisse ithat thynges ye made che thynke parte therein therefore youre behalfe thanke god alwayes whose grace goodnes christes free gyfte suche plentifull sorte departed among whereas heretofore ye buisylye soughte earthly frayle transitory rich ye nowe throughe christes benefite enriched heauenlye treasure suche ryches shall neuer peryshe bryng v vnto true perfite weale token whereof kynde language gyfte knowledge whiche ye haue obtayned aboundauntly late proude ye youre vayne philosophie synce steede false ye embraced true wysedome ye vse selues discretelye late proude ye reason worldly eloquence highlye standyng owne conceytes synce ye aboue inspired gifte tongue ye speake heauenly matter stedfastlye continuyng ye knowe beste meane whereof trueth ghospel faith christ greatter renoume stregthned while al clearely see perceiue yt fact wrought wrought worldely policie myght god geuing gyftes vnto v brought preaching credite insomuche albeit ye neyther sawe peter iames coumpt either chiefe apostle yet gifte wherwith god wonte auaunce ministerie apostle wherin ye ought thinke selfes behynde farre euery manne maye well perceyue notwithstanding minister diuerse yet chiefe doer one synce one effecte doeth alwaye folowe giftes geuen vnto lyke earnest money pledge euerlasting life come ye suche playne sensible token concernyng hope thinges cannot seen awayte daye wherin christe nowe yet semeth membres suffre affliccion shall playnly shewe maiestie deuyde godly vngodly deliuer seruauntes trouble vexacion desyre day ye suffre displeasure feare ye doe dewtie menne maye peraduenture vnrighteously condemne quyte day shal god without wrong apoynte eyther euerlastyng paynes euerlasting pleasure yet distrust ye nothing presente time ayder defender day shalbe iudge goodnesse ye restored olde errours godly life ye haue begune leade godly life pure shal ye likewyse goodnesse continew suche vertuouse conuersacion fearefull daye lorde iesus ye founde blamelesse trust ye shall strength myne goodnesse god whiche disapoynteth man hope standeth surely perfourmeth asmuche promised texte p god faythfull ye called vnto felowshippe soune iesus christe lorde beseche brother name lorde iesus christe ye speake one thyng dissencion among ye may whole body one mynde one meanyng shewed vnto brother whiche house chloe strife among speake euery one sayeth holde paul holde apollo holde cephas holde christe christe deuided paul crucified eyther ye baptized name paul thanke god baptized none crispus caius leste saye baptised myne owne name baptized also house stephana furthermore knowe whether baptized man christe sente baptize preache ghospell wysedome woordes leste crosse christe shoulde haue made none effecte preachyng crosse peryshe folysnnesse vnto v whiche saued power god wrytten wyll destroy wysedome wyse wyll cast awaye vnderstandyng prudente wyse scribe disputer worlde hathe god made wysedome worlde folyshnesse doubted synce free mercy hath called vnto made ioynte inheritoures onely sonne lord iesus christe also fauour labouring continew godly state ye fall fro honourable inheritaunce wherof ye haue already receiued earnest peny hitherto haue spoke suche thinges behalfe doe greatly reioyce wherin would wishe ye continew goe forwarde alwaies ye haue begune nowe harken mysselike would amended wherein desyre ye vnlyke selfes nede teache becommeth profession ye knowe selfes sufficiently onely beseche moste dearly beloued brethre lord iesus christes name sake namei beseche brother name lorde iesus christ ye al speake one thyng moste reuerenced honoure suche haue professed among diuision shamefull dissencion ye agree hearte woorde concorde becomeas one perfite bodye whose partes steadfastly fast knyt together worldly wysedome reason sectes dyuerse opinion soondrye partes deuided reason whereof also perpetuall stryfe contencion among theyr scholers folowers mayntayned christian wisedome among al men haue like rule determinacions one author maister fauoureth suche small pathes carnal sectes men opinios mete therfore professours philosophie learning al one consent agrement mindes abstayne also suche woordes soude towardes stryfe debate inwarde debate wicked vngodly fyght braule woordes agaynste honestie leste peraduenture ye might thinke haue saying vayne suspicion assure brought vnto suche godly perfite lyuers well worthy beleued ye knowe chloe notable godly woman ye knowe housholde acquayntaunce whiche thesame trade lyfe chloe theyr ayder knowen whiche bothe zeale welth necessity helpe heard stryfe contencion among though ye sedicion sorte people quarellyng among selfes thyng el pray meane woordes whiche comenly spoken among while example one sayeth holde paul another agayne holde apollo sayeth ii holde paul holde apollo c holde cephas holde christe saye name sedicions sectes lyke sorte professe vayne wisedome worlde one boasteth pithagoras plato one boasteth aristotle zeno one boasteth epicurus maister maister euery one eche owne maister continuall variaunce haue one maister one learnyng one ordinaunce one purpose intente whence come diuersities name christe deuided hym selfe disagreyng parte deale honoure religionis christe deuided whiche onely dewe one among menne doyng makyng seruauntes maisters gaue grace lyue cyghteously dyd christe whiche owne bloude washed forge ye selfes name whose benefite free gifre geue leaue speake example paul crucified youwas paul crucified yf menne euery manne equally benefite bounde christe synce generally dyed seke title surname diuerse menne inmaner geuyng whiche christe onely haue thankes baptisme planted christe name baptized power baptisme springeth ye rather call selfes paules scholers christes synce ye wer baptized paules name christes yf vpon occasion glory dew god taken geuen menne thanke god baptized none crispus caius whiche trowe glory nothyng therof knowledgei thanke god baptized none crispus caius minister christe chiefe doer might haue chaunced yf hadde baptized many would haue would haue called themselfes stede christes disciple paules disciple cometh mynde baptized also stephanas householde baptized remembre none mynde ranne vpon suche thinges whiche aduaunced christianitie whiche baptisme doen man leaste parte baptisme vsuall accustomed woordes euery man maye pronounce easye thyng without ieopardie dyp water bothe readie willyng thereto office apostle effectual preaching god woorde bring man long accustomed lyfe lawes ordinaunces countrey newe quite contrarie religion stycke wyse doe though thereby stande ieopardie deathe hereof myght lawfully glorye yf myght chalenge suche enterprise thyng owne yet speake disalowe baptisme preferre whiche better whereunto specially assigned christe neuer assigned embassie among gentile minister baptisme setfurth publishe preachingchrist sente baptize preache gospell glory name wynne many coulde gospell vnto hym yet doyng haue cause carnally glorie god woulde haue feate done eyther conueyaunce mannes witte eloquence wherewith suche woonder coulde wrought would haue greate enterprise brought passe rude simple playne preachyng entente prayse acte geuen god pleased vyle lowe reprochefull crosse christe preachyng therof renewe worlde christes crosse semeth lowe try flyng matter yet vyle tryfle subdueth gloriouse maiestie pompe worlde rnde wearysh preaching declare worlde christe fastened vpon crosse therupon died semeth folishe thing without poynte learnyng tellthe preaching crosse peryshe folishnes semeth vndoubtedly beyng blynded sinfull lyfe receyue theyr heartes preachyng gospell therby perysh forsakyng might saued yet suche hereby attayne euerlasting saluacion well vnderstande perceyue weake feble thing thing god owne doyng muche mightie effectuall man power garrison newe vnknowen meane hath pleased god renewe worlde long promised doe thei wyll destroye wysedome wyse mouthe prophete esai thus speaketh wil destroy wisedome wyse wil cast awaye vnderstandyng politique hath perfourmed promise see worlde renewed see men mistrusting theyr old religion casting away theyr affiaunce philosophie embrace crosse christe vnderstand men nowe thyng deuilysh vngodly whiche thought good godly nowe folysh fore thought wittie tell wise man proudewhere wise c knowledge lawe scrybe proude expounder lawe philosopher become searcheth priuities nature forgetting god maker al thyng maruayleth creature euery one made great crake could doe wonderfull thinges yet deceyued themselfes deceyued promised righteousnesse al wealth meane tyme themselfes miserable al drowned sinne god suffered punishemet theyr arrogant mindes wel deserued blindnes runne headlong al kindes dishonestie make knowe see owne estate takyng myght length knowe faulte amende therwith also learne howe vayne thyng vneffectuall philosophie hath god declared wysedome thishath god made wisedom worlde folishnes worlde folysh god time declared wysedome likewyse beautifull spectacle worlde wrought wysedome entent wonderyng suche maruaylouse piece worke men might rauyshed loue workeman purpose god theyr owne foly chauced quite contrary wurshypped creature wonderyng despised maker creature one vnknowen leading theyr lyfe sorte though eyther god fauoured synfull liuyng el gouerned worlde made texte worlde wysedome knewe god wysedome god pleased god folyshenes preachyng saue beleue iewes require signe grekes seke wysedome preache christe crucified vnto iewes occasion fallyng vnto grekes folyshnes vnto whiche called iewes grekes preache christe power god wysedome god folyshnes god wyser men weakenes god stronger menne brother ye see callyng howe many wise menne fleshe many mighty many degre called god hath chosen foolishe thynges world cofoud wise god hath chose weake thynges world cofoud thynges mighty vile thynges world thynges despised hath god chosen yea thynges reputacion bring nought thinges reputacion fleshe reioyse presence hym yt christ iesu god made vnto v wisedome righteousnes sanctifiyng redempcion according written reioyseth reioyse lorde wherfore god bryng thesame purpose passe wente another waye woorke myndyng suche throughe shewyng wysedome creature became worse shoulde bee broughte home agayne restored preachyng whiche men seeme lowe folishe trifle suche philosopher politique menne steede god worshyppyng dumme stone shoulde nowe obtayne throughe fayth crosse christe perfecte saluacion throughe faythe mistrustyng theyr worldelye wysdome haue sure confidence mercye god hope saluacion shoulde haue none vnles throughe faythe vnderstoode whence shoulde looke theyr saluacion bryng aboute therfore fyrste poynte plucke oute mennes heades vayne confidence hadde themselues mennes heades saye iewes onelye also offor iewes require asigne c gentile faythles iewes require signes woondres boaste themselues miracle shewed vnto theyr auncesters studie grecias learnyng knowledge worldly wisedome therby assuryng themselues bothe blysse glorye yet deceiued loked iewes vpon confidence theyr lawe fell fro christe wyse menne vayne pryde conceyued worldlye knowledge receyue humble fyrste sight appeareth lowe preachyng crosse preache neither familiar talke moses god aungels abraham harboured shewed hospitalitie vnto howe sunne commaunded stande styll suche thyng whereof iewes make great boaste preache syde mouynges heauenly bodyes influence planetes starres cause lightninges knowledge thinges make grecian proude preach thewe preach christe crucified c surely doctrine fyrste brunte seemeth base folyshe wytte christe crucified whiche base lowenes iewes occasion fallyng iewes wonder myracle ionas yet fynde fault christes actes greater tha ionas neuer great grecian reason discusse searche thynges thinke folyshenes saye virgyn heauenly power conceiue childe god incarnate take mannes nature vpon hym lyfe shoulde restored death rysen agayne whiche deade meanes christe bothe sortes semeth vile thing especiallye suche theyr owne strengthe haue lewde truste confidence inspiracion holy ghost called faythe preachyng ghospell throughly chaunged iewes grecian clearelye perceyue know thesame lowly meke christ crucified strength power wisedome god nowe neyther iewes nede gape myracles whiche fynde greater christe gentyles wysedome forasmuche haue nowe founde christe welspring wysedo god hath maner hyghe glorious maiestie submitted hymselfe vylenes hygh wysedome come downe oure folyshnes yet whiche hym semed folyshe poynt passeth wysedome worlde whiche hym semed weake feblethe folishnes god wyser n ouerwayeth surmounteth al worldly myght puissaunce reprochefull trespacer among trespacers hanged vpon crosse yet meanes conquered death whome man able withstande plaine homely learnyng ghospel yet homely made newe al world whiche tyme phylosophers learnyng euer able bring whiche done god hereof world clayme parte myght haue doen yf wrought either menne power ryches eloquence great famouse clearkes syth worldly wysedome glorie thereof sealy poore fyshers ouerthrowen vanquished euery man easely seeth al glorious acte renoume therof must gyuen god onely whose secrete power hath wrought brought passe one contrarie another nowe saye onely trewe poore christe apostle owne company also called god grace ye maye see thesame howe fewe eloquente wyse menne noumbre howe fewe menne power meane common reputacion howe fewe menne great bloude parentage labour ghospell youre selues brother see vnderstande glorie ghospell menne lowe degree setfurthe auaunced enlarged simple person nowe euen contrarie whiche wonte simple menne lowe vanquishe hygh rude playnes ouerthroweth craftines therfore chose god furthe especially suche thinges worldly estimacio seme rude vnlearnedgod hath chosen fo e thinges worlde confounde wyse make worldly wyse men ashamed theyr vayne enterprise chose suche meanes worldes opinion feble weake therby mocke either takyng partes ryches tiranny meanes thinke themselues mightie vnto hym chose suche thynges world thinketh vyle despised yea thinges reputacion bryng nought abolyshe thynges highe price intent neither fleshe worldly wisedome therof shoulde presence god haue thyng reioyse albeit haue vayne thyng boaste vpo sight world synce betwixt heauenly earthly thinges coparison made albeit iudgement worlde ye rascalles outcaste yet haue ye great bounteousnes god father gotten greatest honour whiche hath called inheritaunce sonne whome hath nother newe sorte geuen thinges whiche rufflyng proude worlde promised able perfourme hym haue ye receyued true wholesome wysedome ye nede philosophie suche worldly wisedome hym haue ye receyued righteousnesse nowe ye nede helpe moses lawe haue ye obtayned holynes lyfe leste man thynke came owne desertes haue ye receiued libertie whose bloud redemed tyranny synne briefe al weale stand bounde thanke christe god father chiefe authour al goodnesse may come passe writte prophete hieremye let neyther wise man proude wisedome riche bolde vpon trust rich yet strong man trust vpon strength synce none bryng men welthy state yf man iustly glory reioyce let glory knoweth god fountayne geuer good thynges let reioyce assigne parte therof worldly power helpe pthe ii chapiter texte brother came came gloriousnes woordes wysedome shewing vnto testimony god neither shewed selfe knewe thyng among saue iesus christe euen thesame crucified among weakenes feare muche trembling woordes preachyng entising woordes mannes wysedome shewyng spirite power fayth stande wisedome men power god let tell wherin better thus ashamed christes lowlines crake among lawe rich wisdome assured conuerted christe suche meanes fyrste came vnto teache preuey secrete wisedome gospell came furnished neyther meruaylouse gloryouse eloquence singuler knowledge philosophie whiche kynde menne knewe howe greatly ye regarded farre abhorred take vpon thynges face worlde coumpted singular shewed selfe among knowe nothyng el iesus christe euen thesame crucified preached manne suche manne yet god annoynted promised prophetes come redeme mannekynde whiche hym lowest reputacion beganne preachyng gospell albeit preachyng among tooke effecte yet thereby claymed prayse lyuyng among lyke manne power weake one feble gaped greate dominion one stoode daunger ieopardie assaulted deuilyshe persones whose tyrannye pacience ouercame looke sorte lyuyng thesame preachyng lyfe kepte safegarde agaynste violence lewde myscheuouse person mannes hande onely defence god lykewyse preachyng neyther garnyshed floures thetoryke sette furthe argumentes philosophie thereby shewe coulde learnyng eloquence yet symple power myght quyte chaunged braggyng learnyng spirite myghtie power god secrete inspiracio miracle ayded assisted rude preaching whereas ye darkenesse ignoraunce brought lyght ghospel beeyng thyng vnlyke hard bee perswaded manne thinke thesame bee doen worldely wysedome eloquence whiche take vpon v power god preachyng effectuall strong euer disputacion philosopher neuer subtile neuer wittye well set ordre beeyng among whiche proude worldely wysedome ignoraunte wysedome god taught playne matter yet suche saluacion necessarie texte speake wysedom among perfecte wysedom worlde neyther ruler worlde goe naught speake wysedom god whiche secrete lyeth hyd whiche god hath deyned worlde vnto glory whiche wysedome none ruler worlde knewe hadde knowledge would haue crucified lorde glory wrytten iye hath seen eare hath heard neyther haue entred hert man thinges whiche god hath prepared loue hym haue christe deaper poyntes wysedome talke among suche perfite diligente therfore laboure bee perfite ye maye bee partaker secrete hydden misteries god besyde preache crosse christe seme faythlesse preache verye folyshnesse suche stedfastly beleue seme preache excellente wysedome muche differyng wysedome whiche laboureth vayne serche naturall reason cause worlde farre also worldely policie wherof greate estate worlde make greate crake whose authoritie theyr wysedome christe abolished vanquyshed vtteryng theyr folyshnesse preache heuenly wysedome whiche hath outwarde apparence within inwardly myghtie effectuall wysedome curiositie pompe yet symple menne perceyue secrete knowen secrete inspiracion none suche god vouchesaueth make partaker thereof lay furth priuities wysedome comen sort people vtter secretly suche able mete receyue albeit wysedome nowe laste oure tymes publyshed yet god tyme hygh counsel ordained proude person haue hitherto folyshly craked theyr carnall wysedome henceforth meke lowlye haue excellente wysedome reioyse glorie wisdome delyteth dwell simple cleane heartes cause none great ruler worlde magiciens philosopher pilate anna cayphas phariseis deuils themselues neither thei knowen lowe folyshe preachyng christes crosse woulde glisteryng haue darkened glory world weakenes feblenes therof haue put flight vanquished tyrannye death synne neuer woulde haue fastened crosse lorde capitayne renoume glorie learnyng visible thynges theyr pryde knowleage lawe ignoraunt wonderfull misterie mete bee vttered onely suche humble sobre myndes made one wt god esai long prophecied declaryng wysedome whereof talke men soules secretely inspired saying suche thynges neuer seene mannes iyes mannes eares hearde conceyued mannes thought hath god prepared hartely loue hym grounde theyr disputacions vpon faythe vpon mannes reason texte god hath opened vnto v spirite spirite searcheth al thinges ye botome goddes secretes man knoweth thynges man saue spirite man within euen thynges god knoweth man spirite god haue receyued spirite worlde spirite whiche commeth god knowe thynges geuen v god whiche thynges also speake wordes mannes wisedome teacheth wordes holy ghost doeth teache makyng spirituall comparison spirituall thinges naturall man perceyueth thynges belong spirite god folyshnes vnto hym neyther perceyue spiritually examined spirituall discusseth thynges yet hymselfe iudged man hath knowen mynde lorde either shall informe hym vnderstande mynde christe hygh minded ruler proude phylosophers worthie receyue hydden mistery whiche yet god hathe opened v frendes worldly doctrine secrete inspiracion holye spyrite whiche spirite goddes nature proceadyng god searcheth foorth euen deapest mooste secrete priuities god wherunto mannes busye brayne attayneth euery man may easily loke man face lieth hidden bottome hert man able see onely knoweth spirite god man owne conscience like sorte diuers men beholde search property goddes creature thinges lye hidden goddes counsel prouidence body knoweth sauing euerlastyng spirite whiche beyng one nature hym knoweth suche thynges doeth one sheweth another secrete thoughtes secrete whispering eare god good openeth counsell spirite man whiche teacheth nothyng worldly phantasy spirite god sorte spirite suche doctryne teacheth worlde also hath spirite whome whosoeuer rauished bothe sauereth worldlynes loueth worldly thynges inspiracion heauenly spirite god bryngeth v mynde heauenly treasure maketh v vnderstande god hath christes crosse doen v isw haue receyued spirite worlde phylosophie whiche receyued spirite christe teache agayne godly simple people floures coloures thetorike philosopher wonte teache take hade rude wordes set ordre beyng yet suche teache spiritual doctrine reason requyreth forasmuche kynde wysedome far vnlyke haue another kynde teachyng worldly wysedome taught worldly fashion heauenly spirituall thinges must taught newe sorte yet euery man indifferetly suche onely haue receiued spirite christ reason spirituall themselues able receyue spirituall learnyng besemeth surely spirituall learnyng haue spirituall hearer hath bothe vnderstandyng cleansed faythe wylfull desyres corrected charitie grosse naturall man whiche proude arrogant vpon knowledge thinges maye seene ruled beastly lustes regardeth suche thynges apperteyne spirite god coumpteth folyshnes laugheth skorne whatsoeuer soundeth contrary thynketh beleueth thyng hath eyther proued experyence concluded natural reason without regarde learnyng phylosophie whiche teacheth christe borne virgyn bothe god man dying ouercame death rose agayne lyfe wyll perfourme membres suche thynges already doen hymselfe tribulacions waye true blysse death man shall come euerlastyng lyfe suche article cannot mannes reason perceyued inspiracion holy ghost learne thou nedeste wylye craftie wytte rather haste nede simple pure fayth suche instrument mete holye gooste worke wholy geueth vp selfe framed wroughthe spirituall discusseth al thynges vpon hym spirituall manne discusseth iudgeth thinge passing vpon temporall matiers studiouse heauenly thinges yet iudged carnall man hath skyll vpon heauenly secrete wisdome euen man iudgeth goddes matiers carnal man iudgeth spirituall poyntes preachyng taught men inuencions phantasy came furth secrete counsell god prophete esai sayde man liue hymself knoweth mynde god immortall wer one priuie counsel pleased goddes prouidence deliuer thraldome straunge meanes deceiue therby mannes vayne curiositie knowe goddes wyl mynde haue receaued spirite iii chapiter texte coulde speake vnto brother vnto spiritual vnto carnal euen vnto babe christ gaue milke drinke meate ye wer strog nether ye yet ye yet carnal long verely amog enuying stryfe sectes ye carnall walke maner men whyle one sayeth hold paule another apollo ye carnal paul thinge apollo onely minister whome ye beleued euen lorde gaue euery man grace haue planted apollo watred god gaue encreace nether planteth eny thynge nether watreth god geueth encreace planteth watreth one euery man yet shall receaue hys rewarde accordynge hys laboure fore goddes labourer ye goddes husbandrye ye goddes buylding accordyng grace god geuen vnto wyse buylder haue layde foundacion another buylt theron let euery man take hede howe buyldeth vpon another foundacyon man laye layde iesus chryst learning certayne poyntes mete begynners certayne mete wel entred goyng forwarde certayne mete suche verie perfite whiche euerye sorte must taught accordyng capacity therfore whe fyrst came vnto coulde teache deapest poyntes religio suche taught perfitely spiritual submitted preachyng weakenes amog rude vsyng rudnes among grosse speaking grossely lisping stameryng wemen doe theyr chyldren fayth also hath encreasinges sawe therfore christes learnyng euen younglynges fed mylke grosse learnyng substancial foode perfite doctrine able teach greater poyntes ye reason carnall affection blyndnes former lyfe er able vnderstand higher learnynge diuerse among able yet sum among albeit baptisme become christes seruauntes haue yet shaken al fleshly affeccions case surely carnal spiritual nede many wordes feare speake dede selfe speaketh matier knowen dedes synce spirite christ bredeth vnitie concorde contrarie syde enuy contention debate ryse nothing elles worldly desyers synce suche thynges sene among maye man saye reproche ye entangled mannes grosse affection yf ye denye whence come wordes talked among sounding debate strife corrupte mynde wheras one chiefe doer ruler ouer world yet among one sayeth paules secte another sayeth apollo secte sorte lyke sorte title studentes philosophie striue one another whyles one sayeth aristotle scholer another sayeth platoniste stoike epicure whiche thinge yet saye suche strife sectes either name apollo rysen thought good put example person make plainly perceyue haynousnes offence yf vnseamly thing giue v true apostle god suche haue taught nothing receyued spirite christe suche glory prayse onelye due hym beare ye chalenge mennes sectes moche passing bee parauenture false apostle gyue ouer gloriouse myghtye woorke youre saluacion profession vile person whiche shoulde gyuen vnto christ yf one named frangilius benotius angulius carmilius sum name put example haue deuised sum worldlye order rule lyfe wyll ye straight vpon pride theyr name shamfull variaunce among selues extinguyshing christes name make men author trewe religion wherof christ onely beginner yf ye doe remayneth nothing el ye varie newe made name lykewise labour mayntayne nouryshe thys dissencion myndes diuersitie apparell diuersities meates drynkes whole order lyfe prince seruauntes red yealowe partie coloures one cogniza unce nother shewe haue dyuerse maisters whome doe seruice vnto must ye whiche haue gyuen selfes sectes men though ye receiued lyfe libertie glory theyr surname though honorable ynough bee called christian ye ashamed thys name sufficient hurtles godly lyfe openlye declare selues bee breake ye whiche one deuyde christes glorye among lurdaynes er menne youre capitaines speake yet put case thei w r good apollo good paule yea good high chief apostle yet seruauntes christ whome ye beleue chief workman another mannes busines occupied theyr owne ieopardie authoritie haue receiued christ vnder whome principall guyde ruler execute one office another euerie god apoynted example fyrst planted time layed thei haue pla ted apollo watered foundacion learning gospell appollo watered gentyll exhortacions cherished whiche begunne make tree growe encrease plentuouslye bring furth fruite worke god oures planteth watereth labour vayne vnles heauen gyue therto hys secrete power influence whiche somuche effectuall priuey secret yf husband manne thys dysapoynted nothyng maner preuayleth gardiner yet waterer yf heauen bee seasonable whole increase ought aknoweleged come thence god concernyng thys feate aswell setter waterer like case bothe labour mennes woorkes shall theyr paynes receyue rewarde god whose woorkemen iourney men labour worke god ye hys grounde lande whiche hys behalfe tylle oure owne ye buyldyng rered vp hys honour owe hym seruice let euery man take hede seruice doeth hym doe true faythfull seruice shall receyue honeste rewarde yf otherwyse doe eyther shall lose labour receyue suche rewarde hathe therby deserued example according grace god hathe gyuen lyke wyse buylder haue layed foundacion buyldyng myne owne power helpe apoynted office vpon foudacion haue layed diuerse men diuersly buylde let euery manne marke well buyldeth therupon foundacion haue layed cannot chaunged preacher soeuer come v autoritie soeuer thei vnles preache iesus christe fastened crosse geue eare yf allowe foundacion remayneth thereupon buylde suche piece worke foundacion mete foundacion heauenly spirituall suche wherwith buyldyng earthlye carnal learning agreeth vayne counterfaite buylding may haply deceyue iudgement men cannot deceyue god iudgement texte man buylde foundacion golde syluer precious stone tymber hay stuble euery mannes worke shall appeare daye shall declare whiche shalbe shewed fyre fyre shal try euery mannes worke mannes worke hath buylt vpon byde shall receyue rewarde mannes burne shall suffre losse shalbe safe hymselfe neuerthelesse yet thorowe fyre man vpon foundacion buylde thynges substanciall excellente golde syluer precious stone contrary side lay vpon trifle wood hay strawe ende shewe howe euery one hath bestowed labour ye shall clearely vnderstande conceyue mynde grosse declaracion layed christe marke yf manne christe gaue exaumple teache ye ought lyue ryghteously ye ought doe good euen enemy ye ryches put none affiaunce despise honour ye ought poyson abhorre fylthy pleasure doe actes christes glory good dedes looke none rewarde lyfe immortall men ought christes sake desyre dye buyldeth semely acumly piece worke mete foundacion whiche christe yf therupon buylde mennes tradicions concernyng apparell dyet vnfrutfull ceremony suche lyke mennes owne deuises theyr owne glorye lucre glorye christ albeit begunne noble fou dacion growe yet kynde stede good godly make menne supersticiouse hathe preacher layed wood haye strawe euery mannes worke shall openly tryed tyme shall bee brought nygh lyght trueth bee examined rule ghospell yf learnyng ye haue buylded haue brought perfeccion ye canne ouercome carnall desyres maye knowe effectuall great power yf thesame haue made vnable suffre damage loss yf ye therby become suche eyther soone angry testie wayward contenciouse backbiter dissembler ye may easyly knowe learnyng counterfaite suche arested appeare daye wordly iudge one sleyght escape ofttymes god iudgement searcheth euery man vttermoste euen fyer tryeth metall may tyme prosperitie quietnesse vnprofitable buyldyng espied soone stormy blastes persecucion come thicke threfold pleasaunt carnal desire allure yf ye geue place shrynke ye plainly thereby shewe spirite god neither receiued ceremony mannes tradicions whiche whoso indewed suffereth christes sake al suche trouble temptacions euen ioyfully fiers wherwith euery man worke shalbe tryed sorte yf therfore preacher preacher buylding endure abyde fyer let suche one looke worldely prayse men handes yet sure haue reward god whose sake toke payne eythers worke fyre destroyed workeman shall lose labour defrauded rewarde although himselfe escape free yet escapeth burnyng conuey themselfes naked aresteth nothing el doen charge buylde agayne vpon foundacion suche worke meete chiefe moste ready waye teache suche haue professed christe nothing whiche christian man necessarie teacher doe hearer must take double paynes whiche must vnteache theyr scolers taught vnlearne thinges whiche learned hope saluacion long christe foundacion remayneth howe agreeth vncleane lyfe profession howe agree colde waterishe ceremony fyery burning charitie christe punishement shall suffre god hande haue well deserued whiche theyr doctrine corrupte texte knowe ye ye temple god howe sprete god dwelleth man defyle temple god shall god destroy temple god holy whiche temple ye let manne deceyue himselfe manne seme wyse among let become foole worlde may wise wisedome worlde folyshnes god written compasseth wyse theyr craftinesse agayn god knoweth thoughtes wyse vaine therfore let man reioyce men al thinges whether paul either apollo either cephas whether worlde either lyfe either death whether presente thynges thynges come youres ye christes christe god knowe ye ye temple consecrate vnto god heauenly spirite god possesseth sanctifieth yf suche one punished doeth defile temple halowed manne god destroy defyleth temple endeuour must dilygently temple kepte pure holy synce god hath holy spirite cleansed halowed kepe cleane may ye vnhurtefull lyfe christian conuersacion maners ye bee muche desyrouse honoure yf ye bee leach rouse geuen stryfe debate suche wylfulnes suspende ye defile sythe ye temple god buylded lyuelye stone verye wicked certaynely vngodlye prouoketh anye companye suche maners condicions learnynges christe agreable christe deceyueth manne especiallye none themlet man deceiue leane hym let euery manne beware deceyue hymselfe whyles vndiscretely trusteth vpon mannes helpe looke ye blysse felicitie either philosophie lawe lette one manne presumptuously thynke hymselfe better worldlye learnyng excellente lette hym rather worldly reputacion thinketh hymselfe wyse wyselye waxe folyshe maye bee wyse deede lette hym forsake proude teacher folyshe wy dome shall meete scholer verye wyse folyshnes euen ryches worlde make manne truelye ryche honoures worlde make manne truelye noble pleasure worlde make manne truely blessed euen wysedome worlde maketh man truely wyse god whose iudgement manne deceyue neuer wyse sighte worlde god mocketh wysedome while declareth onely whereby attayne saluacion also whiche hyndereth oure saluacion reason maketh men proude fyerse thereforehe compasseth wise theyr craftimes harde taught long spoken booke whiche intitled pacience iob god speaketh wyse whiche compasseth wise theyr owne wilines agayne lxiii psalme lorde knoweth thoughtes menne thinke themselues wyse vayne vnable perfourme suche thynges promise since therfore pythe oure saluacion altogether god men maye vsurpe porcion theyr owne geue parte glorye man chiefe doer since whole shoulde surrendred god synce ye one bodie ioyned together mutuall charitie vnmete one shoulde sticke one phantasie another another phantasie thynges youres indifferentlye whether paule apollo cephas anye authoritie sure goddes free gifte haue one equal authoritie youre profite worlde bee rore agaynste shall finallye bee profite lyue longer liue shall establyshe learnyng yf dye dye strengthen oure exaumple yf bee presente pleasure passe muche vpon soone goen yf thynges come moue laboure stoutelye courage towarde whiche albeit ye see youre bodelye iyes yet see ye iyes fayth awaye therfore name sectes diuision since thynges throughe one chiefe maister youres equally albeit seluesye christes christe goddes owne men suche sorte ye geue man right title vpo ye long iesus christ al together owe selues christ bounde god chiefe lord ruler al thinges whiche hym hath geuen v goodnes iiii chapter texte let man wyse esteme v euen minister christe stewardes secretes god furthermore required stewardes man found faithfull small thyng iudged eyther iudgement iudge myne owne selfe knowe nought selfe yet thereby iustified lorde iudgeth therefore iudge nothyng tyme vntill lorde come lighten thinges hid darkenes pen councels hertes shall euery man haue prayse god let euery man wyll vnfaynedly truely reioyse glorie reioyse name esteme v chiefe auctours maysters reason woulde suche shoulde bee regarded whiche lyke seruauntes occupyed christes affayres suche ought taken whiche stuardes bestowe others goodes committed vnto theyr credence secrete misteries god saye men synce suche behauour soeuer haue taken hande orderyng verye weyghtie matier yet another mannes let menne loke nothyng el wherfore shoulde price faythfully bestowe wherewith god hath put truste none intente purpose christes glorie deceytfull stuardes whiche stede godly doctrine teache mennes phantasy abuse obedience theyr lucre pryde whiche vnder prentense gospell promote theyr owne matiers vnder shadowe christes glory seeke beare tyrannouse rule albeit blynde menes iudgeme te yet deceiue god whome allowed highest treasure coumpte small matier onely iudgemetes allowed disallowed yea mannes iudgement el wh soeuer impossible one man shoulde well iudge another mannes conscience dare geue sentence vpon selfe whether deserue praysed god doen haue beste coulde accomplyshe office wherunto appoynted cannot remembre selfe harme fraude yet dare thereby clayme righteouse man might haue doen thing vnawares otherwyse shoulde haue eyther reason haue passedit lorde iudgeth bondes haue kepte selfe muche within whiche knowen onely god onely iudge office let v make hym iudge hydden vnknowe matiers whose iyes beholde thynges whiche wyll seeth tyme geue sentence vpon euery matier vnmete therfore ye beyng seruauntes shoulde preuete goddes iudgement iudgeyng men time come season geue sentence vpon vntyll lorde come iudge heaue lye earthly thinges vnder earth shall iudgement bring light thing hydden darkenesse open mennes iyes whiche nowe hydden priuey corner mannes harte mennes conscience perceyued shall receiue whose iudgemetes sure vndeceyueable rewardes according desertes hath without corrupcio doen duetie men neuer litle praysed shall god receiue euerlasting rewarde doeth contrary neuer somuche made praysed among menne shall iudgemente god putte shame suffre punishment texte thinges brother haue ensample described myne owne person apollo sake ye might learne v man counte hymselfe beyonde whiche aboue wrytten one swell agaynst mannes cause preferreth haste thou thou hast receyued yf thou haue receyued reioysest thou though thou haddest receyued nowe ye full nowe ye made ryche ye raygne kinges without v would god ye dyd raygne myght raygne playne hytherto haue framed tale selfe apollo beginner suche secte neyther take thyng vpon v among none braggeth hymselfe bee paules secte apollo perceyued among diuerse fauourers diuerse sectes leste myght haue prouoked impaciencie thought beste fayned name sette furth matter epistle shoulde read openly among euery man myght secretly examine owne conscience matter would elswise haue caused much spyte hatred opened name ye maye quietly perceyue howe vncomely certayne triumphe braggue vpon name false apostle despise euery man comparison themselfe surrenderyng vngodly vnto menne whiche dewe god whiche none purpose exalte eche parte dignitie owne apostle themselfes would greater estimacion iudgyng euen folyshlye themselfe whose behalfe doe arrogantly braggue crake thynges perhaps myght suffred yf onely folyshe syth deadly debate aryse matter cannot bee cloked ye ought esteme menne supply apostle office reason would stewardes best war mennes goodes regarded manne crake mannes name synce doe god consideryng thinges selfe cannot meruayle eyther apostle shamefully desirouse honour clayme vndiscretly theyr owne christes disciple rather reioyce triumphe man seruaunte god chiefe doer prouoke aunswere whosoeuer thou bee standeste thyne owne conceyte discontenteste thy selfe counterfayete glorye hym thou haste receyued baptisme small matter authour difference one semeth therby haue receiued haue receiued lesse yf baptised yea apostle golden lauer lauer preciouse stone sufficient chiefe apostle whose porte wealthe admyt passe kinges ryches haue prince god father dare saye manne hath receyued yf baptised fygge tree trough peter fyshers seruauntes seruauntes whiche coriar agayne prouoke aunswer whosoeuer thou art whiche west folishe errour simple people myndes rather abusest theyr errour whiche ought amended tell yet last whereof thou art proude teachest thou thyne owne learning others yf thou teache thine ownewhat haste thou thou haste receyued preachest thou thyne owne glory glory iesus christ yf thou preache others learnyng howe durst thou take vpon thyne owne whiche thou haste receiued god yf thou beleue learning thine owne whiche god hathe geuen blinde thou yf thou vnderstand none thyne doest yet boast crake thy selfe therof though thyne owne shamlesse thou howe great heyght ye corinthian come lowe foundacion beyng hungerbaned famyshed among poore nedye gette dayly lyuyng fayne sowe lether byle cruelly vexed syncerely without corrupcion preached christ vnto ye come despise v apostle councell fyerce full fedyng reason ryches puffed vppe pryde wranglyng sediciouse reason dominion kyngdome haue ye taken possession great ryches selfe thrust v doore haue sustayned greatest brunte matter whether ye haue obtayned great thing iudge selfes certaynly would wishe ye obtayned kingdome semely christe would thrust selfes one parte therof raygne layed foundacion cannot brought minde thinke ye would vnmanerly thrust company welthy state vnto begynners thesame vnlesse vtterly borne misery haue rewarde despite famine infamie emprisonmente strypes ieopardie life menne theyr false learning gette selfes great renoume yf apostle office recompensed worldly rewardes thinke ought ryght haue beste whiche firste great ieopardyes haue graffed christe texte thinketh god hath set forth v apostle lowest menne appoynted death gasyng stocke vnto worlde th angel men fooles christes sake ye wise christe wea e ye strong ye honorable despysed euen vnto time honger thryst naked buffe ed fystes haue certayne dwellyng place labour working owne handes reuiled yet blesse persecuted suffre euill spoken praie made filthines world ofscowring al thinges euen vnto daie yf lawfully raigne emong haue builded vpon good foundacion layed meane thynges thynke selues onelye miserable wrath god theyr ryches fame wysedome hathe broughte authoritye beare rule among v seameth hath christe called loweste apostle office bee punished suffre deathes doe whiche theyr mischeuouse deedes caste vnto wylde beastes exaumple people courte iudgemente whyther haue drawe prison knoweth trouble commen place wherein haue openly mocked onely gazyng stocke worlde whiche defyeth christe onely men worldly wyse also deuils themselfes whiche trouble delighted chaunge thynges tourned vpsidown contrarye foles christes sake despysed preached humbled hymselfe fastened crosse ye wyse men vpon co fidence christ proudely auaunce selfes lyke weake feble christes glorye humbled selfes ye lyke strong proude insolente despised wer rascalles ye noble honourable haue profyte payne trauayle al profite reward haue praye manye daungers trouble farre haue bene vntill daye bearyng great rule dooe coumpt themselfes chiefe apostle oftetymes lacke meate oftetymes drynke oftetymes clothyng muche lesse gote ghospell greate ryches yea oftetymes buffited far obteynyng honour whiche playne proufe extreme nede wander abrode hauing none appoynted dwellyng place house oure owne wherein suffre endure pouertye somewhat lesse griefe seen far poulyng pillyng manne gotte lyuyng handes seke worldelye prayse rather suche reuyle v blysse vnlanyes reproche oftetymes done vnto v oure side geue prayses far oppressing without complaint suffer cruel persecucion nede many wordes emong great renoume sake haue coumpted hytherto outcaste world moste vyle leaste set yf men doe woulde caste teeth trauayles ieopardies labour haue good cause quarell texte wryte thynges shame beloued sonnes warne thoughe ye haue ten thousand instructours christ yet haue ye many father christ iesu haue begotten thorow gospel wherfore desire folow folowe christ cause haue sent vnto timotheus whiche dere sonne faythfull lorde whiche shall put remembraunce way haue christ euen teache euery congregacions swell though woulde come nomore wyll come shortly god wyll wyll knowe wordes whiche swell power kingdome god wordes power wyll ye shall come vnto rodde el loue spyrite softnesse write nowe one youre vnkyndnes hateth make ashamed rather louyng father warne dearly beloued child owne profite myne yf onely hurte matter shoulde well goe forwarde would passe vpon myne owne losse would reioyce whose profite would sticke dye nowe syth perceiue ye new apostle become woorse godlye loue compelleth warne ieopardie coumpte mine owne ye corinthian maie despise good myne fatherly without fayning great difference betwene scholemaister father tyme cruell vnhurtefull age doth duety doe either rewardes sake feare eiuill father prouoked thorough naturall loue prouideth profite childre though ther beare loss damage though ye chaunce haue yea ten thousande scholemaisters surely ye shall fynde fewe father whye shoulde call selfe father chyldren sith fyrste menne preached gospell vnto syth throughe ye borne agayne vnto christe haue maner begoten mother hathe taken muche payne trauaile childe suffered trauailed make christianswherefore desire folowe folowe christe wherfore yf ye acknowledge father yf ye vnfayned child beseche mutuall loues sake folowe father liuing manner synce ye begoten v labour ye rather bee lyke v suche thynges wherof ye ate accused vnto whence came consider selfe surely ye learned yf poynte doctryne bee youre memorie forasmuche canne come selfe sende vnto timothee euen mine owne selfe sonne one groweth kynde goddes goodnes faythful childe fyrste learned christe swarueth tyme father steppe shal put remembraunce ordre life whiche bothe folowe teache example iesus christe vnto onely euery congregacion professeth christe one commen autour rewler muste menne haue one rewle lyuyng naturall childe doth duety feare payne gladlye hearte among whiche absente paste shame wantonly behaue selfes though would neuer returne shalbe deceyued wyll within whyle bee goddes grace tyme wyll haue tryall menne doe wyse auaunce selfe eloquence deedes strength ofthe kindome god wordes gospell standeth royall gorgiouse speache euerye manne maye bse heauenlye strengthe power declared sufferaunce trouble concorde ryghteousnesse wholle lyfe myracles shall come vnto wyll come deede take ye heede ye receyue reason woulde handes standeth make come eyther roughe one dredfull meeke one gentyll haue authorytie geuen vnto christ punishe rebellion vnrewlye rodde correccion rather hadde vse woulde wyshe gladlye youre manner suche lyke louyng mercifull meeke father may reioyce vnhurtefulnesse yf bee among smalle faultes maye easye fatherly correccyon amended v chapter texte goeth commen saying fornicacion among suche fornicacion named among gentyles one shoulde haue father wife ye swel haue rather sorowed whiche hath doue thys dede might put fro among verely absent body presente spirite haue determyned alreadye though present concerning hym hath done thys dede name lorde iesu christe ye gathered together spirite power lord iesus christ delyuer hym vnto satan destruccion fleshe spirite maye saued daye lorde iesus bvt better knowen canne bee denyed grenouse canne borne hanouse conuenient longer bee differred whome temple halowed god cleanes beseamed goeth comen tale shamfull rumour fornicacion suche fornicacion like reproche hath found among painims suche christe straungers whiche one among vseth father wyfe owne greate reproche slaundre christian religion thynke ye suche foule rummoure shoulde bee spreade abrode yet ye meane season thoughe greate infamye nothyng belonged vnto highlye please youre selfe throughe youre worldelye wysedome proude whome beseamed commen mournyng heauinesse declare ye earnestelye disproue filthie deede excludyng dooer suche outragiouse offence oute youre coumpanye three consideracions fyrste leste yf ye vse hym familiarely one owne coumpanye whiche hathe yet shewed hymselfe bee sorye hys offence ye myght seame fauer misdoers gayne leste suche outragious offence receued amonge growe finally entente doer suche mischefe yf ye auoyde companye one comen iudgement condemned shame repente hym selfe vntyll suche tyme perfite sygnes repentaunce bee well knowen mete bee receaued good people company shoulde ye haue done strayghte waye assone commen reporte knowen manne whose name yet cause rehearce suche abomination yf ben selfe presente among woulde haue done nowe absente albeit vtterlye absente withstanding bodye bee awaye yet autoritie spirite present absent therfore saye thoughe present gyue sentence whiche ye must folow comen assemblye resorte manye ye determine one man shoulde take suche autoritie vpon hym whiche assemblye must carnal desire come together haue eye nothinge glorye oure lorde iesus christ wherein wyll sayed onely spirituallye bee present shall also bee authoritie lorde iesus christe whose name ye shall come together whiche power shall make sentence effectuall whiche wythout regarde honestie hath outragiouslye dooen bee caste oute youre congregacion geuen ouer satan bee punished fleshe made ashamed mannes iudgement spirit soule saued iesus christe iudge whan shall iudge shall geue sentence onely vpon thynges manne vpon al world meane season expediente hym also preuente exacte rigorous iudgement god assuryng hymself better suffre temporal punist ement bee condemned euerlastyng tourmentes helle beseameth v rather deuise playster reformacion offendours punishmente vsyng oure selfes maye remaine bee amended kyll manne suppresse vice saue manne punishmente wherewith christian gentlenes oughte bee contented iewes maner stone man death christian parte cure heale suche matter hadde ye regarde moued commen ieopardie wyth commen reproche stylle auaunce selfes though ye well doen texte p youre reioysing good knowe ye litle leuen sowreth whole lumpe dowe pourge therfore olde leuen ye maye bee newe dowe ye swere breade christ oure passeouer offred vp v therefore let v kepe holy daye olde leuen nether leuen maliciousnesse wickednes swete breade purenes truthe greate difference betwixte reioycing worldely people reioycing christian menne glory reioyce sorte onely shame also ieopardouse put case ye wyll saye one hathe done amysse matter maketh whole congregacion ye litell leauen sauereth greate batche dowe maketh sower called leauen whiche remaineth whole lumpe whiche sorte made sower yf part olde lyfe continue remain agreyng simplicitie christe leauen whereof ye muste vtterly bee purged newe kynde lyfe ye maye come newe dowe whole batche parte olde malice mingled christe hath made free sinne must ye diligentelye endeuoure parte olde infeccion take place agayne defile puritie christian lyfe god loueth suche bee without leauen long synce figured law time hebrues passed ouer reade sea quite deliuered bondage egipte continuall remembraunce token benefite certayne tyme yeare commaunded yearlye sacrifice lambe one yeare olde seuen dayes eate swete bread without manner leauen euen dydde tyme prepared departe egypte meane season carryed furth pure flower lefte leauen egypcians anye coumpted woorthye eate pascall lambe onles haue space seuen dayes borne leauen yea saye greate offence tyme hebrue shoulde asmuche haue leauen founde house iewes shadowes haue trewe passeouer moste vnspotted lambe whiche iesus christe oure redempcion vilanous tyrannye syn death offred vppe vpon crosse neyther vayne offred vppe synce haue already escaped egypte meete hence foorth kepe holy feast continually reioycing prowdely auauncing oure selues vpon thynges sometime delited tyme vnder harde shamefull bondage saye leauen moses law leauen old maliciousnes hypocrisie swete bread without leauen say vnhurtefull manner playne pure without counterfaictyng texte wrote vnto pistle ye compaignie fornicatours ment al fornicatours world either couetous extorcioners either idolater must ye nedes haue gone world write vnto ye company together called brother fornicatour couetous worshipper image either tailer either dronkard extorcioner se ye eat haue doe iudge whiche without ye iudge within god shall iudge put awaie euill among lest ye deceaued poynt whereas bad auoyde co pany suche foule vnchastnes euyll spoken meane ye shoulde auoyde company vnchast liuers countreye keape coumpany none suche eyther couetousnesse extorcion euyl spoken one geuen idolatrye yf ye shoulde doe since euerye place suche ye myght surely compelled forsake greece yet also woulde
