wysheyf called brother bee fornicatoure might synce request done require require among christian men bee suche vice infected far square christian religion fornicacion couetousnes oridolatrie railyng drounkennes extorcion see ye farfurth auoyde mannes coumpany ye refuse eate drynke hym vntill suche tyme amende greately standeth hande congregation company pure without corrupcion strau gers sorte lyue litle forceth theyr sinfull lyfe doth neyther infect dishonour name christe suche suche among must ye suffre escape vnpunished offence opely knowe sufficient haue doe iudge also christe straungers belong v euerye man iudge controuler home house neyther thynketh perteine hym done man yf se thing done house thinketh belong whole houshold sufficient therfore christian iudge christian men suche christes professio straungers leaue iudgement god bee man suffre house mischieuous pestilente wretche thrust ye company autour suche myschiefe expedient belongeth honoure christes name shame hymselfe amende shalbe safe ieopardie infeccion suspicion doyng also menne shall perceiue christe approueth suche matiers whiche taught godly life put thesame practise haue taught expel dryue amog pestilent leauen sedicions stryfe suche horrible fornicacion vi chapter texte dare one hauyng busines another go lawe vnder wicked rather vnder saintes ye know saintes shall iudge world worlde shalbe iudged ye good inough iudge smal trifle knowe ye shal iudge angel much may iudge thinges pertayn lyfe ye haue iudgementes worldly matter take despysed congregacion make iudges say shame vtterly wyse man among one iudge betwene brother brother one brother goeth lawe another vnder vndelieuers besides faultes espie also amog dregges former life sauer leauen couetousnes nothyng belongeth iudge christian congregacio vnsemely thing christian men shoulde iudged suche christian fyrste meruaile anye christian finde harte strife money matter appeale iudge whiche maie worsse borne appeale rather vnto heathen iudge christian trowe ye geue righteous iudgement whose whole life profession vnrighteous se ye frowardnes doyng world whose vngodlines shal tyme come fayth godly life good people condemned shoulde thoughe vpryghte better geue sentence vpon good mennes mattiers determyne theyr accions yf ye wyth greate mattier bee putte truste lyfe whole worlde saye wycked people shall bee condemned thynke ye selfes vnmeete iudge small lyghte tryfles ye lighte worlde appoynted reproue erroures suche vngodlye howe canne bee doone bee darkenes enormity wel woorthye reprofe remoue ye accions bryng wicked iudges though eyther wyser ye though menne equitie ye knowe ye tyme come ye shal onely iudge menne geuen worlde also wicked angelles tyrannes worlde thynke greate matter among youre selfes finishe suche lowe quarelles thynges appertayning vse bodyly lyfe fayth shall condemne theyr incredulitie godly lyfe theyr vngodlines vnhurtefulnes shal condemne theyr vnclennes euen nowe condemneth yf ye bee good lyue christianlye forgette ye nowe honour makyng suche bee iudges suite al whose condenacion tyme come sentence shal geuen yet ye debatefull contencious desirous transitorye thynges whose contempte ye take vpon ye onelye dissencion suche sorte dissencion youre matter muste needes bee heard iudge rather bryng vyleste loweste youre congregacion ye speake would haue bee speake make ashamed youre braulyng suite among selfes heathen iudges yf ye bee ye take vpon bee moste vile among better among heathen coumpted chiefeste dooe ye greatlye despyse selfes among none wise lyght matter sitte iudgemente finishe strife betwyxte christian menne among reason brotherlye loue reason thynges commen conuenient agremente shoulde easily bee made nowe ye farre agremente one christian manne gooeth lawe christian manne whiche reprochful euen whiche christe straungers though suche rule man lawes hable geue iuste sentence ye hable thesame rule gospell marke howe many wayes ye offende herein texte fore vtterly faute among ye go lawe one another rather suffre ye wrong rather suffre ye selues haue harme nay ye yourselues wrog robbe brother ye knowe vnrighteous shal inherite kyngdom god disceaued neither fornicatours neyther worshyppers image neyther aduouterers neyther weakelynges neyther abuser themselues wyth mankynde neyther theues neyther couetouse neyther drounkardes neyther cursed speaker neytherpillers shall inherite kyngdome god fyrste shame ye among selfes apease suche smalle matter goe throughe without greate busines angling ye myght eyther geuyng place one another least ende matter arbytremente come suche stoubernes while nether geueth place thother geueth ouer thing another matter syghte people muste bee trauersed commen officer yf suche matter brought heard christian iudges without faulte iangle stryue law heathen iudges euen trifle howe foule sight thynke ye religion peace asmuche nowe christe planted made one bodye thereby become brother beside vnitie despising vile worldlye goodes whiche grosse people striue one another maketh v verye christian menne menne eagerlye stryue eche one wyth one christian manne ashamed call another lawe accuse hym beefore wicked iudge thynke ye iudge looke hereupon wyll thys wyse thynke wyth themselfe among christian shamefastenesse become brotherlye charitie peace somuche speake communitie possession theyr despisyng ryches myldenesse gospell commaunded euen gladly forgoe theyr coate also yf haue taken away theyr cloke behold shamefully smal matter thei striue wt v also among theselfes cometh ye corinthian ye yet somuch set money thesame ye haue greatly defamed christian name religion one wil answer say onles prosecute matter laboure righte sure take wrong onlesse recouer myne owne title shalbee losyng syde woulde aduyse take hede leste while ye feare small losse money ye appayre innocencie good name cause also gospell bee hindered better neuer winne youre goodes recouerye geue vn beleuers occasion mysreporte speake euil christ better passe vpon smal wrong while thou labourest thy right openlye declare thou haste mynde desirouse reuenge nowe truely farre ye lyke mylde christian men without reuenging suffre losse iniurye euen wilfully ye dooe wrong maliciouslye deceaue oppresse onely vnbeleiuers also religion brother sauer suche doinges leauen olde life square suche pointes far learnyng profession whosoeuer professeth christe professeth innocencie lyfe promised kyngdome heauen neyther sufficient bee dipped water yet bee graffed christe onlesse youre life bee agreable christes doctryne none purpose ye taken world planted body christ ende ye hencefurthe godlye lyfe bee lyke vnto christe youre heade knowe ye vnrighteousse liuers bee baptised neuer muche shall bee excluded inheritaunce kyngdome heauen leste anye manne deceaue hymselfe tell agayne agayne geue warnyng neyther fornicatours idolators aduouterers weakelinges whiche growyng mannes kynde lyue horrible kynde bodily luste suche steade woman abuse men theues couetous men dronkardes neither cursed speaker violente pillers mennes goodes shalbe partaker kyngdome god nothyng shall newe name title auayle life olde vice defiled yea christe rather occasion grieuous painfull damnacion texte suche ye washed ye sanctified ye iustified name lorde iesus spirite god maye thynges thynges profitable maye doe al thynges wyll brought vnder mannes power meates ordeined bellye belly meates god shall destroye let bodye applyed vnto fornicacion vnto lord lorde vnto bodye god hathe raysed vp lorde shall rayse v vp hys power suche haue nowe rehersed ye throughe christ borne agayne laye charge ye beefore ye fall nomore thereto washed ye deliuered youre olde synnes goddes free gyfte beeware ye bee nomore defiled wyth washyng hath god bloud restored innocente hurtlesse lyfe geuen also holinesse righteousnes power law youre desertes iesus christe whose name ye baptised spirite oure god whose secrete inspiracio sacrametes christes churche effectual much euery endeuour lest ye yourei maie thing al thinges profitable owne folye lose benefite frelye geuen vnto doyng neyther thankfull geuer yet frendelye louyng selfe suche thynges appertayne naturall necessity maye dooe thynges man forbyddeth vse lyke authoritie apostle vse paraduenture alwayes profitable vse ryght suche fedde liue wyth youre meate suche pyll polle beeyng euen bondslaues bought wyth moneye dare freely warne youre faultes leste ye vpon dyspleasure conceaued wyth bestowe liberalitie otherwyse myght also labour take rewarde namely since tooke paynes anye wanted authoritie dooe woulde dooe thyng whereby myghte bee brought vnder mane power subieccion seame bounde thyntente myghte clearely appeare bothe yf teache anye thyng therein seeke weale profite myne owne also yf dydde woordes anye thynge chastice ye shoulde pacientely heare thyng commenlye seene suche mannes free speache offendeth whiche nothyng bounde hym whome reproueth elles litell mattier maketh whose meate manne eate synce menne muste needes haue meate synce meates ordayned bealye likewyse bealyes meates lette euery manne tyme satisfye presente necessitye neede wythin shorte tyme wyll god destroye bothe bealye meate whiche neyther oure bealyes shall wyth houngre trouble v meates shall bee anye vse whiche haue professed christe muste obeye serue naturall lackes euen heathen vnchristened dooe shoulde yet betwene v vyce bee none agremente meates forbydde none lette euerye manne eare wyll butlet bodye bee applied vnto fornicacion filthye bodily luste forbydde lyke bealye appoynted meate soe bodye prepared carnall pleasure rather oure bodye consecrate vnto lorde iesu agayne coupled vnto v hath pleased hym v member hym heade hys spirituall misticall bodye shoulde bee made kyntte together knotte holdeth litell season deathe deede taketh awaye necessitie meates breaketh knotte wherewyth ioyned christe godde father raysed lorde iesus oure heade deathe wyll likewyse rayse vppe agayne v membres wyth hym rewarde v life euerlasting hable power dooe albeit thynke vnlykelye therefore oure soule shall immortall lyfe bee partaker onlesse presente tyme throughe godlye continuall meditacions haue hadde thesame lyfe delygente remembraunce bodye raysed agayne shall glorye haue parte onlesse thesame presente tyme haue beene free contagion synne foule syght yf member seame vnlyke heade whiche euery pointe pure cleane texte eyther konwe ye bodyes membres christe shall nowe take member christe make member harlot god forbid ye know whiche coupleth hymselfe harlot become one body two saieth shal bee one flesh ioyned vnto lord one spirite remembre ye tolde bodyes member christe sal nowe become mad notwithstandyng know much great reproche head take away membre christe make thereof membre harlote god forbidde yet elles dooth whiche conuersaunte harlote knowe ye playne poynte whiche coupleth hymselfe harlote becommeth one bodye reade genesis manne wyfe bothe shall one fleshe one bodye bee made lawefull matrimonye honeste godlye consente two myndes makethe one lawefull acte matrimonye betwixte two maketh one vnlawefull coumpainying together euery manne beecommeth wherwyth filthylye coupled greate enormitie therefore womanne deceauyng housebande aduouterer bee conuersaunte foule acte bodye whiche consecrate christe shoulde bee coupled vyle harlote whiche coupled vnto lorde iesu reason commen consente betwyxte head bodye hym made one spirite whiche forasmuche moste pure cleane fylthye fleashelye luste moste contrarye whiche manne taketh awaye vse reason alteryng hym brutishe beastelye condicion texte p fle fornicacion euery sinne manne doth withoute bodye fornicatour sinneth againste owne bodye either knowe ye howe youre body temple holy ghoste whiche dwelleth whome ye haue god howe ye youre owne ye derely bought therefore glorifie god body spirites whiche goddes dyligentelye therefore flee fornicacion synnes synfull persones wrought done albeeit haue theyr beginnyng body seame yet ioyned harme dyspleasure mannes bodye pollute seamethe whole manne suche committeth fornicacion doothe wrong vilanie owne bodye foule acte abuseth defileth adulterer defileth hores body except also defile withoute offence committed mannequeller swerde kylleth another without hurte body hurteth another man seameth one part polluted fornicacion defileth whole body eue comen sorte wel vnderstandeth suche acte thesame woone vse bathe therwith washe away filthines therby conceiued hainouse offece wrong hurt another man body mato bodye vilainouse reprocheful semeth apointe extreme madnes albeit fornicacion specially defile body yet thynke therfore offence smal eue body also haue honour forasmuch masio soule whiche immortal cleansed wt holy water baptisme suche sorte consecrate god beecommeth temple holye ghoste whiche ye baptisme receyued whereby ye ioyned vnto christe ye hym shall neuer bee soondred fornicacion owne reproche hurte nothyng moue yet lette moue suche actes canne bee one without greate iniurie christe ye whose bodye ye coupled ioyned hath deathe boughte made owne ye shoulde seruauntes owne men right title bodye bought byers hande thesame whoso eyther selleth handeleth otherwyse owner dothe wrong hym whome thesame bodye beelongethfor ye dearely boughte bee supposed christe litell boughte v oure redempcion spente moste precious bloude wherefore synce ye god wholye consecrated defile reproche hym youre body beare aboute aswell chaste body vnhurtefull myndes holye ghoste among menne auaunce glorie bothe keape chaste leste filthines sake among eiuil people christ whose name ye professe bee eyuill spoken nobilitee maisters belongeth euen seruauntes dishonestie seruauntes theyr maisters reprochfull wherefore albeeit god bee neyther prayse made glorious reproche defamed dede yet sorte naughtye seruauntes dishonoured godly maners holy life glorified while among commen sorte lyfe esteamed vii chapter texte concernyng thinges wherof ye wrote vnto good man touch woman neuerthelesse auoyde whordome let euerye man haue wife let euery woman haue husbande let husband geue vnto wyse due beneuolence likewyse also wyfe vnto husband wife hath power owne body husband likewise husbande hath power owne body wyfe withdrawe selues one another except consente tyme geue selues fastyng prayer afterwarde come gether agayne left satan tempte youre incontinencye saye fauoure commaundement woulde men selfe euery man hath proper gyfte god one thys maner another saye vnto vnmaryed wyddowes good yf abyde euen yf cannot absteyne let marye better mary burne vnto maryed commaunde lorde let wyfe seperated fro husbande separate selfe let remayn vnmaryed reconciled vnto husband agayne let husband put awaye hys wyfe hym haue muche sayed thinke euery acte generacion defileth bodye laboure bring mynde intente lyke hypocrite maye bee thoughte bee holye matrimonye certayne chaste lawefull vse vnlawefull acte muste generallye menne bee auoyded lawefull matrimonie muste euerye manne farfurth vse vse preferment gospell expediente wherefore touchyng question wherein letter ye aske myne aduyce shall briefly answere fyrste suche muste doe already maryed ought doe single widowes also muste doe whiche eyther paynefull vnequall matrimony troubled finally bee done virgin maried maried fyrste therefore many cause time requireth wer well doen men wholy cause absteyne theyr wyues maye freedome applye christes gospell godly lyfe albeit matrimonie holy thyng yet wrappeth man worldlye care wherein howe muche laboure bestowed somuche lesse god serued besyde vse matrimonye hath grosse thyng whiche tyme swaloweth vppe deuoureth whole man whiche beeyng restored hymselfe somewhat lesse man well see specially wished yet dare muche exacte would desire leste while ye vnluckely labour towarde beste occasion fall worse knowe howe vnruly violente fleashelye desyre aslet euery man haue owne wife sure howe ye specially among prone muche geuen vnto surer waye therefore thynke euery man haue owne wyfe euerye wife housebande mutuall seruice eche one maye remeadye others intemperancie albeeit elswise pointes housebandes authoritie yet herein haue bothe equal power neither housebad farfurth lorde maister owne bodye touchyng vse matrimonie defraude wyfe thereof geue another right wyues bodye agayne concerninge vse matrimonie sorte owne maye denye husband vse therof geue another hyr bodye husbandes ryghte debte eche towardes lyke tyme requireth must party delyuered payed haue made promise let housebande geue law mariage bounden geue wife wife likewyse geue housebande lawe wedlocke bounde geue eche one lyke sorte bounde poyntes paraduenture whole gouernaunce autoritye housebandes handes denye right yf eyther bothe aske defraudyng onelye suche defraude whiche paye money bounde paye suche also refuse doe bound doe let neither therfore loue chastitye defraude excepte bee consente bothe towythdrawe selfes one fro another excepte consent time absteine season ye maye cleane myndes geue selfes fasting holye prayer remembraunce heauenlye thinges whose perfeite freashnes suche carnall conuersacion greatly woonte make dulle let either bothe therefore neither absteyne comen consente vpon euerye flyght occasion loue heauenlye thynges long neither certayne tyme returne agayne olde custome thinke beste lyue continuall prayer knowe ieopardy leste satan styll lieth watche destroye perceauyng toward disposicion incontinencie occasion thereof prouoke worse rather haue whiche lesse perfeccion bee ieoperdlesse whiche muche commendable beeyng yet suche ioyned small perill yet speake woulde either compell man marie forbyd man lyue continually chaste able mutuall co sente matrimonie prouyde vpon knowledge haue youre weakenes remeadye agaynste perilles yf yf might woulde wyshe men selfe whiche free bonde matrimonye el vsed theyr wyues theyr sister lyuyng purenes chastitie dare exacte thyng whiche christe neuer required disciple hearer blessed saith loue kingdom god haue made themselues chaste yet refuseth suche chastlye soberly liue vnder lawe matrimonie continuall chastitie taken vpon anye man auauncement christes affayres highe thing lawfull matrimonie honeste state whose chiefe ordeyner halower waseuery man hathe proper gift god god hymselfe betwene bodyes soules meruaylous great difference goddes gyftes euerye manne lyke peraduenture thyng aboue mannes power wholye abstayne acte matrimonie blessed whome god hath gyuen suche strength god people hath loued varietie gyftes shoulde excelle whiche varietie shoulde wonderfullye make towarde swete armonie comlynes whole lette manne therfore reproue another mannes state sorye owne let euerye manne accordyng power godlye vse gyfte whiche god hath geuen hym chaste wedlocke vnchaste virginitie haue ye counsel touchyng marying kepyng youre wyues nowe vnderstande mynde lykewyse touchyng youre question seconde mariages among heare whiche albeit denye ye fredome maye marrye yet one deathe made free woulde haue marrye agayne doubtes thinke yf manne reason death wyfe become single yf anye womanne reason husbandes death wydowe well doen able thencefurth lyue chaste yf neither seeke wyfe another husbande bothe dedicate theyr freedome vnto goddes seruice haue myne owne parte chosen whiche thoughte beste nothing shoulde lette preachyng god worde whiche hartely fauoure loue thereof litle set suche pleasure marriage nowe yf knewe menne thesame mynde woulde lette call exhorte euery manne doe doe synce disposicions mennes myndes bodyes vnlyke vnmeete gyue menne one kynde counsell rather lette euerye manneif cannot abstayne lette marry better marry burne weyghe owne strengthe folowe kynde lyfe whereunto nature thynketh hymselfe moost meete lette suche one vpon profe matrimonie feeleth hymselfe vnable resiste violente burnyng assaultes fleshe rather marrye agayne lawfull matrimonie maye remedye vnchastnes lyuyng syngle vehemente desyre fleshe ieopardie grieuouse offence neither compel men marie yet forbyd mariage leaue euery man fredome weyghe hymselfe expediente nothyng haue herein prescribe vnto taught vnto lorde require commaunded iesus christe suche vnmaried stande free saye either marie marye iudge best theyr doinges haue iye nothing christes glorye man maried would haue done whiche among iewes gentile commonlye seene forlet wyfe seperated fro husbad euerie small matier diuorce made god hathe forbydden menne small offence refuse theyr wyues notwithstandyng moses poynte fauourably bare iewes thought good doe fearyng leste iewes beyng stubberne kynde people readye mischiefe vpon deniall diuorces mighte happelye doe suche thynges muche wurse anye diuorce one cause lorde hymselfe excepted yf wyfe another commyt aduoutrie whiche thyng doeth either fallen righte wedlocke whiche promisyng bodye one manne onelye hathe neuertheles departed vnto another el semeth vnreasonable thyng constrayne manne haue one house one bedde one fyer one table common whiche falselye breakyng promyse made mariage whiche nothing holy hath foule aduouterer abused bodye strong stedfaste woulde christe haue felowshyppe bee vnlesse therfore anye suche thyng chaunce let neither wyfe departe husbande husbande thruste wyfe hym yf displeasure debate aryse meane whereof wyfe chaunceth departe husbande leste throughe owne folye stande without hope reconcilyng lette abyde vnmaried yf continewe vntouched vndefiled paraduenture husbande beeyng better moode wyll contente receyue agayne corrupte womanne wyll receyue nowe yf womanne cannot long refrayne selfe let diligentlye labour wynne husbandes fauoure agayne yf husbande cannot obtayne somuche lette assure whome soeuer couple herselfe thesame knotte maye happely named mariage dede aduoutcie texte p remnaunt speake lorde brother haue wyfe beleueth content dwell hym let hym put away woman hath husbande infidell consent dwell let put away vnbeleuyng husband sainctifyed wyfe vnbeleuyng wyfe sancfied husbande el chyldren vncleane holye yf vnbeleuyng departe let hym departe brother syster subieccion suche god hath called v peace knowest thou woman whether thou shalt saue thy husbande knowest thou man whether thou shalt saue thy wyfe euen god hath distributed euery man nowe touching question vnequall mariage lordes authoritie nothing haue aunswere yet haue thing myne opinion would counsel folowe waye profitable odiouse acte diuorce would haue matrimony broken diuersitie religion chaunce christian woman maried husbande yet christened husbande albeit straunger misteries christe yet hatefull religion sake refuse yf wyfe wyll folowe counsell shal forsake likewise agayne yf chauce husbande beeyng christian man haue wyfe suche one christe straunger synce vnmete man compelled take religion vpon hym vpon displeasure husbandes co trarie religio seke diuorced councell husband shall put awaye cause none christian man christian woman feare leste familiar conuersacio one vnchristened eyther myght defiled withstanding one religion vncleane yet mariage whereby beyng elswise inequall coupled together good lawfull mariage wyckednes wurse infecteth godlines better rather better effectuall greater weight infor vnbeleu ng husband sanctified wyfe c behalfe husband therfore albeit heathen yet touchyng acte matrimony companye christian woman made holy likewise wife whiche hath yet professed christe conuersacion christian husbande touchyng lawfull vse matrimony made good holy yf theyr child borne incestuously vnlawfull meanes coumpted prophane vncleane pure cleane child borne lawfull wedlocke well knowen true wyfe whiche baptised hath vnchristened husband doe doyng obeyeth husband heathen suffereth wycked beareth hym trusteth wyll amende hope maye manne conceyue hym whiche although yet professe christe yet wyfe abhorreth honouryng god throughly heathen rather partly christian mane whiche quietly lyueth wyfe professeth christes name canne paciently bee contented see signe crosse ouer theyr common bedde party doe continewe together suche diuersitie religion deuided vpon hope therfore ought woman whiche fyrste embraced christe abyde husbande yf diuorce growe syde whiche yet beleueth thesame manne hate christes name refuse wyfe syncebut yf vnbeleuing depart let hym departe chaunge hope cause hathe wyfe lyue hym longer loste hathe ryght tytle matrimonie whiche despiseth god authour therof doeth promyse made mariage farfothe bynde christened shall euer bee compelled suffre wycked husbande brawlyng cursyng name christe let therfore vse lybertie diuorce geuen vnto god thencefurth serue christe quietly therfore called god lyfe ghospell lyue sedicion chyding lyue peace concorde therfore yf suche betwene whome vnequall mariage agree vnfaythfull require diuorced let christian wyfe abyde husbande yf agree hope husbande amende let wyfe continewe lykewyse let husbande continewe wyfe hope chaunged howe knowest thou art wyfe whether thou shalt familiar communicacion sobre gentle behauiour wy ely loue cause thy husbande amende saued canst thou know art husbande whether thou shalt lyke wayes saue thy wyfe wynne christe yf eyther bothe doe great gayne yf come passe yet wyll god approue thy good wyll whiche intendest suche thing meane season whyles vncertayne whether wyll let matrimonie vpon good hope continewe holde let diuersitie religion chaunge state lyfe neyther doeth baptisme delyuer wyfe ryght husbande yf vse lawfully yet seruaunte dominion maister yf vse hym ryght reason would texte lorde hath called euery man let walke ordeyne congregacions man called beyng circumcised let hym adde vncircumcision called vncircumcised let circumcised circumcision nothyng vncircumcsyon nothyng keping commaundementes god let euery man abyde callyng wherin called art thou called seruaunt care neuerthelesse yf thou mayest fre vse rather called lorde beyng seruaunt lordes freman lykewyse called beyng fre christes seruaunt ye dearly bought ye seruauntes men brother let euery manne wherin called therin abyde god lorde hath geuen euery man thesame let hym serue christe state lyuing tyme preachyng ghospell manne founde let hym thesame continewe newe religion abolysheth olde lyfe destroyeth olde state lyfe christian religion agreeth standeth euery condicion lyfe geuen god trouble ciuile policie worlde entente euery degree state lyfe euery manne myght lyue therin godly deuoutly councell whiche onely teache also congregacions shall paynfull folowe whiche euery manne foloweth wherfore yf inspiracion god holy spirite calleth fynde maryed breake therefore thy matrimony fynde circumcised without cause art thou thou shouldest loth thy condicion seke bee vncircumcised nothyng eyther furdereth hyndereth vncircumcision newe religion againe yf thesame fynde vncircumcised cause haste thou wyshe circumcised touching newe religion lytle force maketh whether thou circumcised vncircumcised sortes egally belongeth eche lyue henceforth commaudementes god whose rule haue professed carnal desyres moue sufficient chaunge thy old euil maners chaunge condicio thy lyfe nothing neadeth suche thing cannot done without disquietnes trouble haue sayed ye shoulde doe called god state matrimonie state circumcision euen lyke wyse muste ye iudge state bondage suche preaching receuyng gospell bonde let bee content theyr fortune thinke themselues delyueryd theyr maisters dominion delyuered tyranny syn agayn fre man whiche called christian religion hath cause chaunge state become bonde rather let euery man endeuoure yf occasion serue embrace lyberty chaunge hys bondage yf maister displeasure borne christes name reiecte seruaunt let seke newe maister yet displeasure wt selfe maisterles synce hath christe maister whose free seruaunt bee come bonde man syde borne fre borne agayne baptisme let hym state neither bee angrie pleassed hym selfe synce baptisme become bonde seruaunt christ sondrye sortes bondman made fre fremanne made bonde thentent eche shoulde sobrietie beare theyr fortune fredome bondage thinges wherof christe hath maner regarde embrace better yf thou bondage oppressed thinke albeit thy maister hath vpon thy bodie certayne power authority yet thy soule delyuered synne christe warde fre yf thy fredom thyng make prowde remember thou bought christe bought smalle price thou haste maister feare honoure beware thou phantasie thou art fre mayst lyue thy pleasure anye man bonde farfurthe christe made fre yf hys maister commaunde hym doe vngodly seruice rather bounde gyue eare christe hys newe lorde maister hys olde whiche reason abuse hath loste tytle yet reason suche asye derely boughte ye seruauntes men christe price bloud hath made fre shoulde greuouse maister oppressed fauer lybertie yf maye christes seruice perfite libertie christian manne shoulde serue heathen semeth vnmete thinge reason suche christian maister seruauntes shoulde bee fauoured brother chyldren bothe haue one comon maister whome bothe one price redeamed yet leste vnder coloure christian religion state comon weale bee disquieted let euery manne suffer hys condicyon therein abyde abyde meane season remember goddes commaudementes muste bee set commaundementes menne obey youre maisters yet god therwith pleased whiche payed suche poyntes haue taught freedome bondage haue also place state matrimonie single lyfe vnder lawe matrimonie sorte bound single fre state lyfe therfore menne muste alwaye folowe whiche commodiouse maye yf maye saye maye desyre libertie loue therof fall greater ieopardie concernyng virgin haue commaundement lorde yet geue counsell one hath obtayned mercye lorde faythful suppose therfore good present necessyte good man art thou bounde vnto wy e seke loosed art thou loosed wyfe seke wyfe thou marye wyfe thou hast synned lykewise yf virgin mary hath synned neuerthelesse shal haue trouble theyr fleshe fauoure thys saye brethre tyme shorte remayneth haue wiues though thei none wepe though wept reioyce bee though reioyced bye though possessed vse world though vsed fashyon worlde goeth awaye would haue without care vnmaryed careth thynges belong lorde may please lorde hath maried wyfe careth thinges worlde e maye please hys wyfe difference betwene virgin wyfe single woman careth thinges lord maye holy body also spirite agayne maryed careth thynges pertain worlde may please husbande thys speake youre profyt tangle share ye may folow honest comely ye maye cleaue vnto lorde without separacyon man thinke vncomly hys virgin yf passethe tyme mariage yf nede requyre let hym lysteth synneth let coupled mariage neuerthelesse purposeth surely hys herte hauyng nede hathe power ouer owne wyll hath decreed hys hert wyll kepe hys virgyn doeth well ioyneth hys virgin mariage doeth well ioyneth hys virgyn mariage doeth better wyfe bounde mariage longe husbande lyueth husbande dye libertie marye whome wyll onely lorde happyer yf abyde iudgement thynke verely haue spirite god therfore touching question ye aske whether christian men ought marie daughter beyng virgin kepe home perpetuall virginitie halowed vnto christe maye fredome doe hym seruice albeit herin haue commaundement god certainly aunswere yet haue counselle gyue suche thinke best thinke ye disdayne counsell synce haue apostle authoritie whome also god goodnes hath gyuen albeit vnworthy euen wyll pleasure gyue holsome faithfull cousel regarding self profitable nedeful expedient liberty sake iudge thing bee wyshed virgyn bynde selfe none christ thinke matrimonie honeste holy kinde lyfe partly alyance partlie care bringyng vp chyldren state full trouble carefulnes necessitie bondage escapeth abstayneth mariage better therfore embrace thys libertie yf eyther thy power ieopardles suche already vnder bonde matrimonye theyr power suche lyue chaste withoute daungier therfore yf thow alreadie bounde wife seeke vnder pretence christe bee diuorced yf thou bee free seke yoke matrimonye yf thou haue maried vpon mistruste thy strengthe repent therof thou haste doinge synned thou haste dede taken vpon carefull enterprise yet suche lawfull shalt thou therfore christe warde wurse thou haste wyfe thou shalt trouble morelykewyse virgine marrye hathe synned worldly care lykewyse yf virgine haue rather mary gouerne housholde none offence yf doe damage none reason housholde busines lesse fredome studie scripture pray exercise godly matter while therfore geue wayes free lybertie fauer two maner wayes prouidyng lybertie whiche lyue without wedlocke remedie also ieopardie cannot lyue without commende single lyfe state commodiouse approue matrimonie also hauyng lesse ieopardie therfore herein euery manne doeth lette eche hymselfe take hede neyther constrayne forbydde manne namely suche poyntes god neyther required yet forbade require brother generally synce tyme shorte forasmuche laste daye draweth nygh ye vttermoste power make haste obtayne suche thynges prepare agaynste daye castyng awaye suche impedimentes myght lette hastie iourney thytherwarde vncertayne daye shallbe certayne farre daye whoso hath continuall remembraunce draweth nere shall frayle transitorie thynges lytle delyghted whether chaunce vnto hym eyther payne pleasure laste daye shall v take awaye bothe ye death also shall dispatche bothe come daye ende bee suche thynges much troubled reioyce shall within shorte space peryshe heauenly matter hande let haue wyues let without regarde though none shal bondage matrimonie lesse trouble pleasure wedlocke lesse delyght let suche aduersities oppressed wepe though wepte suche haue worldely welthe reioyce though thei reioyced let bye bye thoughe thei possessed thing bought beyng suche shall shortly taken awaye whether thou wylt goe eyther chaunce necessitie entangled wyth worldely busynesse let vse thesame though vsed yf heauenly matter cannot onely bee regarded yet let regarded chiefly fyrst al next worldly affaire nothing hath world euen shadowes good thynges badde wherein nothyng eyther sounde stable whereunto bee muche geuen purpose suche laboure lyfe immortall thynges speake thereforei would haue without care would haue troubled lytle might worldly matter folowe kinde life wherin ye like leaste worldly busynesse behalfe better state single maried single troubled diuerse care nether please father law please mother lawe aliaunce howe contente wyfe child howe prouide necessary housholde dayly encreasing yet howe worthe wyues dowrye holy geueth himselfe christe thinkyng hath al desyre yf onely please hym othersyde albeit whiche maried partly serue god yet seruice oweth wyfe suche thinges apertayne matrimonie lykewyse woman forasmuche wholy owne libertie cannot wholy serue christe reason diuersly troubled partely serueth christe partely housbande virgin single woman hath care el please christe spouse canne none otherwyse please chaste lyuyng without corrupcion bodye onely also mynde maried woman muste nedes betwixte christe husbande deuyde herselfe suche sorte endeuouringe please christe yet displease husbande whome oweth obedience nowe ende haue sayd wherin somuche prayse single life leste man mistake take youthis speake profite tangle snare libertie marie marye necessitie compelle anye kinde lyfe ye cannot phantasie frendly counsell tender weale ye knowe ye maye frely ether ye incline thytherwarde chose rather whiche hath onlye honestie also therwith libertie annexed wherby shall lawfull single person suche sorte wholy obedience loue gyue hym selfe lorde iesus christ wordly trouble care shalbe able time withdraw thesame let euery man vprightly weigh himselfe whether waye whiche seeth honorable free thinke ieopardles disposed vnto feareth leste fall reproch infamie yf ouer long kepe daughter virgine home already mariage able mynded thesame matter selfe requireth lesse good leaue geue doe shal thinke expedient done albeit sayed matrimony haue bondage care adioyned yet without sinne honest lawfull also necessary let therfore father syght worlde season prouyde daughter husbande leste stelth doe shamfully done matrimonie standeth honestie yf father seeyng hymselfe stande full freedom mary daughter mary compelled eyther partes necessitie purposed surely harte decreed kepe virgin styll asmuche desyrouse maried doth well ieopardles stay lette one mariage desyrous godly discourage maydens mynde loue godly desyre chastitie therfore whiche feare peryllhe ioyneth virgine mariage doeth well marieth daughter beyng desyrouse mariage doeth well moueth maydens minde mariage whiche desyrouse lyue continually chaste glad please godly desyre mayden doeth better besyde honestie profession also shall virgine gayne shall haue leysure wholy without intermission serue spouse christe intent purpose none seke lybertie single lyfe syght god comendable thyng state matrimony bestowe god seruice muche tyme lefte necessarie busynesse done abuse pretence virginitie ryote idlenes licencious lyuyng farre therfore restrayning virgines theyr fyrst mariage wheras worlde lytle estemeth seconde mariage let euen wydowes marry euery profitable belongeth particularly prescribe apoynte herein let euery man hymselfe take aduise may doen without offence declare virgine may lawfully marry free maryed woman lyke freedome may doe hath bounde selfe vnto husbande bonde matrimonie duryng tyme lyfe bonde nothyng broken onely death whosoeuer maryeth purpose maryeth knotte made mariage broken yf husbande dye wyfe free agayne yf mynde marry agayne may marry wyll christian maryage saye neyther desyred filthy pleasure sake contracte one religion yet graunt synneth whiche maryeth agayne iudge muche happy whiche desyre godly life standeth abydeth lybertie restored commaunde necessarie folowed councell thyng commodiouse nowe heare councell man yet well agreing wyth wyll christe whiche owne mouthe teacheth many thynges muche also seruauntes synce apostle haue verely thinke receyued spirite apostle haue councell small weyght authoritie p viii chapter texte touchynge thynges offred vnto ymages sure haue knowledge knowledge maketh man swell loue edifyeth man thynke knoweth thynge knoweth nothynge yet ought knowe yf man loue god knowen hym concerning eating thinges offred vnto ydols sure image nothing worlde none god one though called god whether heauen erath goddes many lordes many yet vnto v one god father thynges hym one lorde iesus christe whome thynges hym touchyng question concernyng matrimonie thynke ye sufficiently aunswered vnto ye shall hencefurthe vpon suche matter soundry opinion eche one nomore striue know ye doubt whether lawfull christian manne eate flesh beast offered vnto idolles whiche fleshe painyms take holy question also mynde among know idole nothyng eyther tymber brasse stone therfore fleshe vnto offered dede nothyng differeth fleshe mannes conscience canne kynde meate bee defiled abusyng theyr knowledge euery place without consideracion engorge pamper vppe themselues flesh offered idolles iudgyng mysse matter dede yet forgettyng lawe charitie whiche geueth maunne occasion mysse thynkyng slaundre confourmeth herselfe suche weake vntyll lytle lytle growe vppe knowledge greate matter yf vnderstande image hath godly power christian manne vnderstandeth whiche euen painyms vnderstande yf bee thyng wyser commen sorte yet better oftetymes foloweknowledge maketh man swell loue edifieth rule charitie rule knowledge knowledge doeth oftetymes hurte beyng suche thyng maketh manne swell bee disdaynfull endeuer charitie tyme place doe good hurte manne albeit dede suche seme lacke great parte knowledge also whiche knowe howe vse theyr knowledge poynte teacheth charitie whiche measureth iudgeth thinges weale neyghbour therfore thinges doeth seme perfitly learned must call charitie councell without charitie swelleth vayne persuasion learned far knowledge come far knowe howe vse knowledge godwarde wyse thesame man wyse man dede pleaseth hymselfe seketh owne glory without regarde brother ieopardie learning god alloweth vnfaynedly loueth god must also loue neighbour one therfore god acknowledgeth owne disciple god humbled hygh godhead saue mankynde doeth suche one submitte knowledge compell serue commoditie neyghbour returne therfore purposed matter knowe maner albeit gentyles wurshyp idoles though diuine power godheadwe sure image nothyng yet idole dede nothing el either piece tymber stone hathe nomore godhead vnsquared piece tymber vnwrought stone therfore fleshe offered nomore goodnes hurte suche solde shamble ye see stone wrought vnto image man beast since one god hath none image cannot couterfaited el represent idol deuils miserable people offer vnto stede god men therfore defiled suche meates whiche receyue holy whereas bee vnholye prophane christian suche fleshe defileth whiche eate holye vse creature made god apease hunger vse sustenaunce deuocion hymself laughing folyshe rable heathen goddes beeyng fullye perswaded god one whome thynges holye albeit whiche called goddes whether bee heauen whome call heauenlye el earth whome call goddes earthlye whiche sorte manye goddes many lordes yet name onely god lordes onely suche erroniously beleue haue taken theyr goddes lordes v christian onely one god saye father iesus creatoure gouernour worlde whome receyue goodnes whome onely beyng addicte ought serue al honour reuerence haue also one lorde iesus christe whome onely father hath geuen v thynges throughe whose onelye benefite confesse true god false cursed heathen goddes haue nothyng whiche shoulde nomore estemed yf none suche dede whosoeuer therfore christian strength nothyng passeth vpon ydole vpon whiche offered surely iudgeth well mighte without gilte eate fleshe offered vnto aswell meate euery manne perswaded knewe trueth true dede woulde man offended texte euery man hath knowledge hauyng conscience ymage vntyll houre eate thyng offered vnto ymages theyr conscience beyng weake defiled meate maketh acceptable god neither yf eate better neyther yf eate worse take hede leste meanes libertie occasion fallyng weake yf man se whiche haste knowledge syt eate meate offred vnto ymages shal conscience whiche weake boldened eate thynges whiche fered ymages thorowe thy knowledge shall weake brother peryshe christ dyed ye synne agaynst brother wounde theyr weake conscience ye synne agaynste christ wherfore yf meate hurte brother wyll neuer eate fleshe leste shoulde offende brother nowe sytte feaste whiche lawes theyr elder euen theyr chyldehode perswaded throughlye grounded ydoll holy thyng thynke many sitte one feaste lyke supersticion broughte mynde suche thynges shoulde greatly despised whiche haue suche great reuerence wyll take thyng thou doest vpon right iudgement conscience wyse reasonyng themselues synce christian menne somuche abhorre sacrifice lykely wurshippyng ydolles deuilishe thing make sitteth standeth also paraduenture christian man whiche albeit hath professed christ yet strength fayth become perfite reason infeccion olde lyfe receyued elder long common custome weake feble without grudge mynde eate fleshe offered ydolles thyng trustyng fearyng leste deuyll whatsoeuer bee maye meane either hym good harme maruayle yf chaunce grecian synce se manye christened iewes entangled matier great difficultie vtterly roote plucke mennes myndes whiche therein euen youthe common vse long custome bredde engendred man sodenlye becommeth perfite christian nature processe religion certayne degree therfore age stronger euen course nature suffer nouryshe weaker accordyng christe gaue exaumple ought suche faythe stronger sometymes please beare weaker vntyll continuaunce tyme growe strong daye among iewes christened bee whiche reason theyr olde long continued religion canne despyse suche thynges notwithstandyng holye prophetes playnely prophecied shoulde bee christe hymselfe commaunded thesame fyrste publishyng ghospell yea daye bee whiche albeit confesse christe yet quite oute feare theyr auncetours religion eate fleshe offered sacrifice ydolles foode necessarie satisfie hungrie stomacke holy thinges vowed deuyll deuill suche one seeth thee whome thinketh learnyng iudgemente passe common sorte sytte table paynim suche offered meates supposyng thou eateste euen lyke mynde conscience doeth thesame manne throughe thyne exaumple hurte foloweth thy dede amisse whose mynde conscience knoweth thus whiche staggered litle somewhat supersticiouse throughe occasion become supersticiouse speake allowe either supersticion suspicyon christian charitie teacheth suche infirmity shoulde bee praysed nouryshed shoulde rather tyme place bee borne suffered thinke conuenient alwayes geue place desyres suche weake el styl without ende nourishe supersticion suche sorte please weake thou forsake thyne owne strength suche one weake muste taught warned reproued whiche reason weaker shoulde gyue eare vnto folowe stronger yet conscience iudgeth condemneth hym better beseemed folowing others exaumple encrease strengthe faythe rather strengtheneth disease mynde behoued hym laboure lyke perfeccion constrayneth stronge gyue place weakenes case manne bee yet able take instruccions counsell christian charitie wylleth stronger whyle beare weaker beeyng yet suche one wyl amende chiefelye suche matier wherein two poyntes speciallye bee weyghed fyrste supersticiouse mynde conceyued childehoode long custome tyme established suche thyng canne scarcely bee shaken also ieopardie bee feared ieopardye ydolatrie mater weaker wil another place intreate meane season among see men often offende side endeuoure muste rather suppresse thys arrogante proude knowledgemeate maketh v acceptable god without charitie allow thy saying meate maketh v acceptable god since god mannes vse made thinges v requireth nothing godly life matier hym whether eate fishe beastes wyldefoule none eyther encreaseth abateth godlines difference obserued may make manne supersticyouse godly maketh none since christ himselfe taughte men obserue among suche difference light poynt therfore rashe miserable man goe charge v suche constitucions let rather euery man accordyng state hys body eate hym lyste doone sparelye soberlye thynges geuyng thankes god neyther condemnynge manne eateth thyne hearte proude preseruyng thy bodylye healthe thou forbearest meates thynges paraduenture soe greate ieopardie herein presete ieopardie regarde muste suche weaker whether thou eate suche meates offered vp idoles nothing shall thou better yf thou eate shalte thou anye poynte worse yet meane season must euery man ware leste vsing suche libertie eate meates ye geue weake occasion ruine stoumblyng muste nedes bee one yet supersticiouse see whiche arte coumpted learning iudgemente passe eate like meates dooe haue sacrificed idole albeit conscience dooe yet apparence lyke shall mannes conscience saye beeyng something ready fall olde supersticion thyne exaumple mayntayned prouoked idolatrie moued euyll conscience eate suche meates thy selfe vsest good strong faithe ioyned vpright conscience matter maketh thought thou wilt saye certaynely herein thys ieoperdie leste occasyon thy strength thy weake brother peryshe whiche although bee neuer weake yet thy brother say christian man christe hymselfe farfurth despised deliueraunce vouchsalued dye christ weake vsed lyfe thyng litle woorth regardest thou thy brother weale litle litle sorye meates sake thou wilte despyse hys peryll ieoperdie namely thou lackest wherwith without danger thy brother thou maist prouide thy bealies nede ye thinke smal offence trespace man whe often sorte ye offend weake person suspicious example woundyng theyr weake conscience ye must vnderstand also ye offend displease christ neuer muche younglynges neuer weake yet doeth christ acknowledge member thinketh himselfe offended soeuer done taketh done vnto hymselfe causelesse often tymes bade v beware offendyng weake mannewherfore meate hurte brother c better knoweth meates parte goodlynes vngodlinesse yet perceyue thys ieopardye nygh occasion therof brother yet somewhat geuen supersticion myght prouoked eate thinges eateth grudging conscience would rather life wholly abstayn eating fleshe christes owne meber ieoperdy meate offered vnto idol defileth coscience strong eateth graunte despysyng brother ieoperdie defileth eateth bounde aswel loue oure selues p ix chapter texte apostle fre haue seene iesus christ lorde ye woorke lorde bee apostle vnto yet vnto seale myne apostleship ye lorde myne aunswere aske haue power eate drinke haue power leade sister wife well apostle brother lorde cephas either onely barnabas haue power goeth warrefare tyme hys coste planteth vineyarde eateth fruicte thereof fedeth flocke eateth milke flocke cause therfore hath man complayne say restrained libertie may alway onely consider may lawfully done also profitable straight doe al may defended rather doe christian charitie requireth whiche seketh much pleasure commodity men many thinges haue bene wherein mighte haue vsed myne autoritie charitie otherwise moued staied lacke knowledge well vnderstode might doe regarded profitable many thinges wel wist made litle godly life al apeace would haue christ withdrawen many thynges dyd whiche myght haue done profite moued wyse shoulde apostle wel title auaunce themself christes commaundement sent preache vnto gentile bee apostle well haue lesse apostolique autoritie powerhaue seene iesus christ lorde geuen see lorde iesus christe man thinke great matier se resurreccion apostle estemed theyr famous actes lacke find herein apostolique act bring corinthe wholy geue worldly desire christes gospell hys dominyon thys acte haue god helpe brought passe whether apostle iewes let iudge labour mingle moses christe together least wi e yet vnto apostle preaching beleued christ sawe mightie power god assist strengthen woorde yf men therfore loke actes ye say workemanship albeit dede prayse act ought geuen vnto christ ye testimoniall seale whereby nede able declare glory christ committed apostle office aunswere aske proue apostle yf haue among done asmuch hath chiefe apostle bene done place amog well apostle nowe mine authoritie greate apostle yf haue doone asmuche good haue let lyke estate auctoritye synce haue laboured asmuche haue paraduenture whye shoulde rewarde bee equalle theim wee onlye amonge restrained libertie eate drinke costes whome preached gospel v onely vnlawful leade v christian matrones helpe v necessary thys life expedient apostle say meane sort euen chiefe apostle brother lorde say iames iohn yea cephas also whiche among apostle princypall estimacyon barnabas therfore onely without lyke autoritie liue reste preache gospel men costes doe dooe farre hunting rich preachyng gospel gift toke muche simple course liuing might haue one lawfully time goeth warfare cost planteth vineyard eate parte fruite vineyard fedeth flocke meane season eateth nothing milke flocke euery labor charge borne worke done texte say thinges maner men saieth lawe thesame also written law moses thou shalt mousel mouth xe treadeth corne doeth god take thought ox saith altogether sake sake doubt written eareth care hope thressheth hope shoulde partaker hys hope sowe vnto spirituall thinges great thing reape bodely thinges partaker power ouer wherfore rather haue nothing proue wt onely natural reason confirmeth wholy law god euen thing law nature speketh yes surely moses lawe forbiddeth saying thou shalt mousel ox mouth lead treade corne al vniust thence haue foode wherin creature laboreth maketh apostle say thinke ye likely god lawe onely made prouision ox rather deper meaning belongeth v farre god defrauding laborer liuing would asmuch ox defrauded therof wherfore sentence much written oxen sake teache whosoeuer laboureth painful laborious tillage field lord depriued hope rewarde whoso floore lord treadeth corne beside hope rewarde euerlastyng shoulde also reward worldly nede ease labour thinke great mater geue thinges make life euerlasting receiue giftes apparteine bodely nede transitorye life sow vpon spirituall giftes handes receiue carnal comodities cause one vpb aide man benefites moste precious treasour geueth vy e trifle neither endebted vnto receiue necessary ye offer v vnthankefull denie vnto liuing labor trauil weal haue among vsed autoritie apostle pronounce nothing vse stil much lawfully might doe first among al haue weale taken paine texte u rthelesse haue vsed power suffer thinges lest inder gospel christ doe ye know minister holy thinges liue sacrifice whiche waite temple partaker temple euen also lorde ordain whiche preache gospell liue gospell haue vsed none thinges neuerthelesse wrote doen vnto better die man take reioysing preache gospell haue nothyng reioyce necessitye put vnto wo vnto preache gospel good wil haue rewarde doe office committed vnto reward verely preache gospel make gospell christ free misuse mine aucthoritie gospell yet wittingly well aduised vsed among right vnlawful doe sufficiente otherwyse rather great lacke necessary suffered great hardnes leste otherwise thing might happen whereby increase christes doctrine myght hindred bene regarded weale profite well knew ye certainly assured among grecian whiche minister holy thinges haue liuing sacrifice euen among iewes suche wayte vpon aulter partaker aulter euen hath lorde iesus ordayned suche preache teache gospell gospel haue liuyng geuen meane conuenient liuyng euen faythfully laboreth christes seruice ought content god forbid man shoulde growe ryche whereby taughte despise rich thys ye e many cause consideracions myght lawfully haue done doe yet none moued take anye thyng purpose tyme hereafter take ought lest man suspect brought many reason woulde excuse dooe hereafter whiche heretofore neuer dyd wiche mynde onelye repent selfe would also rather die huger man take glory whiche since haue embraced intende steadfastly kepe sustayne suche lackes sorowfull cheare take pleasure rather coumptyng glorye freely preache gospell synce doe see weale expedient ye also may myne exaumple learne sumtyme abstayne whiche lawfull men weale profitable preache gospell doe cause haue none glorye lorde hath geuen thys offyce whome whether muste obey prayse deserue none execute doe office whiche geuen vnto commission syde assuredbut woe vnto preache gospell punishement preachyng gospell slacke yf willingly without byddyng haue preached gospell god shall readye good rewarde doe wil yet must nedes doe whiche put trust gospell deliuered vnto hyde kepe selfe preache gentile nowe bestowe bestowe treasure lorde myne owne bestowe wrong doe lorde whiche selfe kepe talent without fruite arayn whiche would haue encreased vsury ye wil say one doth duetie sure punished doeth duetie haue rewarde hast thou paule glory vpon certainly therby shal euery haue praise comauded lorde gaue v commaundement preache gospel bade v doe nothyng owne fyndyng rather gaue v autoritie eate drynke thynges people offered whome preached gospell therefore whiche pleasure v lawfull would take vse lawfull thys vsed autoritie geuen vnto knew doe profite auauncement god worde frely preache vnto doctrine gospell thintent myghte libertie warne dueties also echuse clerely appere teache aduauntage doe whiche seke theyr owne profite honour iesus christe texte though fre menne yet haue made selfe seruaunt vnto menne mighte win moe vnto iewes became iewe win iewes vnder lawe made though bene vnder law vnder law win vnder lawe without lawe became though bene without lawe without law perteinyng god vnder lawe christ win without law weake became weake win weake thynges fashioned selfe menne saue leastway doe gospel sake might haue part therof point vsed power autoritie pointes submitted selfe though thinges bene bounde dede fre might haue chose vnder gentile lawes grace gospel made free law moses yet myne owne accorde euen one bounde therto please men ende may wynne vnto lorde iewes therfore fashioned selfe sometime making vowe shauing head causing also timothie circumcised though bene iewe dede well wist moses lawe abrogate di thintent could drawen supersticion auncesters lawes might folowing mindes allure either vnto christ leaste make therunto wurse willing displeasing theyr mindes among therefore thoughte themselues vnder lawe behaued selfe though bene also vnder agayn among suche free deliuered moses lawe sometymes vsed selfe thoughe bene vnder lawe yet beefore god vtterly lawles vnder lawe christe whiche muche esteme moses lawe yet apparence tempered selfe theyr capacity myndes amonge people athens dyd straighte cry vpon theyr goddes whome supersticiously honored writing vpon aulter toke occasion secretly bring christ wherein sorte tempered tale taughte excellente manne one great actes made god taughte god man well wist able receiue mystery yea owne writer broughte witnes meanes could laboring allure vnto christ dyd myne owne pleasure yet lightenesse inconstauncie enlarge gospel might haue vsed mine strength haue bene like selfe thyng mynded rather whiche dede profitable gospel expediet temper self weakenes though bene lykewise weake selfe whiche win vnto christe briefe among euery sorte men altered selfe euery fashion euery place laboured saue diligent seruice winning good willes diligece readines please flattery wherwith seke fauour call hardely either toke reward desired gospel preferment labor mine owne seke thaduauntage lord myne none el loke rewarde doe wil singular rewardes geuen singular vertues grace gospel must onely labor seme haue done parte also carie away pryce chiefe game texte p perceiue ye whiche runne course runne one receiueth reward runne ye may obtain euery man proueth mastery abstame thinges doe obteine croune shall perishe obteyne euerlasting croune therefore runne vncertain thing fight one beateth ayre tame bodye brynge subieccion leste meanes come passe haue preached selfe shoulde aste awaye perceiue ye run comen runnyng plaines wherin striue game many runne onely pryce geuen first cummeth marke thinke therefore sufficiente sorte haue done dueties therby escape punyshment ye muste might labor besteso running course gospell ye obtain win prayse god hand chiefe maister game sake must doe suffer al labor diuerse thinges albeit paynful must abiden helpe rewarde abstayne must many thinges though beelsewise lawfull lette victory generally whatsoeuer stadeth way hasteth toward price must auoyded shame hygh rewarde slowely labor common sorte men doe vile runneth co mon runnyng place refraynethe hymselfe meates pleasure many suche thinges selues delectable victory hindraunce also suffereth many thynges albeit vnpleasaunt passing vpon grieuous labor winne chiefe game whiche seketh let passe nothing vndone vnsuffered al rowsed commended lewde people haue vain praise men carie away sory reward much dooe commended angel praised god haue rewarde life euerlasting whe high weighty matier hand shal midway therto litle meate price like point let purposed course thys goodlye game take ye hede sorte ye behaue selfes runne lyke slougarde wonte doe hasten certayn marke al play champion pastime handes beate ayre al meanes chastice sharpe correccios subdue bodie suppressing taming may therby made obediet spirite may honour gospel require easily abstayn lawful paciently suffer aduersitie lest happen doth preachyng called furth game selfe therein geat prayse finally lest haue encouraged desire praise self departe thence shame vnpraysed labour sure hope rewarde teache man thing worde liuing exercise p x chapter texte p brother would ye ignoraunt father vnder cloude passed sea baptised vnder moses cloude sea eate one spiritual meate al drinke one maner spiritual drinke dranke spiritual rocke folowed rocke christ many god delight ouerthrowen wildernes nowe draweth tale teache toward thattaynyng price wealth euerlasting men shoulde thinke sufficient baptisme become christes houshold benefite deliuered tirannie sin restored agayn fredome onles hencefurth kepe themselfe cleare innocent fylthie desyres lustes euery man generally baptized euery man shal generally receiue one rewarde therfore brother would ye ignoraunt written bokes elder tyme escaped tirannie pharao moses capitain cloude cast ouer mightie power god defended heate sunne al equally went fote ye sea deuided gift soeuer christ geuen vnto v maner among done baptisme christ chiefe doer deliuereth v tirannie sin whyles vnder gouernannce moses beeyng couered cloude passed ouer sea stryking moses rod stode sunder certain sorte baptized therein long figuring baptisme many v baptisme purged equally nouryshed foode christes blessed body drinke al misticall cup likewise dyd eate manna sente downe vnto heauen al dranke indifferently water moses stroke hys rod caused spring rocke supposed thinges done ye common sort chauce christ among time darkely began matier hath v plainly truely perfourmed christ rained downe manna mightie power christe whiche alway present drie barain rocke made geue water plentiously briefly christ vouchsalued endue child great honorable benefites honor benefite commenly geuen yet came place whither theyr purposed iourney nothyng aduauntaged escape egipte caried furthe egipte nothyng auauntaged shake bee rydde theyr oulde bondage yf afterwarde beecame slauishelye bonde fylthye desyres beefore subiecte pharao yea god much displeased onely noughtie beefore also vnthankefull whiche offence iuste vengeaunce god diuersly punyshed destroied wildernes time fier sometime sweorde sometime pestilence time serpentes texte ensaumples v lust euil thinges lusted ye worshipper image according written people sate doune eare drinke rose vp play neither let v defyled fornicacion defyled fornicacion fell one day three twentie thousand neyther let v tempte christe tempted destroyed serpentes neither murmure ye murmured destroied destro theyr departure thence shadowe representeth oure baptisme theyr punishment v exaumple vpon boldenes baptisme leade ot lyfe vnsemely suche baptized neyther wan ly desyre hurtful fleshe returne agayn mynde egipte theyr great destruccyo lothing mana foolishely inte peraunce fall agayne idolatrie asmuch seme fall thereto dyd whiche despysing true god worshipped calfe cast moulde eue cursed painims boke exodus thus wrtten whe offered theyr sacrifice people sate downe eate drinke ful rose vp play euen anon vengeauce god slayne three twentie thousande also example wicked harlottes defiled defyled hoores moabites displeasure god therwith enkiendled one day destroyed foure twentye thousande men let v distrusting christe impacience tempte hym wicked grudging prouoking displeasure al fyrye serpentes destroyed grudge agaynste christ hys minister murmured agaynste god moses makyng conspiracie whereof chore chiefe capitayne begynner tyme besyde suche swalowed quicke earth destroyed fourtene thowsande texte thinges happened vnto ensaumples written put v remembraunce whome endes world come vpon wherfore let thinketh sta deth take hede lest fall hath none temptacion taken foloweth nature manne god faythfull shall suffer tempted aboue strengthe shall middes temptacion make way ye may hable beare wherefore dere beloued flye wurshipping image thinges olde time chaunced vnto auncient cronacles left remembrauce soeuer befel without cause rather geue v exaumple whiche nowe thys laste age ought folow flye hebrues fell agayne wantonnes idolatrie foule playes hooredome vice whiche reason theyr conuersacyon egipcians conceyued fell fauor god gote good deliuered trade life auswered vnto benefites god rather farre forsaken day nacion god fauour iewes likewise greater benefites receyue god prouokyng v godly lyfe much ought feare lest christ grieuously punished baptisme deliuered egipt haue vnder title christe maners beseemyng christ egipt let man therfore eyther vpon pryde strength despise weake vpon boldnes baptisme thynke shall saued onles therto adioyne maners besemyng suche baptized hebrues also thoughte themselues ioly felowes delyuered many ieopardyes semed god specially regarded yet god earnestly punished beeing deuyded wicked painyms fel yet agayne manerslet rather thinketh standeth c man without ieopardie trusteth hymselfe let rather standeth take hede fall surest way men stil walke forward fro better better trusting noe one standyng deuils wylines many thinges may chaunce whereby slouthfull may brought christes fauor haue vsed terrible example feare toward like ieopardie hitherto ye haue offended swarued purenes christian lyfe yet see youre wounde curable growen frayltie ye rather surely trust god wil suffer tempted aboue strength wil sort temper matier make way euill chaunce ye shall bee hable beare among peraduenture whiche symplenesse despise v fauouring apostle reason theyr gayer estate fayre speche yet ye comen vnto sedicion core licenciously haunt vnto feastes wicked painims yet farre gone offer vnto idolles ieoperdie farre wherefore dearely beloued child alwayes flye idolatrie whosoeuer eateth bee conscience neuer strong yet sheweth apparaunce one fauoureth theyr supersticion p speake vnto haue discression iudge ye say cup blessing whiche blesse partaking bloud christe breade whiche breake partaking body christ though many yet one bread one body asmuche partaker one breade one cup beholde israell fleshe ea e sacrifice partaker temple say image thing offered image thing nay say thinges whiche gentile offer offer deuile god nedeth vse many wordes perswadyng forasmuch wisedome ye sufficiently vnderstand iudge selfe whether say trueth likenes pray betwixt reuerend wholy feastes theyr heathen bankettynges whosoeuer eateth lyke meate semeth professe fauour religion doeth holye cuppe whiche thankes geuing consecrate receiue remembraunce christes death declare felowshippe al deliuered bloude christe doeth agayne lykewise holye breade whiche christe gaue exaumple commaunded breake among v shewe speciall league felowshyppe betwixte v wee vnder one religyon christe breade suche sorte made infinite noumber graynes sothat reason myxture bee dyscerned bodye made dyuerse partes suche condycion yet amonge feloweshyppe bee broken become partaker one bread act declare albeit nunber neuer many yet consent mindes one bread one body likewise partaker heathe feastes seme also allow fauer felowship supersticion marke consider whether like among also custome moses lawe euen vntil day sacrifice beastes none among suche iewish religion receiued eating sacrificed beast also eate holy meates seme fauer consent vnto sacrifice whereto maketh one say deniest thou paule thou saidst wit idol nothyng offered idol nothing say sacrifice gentile offer offer deuils god thynge selfe dyfference yet theyr intentes cause diuersitie gentile wurship deuils stede goddes beleue theyr image godly power whoso therefore eateth sacrificed fleshe semeth felow wicked errour texte pi would ye haue felowship deuilles ye drinke cuppe lorde cuppe deuilles ye bee partaker lordes table table deuils either dooe prouoke lorde stronger may doe thinges thinges expedient may doe thinges al thinges edifye let man seke whiche owne let euery manne seke belongeth since ye haue wholy geuen youre selues god woulde ye shoulde deuils haue nothing whoso professeth godly religion hath idolater conuersacion forasmuch besemeth one man vnder diuers religion ye one time drinke blessed cup christ cursed cup deuils yet partaker lordes table also deuils table ye either consent mindes great slaunder suche weaker betwixt christ wicked deuils none agrement one time serued without great reproche dishonour christ prouoke vengeaunce nonce keping company enemy ye doe greater vilannie stronger feare punishement lord prouoked meanes god forbid thinke idolatrie suche detestable vice muste onely free crime selfe also al suspicion therof perswasion maner euen planted mennes harte suche one religion eate together sacrificed meates graunt thing selfe without offence slaunder ryseth men opinion mistaking whiche thing poynt manne muste diligently beware touching meates maye dooe thinges thynges neighboure expedient whose sake muste sometyme abstayne euen lawefull thinges may doe thynges thynges edifye godlye life nowe christian charitie commaunded rather doe whiche weale please ourselues geue menne leaue vse freedome bee ieopardye oure brother oughte regarde expedient selues may lawfully dooe texte whatsoeuer solde fleshe market eate aske questio conscience sake earthe lordes therein yf whiche beleue byd feast ye disposed goe whatsoeuer sette eate asking question conscience sake manne say vnto offered vnto image eate sake shewed conscience sake earth lordes therein consciece say thine libertie iudged man conscience take parte thankes eyuil spoken thynge wherefore geue thankes whether therfore ye eate drynke whatsoeuer ye dooe doe prayse god se ye geue none occasion eiuill neither iewes yet gentile neither congregacion god euen please men al thinges seking myne owne profite profite many might saued elsewise whatsoeuer solde fleshe market eate nothing askyng whether offered idol conscience sake occasion slaunder muste auoyded geuen anye suche matter chaunce thing vncleane since al thinges lordes vncleane made man vse psalme writer recordeth saying earth lordes therein yf vncleanes groweth men myndes meates yf therfore christ straunger bid supper ye also disposed goe whatsoeuer set table eate neyther puttyng difference asking anye questyon whether suche meates set table sacrificed doe conscience sake one owne mocion tel offered idoll eate owne sake gaue warning feare hurting thy consciece vpright strong inough others sake warning semeth thinke vnlawful christia man eate flesh offered idol feared lest man either thinke v deuils fredes deuourers wise thinke himselfe howe muche soeuer christian men wordes abhorre goddes yet abhorre fleshe offered would theyr hart much despised religion doe wordes man conscience therfore waye must founde may without great trouble man errour thou must time beare therewith since thou canste take away thynges christe woulde haue v vse libertie neither commaunded bad kynde meate myfor libertie iudged c libertie iudged man conscience may well done taken suspiciously yf eate meates goodnes god hath geuen v preseruacion life man eiuil spoken since vse therof geue god thankes deuils thys condicion therfore ye shal eate eate whether ye drinke eate whatsoeuer ye ye direct al glory god ordring al life according time condicions nothing found wherwith may iustly offended either iew getile christian therin folowing mine exaumple al pointes fashion self euery man eating eating taking taking vsyng iewishnes vsyng tempering suche thynges tyme may eyther bee well doone well omytted myne owne weale profite manye whome diligence labour winne haue anye aduauntage allure euerlasting saluacion p xi chapter texte p ye folowers folower christ commend brother ye remember thinges kepe ordinaunces euen deliuered woulde haue knowe christe head euery man man woman head god christes head euery man praying prophecying hauing thing hys head shameth head euery woman prayeth prophecieth bare headed dyshonesteth heade euen one shauen yf woman couered let also shorne yf shame woman shorne shauen let couer head ye ashamed folow apostle exaumple synce muche myne exaumple iesus christ entent might win v father al pointes applyed hymselfe infirmity folow lord maister ye child folow father ye disciple folow apostle thys hitherto thinke mariers eatyng fleshe auoydyng paynim sacrifice sufficiently spoken hence furth nowe touche certayn pointes would haue commen assembly obserued kepte woulde auoyded nothing done eyther vnorderly contenciously ryottously first al commend brother al thinges ye remember suche poyntes gaue commaundement mayntayn ordinaunces solemne metinges appoynted kepe one thing must tell yet great importaunce much weightie suche may tyme place require bee chaunged yea woman head c would haue knowe christ head euery man head euery wyfe husband god head christ albeit husbande wiues gouernour yet vnderlyng subiect christe lorde maister christe hymselfe poyntes acknowlegeth autoritie god father whome whosoeuer subiect must nedes dooe thyng hys glory secrete place man may doe shall thinke expedient man soeuer commen assembly eyther prayeth prophecieth hauyng thyng hys head shameth hys head shewing himselfe coueryng bonde besyde christ hath maister whose glory conuenient vncouered head onely puttyng cap also shauyng hys heere heere rather coueryng body parte therof side woman comen assembly pray prophecie bare headed dishonoreth hed secret place peraduenture husbandes pleasure open headed congregacion christ honoured husbandes man bee shorne shauen lyke woman cast vayle bee comely woman caste vayle head men dooe let lykewise menne doe either shorne rounded open place preache prophecie bare headed thys wise doe men consent woman foolyshe euil fauered sight let couering head shew selfe subiect husbande texte man ought couer head asmuche image glory god woman glory man manne woman woman man neither man created woman sake woma mansake cause ought woman haue power head angel sake neuertheles neyther man without woman neither woman without n lord woman man euen man woman al god yet beseemeth manne whiche beareth ymage god whiche suche sorte heade gouernoure womanne christe churche muche synce hym sette foorthe goddes glorye whiche shoulde couered syde womanne subiecte vnto husbande apparayled honoure agaynste well maye coumpted reprochefull yf vncoueryng heade open place shewe owne vnshamefastenesse though free refuse obedience husbande christ honoured yf manne hym seruice preache glorie bare headed husbande honoured yf wife reuerence silence comelye apparel shewe sober obedience one wyll saye lawe womanne compelled subiecte husbande co trarye husbande wyfe tyme god fyrste made mankynde manne came womanne contrarye womanne manne first adam made earthe spirite god soule geuen shortely eue taken furth hys syde certayne porcion manne euen contrary commen course nature first made whiche perfite afterward made imperfiter reason manne matrimonie husbad affeccio man matrimonie woman beside man made woman sake woman made geuen manne comforteneither created womas sake helpe bring furth issue generacion whiche act man principall doer fashioner womanne matier sufferer nowe good reason hym preeminence shoulde geuen whiche first made onely made god womanne asmuche firste begynnyng nature husbande hath geuen vnto hym tytle preeminence surelye womanne oughte acknowledge condicio onely readynes please shewe subieccion towarde hym also reuerente behaueour hym shauen head declareth libertie coueryng head token subieccion yf womanne bee farre paste shame regarde syght menne yet aungels sake theyr testimonie beyng also presente solemne meetynges lette heade couered doyng acknowledgeth doeth beseme yet speake either encourage husbande vse wife vile dreuell commaunded obeye discoumforte wyfe subiecte husbande synce bothe christian religion equall besydes oftetymes husbande also needeth aswell wyues healpe wyfe husbandes albeit begynnyng womanne made manne yet nowe neyther wyfe bryngeth foorth chylde without manne manne canne become father withoute womanne yet cause anye person shoulde hymselfe eyther muche pleased grieued synce ordinaunce god whiche suche sorte setteth thinges ordre texte iudge selues whether comely woman praye vnto god bare headed doeth nature selfe teache shame manne yf haue long heare prayse womanne yf haue long heare heare geuen couer withall yf manne luste striue haue suche custome neither congregacions god returne agayne mattier wherwith beganne yf yet manye argumentes sufficientlye proue howe vncomelye thyng womanne openlye praye bare headed let euen euerie manne owne iudgemente reason weyghe mattier thynke manne verye blockeheade hathe loste iudgemente nature doeth nature selfe teache shame manne haue long heare lyke womanne contrarie womanne furniture haue long heare whome nature gyuen thicke large growyng heare manne whiche subiecte husbande mighte tyme lacke vayle haue shewed thynke seemely anye mattier luste contenciouslye defende opinion lette hym take pleasure knowe neither haue suche custome congregacions god whether meete swarue bothe apostle rule exaumples custome congregacions bee ye iudges lesse hurte yf ye suche poyntes agreed synce bee externe mattiers make muche furtheraunce gospellike godlynesse earnestlye require offended ye kepe beyng thyng whiche taught texte warne commende ye come together better maner worse fyrst ye come together congregacion heare discencion among partely beleue muste sectes among whiche perfect among myght knowen wheras thinges ye remember myne ordinaunces much commende wheras poynte ye remember wherin moste mete ye dyd commende taught ye quietly orderly come together without excesse without strife al equalitie specyally nourisheth cocorde vsing selues together euery man might returne house ameded ye come vnrulynes better come together suche sorte assemble many cause ye offende many wayes fyrste ye come solemlye together heare saye dissencion among whiche truely thyng shamefull glad beleue yet vpon knowledge haue condicions partelye beleue reporte coulde auoyded would suche sectes ryse among whiche euill thyng yet good groweth thesame playnly appeareth whiche throughly perfite whyles confusion fyll theyr paunch myldly berlye accordyng vnto apostle ordinaunces olde custome churche kepe holy feaste wherein represent laste souper christ disciple remembryng league whiche made v exaumple mutuall concorde eche one v towarde another texte ye come together therfore one place lordes supper cannot eaten euery man begynneth afore eate owne supper one hongry dronken haue ye house ea e drynke despyse ye congregacion god shame haue shall saye vnto shall prayse prayse deliuered vnto receiued lord lord iesus thesame nyght whiche betrayed toke breade whan geuen thankes brake sayed take ye eate body broken doe ye remembraunce creapt amog vnsemely vsage oft ye come together lordes souper semeth bee great matter hand suche made disciple rather troublous clamorous feast without equalitie eche riotously gloutonously lokyng begynneth afore eate owne souper wherupon foloweth poore man hongry either hath nothing eate cummeth season ryche man hath begunne souper full drounken meanes whereof spirituall feast two maner wayes dishonoured pryde ryche men poore disdayned christ disdaineth also lordes souper surfetting excesse defiled souper represented misterie christian concorde bealy gut matter prouision haue made priuately mennes owne housen open assembly yf ye delyted fyll paunch haue ye housen wherin ye maye doe syght despise ye farfurth open congregacion christian presence therof ye ashamed lyke glotons vse selfes euen purpose meane seaso goyng make poore one ashamed whiche haue nothing set table whyles ye openly setfurth riottouse costly fare shall herein saye vnto ye corinthian shall prayse certenly would wyshe good cause doe thinges much prayse canot prayse maners far square fro souper lord whose example ye among kepe holy feast maruayle haue brought euill custome amog apostle receyued lord also haue taught lord iesus thesame nyght betrayed disciple taken toke bread geue thankes god brake bread sayed take eate body whiche broken deuided among thyng whiche ye see doe thesame doe ye herafter remembraunce note marke disciple syt together table theyr maister marke howe table meate comon somuche traytour iudas excluded thesame one bread equally deuided among dyd lorde disciple despise ye brother suche felowes religion texte thesame maner also toke cup supper doen saying cup newe testamente bloud doe oft ye drinke remembraunce often ye shall eate bread drinke cup ye shall shew lordes death tyll come wherfore whosoeuer shall eate breade drinke cup lorde vnworthely shalbe gyltie body bloud lord let man examen himselfe let eate bread drink cup eateth drinketh vnworthely eateth drinketh owne damnacion maketh difference lordes body cause many weake sycke among many slepe thesame maner distribute bread toke cup also handes
