supper already done saying cup newe testamente bloud often ye drinke hereof doe remembraunce supper dranke one cup among ryche menne dronke poore athruste christ would haue feast kept among remebraunce death token euerlasting testamente yet nowe kepte among ryot dissencion misticall bread wherof al men lyke sorte partaker cup also holy indifferently apertayning prepared apease mennes bodyly thruste represente secrete matter leste ye myght forgette pryce ye synnes former lyfe redemed often therfore ye resorte together eate breade drinke cup ye goe bealy matter mistically represent death lord iesu whose continuall remembraunce shall cause doe dueties vntyll tyme returne iudge worlde therfore whosoeuer eateth bread drinketh lordes cup otherwise worthy christ haynously offendeth hath otherwise vsed body bloud lorde commaunded vsed muche thing whiche moste full misteries ought purenesse reuerence vsed auoydyng whiche inconuenience let euery man first trye examen consciece vpon throughlet man e hymselfe let eate breade drinke cup examinacion let hym eate breade drinke cup let hym vpon examinacion hymselfe fyndeth vnmetenesse abstayne rather make sacrifice bealy home albeit body bloud lord healthfull thing yet whosoeuer therof doeth eate drinke vnworthily thesame turneth poyson destruccion without reuerence vnclensed conscience presumed come vnto great misterie without due consideracion howe great reuerence body lorde ought receyued christe shall come shall suche punyshed violating misterie albeit meane season also thesame offence presently punyshed cumeth among many syckely person founde vexed sondrye feuers disease yea many dye theyr tyme punyshmentes certayne begynnynges threatnynges iudgemente come texte iudged selues haue iudged iudged lord chastened damned world wherfore brother ye come together eate arry one man honger let hym eate home ye come together vnto condemnacion thynges wyll sette order come yf receyuing tryed iudged selfes haue iudged lorde yet better meane tyme iudged dredfull daye bee damned goodes iudgement temporall lyght meanes punyshed vtterly destroyed punyshment chastised leste myght synners hereafter bee damned euer thing saye manne shoulde flater hymselfe yf vpon vnworthy abusyng thys mistery neuerthelesse bee whole sounde bodye therfore brother resorte thys feaste thentent maye christ gaue example bee equall tary one another yf among hungrye tyme abstayne let hym eate home misticall common feast lest whiche weale ordayned occasion damnacion haue nowe herof sufficiently spoken thinges belonging wyll sette order come xii chapter concernyng spiritual thynges brother would haue ignoraut ye know ye gentyles went wayes vnto dome ymages euen ye led wherfore declare vnto man speakyng spirite god defyeth iesus also man saye iesus lord holy ghost diuersities gyftes yet one spirite difference adminystratyons yet one lorde diuers maners operacyons yet one god whiche worketh gyfte spirite geuen euery man edefye withall one geuen thorowe spirite vtteraunce wysdom another geuen vtteraunce knowledge spirite another geuen fayth hy thesame spirite another gyftes healyng spirite another power myracles another prophecy another iudgemente discerne spirites another dyuers tonges another interpretacyon tonges al woorketh euen selfe spirite diuiding euery man seueral gyfte euen bvt speake thyng concernyng gyftes holy goste forasmuch herein ye agre wel neither bretherne would haue remember ye gentile whiche tyme accordyng vnto supersticion elder ye lead deade dome image went ye furth folowed ye lead errour ye gouerned spirite christ former errour imputed vnto remaineth tyme custome vsage lyfe euen badde deuylysh religion muste bee vpryght godly newe religion trewe holy appeare whatsoeuer doen among thesame seme doen motion holy goste whatsoeuer sayed soung glorye christe cometh spirite wherfore declare vnto manne inspired spirite god father defieth iesus hys sonne manne true heart saye iesus lorde inspiracion holy ghoste goodnes therfore fre beneuolece ought ye thanke glory shoulde bee bestowed though men haue one spirit dede yet giftes diuers whiche pleasure diuersly gyueth diuers menne vse also administracion suche gyftes sondrye wyse bestowed wheras lorde whose gyftes one yea effect operacion spirite diuerse men diuersly worketh gyueth lyfe whereas yet al men one god whome power actiuitie al thinges howsoeuer wrought men haue theyr begynnynges al gyftes therfore ascribed god onely whether high lowe cause man proude another mannes gyfte hathe whatsoeuer man hath inspiracion holy gooste comon profite gyuen hym edifie proude hymselfe one giuen spirite god wisdome gyue sage trustie counsell agayne another hath goodnes spirite gyuen vnto hym vtteraunce knowledge rule good order helpe comon weale another hath spirite gyuen vnto hym stronge confidence whiche according lordes promyse moueth yea mountaines theyr place another hath gyfte cure disease bee also haue singular power worke miracle hath gyfte prophecie therwith either open thinges come el hydden mystery another hathe gyuen vnto hym wyttie iudgement put difference betwixte spirites menne whether bee god haue gyfte speake diuerse language whiche meane greatly serueth towarde knowledge holy scripture another hath geuen vnto hym either inspiracion knowledge secret learnyng expounde declare spoke supposed whosoeuer knoweth language alwaye vnderstandeth secrete meanynge therof hauyng suche gyftes let man either stande owne conceyte synce hathe gyuen hym another yet lacke bee greued forasmuche gyfte holye gooste frelye gyuen hym whiche beyng one workemanne bestoweth gyftes diuerse soundrie soundrye person gyuynge euery manne pleasure wyllyng mutuall charitie eche mannes gyftes shoulde comon thentente thys varietie myght make pleasaunt consent comlynes dissencion shoulde bee misticall bodie christe se naturall bodye texte body one hath many membres membres one bodye though many yet one body euen christ one spirite baptysed make one bodye whether iewes gentyles whether bond fre haue droncke one spirite body one member many fote saye hande body therfore body yf care saye eye body therfore body body wer eye wer eare al hearing wer smelling hath god set membres euery one seuerally bodye hathe pleased hym al one member body many membres yet one body eye cannot saye vnto hand haue nede agayne heade cannot saye fete haue nede albeit euery mannes bodye bee one whole thinge yet made diuerse member framed together yet one spirite geueth lyfe member whome notwithstandinge euery one hymselfe consydered many diuers yet made one bodye euen woulde christe haue bee hys bodye churche wherof bee hauyng equallye receyued baptisme selfe one spirite framed one bodye whether iewes grecian bonde fre men woman maried single hygh lowe thesame spirite haue receyued withstanding haue diuerse v didiuerse operacions body made one parte onely manye diuerse nowe yf foote abasyng selfe saye hande haue reste body nothyng doe therfore parte body yf eare bewayling condicion saye iye haue reste body nothing doe therfore body diuers placyng vse member reprochful varietie rather apertayneth welth whole body office soeuer geuen part thesame geuen vnto helpe whole body iye goodly parte body yf whole body iye eares whole body aneare nose god forseing made body dyuerse member gaue euery meber proper place office deserued pleasure yf thys multitude diuersitie mebers al brought one example nose iey armonie comlynes bodye become nowe wheras euery member seuerally differeth yet reaso haue one soule make one body one member cannot lothe neuer vile neither iye excellent parte body familiar instrument soule say vnto hande vile parte haue nede thy helpe yet head albeit palace soules saye vnto fete lowest partes care seruice texte yea rather great deale membres body whiche seme feble necessary vpon membres body whiche thynke leaste honeste put honestie vngoodly partes haue bewtie honeste membres nede god hath disposed bodye hath geuen honour parte whiche lacked leste stryfe body membres indifferently care one yf one membre suffre suffer hym one membre honour membres gladde also farre vnsemyng membre body despised rather contrarie wyse suche seme imperfiter partes body vpon necessarie haue speciall care suche comen estimacion thought partes lesse honestie outwardly geue great honour suche seme vngoodly ioyne comly vesture diligence recompensyng whiche elswyse semeth vnperfite knowyng well vncomlynesse parte whole body diswurshypped suche partes themselfe beautiful nede none outward ornament example neither face handes yet priuey partes must couered honest apparel cause hath god creatour wondrefully tempered disposed whole body meruaylouse consent agrement sondry partes suche semed lacke semelynes albeit nature parte body vnsemely diligence honour adioyned leaste among mebres selfe myght dissencio rise among none whose vse necessarie rather eche one indifferently care defende leste yf whyles dissencion eche pryuately fauoureth selfe whole bodye hys membres decaye peryshe muche rather yf membre anye commoditie discommoditie chaunce reste thynke thesame belong themselfe membre bee greued thesame rest also greued anye one certayne membre bee honoured also gladde reioyce therof wyll ye leastwise example leaue stryuing one say whiche spirite christe surely ioyned one membres one bodye naturall spirite coupled gether texte ye body christ membres one god hath also ordeyned congregacion first apostle secondarily prophetes thyrdly teacher doe myracles gyftes healyng helper gouerners diuersitie tonges apostle prophetes teacher doars myracles haue al gyftes healyng doe speake tonges doe interprete couete beste gyftes yet shewe vnto excellente waye howe nature doe grace ye bodye christ leaste parte member hath suche sorte placed bodye whiche churche hath geuen euery conuenient degree office firste chiefe place hath ordayned apostle whiche beyng stuardes grace gospell execute christes office secondarely prophetes eyther shewe thinges come el declare secret thinges thrydly teacher whiche beeing indued wyth learnyng rule good order maye bestowe haue common profite fourthly worke miracle kepe vnder subdue power deuyls auaunce name glory christe fyftly suche heale disease suche theyr autoritie counsel help trouble singuler discreacion kepe multitude obediece laste al knowledge togues may profitable varietie doth encourage also copell mutual loue concord forasmuch eche one hath nede others helpe al apostle al prophetes al teacher worker myracles haue men gyft healing doe men speake diuerse language haue men gyft expounde euery hath owne proper gyft man must disdayned yet must euery man endeuour endewed gyftes among chiefe styll encrease better supposed euery man hath gyfte geuen vnto without hope receiue better leste ye growe arrogant say vnto gyftes spirite yet holy spirite god wont endeuour prayer prouoked geue gyftes encrease mayntaine excellent gyftes haue nowe rehearsed suche may vngodly men wil shewe excellent waie al wherunto euery man must spicially endeuour synce without nothyng auayle gyftes whiche haue spoken whiche ye yet suche sorte folowe though none p xiii chapter texte though speake tongue men angel haue loue euen ounding brasse tynk yng cymball though could prophecy vnderstode secretes knowledge ye yf haue fayth moue mountaynes theyr place yet haue loue nothyng though bestowe goodes fede poore though geue body euen burned yet haue loue profyteth nothyng ahygh gyft speake tonges whiche ye specially please selfe though speake tonges encrease matter also tonge angel haue feruent desyre doe neyghbour bestowe gyft god profite men vnprofitable shall bee brasse vayne sounde breaketh ayer cymball vnprofitable tinklyng troubleth eares yea haue also excellent gyft example gyft prophecie wherby know secrete sens scripture god somuch haue chaunced one man vnderstand al yea therwith e ioyned perfite knowledge learnynges haue finally strong fayth could thesame moue euen mountaynes place lacke charitie vayne haue forasmuch profite body yf haue great gyft helpe substance euer haue would content bestow al together reliefe poore yea ayde oppressed would put body al ieopardy yea euen burned yet yf may possybly lacke charitie say mynde desirouse euen freely doe wel gyftes haue none aduauntage charitie taught vse giftes haue vayne cannot vse gyftes sometime defaced ambicion sometime wt malyce sometime dissencion al infeccions farre charitie eche gyft hath owne peculiar comoditie charitie neither corrupted vse moste commen texte loue suffereth long courteous loue enuyeth loue doeth frowardly swelleth dealeth dishonestly seketh owne prouoked anger thinketh euill reioyseth iniquitie reioyseth trueth suffreth al thinges beleueth thinges hopeth thinges endureth thinges though prophecyinges fayle either tonges cease knowledge vanyshe awaye yet loue falleth neuer awaye charitie mylde suffer wronges also present lyfe commodiouse courteouse charitie enuieth man asmuch hath bestoweth vpon euill tounged pleasing euery manne swelling lowly humblyng herselfe thinketh thing vnsemely maye doe good seketh owne priuate lucre thorough iniurye prouoked reuenge farre doyng wrong wrong somuche myndeth reuenged farre doyng wrong herselfe cannot abyde rather reioyseth pure godly maners readie desyre doe good suffereth thynges neuer paynfull farre conceyuing euyll suspicion beleueth thynges despaireth lyghtly man sure trust amendemente stedfastly contineweth hope briefe charitie neuer fayleth farre life one manne shal haue nede others seruice yet shall charitable loue myndes abyde styll neuer cease gyft soeuer time manne encreaseth charitie neuer awaye perpetuall gyft spread generally whole lyfe state christian menne though chaunce prophecying fayle tounges cease knowledge abolished excesse ample knowledge texte knowledge vnperfecte prophecying vnperfecte whan whiche perfecte come whiche vnperfecte shalbe doen awaye chylde spake chylde vnderstoode chylde imagined chylde assone manne putte awaye chyldyshnes nowe see glasse euen darke speakyng shall see face face nowe knowe vnperfectly shall knowe euen knowen nowe abydeth fayth hope loue euen three chiefe loue whiche thynges yet possesse vnperfite neyther knowledge neyther vnderstanding misteries prophecie yet ful perfite come perfite nowe halfe perfite shall sorte abolyshed euen nature hath christian religion degree age increase age chylde spake chylde vnderstode chylde imagined chylde assone became manne cast awaye chyldishnes wholy applying minde thinges better vntill lytle lytle attayne beste wherto though present lyfe come yet must doe endeuour may haue lyfe come small porcio god gyftes vnderstande clerely neyther glasse fayth see euen shadowes heuenly thinges scripture darke speakyng haue god coniecture hygh perfeccion shall come shall behold trueth selfe openly time know god euen vnperfectly shall present know presently euen knowe knowen beloued beloued man god somuch fully throughly shal enioy pleasure vnspeakable knowledge albeit preset time giftes cease vnprofitable necessary reason doctrine fayth sufficiently establyshed whose enlarging settling serued yet meane time abide giftes faith hope charitie fayth wherwith see farre immortall lyfe come hope trust partaker therof charitie whereby loue god agayne hath muche doen v neighbour also god sake thre gyftes excell al yet among charitie chiefe ought eyther thanke hope faith leastwise without saluacion effectuall xiiii chapter texte laboure loue couete spirituall gyftes moste chiefely ye maye prophecye speaketh tongue speaketh vnto menne vnto god man heateth hym howebeit spirite speaketh mystery prophecyeth speaketh vnto menne theyr edifying theyr exhortacion theyr comforte speaketh tongue profiteth hymselfe prophecyeth edifieth congregacion woulde ye spake tongue rather ye prophecyed bvt thynges haue honourably rehearsed excellencie charitie make purpose either shewe gyftes despised disdayned rather teache ye shoulde suche sorte laboure charitie ye yet neuerthelesse haue reuerence beare fauour vnto gyfte diuersitie language gyfte also interpretacion woorde moste al yet endeuouryng bothe whiche profitable wete prophecie declaryng spirituall sense wealthe hearer doeth speake tongue speakethe men whome voyce doeth good speaketh god whome prayseth wordes vnderstande touchyng edifying yf vnderstande maketh mattier whether holde peace speake thesame manne inspired spirite god vttereth misteries whiche put case hymselfe vnderstande yet bestoweth thesame vpon bodye put case doe good yet dooeth good hymselfe onelye vayne therfore speaketh congregacion whome manne heareth hym heareth manne whome vnderstandeth besyde spirituall worde god vnderstanden vnlesse manne perceyue priueye misticall sence heauenly spirite god mente thesame woordes whiche thyng manne canne doe speciall gyfte spirite contrarie hehe prophecieth speaketh vnto men theyr edifying doeth office prophete speaketh onelye god also menne dyuerse sondrye wayes profityng while bothe prouoketh euell lyuers amendmente suche slouthful diligence stiereth vp comforteth faynte hearted marke howe great difference betwixte one gift another speaketh tongue profiteth onely hymselfe gifte prophecie expoundeth misteries scripture edifyeth whole congregacion nowe euerye good thyng common better rehearse agayne therfore whiche sayed leste ye myghte paraduenture disdayne gifte tongue tell selfe great thyng gyfte holye ghoste woulde wyshe ye spake tongue yf seeme good yet woulde rather wishe ye excelled whiche perfite texte greater prophecyeth speaketh tongue excepte expounde congregacion maye haue edifying nowe brother yf come vnto speakyng tongue shall profite excepte speake reuelacion knowledge prophecying doctrine moreouer thynges without lyfe geue founde whether pype harpe excepte make distinccion soundes howe shall knowen pyped harped yf trompe geue vncertayne voyce shall prepare hymselfe warre euen lykewyse ye speake tongue excepte ye speake wordes haue sygnificacion shal bee vnderstande spoken ye shall speake ayer many kyndes voyces worlde none without significacion knowe voyce meaneth shalbe vnto hym speaketh alient speaketh shalbe alient vnto euen ye asmuche ye couete spiritual giftes seke ye maye excell vnto edifying congregacion wherfore let hym speaketh tonges praye maye interprete also yf praye tongue spyrite prayeth vnderstandyng doeth good praie spirite wyll praye vnderstandyng wyll syng spirite wyll syng vnderstandyng el thou blessest spirite howe shall occupyeth roume vnlearned saye amen thy geuyng thankes seyng vnderstandeth thou sayest thou verely geuest thankes wel edifyed thanke god speake tongue ye yet leuer congregacion speake fyue wordes vnderstandyng informacion rather ten thousande wordes tongue excellent prophecieth language vttereth holye wordes suche man vnderstandeth excepte peraduenture fyrste spake tongue straight expounde sayd people maye yet thereby take profite edified dede whiche somuche throughly vnderstande themself sounded theyr tongue wordes vnderstanden fruite maye taken yfye otherwyse thynke conceyue imagyne nowe fyrste came coulde nothyng speake language good shall onles speake declare vnto misterye spake gyfte reuelacion el gyfte knowledge eloquently intreat thinges apertayne knowledge faythe gyfte prophecie open vnto hydden misteries gyfte learnyng teach poyntes belong good maners moreouer euen thynges haue lyfe pype harpe whiche made prepared nothing el make sounde yet except thesame make certayne distinction theyr soundes conuenient measure harmony expresse either argumet dittie song el purpose wherunto songe moueth saye yf instrumentes doe nothyng gyue sounde profite pleasure shall hearer take synce discerne played pype harpe whether merye sadde yf trumpet make vncertayne voyce puttyng difference veray sounde whether woulde haue men begynne battayle retreyte backe auaileth trumpet make suche noyse synce souldiar knoweth whereunto called euen lykewyse vnles ye speakyng tongue vtter suche woordes represente certayne knowen mattier hearer ye shall speake vayne synce whiche sayed cannot vnderstande meane wherof speaker wordes shall enter hertes hearer shall theyr vayne noyse onely fyll ayer manye diuerse kyndes tongue worlde whiche euerye one hathe significacion voyce voyce maye al men hearde yf voyce nothing el adioined vayne shal one v speake another albeit eche v pronounce language well yet neither vnderstandeth chaunceth bothe whiche speake greke seme aliante hym afrike agayne aliante ignoraunt afrike language wherfore synce ye people counthe youre owne accorde folowe muche esteeme gifte tongue mine aduise ye shall applye selues obtayning hygher matiers ye whole congregacion maye become profitablelet hym speaketh togue pray may interprete also whoso therfore hathe gifte language let suche one prayer desyre god maye also receyue gyfte interpretacion elswyse yf praye tongue vnknowen people exaumple among grecian language persia yf speake language aswell vnknowen vnto selfe wont delyghte sing song straunge tongue learned withoute booke whiche vnderstande themselues suche case dede spirite breathe vttereth wordes praier soule without fruit synce lytle nothyng profite selfe thereby also paynefull onely vnprofitable also laughed muste wyll tyme place require praye voyce therewith onely contented praye hearte mynde instrumentes voyce syng oute prayses god contented neyther wyll syng myne hearte vnderstandyng adioyning therto knowledge tongue thou expresse syng furth prayses god language whiche manne knoweth howe shall vnlearned whiche aunswereth steade people make aunswere vsed woorde amen thou haste ended thy prayer thankes puttyng therto woorde ende confirmed whiche spoken prayer hymnes ye knowe pageante manne maye call hathe diuers partes learned begynne vnlearned confuse multitude approuyng whiche sayed one voyce aunswere amen howe shall manne make suche aunswere yf knowe thou sayest notwithstandyng thou sayest bee holy thyng thy selfe paraduenture good yet meane season people become nothing better whiche purpose resorted together hearyng suche learned maye better learnyng open place shoulde lyue home leste anye thinke one ignoraunte tongue fauour gifte common sorte men vseth muche auaunce prayse suche poyntes wherein themselues skylfull despise disprayse suche thinges knowe geue thankes god gifte tongue go beyonde whiche knowledge moste stande owne conceites kynde language vsed among whiche cannot bothe speake vnderstande therfore whereas highly esteme gifte interpretacion tha gifte tongue profe malice vpright iudgement coumptyng gifte tongue gyfte rather vsed priuate place open assembly churche assemblye sayntes rather speake foure fyue wordes fyrste vnderstandyng saye selfe maye afterwarde cause lykewise vnderstande suche sorte speake ten thousande wordes man el vnderstandeth parauenture selfe neyther texte brother ye chyldren wytte howbeit concerninge maliciousnes chyldren wytte perfecte lawe wrytten soundry tongue soundry lyppes speake vnto thys people yet wyl heare sayth lorde wherfore tonges sygne beleue beleue contrarywyse prophecying serueth beleue leue therfore congregacion come together al speake tonges come vnlearned beleue wyll say ye wyttes yf prophecye come one beleueth one vnlearned rebuked al men iudged euery man secretes bert opened falleth downe fare worshyppeth god sayeth god trueth therfore brother synce sayed godly lyfe hath certayne age increase endeuour selues growe vp lower higher giftes ye seme alwayes chyldren certayne gyftes meete suche haue lately begunne professe christe certayne meete whiche religion growen vp touching simple hurtles manner brother would ye continued chyldren styll spirituall gyftes woulde ye wente alwayes forwarde vntyll ye come highest thinke nowe sufficiente hurte man labour muste ye beyng nowe ful rype able good helpe menne manner chyldren wonder small thynges trifle muche please themselfe yet processe tyme despise suche toyes proude laboure obtayne greater thynges lykewise hath christian fayth beginnynges wherein vnsemely manne spende lyfe long synce testified god hymselfe wyse speakyng mouthe prophete esai sundrye tongue sundrye lyppes wyll speake vnto people yet wyll heare gyfte tongue therfore geuen god auauncyng furtheraunce primatiue churche myracle vnbeleuers mighte prouoked beleue whereas suche beleue already vnprofitableprophecy serueth beleue beleue contrarywise gifte prophecie onely serueth vnbeleuers make amende theyr lyues profiteth also faythful maye daylye theyr fayth become stronge euery daye better lyuyng besyde howe lytle profite vse language hathe euerye manne maye well see dothe somtyme hurte offende conceyue nowe whole congregacion comen together euery manne spoke diuerse tongue suche vnknowen example yf one speake hebrue another latin third greke yf meane season enter congregacion christia menne el vnbeleuers ignoraunte yet tongue shall heare suche confuse sounde diuerse language vnderstande none saye ye lyke mad frantike men fondely behaue selues contrarywyse yf gyft prophecie one teache geue counsell one exhorte comforte meane season vnlearned straunger enter companye el vnbeleuer whiche vnderstandeth ye saye lykewise vnderstanden doeth suche one whyles knowledgeth perfite christianitie himselfe condemne owne supersticion abhorre owne diuelishe maners comparison godlynes playnly seeth owne conscience whyles heareth ryght rule true religion seeth himselfe vntyll tyme farre swarued fynding himselfe suche faultes gyltie ye woorde reproue detest meane wherof finally ensue beyng chaunged newe man repenting himselfe wil fall downe flat vpon grounde acknowledging openly testifying ye vndoubtedly inspired holy gost speake lyke madde men whiche beyng diuelishe furie possessed powre woordes whiche neyther themselfes vnderstand vttring sounde man woteth texte howe brother ofte ye come together euery one hath song hath doctryne hath tonge hath reuelacion hath interpretacio let al thinges doen vnto edifying man speake tonge let two moste thre course let interprete interpreter let hym kepe sylence congregacio let speake himselfe god let prophetes speake two thre let iudge reuelacion made sitteth let first hold peace ye may al prophecie one one al may learne maye haue comforte spyrites prophetes power prophetes god causer stryfe peace teache congregacions sainctes let wemen kepe sylence congregacions permitted vnto speake vnder obedience sayeth lawe wil learne thing let aske theyr husbandes home shame wemen speake congregacion must ye doe brother ofte ye resorte comen assembly eche bringeth gyft one hath spirituall song prayse god hath doctrine instructe mennes lyues one hath gyft reuelacion declare hydden darke secretes holy scripture hath indued gyfte tonges disdayne none gyftes let congregacions bestowed comon weale whole numbre yet done without disturbauce confusion let also endued gyftes tonges haue theyr time place yet one time nomore two speake moste thre yet together neither course let speake se one present declare people sayed one interpreter sufficient two thre haue gyft tonges necessarie many woordes spoken language yf lacke kunnyng interpreter tonges nedefull speake cogregacio haue nothing knowledge tonges let vse gift priuate place prayse god edifie hymselfe congregacion comon busynesse hande lykewise let prophetes speake two thre course suche would present whiche haue gyft discerne spirite prophetes whether true whiche disproue thesame yf ought sayed vnmete vnbesemyng spirite christ whyles one speaketh sytteth begynne one inspired god meane time speake leste myght confusion voyces let first hold peace appeareth doubte opened one whiche sought synce inspiracio mouing holy gost letted first speake ye doe none impediment may prophecie doen course eche one speaking geue place euery man may haue fruite knowledge whyles euery prophete sheweth wherewith god hath inspired hym may enioy receyue plentifull comforte whyles euery one vpon common weale bestoweth spirite christe geuen vnto lay excuse suche inspired holy gost theyr owne men see rauished men thinke muche otherwyse madde men suche haue receyued spirite christe whiche suche sorte rauysheth minde man nethlesse owne man whether matter require man speake holde peace sober inspiracion nothing el enforcemente mannes godly mynde suche thinges make god glory spirite muche morefor god causer strife peace serue vnto common quietnes muche contencion thesame commeth god whiche author peace confusion sedicion synce congregacions christian men obserued kept mete also kept metynges yf ye wyll haue men thinke good leste ye thought swarue customes ye dissente religion cause lette wemen solemne assemblyes holde theyr peace leste yf kynde muche geuen babling aryse vncomly confusion wemen authorized preache abrode chiefe doer matter commaunded obedient vnto theyr husbandes genesis speaketh god vnto woman thou shalt attend vpon thy husbandes shall beare rule ouer let wemen knowledge lawe coueryng theyr heades also silence wherwith womanhead moste commended wyll saye doest thou farfurth forbid woman speake thou wylt suffer theyr learnyng aske question vtterly forbid open place speake yf thing vnderstand sufficiently desyrouse knowe let aske theyr hushusbandes home shall neyther defrauded teaching doe thing vnsemely surely vnsemely syght see woman speake chrstian congregacion namely synce doe coumpted foule thing euen among paynim meaneth ye corinthias ye greued kepe custome whiche al kept texte sprong woorde god either came vnto man thinke himselfe prophete either spirituall let knowe thynges wryte vnto commaundementes lorde man ignoraunt let ignoraunt wherfore brother couete prophecye forbydde speake tonges let thynges doen honestly order among came gospell fyrste muste compelled kepe customes gospell come yf ye neither fyrste receaued gospel onely menne professe disdayne ye frame selfes customes yf anye among prophete seme otherwyse indued spiritual gyftes let hym assured suche thynges wryte vnto commaundementes myne lordes yf manne contencion vse hym selfe though ignoraunte despising thinges though mannes rule let suche one owne peryll ignoraunt surely god wyll lykewyse ignoraunt hym refuse hym wyll striue matier thinke sufficient parte haue giue warnyng finishe therfore matier labour brother haue gyfte prophecie gyfte muche excellency meane season restrayned speake tounges haue gyfte el thynges bee done comly order haue tolde leste contrary dishonesty trouble chaunce xv chapter texte brother pertaynyng gospell preached vnto ye haue also accepted ye contynue also ye saued ou wyt maner preached vnto yf ye kepe except ye haue beleued vayne bvt heare say brother doubte rysynge agayne deade suche meane pride worldly knowledge styll remaynyng cannot yet herein bee persuaded touchyng article neede teache newe thynge onely call remembraunce gospell whiche fyrste taught ye receaued wherein hetherto ye continewe meane wherof ye obtayne saluacion insomuche bothe superfluous teache thesame agayne whiche wel taught also lytle honestie inconstantly fal backe whiche ye fauoured speaciallye synce ye haue experience preaching gospel doctrine effectuall saluacion poynte beleue resurrection dead chiefeste parte doctrine gospell wherein ye ought assured ye therof doubte onles ye haue gyuen credence thereto vayne god forbid ye shoulde auayled fauer embrace gospell yf ye denie principall parte thesame wete deade shall lyue agayne texte fyrst al delyuered vnto receaued christ died synnes agreing scripture buried arose againe thyrd day according scripture sene cephas twelue aft r sene mo fyue hundred brother many remayne vnto day many fallen aslepe appeared iames al apostle thinketh ye chiefly remember thing fyrst taught mouth nowe reherse vnto wrytinge also ye receaued lorde iesus christe dyed hys deathe deliuered v synne makyng mendes offence scripture many hundred yeares sayed shoulde bee lyke lambe bee led slaughter hys strypes might heale synnes death vpo crosse raigne suppresse tyranny deuill besyde thys ye muste also beleue verely dyed also buried thyrd daye rose agayne also long prophecied darke sayinges prophetes thentent ye better beleue done dede whiche god holy men promised speaketh see two dayes thyrd day ryse againe lyue syght hym againe dauid thys wyse speaketh thou shalt leaue soule hell ye stedfastly beleue besyde thys taught also howe rysen agayne shewed hym selfe playnly euedentlye many fyrst cephas twelue sene fyue hundred brother gathered al together lest might doubt trewth history thys noumber many alyue euen vntyll thys daye dede sene iames whiche called brother lord fyrste byshope hierusalem sene disciple twelue whiche fyrste called apostle whiche name deriued many texte laste seue one borne due tyme leaste apostle worthy called apostle persecuted congregacion god grace god hys grace whiche vayne laboured abundauntly yet grace god therfore whither preache haue ye beleued last al sene vnseasonable borne apostle full tyme laste lyke vnperfite chyld rather caste wel borne complaine laste sawe lord coumpte greate matter deserued se hym leaste apostle vnworthie called apostle persecuted churche god whome apostle stablysh vnworthy therfore euen asmuche laste chosen felowshype thapostles fre goodnes god vouchsaued gyue honoure notwithstandyng deserued whatsoeuer al hys goodnes deseruynge suffered hys grace either idle baraine albeit order time laste yet preaching gospel behynde haue laboured apostle saye leste thys myght lesse esteme myne authoritie laste chosen bee apostle howebeit labor myne vouche myne gyue al goddes goodnes whose helpe wrought retourne therfore matier whether preachyng gospell theyr authoritie bee myne lytle forceth sure one assent preache one thinge whiche one assente preached beleued ye sure vndoubted doctrine alwaye teache one thinge remayneth ye lykewyse continewe one beliefe nowe doubting agayne wherupon ye agreed texte christ preached rose dead saye among resurreccion dead rysing agayne dead christ rysen agayne christ ryse agayne preachyng vaine fayth also vayne ye founde false witness god haue testifyed god howe raysed vp christ raysed vp yf bee deade ryse agayne yf deade ryse gayne christ rysen agayne christe rose agayne fayth vayne ye yet synnes therfore fallen aslepe christ perysshed lyfe onely beleue chryste men miserable nowe christe rysen dead become fyrst frutes slept came death man came resurreccion dead adam dye euen chryst shall bee made alyue euery manne owne order firste christe christes hys commynge cometh ende hath delyuered vp kyngdome god father hath put downe rule auctoryte power yf apostle wytnesses hath styll preached christe prince author resurreccion rysen agayne deathe malapertnes among saye resurreccion deade yf none foloweth muche christ hym selfe rysen agayne purpose oure heade capitayne shoulde ryse go prepare resurrection v member openyng way v yf christ rysen certaynly vayne preaching vayne also belefe truste yf certaynly perswaded christe rysen agayne aswell perswaded beleue must shall ryse agayne whose restoring lyfe rose yf ryse foloweth bothe haue loste labor preachyng ye beleuyng also founde wrongful agaynst god whome falsly reported raysed christe death whome raysed dede raysed yf dead menne ryse againe either muste ye beleue bothe deny bothe offor yf deade ryse againe christ rysen agayne heade member one resurreccion yf deade ryse whose sake christe rose christe hymselfe rose yf christe rose vayne belefe rysen vayne beleued ye truste confidence ye made free synne wherupon also foloweth ye styll subiecte former synnes hath baptisme wherby meane season christ spiritually ryse agayne syn wrought anythyng v also whiche haue dyed truste hope haue paciently suffered cruel martyrdome death vtterly goen euer yf hope resurreccion yf oure hope conceaued christe reache terme present lyfe onely wretched people also miserable whiche christ straungers yet haue sorte pleasure present lyfe wheras trouble christes name shall lyfe haue rewarde yf ryse body soule agayne god forbyd manne owne destruccion haue suche fonde belefe rather yf ye beleue christ rysen agayne euery godly manne dothe therof foloweth necessaryly shall also ryse againe hym began resurreccion whiche shall v bee made perfyte takyng agayne bodye vpon hym rose deathe shal bothe bodye soule ryse agayne leste otherwyse heade myght bee deuyded member prince capitayne fyrste rose agayne fyrste fruites suche dye hope ryse agayne began resurreccion straighte folowed companyos lordes resurreccion time come shal folowe doubted wyll lykewise doe member hath done onely hym selfe alreadye also many holy menne muste imaginacion conceaue two bodyes one subiecte deathe whiche beganne adam another apoynted lyfe immortall whiche beginnyng christe therfore begynnyng one mannes synne deathe entred whiche heade deriued member rageth infecteth menne one manne whiche vtterly free synne came resurreccion dead throughe adames offence descended hym subiecte deathe throughe chrystes innocencie suche shalbe restored lyfe immortall haue desearued bee ioyned hys bodye shall ryse agayne yet euery manne order fyrste christe suche cleaue vnto chryste partes bodye cleaue vnto heade whome certayne goynge theyr graues rose christe reste shall ryse hys laste commyng resurreccion whole body done paste shall nothynge remayne ende thys worldly alteracions whiche shal bee vtter abolyshment tyrannye death tyme christe victoriouse conquerour shall delyuer vp quiet peasyble kyngdome god father whome subduyug enemy restoreth dominion hathe dryuen awaye vtterly hys whole bodye brought nought power rule authoritie aduersaries texte muste raigne tyll haue put enemyes vnder hys feete last enemy shalbe destroyed death hath put thynges vnder hys feete sayth thynges put vnder hym manyfeste excepted whiche dyd put thynges vnder hym thynges subdued vnto hym shall sonne also hymselfe subiecte vnto hym put thynges vnder god maye al elles baptised ouer dead yf dead ryse baptised ouer yea stande allwaye ieoperdye oure reioysyng whiche haue christe iesu oure lorde dye dayly haue fought beastes ephesus maner men auauntageth yf dead ryse agayne let v eate drynke morowe shall dye ye deceaued euell woordes corrupte good manner awake truely slepe synne haue knowledge god speake shame long necessary sonne shoulde labor trauayle recouery kyngdome god father vntyl haue vtterly subdued hys enemy treade downe vnderneyth hys feete bee rebellion feare euyll synne deathe raigneth death deuyll synne extinguished shall deathe raigne longer albeit thys lyfe power labour yet shal fully haue vntyll laste resurreccion al power death shal quite abolyshed laste enemye whiche moste stubbernly rebelled shall bee vanquished euer thys waye hathe father decreed thynges shall become subiecte vnto hys sonne wrytten psalmes thou haste put thinges vnder hys feete scripture sayeth thynges shalbe vnder fete sonne vnderstanden sonne shall possesse kyngdom father excluded kingdom father sonne one kyngdom new peculiar kyngdom wherin shalbe rebellion synfull desyres pleasure god father recouereth vnto himselfe sonne sorte vseth sonne comon nethlesse father authoritie remayneth sonne receiued kingdom suche sorte fully wholy sonnes yet father loseth nothyng synce one thinges shalbe subiecte sonne shall sonne selfe wholy saye bodye misticall yelde submitte hymselfe father chiefe doer al thinges became subiecte sonne thencefurth member shall thing lefte whiche shall christe contrarie whole sonne shall consente father first begynner al thinges shall depende chiefe doer men shall geue thankes euer tyme place hath well done nowe wheras long synce taught ye lykewyse learned meaneth doubt freshe whether dead shall liue againe wherof hope vayne labour albeit supersticiously tha godly steade dead receyue baptisme fearyng leste suche one dyed without christenyng shall ryse among ryghteouse people auoyde thys prepare one steade dead maye aunswere beleueth desyreth baptisme mennes fayth allowe doynges allowe folyshnes thynke another man baptisme helpeth dead beleue truely well shall resurreccion yf thought dead nomore ryse againe neuer would sake careful yea weby reioysing whiche haue christe iesu lorde dye dayly selfes folishly christes doctrin dayly put life ieopardie greuous tormetes reward folow ieopardie also maner dye dayly oftetymes stad new ieopardie dispached one kinde death saying lye may alwaies glory reioysing haue iesus christ lorde whose glory turne al misery suffer wheras amog ephesias christes gospel suffered much trouble yt could chose fyght wt astes one surely apointed dye profite gayned therby dead ryse madnes without compulsion sustaine many trouble assone dead nothing force howe hath lyued yf death paste hope remaineth wicked person spake esai distrusting promise life come measuring whole state blysful life worldly commodity say let v eate drinke morow shal dye toke thys lyfe nothyng el owne death nothing philosopher false apostle syng suche songes eares paraduenture beware leste theyr tale deceyue bryng perylouse erroure alwayes remembring truly sayd certaine poete euyll woordes corrupte good maners idlenes wanton lyuyng groweth distruste whyles knowing owne enormity deny shall resurreccion suche blyndenes synne lyue wyth regarde godly lyfe awake ye study ryghteousnes leauing pleasure leste ye fal greate ieopardye distrust albeit amonge whiche swell proude worldely wysedome yet ignoraunt hyghest parte wysedome knowe god beleue might dead restored life againe standing almyghtie power yet remembre easyer thing restore whiche decayed nothing make somewhat tell displeasure entente ye shame hecefurth nomore geue eare labour make beleue folishe deuilishe poyntes texte man wyll saye howe aryse dead body shall come thou foole whiche thou sowest quyckened excepte dye sowest thou thou sowest body shalbe bare corne whete god geueth body pleasure euery sede owne body fleshe one maner fleshe one maner fleshe beastes another fish another byrdes also celestiall bodyes bodyes terrestriall glory celestiall one glory terrestriall another one maner glory sunne another glory moone another glory starres one starre differeth glory resurreccio dead sowen corrupcion ryseth againe incorrupcion sowen dishonour ryseth againe honour sowen weakenes ryseth power sowen naturall body ryseth spiritual body naturall body spirituall body also wrytten fyrst man adam made lyuing soule last adam made quickenyng spyrite howbeit fyrste whiche spirituall whiche naturall whiche spirituall fyrste manne earth erthy seconde manne lorde heauen heauenly erthy suche erthy heauenly suche heauenly haue borne image erthy shal beare image heauenly say brother fleshe bloud cannot inherite kyngdome god neither doeth corrupcion inherite vncorrupcion beholde shew misterie shall slepe shall chaunged momente twinkling lye last trompe trompe shall blowe dead shall ryse incorruptible shalbe chaunged corruptible muste put incorrupcion mortall muste put immortalytie corruptible hath put incorrupcion mortall hath put immortalytie shalbe brought passe saying wrytten death swalowed vp victory death thy styng hell thy victory styng death synne strength synne lawe thankes vnto god whiche hath geuen v victory thorowe lorde iesus christe therfore deare brother ye stedfast vnmouable alwayes ryche worke lorde muche ye knowe howe labour vayne lorde synce certaine general resurreccio shalbe curious perso wil aske sort shal kind body shal men rise synce body whiche haue tourned ash earth thing vile thou foole maruailest howe god doe renyuing body nature dayly worketh sede cast grounde thou sowest drye dead sede earth agayne thesame beyng putrified semeth dye finally growyng earth lyueth agayne groweth coulde thesame wyse lyue agayne onlesse fyrste dead buried nowe groweth sede vppe another fourme cast earth earth cast lytle vyle blacke drye grayne beeng continaunce tyme putrified due season groweth vp becommeth fyrst tender grasse stalke laste eare whiche three appeared none small grayne thou dydest cast earth euery sede hath power growen vp appeareth may seme vtterly thou dede knowest saue chaunged better forme seest thou lyttle kernell howe greate tree groweth howe myghtye stemme howe rootes spreade howe large boughes noumbre braunches howe pleasaunte blosomes plentefulnes fruyte nothyng thou dyd cast sealye small kernell grounde yet tyme thinges didest thou hope vpon trust conceiued workes nature darest thou vpon trust god almyghtye power surely looke lyke done god kernell thou sowedste tree yet geueth god kernell quickned body suche pleasure geueth euery kynde sede speciall property wheras growe agayne yet haue poyntes thesame forme lyke sorte kyndes beastes wherof euery one hath seueral sede euery seed euery beaste engendred though beastes commen haueall fleshe one maner flesh fleshy body yet betwixte one flesh small difference flesh men one maner flesh beastes fyshes byrdes another lykewise also though creature lacke lyfe called body yet diuerse forme heauenly body earthly stone water earth yea heauenly bodyes one beautie comlynes earthly euen diuersitie among heauenly bodyes selfe fyrste nether lyke glory bryghtnes moone sone starres moone briefly euen verie starres selfe brightnesse diffre one another bryght day starre lykewyse resurrection men shall ryse theyr owne bodyes yet vnlyke glory without doubte shal please god gyue lyfe haue deserued vngodly shall rise one fourme good among also good euerie one hath lyfe vsed hymselfe shal excell gloriousnes new bodye yet generally good men shall haue muche actiue bodye death forsoke nature couer seed vnder earth matier resurrection buriall deade bodye whiche seede growyng agayne bodye rysyng agayne one muche better groweth vp caste earth euen albeit thesame bodye ryseth agayne yet farre vnlike sowen grayne earth body subiect corruption thesame shall ryse againe without corruption hydden earth vyle body lothsome shall ryse againe body gloriouse honourable buryed bodye whiche euen lyued weake shall ryse agayne full power myght buryed bodye albeit alyue yet grosse heauye reason bourdaynouse soule gouernour shall ryse agayne naturall spirituall bodye whiche shall soule let whither soeuer moue difference body also one naturall whiche hath neede meate drynke weryed labour whiche diseased whiche age weareth awaye grosse fautie instrumentes ofttimes letteth intent soule reason froward desyers oftentimes prouoketh vyce whome yf soule obedient geue ouer tourned body groweth nature fleshe another spirituall lyfe lytle lytle purged sensual appetite desiers resurrection renewed agayne maner transfourmed nature soule godly desyre applyed selfe oure soule obeyng spirite god rauished maner transformed maye bodyes beyng obedient vnto soule pourged shakyng grossenes purified body lyke soule grosse earthly body receiued first father ada made earth subiect earthly desiers secode adam somuche begynner natiuitie resurrection hath heauenly beginning fre al infeccion earthly desyers reade genesis fyrste man adam made lyue benefite soule yet soule beyng bound grosse body nothing bodily instrumentes leaste material meane geuen seconde adam conceaued holy gost geue lyfe grosse lyfe whiche haue many poyntes common beastes spirituall heauenly lyfe christ therfore repayred al poyntes better state thing whiche time firste also substance grosse order nature nowe beare v naturall bodye tyme come shall haue spirituall bodye grosse parent stocke went folowed christ begynner newe generacion sorte one earthly parent suche posteritie saye men gyuen earthly desyres agayne kyndethe fyrste manne earth earthly one heauenly adam borne agayne hym wete wholy delyted heuenly thinges must state begyn intende herafter perfitely enioye baptisme vngraciouse maners resemblyd nature fyrst father borne agayne vnto christ baptisme muste nowe heauenly lyfe resemble oure heauenly father yf neither shall partes christes bodye tyme come gloriously ryse agayne deede admitted kyngdom god tell brother flesh bloud say men first generacion cannot come enheritaunce kyngdome god lyfe whiche synne corrupted shall haue inheritaunce lyfe immortall ye shall ignoraunt nothyng apertaynyng maner resurreccion beholde tell misterie shall dye laste daye shall peraduenture fynde v alyue yet shall chaunged glory immortall lyfe whiche sorte abstayning infeccion synne godly conuersacion beginne immortal lyfe come chaunge shal made lytle lytle see natural thinges chaunged minute twynkling iye sounde laste troumpe troumpe shall blow voyce wherof suche dead shall ryse immortall whiche shall day found alyue beyng sodaynly chaunged shall lyue sorte say doe rysen necessary perfitly possesse kingdom heauen vtterly put al earthlynes corruptible body made incorruptible mortal body become immortall shal verely perfourmed prophete see foreseing sayth reioysing thedeath swalowed vp victorie c vtter destruccio death death swalowed vp victory death thy styng hell thy victory sting death sinne strength sinne lawe occasion geuing prouoketh v sinne law taken away power sinne faynt feble sinne taken awaye power death ceaseth reason styng taken awaye wherwith wounte stryke v vnable vtterly fyght violent aduersaries strength owne thankes therfore geue god hath caused wil may wynne gloryous victory iesus christe lorde whiche sake death ouercame death toke vpon hym purge synnes therfore dearly beloued brother synce certaine resurreccion shalbe synce knowen blysse glory men shall enioy therby yet man shal receiue forsaking sinne godly liuing begynne doubte ye haue beleued suffer selfes talking vngodly person bemoued right receyued fayth rather apply continually profite thynges may bryng god fauoure ye become euery day better preparyng selfes agaynst resurreccion come shrynke ye take paynes assuryng selfes christes helpe transitorie labour ye shall receyue ioyes without ende p xvi chapter texte concernyng gathering sainctes haue ordeyned congregacions galacia euen doe ye vpon sabboth daye lette euery one put asyde home lay vp whatsoeuer mete gatheringes come come whosoeuer ye shall alowe letter sende bring lyberalitie vnto hierusalem yf mete goe also shal goe come vnto whan goe ouer macedonia wil goe thorowe macedonia concerning gathering reliefe liberalitie sainctes whiche hierusalem apoynted vnto galathians money gathered purpose yf owne free wyll disposed bestow euen would haue thesame done among poynte also ye agree congregacions vpon fyrste daye weke say sonday let euery one set asyde home lay vp asmuche purpose thinketh mete geue warnyng euery man hath purposed geue may readines leste come gathering money made whe come vnto thither soeuer ye shall chuse messangers wil letter send hierusalem carie thither liberalitie yf ye thinke nedefull also goe selfe thither shall goe leste man myght suspecte wise goe owne busynesse see haue gonne macedonia mynde see waye texte peraduenture abyde whyle el tarye wynter ye maye bring waye whyther soeuer goe see nowe passage trust abyde whyle yf god shall suffer wyll tarye ephesus vnto fyftieth daye great doore frutefull opened vnto many aduersaries yf timotheus come see without feare worketh worke lorde doe let manne therfore despise conuay hym forth peace may come vnto loke brother peraduenture abyde whyle sure whether shal tarie al wynter beginning nexte spring ye may bring furth may goe whyther soeuer busynes gospell calleth would haue commen would see houerly passage trust shall another tyme haue oportunitie tarie certayne dayes lorde iesus suffer meane season tarie ephesus vntil fyftyeth day matter uireth leysure albeit place great doore opened vnto great hope auancing gospel yet many aduersaries yf meane season timothie come vnto see put ieopardie high hearted proude person young man yet felow preaching gospel laboureth purely frely doe let man therfore despise hym young rather let hym goe without harme displeasure apostle felowe loue bring furth maye come hym looke brother company texte speake brother pollo certifie greatly desyred come vnto brother nde come time howbeit wil come shall haue conuenient tyme watche ye stande fast fayth quyte lyke men strong let busynesse doeu loue whereas ye rather desyred apollo haue sente vnto surely came wet vehemently exhorted hym go certayne brother vayne certayne consideracions wyse mynded nowe come yet come wyll assone conuenient leysure shall serue watche agaynst deceytes suche geue euill counsell stande faste faythe whiche ye haue receyued quite selfes lyke agaynst suche thinges resiste gospell stronge valiaunt whatsoeuer doen among let doen loue contencion texte brother ye knowe house stephana fortunat achaicus fyrste fruites acha haue appoynted themselues minister vnto sayn re beseche ye obedient vnto suche helpe laboure glad commyng stephana fortunatus achaicus whiche lackyng vnto parte haue supplyed haue comforted spirite loke therfore ye knowe suche beseche brother nede besechynges ye knowe householde sthephana well worthie made muche bothe thesame first fruites achaia gotte firste vnto christe geue helpe poore meete therfore ye againe make muche many wyth v promote gospell partaker labour pleased well ye sente hyther stephana fortunatus achaicus theyr cumming hyther name supplyed wyth theyr gentilnes whiche lacking vnto parte coumforted spirite yea might saye spirite whiche regardeth nothyng weale thyng delighted furtheraunce suche know ye bearyng towarde speciall fauour texte congregacions asia salute aquila priscilla salute muche lorde doth congregacion theyr house also lodged brother grete grete ye one another holy kysse salutacion paule myne owne hande man loue lorde iesus christ thesame bee anathema maranatha grace lord iesus christ loue christ iesu amen congregacions asia salute aquila priscilla companie christian theyr house salute harte suche professe name christe salute beare ye also good wil eche one another salute one another holy chaste kisse token trewe concorde paule salute subscribed mine owne hande thereby bothe declaring loue towarde epistle counterfayte yf man loue lord iesu thesame anathema maranatha forasmuche refuseth hym whome onely might obtayne saluacion denyeth come euery man knoweth come great blisse commoditie suche beleue hym damnacion suche beleue grace mercie lorde iesus christe desyre beare christian loue towarde ye lykewyse vnfaynedlye loue eche one another wt charitie wherwith iesus christe hath ioyned knytte together amen argument vpon second epistle apostle saint paule corinthian de erasmus roterodame sainct paule hath beginning epistle somewhat spoken great trouble affliccions whiche suffered christes gospelles sake declaryng al god coumfort firste sheweth cause came agayne corinthian epistle promysed straight bringeth agayne fauour corinthian haynouse fornicatour former epistle commaunded bee geuen ouer satan desyring louyngly receiue hym vpon hys amendement whome banished offence maner doth firste seconde chapter reherseth greate laboure preachyng gospell waye checkyng reprouyng false apostle whiche sekyng theyr owne aduauntage glorie tymes place allured men moses lawe whiche sort laboured myngle law christe though without hope saluacion therefore preferreth lyght gospell shadowes moses lawe eftsones exhortyng ceremony lawe vpryght conscience leade christian lyfe shewyng meane season without corrupcion preached christes gospell misery suffered gospel sake hope heauenly reward beside declareth poyntes christianitie specially standeth whiche matter paule entreateth latter ende seconde chapter thirde fourth fyfte begynnyng syxte reste chapter begynnyng nexte exhorteth knowe theyr owne dignitie holines theyr profession willyng absteyne wyth diligence corrupcion viciouse life painyms men nothyng dooe fourthly mollifieth sharpenes vsed former epistle praysyng theyr obedience poyntes obeyed epistle notwithstandyng sharpe earnestnes thereof reioysing short heauines wherein caste letter made e corinthian hym mearye euen men wont bitter medicine restored health fyftlye prouoketh euerye one well exaumple macedonian dyuers argumentes recordes scripture bestow according theyr ability good wyll thyng towarde reliefe sayntes hierusalem remembryng peter commaunded doe purpose sending thither tytus coumpanion whiche parte doth suppose luke whome commendeth vnto thys dothe paule viii ix chapter sixtely false apostle epistle priuely checked taunted playnly opely reproueth proud highe lokes toke vpon honour dignitie apostle bringing paule dis eine saiyng ase persone whiche vsed shomakers crafte rude vnlearned besyde ofttymes wronged beaten againste paule defendeth authoritie declaryng alttymes apostle power autority yet woulde vse men payne comoditie hearer glory christ compelled somwhat boast desireth first beare folishnes fyrst maketh himselfequal chief apostle setieth hymself al many cause eyther enlarged doctrine gospel el taught thesame freely nether self chargeable achaian finally gospel sake suffered persecucion anye al coumpting misery trouble matter glorie vpon thought despised humble low mind confesseth rudenes barbarousnes language yet knowlage learnyng taketh vpon leste myghte hym finde lacke finally false apostle among simple people made greate crake fayned vision angel paule shewethe verye notable trewe vision taken vp thyrd heaue taught thynges passed mennes capacity thynges intreateth x xi xii chapter seuenthly lest false apostle myght fall agayne theyr old vice saieth purposed se agayn eftsones threateningts warnyng founde suche theyr ordre lyfe therby myghte compelled vsyng extremitie vnlike hymselfe el leste compelled vehemently letter wryte vnto myght beyng present compelled vse autoritie otherwyse done tymes past myght haue lawfullye done doth paule latter ende xii chapter xiii greeke title declare epistle sent philippos titus lucas bryefe argumentes whiche found latine bokes without autours name record testifie thesame messangers sent troas place paule maketh mencion seconde chapter present epistle ende argument pharaphrase erasmus vpon second epistle saint paule corinthyans p fyrste chapter texte paule apostle iesu christe wyll god brother tymothye vnto congregacion god whiche corinthewyth sayntes whiche al achaia grace wyth peace god father lorde iesus christe paule ambassadoure iesus christes behalfe authorized god father timothy religion brother felowe office vnto christian companye onelye whiche corinthe also sayntes thorowe whole countreye achaia whereof corinthe heade citie dooe faythfull searuyce christe grace wyshe wee vnto peace concorde free gyfte lorde iesus christe god father whiche also father v texte blessed god father lorde iesus christe whiche father mercy god coumforte whiche coumforteth v oure tribulacion insomuch hable comfort maner trouble wt thesame comfort wherwith selues coforted god affliccions christe plenteous euen oure consolacion plenteous christe good luckye woordes blessed magnified praysed bee god father oure lorde iesus christe fountayne autoure goodnes fearefull god righteous godly one comfort commeth whiche ceaseth aide comforte v messangers suche trouble maie wayes befall v whiche doothe onely sake leste myght happely vehement persecucion fall hym sake also whiche oure trouble loue ye beare towarde v greate heauinesse ye oure reliefe easte gladde ioyfull exaumple hope goddes healpe manfully continue suffreyng persecucion trouble standyng sure truste confidence god ye se aided strengthned v beyng oppressed misery wellnygh deade wyll hein trouble healpe succour whose goodnes suche wyll accordyng oure temptacions measure mercifull comfort loth suche affliccions suffre endure christes sake christe gaue exaumple knowyng greuous tormentes suffered comforte honoure greater tormentynges lykewyse glory suffered bode meane muche plentiouslye hath god relieued v deliuered trouble intent ye lykewyse stande hope loke whiche ye see alreadye doone v texte whether wee bee troubled consolacion health whether wee bee comforted comforte saluacion whiche saluacion sheweth power ye fu thesame afflicions whiche also suffre whether wee bee comforted consolacion saluacion hope also stedfast asmuch know ye partaker affliccions ye partaker also consolacion therefore whether wee bee troubled aduersities doeth god encourage v wealthe expediente meane ye beeyng throughe exaumple strengthned may stoutly abyde euen moste extreme violence maye bee laied vpon whose sufferaunce albeit paynfull yet verye holsome el yf refreashed storme persecucion paste alayed euen doth god also intendyng relieuyng v refreashe youre courage leste ye myghte wyth sorowe payne faynt despayre rather vpon remembraunce chaunge soro pleasure ye myght likewyse bee hable suffre suche trouble wee dooe trewlye greate hope wee ye wyll surelye dooe ye maye bee also ioyes partaker hereafter ye alreadye partaker affliccions ye heretofore sorye affliccions shoulde ye nowe reioyce deliueraunce synce meete conueniente frendes louers shoulde bee lyke condicion paynes pleasure texte brother woulde haue ignoraunte trouble whiche happened vnto v asia wee greued oute measure passing strengthe greatlye despayred euen life also receaued answere death selues put truste selues god whiche raysed dead lyfe agayne deliuered v great death doth deliuer whome wee truste yet hereafter wil deliuer helpe prayer v meanes manye occasion thankes maye bee geuen manye behalfe grace geuen vnto v perfeitely knowe ye woulde much reioyce yf ye throwghlye wiste howe vehement blaste persecucion happened vnto v asia suffered wee affliccions aboue al measure vehement strength hable beare reason whereof broughte poynt despayred life vtterly vnable suffre manye extreme trouble yea violence persecucion onely despayred howe shoulde bee hable indure ummyne owne mynde vpon distruste conceaued strength euer death presente hearte gaue looke nothyng last daye extremiti pleased god shoulde brought shoulde strength put none affiaunce trust healpe comonly wont hand succour whe al worldly aide disapoint v fayle whiche pleasure onely deliuereth oppressed fro ieopardies death restoreth also suche dead life agayne thyng euen dead destroyed whiche death yet god deliuered dothe euen nowe styll deliuer whome also stande suche confidence wyll hereafter deliuer v specially yf ye healpe prayer procure obteyne fauoure god intente saued wish many weale many may diuersly many men deliueraunce thankes geuen god maye appeare benefite god deliueraunce onely bestowed vpon vpon al suche haue good therby texte oure reioycyng euen testimonie oure conscience singlenes heart godlye purenesse fleshly wisedome grace god haue ou conuersacion worlde moste youwardes write none thynges vnto ye reade also knowe ye truste ye shall finde v vnto ende euen ye haue founde v partelye youre reioy ing euen ye daye lorde iesus touchyng selfe haue owne breste wherewyth comforte sufficientlye middes trouble yea make reioyce glorye conscience whiche witnesse priuy poynte neuer laboured ministerie christes gospell sekyng gaynes auauncing selfes worldlye wisedome among dooe taught simplicitie godly puritie bothe greece speciallye among whose sake albeeit wee haue suffered suche greate thynges yet neuer loked wee tooke rewarde handes leste myght take occasion thynke wee oure aduauntage muche sought vpon muche haue sayed arrogantly trueth boast otherwise self ye haue hadde experience neuer founde ye v suche wee saye letter ye reade make wee ourselfes woordes writyng wee among shewed oureselfes dooyng yea truste ouer sorte ye haue hytherto partely founde v suche shall ye alwayes finde v hereafter eche v maye glorie ye lyke thankfull apte child sydes godly lyfe deedes bee lyke vnto father teacher haue al pointes bene vnto goddes true messenger lette meane season boste themselfes neuer muche among menne disdeine outcaste one affliccions yet certaynelye lorde shall come beefore whome paynted coulours shall nothyng serue wyl reioyce haue wonne vnto christ shall ye also glorie whome nothyng taughte christes trewe doctrine texte confidence minded firste haue come vnto might haue one pleasure passe macedonia haue come againe macedonia vnto bee led foorth towarde iewrye thus wise minded vse lightenes thynke carnally thynges thynke shoulde bee yea yea naye naye god faithefull preachyng yea naye goddes sonne iesus christe whiche preached among euen siluanus tunotheus yea nay hym yea promise god yea hym amen vnto lawde god thorow v god whiche stablisheth v christe standeth v hath anointed v whiche hath also sealed v hath geuen earneste spirite hertes call god record vnto soule fauour al came vnto corinthum lordes ouer fayth helper ioye faith ye stad vpon confidence vpright conscience hope conceaued encrease furtheraunce occasion minded time visite therby purposyng double pleasure wt mine epistle fyrste also waye wyth presence purpose see went macedonia agayne returnyng macedonia come vnto promissed epistle thence ledde brought furthe iewrye meane season wyll thynke synce wyse mynded dooe whether came lightnesse chaunged myne intente whether perfourme worldly policie whiche purposed doe alteryng minde occasion serueth good consideracions aduisedly folowed mine destre wel vnderstode weale expedient dooe otherwise defferryng retourne congregacion myght bee amended whome would see theyr vncleanesse poynte alwayes constaunte lyke self tymes seeke youre weale behalfe neuer wauer alwayes dooe whiche shall bee profite alwayes shonne thatfor preachyng yea naye c whiche thynke vnprofitable thynke lyeth v perfourme asmuch purposed know god deceaueth whose healpe woorde wherewith wee preached vnto gospell wauered time like selfe wee preached vnto worldlye carnall matter taught weightye effectuall vnchaungeable doctryne constauntly one sorte bothe siluanus timothie e iesus christe sonne god whose name among vneffectuall mightye full power oure strengthe free gyfte vntil time haue ye receaued giftes holye ghoste possessing earneste peny sure shal ye bee suche thynges time come promissed al thynges promissed hym sure doubte hym whome glorye dewe neyther oure promisses whiche wee layed shewed god chief geuer minister messangers glorie maketh yf whiche wee preache name bee founde trewe effectuall besyde whereas wee haue constauntelye preached christe ye haue constauntelye continewed christes religion receaued goddes gifte also whiche wee promisses haue cofidence hath also anointed v secreate gyftes printed certaine marke oure heartes yea geuen oure soules spirite earneste pledge blessed state promissed vnto v hereafter lette manne therefore thinke lightenesse vntill time differred commyng vnto god take recorde whereas hitherto came corinth doone displeasure borne towarde rather louynge mynde lefte yf hadde commen rather shoulde haue beene compelled vse extremitie towarde suche yet amended whome trusted yet woulde meane season cumme amendemente better thoughte sommewhat later cumme vnto cummyng mighte bee bothe pleasaunte bee among earneste behauioure sad lette thynke woordes bee spoken proudelye threatening sorte youre correccion wee beare lordelye rule vpon anyenot lordes e youre fayth suche haue sinned touchyng therefore fayth wherein ye continue wee beare rule vpon ordre lyfe thyng whiche woulde amended farre wee threatenynge suche eiuil liuers shewe thereby authoritie haue vpon wayes wee prouide kepe gladdenesse whiche woulde corrupt maners mine earnestnesse could choose vse bee wyse appayred sorowefulnesse seconde chapter texte determined self woulde come heauines make sory shoulde make glad whiche made sory wrote vnto leste came vnto shoulde take heauines vpon heauines whome ought reioyce confidence haue towarde ioye ioye greate affliccion anguish hert wrote vnto many teares ye shoulde made sorie ye mighte perceaue loue whiche haue moste specially vnto bvt rather forasmuche former letter necessitie made heauye pensife condemning incestuouse fornicatoure thoughte meete comming thither anye newe heauinesse vexe trouble eyther self fayne would alwayes vnto bee pleasaunte neuer painful nlesse ye prouoke yf anye tyme bee thoroughe outragiousnesse compelled while correcte fewe make sorye self meanes made sorye canne make gladde agayne manne whiche made heauye sadde surely ioyfull shall bee yf suche sharpe correccion finde healed fynde likewise nowe reioysing recouerye ye fore sorowe partaker euen cause wrote epistle vnto beefore cummyng leste yf come vnto might suche take sorow whome mete seaming toke pleasure comfort specially synce surely perswade selfe ye suche sorte minded towardes whether mourne correccion punishemente heauinesse bee commen bee gladde youre amendementes ye also bee gladde nothyng greuous vnto among see suche thynges beseame religion agayne man gladde yf see nothyng woorthie reprofe therefore beeyng exceadynglye astonied suche outragiouse offence wel knowe amog wrote vnto ye letter without greate heauinesse hearte great affliccion without many teares make sory ye might perceaue loue good wil towarde readie plentiful toward much ye greueth dishonestie amog texte pyf man hathe caused sorowe hathe made sory partelye shoulde greue sufficiente vnto man rebuked many contrarye wyse ye ought rather forgeue coumforte leste persone shoulde bee swalowed vp wyth ouer muche heauines wherfore exhort loue maye haue strengthe ouer cause verelye didde write ighte knowe profe whether ye shoulde bee obediente thynges whome ye forgeue anye thyng forgeue also yf forgaue anye thyng whome forgaue sake forgaue syght christe leste satan shoulde preuente v thoughtes vnknowen vnto v yf manne haue geuen occasion bee sorye hathe onely made sorye synce hath made also sorye manne whose name vtter yet rehearse fault whereof ashamed sufficiently punished suche sorte openly rebuked beefore people auoyded euerye mannes coumpanye muche done vnto hym partelye cure disease partelye feare lyke nowe remaineth ye increase sorow rather forgeue hym vpon repentaunce offence ye abhorred co fort hym sorowe leste bee desperacion swallowed vppe wherefore beseche forasmuche ye condemned hym euen loue displeasure purpose elles condemned hym intente shoulde amende bee saued see fynde youre loue effectuall towarde receauyng hym hartylye louyngly whome ye excluded heauinesse also another cause wrote letter vnto woulde haue tryall whether ye woulde poyntes obeye commaundementes condemnyng hym whome commaunded bee condemned ye obeyed likewyse wyll ye truste obeye receauyng hym youre fauoure whome woulde haue reconciled wylles maie euerye poynte agre whome euer ye forgeue anye thing forgeue also coumptyng selfe fullye contente yf see satisfied forgaue anye thyng youre sake forgaue iesus christe witnesse approuer leste satan elswise myght take v thorowe desperacion vse sleighty thoughtes vnknowen vnto v whiche doth onely lye watche disceaue v pleasure also heauinesse sorowe thone alluring v outragious offence thother casting v downe headlong depe ungeon desperacion texte come troas christes gospel sake greate doore ape vnto lorde reste spirite founde titus brother toke leaue wente awaye macedonia thankes bee vnto god whiche alwayes geueth v victorye christe openeth fauoure knowledge v euery place vnto god swete fauour christe among saued mong whiche perishe one parte sauoure death vnto death vnto parte wee sauoure lyfe vnto lyfe meete vnto thynges moste parte whiche chop chaunge worde god purenes power god sighe god speake christe came troas preache gospell christ fauoure god plentifull hope encrease opened vnto greately mynde disguieted becaused therwyse loked found brother felowe titus whome hadde greate neede beare greate weightie matter leauing therefore went macedonia without great ieopardye thankes geue vnto god whiche victoriously carrieth aboute v triumphe christian religion makyng glorious glorye hys gospell dailye spreadeth whiche preachyng enlargeth place abrode knoweledge hymselfe vsyng v though swete incense preache place world glorye gospell elles dooe wee spreade abrode swete fauoure christe selfe deede saye menne pleasaunte holsome yet throughe theyr owne faulte deadlye poyson holsom suche throughe fayth gospell obteyne saluacion vnholsome deathlye suche refuse thereby doublyng theyr damnacion deathe euerlastyng menne encreasyng theyr former offence wyth vnthankefulnes stubbernesse myndes meete dooe preache whoso myndeth laboure muste therein nothyng regarde onely glorye christe bee whiche teachyng gospell either honoure aduauntage spreade somuche abrode swete sauers christe theyr owne countrefaite deuises profityng themselfes christe whose manner wee abhorre corrupte wee woorde god wyth worldlye doctryne sekyng oure commodity euen pure hearte teache thyng came god selfes glorie iesus christe god hymselfe witnesse pthe thyrde chapter texte pwe begin praise selues againe neede epistle recommendacion vnto letter recommendacion ye epistle written hertes whiche vnderstande red men forasmuche ye declare ye epistle christ ministred v written inke spirite liuing god table stone fleshely table hearte bvt feare leste anye manne thynke agayne prayse ourselfes vnto thyntente wee maye bothe price estemed nede hath man seke commendacions matter self commendeth hym nede letter recommendacion false apostle carrie obteyned either vnto nothing passe vpon letter liuely epistle wherwyth thinke selfes sufficiently praised ye corinthian written heartes muche lesse payne carrye aboute dooe theyrs epistle place come euerye manne readeth vnderstandeth neede none epistle synce youre godlye lyfe menne perfeitelye knowe manner apostle wee farre foorth assure wee selfes youre good wyl towarde v seeyng oure owne diligente labor doth aboundantly comend v wee nede men letter commendacion while ye perfite fayth christian life declare ye christes epistle written hym dede yet ministerie laboure written say wyth ke teache humaine carnall phantasy spirite liuing god written agayne table stone mannes lawes fleashye table hearte heartes wherin wee printed doctrine gospell vsed steade parchmente tongue steade serued penne christe himselfe holye spirite indited thing whiche wrote texte suche truste haue thorowe christe godwarde sufficient ou selues thynke thing oure selues hable vnto thyng cummethe god whiche hathe made v hable ministre newe testamente letter spirite letter killeth spirite geueth lyfe ministracion death thorowe letter figured stone glorious child israel could beholde face moses glorie countenaunce whiche glorye done awaye shall ministracion spirite bee muche glorious ministryng condemnacion bee glorious muche dooth ministracion righteousnesse excede glorye doubt glorified glorified respecte exceadyng glorie whiche destroyed glorious muche whiche remayneth glorious seeyng wee haue suche truste wee vse greate boldenesse dooe moses whiche putte vayle ouer face child israell shoulde see purpose serued whiche putte awaye theyr myndes blinded vntill thys daye remaineth coueryng vntaken awaye lecture olde testament whiche vayle shalbee putte awaye christe euen vnto daye moses ad hangeth theyr heartes neuerthelesse tourne lorde vayle shall taken awaye lorde doubte spirite spirite lorde libertie beholde mirroure glorye lorde w th face open chaunged vnto similitude glorye glorye euen spy yte lorde asmuche doctrine gospell passeth better tha moses lawe somuche fruitfull better laboure yet take thus muche vpon v arrogantlye speake trueth god recorde whiche seruice christe perfourmed wee speake healpe bene certainly farre euen thinkyng vpon suche thyng owne power muche farther doyng yf eyther hable haue bene hable doe anye thynge al came free bounteousnesse god whyche hathe healped v oure labour hath committed vnto v ministerye dispensacion newe testamente thentent wee bestowe among grosse olde testament false apostle teache standeth knowlege letter administracion whereof committed moses newe testamente whiche heauenly spirituall standeth affeccions mynde ceremony lawe gospel haue one maker ministerye boothe soondrye two apostle muche excellencie letter committed vnto moses reaso certain rule lawes driueth men death forasmuch occasion prouoketh sin also condeneth sinner death whereas contrarie spirite whiche geuen preachyng ghospel forgeueth offence former lyfe suche haue deserued deathe offerethe lyfe nowe yf fyrste lawe whyche beeyng grauen stone wroughte deathe transgressour gaue grace great maiestie glorye moses seconde tyme broughte downe table hebrues coulde beeholde face reason glorie maiestie whiche sure yet bee abolished shoulde muche rather ministerye gospell haue honoure maiestie whereby throughe faythe free gifte spirite euerlastyng saluacion geuen yf lawe whiche coulde condemne hable saue hadde suche honoure certainelye muche honoure desearueth gospel preachyng whereof synne onely forgeuen ut also rihgteousnesse geuen whiche twoo thinges suche difference manne narowelye compare eche one theym whiche selfe glorious wyll appeare base beyng darkened bryght excellente glorie gospel lawe whiche geuen season shoulde wythin bee abrogate among menne suche honoure muche dignitie lawe gospell whiche bothe generallye geuen menne shall neuer bee abolished newe testament whereby olde abrogate christe hymselfe calleth euerlasting testamente epistle taught whiche thyng wee beeyng moste certainlye perswaded assured oure eachynges vse darke riddle freelye openlye sette furth lyghte gospell surelye beleuyng bothe glorye lawe suche shoulde bee hidden ye ireyngthe clearnesse conscience ye hable looke thereupon therefore wee dooe read moses didde whiche broughte downe seconde table fyrste broken couered hys face vayle child israell shoulde looke thereupon deaue thereto euer synce euen proufe significacion glorie moses lawe shoulde bee abolished whiche euen time made verye glorious vayne thyng glorious whiche manne canne see figure represented grossenesse nacion whiche seeyng sawe hearyng hearde insomuche whiche doone moses face moste verelye done theyr heartes whiche blynded beeyng ouercaste wyth vayle dulnesse yea daye blyndenesse remayneth nacion stille reade bookes lawe vnderstande theym stubberne myndes zeale towarde lawe refuse hym whose commyng lawe selfe graunteth shall bee abolyshed therefore suche sorte reade olde testament wyll embrace newe promysed therein holde faste moses vayle see faythe castyng thorowghe christe darkenesse lawe brogate stu bernelye yet stycke theyr moses cumme whome moses bade geue eare hym reade theyr synagoges reade hym carnallye sekyng nothyng corporall thynges wheras lawe menne well loke thereupon deede spiritual letted thei doubtelesse euen vntyll day wyth vayle cast ouer theyr heartes remoued fayth gospell tyme shall come shall leaue theyr grosse myndes receauyng vniuersall fayth tourne vnto lorde shall theyr vayle taken away shall see suche thynges without bryght eye fayth seen moses grosse carnall lorde iesus spirite teachyng suche thynges maye bee seene oure bodyly iyes thynges inuisible whiche fayth beleued moses law feare punishemente kepte menne ordre lawe thraldome vayle also token bondage spirite lorde iesus whiche secretelye moueth manne withoute byddyng compulsion lead godlye lyfe libertie manne compelled beleue beleueth shoulde accorde auoydeth filthines vncleanes lyfe foloweth al goodnesse dooyng wyllinglye mocion charitie coulde euer begotten iewes wyth feare punishemente blinde therefore lacke iyes faythe throughe pure fayth without vayle beholde glorye lorde whose brightnes while receyue glasse altered sorte glorye plentifully powring vpon brightnes receyued god moses face talked god shyned euen glasse doothe layed againste sonne oure soule euerye daye secr atelye enamoured encreasing glory glory reason continual conuersacion spirite god inuisiblye nowe woorkethe v whiche hereafter shal openlye bee accomplished fourth chapter texte ptherefore seeyng haue suche office euen god hath hadde mercye v wee
