goe kynde haue caste v clokes vnhonestie walke craftines neyther handle woorde god discreatefullye open trueth reporte selues euerye mannes conscience sighte god oure gospell bee yet hydde hidde among loste whome god worlde hath blinded mindes whiche beleue leste light gospell glorie christe whiche image god shoulde shyne vnto synce god mercy would haue v bee minister preacher suche blisfull state geuyng vnto v authoritie apostle execute oure commission louthfullye preache veraye gloriouse matter refuse clokes whiche meete dishonestie glorye neyther leadyng oure lyfe craftely deceitfulnes woorldely learning corruptyng woorde god frealy playnly without deceyte declaryng al men bare trouthe without cloud office vsing selfes though manne prayse v yet oure lyfe commendeth v menne whiche knowe witnesse oure perfectnes onelye menne whiche maye bee deceyued also god whiche seethe thynges v therefore al place shyneth trueth gospel euerye man may see euedently yf yet whome knowen therefore geueth saluacion faulte gospel tolde israelite haue likewyse vayle caste ouer eye theyr hearte reason wherof see suche thinges verye bright blynde middes sonne light bryng vncleare iyen suche corrupte worldlye desyres whose vnfaythfull myndes satan god worlde theyr god make hym whiche hym geue eare true god hathe blynded couering theyr iyes bryghtnes gospell geue light whereby glory maiestie declared moses christe whiche image god father sonne egall father man maye knowe father texte preache oure selues christe iesus lord selues seruauntes iesus sake god comaunded lyght shyne darknes whiche hath st yned hertes geue lyght knowledge glory god face iesus chryst haue treasure erthen vessel excellency power myght god oures troubled euery iyde yet without shyfte pouerty vtterly without somewhat suffer persecucion forsaken therein cast downe neuerthelesse peryshe wayes beare aboute body dying lorde iesus lyfe iesu myght also appeare body whiche ue alwayes delyuered vnto death iesus sake lyfe also iesu might appeare mortal flesh death worketh v lyfe auaunce oure selues preachyng doe teachyng gospell aduauntage glorie preache iesus christe oure lorde doctrine teache hym labour oure lorde mayster payne soeuer take farre takyng anye thyng arrogatly vpon v graunt selues seruauntes ministre ghospell vnto neither feare yet hope auauntage iesus sake whose loue whereas free euen seruauntes submitte selues men lyke sorte blyndnes wherewith diseased stil yet gotte light selues god whose commaundement lyght fyrste made whome light procedeth expelled darknes oure vnderstandyng commaunded lighte trueth shoulde appere rather lighte euerlastyng lightened oure hearte v glory maiestie might spread abrode among beyng notified preachyng gospel wherein preachebut haue trea ure earthen vessel lorde iesus whose face moste brightly shineth image glorie father yet greate matier onlye wrought soules secretely touchyng bodye seme vyle abiectes arie aboute v preciouse highe treasure earthen vessel saye sealye body subiecte vilanye punishment hathe pleased god good cause pleased hym prouided proude great high myracles wroughte v whereby might clayme parte therof know owne infirmitie vnderstande selfe highe power whiche geuen apostle wrought strengthe god power onely touchyng owne infirmitie dayly greatly troubled yet god help suffer al trouble continue ouercomen euery syde ouerlayed aduersitie yet withoute shifte brought beggery oure beggerye forsaken suffer persecucion yet persecucion dismayed beaten downe tredden vnder feete yet peryshe behalfe folowyng lorde iesus nyghe maye whome preache setfoorth dyed men daylye continuallye ieopardie death beare aboute oure bodyes image deathe ready bestowe lyfe sake dyeng folowe death iesus maye lyfe iesus wherunto rose deathe oure body declared whyles either hym delyuered deathe despising oure temporal lyfe playnly testifie affirme deade shall ryse agayne yf beleued bodye dead woulde neuer lyue woulde lytle regarde oure temporall lyfe thys straunge waye therfore ye see howe euerlasting lyfe christ affliccions corruptible body better knowen difference violent ieoperdy death falleth vpon oure body fruite lyfe groweth deathe whose sake put selues ieopardyes texte seyng haue spirite fayth accordyng wrytte beleued therfore spoken also beleue therfore speake know raysed vp lorde iesus shall rayse vp v also meanes iesus shall set v thynges sake plenteous grace thanckes geuen many maye redounde prayse god wherfore weryed though vtward man peryshe yet inwarde man renewed daye daye buiacyon momentany lyght prepareth exceadyng eternal waight glorye vnto v whyle loke thynges whiche sene thynges whiche sene thynges whiche seue temporall thynges whiche sene eternall yet repente v preachyng gospel since haue also euen gifte faythe ye haue whereby ye loke life immortall preachyng powred heartes foloweth dauid misticall psalme sayeth therfore spoke beleued feare nothyng ieopardye oure lyfe preache trueth gospell vndoubtedly assuryng selues whiche raysed lorde iesus death wyll throughe hym rayse v agayne dying sake bryng v together generall glorie resurreccion lyke fayth knytte together whether meane season troubled deliuered trouble done sake trueth gospel maye spread abrode among amende theyr lyfe manye geue thankes v god whose glorie appertayneth faithe would haue comen men moste plentifully enlarged hope sure co fidence trouble werye v rather ware stronger knowing wel albeit oure vtwarde body litle litle worne awaye yet inwarde better parte dayely continuall decaye body becometh quicke sustie misery growyng yong agayne beginnyng taste lyfe euerlastyng come albeit bodely affliction whiche gospelles sake abyde lyght transitory yet lyght prepareth v small exceadyng vnspeakable weight glory whyles suche transitory tormentes suffered christes sake made worthy blysse euerlastyng temporall deathe sustayned hym receaue rewarde euerlastyng lyfe hope wherof lytle esteme oure bodyly lyfe somuche passing vpon suche thynges seene owre bodylye eye vpon suche seene eye faythe suche thinges sene world beside thinges neither throughly good throughly bad whiche sorte lucre honoure pleasure lyfe losse godes reproche tormentes deathe also continuallye abydyng whereas suche thinges sene eye faythe bothe trewe ryches suche wyll endure euer v chapiter texte knowe yf oute earthly mansyon thys dwellyng destroyed haue byldyng god habitacyon made handes eternall heauen therfore sygh desyryng bee clothed oure mansyon whiche heauen yet yf founde clothed naked thys tabernacie sygh greued would vnclothed would clothed vpon mortalitie myght swalowed vp lyfe hath ordeyned v thys thynge god whiche hathe geuen vnto v erneste spirite vpon thys sure truste certaynly lytle regarde euen oure lyfe knowinge well yf chaunce soules worlde chaced mansion oure bodye whiche myght properly call tent mansion suche manne maye long tary though nomanne dryue hym thence haue prepared v another howse heauen whence shall neuer excluded howse oures made claye buylded manne whether wyll decayeth dayly albeit man pull downe euen see buyldynges continuaunce tyme destroyed mennes workmanshyp longe continuaunce whiche repayred god becomen heauenly suche ieoperdies chaunce reason tyme lytle feare departe wretched body vntyl sygh desyring discharged burdayne mortal carkas wherewith soule earth much burdeyned kept downe desyrouse flye hence another place clothed mansion gloryfied body shall heauen gyuen vnto v bee vnclothed bodye bee founde vtterlye naked confidence good lyfe clothed hope lyfe immortall grone thys meane season heuynes oure bodye thrall subiecte manye misery thyng selfe bee desyred man departe hence desyre haue bodye restored better fourme mortalitie rysyng againe receaue immortalitie seme vtterly spoyled bodye whiche tyme forsoke better clothed corruptible bodye shall receaue incorruptible albeit seme neuer vnlikely shall mortall body ryse immortall fre misery yet muste mistruste sonne god whiche hathe prepared v receaue glory lyfe immortall hathe also meane season gyuen v pledge earneste peny holy spirite confirme establyshe v present inspiracion hope whiche come texte therfore alwaye good cheare knowe longe home body absent god walke fayth outwarde appearaunce neuerthelesse good comforte leuer absent body present god wherfore whether home home endeuour selues please hym must al appeare iudgement seate christ euery man may receaue workes body accordyng hath done whether good bad seyng knowe lorde feared fate fayre men knowen wel inough vnto god trust also knowen conscience prayse selues agayne vnto geue occasyon reioyce v ye maye haue somewhat agaynst reioyce face hearte yf bee feruente god feruent yf kepe measure cause kepe measure loue christ constrayneth v thus iudge yf one dyed al dead dyed al lyue hence furth lyue vnto themselues vnto dyed rose agayne wherfore henceforth knowe man fleshe somuche though haue knowen christ flesh yet hence forth know nomore therfore yf man christ newe creature olde thynges passed away behold thynges become newe neuertheles thinges god whiche hathe reconcyled v vnto hymself iesus chryst hathe geuen v office preache attonement god chryste made agrement betwene worlde hym selfe imputed theyr synnes vnto hath commytted v preachyng attonement messenger rowme christe euen thoughe god dyd beseche thorowe v praye christes stede ye reconcyled vnto god made hym bee synne v whiche knewe synne hys meanes shoulde bee rightewesnes god alowed therfore tempestes soeuer befall v alwayes good knowing longe home thys bodylye mansion straye abrode deuided god whome departure nyghly ioyned meanyng god thys presente tyme v yet clearly sene shall bee albeit meane season bee sorte seene faythe yet farre whiche shall presently bee seene euen end obscurely therfore yf pleasure god bee body shall yet suffer affliction good hope stande shal easyly suffer hope rewarde come yet thys v muche bee desyred departe saye thys bodylye mansion suche departure may nyghly ioyned god therfore whether bee compelled continewe thys house orels muche desyre departe hence saye whether lyue dye endeuoure bee allowed god vnles manne departe hence goddes fauer let hym loke rewarde immortall lyfe whiche poynte gyue warnyng leste thinke baptisme meane sufficent therunto without godly lyuyng wycked synners theyr damnacion receaue agayne bodyes whiche abused theyr owne synfull lustes glory god euery man deseartes haue lyfe suche shall rewarde euery mann deseartes thyng yet vnkowen yet must al open syght worlde appeare iudgement seate christe nothyng shalbe hydden euery man shal reape hath sowed hys body body soule ioyned together enioy suche reward workes whyles liued whether good badde therfore hauing alway terrible daye iyes diligently laboure poyntes please god man albeit deceiue men counterfaite kyndwe knowen wel ynough vnto god holynes yet doth god throughly knowe v seeth euen bottome heartes whiche thyng man howbeit trust haue sort vsed selfe amog ye throughly knowe perceaue synceritie lyfe glorye contented auaunce office agayne eyther would made seke aduautage handes forasmuch perceiue make greate boste assigned vnto theyr office chiefe apostle geue occasion glory lykewyse v agaynste whiche respect lytle set ye haue abiect vile one apostle albeit sawe lorde mortall bodye apostle dyd yet sawe hym immortall hym receiued myne apostleshyp dyd haue hys helpe done lesse haue rehearse sake ye shoulde haue thing wherwith aunswere contented prayse owne conscience good dedes high proude lookes seke worldly commendacion wheras consieces inwardly co demnethefor feruente god feruente nothing speake sake whether speake great actes therby seame peuishe peuishe godwarde whose glory rehearse thinges helpe yf kepe measure speakyng selfes therby seme wise wise whose weaknes teper tale make selfes equal apostle boastyng loue christ constrayneth v openly speake thing appertayneth glory praise maketh v gyft thing notable done people better knowe howe death vnfruitfull forasmuch doth indifferentlye profite al people farfurth euen v thei despise sheweth power sawe christ manhode haue carnal allyaunce rather wise reason matter selfe yf christe alone indifferently dyed al foloweth generally people thrall subiecte death pleasure death redeame death woulde haue men indifferentlye bounde vnto hym therfore dyed suche hys benefite lyue beyng hym newe borne agayn shoulde longer lyue themselfes hym whiche boeth dyed rose agayne men estemed carnall affinitie yea albeit maye glory selfes stocke iewes yet synce tyme professed christes religion knowe man one stocke coumpte suche kynred lyke fayth ioyned vnto v vayne crake therfore whiche make christes owne countrey men el kynsmen lyued familiarly fleshe geuen season presently synce body taken awaye holy spirite sent wil pleasure knowen spirite coumpteth hym nyghest kynne whiche hath promisses moste affiaunce let man cause lesse esteme v later apostle knew christe lyuing earth mortal body synce yf knowe hym dede yet would haue forgone knowledge hyndred spirite woulde nowe synce become spirituall loue hym spiritually whoso therfore baptismetherfore yf man christe new creature graffed christ let hym forsake olde phantasy thinke thys man iewe man grecian bonde man fre man remembre rather howe euery man borne agayne newe man carnall man becomen spirituall olde thinges paste gone beholde christ al thinges day ly made new away therfore wordes grecia aliaunt iewe worshypper idoles spoyler holy place man hath forsaken suche workmanshyp christ altered newe creature vnlyke beast vnlyke man whatsoeuer geuen v al came fro father reconciled v vnto himselfe vaquishing sinne sonne iesus christ preaching reco ciliacion father hath put v trust sone among men dyd father message execute doe christes message albeit christ mortall earth among mortall men semed simple man yet god father reconcilinggod christe made agremente betwene world hymselfe ministery worlde vnto himselfe making new made worlde mercy receyued men fauer onely toke vengeaunce vpon v sinnes oure merlyfe also would asmuch laie vnto mannes charge hys synnes done baptisme thoughe nowe manne fauourable reconciliacion pleased god father gyue sonne woulde haue bee preached v therfore chrstes behalfe executing ambassage commytted hym vnto v euen god exhorted v beseche christes name leaue olde vyces bee reconcyled god intente would delyuer v sinne sonne verie iustyce selfe altered maner sinne rakyng flesh vpon hym v subiecte synne become sacrifice purge sinnes hainous offender among offender fastened crosse entente hym myght chaunge v whiche nothyng el synne ryghteousnesse ryghteousnesse yet ryghteousnesse law neither god whose fre goodnes sinnes forgeuen hencefurth myght take v righteouse planted christe sake vsed christe synner p vi chapter texte also helper exhorte ye receyue grace god vayne sayeth haue heard time accepted day saluacion haue suckered behold accepted time behold day saluacion let v geue occasion euyll offyce founde faute thynges let v behaue selfes minister god much pacience inafflicci necessity anguisshes stripe prisomentes stry e labour watchinges fastinges purenesse knowledge long sufferyng kyndenesse hoy ghost loue vnfayned woorde trueth power god armour rightewesnes right hand leaft honour dishonour euil reporte good reporte deceyuers yet true vnknowen yet knowen dying beholde lyue chastened kylled sorowyng yet alwaye mery poore yet make many ryche hauing nothing yet possessing al thinges ye corinthian mouth open vnto herte made large ye strayte v strayte owne bowelles promyse vnto lyke rewarde vnto chyldren tte selfes large beare yoke vnbeleuers feloshyp hath rightewesnes vnrightewesnes copany hath light darkenes concord hath christ belial either part hath beleueth infidel agreeth temple god image ye temple liuing god sayed god wil dwell among walke among wylbe god shalbe people wherfore come among sepatate selfes sayeth lord touche none vncleane thyng receyue wyll father vnto ye shalbe sonnes daughter sayeth lorde almyghtie would christ would god ye benefite take effecte therfore helper executyng god wil also prouiding weale beseche synce sinnes freely forgeuen ye nomore falle olde lyuyng thereby shewe ye haue receyued grace god vayne yf chaunce v present tyme fall may amende shall alwaye able doe prophete esai speaketh god tyme accepted haue heard daye saluacion haue suckered beholde accepted tyme promysed god fauourable wherin god refuseth synner repenteth herte beholde nowe daye wherein may lyuyng godly obtayne saluacion tyme wyll folowe terrible daye wherin shall vayne seke reconciled therfore behalfe laboryng doe dueties take hede poynt geue man occasion euil leste fault gospell christ wherof minister reproued blamed might leade liues men beleuing thinges teache al poyntes shew selfes dede conuenient labour god seruice howe proue selfes suche dede surely neither high lokes bade men gaynes taking chargeyng menne ceremony doe euen christ approued hymselfe saye muche pacience dayly affliccions necessity distreasses sufferaunce stripe enprisonmentes sufferyng sedicions fastyng cleanesse lyfe apostolique knowledge courteousnesse kyndnesse holy ghoste pure vnfayned charitie woorde trueth bolde enterpryses vpon worldly strength vpon power god furnished withby armoure ryghteousnesse weapon worldely defence euery syde surely fensed armoure iustice ryght hande vpryght conscience prosperitie waxe proude thesame leafte syde also aduersities dismayed vpon trust helpe god ieopardies thruste breake preache ghospell honoure dishonour good reporte euyll coumpted deceyuers whereas tell trueth taken menne vnknowen whereas knowen lyke suche dying ye see lyue menne chastened kylled menne beyng sorie whereas alwayes meary poore menne yet euryche many menne haue nothyng yet christe possesse thynges shoulde people charitie bee enryched theyr patrimonie yf lusted vse ryght whither plucked vehemence tale moued cannot refraine vtter vnto al mynde towarde ye corinthian mouthe open heart enlarged suche confidence haue bolde glory synce lothe condicion repente ye yf ye contente mynde bothe haue cause glory ye lesse cause reioyce without cause ye ye sake straight narrow mynde yf straitnes groweth euyll myndes welth leaue nothyng vndone vnsuffered ye towarde agayne beare lyke loue hope resurreccion loue borne toward manfully abydei promise vnto like rewarde vnto child suffer trouble synce ye looke haue thesame rewarde synce haue hetherto loued lyke father meete ye strength myndes resemble father vnreadines lay vnto charge mine aduersaries rehearse dearely beloued chyldren despise watryshe ceremony iewes despise worlde trust suche good thynges verely vyle straite mynde cummethe bee contente presente thynges straite mynde desyre nothyng worldely vanity whiche wyll soone peryshe christe aboundantly ryche aboundantly gloryouse aboundantly myghtie welthy let hym sufficient hym embrace ye heartes knowe condicion looke vpon welthy state coumpt selfe greater vnbelieuers haue thing doe betwixt difference wyll suffre yoked together agrement betwixt ryghteousnes vnrighteousnesse vnryghteousnesse companie hathe lyght darkenesse concorde hathe christe beliall goddes diuerse religion diuerse diuerse maners diuerse hope howe agreeth temple god heathen image ye temple lyuyng god god hymselfe holy scripture testifieth saying wyll dwell among walke among wyl theyr god againe shalbee people specially consecrate halowed vnto yf iewes abhorre gentile vnpure cursed flye infeccion come ye good people veryly consecrate lyuyng god companye vnreligious kepe selfes theyr felowshyppes lord prophete esai exhorteth saying synce ye holy touche vncleane thyng wycked maners verily vncleane full ieopardouse contagion whose company beware leste cleannes defiled counsell flie standeth somuche chaungyng place chaungyng myndes yf ye doe wyll knowledge receyue holy holy selfe shall ye fynde father embrace sonnes saieth lord almightye lesse ye myght mystruste promise maker p vii chapter texte seyng haue suche promyses dearly beloued let v clense selues lthynesse fleshe spyrite growe vp full holinesse feare god vnderstande v haue hurte manne haue corrupte manne haue defrauded manne speake condemne haue shewed ye heartes dye lyue bolde ouer reioyce greatly fylled comforte e ceding ioyous tribulacion come macedonia fleshe rest troubled euery syde outwarde fightyng inwarde feare neuerthelesse god comforteth abiecte comforted v cummyng titus cummyng onely also consolacion whiche receyued tolde v desyre feruente mynde reioysed though made sorye letter repente th uch dyd repente perceyue thesame epistle made sorye thought season nowe reioyce ye sorye ye sorowed ye repented ye sorowed godly nothyng ye hurte v godly sorowe causeth repentaunce vnto saluacion bee repented contrary wyse worldely sorowe causeth death beholde diligen godly sorowe ye tooke hathe wrought yea caused cleare youre selues caused indignacion caused feare caused desyre caused punyshement thynges ye haue shewed selues ye cleare matter wherefore though wrote vnto dyd cause done hurte neyther cause hurte good mynde v myght appeare among syght god therefore comforted ye comforted yea erceadynglye ioyed ioy titus hadde spyryte refreshed therefore nowe ashamed though sted selfe hym thynges whiche speake vnto true euen boasting made vnto titus founde true inwarde affeccion aboundant towarde remembreth obedience howe eare trembling ye receyued reioyce may bolde ouer al thinges vpon sure trust suche promyses god therfore let v vse selfes dearly beloued seme worthy thesame cleansyng selfes onely filthynesse body also soule may leade hurtlesse lyfe among menne haue therwith vpryght harte god furnyshed full perfite holynesse agaynste cummyng christe meane season doyng dueties dissimulacion hypocrite doe feare god geueth euery manne reward accordyng deseartes wyde large loue whiche beare towarde claspe embrace together whole harte receiue ye lykewise harte specially synce ye receyue loue lesse theyr costly fyndyng disdaynfulnesse chargeable vnto besyde lode also ceremony neuer hurte false learningwe haue hu haue defrauded man corrupted violently exacted ought man whiche ye muste take spoken condemne reiecte make better haue alreadie wryten vnto may clearly perceyued harte loue stronge bande charitie knytte vnto readie bothe lyue dye suche greate trust haue vpon youre head dare waraute thyng greate cause haue glorye whome haue poyntes founde obediente offence letted freely reproue nowe see amended harte coumforted full gladnesse myne affliccions whiche elswyse many daungerouse stormes clearly wyped waye sorowe mynde takyng pleasure suffer suche mennes sake commen macedonia bodye hadde reste troubled euery syde outwardlye vexed suche aduersaries fought agaynste ghospell inwardlye feare leste false apostle craftie meanes myght peruerte aduersaries ghospell beaten afrayed leste beeyng dismayed oure miserable state myght despayre god whiche coumforteth lowe abiecte person coumforted refreshed v cummyng titus onely comegod comforteth abiecte comforted v cumyng titus whose companie specially desyred also came merye gladde made merye made gladde merye lykewyse tolde howe desyrouse ye howe ye weap e wayled beeyng offended came yet vnto shewed moreouer howe diligently ye obeyed comaundementes insomuche enfourmed titus toke pleasure diligence amendement sad offence lothe time make sorye yet synce fortuned wel repent letter made sadde albeit dyd repente althoughe thesame epistle whiche bothe sorowful season made sorye yet nowe well therewith pleased made sorye sorowe broughte repentaunce worlde hathe certayne kynde sorowe vnfruitefull hurtefull menne either losse money losyng theyr pleasure wrathe enuye disquieted theyr myndes christian religion also certayne sorowe suche profitable good meane wherof ye farre beyng worse thesame ye well amended become godly sorye hath displeased god sheweth thereby amendedgodly sorowe causeth repentaunce vnto saiuacion sorowe sorte bringeth one repentaunce suffereth manne fall agayne vnto olde faultes contrarywise sorowe whiche groweth worldelye desyres worketh death hurtefull bothe bodye soule dooeth youre state declare maner diligence hathe godlye sorowe youres wroughte speake diligence myghte muche rather saye satisfaccion wherewith ye haue cleared youre selues playnelye shewyng ye approue vnhappie deede yea mighte saye indignacion sharpe agaynste offender compelled moue bee fauourable gentle yea feare thoughe one mannes leopardye hadde belonged yea desyre foorthwith amende faulte yea zeale loue folowe sin banishyng dishonestie bee shorte desyre also reuenge appeared whiche dyd faulte straighte punished ye haue poyntes declared youre selues bee cleare free matter wherfore thoughe wrote vnto matter thoughe hadde belonged wrote onelye fake whiche dydde faulte hym agaynste whome dooen rather ye shoulde perceyue great care haue god witnes whiche sopensyfe bothe leste infeccion myghte crepe among faulte one two infecte whole bodye agayne leste shoulde bee vnknowen loue ye beare towarde whose wyll ye gladlye obeyed synce vnto coumfortable whiche reioyse suche amended meete shoulde gladde also youre gladnes pleasure myne gladnes titus encreased whiche vpon commendacion receyued among hearte refreshed sawe howeye esteemed nowe yf haue hym thyng bosted youre vertue obedience haue taken shame ieopardye prayseth manne hym praysed vnto praysed hym bothe chaunced well ye poyntes founde titus suche one tolde euen founde suche thinges true bosted vnto hym therfore neither hym ashamed lying whereas heretofore loued nowe yet vpon profe youre gentlenes euen verye heart roote loueth whyles bethinketh hymselfe calleth mynde gladlye ye obeyed oure mynde whiche broughte vnto also feare reuerence yo receyued hym cummyng certaynlye glad fynde suche maye thinges hereafter bolde vpon hencefurthe wyll feare require thyng viii chapter texte certyfy brother grace god geuen congregacyos macedonia aboundaunce theyr reioising tryed much tribulacion though exceading poore yet haue geuen exceading richely synglenes theyr power beate record ye beyond theyr power wyllyng theyr owne accorde prayed v great instauce would receaue theyr benefyte suffre partaker ministryng sayntes loked gaue theyr owne selues first lord vnto v wyl god coulde desyre titus accomplyshe thesame beneuolence among also euen begonne therfore ye shoulde herein also satisfie bothe desyre resemble godly deuocion congregacions certifie brother howe god asisted church macedonia ready ioyfull myndes receyued gospell farre fro beeyng discouraged affliccions silas whiche v also trouble throughe confidence gospell ioyfully endured al persecucions briefely greater tormentes suffered glad oure deliueraunce whereas needy exceading poore yet suche hearty myndes litle whiche lefte theyr emptie cofers departed reliefe poore meane wherof poorer became broughte neede throughe theyr godly liberalitie rycher growen gentle heartes singlenes onely founde harde geuyng theyr goodes also beare true witnes thei would good wyll onely geue accordyng theyr ability also theyr ability insomuche fearyng leste suche exceading great liberalitie reason nede might doen sorte refused receyue theyr free offer moste instantelye besoughte v suffer partaker prayse whiche geuyng parte theyr substaunce reliefe saynctes might agayne partaker theyr godlynes doyng onely satisfying desyre also loked onely offered theyr goodes also frely gaue theselues first god v also wil god whose inspiracion moued gladly obey v hose good minde greatly pleased exhorted titus hys good counsell ye already begun liberalitie vpon good people would accomplishe whiche begun intent ye shoulde beholding vnto whome ye haue obteyned godly prayse beneuolence poynt ye behinde none texte nowe therefore ye ate ychein party fayth woorde knowlage al feruentues loue whiche ye haue v euen see ye plenteous beneuolence also saye commaunding feruentues doe alow unfainednes loue towarde men ye knowe liberalitie lorde iesus christ though tyche yet sake became poore ye pouertie might made riche geue counsell hereto expediente whiche began doe u ly also yere agoe nowe therfore performe thing whiche ye began doe tedines euen ye may perfourme dede whiche ye haue first willing minde accepted according man hath according hath rather ye gyftes passe wit gift fayth gift tonges gift knowledge gift diligent ministring gift charitie ye haue declared toward v ye likewise gift excellent require much rehearse ready mindes macedonian ye example prouoked frely declare vnfayned charitie behalfe folowing lorde iesus christe asmuch ye able albeit ryche lorde al yet would doe v good hys free goodnes made himselfe poore hydyng hys almightye power became manne ende throughe hys pouertie ye might bee enryched makyng chaunge wherein receiued pouertie humanitie woulde make v partaker rich godhead therfore letter required leade syngle lyfe weale profite counsayled thereto thys matier commaunde geue counsell geue counsell thynke shall profitable namely since thynge geue counsell suche ye haue alreadye without counsell onely begunne dooe also gladly owne myndes begunne nowe remayneth thys suche thynges ye haue begun dooe ye perfourme dede ye willyngly mynded yere paste ye perfourme macedonian gaue exaumple aboue habilitie dyd euery manne able manne geueth hys acceptable mannes bee good ready sufficiente though gift measured hys habilitie man required geue hath texte p mynde set ease ye brought cumbrauce egalnes time aboundaunce maye succour lacke theyr aboundaunce supplye lacke maye equalitie agreeing whiche written much aboundaunce bad litle bad neuerthelesse thakes vnto god put good minde herte titus accepted requeste ye rather well willing owne accorde came vnto must men vse theyr liberalitie vpon whome bestowed liue rest pleasauntly geue brought pouertie egalnes kept among witte youre rich wherof ye haue aboudauce pouerty may relieued fayth godlines wherin passe may recompence perchaunce wanteth whyles eche departeth neyther lacke anye thyng bee equalitie obserued reade chaunced oure elder gatheryng manna whiche gathered hym remayned whiche gathered lesse written booke exodi muche aboundaunce litle neuerthelesse temporall rich haue season liue tyme tyme man long beefore caste hys penyworthes shall haue lefte hym ye goe way worke man thinke hath sufficient spare geue vnto present tyme man hath nede thou hast much thou hast inough geue presente nede requireth hereafter chaunce thou thyselfe nede thou shalt like liberalitiie eased thankes geue vnto god whiche inspired good purpose titus hearte well myne gladly accepted request elswise well disposed thereto yea came vnto much request good wil albeit myne encouraging better willed texte haue sente hym brother whose laude gospell throughout congregacions onely also chosen congregacyons bee felowe v iourney concernyng thys beneuolence minystred v vnto prayse lorde stiere vp prompt mynde thys exchewe manne shoulde rebuke v thys plenteous distribucion ministred v glory lorde make prouision honest thinges onely sight lord also sight hym haue wee sent brother whose faythe entyrenesse preachynge gospell throughout congregacions well tryed wel tryed congregacyons chosen reste bee felowe companyon iourney bee helper gatheryng money whiche ye liberalytye geue glorye lorde whose mocy n thys matier wroughte playne declaracyon menne prompte myndes dyscrecion would perfite tryed menne put thys busynesse leste weake personnes conceyue suspicion thys great summe money whiche ye free goodnesse geue much gathered selues whereas wee thereof take nothing selues labor trauaile gather conuay wel know gather money specyally summe bee great hath apparentesuspicyon griedines aswel knowe mennes conscience nothyng sooner corrupted texte haue sente brother whome haue ofte time proued diligent many thynges nowe muche diligente great confidence whiche haue hath caused thys dooe partely titus sake whiche felowe helper concerning partely whiche brother messenger congregacions glorye christe wherefore shewe ye vnto proofe loue boasting sighte congregacions two whome ye haue good experience haue adioyned thirde certain brother whome albeit ye knowe well yet diuerse thynges haue oft tymes founde hym dilygente faythfull thys businesse diligent nothyng doubte ye summe money truste partely vpon consideracion titus whiche felowe partaker labor whiche vndertake sake partely consideracion also adioyned whiche besides brother also chosen dooe businesse voyces congregacions whome glorye gospell set foorthe may well called onely apostle also glory christe shall ye sorte vse selues ye nowe specially declare howe greatly ye loue v haue without cause boasted vnto suche gentlenes ye shewe vnto ye shall shewe toward congregacions whose messenger p ix chapter texte pof ministring saintes superfluous write vnto knowe redines mynde whereof boaste selfe vnto macedonia achia prepared yere agoe ensaumple hath prouoked many neuerthelesse yet haue sent brother lest boasting whiche make vayne behalfe ye haue sayde may prepare selues leste peraduenture macedonia come fynde vnprepared wee say ye shoulde ashamed matter boasting wherfore thought necessarie exhort brother come hand vnto prepare good bles yng promised afore might readie blessing detraudyng howe bestow labour letter moue charitable vpon poore thinke superfluous synce haue readie good myndes suche sure perfite knowledge nothynge doubte boaste thereof among macedonian farre exaumple onely corinthe welnyghe achaia dysposed ready well mynded lyke liberalitie albeit well assured youre good mynde beefore yet thought amysse sende brother lest happely appeare meane haue made vayne boaste poynte whiche thynges hitherto haue done sayde nowe purpose sent wee wrote vnto money gathered good tyme bee redinesse whiche euery man willyng geue leste macedonian whome haue boasted come fynde vnprepared bee put shame one hath made vayne bragge saye leste ye bee put shame menne thys vnlike selues whiche giftes excell thys cause thoughte good desyre brother goe thether vnto beefore came myselfe prepare contribucion whiche ye purposed appoynted mighte readines wont called speake greke eulogia saye blessyng euerye benefite shoulde gladlye without murmuryng geuen taken bee rather extorcion fre gifte wil geue let hym freely geue asmuche thys poynte warne manne geueth rewarde shall haue texte thys yet say whiche soweth litle shall reape litle soweth plenteously shall reape plenteously let euery manne dooe accordyng hath purposed hearte grudginglye necessitie god loueth cherefull geuer god hable make ryche grace ye thynges hauyng sufficient vnto vtmoste may bee ryche vnto maner good woorke written hath sparsed abrode hath geuen poore righteousnes remaineth euer ministrethe seede vnto sower ministre bread also foode multiply seede increase fruites righteousnesse al partes ye may made rich al singlenes causeth thorow v thankes geuen vnto god office thys ministracyon onelye supplyeth nede sainctes also aboundaunte herein laudable ministryng thankes might geuen god many whiche prayse god obedience consentyng gospell christ synglenes distributing men theyr praiers whiche long aboundaunte grace god thankes vnto god hys vnspeakable gifte whoso soweth litle shall reape litle soweth plenteouslye good chere shall lykewise reape sowed doe bad hym hys hearte hath purposed largely freely geueth whiche geueth good sparingly geueth whiche geueth heuie chere one compelled god loueth chearefull geuer dooeth hys duetie agaynste hys hym coumpted thoughe dyd hys duetie cause none ye feare leste ye lose almes god coumteth bee doone vnto hym whiche hys loue bestowed vpon hys saintes sufficiently able albeit ye receyue recompence menne make almes dedes gaynfully returne vnto wil geue substaunce inough mayntenaunce lyfe also enryche plentifully encrease godlye woorkes almes dedes whiche bestowed relieue poore saintes good parte iustice godlines eue psalme writer testifieth also dealed abrode gaue poore whiche hys iustice continueth tyme tyme perpetually prayer ministreth sede vnto sower geueth bread hys nouryshmente substaunce helpe poore people mayntayne alwayes rich eftsones helpe multiplye seede increase fruites righteousnes ye may eriched al kindes vertues therewith alwayes growe forwarde al synglenesse gentle dysposicion hert ye dayly regard money lesse lesse bee bestowed vpon euerye rascall vpon saynctes dooe cause youre lyberalitie auaunce goddes glorye godlye people beeyng refreshed youre almes doe v geue thankes vnto god herein claime rewarde whiche bryng matter passe execucion office wee onelye youre liberalitie attayne reliefe poore men also greater almes geue thankes god whiche hauyng experience youre godlinesse ounteousnesse prayse god dooe perceaue youre obedience gospell one accorde reason whereof ye dooe freelye frankelye deale youre substaunce onelye whome wee sue presente tyme also poore muste bee holpen wheresoeuer bee finallye ensueth theyr prayer whiche thankefull menne offre vnto god wishe see maye euidentelye see theyr face singular godlinesse whiche knowe bee geuen god greatenesse almes wherewith refreashed vnspeakeable gifte specially thankes ought bee geuen god whych moueth mind geue prouoketh abuse giftes idlenes riot prayse god x chapter texte pi paule selfe beseche meekenes softenes christe whiche presente among reputacion bolde towarde beeing absente beseche neede bolde presente confidence supposed haue bene bolde againste repute v though walked carnally though walke fles yet warre fleshly weapens warrefare carnall thynges thinges mighty god caste downe strong holdes wherewith wee ouerthrowe councels euerye hye thyng exalteth itselfe againste knowledge god bring captiuitie imaginacion obedience christe readye take vengeaunce disobedience obedience fulfilled loke ye thinges vtter appearaunce bvt let passe thinges come meane apostle verye selfesame paule whome ye knowe well whiche sake bothe haue suffered dooe suffer greate trouble doe beseche mekenes softenes mercie iesus christ whose exaumple folowyng dooe humble selfe among outwardelye behauyng self though rascall outcaste taking vpo apostle dignitie authoritie false apostle thynke stande highe lookes yet myne absence caytifes quarell fraye roughe cruell letter beeyng bolde vpon youre obedience beseche saye redresse youre lyfe cummyng bee compelled execute selfesame authoritie agayne seame haue vsed agaynst certaine false apostle thinkyng bee suche bee reporte carnally lyue among flatterer presente courye fauel feare beeyng absente b letter boaste selfe though feared nothyng nothyng carnall minde whatsoeuer ali weale glory gospel though bee clothed mortall fleashe yet warre wee vnder rule gouernaunce fleashe holpen wyth assistence spirite god lowe weake ye thinke v yet vnweaponed without strength suppresse aduersaries gospel weapon spiritual warrefare mighty reason yron steele worldlye mennes wont mighty power god able throwe downe euerseameth stronglye buylded agaynste hym ith ouerthrow tourne vpsyd al crafty deuises euery high state wicked people whiche exalte auaunce themselfes vpon theyr worldly wisedome agaynst wisedome god gospel professe suppresse also subdue bryng captiuitie al worldlye imaginacion make hencefoorth obediente vnto christe whome resisted yf manne stubbernly rebelle readye wee reuenge vpon al disobedience power sake haue hytherto forborne leste vsing extremitie vpon among yet fauoure supposyng bee excellente apostle myghte trouble commen quietenesse whiche yet hereafter vse paraduenture see obedience growen suche perfeccion ye canne quietly contented suche shoulde bee excluded youre coumpanye ye punishemente haynous incestuous fornicatoure tell dignitie power apostle bodily power spirituall ye yet wiser iudge apostle suche thynges seene lyke commen people esteame lorde bee gaye felowe outewarde ambicious por e gyftes fortune bande men texte yf manne truste himselfe christes let consider agayne af himselfe e christes euen wee christes though boast self oure authoritie whiche lorde hath geuen v edifie destroy shal bee shame leste shoulde seame thoughe wente aboute make afrayed letter epistle saieth sore strong bodily presence weake speche rude let suche thinke wise wee woordes letter absente suche wee deedes presente tyme nothyng speake false apostle generally speakyng saye yf man thynke christes eyther saw mortall bodye earth vnto hym nigh aliaunce kinred lette hym agayne likewise remembre wyth hymselfe christes wee christes beehalfe wee good nothing hath wherewith please hymselfe despyse v spirite whiche maketh v igher christe carnall kynred nothyng dooe yet hytherto make selfe equall apostle yf somewhat tooke vpon aboue gloried myne authoritie rather myne geuen vnto lorde geuen vnto doo good hurte thynke shame thoughe vaynly bosted self truely hyghe authoritye speake nothyng lest thinke threatening epistle would make afrayed sayeth one whome honour sake name paule sendeth arrogante vehemente letter presente altogether vnlike hymselfe e weake bodye wherein maiestye hys speche rude parte resembleth authoritye wherwyth epistle thunder lyghten despiseth authoritie hym well e speche myne epistle absence whiche menne saye vehemente suche oure power authoritie beeyng presente yf wee see cause vse bragge wyth woordes suche thynges cannot deede perfourme lyghte persones texte wee cannot fynde oure hertes make oure selues noumbre compare oure selfes whiche prayse themselues neuerthelesse whyle measure themselues wyth themselues compare themselues wyth themselues vnderstande noughte reioyce aboue measure accordyng measure rule whiche god hath distributed vnto v measure reache euen vnto wee stretche oure selues beyonde measure thoughe wee reached vnto euen also haue come wyth gospel christ wee boaste oure selues oute measure men e labour yea wee hope wyll cumme passe faith increased among wee shal bee magnified accordyng oure measure largelye shal preache ghospell region whiche beeyonde boaste thynges whiche another mannes measure prepared alreadye lette hym reioyseth reioyce lorde prayseth hymselfe alowed lorde prayseth canne wee fynde oure heartes accoumpt selfes noumbre compare oure authoritie wyth suche wyth deceytefull meanes crakyng woordes auaunce themselfes deedes whiche meane season forgea e howe measure themselfes theyr owne dooynges settefoorthe themselfes comparison menne without courage themselfes bee anye waye proue theyr owne syngularnesse deprauynge mennes actes praysynge theyr owne god forbydde wee shoulde wythoute ende glorye dooe yf euerye manne hadde desyre bee taken greate arrogauncye woulde make hymselfe certaynelye woulde bee boastyng ney measure ende yet take wee vpon v mennes glorye accordyng vnto measure condicion suche actes haue goddes helpe doone esteame oure selues wee bee asmuche gaue v muche take vpon v beyonde thys glory surelye wee haue sklendrelye enlarged dominion oure capitayne whiche came euen farre myne owne head onely sente god sufficient matter glorye haue wee came vnto commen sorte suche sorte v gospell christe preached vnto wee neede hyghe woordes prayse oure selfes thoughe wee deede reached vnto whyche el wyse verye easye bee wo e came wee vnto beyng alreadye brought beliefe false apostle vse fyrst al perswaded boaste wee oure selfes aboue measure mennes labour takynge vpon v prayse mennes actes cowardly capitaines dooe chalenge prayses winnyng holde whiche another manne gote rather wee truste fayth daylye encreaseth groweth wee shall also geate praise accordyng vnto marke appoynted vnto v god preache also gospell christe countreyes beyonde auaunce hys banner wee haue hytherto doone dooyng actes throughe anothers guidyng vnder souldier enteryng vpon already gotten malapertly taking vpon v praise mennes labour point wee rather onely boaste selfes mennes actes also take vpon glorye myne owne knowyng whosoeuer doth reioyce muste reioyce christes name whose businesse doeth commended god whiche bloweth abrode hys prayses chosen god meete persone faythefullye doothe office co mitted vnto hym onely one whome lorde approueth prayseth xi chapter texte woulde god ye could haue suffered litle folishnesse yea ye dooe also forbeare gelous ouer godly gelouslye haue coupled manne make chaste virgin christe yet refrayne muste somewhat gloriouslye sette foorth selfe notwithstandyng knowe taken pointe folishnes yf manne prayse hy selfe would god ye woulde litle suffre playe foole yea doub ye wil beare folishenesse dryuen neither arrogant mynde yet anye desyre auauntage vehemente feruente loue beare towarde mighte call ialousye certainelye al u ouer euerye thyng afrayed whome tenderlye loue loue worldelye sorte godlye selfe ialouse christes beehalfe hym youre onelye spouse haue spirituallye maried chaste vndef ied virgin whome ye may neuer bene deuided take nothyng myne christe spouse mariage maker texte p feare leste cumme passe serpente beeguyled eue hys subtiltie euen youre wyttes shoulde bee corrupte singlenesse ye hadde towarde christe cummeth preache iesus hym whome preached ye receyue spirite whiche ye haue receyued eyther gospell ye haue receyued ye myghte ryghte well haue beene contente suppose behynde chiefe apostle though bee rude speakynge yet knoweleage howebeit monge wee haue bene knowen vtmoste thynges dydde therein synne submytted selfe ye myghte bee exalted preached gospell god free robbed congregacious tooke wage dooe seruice presente nede chargeable manne whiche lackyng vnto brother came macedonia supplyed thynges kep e selfe shoulde bee chargeable manne kepe selfe delyuered vnto hym pure chaste virgin craftie serpent beguiled symple mynde eue corrupting purenes wherein made feare leste throughe subtiltie false apostle youre simple wittes bee corrupted chaunge purenesse whiche ye haue hitherto vsed towarde iesus christe youre husbande whome poyntes pure ye purelye receiued v newe apostle whiche hathe entered vpon labour taughte iesus whiche preached vnto hym ye receyued spirite whiche ye receyued v taughte ghospell whiche taughte mighte ye lawefullye suffer hym braggyng auauncynge hymselfe aboue v one whiche hadde geuen coulde geuen v nowe ye receyue nothyng whiche plentifullye gaue shoulde matter meane ye manier dysdayne v beare theyr arrogante hautenes bee bee hyghe apostle yet touchyng encrease ghospell surelye thynke selfe poynte behynde anye chiefe apostle bee bee eloquente yet knowledge geue place nede paynted tale thyng selfe presente lette neuer muche theyr blasyng woordes boaste themselues haue veraye deedes shewed towardes oure myndes power apostolique ye coulde v fynde lacke excepte peraduenture displease whiche ye shoulde moste commende oure good myndes haue disdaynefulnesse beene painefull vnto bee among humbled submitted selfe deceiue thereby throughe myne humblenes exaulte faithe costlye vnto freelye mine owne finding preached vnto ghospell god farre foorthe sparing withstandyng great pouertye yet rather robbe congregacions would without charge dooe seruice muche time chargeable manne among though great nede pouertie relieued came macedonia thing also haue lykewise hereafter warely kepe selfe man bee chargeable texte p trueth christe bee thys reioysyng shal bee taken region achaia wherefore loue god knoweth neuerthelesse dooe dooe cut away occasyon whiche desyre occasyon myghte bee founde lyke vnto v wherein reioyce suche false apostle disceateful woorkers fashion themselues lyke vnto apostle christ marueil satan hymselfe chaunged fasshyon aungell lyghte therfore great thing though hys minister fashion themselues though minister righteousnesse whose de shalbe according theyr dedes speake arrogantly alway fauour aide trueth christe onely corinthe also whole countrey achaia thys glorye myne preachyng gospell freely shall taken doe despyse liberalitie anye hatred borne toward god knoweth thys cause whiche dooe mynde dooe hereafter cut away occasyon suche v seeke fynde faulte menne ryche pretendyng openly refuse rewardes yet receyue secretlye muche poynte wherein seeke false prayse founde better wee whiche muche pouertie receiue oughte anye man sufferyng shoulde passe v thys vayne counterfaycte kynde godlinesse dede preache gospell good theyr owne lucre auauncemente whereas neither sente christ dooe christes seruice yet take falsely vpon honor apostle name make though hyred vineyarde lorde hys woorkemen hynder hys businesse vnder pretence gospell seeke theyr belly fare enterlasyng theyr owne doctrine muche like whiche intendyng deceiue mingle pureste wine deadly poysone takyng vpon meane season apostle persone vnder colour autoritie shadow hygh name may rather deceiue simple people lyke enterlude player apostle surely moste deuelyshe kinde deceite vnder colour religion sowe venemous poyson vngodlines say christe theyr maister dede dooe deuill seruice maruaile scholers resemble theyr maisters euen darke deuill satan hymselfe craftie meane hurteth menne whan dyssemblyng enchauntemente turneth hymselfe lykenesse bryghte aungell suche vnfayned dysciples christe vse deceite thereyn resemblyng theyr maister new thyng minysters deuyll take vpon contrary persone whereas serue vuryghteousnesse may yet seeme minysters ryghteousnesse whiche beeyng moste false traytours pretendyng frendshyp extreme enemy vse yet myne autoritie vpon quyetnesse leaue theyr malyce shall escape punyshement euill woorkes shall haue euil ende texte p say agayne leste manne thynke foolyshe orels euen nowe take ye foole also maye boast selfe litle speake speake orde folyshelye thys matter bostyng seing many oy e eshe wyll e oyce also ye suffre fooles gladlye seing ye selues wyse ye suffre manne brynge boudage manne deuoure manne take manne exalte hym selfe manne smite face speake concerning rebuke though bene weake behalfe nowe muste agayne desyre beare may sumwhat truely boaste actes leste thynke foolishenes praise selfe yf obtain much yet beare muche foolyshenesse ye synce marcha ntes among much crake themselues may also somewhat glorye selfe whiche nowe say shall sauer pure spirite christe rather worldly foolyshenes glorye suche thynges whiche nothing brynge v goddes fauoure suche whereof foolyshe commensorte woonte bragge crake whereas true glorye resteth knowe lyke foolyshenesse dooe false preacher crake copel yet ye fondly suffer glory since therfore among manye whiche woulde coumpted apostle yet boaste suche thynges make apostle dignitie wil also sumwhat selfe glory folowing theyr foolyshenes whiche oure foolyshenes ye shal meane season take good woorthe wyse menne ye gladly beare mennes foolyshenesse good reason amonge manye continually glorye ye whyle suffer synce reioysynge shall vnto paynefull theyrs ye suffer willyngly bee broughte bondage whereas christe woulde haue free anye costes deuoure weare oute whereas frely taught ye suffer receiuing presentes giftes diminishe substaunce throughe pryde vse tyrannye vpon yea whiche poynte extreame vilannye smyte face hys hande thys dooe yet handle way vila lesse theyr thys dooyng ye thynke hygh apostle hauyng pryce suche thynges whiche commenly coumpted foolyshenes manne auaunte hymselfe though coulde abuse tytles power autoritie kepe vnder rather hadde greater respecte youre wealthe dominion texte howbeit wherin soeuer man dare bolde speake foolishly dare bolde also hchrues euen israelite euen sede abraha euen minister christ speake foole labore aboudaunt st p aboue measure prieson plent ous death iewes ue me receiued euery ne fortie stripe saue one thrise beaten oddes stoned suffered thrise pwracke nyghte day haue bene pe ourneing often parels water parels robber opardies ne ne ne eoperdies among heathen parels e parels wy dernes parels ea parels mong false brother labor trauail watching ten hunger thi ste fast nges often could nakednes besyde thynges ou ardly happen vnto bred dayly doe ar al congregacions ho weake weake offended burne ust nedes boaste boaste thinges concerne myne infirmity speake lyke foole crake maketh much stand conceites wherin match would haue seme great mater bee hebrue though god much regarded sto ke man cumeth yet bee thing wurth bee hebrue borne hebrue also israelite sede abraham euen vain tytles brag themselues yet lusted glory good poyntes whiche verely make toward glorye apostle passe minister christ let speake thys foolishly yet truely declared neither wth high looke takyng presentes braggyng kyndred suche meanes uidetly proued mine apostolique spirite haue take paine stry e haue suffered oft time emprisoned eop rdie death often ye lust heare particular rehearsall iewes fyue tymes receyued euery time fortye stripe saue one thryse beaten argeauntes roddes stoned thrise suffered shipwracke night day haue bene deape sea without extreme desperacyon lyfe nede make syngulare rehearsall synce gospel sake haue time bene ieoperdie onely sea also lande oftentymes ieoperdies water peryll robber perill reason per ecucion iewes eoperdies among violent heathen perill ci peril wildernes peril sea lyke haue bene slayne mariner ieoperdie suche vnder false name christian men resisted gospel wil let passe continual labour trauayls taken gospel sake rehear e continual often watchinges huger thrust suffered often time often fastynges payne coldenesse nakednes paine haue hitherto rehersed appertain onely bodely affliccion meane season lykewyse lesse trouble carefulnesse mynde take suche multitude congregacions hartely tender whatsoeuer chaunceth vnto thinke chauce vnto self whose misery sory myne owne weake diseased whose weakenes also g ieued selfe offe ded whose displeasure mind offeded yf must nedes bost rather wil bost thinges shew mine infirmitie shew greatnes let bost gospel sake much made grow riche vnder christes tytle beare great rule uly thinke boast christes sake haue suffered vilany affliccion texte god farher ou lorde iesus christe whiche blessed euermore kneweth lye ne damasco gou nou e people vnder kyng retas layde watche citie damascens woulde haue caughte wynd let downe basket thorowe wall scaped handes god father lorde iesus christe knoweth lye nothyng damasco whome kyng areta father lawe herode hadde made ruler ouer countreye layed watche citie damasco labouryng meanes coulde take iewes pleasure woulde haue kylled auctour sedicion shoulde learned lorde sometyme cruell persecucion flye mynde gaue tyme yet comen suffer martyrdome rather tyme required preache gospell abrode tyranne rounde besette refuge none basket throughe wyndowe wall rope lette downe thus escaped ruler handes xii chapter texte doubtlesse expedient boast wyll come vision reuelacions lorde knowe man christ aboue fourtene yeares goe whether bodye cannot tell whether body cannot tell god knoweth howe taken vp thyrde heauen know thesame man whether body body cannot tell god knoweth howe taken vp pa adyse heard secrete wordes whiche vtter man boast selfe wyll boast e cepte myne infirmity thoughe would b al fole would saye trouth neuerthelesse spare leste man shoulde thynke aboue whiche seeth heareth leste shoulde exalted measure thorowe excellencye reuelacious geuen vnto vnquietnesse thorow fleshe euen messenger sata buffer shoulde exalted ou measure thyng besought lorde thryse might departe sayed vnto grace sufficient strength made perfect thorowe weakenesse gladly therfore wyll ioyce weakenes strength christ may dwell farre foorth haue rehearsed suche thinges declare cure trouble misery iers mennes iudgementes br ng v rather contempte renoume nowe whether also rehearse thinges haue fully determined whiche yet falsly boaste theselues shoulde glorie yea sometyme expediente glorie namely since brifte myne epistle hath brought vision reuelacions lorde iesus whiche sorte synce false apostle fayne manye wantonlye boaste euen agaynste wyll one compelled leste seeme behynde wyll reh arse onelye one glorie neither glorie god knowe certayne manne whiche aboue xiiii yeares goe taken vp whether bodye without bodye cannot tell god knoweth whiche yet taken vp thyrde heauen hence agayne taken vp paradise bothe place hearde secrete woordes whiche manne vtter mannes sake whome god fre goodnes blisfulnes befell glory selfe boast wil sauing rehearsing thinges declare weakenes infirmitie yet matier also minded sumwhat speake selfe since neither lie selfe speake vaingloriously though haue acknowledged folishnes yet could iustly condemned thereof yet sake myne owne abstayne rehearsing leste thinke tha suppose greater one tha either myne actes preaching pretende peraduenture without ieopardie neither glorye suche thinges make v great thereby nigh vnto ieopardie arrogancie cause leste myghte bee proude reason high reuelacions el among men taken greater expedient shoulde haue sufferaunce mostethere geuen vnto vnquietnesse thorowe fleshe merciful god gyuen vnto vnquietnes affliccion bodye bothe put remembraunce condicion also teache men mortall manne vnder lyke misery geuen saye truble whiche christes seruice messanger minister satan resiste gospell mooste cruell persecucions vexe one heade gyueth buffettes keapyng vnder suppressyng leste mighte muche bee exalted punishemente exceadynglye disquieted thryse besoughte lorde woulde affliccion delyuer seeyng better coulde selfe aunswered sorte paule bee contente goodnes towardes thee desyre nomore thyne affliccions appertayne bothe magnifying glorye throughe ayde canste bee ouercommen bee stormes neuer greate also thy saluacion whiche bodilye affliccions arte spirituall treasure soule dayelye enriched dooeth mannes weakenes make perfite power godfor strengthe made perfect thorow weakenesse infirmitie accomplyshe strengthe preachyng vile weake personnes gospell onelye holdeth also flourisshethe agaynste deuyll worlde vsyng agaynste kyndes cruelnesse maketh playne profe geare anye worldelye power broughte aboute power god nowe affliccions suffer goddes glorye sette foorthe whiche v woorketh sheweth power synce thus aunswered god hencefoorthe wyll nothyng gladlye reioyce affliccions whereby seeme rather feble greate whiche also appeare anye greatenesse heygthe glorye god christes sake seeme feble hym maye seeme strong mightie texte therfore haue delectacion infirmity rebuke reade persecucyons anguyshes christes sake weake strong becoe fole boasting selfe ye haue compelled ought haue commended nothing inferiour vnto chiefe apostle though nothing yet token apostle wrought among pacience sygnes wonder myghtie dedes wherin ye inferiours vnto congregacios excepte herein chargeable vnto forgeue wrong beholde nowe thirde tyme ready come vnto yet wyll chargeable vnto seke chyldren ought lay vp father mother father mother chyldren therfore specially reioyce triumphe myne affliccions reproches pouertie persecution distreasses suffered christes sake suffering forsake despayre myne owne strength christes healpe verely stronge myghty whither driuen vehemencie mine oration thinketh nowe boasting fallen playne folishnes ye occasion compelled therto synce euer able geuen weale besemed haue spoken thing commendacion whiche nowe vnsemely compelled reporte selfe seke prayse thing neuer dyd haue done asmuche made poore manfor nothing inferioure vnto chiefe apostle lowe degree troubled beaten vnder fote eloquent neither refuse improue anye thynges myne yf incommodytie yet vile touching ye founde poynt behynde apostle wyll saye meane sorte onely somuch behynde hyghest boaste selfe whiche ye haue founde haue playnly proued apostle therof make selfes iudges fyrst chiefe argument profe apostle gospelles sake gladly suffer trouble poynte haue certaynly shewed selfe apostle neyther lacked gyftes wherwith god vnbeleuers sake bringeth preaching credence signes miracle myghtye dedes yf saye truth tell wherin ye behynde congregacions gaue greate apostle congregacion whiche gaue excepte thys onely lacke costly vnto apostle ye ca finde lacke point yf haue offended forgyue displeasure euen haue offended though dede repent doyng nowe haue twyes already among chargeable man loe nowe purpose thyrde tyme see yet mynde chargeable vnto nowe haue ben though shewe yet none earnest cause yet notfor se without cause cause soeuer doe al weale matier vse selfe true father child ought laye vp theyr father mother contrary father mother theyr chyldren father loue thing content bestow goodes whiche great labour haue gotten weale theyr child also theyr lyues texte gladly bestowe wilbe bestowed soules though loue lesse loued agayn chargeable vnto neuerthelesse whan craftie tooke gyle pyll whome sent vnto desyred titus sent brother dyd titus defraude thing walked one spyryte walked like steppe agayne thinke ye excuse selues vnto speake christe sight god doe thynges dearly beloued edifying feare leste come passe come shall fynde suche woulde shall founde vnto suche ye would feare leste founde among debate enuying wrathe stryfe backbytinges whysperynges swellynges discorde feare leste come agayne god bryng lowe among constrayned bewayle many whiche haue synned readie haue repented v c eanesse fornicacion wantonnesse whiche haue commytted therfore farre exacting thyng ready harte bestowe haue vpon also selfe expedient soule helth sufficient father doe chyldren albeit ignorant towardes many father theyr chyldren wheras tenderly loue lykewyse loued agayne lesse regarded whiche would well put case selfe chargeable vnto fearing enuye yet craftie conueyaunce beguyled workyng hiered therunto ashamed doe selfe paraduenture wil make cauilacion thinking bee tell pray exacted thing whiche came vnto name desyred titus goe vnto todyd pyll sent vnto hym adioyned companion brother whiche well tryed knowen congregacions exacted titus thyng one mynde walked lyke steppe refuse haue layed charge whiche done suche sent vnto thinke ye agayne whyles speake pleade owne matter whatsoeuer speake whether humbling selfe exalting laying vnkyndnes charge al done weale dearly beloued brother god witnesse whiche knoweth conscience christ also witnesse whose cause haue hande assay wayes leaue meane vnsearched shape selfe al fashion bryng better frame nothyng feare counterfayte apostle owne sake feare leste whe come vnto fynde would ye ye agayne fynde ye would desyre see al poyntes faulteles ye may againe see mylde wel pleased ye continew geue eare feare leste shall fynde among debate enuying wrathe strife backbytynges whisperinges swellinges discorde yf come agayne feare leste chaunce semed seen mery pleasaunt one sufficiently troubled outragiousnes already lorde among bring lowe agayne steade tryumphe compelled morne theyr behalfes whiche haue already synned repented yet vncleanes fornicacion wantonnes haue committed pthe xiii chapter texte nowe come thyrde tyme vnto mouth two thre witness shall euery woorde stablyshed tolde tell sayed present seconde tyme wryte nowe beyng absent whiche tyme past haue synned yf come agayne wyll spare seyng ye seke experience christ whiche speaketh amonge weake myghtie though crucifyed weaknes yet lyueth throwe power god dout weake shal liue myght god amonge shalbe thyrde cummyng vnto againste let euery readines wil loger wynke matter minde procede straitly extreme rigoure lawe whosoeuer shall accused shall wytnes two thre either quited condemned haue already warned agayne nowe warne sayed present seconde tyme wryte vnto nowe beyng absent whiche euen tyme hadde offended also offender yf fynde vnamended forasmuch haue nowe twyse geuen warnyng spare haue hertofore done meane seke ye owne displeasure haue experience whether suche thynges speake speake selfe spirite christe speaketh vnto despise ye hym also weake towarde weake though suche vnto iewes pilate rather among declared himselfe mighty whose name ye sawe dead liue againe deuils flee sycke made whole albeit touching weakenes nature whiche taken vpon hym would fastened vpon crosse yet must therfore coumpted weake dyed reaso infirmitie body lyueth power god father lykewise apostle though folowyng steppe christ maister vnbeleuers seme feble whyles beaten emprisoned reuiled yet power god mightie shal hym againste yf stoubernes prouoke pacience texte proue selfes whether ye fayth examen owne selues knowe ye owne selues howe iesus christe excepte ye cast awayes trust ye shall knowe cast awayes desyre god ye doe none euyll seme commendable ye doe whiche honest let v counted castawayes doe nothyng trueth trueth glad weake ye strong also wishe euen perfectnesse therfore wryte thynges beyng absente leste presente vse sharpenes according power whiche lorde hath geuen edifie destroy finally brother fare ye well perfecte good comforte one mynde lyue peace god loue peace shalbe gr another holy kysse sayntes salute grace lord iesus christe loue god felowshyp holy ghoste amen seke haue profe v rather proue selfes whether ye continew gyft fayth el fallen searche examine one ye playne experience workyng miracle sondrye gyftes howe muche christ weake yf power gone plaine profe eyther fayth waxen faynte christe beyng displeased euyll lyfe hathe altered good mynde warde ye knowe selfes wyll ye haue experience youre selfes knowe whether christe bee yf strength faythe bee onlesse peraduenture faythe beeyng sorte safe ye haue vncleane lyuyng deserued bee reiected christe howesoeuer matter goe truste ye shall v euidently perceyue forsaken faythe whole thereby shall christe bee able punyshe al suche wyll good come amendmente sayd truste yea rather contrarie muche wyshe desyer god faultes compelled shewe power feare leste founde weake goe shewe thesame vaynly talke rather desyer coumpted castawayes ye vpright honeste yf ye contynewe fayth godly lyfe cause haue none whye vse power agaynste refuse thys sorte towe nothyng againste trueth trueth seme weake thys bee reakened haue power ye gaue none occasion exercise agaynste truth nothyng whatsoeuer doe truth somuche agaynste innocentes haue power agaynste offender power yf nothing founde worthy correccion ye shall vnarme v innocencie declaryng selfes mightie reason ye shal fro weake one take away power geuen vnto punishe slaunderers name saye doe nothing affirmyng coulde lacke doe thing whiche reason integritie coulde doe gladde often sorte ye stronge though iudged weake yea gladde yf also moste heartely wyshe seme lacke somewhat ye perfecte cause thought good earnestly warne letter leste come myght compelled vse rigoure muche wyshe haue amended threatnynge woordes vse power punyshyng geuen vnto lord weale hurte innocentes canne doe nothyng maketh muche matter suche haynouse vice corrupte congregacion scape alwaye vnpunished haue nowe aduertising done parte remayneth ye doe diligently apply selfe vnfaynedly reioyce occasion sorowe sette parte encreasing styll better better vntyll ye become perfecte amending suche thynges hurte innocencie faultes sufficiently corrected ye may amendemente take comforte agre together striue eche one sondrye opinion lette bee among peace mutuall loue yf ye wil god loue auctour peace alwayes fauour bee contented greete eche one another holy kysse common sorte euen heartes sayntes whiche grete fauour oure lord iesus christ loue god father felowshyp holy ghost bee among al acknowlegyng benefite sonne charitie father towarde whiche suche sorte loued gaue onely sonne bee redemer goodnes holye ghost whome alwaye geueth v giftes ye maye exaumple vndeuided trinite lyue lyke vnitie witte concord bothe pure perfite p thus endeth paraphrase vpon latter epistle paul apostle corinthian argument vvhole matter epistle sainct paule galathians de erasmus roterodame albeit galathias grecias yet originally desceded frenchemen hierome sayth dulnes witte resemble thing also hillary frenchma borne hymnes testifyeth callyng countreymen dullardes sainte paule also present epistle reprouing calleth anoetous say witlesse foolishe whose capacitie temperyng matter vehemently sharpely reproueth epistle doeth rather checkyng teachyng thentent could reason brought better mynde might yet lestwyse authoritie called home againe amended epistle laboreth paule matter whiche el euery place doeth cal men say bondage moses lawe grace gospell whiche matter epistle romaine also entreateth people like errour yet sondry sorte fallenthervnto romaine fyrst brought iewishenes afterward amended galathians contrarye beyng apostle fyrst well taught sleightie desceiptes false apostle brought backe againe iewishe religion romaine simplenes misteachyng begiled wysedome discrecion came warnyng sone amended side wheras galathians sone receiued fauored christes doctrin point easines straight fal againe become iewes euen lightnes folishnes came false apostle takyng vpon though sent chief apostle peter iames whiche labored abate paules authoritie teachyng credence geuen whiche inconstant sometymes obseruyng ceremony lawe appeared made vowe shauyng head caused timothe circumcised sometymes gentile reprouyng condemnyng lawe bearyng hand also suche rather ought beleued peter iames conuersaunt whiche seen christ manhod whereas paule neither seen christ disciple suche disciple messenger christ paule therfore vehemently sharpely none epistle sharpe holsome earnestnes fauorable sharpnes bothe cureth galathians errour also defendeth owne authoritie openyng false apostle disceiptes beginnyng epistle makyng selfe equal euen chiefe apostle yea point aboue tyme christ put authoritie preache become immortall vpon boldnes authoritie certain tyme arabia damasco preached christ talked apostle whiche enterprise graunteth sawe deede ierusalem fewe dayes peter iames yet nothyng holpen whiche tyme sayeth preached xiiii yeres syria cilicia vntyll suche tyme god commaunded returne vnto ierusalem barnabas titus wher paule compared examined gospel suche wer christes apostle beganne doubt many yeres preachyng intent theyr approbacion allowaunce whose authority chiefe among men might confirmed whiche tyme compared peter learned nothyng touchyng gospell onely peter compelled charge gentile burden lawe tyme peter antioche eate company gentile suche meates wer lawe forbidden feare iewes came withdrewe selfe co pany checked euen face declaryng fayth men obtaine grace god offred gospel kepyng law whiche tyme abolished though begunne disputacion peter yet persueth large turnyng matter galathians instructyng declaryng moses lawe geuen tyme al thynges taught therin appertained directed christ onely lawe fleshe gospel spirite lawe shadowes gospel light lawe image gospel truth finally lawe bondage gospel libertie galathians extreme folishnes tasted better thynges fal worse whiche pointes saint paule entreateth fyrst second third fourth chapiter hath earnestly warned receiuyng circumsicion shamefully cast selues bondage lawe teacheth christian libertie libertie manne lust synnefully willyng ioyfull mynde well euen loue lawe comaundeth finally exhorteth galathians christian concorde helpe suche weake fallen suche haue taught v christian fayth suche workes workes spirite euerlasting glory rewarded whereas temporal ceremony deserue glory temporal incidently bringyng false apostle displeasure hatred whiche nothyng el labored haue galathians circumcised might therof glorye bryngers passe suche high arte lyke disease haue suche day whiche fynde newe straunge kindes religion may sayd suche kynde men made epistle paule semeth wrote owne hand shewe tenderly loued galathians whereas epistle maner nomore subscribe latine argumetes shew written cytie ephesus greke title reade sent rome paraphrase vpon epistle apostle sainct paule galathians de erasmus roterodame fyrst chapiter texte paule apostle men neither man iesus christ god father whiche raised vp death brother whiche paule apostle apostle meane sorte whiche say lest either dispise one lesse reputacion power authoritie apostle abate suppresse myne neither man putte commission office haue whiche either beyng disciple vnderlynges apostle auaunce selues thoughe highest sorte el vnlawfull meanes procuryng men fauor violently breakebut christ god father office apostle putte authoritie preache gospel excellent person iesus christ selfe sonne god mannes eleccion consent commaunded preacher gospel owne mouth tyme becomen immortal euen heauen called foorth busynes vndoubtedly decree authoritie god father raised sonne iesus death therfore supposed dead v lenger seen rather suche worthyly taken high apostle christ appointed beyng yet among mortal men mortal surely coumpted theyr inferior tyme heauen man euen god called apostle messenger point equal euen highest apostle iesus christ institute preeminence may lawfully chalenge christ chose tyme bodily infirmity subiect called sonder preacher tyme put condicions mannes weakenes texte vnto congregacion galacia grace peace god father lorde iesus christ whiche gaue selfe synnes deliuer v present euil worlde accordyng god father praise euer euer amen paule therfore euen apostle suche apostle write epistle many whole countrey galacia consent agre christes doctrine lest one man authoritie smale weight onely also many great numbre whiche professe name christ forsakyng moses lawe embrace fayth doctrin gospel fyrst wishe grace peace concorde grace vpon fre deliuerauce old lynnes ye may hereafter liue innocente pure life concord ye neither dissent fro congregacions yet fro selues whiche giftes muste looke receiue neither moses mortal man god father welspring al welth cometh sonne lord iesus christ pleased god geue v thinges must thanke misery haue escaped also al goodnes haue obtained vnto moses circumcision made man innocent christ owne fre goodnes offred self death would synnes make amendes purposyng grace gospel supply moses law able onely benefite beyng deliuered synne synfull myndes wherevnto world bound may neither slauishely vnder vnclennes man ceremony hath pleased god father beyng fyrst made foly fell againe bondage synne restored againe like men newe borne yearthly becomen heauenly carnall made spiritual therfore al goodnes floweth honor glory geuen transitory moses lawe suche shal neuer haue ende amen texte meruaile ye sone turned fro christ whiche called grace vnto another gospel whiche nothing el whiche trouble intende peruert gospel christ wheras lately preached vnto synce ye receiued maruaile litle hath chauced ye fallen fro good father sone fallen fro frely forgeuyng al trespaces hath called prouoked euerlastyng saluacion forwhiche called grace vnto gospel kepyng lawe grace bounteous mercy benefite iesus christ ye sodenly fallen againe bondage moses lawe gospel dede beside whiche preached vnto gospel whence great vnstablenes fro whence lightnes chaunge suche fredome freely geuen vnto suche wylfull bondage wittes reproue thinke fault rather layd certain false apostle whiche beyng rather preacher moses christ abuse rudenes trouble title high apostle manacyng threatenyng though stode ye could without circumcision attaine vnto saluacion doyng onely laboryng renue ceremony olde lawe meete abrogate abolished vnder colour also vtterly peruertyng gospel christ synce gospel fayth godly life assureth al men embrace perfite weale saluacion well may coumpted vayne deceiptful doctrine teache man haue entrey euerlastyng welth vnlesse circumcised custome moses lawe requireth god defende mannes authoritie remoue fro purenes sinceritie gospel texte neuertheles though selues angel fro heaue preache gospel vnto whiche haue preached vnto let acursed sayd saye nowe againe man preache gospell ye haue receiued let accursed rather farre fro beyng moued name peter iames ihon neuer great whiche name men abuse bring vnder burdaine lawe euen angel sent fro heauen preache vnto gospel preached let onely heard also taken one abhorred accursed lest thynke wordes spoken either hastynes vnpacience reherse whosoeuer whether angel apostle high name preache vnto otherwyse ye haue learned v accursed saye abhominable texte persuade men god either go aboute please menne hitherto studied please men seruaunt christ often men hand wt right line christes fayth neither man authoritie angel ought preuail take place preacheth christes gospel laboreth man busynes godseither go aboute please men feare man authoritie man god put trust preache gospel whiche office pray whether suche wyse hadle selfe please men god onely acknowledge author maister iewes vpon worldly zeale labor set furth among al men theyr rite ceremony thentent may vnder coloure made nature men would haue euer suche way seme best wherin selfes brought vp wherfore sekyng haue iewes fauor labor bryng men minde circumcised preache kepyng sabboth day wt obseruyng difference meates though reache taught men high singular point god forbid yt farfoorth labor please iewes beyng rather carnal spiritual suffre wt iewishe ceremony ye puritie gospel corrupted tyme past geuen iewishenes pleased countreymen wayes could persewyng professed name christ while went please men displeased god would haue moses abolished glory sonne christ set foorth long bonde lawe al myne entent andfor hitherto studied please men c endeuoure kepe moses rule sought praise men handes hath god called way whose onely praise desyre loke hence foorth styl loke praise menne certainly christes seruaunt man thinke seruaut apply selfe winne fauor men tha comaundemetes feare displease ye iewes god father christ author ye gospel neuer slauishely bonde ceremony moses lawe well wyst light christes gospel quite abolished suche tyme wholy geuen selfe christ albeit twyse appeasyng commocion whiche might elswyse haue beyng among iewes obserued certain theyr customes yet neuer thought hope saluacion tyme applyed selfe myndes countreymen might therby bryng vnto christ synce perceyue submyssion myne wrest wrong meanyng nowe matier gone ferre stycke charge ye burden lawe thing necessarie euen gospell founde free burden thynke hyghe tyme freely playnly speake agayne moses rite openly deteste maketh derogacion christes glorie doyng shall none apostle authoritie feare neuer notable assuryng selfe wholye christe whose wyll commaundement folowe thycke thyn ieopardye texte certifie brother gospell whiche preached maner men neither receiued learned man reuel ac iesus christe ye shall better vnderstande without consideracion fell moses lawe nowe suche boldnes preache libertie gospell ioo wil brother gospell whiche taught suche worldly ordinaunce maye mannes pleasure altered maye whiche made man suche preache circumcision let theyr parte take hede whence learned theyr gospell surely ioyfull tydynges taught neither receyued learned man meane whero myght coupelled either leane authoritie folow mennes interpretacionsfor neither receiued learned man christe hymself vouchesaued shewe vnto misterie newe lawe abolyshment olde man shall thynke without consideracion rashely chaunged el receyued gospell whiche preache person graue authoritie christe suche sorte man yet mortall man yet vnder suche delites men el christe also suche condicion man therwith also god whose secrete power spirite sodenly chau ged new man elswyse stubbernly gyuen moses law taught vnto myne elder reuerence honoure lyke worldly perswasion plucked heade holye ghost enspired myne hearte texte ye haue heard conuersacion tyme paste iewes waye beyond measure persecuted congregacion god spoyled preuayled iewes waye aboute many companion myne owne nacion beyng seruent mainteiner tradicions elder tale thynke ignoraunt lykelyhod report knowe sorte vsed selfe vnder iewes lawe loue borne therto greatly abhorryng gospell christ whose secret knowledge yet receyued meanes could persecuted new congregacion tyme spirite god began gathered doctrine gospell moste tyra nie could destroyed thinking meane season dyd noble acte suche acte hyghlye pleased god whyles dede lyke foole ignorauntly fought agaynst god surely matier went well forwarde iewyshe profession whome onely tyme thought good godly among companion got prayse passed well nyghe werre companion rekened holy
