religiouse styfly cleaued vnto forefather lawes doyng deceaued lacke ryght iudgemet knowledge lacke good intet purpose zeale borne law resisting maker therof blyndnes pleased god secrete counsel suffer tyme thentent beyng sodenly chaunged great bolsterer lawe preacher gospel myght myne example drawe prouoke many christe texte pleased god seperated mother wombe called hereunto grace declare sone preache hym amog heathen immediatly communed matier fleshe bloud neither returned ierusalem whiche apostle went wayes arabia came agayne vnto damasco wherfore sone pleased god whiche long euen fro mother wombe purposed chosen busines vpo declare notifie pleasure whereas suche thyng deserued owne free goodnes call office instrument glorie sone iesus myght knowen whome yet verie fewe iewes knewe gentile almoste none among specially would haue preacher thinke ye dyd dyd styll cleaue vnto forefather lawes slacke toi communed matur wt fleshe bloude set vpon busynes wherwith put trust mistrusted worde god compared gospell anye apostle countreymen went man aske aduise went hierusalem haue gospell stablyshed theyr authoritie called dignitie apostleship highly estemed dyd thought conuenient shoulde mannes authoritie confirmed whiche christes commaundement immediatly commuted vnto furthwith soone perceyued myne errour receyued heauen commission without delaye went arabia nothyng doubted preache christes name beyng yet wylde harbarouse people either vnknowen hated lesse zeale preachyng grace gospel exste preached moses lawe arabia retourned damasco streyght fro baptisme begun professe christes name texte thre yeares retourned ierusalem se peter abode hym xv dayes apostle saw none saue iames lordes brother thinges therfore whiche wryte beholde god lye thence thre yeares space came hierusalem rather see peter thyng compare wt hym abode nomore xv dayes though among apostle semed chiefe apostle laboured see none sauing iames whose surname iustus perfit holynes lyfe called lordes brother therfore became fyrste byshoppe hierusalem ferre ye see mistrustyng gospell sekyng mannes ayde assistence nowe thynges saye trewe witnes god hymselfe whose commaundemente haue taken vpon preache gospell texte p came vnto coastes siria cicilia vnknowen touchyng person vnto congregacions iewrye whiche christe hearde whiche persecured v tyme paste nowe preacheth fayth whiche destroyed glorified god thynges done went countreyes syria cilicia euery place preachyng name christe euen countreyes certayne noumber iewes began fauer christes doctrine yet syghte vnknowen notwithstandyng iewe borne onelye knewe reporte whiche goddes wyll persecutor christian fayth sodenly become preacher fayth vtterest power assaulted nowe euen ieopardy lyfe defended whiche chaunge two maner wayes glorified god one suche greuouse persecucio deliuered gotten suche defender theyr profession ii chapiter texte fourtene yeares thereafter went vp agayne hierusalem barnabas toke titus went vp reuelacion commoned gospell whiche preache among gentile specially whiche coumpted chief leste shoulde tunne runne vayne bvt fourtene yeares preached doctrine gospell speacyally gentile went agayne titus barnabas hierusalem whome minded take witnes whiche done dyd nowe humanitie dyd goddes commaundement intent iewes shoulde better knowe see great number gentile without circumcisio called euerlastyng lyfe aswell saluacion oughte loked circumcision sake fayth geuyng gospell therforei w vp reuelacion comuned compared gospell whiche christes wyll hitherto preache among gentile especially communed whose authoritie among iewes moste estemed least anye whiche styll beleued christes gospell myngled moses lawe might saye either course gospell runne vayne styll yet runne gyfte fayth without mencion makyng circumcision promysed saluacion whiche circumcised puttyng confidence christe truste haue enioye texte also titus whiche though greke yet compelled circumcised incomers beyng false brother came priuely spye ante libertie whiche haue christe iesus myght bryng v bondage whome gaue coume tyme concernyng brought subieccion trueth gospell myght continewe ferre chargyng gentile burden circumcision somuche titus bothe hierusale conuersaunt also among iewes styfly defended circumcision chief apostle iewes compelled circumcised grecian iewe muche lesse ye lo galacia compulsion false apostle suche among apostle chiefe required v haue grecian circumcised therin vndoubtedlye intendyng bondage lawe shoulde lytle lytle weare quyte awaye libertie gospell establyshed oure companye crepte certayne falseand incu mers c christian men whome maye good cause call exacte whiche christe would weare vse trayterously falsly came within v espye oure lybertie gyuen vnto v throughe gospell christe wherat enuied intendyng nothyng elles circumcison bryng v agayne backwarde bondage lawe lykely shoulde theyr importune meanes compelled leste resistyng commocion might stiered vp yet muche gaue ferfurthe place tyme satisfyeng theyr myndes submitting oure selfes titus shoulde circumcised thinge v done sake leste whiche titus done necessitie ye without necessitie folowyng myght fall truthe gospel iewyshe supersticion texte whiche semed somewhat tyme passed maketh matier god loketh outwarde apparence man neuerthelesse whiche semed great added nothyng contrariwise sawe gospell ouer vncircumcision committed vnto gospell ouer circu cision committed vnto peter myghtie peter apostleshyp ouer circumcision mightie among gentile perceyued grace giuen vnto iames cephas iohn whiche semed pillers gaue barnabas right hades felowshyp shoulde apostle among heathen circumcision onlye remember poore wherin also diligent yf whose authoritie chiefe tyme either exacted circumcision elles permitted whither therin well dyd lytle appertayneth vnto sufficient haue forsaken theyr olde opinion nowe howe soeuer matier goe among men great mattier well estemed god regarded suche outwarde apparences trouthe authoritie greater myne yet touchyng pure preaching gospell lytle furthered rather therin encrease furtheraunce vpon declaracion tryal preachyng vnto perceyued christe aswell put truste preaching gospel among gentile done peter among iewes sawe also preachyng without circumcision lesse effectual peter circumcision ioyned vpon oure reporte vnderstode god gyuen v equall grace gospell ferre peter iames iohn amonge thought principall pillers reprouyng preachyng barnabas gyuyng v theyr ryght handes made alegue felowshippe shoulde one consent mynde preache one gospel euery man portion among gentile among iewes gaue v iniunction call anye gentile circumcision onely desyred v tyme among gentile preached gospell woulde remember poore people whiche hierusalem thereby myght relieued whiche poynte forasmuche well agreed doctrine gospel diligently obeyed theyr commau dement would haue done gyuen v commaundement circumcise gentile vnmete thyng v mannes authoritie shoulde take place fauer borne vnto hym shoulde ryght trade see vnto ghospel begynnyng matier required thyng season beare suche iewyshenes turned gospel could vtterly brought religion wherin accordyng theyr elder lawes nozeled euen theyr youthe leste occasion many might christe discouraged diligence vsed oure aduertisement suche people myghte content leaue lenger borne specially synce therin ieopardy auauntage whiche iewes embrace doctrine gospell verye small noumber comparison getiles preachyng haue enryched christ theyr encrease also stande great hope synce gentile dwell fer wyde abrode worlde whereas iewes comparison contayned within narow cumpace nowe gentile greatest parte suche sorte abhorre circumcision lyke forsake christ gospell vpon receiue yoke suche odiouse law beside al also greater ieopardy feared leste yf men longe place abrode vse suche kynde sufferaunce bearyng come passe free benefite saluacion whiche goddes goodnes oure fayth shoulde thaked greatly seme hang vpon ceremony law yf men se obserued chiefe apostle wyll suche somwhat bent supersticion take thoughe without fayth taught gospell attaynyng euerlastyng saluacion sufficient externally done men se myndes purpose thynges done se matiers suspicion knowen thyng men commo ly gyuen alway suspecte wurste bye meane wherof shall tyme gyuing place exceadyng supersticion iewes agaynst theyr conscience wyll iudge done deuocion beare theyr weakenes men haue season borne wt iewes ineuitable strupulositie whome must nowe lytle litle encrease better exacte gentile whiche tyme suffered iewes maye meanes borne iewes fyrste excused reason certayne perswasion receyued theyr predecessours besyde long custome whose power asmuche effectuall power nature agayne god authour theyr lawe dyuerse thynges also none maye brought defence gentile yf shoulde lykewyse myngle moses lawe christes together specially put trust gentile peter charge ouer iewes meete eche v pryncypallye haue regarde owne cure charge texte peter come antioche withstoode hym openly worthy blamed yet certayne came iames dyd eare wyth gentile come withdrewe separated hymselfe fearing whiche circumcision iewes dissembled aswel somuche barnabas also brought theyr simulacion wherin surely wyll gyue place mannes authoritie somuche peter came antioche albeit among apostle well wist autoritie chiefe yet nothyng doubted playnlye euen face withstand hym esteamyng gospell dignitie letted men reproue waueryng inconstancie pretended feare synce acte selfe wel worthyi withstode hym open reprofe made great daunger manye lykely otherwyse take hym ment euen thoughe done vpon conscience beare iewes infirmitie syttyng dyner certayne whiche gentile wer come profession gospel eating indifferently kyndes meates streyght certayne iewes sent iameshe dyd eate ge tile came vpon diner tyme withdrewe hymself table pretendyng thoughe indifferentlye eaten commen meates without doubte fearyng leste shoulde offende theyr conscience thought yet somewhat supersticiouse coulde wholy forsake leaue suche choyse meates also suche whiche iudged coulde well stande godlynes iewe shoulde gentile asmuche sytte one table whiche cloke pretense peter albeit came good mynde yet thing vndiscreteand iewes disse bled aswelas lyke haue turned vtter destruccion many onlye rest iewes sate v fauored peter dissemblyng also felowe barnabas moued peter authoritie euen peter withdrewe hymself syttyng whose dissemblyng doubt rest welnigh would haue folowed remedye founden fierce vehement resistence contencions texte sawe went right way trueth gospel sayd vnto peter al thou beyng iewe liuest maner gentile iewes causest thou gentile liue iewes whiche iewes nature synners gentile knowe iustified dedes law fayth iesus christ haue beleued iesus christ might iustified fayth christ deedes lawe deedes lawe fleshe shalbe iustified perceiued therfore certaine one appliyng getiles fredome while iewes weakenes haulted betwixt went right way stedfastly forwarde trueth gospell would whiche tyme brymme tyme without clokyng stedfastly professe ceremony lawe abolished saluacion offered gospel helpe nothyng remedy peril euery manne plainly euery mannes sight resisted gainsayed peter vpon correccion heade might example amende would see euen obeyed reformacion wordes resisted sayd meanest thou peter purpose thou wyse withdrawest thy selfe doest thou while thou vndiscretely fearest thy iewes drawe gentilesif thou beyng iew c daungerous supersticion thou beyng natural iewe thy selfe yet regardyng supersticious vsages thy coutreymen liue euen gentile coumptyng nothyng vncleane whiche godwarde vncleane synce againe thou hast tymes heretofore done likewyse cornelius ceturio euen tyme also company art thou become vnlike thy selfe doest thou inconstantly withdrawe diner euen though wheras tyme thou shewedst thy self regard difference meates yet gentile conuersant suche actes thine done vpon suche iudgement discrecion please men withal semest thou vnderstande thyne example onely confirmeth iewes theyr supersticion whiche mete abolished gentile also whiche becomen christian like compelled thine example whiche arte among apostle chief charged ceremony iewes christ would haue men free onely grace gospel found fre also iewes selfe found bonde gentile borne iewes cal synners vnpurea man iustifyed dedes lawe whiche tyme preachyng gospel dede idolater nature iewes borne vnder lawe whervnto season wel obeyed beyng yet taught kepyng lawe noman iustified rather certaine cofidence wherby trust fre mercy christ haue remission synnes mistrustyng lawe elder resorte christes religion trustyng meane therof obtaine righteousnes suche may bryng v mennes fauor fauor god whiche kepyng ceremonial lawe thing sufficient able bryng aboute shal beginner author gentile mistrustyng christ shall seke vpon succour lawe specially synce well knowe benefite lawe man god made righteous menne nede resorte fayth gospel texte seeke made righteous christ selues found sinner christ minister sinne god forbid receiuyng fayth gospel neuertheles found subiecte synne nede yet remedy muche nede beyng vnder moses lawe beyng disapointed hope stoode againe compelled seke vpon lawe v forsaken shal say shal say christis christ minister synne beleued author perfite iustice minister vnrighteousnes onely deliuereth v olde vnrighteousnes also occasion encrease therof onely geueth vnto v welthy state whiche loked also causeth co demnacion grieuous forasmuche vpo hope forsoke lawe whervnto againe compelled returne might seme without fault vnaduisedly haue forgone whiche fault christ semeth occasion god forbid man iudge christ thinke grace gospel doeth lacke perfeccion towarde attainement saluacion nede seeke somewhat moses law texte haue builte againe thinges whiche destroyed make selfe trespacer lawe haue dead lawe might liue vnto christ returne againe moses haue receiued lawe gospel certain fallyng away christ reproche gospel yea iewe straunger soeuer doeth therin declareth selfe also transgressour moses lawe lawe thyng made saluacion forsoke nothyng made falleth agayne buildyng throwen doune myne owne handes begynne euen foundacion buylde againe whiche erste destroyed shewe therin foly whiche sette vp againe whiche vnaduisedly destroyed cause haue embraced fayth gospel goodnes christ would receiue perfite righteousnes saluacion regarde succour grosse lawe whervnto lenger bonde death either two maried deliuereth partie left liue fro bonde matrimony whiche iewe lawe somewhat long mutual right endured say long lawe liued vnto liued lawe texte crucified christ neuerthelesse liue yet christ liueth life whiche liue fleshe liue fayth sonne god whiche loued gaue selfe dispise grace god righteousnes come lawe christ died vaine assone death christ sacrament baptisme became prentice spiritual lawe fayth maner grosse carnal lawe dead yet dead liued dead begunne liue better way condicion hitherto liued moses liue god god spirite christ liued mortal man hauyng body subiecte misery beyng dead fleshe also world liueth god father free corrupcion misery death whiche baptisme crucifyed christ also dead farre beyng bonde grosse carnal rather spiritual godly obseruaunces dead liue grosse carnal subiect also worldly desire dead saule stoute de ender law persecutor gospel yet spirite christ haue receiued life muche better rather liue selfe whiche selfe nothyng carnalnot christ liueth c liueth christ e holy spirite wyll pleasure gouerneth myne actes wheras yet free contagion death haue stil body somewhat subiecte mannes weakenes discomodities mortall life yet maner liue life immortal conceiued soule sure hope assuryng selfe vpo promise sonne god whose bounteous mercy haue receiued gift fayth fayth righteousnes righteousnes life euerlastyng keapyng grosse lawe singular goodnes christ owne good wyll loued deseruyng suche thyng greatly synnes suffered punishement crosse welth gaue selfe death free geueth pleasure saluacion beholdyng kepyng lawe whiche frely geueth thisi dispise grace god c benefite men whiche taketh way synne geueth pure innocent life vnkynde yea spitefull christ refused offre refuseth baptisme receiued loketh backe againe helpe lawe though abolishe al synnes worlde geue euery manne euerlastyng saluacion christes death sufficient innocent hurtleslife become immortal whence pray rather loke receiue confidence law fre mercy christ free mercy hang styl lawe keapyng moses christ dead vayne forasmuche whiche pleasure dye death geate third chapiter texte ye folishe galathians hath bewitched ye beleue truth iesus christ described eye among crucified comenly among men folishenes childishnes ye euil spoken may truely say ye folishe galathians whiche would brought opinion farre reason iewes fayth gospel preached vnto deliuered fro burden law ye beyng free menne borne wyl wilfully cast selfe bondage harme whiche herein done lay wholy charge blame lightenes beleue easynes persuaded much blame malice certaine haue altered former mindes would god ye would rather haue folowed simple vngracious cousel enuye grudge borne weale vnder whiche ye haue hitherto continued libertie gospel hath bewitched charmyng christian mynde hath enchauntment cast frensye ye men mistrustyng christ seke helpe colde baraine lawe wherethat ye beleue truth singular confidence become whereby death christ ye sure hope haue perfite righteousnes saluacion without heal e ayde lawe ye say whose heartes iesus christ onely author saluacion farfoorth grauen printed iyen fayth ye suche sorte sawe crosse recocilyng worlde father though painted face though selues witness dede doyng whiche dede done ierusalem iewes sawe hangyng crosse yet denied sawe muche ye among whiche death trusted receiue euerlasting saluacio verely crucified iyen alwaye vpon brasen serpent hanged vp vpon tree onely ye trusted receiue holsome remedy synnes whither sodainly cast ye iyen texte onely would learne whether ye receiued spirite dedes lawe preachyng fayth ye vnwyse ye haue begunne spirite ye ende fleshe many thinges ye haue suffered vaine also vaine yet wytte lefte euen consider whiche vnlesse ye blind ye may easily vnderstand wyl subtily reason matter seeke farre fetched argumentes ye remembre lately preachyng gospel baptisme puttyng handes vpon ye receiued spirite christ vaine persuacion wonderfull worke god ensuyng thervpon gifte language prophecie healyng giftes made plaine profe came power god mannes craftie conueyaunce spirite god say whether pray receiued ye moses circumcision el preachyng ye beleued gospel christ notwithstadyng ye moses straungers yet gaue christ vnto fayth strong mightie spirite ernest peny blissed state promised vnto ye elswhere looke saluacion ye haue receiued plaine gage blisse come preached circumcision trust therin ye receiued heauenly spirite god content parte saluacion ye shal geue thankes moses lawe nothyng taught iesus christ puttyng confidence onely ye found selfe euen giftes iewes baptisme receiue ye dispite christ seeke heauye paineful burden iewishnes wyse thriuyng scholers rude beginnynges growe forwarde encrease ye suche godly commemdable rudimentes fal backe worse iewes borne vnder bondage grosse lawe forsakyng ceremony theyr elder repayre vnto spiritual doctrin gospel ye contrary godly beginnyng gospel heauenly profession growe kinde iewishe supersticion iewes become christian menne labor ye christian become iewes neded v indaungered become debter christ moses law sufficiently worke saluacion forsake ye whose sake ye haue suffered suche affliccions euen hated christes name glory circumcision thinketh saued man fallen christ wyll ye suche sorte vse selfe menne shal thinke ye haue christes sake suffered vaine suche great affliccions god forbid ye haue suffered vayne right way ye ye lacke good wyl lacke knowledge malice partie rather staggeryng enticemet amende tymes feare ye shall nethelesse enioye fruite olde fayth texte moreouer ministreth spirite worketh miracle among doeth dedes lawe preachyng fayth euen abraham beleued god ascribed righteousnes tell whether god geueth holy spirit meruailous workes sheweth mightie power whether say doth god ye haue kepyng moses law wone fauor el rather preachyng ye gaue credence gospel gentile become iewes worke suche miracle assone circumcised ye cause desyrous lawe wonderfull workes seen none suche haue receiued fayth gospel elswhere looke ende whence ye see begunne beginnyng author circumcision abraham whose child iewes glory circumcised muche obtained circumcision praise perfite iustice onely credence geuyng goddes promise tyme yet circumcised reade genesis abraham circumcised thereby became righteous abraham beleued god coumpted righteousnes texte ye knowe therfore whiche fayth child abraham promise therfore made long since abraham posteritie none theyrs belongeth haue nothing el abraham circumcision suche fayth geuyng gospel natural child theyr circumcision proude boste selfe abraham child make suche vaunte crake al vaine synce bastardes lawfull begotten child abraha suche none el natural child faythfully theyr heartes geue credence vnto god abraham put theyr trust speakyng vnto v gospel stocke euer descended carnal kynred herein regarded estemed like perfeccion myndes texte scripture seyng afore hande god would iustifie heathen fayth shewed hand glad tidynges vnto abraha saying shal nacions blessed whiche fayth blessed faythful abraham marke considre saying scripture many yeres gon testified ment wete al men fayth loke saluacion onely fewe iewes circumcision preached vnto gospel many hundreth yeres gone god promised abraham saying shal al nacions blessed wynne praise could wyse true al nacions shuld borne abraham yet blessyng promised vnto people though posteritie dede bloud stocke resemblyng fayth besemeth child resemble parentes therfore suche mistrustyng ceremony workes lawe haue vndoubted trust promise gospel true child abraha shall theyr faythful father enioy blessyng promised vnto whiche suche shalbe excluded bastardes vnlawfully begotten worthy cursed blessed circumcision trust saued texte many dedes lawe subiecte curse writte cursed euery one continueth thinges whiche written boke lawe fulfil many hang vpon obseruaunces moses law kepe dede breake vnder goddes indignacion curse iewes selfe cannot deny forasmuche boke deuteronomie wyse written cursed continueth thinges whiche written boke lawe doeth suche thinges lawe comaunded whiche wordes ye see suche kepe lawe ceremonial promised made righteous transgressers therof threatened goddes curse man able perfourme whole lawe specially synce suche thyng whiche inhibicion hath prouoked men syn gyueth strength ablenes suppresse ouercome desyers texte man iustified lawe syght god euident iuste shall lyue fayth law fayth man fulfilleth thinges contayned lawe shall lyue brieflye graunt man maye throughlye kepe lawe suche one happely shall among men taken accoumpted ryghteouse lykewyse coumpted god whose hande yf man throughe keping ceremonial lawe moses iudged righteous without doubte trewe prophet acu wrytten righteous lyueth fayth syn seede wherof death groweth godlye lyfe begynnyng wel spryng lyfe law hangeth vpon keping certayne prescript ceremontes vpon fayth ceremony obserueth kepeth shall lyue dede euerlastyng lyfe wherof throughe faythe put assuraunce looke righteousnes lawe gyueth lyke kynde lyfe gyueth among men whoso breaketh rule law ryghteous lyueth among men oute feare punishmet god neither shall accoupted righteous yet lyuyng vnles surely truste vpon promise made gospell texte christe hath deliuered v curse lawe inasmuche made cursed v written cursed euery one hageth tree blessing abraham might come gentile iesus christe might receyue promise spirite fayth christe among vnder curse lawe innocente hurtles lambe law nothing endaungered daunger reason therof accursed whiche wretchednes curse delyuered v turnyng offence innocencie oure curse blessing muche lesse woulde haue nowe vnder bodage carnal law howe delyuered v without doubte beyng without spot syn vpon bodye tooke payne oure trespaces dewe curse vnder whome toke vpon hymselfe whereas free partaker blessyng e oure trespaces vpon hym whiche offender among offender oure redempcion suffered shamefull vilanie crosse boke deuteronomie reade cursed euery one hangeth tree woulde god haue surelye intente curse lawe beyng taken awaye blessyng promised abraham shoulde steede throughe fayth take place take place saye iewes onlye gentile throughe benefite lawe whome christ woulde haue abolyshed free mercye iesus christe whose death beyng brought agayne goddes fauour delyuered burden grosse lawe maye throughe fayth obtayne blessyng gospell promised abraham posteritie spirituall posteritie meane carnall let v surely truste god wil promyse deceyue manne promised wyll perfourme texte p brother speake maner men though mannes testament yet yf allowed manne dispiseth addeth thyng therto abraham seede promise made sayth seedes manye thy seede one whiche christe intent ye shall better vnderstand loe worldly familiar example thoughe betwixt god man comparison yet mannes testamente couenaunte allowed ratified manne either breaketh putteth thyng contrary wyll maker howe muche stable sure shouldto abraham seede promise made couenauntes promise god god promised abraham blessyng whiche seede nacions worlde shoulde haue wherin obserued marked scripture sayde seedes seede leste dauid moses myght loke haue goddes promise wordes noted seede verye seede euerlastyng abraham whiche iesus christe whome throughe baptisme throughe receyuyng spirite throughe loke gyftes whiche god hath already gyuen vnto hym texte saye lawe whiche began afterwarde beyonde foure hundred thirtie yeares dothe disanull testamente confirmed afore god vnto christwarde make promise none effecte yf inheritaunce come lawe commeth nowe promise god gaue vnto abraham promyse compare former example promise couenaut whiche god lawe gyuen made abraham whiche promise woulde haue stable lawe whiche folowed gyue promise couenaunt coulde defete disanul yet shoulde restrayne disapoynt promise yf inheritaunce goddes blessing promised abraham posteritie due suche kepe lawe forasmuche promyse condicion lawe expressed howe coulde therin lawe mencion made synce lawe tyme gyuen case lawe folowed promise yet woulde god netheles abraham posteritie haue kepte couenaunt made abraham nowe yf promise blessed state due reason goddes promise promise made law condicion keping law ioyned wt itfor inheritaunce cu law c cause exclude fro promise suche law straugers straungers fayth yf lawe men enioye thenheritauce goddes promise couenaunt frustrate broken whiche god without kepyng lawe wyll perfourme euen lyke man hath agreed gyue hym doughter mariage bargayne made go worde denying vnles agayne wyll promise hym syster wheras bargayne makyng syster borne tyme couenaunte mutual mariage mencion made promise god free vpon onlye condicion fayth confirmed perfourmeth man hath right promise texte wherfore serueth lawe lawe added trangression vntyll seede came whome promise made ordayned angelles hande mediator wyll saye yf fayth goddes promise euery manne must loke saluacion ende purpose made god vnprofitable lawe afterwarde saye al vnprofitable albeit make manne vpright innocent yet restrayneth oure libertie syn whyles ceremony kepeth noughtie desyers appetite within due measure compace ryght reason vnrulyethe lawe adde transgressio malice men required lawe gyuen al yet lawe gyuen neyther men shoulde therto wholye euer bounde gyuen god tyme shadowyng season christe come punishementes fearyng men synne promise prouokyng well purpose made ordayned aungels goddes commaundement endure vntyll many eares seede shoulde come wherby god abraham promised saluacion abraham lawfull chyldren suche sorte law made angel yet whole power gouernaunce christe handes suche wyse meane came betwixt moses lawe grace gospell ende one begynner suche sorte also meane betwixte god man thentent would betwixt make atonement hymselfe comprised bothe nature texte mediatour mediatour one god one lawe agaynste promyse god god forbid mediatour meane betwixte must needes meane betwixte many man hymselfe dissencion disagreed god father one makynde variaunce wherfore necessarie shoulde certayne thyrde parson whiche hymselfe contaynyng nature shoulde bryng bothe vnitie concorde death fyrste pacifying god wrath doctrine alluring worlde trewe honouryng god lawe contrarie goddes promise forasmuche lawe folowyng promyse made god made promise vayne kepte men continual expectacion loking goddes promise doyng myght apte readye receyue grace offered gospell lawe abolyshed agaynst goddes promise conuenient meete shadowes gyue place truth vnfectuall whiche mightie effectuall texte yf bene lawe giuen whiche coulde haue gyuen lyfe doubte righteousnes haue come lawe scripture concludeth thinges vnder syn promise fayth iesus christe shoulde gyuen vnto beleue fayth came kepte vnder lawe shutte vp vnto faythe afterwarde declared yf suche lawe bene gyuen coulde vnfaynedlye truly haue giuen lyfe neuer haue bene abrogate shoulde haue nede healpe ayde ghospell asmuche lawe euery man might haue attayned vnto perfite righteousenes sufficient bene therfore case truste vpon lawe euerlastyng saluacion desyrouse nowe leste men vpon boldenes theyr workes myghte despise thebut scripture concludeth thinges vnder sinne grace christe purpose lawe gyuen declaryng prescribyng done auoyded men shoulde perceyue themself daunger syn whyles shune lawe knewe euyll vndoubtedly ouercommen theyr noughtie desyers meanes knowyng theyr disease myght willyngly embrace remedie offered grace gospell lawe gyuen menne without correccion fell syn whome lyked streyght thought lawfull defence mennes synfull lyfe thyng laye theyr excuse lawe suche brake coulde chuse graunt well deserued punishement somuche could denied good honeste whiche lawe commaunded god therfore great wysedom suche meanes taken awaye vayne confidence selfes sette oure iyen synfull lyuyng declareth perfourmeth promise made abraham whiche iewes loked peculiarlye belongyng beyng sayed chyldren abraham generally belong suche fayth becommen abraham chyldren theyr deserte keapyng lawe theyr heartes put theyr affiaunce ghospel beleued also death iesus christe godly lyfe shal people haue receyue glory also saluacion purpose lykewyse season serued moses lawe partly manacyng punishmentes partly wt hope promise made therin partly rude expressing christe come iewes suche sorte within theyr bondes leste christe commyng haue foud strayed kyndes mischiefe neither worthy yet apte receyue grace gospell promise lawe iewes certayne rude knowledge misterie gospell obseruaunce lawe menne long stayed vnderpyght vntyll ghospell opened whiche law shadowes represented yf men wyll nowe awake maye clearlye see euen put vre wherof dreame texte p wherfore lawe oure scholemaister vnto christe might made ryghteouse faythe fayth come lenger vnder scholemaister ye chyldren god ye beleue christe iesu al ye baptised haue put christ lawe therfore brought men perfite righteousnes scholemaister gyuen rude people whome regarde honestie yet able kepe good order myghte feare ofthat mighte de righteous feyth punishemente kept extreme noughtines suche meanes encreasyng lytle lytle mighte broughte trustyng vpon theyr olde ceremony vnto christ whome onely loke receyue perfite righteousnes nowe chylde vnder scholemaister scholemaister hym muste al waye hande onlye vntyll suche tyme beyng rype growen vppe better knowledge euen theyr owne accorde fall honestie haue nede feare punishemente kepte euyll theyr father encouragyng freelye wyllyngly study goodnes honestie whyle nowe rulyng theyr scholemaister whose holsome sharpe correction tyme endured father therfore though tenderly loue chyldren compelleth yet tyme vnder scholemaister whose maister chyldren shorte tyme shall hathe god sharpenes lawe kepte vnder rude grosse people vntyll concerning doctrine ghospel beyng made owne menne lenger neede vnder correccion theyr scholemaister lyue freelye free chyldren vnder theyr moste mercifull father though god gaue vnto iewes onely scholemaysterfor ye chyldren god ye beleue yet toke onelye chyldren ather coumpted suche faythe ghospell graffed bodye iesus christe endued holye spirite goddes chyldre soone christe made one nowe yf wherby ioyned vnto christe generallye belong menne lette shoulde god shoulde indifferently coumpte chyldren throughe baptisme haue ye receyued spirite christe circumcision many baptised become christ ioynte enheriters behalfe poynt inferior iewes boast themself priuelege circumcision neuer somuche texte iewe neither gentile neither bonde neither free neither man woman ye one christe iesu yf ye christes ye abraham seede heyres accordyng promyse thinges hange vpon mennes fauer condicion state person regarded god woulde benefite bothe free also commen men throughe baptisme newe borne agayne sodenly altered newe creature touching gyft layed noman passed vpon whether baptisme iewe gentile bonde man free manne woman ye baptisme belonging christes bodie equally partaker goddes gifte whiche head conuayed member yf christe seede abraham god promisedfor ye al one christ iesu blessyng nacions worlde forasmuche ye planted christe nedes must ye abraham posteritie farther yf ye abraham posteritie euen lyke heyres ye haue ryght promise god yf felowshyp christe ye become goddes chyldren receyued fayth baptisme necessarily foloweth inheritaunce equallye appertayneth men fourth chapiter texte say heyre long childe differeth seruaunt lord vnder tuters gouernours vntil tyme father hath appointed euen also child bondage vnder ordinaunces worlde long synce goddes promise due title inheritauce receiued sayd mannes lawes ordinauces heyre within age vseth right yea nothing differeth fro seruaut borne lorde ouer kept vnder feare ruled men wyll passyng tyme vnder creansers gouernours vntyl growen vp rypenes whiche either lawe father hath appointed likewyse tyme past yet apt receiue gift whiche requireth euen heauely mindes vnderstadinges also therto stregth sufficient yet like child wt suche certaine grosse lawes mete infirmity kept due ordre beyng suche tyme could sauor heauenly learnyng rather suche would suche thinges moued might fleshely iyen seen material thynges world example difference dayes differeces meates differeces apparel sacrificyng killyng beastes circumcision long apt receiue higher instruccions euen seruauntes season obeyed vnder texte time ful come god sent sonne made woman made bonde vnto lawe redeme whiche bonde vnto lawe eleccion might receiue inheritaunce belogeth vnto natural sone assone came wardship growen vp ryper age tyme paste whiche euerlastyng father secrete cousel appointed suffered v leger vnder carnal rule lawe sent deliueraunce neither moses prophete onely sonne iesus christ sent sonne say seen thinges seen dreame vision man might doubt whether openly euery mannes iyen man borne woman vnder weakenes nature thetha eleccion myghte receyue thinheritaunce entent would readyly heale wretchednes god would haue circumcised suffre bondage lawe thende would deliuer iewes burdaine lawe founde therto subiecte noman thencefoorth like childe within age liue vnder gouernours called libertie child bondage contrary name childe texte ye sonnes god hath sent spirit sonne heartes cryeth abba father god would goodnes euidently declare restored fredome child puttyng away feare punishement hath powred euen bottome heartes spirit sonne v certaine witnes god child spirite seruage sauoreth cryeth one sorte loue good mynde child one desireth escape displeasure maister thother great confidence crieth father father texte wherfore thou art seruaunt sonne thou sonne thou arte also heyre god christ wherin doubted god doeth muche thakefully knowledge name godly loue charitie name feare say neither would christ haue called scholers brother haue taught menne praye vnto god vnder name father teacheth v say father whiche art heauen soeuer therfore god geueth spirite sonne man lenger seruaunt sonne christ sonne likewyse must god heyre namely synce whoso adopcion receiueth name sonne doyng geueth right inheritaunce texte notwithstandyng ye knewe god ye seruice vnto whiche nature god ye haue knowen god yea rather knowe god ye turne againe vnto weake beggerly ordinaunces whervnto againe ye desyre afreshe bondage ye obserue dayes monethes tymes yeres feare lest haue bestowed labor vain iewes season grosse religion rather supersticion kept vnder vtterly slyde al religion tyme true god vnknowen vnto accordyng ordinaunces elder ye worshipped deuils beleuyng goddes whiche dede none semeth muche nigher true religion vnder false thinketh god dispisyng religion god layeth iewes charge tyme liued vnder theyr elder lawes fro taught better learnyng turned right trade godly conuersacion worshippyng idolles ye erroniously supposyng haue heauenly power honour layde synce tyme preachyng gospell ye knewe liuyng god el speake better synce tyme ye werebut ye haue knowen god c knowen god ye found holy spirite drewe vnto euen whereas ye nowe tenderly loue father cometh none meanes fyrst loued god fauorably gentilly forgatte olde errour owne accorde trueth knowen wylfully returne againe offence outragious damnable iewes beyng taught true religion forsake theyr ceremony wyll ye beyng called fro idolatrie taught preachyng gospell perfite religion receiuyng holy ghost cast selfe againe headlong iewishe bondage wheras ye fre ye rather vnder grosse beginnynges worlde whiche neither able make righteous effectual saluacionhow ye turne againe vnto weake beggerly ordinauces c fall ye againe iewishely ye obserue day monethes yeres suche difference tyme though iewishe sabboth day feastes newe moone holy dayes tymes wherin iewes either certain thinges abstaine certaine vnlawful actes thyng healped onward saluacion christian men tymes free honour god ye haue christ sure confidence whence supersticion ye haue teare lest haue vaine bestowed muche labor vpon instruccion ye fall christ ye myngle iewishenes suffer either whiche haue suche great sundry trouble taught gospel lose therin labor ye vaine haue suffered christ sake suche affliccions texte brother beseche ye ye ye haue hurt ye knowe infirmitie fleshe preached gospel vnto first teptacion whiche fleshe ye dispised neither abhorred receiued angel god euen christ iesus rather regarde ceremony lawe ye see put trust christ onely selfe sometyme suche one ye iudgyng high pointe godlynes circumcised kepe iewishe sabboth day obserue difference meates sacrifice beastes zeale persecuted churche god whiche pointes reaken trifle wheras brother somewhat vehemently complaine vpo surely may ye beleue seke myne owne weale mightye haue hurt al quiet vprightnes myne owne conscience selfe contented displeased ye haue done wronge pitie see go suche good beginnynges looke rather ye stable constant encreasyng styl better better rather better worse tyme fyrst preached vnto gospell iesus christ submitted selfe weakenes rise ye vppe strength lose gloriouse praise fayth late preached vnto gospel ye knewe toke great royal state vpo euen behauour lowe simple abiecte person pray saw ye sealy ready take harme hated many christes name vnder diuerse trouble vexacions beside one simple rude language taught nothyng iesus christ sake faste vpon crosse whiche tyme suche readynes fayth ye suche vilenes person beyng nothyng offended neither forsooke dispised gospell tyme fayth therin promised life euerlastyng yea say ye receiued heartely great honoure paule angel god yea iesus christ selfe ye perceiued brought vnto worldely doctrine heauenly godly went aboute myne owne busynes labored iesus christes behalfe god therfore christ worshipped ye texte felicitie beare recorde yf possible ye would haue plucked owne iyes haue geuen therfore become enemie tel trueth whiche actes well declare singular fayth ye whiche ready sounde constant abated notwithsta dyng myne affliccions notwithstandyng vilenes ioyful blessed iudged self lucky gotten suche good disciple ye suche good beginnynges repet felicitie becomen also mine whiche tyme reioysed ye likewyse ought truely testifie loue bare ye towarde neede ye would haue plucked euen iyen heades haue geuen vnto slide ye callyng vnto newe apostle learne iewishnes flatteryng coloured wordes allure geat fauor preachyng suche thinges helpe saluacion suche make theyr lucre auauncement therfore become enemy plainely truely taught suche thinges well wyst belonged saluacion texte ielouse ouer amisse yea entende exclude ye feruent warde good alwayes feruent good thyng onely present wel see galathias wherabout go ielously wooe enuiyng labor wynne fauor yet neither good ne godly purpose profite plucke backe libertie gospel iewishnes vnder whiche selfes busily labor make like thende may seme folowe teache meruailous goodly kynde doctrine thinke euery manne euery thyng must folowed folowe suche thinges good costantly onely present among also absent ye sawe dispise ceremony lawe preache thing vnto christ ye folowed preachyng present well done folowe ye myne absence suche thinges good texte lytle child trauaile birth againe vntil christ fashioned would wer could change voyce stande doubt would god ye could iyen se secrete partes heart ye clearely perceiue great griefe write litle child begotte christ without great trauaile paine swaruyng christ labor beare againe vntyl christ throughly fashioned sowed good seede wherof te perfite christian haue growen enchauntment wote ye turned iewes chaunged kynde christ heauenly spiritual ye carnal yearthly epistle expresseth sufficiently vehemencie minde would god might bei would wer co chaunge voyce presently among liuely wordes sette sorte signifie letter vehemencie would partely countenaunce partely teares partely voice encreased bring againe christ would chaunge selfe sortes sometymes speake faire sometimes require sometimes chide accordyng variety nature necessitie matter would better apply temper wordes would assaye euery medicine vntyll tyme brought health forasmuche see fallen iewishenes ieopardie fallyng trust costant doctrine minde muche care feare vncertaine kynde letter reamedie great harme texte tell ye desyre vnder lawe ye heare lawe written abraham two sonnes one bonde mayde free moman yea whiche borne bonde woman borne fleshe whiche free woman borne promise peculiarly speake vnto suche contented fall backe iewishnes beseche answere moses lawe greatly please folowe ye authoritie ye distrust gospel euen moses lawe selfe would suche receiued felowship christ free bondage lawe ye receiued lawe ye geue none eare sayd ye gaue eare vnto ye vnderstande ye cleaue litterall meanyng onely pearce spiritual sence therof written booke genesis abraham beginner father right beleuers two sonnes elder called ismael begatte agar theabraham two sone c bonde maide yonger called isaac lawfull wife sara borne handemaide borne child comenly wont nothing abraham sone euen iewes neuer farre christ borne free wife contrarye comon course nature borne barrain mother olde father accordyng god promised age weakenes body put desperacion hauyng heyre god promise put perfite assurauce haue child fyrst childe therfore childe nature childe fayth texte whiche thinges spoken alligorie two testamentes one mounte sina whiche gendereth vnto bondage whiche agar mounte sina agar arabia bordereth vpon citie whiche called ierusale bondage child ierusalem whiche aboue free whiche mother v supposed tale hath beside trueth historie secrete hidden misterie comenly suche moses law mane vnder grosse fleshe coueryng body hidden soule ruler therof vnder letter historie priuey thyng higher mistery couered let v serche foorth alligorie two mother two sonnes signifie surely thefor two testame te c twoo mother represent twoo testamentes one brought foorth people subiecte bondage lawe brought foorth people fayth free fro burdain sina mou taine arabia whiche chaldee language hath name bondmaiden agar bordereth vpon mountaine sion wherin standeth cytie called iebus called ierusalem inhabite mountaine agar euen day bonde theyr state resemblyng beginner nacion ierusalem whiche inheritaunce fel isaac posteritie free citie forasmuche standeth high place representeth heauen whose freedome called cytie onely mother iewes v whiche beleue christ moses lawe yearthly lawe gospel forasmuche camebut ierusalem whiche aboue free c heauen heauenly body seruaunt soule whiche grosse bonde whiche spiritual free moses lawe brought foorth childe fyrst lawe gospel albeit issue yet many child brought god moses lawe brought foorth one nacion great multitude neither lawe gospel containeth nacions worlde texte written reioyce thou barren bearest child breake foorth cry thou trauailest desolate hath many child whiche hath husband lest thinke chaunce esai long sayd spirite prophecie foreseyng great noumbre gentile resortyng gospel christ oyseth wordes glad thou barren bearest child breake foorth crye thou trauailest many child haste thou whiche semedst desolate barren hath hath husbad semed put men meruailous hope posteritie iewes state tyme fewe came vnto god fauor fayth gospel hath brought many wil without ende bryng thus see ye twoo mother theyr twoo child beginner twoo nacions texte brother isaac child promise borne fleshe persecuted borne spirite euen suche yet styfly cleaue moses lawe belong ismael whiche borne handmayde whiche gyuyng ouer cofidence lawe perfite fayth hang vpon christ isaac child borne free lawful wyfe cour e nature promise god receyued welthy state taught gospell borne vnder lawe god log synce promised saluacion thorough fayth woulde come felowshyp sonne iesus christ yea also allegorie featly agreeth bothe posterity sauer theyr beginner tha elder sonne ismael carnall sonne vnto abraham persecuted yonger called isaac borne goddes promise eue tyme whe playeo together takyng vpon hym mere tyme cleaue faste carnall lawe hate suche embrace spiritual lawe gospel labouryng esteamed chalengyng theyrs ryght fyrste begotten whiche dewe christe labouryng also title aunciencie make free mother chyldren bonde thentent elder seruauntes maye ouer v yonger beare rule texte neuerthelesse sayeth scripture putte awaye bonde woman sonne sonne bond woman shal heyre sonne free woman brethen chyldren bond woman free woman free mother alloweth suche alteracion wyl suffer two borne suche diuerse sorte conuersaunt together put away bond womanne wt sonne scripture saythe great indignacion cryeth put awaye bonde woman sonne wyl suffer bond womanes childe shal wt sonne isaac inheritour iewyshe synagoge muche hangeth whiche beleue gospell iewes require muche christian whose libertie enuye yt bonde mother wyll gladly depart let rather thrust wt slauyshe companye corrupt sonne inheritaunce euerlastyng lyfe promised isaac hym dewe let agar yf luste carye furthe water potte vnsauery lawe whome greatly loueth sonne isaac drynkyng effectuall lickor gospel shal styll good lucke growe vp vntill become perfite man wherfore suffer brother iewes stubbernly delyte seruile lawe haue styl theyr owne bondage growe oute kynde theyr mother sometime selfe vnder bondage law lyke vnto chyldre bond woma agar persecuted verie naturall childre churche nowe delyuered fro olde bondage receyued title saraes chyldren libertie thanke christ whome fayth planted become inheriters promised inheritauce heauen libertie christe hath death falling restored v iewes ye gentile called preaching gospell v chapiter texte p stande faste therfore libertie wherwith christe hath made v free wrappe youre selues agayne yoke bondage nowe remayneth nothyng ye stedfastlye continewe ye haue gotten madnes forsake liberall gyfte freedome wherin christe especiall fauer hath sette become bonde paynfull bondage haue experience glad reioyse oure libertie ye youre libertie suche sorte weaty ye content become bonde texte p beholde paule saye vnto yf ye circumcised christe shall profite nothing wyse peraduenture ye deceyue selfe saying renounce christ would euerlasting saluacion assuraunce ioyne christe lawe together tell christe would haue whole benefite comen woulde onlye thanked bounteouse gyfte wyll haue copartener ye shall better vnderstande great ieopardy turne backe iewishnes beholde paule apostell gentile whome ye well knowe yea apostle appointed christe hymselfe tell playnly yf ye circumcised christe shall nothyng profite yf ye perfitelye beleue able gyue men healthe euerlastyng seeke ye circumcision ye mistruste feare leste able know ye yet benefite christe wherof suche mistrust cannot partaker synce gyfte giuen suche beleue truste muche desearte oure workes either muste ye whollye become iewes forsake christ el christian wholly forsake iewyshnes suche playe handes cannot awaye wyl haue newe wyne poured olde bottels yet olde wyne newe bottels beare haue newe clothe sowed patched olde garmente olde clothe patchedlye sowed newe bondage iewyshenes easye neded peraduenture passed vpon yf rewarde great payne therof parte therby recompensed nowe besydes burden exceadyng paynful ye shal takyng haue auauntage also great hurte texte testifie agayne euery man whiche circumcised bounde kepe whole lawe christ become vayne vnto manye iustified lawe fallen grace beware leste suche standyng owne conceytes ye deceyue selues saying wyl whole burden lawe bound somewhat wyl take lawe example circumcision onlye lest seme vtterly refuse sacrificyng beastes suche obseruaunces lawe wyll medle ye shall deceyued tell men playnlye whosoeuer doth circumcise hym selfe whether iewe gentile man maketh hymselfe bonde kepyng whole lawe throughe baptisme menne wholy belong christe whoso circumcised byndeth hymselfe law circumcision marke wherby becommeth iew vncircumcised gentile stande libertie gather lawe suche thinges nedefull circumcised bounde whole lawe whoso content receyue circumcision muste lykewise therwith receyue sacrifice kepyng sabboth feastes newe moone washynges choyse meates standing fasting dayes suche lyke wylfully submit youre selfe great burden playne poynt madnes speciallye rewarde vnder moste paynful vnprofitable bondage fallyng christ gyuer libertie saluacion yf nowe haue ofte tymesas manye stified lawe c tolde ye looke purchase perfite iustice helpe law confidence workes promiseth certayne perfeccio surely ye gone departed ferre felowshyp christe woulde haue gyfte free gyuen desertes yf ye departed christes felowshyp lawe wyll good neither rather confusion yf lawe anye vse profit lyght gospel al gospel preached taught quite gone yf ye esteme lawe christe abolyshed ye receiue christ muste lawe gyue place speake lawe vnderstande groce carnall parte moses lawe whome iewes stifly mayntayne corporal obseruaunces therof promysing themselues perfite righteousnes thinkyng bloud beastes sprinkled vpon pourgeth soule synne washyng water scoureth filthines soules cleane vncleane meat pourgeth defileth mynde texte looke hope spirite iustified faith iesu christ neither circumcision thyng worthe neither yet vncircucision fayth worketh loue contrariwyse embracyng spirituall parte lawe looke righteousnes promised supersticiouse obseruaunces corporall ceremony throughe gospel beleue christes death freelye receyue innocencie lyfe full saluacion nothyng skylleth whether ye come christe circumcised vncircumcised synce mattier standeth kepyng lawe fayth whiche albeit without workes moses lawe yet idle secretly worketh vehement onwardnes godlynes muche lawe byddeth charity sake whiche withoute bydding euen owne accorde dothe muche law manacing wordes punishment able get yf ye haue charitie nede haue rule lawe ye lacke auayleth kepyng lawe texte ye runne wel let vnto ye beleue truthe co sente vnto noman euen counsel whiche came hym calleth lytle leauen dothe leauen whole loumpe dowe course gospell ye dyd runne apace makyng hastye spede euen ryght waye towarde chiefe game euerlastyng blysse stayed course approue ye continually thing wherewith ye well pleased go ye fro intended purpose folowing mennes myndes whyle beware mannes authoritie weyghe muche make drawe backe course apoynted foule shame fall shadowes ye gaue credece truthe taught nothing commaunded god labour persuade contrarie lettyng therby encrease fayth andwho lette ye beleue truthe callyng youre profession iewyshenes folowe god theyr authour faythe hath called fauour iewyshnes receyuing circumcision folow worldly desyres seekyng theyr gaynes glorie maynteynaunce theyr tyrannie diligently take hede beware theyr persuasion fewe onles ye auoyde fewes companie feared leste corrupte whole multitude deface puritie religion euen ye see lytle leauen sowreth whole batche wherwith myngled castyng lytle sournes self throughout whole dowe whiche swete neuer smal poynt iewishnes myngled gospel lytle wyll corrupte purenes therof texte haue truste towarde lorde ye shall none otherwyse mynded troubleth shall beare iudgement whatsoeuer forasmuche ye haue hitherto staggered throughe enticement despayre ye wyll hencefurth stedfastlye continewe youre olde godly purpose standyng truste muche vpon knowledge triall youre nature speciallye vpon helpe christe wrought begynne mery chere wyll lykewyse worke grace manfully continew whosoeuer hath new learning troubled quietnes purenes faith albeit deceyue menne yet shall escape goddes iudgement hym tyme certayne consideracions vtter vse extremitie agaynste hym goddes handes whome vnknowen sure punyshed without regarde mannes authoritie whome hath muche rather offended let moue though saye abhorre kepyng law whiche haue iewes lyued lyke iewe caused timothie circumcised dyd compulsion oftentimes resisting gyuyng yet place tyme wherin sawe greate ieopardie hande doyng contrarie yf done bene great commocion nowe vpon diuersities tyme circumstaunce expedient folowe another way tell briefly herein mynde one suffer permit circumcision preache suffered timothie circumcised neuer taught either anye el circumcised lykewyse oftetymes conuersaunt among iewes abstayned meates forbydden lawe neuer enioyned vnto anye man suche choyse meates shoulde rather taught contrarie forced nothyng kynde meates eate vse soberly thankes geuyng god tyme nedefull beare sinistre rooted persuasion iewes nowe synce gospell clearelye knowen iewes stubbernely labour drawe gentile theyr supersticion neither wel done ieopardiles beare lynger rather besemeth euery man boldely preache moses lawe expired men ought embrace libertie gospell texte brother yf yet preache circumcision suffer persecucion sclaunder crosse ceased woulde god separated whiche trouble yf trewe reporte preache set furth circumcision cause whye vntyll daye iewes maliciously hatefully persecute thence al countrey mennes displeasure suche sorte preache christes gospell therwith teache moses lawe gone abolished iewes thynke among men made yf rite moses law might myngled christes doctrine nowe great enuie haue people fayth receiued goddes fauour whyles vpon carie vnprofitable marke circumcision cause without al pitie haue long tyme gone destruccio euery preache promi e men perfite weale without helpe circumcision yf preached circumcisio falsly report iewes styll persecute synce cause al theyr displeasurewhy th n suffer persecucion borne towarde vtterly taken awaye trust ye ye people galacia preachyng hath alwayes ben one shall hencefurth continewe lyke youre parte see lykewyse fayth myne farre mynde agree teache circumcision yf theyr stubbernes wyll suffer forsake theyr lawe rather tha vtterly withdrawe gospell theyr persuasion plucke ryght waye woulde wyshe vtterly separate felowshyp gospell yf frowardly gyuen circumcision god graunt circumcised also vtterly cutte maye plenteously haue theyr desyer better perishe drawe many damnacion texte brother ye called libertie let libertie occasion vnto fleshe loue spirite serue one lawe fulfylled one worde whiche thou shalte loue thy neyghbour thy selfe yf ye byte deuoure one another take hede leste ye lykewyse consumed one another synce content let styll continewe theyr shamefull bondage ye brother throughe gospell called libertie bonde nothyng elles nowe remayneth take hede libertie gyuen vnto spirite christe applyed occasion fleashlye lustes bondage lawe suche sorte taken awaye steede come charitie taughte gospell whiche fayre meanes obtayneth lawe able compulsion yet among frendes whome one glad may stershyp bondage law byddeth noman put lyfe ieopardye defence frende man shoulde defraudyng nature ease brother nede thou whiche arte stronger shouldest beare weaker learned vnlearned better worse whiche yet commaundeth charitie whiche alwaye telleth thynges done force euen good wyll voluntarily besyde onlye charitie comprisyng whole strength effecte lawe briefly bryngeth aboute lawe many rule threatnynges able brablyng law many rule laboreth bryngfor lawe fulfilled one word c passe shorte sentence concluded written liuiticum whiche thou shalt loue thy neyghbour thy selfe wherfore yf ye charitie knytte together ye shall one others diligent labour helpe mutuall seruice labour comforte contrarye yf ye carnal men wont disagree eche one hating onlye helpe eche one another also backbite gnawe one another onlye backbyte gnawe lyke outragiouse wylde beastes asmuche deuoure great cause surelye haue ye feare leste ye lyke beastes tearyng one another eythers woundes destroyed inconuenience fall whiche beyng withoute charitie taught gospell stycke styll carnall law whyles measure al thynges theyr priuate commodity wheras contrary christian charitie readynes men good texte say walke spirite fulfill lustes fleshe fleshe lusteth contrary spirite spirite contrarye fleshe contrarye one ye cannot whatsoeuer ye would ye led spirite ye vnder lawe whole effecte woordes drawe ende forsomuche ye deliuered bondage moses carnal lawe ye leade life accordyng spiritual lawe charitie ye shall dede ye neither esteme perfite righteousnes stande iewishe ceremony liue vnder carnal desire ye liue vnder carnal lustes ye shal alway vnder lawe endeuour ye therfore leade spiritual life ye thus shal ye abstaine fro suche actes fleshethe fleshe lusteth cotrary spirit shal prouoke vnto one manne grosse heauy body soule heauenly immortal one law grosse parte call letter heauenly thyng whiche called spirite one mannes soule one power whiche styl calleth goodnes power contrary like vnto body letter law whiche prouoketh v dishonestie betwene partes cotinual battaile while fleshe fighteth spirite spirite fleshe well may fleshe restrained fro desyres yet wyll oppressed wyl labor striue spirite fleshe happen haue vpper hand sometyme seen man hath desyre godlines yet beyng ouercomen fleshe doth suche thinges knoweth auoyded spirite christ sufficiently moue willyngly suche thynges good godly hath moses lawe vpon none authoritie texte dedes fleshe manyfest whiche adultrie fornicacion vnclennes wantonnes worshippyng idolles witchecrafte hatred variaunce zeale wrath strife sedicion sectes enuiyng murder drokennes glotonie suche like whiche tel haue tolde tyme past whiche committe suche thinges shal inheritor kyngdome god ye shal ignorant spirite wherof speake thyng cannot seen fleshe may seen yet notthe dedes fleshe c th se adultrie c hard coniecture whether man seruaunt fleshe ledde spirite god welsprynges suche water flowe thence mannes life maners doynges plainly shewe man within wyl tyme speake doubtful hidden matter make plaine profe man styl seruaunt fleshe notwithstannyng baptised haue shaken bondage lawe aduoutry say fornicacion vnclennes watonnes idolatry witchecrafte hatred variance zeale wrath strise sedicion sectes enuy murder dronkennes glotony whosoeuer bonde albeit man baptised yet throughly free bondslaue naughtie desyres ouer bolde ye baptised workyng myracles tyme among warned letter earnestly warne againe al whiche suche thinges shalbe excluded enheritaunce kyngdome heauen texte contraryly fruite spirite loue ioy peace long sufferyng gentlenes goodnes faythfulnes mekenes temperancie suche lawe truely christes haue crucified fleshe affeccions lustes othersyde suche perfitely free ruled spirite god knowen fruites spirite ioyned charitie ioy peace long sufferyng gentlenes goodnes faythfulnes mekenes temperancie theyr owne good wyll haue nede pricked foorth compulsories lawe theyr owne innocencie maketh free besyde truely christes besemeth spiritual people haue crucified fleshe vice desire therof baptisme dye christ buried also texte li e spirite let v walke spirite let v desirous vayne glory prouokyng one enuiyng one may stande doubtfully betwene fleshe spirite whether folowe spirite geue life body reason body vnder gouernaunce spirite haue receiued life spirite christ law let v liue accordyng vnto inclinacion spirite haue truely tasted spirit christ let v bryng foorth fruites abstaine al carnal workes let v desyrous vainglory prouokyng eche one v debate strife enuiyng one v euen professe rule godly life vice oftetymes trouble whiche yet dede pestilence destruccion true godlynes vi chapiter texte brother man also taken faulte ye whiche spiritual healpe amende spirite mekenes consideryng thy selfe lest thou also tempted hitherto haue shewed brother ende haue taken christes religion vpon must enforce selfes yet baptisme taketh v men styl among reason weakenes fal offence part stroger spirit god haue geue place fleshly desyres gentle meke wordes restore againe encouragyng vp may rise againe wt rough speache causing despayre hipocrites vse suche proud lokes high wordes christes spirite forasmuche desyreth al men saluacion meke gentle meanes calleth men amendement oftetymes chaunceth sharpe earnestnes withdraweth vtterly gentle brotherly correccion maketh humble boweth moses law suche sorte suppresseth synne destroyeth siner christia charitie remedyeth vice yet saueth better thou arte muche gentlely condescende thou thy brother weakenes christes owne example moue sufficiently mercifully suffered child vntil tyme theyconsideryng thy selfe lest tempted amended lestwyse yet lette encourage ye knowe like may chaunce vnto selfes texte beare ye one others burdaine fulfil lawe christ man seme selfe somewhat dede nothing deceiueth owne minde man fallen remember thou art fraile man also let fall vnto lesson neither bolde vpon thy selfe yet trust muche thine owne strength vse thy selfe towarde fallen thou wouldest glad vsed like chauced mischaunce may befal worldly man suche mocion certaine false apostle haue staggered must cruelnes banished company charitably called againe theyr olde stedfastnes tyme may come beyng made strong may againe beare weakenes hath vpo heauy burdain must eased throwen doune wherfore eche beare others burdaines shal ye euery point fulfill lawe charitie whichebeare ye one anothers burdaine lawe christes owne lawe christ wheras neither vnder synne nigh ieopardye therof yet bare vpon wickednes great mercy healed v condemned v one without pitie let man thinke selfe righteous vpon confidence therin despise brother kynde synne entangled man seame iust selfe profe fained righteousnes wherfore man thinke selfe somethyng dede nothyng deceiueth selfe texte let euery man proue owne worke shal haue reioysyng onely owne selfe euery man shal beare owne burdaine neither man therfore righteous auaunceth selfe sinner therfore one man defiled mennes synne submitte selfe restore againe therfore good copareth selfe worse euery man shalbe iudged owne dedes yet must noman owne dedes haue confidece euery manne must serche selfe whether wherin beareth selfe hand well suche god shuld allowed thine owne conscience condemne yet glory e weake glory thyne owne strength glory inwardly geuyng god thakes giftes bestowed vpon bost among ne dispise strong thou art helpe thou able thou able let god iudge alone neither shal synne diminishe thy rewarde thou mannes offence punished god euery man shal beare owne burdaine texte let taught worde minister vnto teacheth good thinges deceiued god mocked soeuer man soweth shal also reape soweth fleshe shal fleshe reape corrupcion soweth spirite shal spirite reape life euerlastyng long worlde bounde eche one helpe belongeth whose giftes aboue others teachyng comfortyng exhortacion helpe brother weakenes let suche holpen remembre vnthankeful suche haue done among shal al good thinges bebe deceiued god mocked comen preache gospel teache comfort beare vppe rude againe taught theyr substaunce geue theyr teacher counsailours necessary one let teache take heede theyr doctrine christian sauor spirite christ el better wer beleue teacher besyde corrupte teachyng gospel receiueth mede teacheth man deceiueth yea selfe god deceiued wherfore counsail ye teache sincerely gospel god mocked suche seede euery soweth suche shal mowe whoso teacheth carnal doctrin sede shal reape fruit corruptible teacheth spiritual doctrin shal spiritual heauenly counsail receiue like rewarde whiche life euerlastyng texte let v weary well doyng tyme come shall repe without wearynes whyle haue therfore tyme let v good vnto men especially vnto whiche housholde fayth therfore let v alwaye endeuoure men cease tyme good dedes whether haue gentle scholers vngentle whether haue rewarde men tyme shall come shall gather fruite whiche shall neuer dye receyue temporall labour wage euerlastyng sowyng time shall alwaye continew thewhen time come sh l reape without yn tyme shall come shal neither owne dedes holpen mennes tyme present lyfe maye good workes wyll goddes fauour helpe daye iudgemet neither shall oure good workes haue place able anye therfore let v take tyme whyle serueth endeuouryng bothe men specially religion fayth iewe fauoureth none iewes christian folowyng example christe desyrouse good men texte pye se howe large letter haue wrytten vnto myne owne hand many desyre outwarde apparence please carnally constrayne circumcised leste shoulde suffer persecucion crosse christ themselues whiche circumcised kepe lawe desyre haue circumcised might reioyse fleshe ye se ye people galacia matier delited myne owne hand wrote vnto long epistle ye knowe hande wryting cause haue ye thinke counterfaite letter myne declaracion good wyl towarde looke wt weight anye false apostle doctrine suche endeuoure rather please men god suche saye moue circumcised thintent maye bryng hatred gentile christes sake displeasure iewes lacke circumcision iewes teache feare displeasure theyr cou treymen yf shoulde without circumcision preache christe menne abolyshyng lawe suche rather stande feare men god seeke prayse menes handes rather goddes suche feare leste sincere profession crosse christe mighte stiere vp hate christes name persecute feare also leste shoulde coumpted vnlearned yf shoulde nothyng elles teache simple lesson christ crucified zeale borne lawe theyr countrey erroniouslye dyd persecutyng flocke christ forasmuche iewes self kepe law notwithstandyng theyr forefather circumcised abuse rudenes chargyng circumcision ende among theyr companion maye vaunte themselfe theyr preachyng teachyng ye fallen iewyshnes policie vse pacifie enuie theyr countrey men whiche coulde abyde throughe gospell christe lawe abrogate neither feare hatred iewes persecucion gentile lesse inceritie preache christes gospell texte god forbid shoulde reioyse crosse lord iesu christ wherby world crucified vnto vnto worlde christ iesu neither circumcision auayleth thyng vncircumcision newe creature god forbid shoulde anye thyng el reioyce crosse lorde iesu christe gentile knowe coumpte crosse vilanie reproche iewes hate enuie yet therin onlye put glorie whiche nothyng regarde worldly prayse one whome throughe baptisme beyng graffed bodie christe worlde iswherby worlde cru ified vnto vnto world deade contrary wyse worlde aduersities therof fearde prosperity delited passe vpon displeasure couet commendacion without feare worldly reproche without desyre vaynglory christe onlye sufficient al agaynst whose profession whether man come circumcised stocke iewes circumcised stocke gentile forceth whose bodye whoso fayth transfourmed sodaynely suche sorte chaunged become newe creature called regenerate button therfore worldely difference whoso professeth christe let nothyng el remember christian man texte manye walke acordyng rule peace mercye vpon israel pertayneth god hencefurthe let man put busynes beare body markes lorde iesu brother grace oure lorde iesu christ spirite amen let sure rule whiche rule whosoeuer folowe wyshe peace mercye meete wyshe thing whiche dauid wished israelytes psalmes saythe peace vpon israel isralites two sortes one whiche acoumpted men god streyght vecie israelite whiche circumcised whose mynde circumcised fayth strong godwarde suche israelite whiche noumber ye also wyshe peace mercie away false israelite suche stubbernly maliciously stryue agaynst gospell christe shall neuer doctryne moue haue preached wyll euer preache therfore matieri beare bodye markes lorde iesu let trouble far moued truthe gospell vilanye affliccion whether socuer go carie bodye spite haue christe sustayned emprisonmentes scourgynges chaynes stonynges aduersities suffered christes name token markes lorde iesus christe blasyng certayne sygnes victory coumptyng glorie farre maye deserue folow crosse christ whome preache grace good wyll lorde iesus christ brother euer spirite ayde ye maye continewe truthe gospell whiche desyer myne maye take effecte graunte whose spirite wrote finis christian reader iohn olde wysheth grace mercye peace god father sonne iesu christ lorde onely sauiour forasmuche moost gentle reader euery pryest vnd certayne degree scholes bounden kynges maiesties gracious iniunctios haue prouided daye lymited owne study erudicion whole paraphrase erasmus vpon newe testamente oth latine englishe heard neuertheles begynnyng last somer pryntout hertie good frend edwarde whitchurche paraphrase vpon seuen paules epistle saye ephesian philippian thepistles thessalonias timothee thepistle philemon neither translated ready prynte ne ye appoynted certaynly translated man thafore mencioned iniunction lyke case frustrate due execucion ignoraunt priestes iniunction breaker thynges ynowe bebesydes symple vulgare people hungryng thirstynge ryghteousnes wantyng paraphrase vnfedde onely vnfedde lacke suche liuely playne exposicions scripture paraphrase thynges also reason continuaunce accustomed vanity yea rather blasphemy churche broughte throughe popishe persuasion couetous gredye missal sacryficers daylye encreace errour ignoraunce althoughe myght iustely answered vnto onelye lacke translated paraphrase wherby commune people communely contynue still ignoraunce muche rather lacke aswell good wyll habilitie priestes curate reade good homylies al ready set forth scripture cuttyng hackynge hummyng cheopping mynceyng sort people parish broughte great tedious wearynes bicause vnsauery imperfite readynge pronouceing pointing good thinges also certayne coteptuous lothsomnes hatred therof seing curate beare lytell good wyl vnto warde furtherauce god worde glory parishene erudicion diligent cotinue aduaunce popyshe pryuate mass straunge tounged seruice passe awaye tyme kepe theselues people blynde styll yet myne vnfeyned hope trust lyke almyghtie euerlyuing god father lorde iesu christe christe al perfite christian hath owne vnspeakeable mercye mooste emperiall realmewarde geuen gracious godly vertuous learnedly toward faythful christen kyng worthy supreme head eue soueraine lord king edward vi rule gouerne nourishe defend thaduise ministery trauaile victorious noble vncle lorde protectours grace moste honourable counsayll seketh kyngdome heauen righteousnes therof aswell free settyng forth holy sacred scripture iniunccions visitoures diligent placeing sendyng abroade moste excellently learned reader preacher instructe subiectes true knowledge selues god theyr bounden dueties theyr superior also christian charitie neighbour also moste haboundaunte ryches mercye inscrutable power contynue wyth daylye encreace suche forewarde hertynes hertye forewardenes earnest godly procedynges kynges moste roial maiestie aduise ministerie trauayle foresayed ignoraunt minister charitably amoued ecclesiasticall cure hauyng competent trade lyfe rest vpon reasonable necessarie prouision honest mayntenaunce learnyng good minister beyng father mercy lorde glorye whose way vnsearcheable iudgementes incomprehensyble whose wisedome thynges swetely disposed ordred wyll case seruent hear e prayer slacke rendryng thankes vnto excedynge manifolde benefites sende conuenient w llyng l stye forewarde workemen copious great haruest englande aswel extirpacion banyshement yng popyshe faythe false religion cankred opinion heathnyshe rite idoiatrous worshyppynges supersticious deuoucions disguysed myssall sacrificeinges aduouterous conuersacion grosse vile iniquity arysyng growing contempt dishonour liuyng god braunches roote romyshe antichristian religion also plantyng settyng forth glorifyeng moste vndefyled lawe lorde conuerteth soules naughtynes godlynes syncere teaching sacred religion christ true wourshyp god reformacion maners also expressyng godly behauiour outwarde conuersacion ministre parishene walke loue christ hathe loued v christen almose dedes scripturely fastyng ghospellike prayer rendryng thankes lifting vp pure handes pacience long suffryng perfite charitie temperaunce sobrietie chastitie brotherly compassion true obedience towardes kynges maiestie set autoritie vnder hym office workes dedes vertues god requireth commaundeth actes proclamacions decree earnestlye straightely mentioned mooste holy perfite boke byble god doubt shall vouchesafe long preserue vnto thys realme vnspeakable worthy iewel kynges hyghnes defendyng fro daungerous plague curse due vnto wicked child vnbelefe shall vouchesafe also powre vpon mercy blessynges pleyntuous habundaunce hath promised boke beleuing chyldren obedience vpon respectes hope consideracion seing thaforenamed seuen epistle whiche dede necessarye requisite piece scripture furtheraunce christes religion christen maners rest newe testamet left vntraslated toke hade traslate seldome leasures possiblie could fro mine prophane trauailes incidet drudging vocacio spare last haue finished doubting albeit cofesse self eue fro botome mine vnmete kinde office carte husbadry caruer noble man table yet rude traslacio bothe accordyng texte euerye sentence agreably paraphrastes mynde playnlye englished vnderstandyng moste vnlearned englyshe men whose erudicion take vpon thys laboure althoughe curious soughte termes rhetoricall englishe thys translacion woulde better please delicate eares fyne wyttes men fynely broughte vp trickynge termes tounges yet asmuche translated paraphrase set forth informacion playne teaching kynges maiesties playne englyshe subiectes vnderstande none theyr owne natiue barayne tongue thoughte rather better seke edification playne vnlearned playne termyng wordes tedious circum ocucion make paraphrase vpon paraphrase meanes onelye leaue simple vulgare people vntaught neuer better also vayne sekynge curiositie iustly laught scorne bunglyng thyng ferre aboue capacitie therefore vnnecessary fynesse wanteth accept true meanyng playnesse good reader nobre men whiche leade get easye wealthye lyfe almoste altogether deprauinge comptrollyng querellyng mysreportyng fault fyndyng mennes doynges whose studye doe good loyter tyme selues good case thou chauncest fynde notable faulte grosse translacion whiche hathe escaped either lacke leasure learnynge beseche thee correcte charitably aduysednes reader hearer thereof maye better expressely perceaue paraphrastes mynde considrynge howe profitable doctrine oure present daungerous dayes paraphrase doe importe aswell teachynge christ sincerely settyng forthe christen manner playnlye rebukyng vice wicked customes sharpely ment thys translation hunt worldly commendacion temporall rewardes god witnes good best poore vnlearned talente vnto symple vulgare sort perceiued euident experience kynges highnes visitacion wherin vnworthye wayting ministre glad conformablye willyng heare pure word god obedient receyue kynges godly iniuccions traynyng would contynue case theyr ordinary curate minister try ler hynderours therof seduced taught sedicious earewhisperours contrary worde god kynges hyghnes mooste godly gracious procedinges onely pelfe belycheare ease lucre take meane trifler hynderours sinistre resister ordinary curate ministres chiefe byshoppes ordinary wt possible earnest labour paynes tendre gospelles affaire god thanked sondry curate ministres know althoughe fewe honest diligently well wyllynge towardes trueth diuerse shyres wayted vpon kynges hyghnes visitours especyally lincolneshyre shire diocese verayly trust god nombre honest sorte shall dayly encreace aboute industruous ministerie vniforme concurrence holsome doctryne byshoppe deane lincolne rather helpynge forewardnes forewardyng helpe deuoute woman god duchesse suffolke meane onely certaine sortes minister ou noble learned paraphrast erasmus paynteth notablye person euangelistes apostle one sort beyng altogether vnlearned leauer cotinue styl like horse mule without vnderstanding acknowlege ignoraunces blyndenes laboure better knowledge become chyldren lyght dogges backe ouerseers see also blynde guydes whan blynde doe folowe blynde guydes onely blynde folowers also sauiour christ selfe testifieth doe fall bothe ditche errour endles danacion seconde sorte beyng noseled roted worldly pelfe belycheare promocio obteined coutrefaite crouching hipocritical lowting meanes courtely fredes wil rather obstinately resyst murmure agaynst kinges maiesties godly trauailes procedinges much lyeth slauderous dissuasion perplexe impertinet interpretacios go bryng pure playne worde god contempte yea incese people tumultes sedicions rumour rebellion practiced experience hath late dayes mooste lamentably taughte v woulde lose forgoe iote worldely wicked pompous mammon conscience sake submytte selues trueth scripture syncere godly quietnes cursed shepeherdes israell eate vp fatte shepe clothe selues wolle slea best edde nourishe flocke damnable hipocrites shute vp kyngdome heauens men forbyddyng dissuading discourageing readynge meddlyng scripture whiche breade soule wyll nether entre selues ne suffre woulde false doctours peter prophecied hand slyghtyly bryng pernicious sectes amonge people denyeng euen lord bought throughe couetousnes feyned woordes make marchaundise men incarnate angelles satan theyr fyne maner crepe bosome outwarde pretence holynes transforme selues angeles lyght ching eared maisters spirites errour teache doctrine deuilles inconuenient thynges fylthy lucre sake hauing conscience marked ho e yron teaching genealogy endles riedles engendre question edifie godwarde antichristes al whole scripture vndenyable de ogation merite dignitie christes death blodsheading done take vpon dayly sacrifice emyssion synnes quycke deade teache swete sowre sowre swete lyght darknes darknes light also right sonnes right father deuill hath bene murtherour alyer fro begynnyng finally whelpes roaring lyon deuil goeth sekyng ministery may deuour thrid sorte whiche sauetie pelfe promocion employe studyes forecastyng pollycies please partes thynkynge owne phantasy possible christ true doctour sayth impossible serue god mamo whose occasion people halt betwene two opinios knowyng best folow wheth god baal messagiers laodicia whose workes nother colde whote betwene bothe smellyng neither muche ghospel lytell pope ie yet must called fauourours trueth woulde fayne thynges well long woulde fayne haue goddes corne come vp yet dare sowe none longer worlde saye maketh faire wether notwythstandyng parte yea muche parte ecclesiastical parson three sortes saye eyther blockeheaded ass plaine professed enemyes doublefaced frendes yet god habundaunt rich exceding great mercy hath reserued vnto selfe syncere bysshoppes preacher emperiall realme erecte confirme towardenes true meanyng fauourours comforte weakeharted confounde stow e rebelles golden
