cupped courteours prowde whore babylon myghtye swearde spirite whiche word god theuidenter declaracion mercy englishe flocke glorouse enhaunceyng hys kyngdome glorie thys realme forewardyng godly labour industruous trauailes hys faythfull plowman ministres despighte hys enemyes god whose hande kynges heartes hathe put hearte oure mooste royall worthye kynge edwarde vi onely lyke moste christen iosias ministerie trauaile studious endeuours moste faythfull deare vncle lorde protectours grace honorable cou sayle abolyshe idolatrous sacrificeinges supersticious customes restore true worship religion gospell christe pristine sinceritie purenes lybertie agayne also lyke moste prudent yong salomon buylde vp perfitely lordes house walke thexample olde salomon porche temple lyke goddes true minister expell kepe false worshyppinges popishe goddes seruice vayne ceremony pernicious sectes sedicious tumultes fylthye errours noughtie lurkyng hereticall opinion amonge hys christen englyshe subiectes whiche lyuing temple god trayne ordre gouerne rule holsome lawes banishemente vngodly licencious libertie men nowe dayes muche geuen bent vnto nourishement vertues whiche god requireth also kepe defende intestine tumultes daungers inuasions myght perchaunce intended forayne homedwellyng enemy forasmuch al kinges maiesties obedyent true subiectes straytely debtebounden generally rendre humble perpetual thankes god throughe lorde iesus christ excedyng vnspeakeable mercy bounteous liberall benignitie powred habundaunt wyse vpon v nowe already sene manifolde proued miraculous experience sendyng v godly yong kyng placeing noble religious protectour inprouiding worthy prudent cousail lyke may vndoubtedly sure case lay fast hold promisses god stick hard gospel wt costaut belefe hert wt vnfeined cofessio mouth frame couersacio wtout grudging agreably wyll cotinue maintene increase trasoures blessinges liberal benefites vpon v eue standeth v hade wt al vigilaut circuspection generally beware take grace god getly frely bounteously geue vnto v vayne lest oure neglygente vnthankefulnes contemptuous stubburnes outragious licenciousnes dissolute vnthriftines withdrawe blessynges take away precious iewelles treasours benefites v owne wicked desertes iustely leaue v selues worke thynges conuenyent euen gredynes receyue therfore rewarde errour therefore playne good reader seyng moste bounteouse mercyfull god almyghtye doeth aswell powryng hys mooste plentcouse proued blessynges vpon v engyshe folkes without deseruynges longe sufferaunce wynkyng daylye practised naughtines inuite gently prouoke v vnto repentaunce thinke best v mocke styll god contemne rich goodnes long suffraunce god wyll mocked v yet yf man thyng earnestly marke maners roiall rufflynge worlde woulde seme men thynke god either god slepe elles greuously displeased fylthynes synne disobedience holy scripture place reporteth leaste scripture woorde whiche declareth comaundement trueth god monstrous mater marke howe shamelesly romyshe ympes slaunder depraue abuse moste holy sacred worde god byble true preacher expounder namyng falsely newe learnyng new fangled felowes howe hansomly vpholde stubburnely continue theyr popyshe baggage dumme ceremony idolatrous worshyppynges heathnyshe rite cankred opinion disguysed deuotion missall sacrificeinges faythles phantasied workynges trade countrefaycte supersticious religion estemyng trueth god lye lying prophecy methodius fonde imagination trueth horrible thyng also heare blasphemous swearyng sturdye disobeyeng traiterous rebellynge false rumour inuentyng deuelishe backbyting slaunders caryeng sedicious murmuring agaynst trueth al godly procedynges see hellyshe workes palpable darkenes exercised nowe dayes whan euer disdayne excesse costly apparell vsed lesse clothyng poore nowe whan haftyng craftyng scrape money gether lesse succouryng pore wydowes fatherles child poore neady impotent person whan time forecast ioyne house house lande lande lesse hospitalitie nowe whan anye age io many gorgious buyldynges set vp wealthye men pleasure fewer hospitalles mayntened poore mennes succour nowe whan destroying enclosyng whole townes village comins one mannes priuate vse nourishynge rearyng stoaring shepe brute beastes wherby straunge realmes enryched lytle studie maynteyne tyllage nouryshe tall yomen thencrease commen strengthe theyr owne natyue realme serue kynges maiestie necessarie affaire nowe whan euer pollyng pylling theuing robbyng extorcionyng brybyng lesse restitucion makyng nowe whan tyme holsome lawes made comme wealth good ordre euery estate lesse obserued obeyed nowe whan swearyng takyng othes vpon holy eua gelistes solemnely vsed lesse truth promysse kept wha excessyue riotous bankettyng pottecompanyonyng belychearynge outragiously vsed pore hungriousnes lesse refreshed whan shameles whoremongyng licenciously frequented withoute punishement nowe whan holowe herted flatterye craftye deceauyng practiced lesse hertye frendeshyp steryng wha parentes negligent vertuous bryngyng vp child child disobedient parentes nowe whan maisters vnlouyng strayterlaced seruauntes seruauntes lesse diligent trustye maisters nowe whan quycke bargaynyng among men lesse true dealyng nowe short wha mo ghospell talker fewer ghospell walker nowe whan many ghospell bablers fewe ghospell folowers nowe finally whan wente christe ministres diligentlye preachyng founde lesse faythe vpon earthe lesse entreteyned thynges therfore respectiuely weyghed conferred together euydent profes lyghte comen worlde men haue rather loued darkenes lyght also aunciente practice father pope malignaunt churche diligent preachyng prelate doctour deuyll whan get damnable disciple ynowe sactisfie gredy lust throughe poperye reason cleare lyght powre ghospell shynyng forthe take vpon fyne forewarder ghospels lybertie saye instigate men pretense ghospell scrape cloyne handes muche possession thintent godly learned preacher ministres lyuing beyng deade competent prouysion preaching learned men beyng may growe blinde popery barbarousnes ignoraunce posteritie oure tyme laste errour shalbe worse farther salomon sayeth whan preachynge ceaseth people shall runne hauocke subtill satan practise also pretence ghospelles libertie cause men make belies goddes see dayly ala therfore euery lyghte headded ydle person euerye raungeyng ruffion shamelesly pampre paunche fleshe delicates regardynge neyther ordre comune wealth sparyng nether place time ne yet geuing god thakes al ether fleshe fishe meate drinke may appeare impudent abominable lyuinge couetous gredynes worldly pleasure swearyng whoring dyceing cardyng braullyng raylyng braggyng querelling fighting piking stealing robbing bawdy talkyng al kyndes elles hellishe iniquitie reason ouer danable estate poore symple vntaught weake brother christe died seyng thys lybertie thys iniquitie ioyned together offended defyeth worde god rashe beastly bellyed mannes wyckednesse whiche prateth worde lyueth cleane contrarie agaynst thus deuyll saye purchaseth selfe fyre hell many rather mo slaues countrefaite ghospellyng open idolatrous popery mayntenyng nowe therfore goe downe thy selfe good reader see case thou standest thou seest experience dayes euyll lo e good oportunytie god hath lent thee saye lorde lorde shal entre kyngdome heauen doeth father wyll whiche heauen althoughe made ryghteous god throughe onely fayth yet muste expresse fayth suche charitable workes men god commaundeth el faythe deade become faythe thoughe saued throughe grace yet may abide synne stil grace maye abounde lyke whan synner repenteth merye heauen angelles reioycing gladnes euen whan man repenteth lyueth styll infidelitie synne maketh holy ghost sadde sorowfull heauen thoughe quyckened together christe owne fre mercye without deseruynges yet commaunded holy worde mortyfie oure carnal membres vpon earth lyke haue tymes past made seruauntes vngodlynes one naughtynes shoulde henceforth make seruauntes puritie santtification gaue v christ newe garmente badde v apostle paule put olde adam elles christe woulde stycke cleane backes onlesse olde adam stryped cleane wyth ragged rotten patch infidelitie sinfulnes sayeth let u put armour lyghte sayeth fyrste let u cast uaye uuorkes darknes lyke god loueth wourshypped onelye accordynge owne worde byddyng curfeth inuent vse kyndes worshyppyng seruyng besydes worde lyke god filleth grace reuerently truly vse holy name fylleth also full wikednes swearours maketh plague vengeaunce hang styll ouer house abuse goddes name lyke god promyseth reward helpe pore neyghbours nede threateneth punishement also hurte neyghbours worde dede like holy goste alloweth chaste wedlocke holy honourable among men doeth pronounce whoredom bawldrye cursed abominable among men christe geueth peny diligent worker byddeth auaunt knowe loyterours prophete dauid sayeth prope est dns oibus eum inuocantibus sayeth also longe peccatoribus salus ghospell power god saue beleue shall also witnesse last daye shewe selues worlde vnbeleuers frutes vngodly behauyour assure thy selfe thys good reader lyke god deuyll heauen hel lyfe eternall saluation death eternall damnacion therfore cast careles securitie diligent readynge hearynge goddes worde christe thy sauiour make moe mediatours thee onely lyke wyl geue away glory passion wyl geue awaye glory intercession cast feyned custome laye holde vpon vnfailyng veritie forsake blynde broade byewayes folowe streight narowe pathe way awaye fylthy whoremonging take thee chaste wedlocke thou wilte chosen make sure thy vocation thou defyest deuyll meddle false teacher deuely lyuyng thou louest deuylles sauour dwell vpon hys donghill stynkyng ydolatrie supersticio thou sonne abraham doe workes abraham thou iustified throughe onely faythe christ leade lyfe doe dedes faythfull iustifyed christen man christe thy lorde thou true seruaunt thou wylte take vpon christes disciple see thou weare badge christen charitie christe thy good shepeherde herken voyce none christe haue borne owne shoulder shepefolde whan thou wast runne astraye see thou runne oute agayne lest thou droppe pitte drowned throughe thyne owne folye thou wylte take god thy father see thou holy holy thou wylte haue holy spirite god thy comfortoure make sadde resisting waiwardnes thy spirite mayest thou surely bolde preace vnto throne hys grace shalte sure fynde mercye conuenient tyme take hede tyme nowe tyme verye howre v ryse vp sleape therfore saye take tyme repentaunce whyle tyme tyme wyll awaye yf thou wylte aryse heare voyce thy shepeherde christ hauing lybertie goddes woorde rather ample enterpretyng godly paraphrase teache thee thy warraunt thexample kynges maiestie hys gracious vncle lord protectour test honorable counsail encourage ayde defende thee wylt tomble walowe styll wylful ignoraunce errour stickyng olde heathenyshe idolatrous worshippinges supersticious deuisinges masse meritinges beade droppinges popyshe customes disobedyence agaynst superiours parentes blasphemous swearyng aduouterous lyuing theuyshe stealyng murder robbynge couetous cloynynge bawdye talkyng holoweharted flateryng false witnesse bearyng vntrue dealyng craftye deceauyng dronken drinkyng paunche pampryng subtyl vnderminynge wyckednesses vilanies wrytten word commau dement god differrest repentaunce daye daye heapyng synne vpon synne sayest mercye god greate tushe let god sende mery lyfe ynoughe worlde let hym doe worlde wyll thou assured thou enforcest god take awaye hys holy spirite good gyftes thee layest vp wrath stoare thy selfe agaynste daye wrath whan god shall iudge secret thoughtes men iesus christe thou shalt haue immortall worme thy conscience g awe contynually vpon thee fallynge desperacyon grudgeynge agaynste god thou shalte begynne thyne hell euen thys worlde hauynge anguyshe trouble vpon thy soule thy wycked lyuynge greate feaste daye whan thou shalte appeare wythoute weddynge garment perfyte faythe garnysshed wyth workes charitie good lyuynge christe kyng shall commaunde thee bounden hande fote cast vtter darkenes shalbe weepyng gnashyng teethe rewarde thyne errour wickednes thou shalte constrayned perforce pledge deuyll cuppe prepared euerlastyngly hypocrite drynke vpon whereinto lorde god shall rayne snare fyre brymston storme tempest wyll auayle repente wylbe late crye wyste remembre thy selfe therefore tyme seyng god hys curteous gentylnes hys holy woord geueth thee curteous warnynge take good parte thys symple translacyon intended none purpose thy forwardynge helpe lorde wytnesse god sende thee perfyte vnderstandyng gentle reader hys trueth well fate amen p thus endeth prologe argument vpon epistle apostle saynt paule vnto ephesian erasmus roterodame ephesus sometyme chiefe citie lesse asia citie supersticiously geuen wurshipping deuilles especially diana whiche cause called actes apostle wurshipper diana diana huntour vnto whome poetes attribute bowe arowes diana many pappes whome grecian call polymaston saye nource maner beastes hieromes reporting temple diana ephesus greatest estimacion al world much ethnike writours make special mencion almost al writinges men geue whole study vnto curiouse artes science may gather reade preaching apostle brought theyr bookes enchauntmente burned fyer whan coumpted price founde fiftie thousand siluerlinges purported xix cap actes therfore thentent might withdrawe great errours taried still among three yeares trauaylling vttermost hys power bring thyng passe myght profitabe forwarding theyr saluacion albeit many made great resistence agaynste specifyeth hymselfe place cast beastes lyke maketh mencion secounde epistle corinthian whan departed thence commaunded timothee remaine still amonge like citie full curiouse menne suche geuen magicall artes euen many great learned men reason wherof paule tempereth himselfe according maners nature men maketh often mencion deuils spirites whan sheweth difference good men bad besides openeth certaine darke hard sentence none epistle hath darke hidde sentence ephesian shoulde seme epistle chiefest occasion petre wrote sorte euen derely beloued brother paule accordyng wisedome geuen vnto hym wrote yea almoste euery epistle speaking suche thynges among whiche many thynges harde vnderstanden vnlearned vnstable peruert scripture theyr owne destruccion therfore men aboade constauntly fayth exhorteth continue goe still forwarde vntill become perfite putting remembraunce manier people whan addict vnto naughtines seruice vnto wieked spirites become engraffed vnto christe teacheth withall althoughe grace gospell promised vnto iewes yet eternall decree god rightfully enlarged vnto gentile also minyster ordayned god office forasmuche wrote thys epistle prison exhorteth cast downe theyr harte affliccions rather thinke haue much cause reioyce thinges treateth first seconde chapter three prescribeth fourme godly conuersacion vnto shewing folowed bee auoyded duetyes husbandes wyues wyues vnto husbandes office parentes child child theyr parentes dueties maisters seruauntes seruauntes maisters epistle written citie rome tichicus diacone whome speaketh end epistle calling faithful minister ambrose sayeth furthermore wrote prieson whan caried hierusalem rome liued vnder suertie without tentes tenement taken hyre ende argument paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle sainct paule apostle ephesian p chapter texte paule apostle iesus christ god sainctes whiche ephesus whiche beleue iesus christ grace peace god father lorde iesus christe blessed god father lord iesus christe whiche hath blessed v manier spyrituall blessyng heauenly thinges christe according chosen v foundacions worlde layde shoulde holy without blame thorow lou whiche ordeyned v thorow iesus christe heyrs vnto himselfe according good pleasure prayse glorye grace wherewith hath made v accepted thorow beloued haue redempcion thorow bloud euen forgeuenes sinnes accordyng rich grace wherof hath ministred vnto v aboundauntly wisedome prudence hath opened vnto v mistery according good pleasure whiche purposed himselfe haue declared time ful come might set vp al thinges perfitly christ thinges heauen thinges whiche earth euen whome made heyrs therto predestyna e accordyng purpose hym whose power thynges wrought according purpose owne beleued christ vnto prayse glorie also beleue asmuche haue heard woorde trueth euen ghospell saluacion wherin ye beleued ye sealed holy spirite promes earnest enheritaunce forthe recouering purchased possession vnto prayse glory paule apostle moses man iesus christe whose businesse take hande sence vpon myne owne head mennes commissyon autoritie commaundemente god father whiche hys sonne hathe commannded preache doctryne ghospell among heathen write epistle al leade theyr lyfe ephesus leade theyr lyfe suche sorte applye theyr endeuoure kepe vnspotted vice vncleanesses world sincere conscience beleue ghospell iesus christe lookyng rewarde innocencye holynesse elles whence receiued example waiting ende felicitie whome sprong beginnyng meane seasongrace vnto peace wish vnto vse doe measure felicitie dignity thys worlde wyshe god autour goodnesse whome nowe may call euen father created v onely muche rather engraffed vnto body christe receaued enherytaunce chyldren maye daylye encrease hys beneficence wherwith hathe frely deliuered transgressyons youre olde life vngodlye hathe made folowers innocencye righteousnes continue concorde maye bee one mynde amonge selues reconsiled god maye take hede breake fallyng synnes agayne promysse couenaunted hym iesus christ sonne whome whome geueth vnto v al thinges also shal hensfoorth woorthely call lorde forasmuche hath set v libertie tirannye deuil pryce holy sacred bloud taken v himselfe hauing deliuered v deuilles seruitude hath made v owne seruitude fortunate vniteth v christ beit thyng happened vnto v chaunce oure owne meryte godblessed bee god father father lorde iesus christ altogether praised behalfe hys free fauour hath powred gentle kyndenesse vpon v bestowyng thinges vnto v perteyne vse lyfe bodelye susteynaunce onelye also excellent giftes auayle saluacion soule lyfe immortall lyfe abydeth v heauen christ whome father hath set heauen gate wyde open manne shoulde curious aske commeth exceadyng fauour whence cummeth wonderfull gentlenes resolutelye determined throughe goodnes god eternall decree euen foundacionsaccording chosen v worlde layed euen chosen v hys sonne whome created gouerneth restoreth thynges former vicious liuing wyped awaye cummen holy faultles onely syght men also god himselfe estemeth man according secret affectes minde terror moses lawe seueritie wherof tryed vnto thys purpose altogether vneffectuallthrough loue beliefe loue required ghospell whiche wynneth suche willyng lawe enforced rigorous compellyng perfite seruice seruauntes doe constrainedly feare inconuenience theyr maisters dyspleasure child dooe vncompelled byloue good affeccyon thyng impossible beewhich ordayned v perfourmed strength v god hys eternall decree chosen v roume heritage child onely iesus christe vnto whome hath incorporated v fayth loue beyng made member may one participacion attain thyng due deseruynges therefore may wyse attribute thankes vnto selues asmuche stoode good pleasure hym naturally good declare manifest freeto praise glory grace liberalitie bestowed vpon v playne open whole worlde concerning strength could possibly thing el enemy god abiect slaues hath reconsiled v himselfe christ whome loueth expressed damnable wretch hathe made v acceptable deare child long beyng shared daunger sinne mebers deuil coulde neither loue god loued god masmuch dere sonne hath redemed v price holy bloud bondage sin encorporated v mebers vnto himselfe father possibly choose loue whome pleased make partner hys sonne benefite surely inestimable notwithstanding suche bounteous largesse almightie god although manifestly apparet euery thing yet peculiarely abounded vpon v forasmuche openeth vnto v merciful harted father vnto child secret mistery eternal wil many long yeres hidden world knowlage wherof hygh wisedome chiefe prudence much excellent knowlege wherin singularely learned humayne discipline ye haue excelled sortes men euer vnto day mannes wit atteineth knowlege ofin al wisdome prudence secretes nature yet whan knowen vttermost make man anything godly al secret mistery speake reason mannes mynde coulde attaine onles god himselfe opened vnto knowledge bring v true perfite felicitie man wouldaccording good pleasure aske cause hath god kept close long length manifested planiely haue nothing aunswer pleased good wil willeth al beste asmuche goodnes selfe new vnto v new shewed open world sending sonne later dayes eternally decreed father sonne albeit would certayn vnspekable counsail haue secretly hidden vntil determined time fulfilled open secret vnto mankynde wherin loss tyme people time past mi en vaine seking saluacion outward obseruacion moses saw studie philosophie supersticyous religion wurshipping deuils expelled whole sume thinges apperteine true innocencie true godlines ascribed christ besides man ought desyre thing asmuch foantayn content gratify peticious good thyng eyther heauen earth god father hath appoynted head men depend hym onely trust receiue hand whatsoeuer rightly desired acknowelege cummeth whatsoeuer bounteous liberalitie bestoweth vpon v whome also aboundant felicitie hath chaunsed vnto v wer chosen vnto lotte enheritaunce immortalitie owne deseruinges predestinate decr log go whose arbitrement power thinges ordred disposed vnscarcheable counsel behalfe according owne wil forasmuch best wise cannot possibly wil thyng thingesthat e may prayse best wisest determinate wil called vnto enheritaunce felowship christ desertes fr benignitie monicyon prophetes sayinges maner fixed hope christ promised vnto v yea e afore trueth gospelcame light benefit ascribed obseruacion moses law al praise wholy redound glory goodnes god content frely geue v neuertheles iewes wer called alone promised felowship christ although distrusting shadowes moses lawe hauein whome also embraced trueth ghospell wherof trust assuredly receiue true saluacion yea without helpe lawe also albeit vncircumcised yet assone ye beleued gospell chosen thesame felowship debtours vnto circucisio receiued hope immortalitle vnto fayth haue wel iewes let fro getle goodnes god cutting way foreskin marke discerne iewe fro heathen marke gospel extedeth printed vpon bodye soule signe marked indifferentlye nacion soeuer embrace doctrine gospel beleue promisses aske token discerneth christian wieked truely holy gost inward affect seruile bonde affect onewhich earnest commonly good child maketh v al hart beleue promisses gospel yea although yet world presently appere enheritaunce wherinto engraffed shal fully performed resurreccion bodyes beit geueth v spirite meane season pledge ernest promised enheritaunce thys token surely certified god accepteth v childre doubting wil take owne himselfe hath redemed deathe sone merciful getilnesse god desirous winne many wold hauevnto praise glorye magnificence specially knowe notified makind whiche opened abrode mo shall speake god time past cared peculiarlye iewes deliuered fro seruitude egipcians small matter haue goodnesse god set forth one nacio wil praysed extolled al ina nuche hath frely redemed al fro bondage sinne estemeth pertinent glory iewes al nacions whole world beliefe gospel partaker saluatio texte wherfore also heard faith ye haue lord iesu lo vnto sainctes cease geue thankes making mencio praie god lord iesue christ father glory maye geue vnto spiryte wisdo reuela knowlage selfe lighte eye pour myndes ye may know hope wherunto hath called riche glory inherytaunce vpon sainctes excedyng greatenes power v e beleue accordig working mightie power wrought christ raised hym dead set right hand heauenly thinges rule power myght domymon aboue euery name named worlde onely also world come hath pur thinges vnder f e hath made hym aboue thinges head congregacion whiche bodye fulnes sylleth cosideracio passe whether circucised wha seeuident token euagelical saluacio first haue reposed whole trust lord iesu tha declare christian charitie towardes al saintes mebers christ cause ceasse geue thakes euagelicall sincerite suche efficacie causeth v glad mennes comodities lesse tha owne make alwaies mecion prayer wher wt daily call vpon god aduaucement gospel businesse god al sortes people indifferentile iesu christ also humaine nature also christ hath god vnto vnto autor foutaine al goodnes emay geue vnto spirite sedome al glory doth wholy belog may geue vnto ernest haue spoke spirite inspire mindes heauenly wisedo knowlage mysterie maye knowe hym thouly autor healthe may behold hym meane iyes bodily eiyes iyes harte mynde see light faithe wherewith thynges also seen come whiche cannot seene grosse bodily iyes whereby maye knowe humayne philosophie teacheth blissed enheritaunce whiche hath called v truste vpon excellent dignitie pleteous enheritauce saynctes shal receyue howe great largenesse excedyng greatnesse power declareth eue v also certain secrete enforcement cannot expressed wt tongue hath transformed al red v fro olde trade sorte contene al thiges trust onely cotening thinges wese hope thinges himhe hath wrought christe c se hath openly declared head christ mightie power hauing raised death life immortal hath exalted vnto high honor hath set owne right hand kingdo heauen geuen autoritie ouer al rule potestate power lordship euery name dignitie power excellent euer aboue afore rehearsed eyther worlde worlde come may lorde onely ouer bodely earthly thinges also ouer spirituall heauenly thynges ferre hath subdued al thinges without excepcion vnder feete make hope stedfast certayn thatand hath made aboue thinges head shall also come felowship glorye asmuche hath made christe lorde ouer thinges pleasure also shoulde head vnto al whole flocke beleuing cleaue fast christe whole body coupled head one disceuered fro finally glory head common rest member wherunto head set powreth good nourishment euery one bodye perfit onles head head wanteth sum body set perfitly consummate bres wherunto christ doeth seuerally powre excellent giftes wise himselfe fulfilleth thiges liueth reigneth whole entierely perfit hauing member vnited vnto himselfe p ii chapter texte hath quyckened wher ye dead trespass synnes whiche tyme passed ye walked according course worlde euen gouerner ruleth ayre spiryte nowe worketh chyldren vnbelefe emong conuersacion also tyme past lustes oure fleshe fuli lled wyll fleshe minde nature chyldren wrath euen well god whiche ryche mercye greate loue wherwith loued v euen deade sinnes quickened v together christ grace ar ye saued raysed v vp together hym made v sytte together wt hym emong heauen chryst iesu tymes come myght shewe exceding rich grate kindnes v ward thorow christ iesu grate ye made safe thorowe faythe selues gyite god cometh workes lest man ast hym selfe worckemashyppe created christe iesu vnto good workes whiche god ordeined walke nowe marke father hath begon maner accomplish euen accomplished already christ shal ward accoplished christ dyed rose agayn shall neuer dye certes subiecte sinne albeit forasmuche tooke vpon humaine bodie subiecte mortalitie briefe like sin certain death soule forewarning eternall death euen innocencie certayne life soule beginning eternal life maner lyfe god geueth v spirite prince deuil autor death hauing also spirite owne wherwith enspired rapt vnto pleasure world plainely distrust promisses eternal lyfe christ dyed offence rose agayn make v sure immortalitie come meane tyme hys exaumple also engraffed christ baptisme dead sinnes wickednes wherein long liued vngodly dead dede asmuche affyaunce nothing noysome shadowes good thinges wherwith worlde tyme disceaueth suche wantyng thein child unbeliefe spirite god lead spirite satan whose tirannye meane permitted ouer lower element spirit say himselfe setteth power hauing trust promisses gospell set theyr whole felicitie visible transitory thinges geue eare god father allureth true felicitie leauer serue wieked cruell maister whome tymes past serued alone also albeit law restrayned v wurshipping image yet lyfe altogether defyled noysome lustes corporall thynges enforcemente whereof passed tyme doyng thynges whiche holy ghoste commaunded owne mynde geuen filthie affectes bad v doe reason wherof came passe like encorporated christe fayth appertayne enheritaunce promised obedient child euen disobedient child haue belonged ferre contrary enheritaunce say haue becomen companion hym whome ioyned selues death eternal appoynted wickedand nature childre wrathe wherunto also subiect asmuche touchyng owne state condicion addicted ourselues vnto owne free choice power wynde v agayne miserable seruitude nowe haue heard death haue harde destruccion whereof commeth lyfe whereof commeth saluacyon truely ofbut god whiche riche mercie desertes yet benefite moses lawe whence surely free largesse god father whose bounteousnesse louyng affection plenteous exceadingly great mankyndewarde hath onely punished v according desertes also whan dead reason sinnes hath called v agayne lyfe together christ say deseruing came free gyft hath called v agayne lyfe hys sonne also hath caryed v vp fro thinges yt benethe vnto thinges heaue hath placed v christ y haue indifferetly together whatsoeuer head hath possesse hope yt shal shortly possesse dede thus wil resurreccion whan promisses shal euidently appeare may declare aboudant liberalitie pleased hi free goodnes powre vpo v good dedesby grace ye made safe sake merites y christ thing often rehearsed yt ought fixed moste depely harte cumeth fre grace say haue obteined saluacion destruccio wherin ye tangled lest ye folow error iewes thinke sauedi gift god obseruing prescriptes moses law endebted saluacion fayth wherby ye beleued gospell yet may brag faith though come selfe christ loued first hauing drawen himselfe hath geuen power loue hym agayne hath freely powred gift fayth whiche set darkenes apart see lyghte ghospels veritie wholy therfore ascribed vnto fre gift man hath thereof tofor workemanship boast though owne created endebted god agayne regenerate faythe baptisme made newe maner diuorced felowshyp parent sinfull adam engraffed christ prince innocecie intent helpe exaumple hensforth apply office true godlinesse renouncing olde man shoulde represent new man new dedes become ferre vnlike oureselues condicions man might iustly say god doctrinevnto good workes whiche god ordayned ghospell hath opened vnto v rewarde immortalitie intent preace hard vnto innocencie lyfe well euangelical faith idle mattier hath inseparable companion charitie whiche causeth moe dueties done willyng prescriptes lawe hable enforce constrayned texte wherfore remembre ye tyme passed gentile flesh called vncircumcisyon whiche called circumcisyon flesh whiche circumcisyon made handes reme ber saye tyme ye without christ beyng aliantes ye commen welth israell straungers testamentes promes hope without god world meanes christ iesu ye somtime farre made nye bloude christ peace whiche hath made one hath broken downe wal stoppe betwene v hath also put away throw fleshe cause hatred euen lawe commaundementes contayned lawe written make twayne one newe man selfe making peace reconcyle vnto god one body thorow crosse slewe hatred therby came preached peace whiche farre nye thorow hym haue entraunce one sprite vnto father yoke moses law layed vpon one onely law christian charitie sufficient accomplishe dueties iewes endebted theyr lawe theyr saluacion yet much bounden goodnesse god far true wurshipping god true religio therfore ye may vnderstade muche bounden bountie god nowe ye duetie remember ye haue bene afore tyme sumtyme heathen corporall distinccion kynred whome nacyon iewes bragging carnal circumcision done handes name contumeliously vncircumcised repute prophane person abhominable supposing felicitie promised log agoe oracle prophetes belong peculiarely themselues vnderstandyng reputed vncleane persones god whose inward myndes vncircumcised time vncircumcised body andhauing hope soule muche abiect miserable condicion iewes ye hope christes benefite youwarde saye vtterly astraunged aswell tytle felowshyp nacion iewes vnto whome semed peculiarly promised also exileledgene xxii couenauntes god wherin promised saying abraham father nacion thy seede shall nacyons bee blessed bee briefe remayned apparente hope saluacion afmuche wurshippers deuils ye knowledge thys worlde true god iewes called theyr god agayn called hys people neuerthelesse soone trueth ghospellbut nowe meanes christ iesu shewed furth lyght christe turned course thynges vpsyde downe brough e passe whiche seemed nothyng perteyne vnto god knyt moste nere vnto circumcision foreskinne bloud iesu christ price wherof ye deliuered sinnes olde conuersacion also reconcyled vnto god father tymes paste discorde iewes yea discorde god christ autour peace concordefor ou peace stroke away al difference circumcised circumcised toke away ceremony moses law bene wall deuyded concord betwene iewes gentile two sortes people beeyng afore ferre different one agree growe together one vtterly expelling theyr olde grieues christes cummyng gentile wonderfully adhorre iewes obseruaunces supersticious thinges iewes contrariewise conceipt themselues reason ceremony held al accursed without christ therfore woonderful deuise abolished brought vse ha ed lawe consisteth onely prescribed carnall ceremony would neyther alyenate iewes presse gentile burthen beyng god man fleshe obseruedthrough fleshe commaundementes lawe yet testifyed saluacyon brought spirite belonged lesse gentile iewes shoulde neyther abhominable vncircumcision iewes stouter theyr circumcision dispatchyng olde cankerdnesse bothe nacions mighte two make one new growe together one new man christ common sauiour indifferentlye lyke made iewes gentile one betwene themselues euen made one withmaking peace god nothing breake atonemet thinges heauen thynges earth shoulde bee ioyned together one body death christe suffered sinnes hath vnited v god whome man peace hath delyghte synne forasmuche peace bestowed iewes gentile indifferently cause eyther shoulde thinke better specially asmuche pledge gage holy ghost whereof spake litle geuen commonlye bothe without difference se come passe esaye inspiracyon prophecyed long agoe come christ hath offered doctrine gospell iewes onely vnto whome blessed felicitie semed peculiarelyto ferre promysed whiche also theyr sorte true wurshyppers god also vnto whiche ferre bothe kinred people iewes wurshippyng true god teaching thereby throughe hys deathe bothe flockes shepe shoulde goe together one shepefolde knowe hym bee theyr onely shepehearde hath opened vnto v entraunce father displeased sinnes none hath opened entraunce iewes hathe opened gentile bounden alone bolde approche bothe merciful father hauing confidence commune spirite inspireth assured trust indifferently heartes v bothe texte p therfore ye straungers foreyners citesens saintes houshold god built vpon foundacion apostle propheres iesus christ himselfe head corner stone whome building soeuer coupled together groweth vnto holy temple lorde whome ye also built together habitacion god thorowe holy ghoste therfore intente shoulde thinke selues wurse came stocke dauid abraham concerning kinred fleshe ye without lawe moses asmuche spirite ye citezens felowes saintes perteining house god builded iewes onely al purely beleue gospell foundacions house apostle preacher ghospel prophetes shewed long goe theyr prophecy gifte ghospell indifferently common men thys foundacyon also faste layed shorte iesus christe chiefe head stone building whiche layed corner coupleth kepeth walle together bothe sydes whose power couplyng buildyng beleuers compacted together euerye syde dayly encreaseth ryseth vnto perfitely holy spirituall temple consecrated lord holy building also parte whilest lyke lyuelye stone layed vpon foundacyons holden togither corner stone make purenes mynde spirite vnto god holye habitacle vnspotted synnes voyde lustes bee none receyued moses temple iewes temple perteyne indifferentlye embrace fayth ghospell p iii chapiter texte p cause paule prisoner iesus christe deathen yf ye haue heard ministracion grace god whiche geuen youwarde yteuelacion shewed mistery vnto wrote afore fewe woordes whereby ye reade ye may vnderstand knowlage mistery christ mistery time passed opened vnto sonnes men declared vnto holy apostle propheres spirite gentile inheritours also bodi partaker promes christe meanes ghospell whereof made minister according gift grace god whiche geuen vnto working hys power vnto leaste saintes grace geuen preache among gentile vnsearcheable rich christe make men see felowship mistery beginning worlde hath bene hid god whiche made al thinges thorow iesus christ intent nowe vnto rule power heauenly thinges mighte knowen congregacion manifolde wisedome god according eternall purpose whiche wrought christe lorde whome haue boldenes enteraunce confidence whiche fayth maye geue constaunte creden e hereunto vnderstande paule laden bondes cause el say naughtie dede iesus christes sake vnto whoe trauayll winne gentile wherat iewes haue indignacion yf ye haue heard tell office committed christ preache saluacion gospel whiche afore tymeiudged belong none iewes euery place yea euen among gentile whose noumber secret mistery hidden apostle christ opened chiefelyby uelation shewed mestery vnto lyke begonne speake briefely writynges nacions readyng whereof may know ignoraunt secret counsel christ whan tolde ananias beforehand carie name among gentile commaunded goe dooe message vnto gentile dwelled farre whiche thing semed abhominable wieked persones image wurshippers called felowship gospel notwithstanding decreed god long ago yea euen afore world made maner opened vnto prophetes inspiracion albeit playnly opened world gentile onely fayth gospel without helpe moses law attayn saluacion yea much chiefest apostle durst admit suche circumcised vnto baptisine nowe playnely opened vnto holye apostle christe hys prophetes inspiracion holy goste gentile faith vnited vnto iewes comen felowship selfe enheritaunce growe one bodye reioycyng theyr common head christe reason therof becomen partiners proinisses abyde suche beleue ghospel christ preache ghospell autoritie commytted vnto ceasse dooe commaunded office labouring constauntly hitherto ghospels busines euen vnto emprisonmetes fetter thing mete mine owne strength painful busines appoynted office hath laied owne helping hande concerning myne owne habilitie feble weake benefite strong full courage agaynst stormes al mischiefes boast myne worthinesvnto least al saintes grace geuen c cofesse least saintes yet litle hath pleased goodnes god putte trust businesse moste weightie importaunce shoulde publishe preache among gentile whiche time knewe nothyng god vnsearcheable richesse christ offereth plenteously men bryng lyght thyng hidden benefit ghospell dispensed ministred maner nacions whiche beefore supposed geuen onely iewes although otherwyse decreed eternally god maker gouernour thynges notwithstanding haue thys counsayll hys diuyne intente yet hitherto kepte secrrete whiche tymes woulde openly manifeste congregacion wherinto powred suche aboundaunce spirituall giftes manifolde wisedome whiche wounderfull deuises disposeth thinges death geuyng life shame exaltyng glorye humilitie aduauncyng goddes maiestie whiche man time paste coulde haue imagined shoulde nowe bee brought lyght onely brode worlde euen prynces chiefeste angelles deuilles haue dooe skyes vppermoste parte ayer whiche thynges albeit myght gesse come passe mankynde redemed yet knowen reason wisedome god eternallye decreed bringit passe whiche thing length openlye knowen whan sent sonne world hauing taken vpon humain bodye would vnspeakeable meanes vnite couple congregacion hymselfe whereof lorde iesus christe bee head whome like innocencie chaunced vnto v sinnes doen waye euen chaunced vnto v assured truste also child shoulde afraied approche vnto father whose displeased countenaunce durst afore beholde shoulde bee afrayed hauyng suche heade wise suffreth membres perishe albeit meane season suffre sum affliccion texte wherfore desire ye faint tribulacions suffre sake whiche praise cause bowe knee vnto father lorde iesus christ father ouer called father heauen earth would graunt accordyng rich glorie ye maye bee strengthed might spirite er man christe maie dwell hertes faith ye beyng rooted grounded loue mighte bee hable comprehende al sayntes bredth length depth height knowe excellente loue knoweledge christ ye mighte bee fulfilled fulnes cummeth god vnto hable doe exceading aboundantly aboue al aske thinke according power worketh v prayse congregacion christe iesus thorow al generacious tune tyme amen secrete counsayle god forasmuch preache boldely euery place suffre exceadyng punishemente yet cannot possibly perswaded matter beseche let myne affliccions whiche suffre sake anythyng disquiete dismaye cause shoulde ashamed suche apostle though bee laden fetter like crosse christe glorie euen fetter euill dedes sinceritie ghospel honestiethat ul graunt accordig rich glory rebuke displeasure suffre constaunt mynd ghospell christe entierly cause people beleue promise christe vayne inasmuch assured hope faint displeasure life ioyous onely suffre ghospelles businesse also becommeth al men entred vnto christe folowe example autour head truely cause sake bowe knee praye earnestly euen botome myne harte vnto god father father lorde iesus christe whome supreme head dependeth spirituall kynred wherbywhich father incorporated together whether bee angelles heauen faithfull people vpon earth whome onely fountaine springeth whatsoeuer belongyng true felicitie like hath begonne declare hys aboundaunte glorye maye augmente liberall goodnesse ward engraffed christ baptisme borne newe agayne maye gather courage strengthe daylye encrease accordong bodye accordyng mynde soule saye gyfte spirite father continually encreacyng v whome made stronge valiaunt withstande al dredes persecucion constancie fayth maye suche thynke surelye christe neuer fayle rather dwelle wardly hertes ye faythful trustes sake wherwith commit selues wholy vnto specially presente distruste theyr owne strength depende wholye helpe shall rather come passe yf hauyng ghospellike fayth practyse also ghospellike charitie knittyng oue thother maie vtterlye reste take rote inye beeyng rooted grounded loue soules ye entent established grouded vpon sure fou dacion maye ware greater greater spirite certayn wise correspondent vnmeasurable spirite god maie grow go forward perfitely onelye iewes also vniuersall multitude sayntes whiche encorporated bodye christe beliefe ghospell maie bee hable comprehend infinitely goodnesse god extendeth selfe restrainedmyght bee hable co prehende within narrowe bondes limittes heigth reachyng vp angel depth pearcyng downe helles length breadth spreadyng selfe vnto coastes worlde maye hable also vnderstand inestimable charitie christe towardes mankynde whose knowledge excelleth knowledge man excellente euer may gyftes encreace perfite lustye membres maye bee answerably mete noble heade hygh father lyke bodyly byrth hath degree age hath encreases hath measure long growing time endureth euen spiritual generacion also hath childehood hath springing time perfite lusty growen age thynges saye praye often vpon knee vnto god father thinges dede although thei greate far mannes powerunto hym hable yet desyre hym whose power myghty cannot possibly imagyne great matter hable dooe muche greatter good gentill dooeth onelye accoumplishe desyres wyth owne liberalitye also geueth v muche hope yet nothyng behalfe dooen throughe merites power nothyng elles instrument diuyne power woorketh owne myghte v glorye florisheth congregacion wholy ascribed hys largesse christ iesus whose participacion congregacion endowed excellente gyftes glorye shall bee ende shall endure age ternally like congregacion christ shal also haue none end haue sayed certayne vndoubtedly true iiii chapter texte therfore whiche prysoner lordes exhorte ye walke worthy vocacion wherewith ye called al lowlines mekenes humblenes mynde forbearyng one thorowe loue diligente kepe vnitie thorowe bonde peace one body one spirite euen ye called one hope calling let bee one lord one fayth one baptisme one god father whiche aboue thorowe inasmuche ye perceiue vyle condicion vnto great dignitye depe desperacion excellente benefites called beseche cheines sake wherwith tyed mine faultes glorye god saluacion asmuche remaineth behynde would conforme youre selues honest couersacion answerably professio mercifulnes god hath shewed youwardes shalbe doen case excellencye profession make hygh minded fearcely stomaked see custome life resemble thynges true modestye gentilnesse lenyte mynde one disdeyne euerye one suffre mutual charitie rather one bearyng others weakenesse tyme whan euerye one goeth holde owne tothe nayle breake concorde vniforme loue wherwith made one vnited together bonde peace conueniente mennes myndes deuided among theselues haue many thynges commune al one bodye depende one heade haue receiued one selfe spirite christ also indifferentely called one hope inheritaunce one lord al iesus christ al haue one profession faith one baptisme al meanes christes death indifferently effectuall vnto beleue ghospell whether bee circumcised vncircumcised finallye one god father al prynce autour thynges hath dominion ouer v suche sorte spirite wherewith gouerneth v geueth hymselfe vnto kepeth continual residence v releuyng helpyng v thynges gifte onely one good thyng soeuer haue texte unto euery one v geuen race according measure gyfte christe wherefore saieth went vp hye led captiuitie captiue gaue gyftes vnto men ascended meaneth also descended first lowest partes earthe descended euen also ascended vp aboue heauens fulfill thinges verye made aposties prophetes euagelistes shepeherdes teacher edifiyng saintes worke ministracion euen edifiyng bodye christe till come vnitie fayth knowledge sonne god vnto perfeit man vnto measure full perfeit age christe ought wyse hynder concorde giftes god bee one sorte alyke appearyng al menne see mebres body agre racked one fro thei indifferetly apte al one vse fele al alike influence ye head maner varietie ought rather ye occasion vnitie inasmuch bre body hable fully vphold commeth passe yt euerye one muste haue nede others offyce one maye contemne distribucion gyftes dependeth v wyll god distributeth vnto euerye man lesse semeth expedient owne syghte cause shoulde bee disdeyned hath lesse shoulde exalte hymselfe hathe one goddes measuryng thys goddes plenteous enlargyng christe geueth also thynges equally father certaynly thyng yt psalmiste inspiracion holy gost spake long agoe christe hauyng ready conquered helles ascended alyue agayne hygh kyngdome father hath caryed ensigne conqueste euen flocke v myserable captiues hath frely deliuered tyranny deuyl synne thence father liberalitie hathe geuen throughe holye ghoste soondrye kyndes gyftes bestowed among menne solemne manner suche wynne maistrye tryumphe throwe downe token tryumphe abrode among people sente downe giftes heauen heauenly thynges sente briefe sayed ascended doeth consequently folowe descended descencion aboue descencion ascencion none deserueth worthelye bee exalted hyghe onelye throughe lowlinesse humbleyng hymselfe conclude moste lowe humblyng foloweth moste hygh aduauncing moste hyghe heauen whiche nothyng higher christ deiected euen vnto helles nothyng lower cause sake worthily exalted aboue higheste heauens tooke bodily presence oure syghte intente accomplishe thynges aboue wyth heauenly giftes maner reason effectually presente v whan conuersaunt emong v vpon earth forsoke body deuyded gyftes vnto euery membres suche wyse none want anye thyng albeeit endued excellent giftes would haue chief apostle ryng leader autours gospel preahing prophetes coulde expounde hidde meanynges moses lawe euangelistes occupye apostle roumes carrye aboute gospell place place pastours doctours byshoppes feede flocke christe meate holy doctryne holsome example goodlyfe teste instructed one gyfte intente conferred together coumpanye saynctes shoulde bee perfeitelye consummate furnyshed vse euerye good offyce perfeit bodye christe beyng fully growen together menbres shoulde bee cherished one succour stronger membre shoulde beate tyme weaker weaker marke folowe exaumple stronger vntill maye length cumme equall strength fayth lyke perfeccion knowe sonne god throughe whose helpe maye waxe bygge lustye secrete encrease mynde sorte length may growe vnto perfeit manne accordyng oure measure frame oure selues aunswerably perfite head whome neither imbecillitie erroure neyther yet defaulte texte hence forth nomore child waueryng caried euery winde doctryne wylmes men thorowe craftyues whereby laye awayte tor v deceyue v let v folowe trueth loue thynges growe hym whiche head euen christe whome yf bodye coupled knitte together thorowoute euery ioynt wherwith one ministreth accordyng operacion euerye parte hath measure encreaseth bodye vnto edifiyng sel e thorowe loue age bodye geueth full strength membres putteth away tendernesse chyldehood semble ble wyse vnto lyke procedyng ordre godlinesse whereunto ought geue diligent endeuour hencefoorth haue waueryng lyke child vncertayne opinious addicte certayne decree attayne saluacion men voyde trueth catryed nowe iudgemente euery wynde doctryne submittyng selues pieuishe chyldren subtiltie crafte certayne men whiche trauayle teache v christe sincerely catche v theyr subtill artes snare v craftie deceates philosophicall reason bryng v doubte thynges faith ought wise doubted elles stede gospelles veritye set v shadowes moses lawe hauyng embraced veritie gospel lette v rather ioyne vnto sincere charitable loue towardes al men enforcing cominuall studye ende maye profite onelye knowledge trueth also continual diligente workes charitie beyng membres maye answerably like vnto head truely christe head also trueth selfe hathe loued v hath geuen hymselfe make v safe head requisite membres agreable inasmuche hym spirite lyfe floweth whole bodye beyng compacte set together sondrye membres ioyned ordrelye one pearcyng throughe euerye ioynt lymmes coulde excepte partes bodye ioyned agreably one lyfe may haue passage one membre hande fote beeyng cutte cannot possiblye haue parte vertue commeth toppe heade forasmuche whole bodye perfeitly conglutinate self commeth passe spirite christe practiseth efficacie euerye membre accordyng seuerall capacitie ordre forasmuche membres studye mutuall loue profite euerye one whole bodye wareth bygger bygger made lustye stronge wyll geue place condicion wyndes false opinion alluryng way ware bryng trueth texte saye therefore testifie thorowe lord ye hence forth walke beutiles walke banitie theyr minde blinded vnderstanding farte godly lyfe meanes ignorauncie blindenes harte whiche paste repentaunce haue geuen themselues ouer vnto wantonnes worke maner vnclennes euen gredines ye haue learned christe bee ye haue hearde hym haue beene taught trueth iesu concerning conuersacion time paste late olde man whiche corrupte according deceanable lustes matter haue gone open vnto many similitude whole sume onely monish also desyre beseche lorde iesus sake vnto endebted saluacion soone encorporated vnto hym frame selues lyke vnto hym onely synceritie faith veritie doctryne also vpryght integritie lyfe whan noumbre gentyles answerablye lyke vnto theyr condicion becomme men regenerate christe becommeth also maners gentyles forasmuche haue receiued trueth gospel leadde vaine opinion woorshpping dumme image steade god mesuring theyr felicitie temporal commodity worlde cause worshippe dead ware truste transitorye thynges haue knowledge true eternal lyfe whiche god forasmuche cannot sene onely scourediyes soule cause seen whose harte abscured yea rather blynded darkenes naughtye lustes cloudes infidelttie beyng geuen ouer theyr owne naughtines growen length high mischeafe men hope returne amendement fele theyr vyle miserye renne headlong al kindes abominacion insaciable lustes dooe thyng fylthye tuen ferre shame also speake doctryne gospellis ferre difference suche kinde menne haue learned folishe humayne opinion christe hymselfe fountayne example innocencie case haue truely herd speake wardly truely taughte spirite power maye diligently folowe thynges truelye iesu wete lyke vtterlye voyde synne nowe hauyng conquered death dwelleth glorye immortalitie euen beyng also regenerate vnto hym put old man representeth fyrste originall poyson afreshe naughty venemous lustes texte renewed also spirite mynde put newe man whiche god shapen righteousnesse true holmes wherefore put awaye lying speake euery man trueth vnto neighbour muche membres one another angry synne let sunne go downe vpon wrath neyther geue place vnto backebyter let hym stole steale let hym rather labour handes thing whiche good maye geue vnto hym nedeth forasmuche engraffed vnto newe man christe throughe baptisme bee also renewed hym bodye mynde wherein spirite christe dooeth moste chieflye woorke laying awaye maner youre olde cankered lyfe put newe man whiche made certayne spirituall sorte lately woorke manshippe god yea made certayne transformacion vnrighteousnes abolished innocencie shoulde succede vnclennesse humayne lustes beyng taken oute waye holinesse gospelles veritie shoulde take place loke therefore folowe holines euery condicion see ye desceaue one countrefaict speache liyng euety one consider thing true deale truely neighbour remebring inasmuche al mebres one bodye man hurte muste nedes also hurte hymselfe great perfeccion moued angre case frailtie mannes nature rage angre come minde remebre holy psalmographe geueth warning restrayn angre whan would barste yt breake scoldyng iniurie malicious hatred lette angre onely vnhurtefull also let remayne litel whyle bee sooner stomakes sunne besydes earth leste whan earth night season naturally colde contrarie wise chaufe youre selfes meane tyme hootelye angre nothyng concorde yt hable defende safelye agaynste assaultes deuyll yf bee broken malice displeasure one agianste another open wikette enemye breake vtter destruccion concord deuyll feble discorde myghtye yf geue place malice must perforce geue place also hym olde naughty facion lyuyng robbed polled others let hym absteyne onelye mennes goodes also geue awaye liberallye hys owne haue dooe let hym disdeyne get honeste hande labour wherewith succoure suche nedye texte let fylthy communicacion procede mouth good edyfye withall oft nede may minister grace vnto hearer greue ye holy spirite god ye sealed vnto daye redempcion let bytternes fearsnes wrathe roryng cursed speaking put away maliciousnes ye courteous one another mercyfull forgeuyng one another euen god christes sake hath forgeuen ynoughe kepe still handes continente excepte tongue also vnhurtefull many pestilent mischeafes naughty tongue woont occasion filthy communicacion infecteth backebiting infameth false accusacion destroyeth lying periurie desceaueth let euil communicacion therefore procede mouthe speache minde yf pure mynde besemeth impure communicacion procede ynoughe christian mannes co municacion vnhurtefull ought also bee suche sorte bee spoken season good purpose maye bee commodious vnto hearer case doe otherwyse shall onely offende menne vnprofitable vnseasonable noysome communicacion also holy spirite god dwelleth christian harte whome youre soules bodyes marked vnto god furthermore conueniente bryng foorth marke safe fayre daye whan shall receyue rewarde innocencye whiche daye shal bee dysseuered coumpanye eiuyll trewelye thys spyryte dryuen awaye dyspleased kynde vncleanesse canne abyde haue dooe wyth wrathe wyth reuengement filthye communicacion peaceable gentyll bounteous yf haue truelye receyued hym let al bitternes swelling fearcenes ferre conuersacion let angre loude speakyng scoldyng fer yt leauen malice remayne youre stomake whereof manner myscheafes woont budde rather bee tractable gentill among youre selues readye haue mercie pardone forgeue euery one yf thyng chaunce bee dooen amyste errour mannes imbecillitie forgeue saye christes sake forasmuch god hath forgeuen offence christe al beit lord hath forgeuen seruauntes vpon condicion exaumple also euery one forgeue oure felow seruauntes concorde possibly wyse continue among men onles thei beare paciently euery faultes others v chapter texte ye therfore folowers god dere chyldre walke ye loue euen christ loued v gaue hymselfe v offeryng sacrifice swete sauer god fornicacion al vnclennesse couetousnes let named among commeth sayntes filthynesse foolishe talkyng testyng whiche comly rather geuyng thankes ye knowe whoremonger eyther vncleane persone couetous persone whiche worshipper ymages hath inheritaunce kyngdome christe god let man deceyue vayne wordes suche thynges commeth wrath god vpon chyldren disobedience ye therfore companion ye sumtime darkenes nowe ye lyghtm lorde walke child lyght fruite spirite consisteth al goodnesse righteousnesse trueth accepte pleasyng vnto lorde forasmuche holy goste child god see bee lyke father holines lyfe maye worthylye bee loued hym euer truely thus shal shewe hys loue towardes perpetuallye yf loue among selues one vnto another howe aboundauntelye greate father loue towardes v appeareth playnelye hys sonne loued v enteirlye muche onelye hathe frely pardoned al sinnes also offred vnto death vpon crosse thintente god father displeased angred v meane sacrifice offreyng good sauour smelleth swete prefence become louyng mercifull vnto v louyng charitie case folowe becommeth v doe shal onely tractable yf thyng shall chaunce committed agaynste v also shall drede occasion require commoditie neighboure putte lyues daunger nowe purpose neede speake earnestly vnto touchyng suche vyces filthye grosse whoredome al kinde vncleanes insaciable desyre money monstreous abominacions christian mannes conuersacion oughte ferre alienate yt wer shame haue spoken among thinges execrable honeste pure harte woulde euen abhorte thinke becometh saynctes honest cleane couersacion also bee chaste mouthed pure communicacion may thinke ynoughe pure woorde cleane lyfe onely excepte abhorte also talke foolishe friuolous fable vayne flirtes iestes whiche maye tolerated commended truely christian nothyng e congeuen e christian theyr moste spedye iournaye heauen haue constinuall ba ayle byees daungerous battayle canne haueno laysure applye suche tryfles sportes rather haue wepe whan mynde woulde make merye good successe well spedyng oughte make metye hymnes thankes geuyng god howebeit knowe well ynough philosopher teache carnal copulacion mariage punished mannes lawe couetous besyre money faulte temporall peyne appoynted vnto woulde haue vnderstande certayntye whosoeuer onger spotted kynde vncleanelustes geuen couetousnes whiche forasmuche reposeth principal felicitie dumme transitorie substaunce reckoned lite better woorshipper image shal admitted enheritannce immortal lyfe god hath promised nherite commoly christ thinke paine light geue credence goe aboute perswade vnto synnes lyght suffer selues deceyued wyth che maner vayne friuolous communicacion take hede rather doctryne gospell seyng suche maner synnes althoughe punished mannes law yet vengeaunce god commonly falleth vpon child disobedience distrusting promysses heauenly father posyng theyr felicitie suche kynde thinges onte diuorted youre selfes suche mennes company professed christ standeth therfore hande beware conuersacion lyke vnto ghtynesse professe one waye lyue ferre wyde waye darkenes ignoraunce hath bene yet hitherto occasion erroure trueth gospel sprongen vp wyped awaye darkenes tymes paste walked darke night committed shameful vyces doen night nowe god lyghte gospel hath enlumined harte maye clerelye descerne howe bominable thynges appeared pleasaunt swete nighte hath shame couereth many thynges man woulde bee bolde dooe clere day therefore see ordre conuersacion together suche sort forgette consider lyue daye alwayes seene theiyes god taketh iourneye night many tymes stombleth seeth shoulde goe daye parte hath commoditie sheweth folowed auoyded teacheth v euery condicion flee malice cursed speakyng dissimluacion steede folowe goodnesse righteousnesse trueth generallye marke rhat thyng alwayes pleasyng vnto yt swete delectable vnto v yt acceptable vnto wil god whose appointmet couersacion ought altogether gouerned texte haue felowship vnfruictful workes darkenes rather rebuke shame euen name thinges whiche doen secret thinges rebuked light manyfest whatsoeuer manyfest light wherfore saieth awake thou slepest stand vp death christ shall geue lighte page duplicate page duplicate christe fountayne dayelyght yf wyll continuallye cleane vnto hym endeuour shal doe fruictefull honeste office godlines suche worthye lyght henceforth shamed haue doe vnfruictefull workes darkenesse therfore take good hede yde agayne olde former darkenesse may rather lyght bewray reproue naughty dedes co mit theyr darkenes wha thei afraied offend god oft night secrete place hath take away shame thynges abominable shame euen make rehersal long offende whyle lyghte appeareth offende cenciouslye without punishement often bewrayed open light vilenesse thyng begynneth bee knowen faultes wrayed amended turned better whan nyghte turned daye blyndenesse harte vtterly expulsed yf conuersacion light shalbe ashamed theyr owne filthynes wh n see innocencie shall come passe beeyng moued honeste godlye demeanour shall bee styrred vp innocencie yf see lyght christe shynyng deede thus sayeth prophete wake thou sleapeste ryse vp deade christe shall geue lyght deade sleape yea rather death selfe bee ouer whelmed pleasure worlde respecte thynges eternall vnfeynedlye good yet cannot otherwyse awake meanes returne lyfe onlesse christe spring theyr harte wrpe awaye grosse darkenesse ignoraunce texte p take hede therfore ye walke circuspectly vnwise wise men oiding occasion dayes euyll wherfore ye vnwise vnderstand wyll lord droncke wyne wherin excesse fylled sprite speakinge vnto selues psalmes hymnes spyritual songes singyng making melodie lorde hertes geuyng thankes alwayes thynges vnto god father name lorde iesus christ submittyng selues one another feare god therefore ephesian vnto whome christe bryght sunne geueth hys clere lyght take hede loke maner walke leadyng lyfe nowe maner gentyles blyndenesse harte perceyue honest becommeth vnderstande truelye doctryne ghospell losse haue redeme oportunitie obteyne saluacion whiche gredelye layed holde vpon tyme per ously naught many thynges flowe euerie side hable withdrawe vncircumspect men synceritie christian doctryne therfore standeth hand take circumspecte hede throughe vnaduisednesse geue occasion vnto wicked eyther maie open aduersaries gospel elles drawe backe profession whole summe saluacion behalfe ought warely wyse wynke thynges declare vnderstande perfeitlye lordes wyll desire haue al men brought saluacion gospel possible shalbe requisite take busines hand bee sobre drounkenship hartelesse vncircumspecte onelye harteles also rashe temerarious therefore wyse drounken wyne whiche thyng vnnecessari prouoketh ciuiousnes filled swete wyne holy ghoste fortunate ebrietie stirre v wanton dauncynges folyshe ballettes wherewith gentile crie vpon theyr deuilles vnto psalmes hymnes spirituall song wherewith reioyce syng make merye amonge selues vnto lorde vncomly yellyng noyses madde drounken men vsed dooe wardelye soules hertes pleasure loue ba kette woorthye christian leste shoulde excede gentile drounken bankettynges theyr drounken pastime sorowe dooeth ensue many tymes also disease bodye myrth continuall merimente whatsoeuer chaunceth vnto whether bee gladnesse whether bee sadnesse gladnesse mercifull god sadnesse hym laboureth saluacion bounden alwayes geue thankes thynges beyng assured nothyng happen beste auauntage eternall felicitie thankes bee geuen vnto god autoure al good thynges al menne thesame also father god lord iesus christe whome geueth v thynges hym wyll haue praysed thinges equally wt himselfe christ hath submitted himselfe obedietly vnto father lyke case becommeth v submmitte selues vnto hym besemeth christian terrour vnto christian reuerently folow christ apperteineth grudge submit theselfes euerye one inasmuch beyng supreme head al hath submitted himselfe humbly vnder al let inferiour acknoweledge autoritie superiour syde let superiour confourme hymselfe vnto capacitie inferiour rather may hym good yt among christian beareth moste rule ruleth none ende good ca texte p ye wemen submitte selfes vnto owne housebandes vnto lorde housebande wyues head euen christe head congregacion thesame ministreth saluacion vnto bodye therefore congregacion subieccion christe likewyse let wyues also subieccion theyr housbandes thynges ye housebandes loue wyues euen christe also loued congregacion gaue hymselfe sancrifye clensed fountayne water throughe woorde make vnto hymselfe glorious congregacion withoute spot wrinkle anye suche thyng holye withoute blame ought menne loue wyues theyr owne bodyes loueth wyfe loueth hymselfe manne euer yet bated owne fleshe nourysheth cherisheth eue lorde dooeth congregacion membres bodye hys flesh bone cause shal man leaue father mother shalbe ioyned vnto wife two shalbe made one fleshe great secret speake christ congregacio neuerthelesse dooe ye euery one loue wife eue himselfe lette wyfe feare husbande let wyues therefore acknowledge autoritie theyr housebandes subieccion vnto none otherwyse congregacion subieccionthe houseband wiues head euen christe head congregacio lorde iesu lyke christe heade congregacion euen euery housband head wife neuertheles like head hath preeminence ouer bodye entent health body depende euen housebande autoritye ouer wyfe thintente vse cruelly like tyranne prouide wealth hys witte substanciall yet wife maye bristle housebande seeketh handes bee loued feared duety somuch subieccion al pointes like ye congregacio much ye subieccion vnto christ hath lowly submitted saluacion spouse parte yt ye housbades loue wiues christ al hath louedtde congregacion housbades buse autoritie lyke tyrannes ouer wiues rather vse like louyng charitie christ hath doeth loue congregacion whome beyng aduouterer obstinate rebel onely caste also gaue hymselfe vnto death redemyng saluacion adefiled one made pure holye vncleane foule made fayre goodlye yet caste teeth vyle filthinesse washed cleane streame bloud scoured fountaine lyfe worketh profitably inuocacion name god owne diligent goodnes myght prepare hymselfe glorious wife euen congregacion whiche nowe neyther haue spotte wrincle suche lyke might displeasaunt housebandes iye euery point fayre faultles becommeth housebandes lykewise affected wardes theyr wiues leaue nothing vndone whereby maye make theyr wine perfite christian woomen bee lesse carefull wyues healthe head carefull health bodye wyfe housebandes body admitte thy wyfe croked condicions nyce wanton geuen vnthriftynesse destroyeher ragyng crueltie heale amende bre lenitie correcte faulres thou loue thy wife neuerthelesse would head doe yf see bodye full sickenes disease would beginne hate sake rather heale coulde coulde meanes heale yet least beare withhe loueth wife loueth cherishe might thought great absurditie head would wishe euill owne bodye loueth wyfe loueth hymself parte hymselfe man euer litle felyng sens nature hate owne bodye man dooeth rather nourishe cherishe hys bodye maner one euer bee make better lustier seyng ethnikes doe naturally lesse doeth christian charitie worke v great deale inasmuche moued thereunto exaumple christe forsake wife congres gacion though disteyned tyme many sondry wayes whorishe naughty packe clensed pyked made perfectly trimme euery poynt therefore house bandes doe vnto wyues christe hath dooen vnto v membres body whiche congregacion lyke wyfe bodye housebande whose fleshe bone made thintente maye manifestlye knowen thyng oughte wyse bee diuorced asondre one selfe thing thus reade booke genesis wyues sake man shal rather forsake father mother forsake wyfe vnto shall kepe hymselfe twoo bee made one moste perfite coupling together body soules nexte god bounden father mother yet wife preferred boue herin ment certain vnspeakeable great misterie howe thyng doen adam eue vnder figure performed effect mistically christ congregacion inseparable coiunccio whosoeuer wil wel weigh shal perceiue lyeth hidde great mistery lyke christ one father euen would haue al one albeit mistery importeth greater circumstaunce nowe presently expressed yet inough haue applyed exaumple ende euery man loue wife none otherwise loueth himselfe considre al one selfesame thing euen christ loued congregacion whome vnited entierely himselfe finally shall wyues parte loue husband agayn companion liue together also reuerence autoritie sake hath ouer shall hartie loue continue long together goodly case party doe theyr dueties accordingly p vi chapter texte child obey father mother lorde right honoure thy father mother firste comaundement promes thou mayest prosper liue long earthe ye father moue youre child wrathe ye shall bryng vp norter informacion lorde ye scruauntes bee obedient vnto bodely master feare tremblyng euen synglenes youre hearte vnto christe dooyng seruice vnto eye go aboute please menne seruauntes christ dooyng wyll god hearte good wyll seruyng lorde menne knowyng whatsoeuer good thyng manne dooth shall receyue agayne god whether bonde free ye master dooe euen thynges vnto puttyng awaye threatenynges knoweyng master also heauen nether respect person wyth hym let autoritie gouerned charitie wyse practise tirannie side let reuerent feare holde vnder lower sort much sufferaunce waxe rebellious concorde quietnes possibly hauocke without ordre ouer wyfe husband onely hath autoritie child bounden acknowlege autoritie father mother therefore accordyng rule child curteous obedient vnto father mother al theyr honeste christian commaundementes doeth euen equitie nature also require shoulde honour whome bounden bringing v worlde kinde vnto whose goodnes nourished broughte vp briefe lawe god commaundeth sayeth honour thy father thy mother inough geue commaundement doth commaundementes thou shalt doe murther thou shalt steale c added also reward vnto allure rather doe theyr duetie although thinges honest ought dooen frely without rewarde rewarde doeth scripture promise may happen wel vnto sayth thou mayest long liued vpon earth verely thought persone worthy long life vnkynde rebellious agaynst whome hath receiued vse life part father abuse autoritie obedience child thinking may lawfully lust child bonde seruauntes let gentlenes mitigate autoritie must beware waiwardnes old age strayt dealing immoderate frowardnes amend prouoke stomakes bee wurse case doe amisse reason youthe ought admonished may rather taught discouraged let speciallest poynt charge enforme mouicions instruccions theyr tender yeares allure exaumples godlines may appeare brought vp vnder christian parentes accordyng doctrine christe meanes shal soner brought good frame threatninges crueltie ifye seruau te obediet bodely master c taught altogether compelled seruauntes let appere profession gospel hath made better profitable duetie doe maisters vnto bounden temporall condicion seruitude loke behalfe doe much aboundauntly office baptisme geue libertie shoulde bee bondage shoulde dooe youre bounden seruice diligently shoulde disdayne maisters become brother profession muche ought haue reuerence afrayde offend common sorte seruauntes doth duetie feare mynde curse watche vpright sincere conscience obey considering self duetie vnto christ vnto whose wil obedient although peraduenture maisters deserue obedience meanes shall come passe shall lyke common trade seruauntes dooe theyr maisters commaundementes presently syght feare displeasure assone thynke body seeth wil luste dede thys serue vnto eye conscience nothing elles couet please men christe whose syghte nothing acceptable counterfayetly done el coaccion becummeth seruauntes christe hartely faythfully curteous diligent dueties towardes maysters necessitie enforceth god willeth see alienate selues dueties albeit haue croked wieked maisters dede expediente forwardenes gospell shoulde curteous vnto obedience turne vnto vngodlinesse considre selues doe vnto christ doe vnto gospel sake doe vnto god vnto men inasmuche doe men loue god case winne vnto christe diligence righte well bestowed duetie shew themselues vnthankeful yet know certaintie man shall lose rewarde well although shal receiue man hand yet shall vndoubtedly receyue lord onely bondman also freeman whatsoeuer good turne shall hartely bestow vpon vnthankeful man conclude like bondseruauntes professe christe ought much profitable vnto maisters euen requisite christia maisters gentle commaunding seruauntes behauiours vse themselues wise may appeare couet rather loued feared hartely louing vnto theyr bond seruauntes inasmuch receiued felow ship brother alwayes ready threate beate common sorte maisters accustomed doe let seruauntes perceiue become gentle reason gospel also may rather allured vnto professio wel peraduenture haue yet alredy professed considre maisters autoritie temporali thing onely established man lawe becummeth v wise disturbe yet neuertheles respect person god maketh neuer whit lesse bonde seruaunte maketh manne gentleman borne according man lawes maisters haue power ouer seruauntes vpon earth meane tyme haue maister heauen well hys care youre seruauntes commoditie reasonable commaunding presse tirannie thynges haue hitherto treated tend end aswel lyke vnto head christ holines life agree together among selues mutuall concorde texte finally brother stronge lorde power might put armoure god ye maye stande againste assaultes deuill wrestle bloode fleshe againste rule power worldly ruler euen gouernoures darckenes worlde spirituall cra tyues heue thinges whertore take vnto whole armoure god ye maye hable resist euell daie stande perfecte thynges stande therfore loynes girde wt trueth hauyng brestplate righteousnes hauing shoe youre ere ye maye bee prepared gospell peace aboue take shilde faithe wt ye maye quenche ficrie dartes wicked take helmet saluacion de spirite whiche woorde god remayneth finall conclusyon forasmuche wieked doe lay sundry engine ouerthrowe tranquillitie must also bee armed strong lustie inward conscience resist ayde owne power meane lorde jesus defendour suffer hys bodye destitute verely v feble member valeaunt mightie hath taken vpon protectour desyre therefore maner spirituall armour weapon therwith euery poynt surely harnessed may hable stand valeauntly agaynst assaultes deuil haue warre battayl men whose wronges duetie ouercome pacyence battayl wicked spirites enemyes foe christe whose champion instrumentes ragingly assault v ministery prince power deuils geue battail v fro aboue exercise theyr tirannye vpon suche bee addycte vnto throughe naughtinesse thys worlde lay wayte darkenes worlde loue lyght gospel agaynste say must necessarily abyde battayll onely mightye strength also exceadingly perfite spirituall pollicie coastes ayre may easelier come vpon v harder v apprehende warre agaynst kinde enemy humayne weapon armour doe good onely armour god must defende v harme therefore often must entre battayl aduersaries doe alwayes noble warriers accustomed whan haue doe daungerous enemie get harnesse doe euery thyng accordyngly whan daunger battayl shalbe may hable kepe place stedfastly stand vpon sure rocke christ whan menne goe warre one agaynst fyrste couer themselues euery syde lye open way theyr enemy ordinaunce make ready bea e backe inuader middle partes theyr body tendernes girde apron maile vpper partes harnesse brest plate upon legges feete weare bootes helmet vpon head lefte syde shylde buckled kepe arowe shot like case haue spiritual battayl wicked spirites continually steede girdle put trueth girde vp loines mynde stande vpryghte shrynke naughtie enticement false goodes false opinion breste plate put innocencie righteousnes kepe inward partes mynd safe sure mayles vertue godlines bootes put legges fete loke haue sincere affeccion coueteth nothing thinges heauenly afrayde nothyng onely vngodlines may alwayes readilye prepared defende gospell whose defence consilieth styrryng tumulte patience quietnesse cause sake called gospel peace preacher wherof prophete time past respecting admiracion considre howe excellently fayre feete must diligently see haue continual readinesse euery syde buckeler faythe wherby maye assuredly trust promyses god larum euer happeneth buckeler shal vaynquished fyrie dartes euer subtill aduersary shall throwe v buckeler shal kepe theim none theim shal pearce parte oure liuely membres thing wounde soule defieth death selfe haue also buckler helmet vigilaunt mynde take good circumspect hede nede wise afraid health finally haue alwaies right hand sword spirite aswel cut naughtie lustes mindes pearce inwarde partes harte also kepe resistours gospel veritie suppresse false head trueth may preuayle sworde worde god pearceth constaunt power fayth maner mannes cutting reason rather renneth cutteth woorde man weake watrishe woorde forasmuche entreateth onely vayne transitorye matter woorde god effectual skil nothing heauenly thinges pearceth vnto ioyntes soule searcheth euen inwarde boanes marye enemy christian haue battail withal wheras men peace weapos wherwith defend themselues get vietorie power helpe christ mightie captayn whose luckie ayde theyr batayl hath good successe texte praye alwayes maner praier supplication spirite watche therunto instaunce supplicacion sainctes vtteraunce maye bee geuen vnto maye open mouthe frely vtter secretes gospet whereof messenger bondes therein may speake frely ought speake ye may also knowe condicion wher dooe tichicus dere brother faythfull minister lorde shall shewe thynges whome haue sente vnto purpose ye mighte knowe case stande might coumforte harte peace e vnto brother loue faith god father lorde iesus christ grace al whiche loue lorde iesus christ vnfaynedly amen therfore standeth v hande pray alway vnto continual supplicacions desyre bottome harte without ceassing praiers day night al saintes may haue vpper hand sweorde spirite also duetie helpe prayer beseche god would geue plenteous vtteraunce gospel whansoeuer shall preache would please vse mouth instrument vnto owne glory saluacion may boldly without shrinking declare vnto al men mistical doctrine gospel wherunto men called indifferently hindred suche labour possible meanes glorye gospell spred abrod wherof made embassadour yea euen laden chaynes suffering excedingly may boldely goe office committed vnto mind may still perseuer vnto ende helpe christe may freely speake becummeth speake rebuke preacher gospel afrayd anything hinder doyng office gospell conclude concernyng state myne owne thinges howe matter standeth shall knowe tichicus welbeloued brother brother onely sinceritie fayth also minister helper gospel businesse whome haue sent vnto purpose might know certainly state much couforted beyng lest harte discouraged myne affliccions tyed bounde gospell christ doeth triumphe notwithstanding euen prieson prayer peace mutual loue ioyned sincere fayth may vnto al brother faith springeth charitie charitie nourisheth concord thre prosperous procedyng graunt vnto god father lorde iesus christe loue merciful goodnesse god euer vnfained conscience
