vnspotted life loue lorde iesus christe despysyng transitory tryfles worlde folowe thynges eternall heauenly confirme mine hartie praier beseche god graut mercifully amen thus endeth paraphrase vpon epistle paul apostle ephesian p argument vpon epistle saint paule apostle philippian erasmus roterdaine philippian first parte macedonia declared xvi actes people deducted oute citie philippos called philip buyldour thessalonica head citie philippian whiche worthilye muche praysed apostle bicause persisted constauntlie faythe receyued woulde allowe false apostle among wheras corinthian galathians receyued geuen credence vnto unto philippian paule beyng warned holy ghost wente taried among good maynye dayes without greate trauayll paule scourged whippes caste silas pryson tyme keper prison household baptized citie also lydia purpleseller fyrst beyng couerted receaued paule house also souldiours knowing paule cetezen rome desired theyr owne mynde goo whither woulde name christe notified abroade luckye prosperous successe also whan paule prison rome philippian sent hym suche thynges necessarie lyue epaphroditus doon afore whan thessalonica selfe witnesseth epistle whiche hauyng set forthe prayses commendacions exhorteth perseuer goo forewarde shewyng ought reioyce euen affliction make aduau cement christes gospel onely afrayed death also woulde gladlye wishe yf christ would gyueth speciall exhortacion mutuall concorde whiche possible amonge suche stoute stomaked shoulde better content promyseth sende tymotheus vnto come againe shortlye selfe meane tyme sendeth epaphroditus whiche amended extreme daungerous sickenesse treateth two first chapter thyrd confirmeth theyr conscience false apostle alluryng men euery vnto iewyshe secte calleth dogges worker wickednes enemyes christes crosse makyng belyes god place apertely stomaked epistle fourth chapter ful comendacions salutacions onely intermingleth certain monicions way thanketh philippian liberall gentilnesse shewed towardes epistle wrote citie rome epaphroditus wha layed seconde tyme prison firste defense leadde agayne prison wherof maketh reporte epistle tymothee ende argument paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle paule apostle philippian chapter texte paule tymothe seruauntes iesu christ sayntes christe iesu whiche philippos bishoppes deacon grace vnto peace god father lorde iesus christ paule timothe felowes office gospel seruauntes iesus christe companye sayntes purelye entierlye professe name christe also haue ouersight ministracion christia flocke philippos wishe grace peace vnto god father lorde iesu christ texte thanke god al remembraunce alwayes al prayer praye gladnes ye come felowship gospel fro frist day vnto surely certified hath begonne good worke shall performe vntil day iesus christ becometh iudge al haue berte asmuche ye companyons grace wyth euen bondes defendyng stablyshynge gospel god recorde howe greatlye longe hart rote iesus christ pray loue may encrease yet knowledge vnderstandyng ye may accepte thinges excellet ye may pure hurte man coscience vntyl day christ beyng filled fruit rightewisenes whiche fruit cometh iesus christ vnto glory prayse god verely often call vpon god prayer doo dede ceassyng make continuall mention rendryng thankes excedyng reioycyng behalfes euer synce fyrst entraunce profession euen vnto daye haue releued wyth helpe gentilnes haue shewed youre selues felowshyppe gospel continuall prayer maye encrease vertuous doynges doubtyng god hath entred godly partes wyl performe hath begon vnto day iesus christ shall come recompence eternall rewarde well done dedes conuenient ye iudge ye helpe god asmuche alwayes hitherto haue suche experience youre constaunte true gospellike loue warde may easyly gather good begynnyng shal come good ending ye cause sake minde affectuously set towardes ye euen bandes wha arraigned neroes barre wher must pleade head giltie giltie mine affliction power gospel hindred obscured cofirmed aduauced haue euer borne singuler good bicause haue alwayes perceiued glad self word christ doth florishe painful afflictio god selfe knoweth fro nothing hidde disirously affected towardes maner mannes affection either intente get anye thyng yet anye wyse flattre youre lyberalitie shewed loue wt pure christia affectio none purpose bycause see loue iesus christ constauntly purely thanke god heartely bestowynge hys gyftes vpon beseche hym youre charitie may encrease knowledge vnderstandyng maye knowe vnto whome youre dutie minister office charitie commaundement charitie mynde doo good dedes discretion sheweth howe shoulde doo good dedes euer shall bestowe christes sake vpon preacher promotours ghospell best bestowed bycause shall receyue agayne greate auauntage cause wyshe praye may alwayes encrease gyftes maye hable proue best done maye sincere affection geue respecte nothyng onelye christe set profession ghospell suche vprightnes lyfe geue man occasion offended rather allute men true wourshyppe god perseuer styll vnto daye christes commynge maye appeare ryche aboundauntlye ful good workes wherof world make wer seedenesse shall reape ye frute therof day wt moste plenteous encrease ye meritours goodnes iesus christ glory glorye praise god foutaine al goodnes al thinges referred texte would ye vnderstande brother thynges whiche happened vnto chaunced vnto great furtheraunce ghospell bondes christe manifest thorow iudgement hall al place much many brother lorde beyng encouraged thorowe bondes dare boldely speake worde wythout feare preache christ enuye stryfe good wyll one part preacheth christ strife sincerely supposyng adde aduersitie bodes agayne part preache loue know set defend gospel christe preached anye maner waye whether occasion true meanyng glad therof yea glad know shall chaunce saluacion thorowe prayer ministrynge spirit iesu christ accordyng expectation hope nothyng shalbe ashamed bold nesse alwayes euen nowe also christ shalbe magnified body whether thorow lyfe thorowe death christe lyfe death auauntage chaunce lyue fleshe thyng frutefull worke shal chose wote costrained two thynges desyre lo ced wt christe moche farre better neuerthelesse abyde fleshe nedfull sure shal abyde continue wt youre furtheraunce ioye fayth reioysyng maye aboundant thorow iesus christe commyng agayne intent ye may amplye partaker ioye would ye vnderstand brethre emprisonmet fetter arraignemetes calamity wher wt tossed turmoyled ye gospel christ hinder ye sitting abrod cofirming ye doctrine gospel also happened great furtheraunce withdraw faythfull fro profession taken vpon also confirmed greate deale ye made hartie better courage vnderstode vndoubtedly true preache afraied suffre thinges made bold entreprise lyke myne exaple ye part comen chauce yt happeneth matter honestye weightye importauce holden vnder turmoyled hereawaye thereawaye muche come forwarde appeare withstading ye endeuour ye wicked trauailling cotrarie dede bondes gaue occasion woorde christe came onelye fewe symple sorte commune people afore floryshed also throughoute neroes hall whole cytie sondrye brother whyche professed ghospell tyme men halfe afrayed nowe beynge encouraged wyth bondes lorde iesus ordreth matter begynne alid myne example professe woorde ghospell freely boldelye drede set aparte albeit men dyd wyth lyke synceritie dyd also wyth lyke dylygence yet matter chaunced occasion furtheraunce ghospell among dyd maliciouse purpose procure greater hatred kyndle neroes stomake muche fearcely agaynste v sawe thys secte encrease come forwarde whiche erronious conceipte iudgeth hurtefull empire consideration whereof thoughte woulde soner haue dispatched oute waye perchaunce manye hauynge disdeigne glorye whyche notwythstandynge chalenge selfe resigne whollye vnto christe haue gone aboute throughe malicious enuye obscure commendacion myght seme diligente wee agayne preache christe dooe syncere good conscience thoughe throughly perfite concernynge fauoure outwarde maner man wante anye theyr handes whyche loue see endaungered thys cause goe stedfastlye accordyng offyce commytted vnto defende ghospell agaynste wycked althoughe euen preache vpon moste naughty purpose haue furthered glorye ghospell also preache christe christian conscience vpryghte purpose labour intente myghte cause nowe taken bounden greuouslye punyshed case throughe theyr earnest hoote cockled ghospellyng coulde haue broughte v haynous displeasure thys euer shal happen vnto shall make great matter turne glorye christe vnto whome owe suche entier hartie loue glad haue hym notified vnto men occasion euer deserue greatest commendation god preache christe vpon intente doe borne wythall vpon certayne pryuate affection towardes v set forwarde doctrine gospel preache christ displeasure hurte theselues sorye goe hurt defye froward purpose turneth furtheraunce ye gospel veray glad teache christe truelye althoughe theyr entent nothyng vpryght doo onelye reioyce nowe presentlye also wyll reioyce hereafter rase goe styl despight set doctrine christ greueth intente thys meanes destroye seynge knowe well ynoughe wyth helpe youre prayer spirite iesu christe forwardynge gouernyng busines shall proue vnto best commoditie whether dye lyue faythfull truste haue coceyued hym shall neuer desceaue whiche moste certaynly perswaded wil neuer leaue destitute put shame preaching gospell hathe comytted vnto shal enforced wyth anye affliction either ante vayne holde tongue speakyng thyng sure mooste true rather lyke affliction whiche haue suffered mennes handes bodye haue alwayes hetherto turned aduauntage ghospell eyther whan stoned whan scourged wyth whyppes whan caste wylde beastes euen thys afflyction whereby ieoperdye heade lyfe shall proue also glorye prayse christe whether chaunce lyue dye former stormes myne affliction althoughe troubled thys ca ca dyd neuer wythdrawe myne harte made shrynke stedfast preachyng christe shall also thys hoote tempest thyng withdrawe yf lyue shall defende trueth ghospell boldely yf shall dye euen deathe whiche shall gladlye suffer ghospelles sake shall glorye christ whether waye euer happeneth vnto shalbe sure sauegarde death onely afrayed thynke also rather wyshed yf myghte spedye furtheraunce ghospell yet wearye lyue thoughe lyue thys payefull estate measure felicitie lyfe successe ghospell parte affrayed death shalbe vauntage brynge ioyes heauen thys lyfe shall truely lyue yet meane tyme thys vyle corporall lyfe wanteth frute forasmuche amplyfyinge good dedes rewarde immortalitie amplyfyed also besydes whyle lyue thys worlde ghospell christe set forwarde confirmed throughe oure trauayll hande christe whether hys pleasure rather lyue dye myne owne parte readyly prepared eyther waye tell whether better chose cause shoulde wyshe dye cause shoulde refuse lyue whan haue cast best examyned myne owne hearte perceyue greate deale better losed frome troublous toylynges thys lyfe presente companye wyth christe goe agayne vnto vnspeakeable felicitie taste whan apte thyrde heauen agayne whan consider best moste expedyent perceyue profitable yea rather necessarie contynue yet whyle thys myne office knowe certayntie shall tarye styll yet life tarye shall haue youre companye agayne suche libertie shall goe forwarde aboundauntlye faithe shall haue muche cause glad encreace fayth parte maye glad commyng vnto agayne whan shall see helpe christe haue onely geuen place myscheuous trouble also preserued encrease best profite texte onely let conuersacion becommeth gospel christ whether come see el absent may yet condicion ye continue one spirite one soule labourynge doo mayntayne faythe ghospel nothyng fearynge aduersaries whiche cause perdicion saluacion god vnto geuen christe onlye ye shoulde beleue hym also ye shoulde suffre hys sake hauynge euen suche sight ye sawe nowe heare doo see nowe howe lytle regarde myne owne feli itie comparison youre commoditie man woulde loothe care thys worlde thyrde heauen woulde desire vpper paradise delyuered misery woulde contemne communication man whan remembreth secrete wordes spoken aboue would stedde many daungiers mani ieoperdies many deathes rather chose quietnesse neuer shall haue deathe neuertheles set muche brotherlye charitie regarde profyte others myne owne desyre therefore shalbe youre partes applye youre selues diligentlye maye doo lykewyse accordynge mynde thys behalfe shalbe case wyl frame lyfe answerably vnto ghospell christe whose sake abyde trouble frustrate frute whiche onelye thyng woulde wyshe seperated moste blessed felowshyppe christe therefore endeuoure youre selues case see agayne maye fynde suche woulde wyshe yf anye let see agayne yet least maye myne absence lyke haue done alwayes hitherto continue styll one spirite whiche haue commonlye receyued agree one mynde holdyng vp wyth diligence prayer fayth ghospell warreth agaynste wycked afrayed persecution resiste enemy christe manfullye euery place whose wycked doynges shall worke nothyng elles owne destruction saluation cause glorye ghospell flourishe theyr owne wycked purpose proue alwayes worse worse goodly thyng suffer christe excellent thyng hym conquere aduersaries howbeit wyse attribute oure selues geuen god onelye beleue ghospell christ wythout dyssemblyng preache also readyly suffer see doe shrynke abyde conflicte ghospelles sake haue sene suffer manye wayes afore whan haue harde beyng nowe boundes haserd heade thynges happen chaunce aduentures appointed goodnesse god vnto specially whose godlynes haue notablye sene affliction life p ii chapter texte ther therfore consolacion christ comforte loue felowshyp spirite yf compassion mercy fulfyll ye ioye ye lyke mynded hauyng one loue beyng one accorde one mind thing done strife vayne glory mekenes mynd let euery man esteme another better selfe loke ye euery man hys thynges euery man thynges mennes nowe therefore yf anye mutuall consolation among haue professed one christe anye comfort brotherly loue maketh commune whether sadnesse gladnesse among spirite christe worketh efficacye vnto yf anye commune louyng affection among whereby men commenly greued frendes heauynes yf merciful compassion wherby euen natural instincte mourne sory hu te loue hartely suffre sake be che philippian make good ioye haue coceyued whatsoeuer owe vnto maner behalfe wyll acknowledge full paymente case sticke together perfyte concorde harte case haue loue among one vnto case one mynde one consent peace concorde possibly continue among hote stomaked hyghe mynded forasmuche hote mynde swellynge stomake causeth contention causeth ambition causeth angre whiche present poysons brotherly loue frendshippe ought among men seyng made one among selues spirite christe professe doctrine christe see thyng done contention vayne glorye one prouoke fearce demeanour none wyll gyue place meanes whereof among worldly disciple arise chydynges braulinges dissension therfore let wrathe ambition pryde counsail naughtye counsaillours rather brotherly loue companyon modestie minde man preferre selfe thinke euery better selfe withoute boastes hys owne doynges content gentlye glad mennes better quality let euery man respect owne priuate commoditie doo publique concorde lyke continue let euery man regarde commodity others christian charitie whose propertie seke thinges owne texte let mynde also christe iesu whiche whan shape god thought robbery equall wyth god neuerthelesse made hym selfe reputacion takyng hym shape seruaunte became lyke vnto men founde hys apparell man humbled hymselfe became obedyente vnto death euen death crosse wherfore god also hath eralted hye gyuen hym name aboue name name iesus euerye knee shoulde bowe bothe thynges heauen thynges earth thynges vnder earth tonges shoulde confesse iesus christe lorde vnto prayse god father let wycked thought come myndes shoulde beyng better gyue place wyttynglye wyllynglye vnto hym worse ashamed folowe example christe doth become beyng companyons felowe lyke louinglye mynded one christe v case haue chalenged superioritie hym selfe case haue gredylye soughte hys owne gayne maye honestlye ynoughe stryue one wyth suche thynges veray god nature declared hym selfe god expresse dedes restored dead men vnto lyfe agayne becke altred elementes nature thynges maketh deuilles obedyent commaundement healeth kyndes dyseases wyth worde yet intente myghte set v example perfite modestie thoughte rauyne equall wyth god neuertheles humbled made hymselfe basse among men lokynge receyue glorye father entraunce wherunto example teacheth proude ambition lowe humilitie moste hyghest humbled selfe lowe neuerthelesse onelye conuersaunt man amonge men beyng payned lacke slepe suffryng thurste honger wearynesse pouertie daungiers iniuries condicion v also toke vpon hym shape seruaunte hurtefull seruaunte wheras innocencie selfe elles desertes hurtefull seruaunte taken bounden scourged whippes spytte vpon christe submitted hym selfe abyde thus muche onely also thoughe bene euell dooer humblye suffred punishement death mooste shamefull deathe crosse suche decreed wyll father christe shoulde suffre paynes oure offence shewed hymselfe wyllynglye obedyent thynges shrynkyng condition abyde euer auayleable saluation worldely affected mynde corruptelye prouoked vnto feyned boastyng selues throughe ambicion stryfe thoughe deserue prayse christian seketh true glorye neuer shall decaye muste preace vnto waye christe entred waye vnto true glorye false feyned slaunders entrie vnto immortall thirfte throughe losse transitorie thynges fade awaye moment behoueth stryue commendacion deserue commendacion heare christe deserued hys humilytie certes vsed arrogauntlye amonge men boaste hys maiestie time god father aduaunced sonne vnto mooste excellente hyghnesse throughe humilitie shame crosse exalted hym gaue name passeth glorye man reporte say name iesus spitte vpo crucified euery knee bowe make courtesie thynges earth al thinges also ether vnder ye earth heauens aboue yt kynd tongue either men aungelles deuilles shoulde confesse iesus prince lorde thynges sytteth god father ryghte hande equall possessor hys kyngdome glorye vnto glorye god father frome whome procedeth vnto redoundeth glory sonne mannes ambicion ryches kyngdome humayne diligence dyd euer wynne man excellente renoume men christes humilitie wonne vnto hym thynges sake owne neyther deserued brought lowe neded aduaunced hygher learne practise lyke humilitie asmuche without possyblye preserued texte wherfore dearely beloued ye haue alwayes obeyed whe preset much myne absence euen worke youre owne saluacyon wyth feare tremblyng god whiche worketh bothe also deede euen good wyl al thynge without murmuring dysputyng ye maye suche man complayne vnfained sonnes god without rebuke middes croked peruerse nation among see ye shyne lightes world holdyng fast worde lyfe maye reioyce daye christ haue tunne vayne neither haue laboured vayne yea though offred vp vpon offryng sacrifice faith reioyce reioyce wt cause also ye reioyce reioyce nowe therefore dearely beloued brother see goe forwarde also thys behalfe lyke youre selues styll euen lyke accordyng example christ haue alwayes obeied ghospel preached v loke styll herafter onely whan shalbe present much nowe absente shewe diligente endeuour one would haue bestowed vnto case ben present doe businesse youre saluation carelesly carefulnes tremblyng considre howe weyghtie cause muste take hande defende maner aduersaties muste haue doe oportunitie slepe careles agayne cause shoulde discouraged youre parte stycke possyble power god worketh thys habilitie perteynynge youre saluation maye bothe wyll doe thyng good purpose putteth mind ignoraunt vu ascribed yf put thyng mynde standeth hande circumspect behauiour commende doctrine ghospell expressely owne conuersacion euen straungers whiche thing shall doe case see lyue perfite concorde like trusly affiauce euer doe done without murmurynges puttyng doubtes one apperteyneth doe thynges agaynst theyr willes commeth theym haue none affiaunce doe rather syncerely vyryghte thynges pure vnspotted demeanour man hable iustlye complayne maye euindently appeare vnto al men veraye ryghte chyldren god bastardes vnlawfull chyldren perfitelye resemblyng youre heauenlye father youre heauenlye conuersacyon ordre youre lyfe myddes frewarde cruell corrupte nation youre syncere vpryghtenesse spotted condicion rather let youre innocencie lyfe shyne amonge darkenesse certayne lyghtes world set mennes eye whome christe speaketh ghospell sayeng lyghte worlde whiche holde vp lyuelye woorde ghospell euery bodye maye see expresse doctryne christe euen conuersacion assured trust coming christ shall also reioyce constaunt perseuerynge haue laboured vayne runne vnprofitablye rase ghospel haue wonne suche disciple vnto christe doo onely repente labour whereby haue offred moste acceptable sacrifice vnto god also incase selfe chaunce offred vpon oblacion sacrifice fayth shalbe gladly contente bothe youre behalfe myne owne youre behalfe haue conuerted vnto gospel offered acceptable sacrifice vnto christe myne owne behalfe hauing fynished suche sacrifice shall also offered vp together selfe lyke see well myne affliction chaunced vnto furtheraunce euen knowe deathe shall chaunce furtheraunce ghospell cause sake death shalbe euen hartely welcome yf conueniente shoulde equall parteners ioye oughte wise sorye death whiche shalbee pleasauntly welcome texte trust lorde iesus sende timotheus shortely vnto also maye good comforte know case ye stand haue man lyke minded pure affection care matter al seke thinges iesus christes ye know profe sonne father hath bestowed setuice gospel therfore hope send assone know wil go trust lorde also selfe shall come shortly nowe ye perceyue behalfe bounden glad state trust throughe grace lorde jesu see shortly tymotheus inasmuche come selfe yet therefore sende euen selfe intent lyke glad know state maye glad whan timotheus commeth hither agayne knowe state thought chieflye mete man sende vpon message seyng neuer one rest contenteth mynde wel ghospelles businesse bicause applyinge youre necessary wyll willinglye diligent faithful selfe must vnderstande haue iuste cause regarde hym myne owne sonne whose ministerye might better spar woulde sende neuer one throughly tried integritie rest almost seke sent suche message doo muche good vnto prouide owne gayne rather wynne vnto iesus christe knowe haue alwayes abhorted suche purposed intentes thynke necessarie shoulde prayse hym vnto bicause haue ready seen demeanour remembre afterwhat sorte behaued selfe wyth ghospelles affaire ryght sonne represent father thynges hym therefore truste sende soone see nde matter wyll growe truste thys grace lorde selfe shall also shortely come vnto texte supposed necessarie sende brother epaphroditus vnto companyon labour felowe souldier youre apostle whych also ministreth vnto nede longed full heuynesse ye hearde saye bene sicke doubte sicke somuche nye vnto death god mercye hym hym onelye also leste shoulde haue sorowe vpon sorowe sente hym therefore dylygently ye see hym ye maye reioyce agayne maye lesse sorowfull receynt hym therefore lorde wyth gladnesse make muche suche worke christ weute farre nye vnto deathe regarded lyfe fulfyll lackyng part towarde furthermore thoughte thys also veray requisite epaphroditus bothe brother companyon felowe souldier youre apostle shoulde beare tymotheus companye vnto entente myghte commendablye welcome vnto bothe sake youre owne also broughte vnto youre louyng charitie wherwith wonte releue nedes good goe muche desyrous come see wonderfully afrayed lest greued sore heare tell perylouslye sycke true hearde saye sooze sycke ieoperdye hys lyfe vearye lyke haue dyed god restored hym agayne compassyon vpon hys seruaunte vpon onelye also vpon ieoperdye whan ieoperdye leste vpon sorowe conceaued sickenesse haue double sorowe death faythfull felowsouldyour therfore diligent sende hym vnto specyally myghte glad see hym well amended agayne peraduenture beleue tale tolde sorowe maye wyped cleane oute mynde yf perceaue vnfeynedlye ioyous glad hys welfare receyue hym therefore louynge christian affection ioyfulnes haue hym price onely also lyke whan sente hym hyther onelye nothyng afrayed neroes crueltie whome knewe muche greued also ghospell christe put selfe suche haserde verye lyke haue died preferrynge doctrine ghospell owne healthe consideracion bycause beyng awaye thoughte dyd office lackyng youre parte toward meanes myghte maner presentlye broughte youre charitable token vnto hys ministeries serued daunger myghte one alone represente vnto p iii chapter texte p moreouer brother reioyce ye lorde greueth wryte one thing often sure thing beware dogges beware euyll worckers beware dissencion circumcision whiche serue god spirite reioyce christ iesu haue confidence flesshe though might also reioyce flesshe yf eny man thincketh hath wherof might trust flesshe haue beyng circumcised cyght daye kynred israell try beniamin hebrue borne hebrues concernyng lawe pharisaye concernyng feruentnes persecuted congregacion touchinge right wysnes lawe vnrebukeable thinges vauntage vnto counted losse christes sake yee thynke thinges losse excellencye knowledge christ iesu lorde whome haue counted thing losse iudge vyle maye wynne christe founde hauynge myne owne tyghtewesnes lawe thorow faith christ euen righte wesnes whiche commeth god thorowe faith maye knowe veriue resurreccion felowshyppe passion conformable vnto death yf eny meanes might attaine vnto resurreccion deed haue attained vnto already already perfect folowe yf maye comprehende wherin comprehended christ iesu brother counte selfe haue gotten yet one thing saye forget thinges whiche behynde endeuoure selfe vnto thinges whiche accordynge marke appoynted preace rewarde hye callynge god thorowe christ iesu let v therefore many perfect thus wyse mynded yf ye wyse mynded god shall open also vnto neuerthelesse vnto whiche haue attayned vnto let v proceade one rule maye one accorde brother remayneth moreouer whan knowe thinges doen hauing epaphroditus sent againe health maye reioyce neglectinge affliccions wherwith world hath turmoiled v may glad lord iesus christes busynesse goeth alwayes forwarde better better behalfe wherof muche afrayed ethnikes whiche impugne gospell openly halfe christian whiche preache christe suche wyse myngle iewes maner doctrine withall matter haue muche carke care oftentymes warned yet shall payne vnto put wryting maye sure almoost neuer ware ynoughe pestilent wycked shameles kynde alwayes lye wayte euery place haue enuye lybertye barke syncere doctrine depraue mennes lyuinges laboure gospelles busynesse howbeit none ende cortupte bragge foreskynnes circumcision whan inwarde mynde together vncircumcised beware brother begyle take hede dogges take hede naughtye worker beware vncircumcysed circumcision yea rather concision haue cause bragge selues though beare fylthy marke highe bragge wheras conscience vncleane wicked circumcision worthye boasting circumcised dede iewes dede ryghte child abraham worshyp god beastes bloude spirite woulde wourshypped boaste lytell skynne cut parte bodye yet moses christ iesus spirite hath cut awaye synnes soules hathe prynted harte excellente goodlye marke wherby maye manifestlye appeare sonnes god nowe glorious true circumcision god hence forthe estemeth man state bodye men neclecting care ye soule repose al whole trust fleshe wherin yf man maye boaste parte wyll geue place behalfe none haue quarell set naught circumcisio haue man stande owne coceite bicause circumcision maye bragge selfe greate deale lawfully circumcised eyght daye accordynge commaundement lawe israelite engraffynge kyndred straunge foundlyng iewe beynge borne iewes vncertayne kyndred special chiefe kynored beniamin whiche hath ben alwayes ioyned tribe iuda wherof kynges leuites priestes also ordayned wher many suppose selues israelite bycause descende kyndred concubine israel hebrewe hebrewes birthe sectes law pharisee whose ordre hathe alwayes highest dygnitie yf wyll esteme man studye obseruacion lawe haue also wherin preferte themselues regarded dyligent study lawe father earnestlye muche defence persecuted congregacion christ possyble meanes coulde entierlye obserued thinges lawe commaundeth nothinge wherin coulde iustlye founde withall transgressour yf geare deserued prerogatyue might iuster cause boast men woulde seme halfe goddes circumcised time dede forasmuch yet taught christ thought selfe iolye fortunate man aswell nobylitie kyndred dignitie secte also sitayte obseruyng law sone lea ned gospel christ thinges true righteousnesse cosisteth matter ferre greater excellecie wer signified figure shadowes moses lawe cast awaye renounced thinges haunted matter wonderous holynesse thought damage vnto soeuer hindred neuer litell doctrine christ condemne lawe yf man vse ought attribute muche vnto gospell christe lorde doo onely set lesse carnall lawe moses wherin men boast tha excellent knowledge christ also thinke losse soeuer world hathe excellent howe glittering shewe soeuer knowledge therefore sone begonne whitte taste aduauntage thing goodly euer esteme losse yea regarde rubbyshe rotten wall yf thinge vyle losse maye wynne christe fountayne good thinges truely good take myne owne ryghteousnesse nothing worthe obseruyng moses lawe ryghteousnesse thought among men haue ben muche auayleable maye atteyne vnto true righteousnes may call myne forasmuch gotten owne merites frelye geuen dystrust selues put whole cofydence symplye christ neuertheles springeth certaine ryghteousnes also lawe howbeit auaylable geue saluacion righteousnes whiche geuen god notwithstandynge geueth v true perfite saluacion case beleue gospel faith come knowledge iesus christ whose natiuitie wanderful vnderstanden mortall mannes wysedom whose resurrection power perswaded argumentes man onlye faith hable perswade vnto v hathe perswaded dede beyng establyshed hope promysses gladly content come vnto felowshyp affliccions bounden dye gospelles sake lyke beaten crucified v maye meanes chaunce vnto lyke folowe example hys death maye come glory resurrection beyng raysed vp moost certaine constaunt hope doeth comforte affliction bycause assuredly trust promysses christe hath promysed feloweshyp kyndome wyll shrynke felowshyp crosse nothwithstandyng ment speake thus though atteyne hyghe worthynesse come yet ende race haue yet wonne game matche yet together ende howbeit preace vnto vttermoste power maye atteyne thing pursue euery bodye wynneth game euer runneth preaceth lustily laboureth constauntlye good hope shall catche asmuche christ hath catched ende beyng pulled backe myddle race time past purposed wickedly congregacion might runne well race gospell wynne game immortalitie lest fall slouthe naughty securitie trustyng promised game brother doo thinke haue yet atteyned thinge goe hope atteyne weightye matter importaunce folowe lyghtlye atteyned man knowe christ true nature man frayle mutable wyll suffre yet careles wherefore meanes excellente greate hope set thinges syde goe one thing onely race gospel maye forget thinges behynde preace possible endeuour thinges afore howbeit rushe awaye awaye rashely care whither loseth game runneth naught bende selfe streyghte towardes pricke gospel set e e rewarde immortalitie wherunto god maister game lokyng heauen vpon endeuour calleth v helpe christ iesus therfore thing goe men myngle lawe gospel hyndre v race cause many v perfite let v affected mynde wee set nothinge v runne marke gospel yf amonge somwhat weaker vtterly contemne law father wherin haue ben nousled let borne withall vntyll waxe perfite also god hathe shewed vnto ayde lawe nothing necessarie peraduenture shall come passe wyll reuele also vnto texte p brother folowers together loke whiche walke euen ye haue v ensample many walke whome haue tolde often nowe tell wepynge enemyes crosse christe whose ende damnacion whose bellye god glory shame worldly minded conuersacion heauen whence lake sauiour euen lorde iesus christ whiche shall chaunge vyle body maye make lyke vnto glorious body accordyng workyng wherby able also subdue thinges vnto selfe whyle worlde let v goo styll race haue taken hande accordynge rule prescribed vnto v let v truely agree suffre oure selues drawne backe purpose let v make spedye haste euery man power atteine game immortalitie ther kepe race right good folowe rather folowe runne streyght gospelles game marke see treade forwarde example v christ hath set v best facion example whiche see preace place went vnto runne race wyune game therfore good folowing euery one runneth many whome haue oftentymes tolde tell againe wepyng teares preache christ sorte enemyes christes crosse wyll wyse folowe example lyfe deathe intent may euerlastinglye lyue owne lucre vayne gloryes sake stede true godlynesse teache iewyshe obseruations circumcision foreskynne choyse meates dyfference dayes intent men beyng burthened ware selues maye reigne lyue ease though lyfe loked none let ende fraye v awaye condicions lyke slaunderous reproche man drawe eternall glorye affliction world preace vnto immortall felicitie euen transitorye pleasure worlde procure selues euerlastyng destruction bycause stede god honour belye helpe countrefaicte vayne glorye among men whiche repose christe thinges ought ashamed make spede euerlastynge shame soeuer earthly temporall countrefayte euer heauenly true euerlastynge studye nothynge elles thinges earthe repose glorye set pleasure put theyr hope helpe runne astraye ferre marke gospell folowe christ aright though bodyes deteyned vpon earthe yet soule conuersacion heaue sighing continuallye thither head gonne afore whence also faythe loke lorde iesus christ whiche shall rayse v death delyuer v possession thinges promyseth v shall transforme vyle naughtye bodye make lyke vnto owne glorious bodye consyderacion membres wer felowes affliction worlde shoulde called felowshyp hys felicitye matter shall seme vncredible man wyll dyligentlye pondre great power shall doo dede nothinge brynge passe whose hande also subdue thinges himselfe owne pleasure power shall openlye shewe vnto al men although meane season doo many time kepe close iiii chapter texte p therfore brother dearly beloued longed ioye crowne continue lorde ye beloued praye euodias beseche sintiches ne accorde lorde yee beseche faythfull rockefelowe helpe wemen whiche laboured ghospell clement also labourfelowes whose name boke lyfe inasmuche therfore established hope great hyghe matter dearly beloued brother longed whose good successe repute myne owne ioye whose victorye take crowne lyke haue begonne see continue suffre selues drawe away fro iesus christ moreouer welbeloued brother eftesones beseche euodias desire sintiches eyther selues agree one true concorde myndes promotynge gospell christe also require myne owne true naturall wyfe whiche agreist trauayle gospel helpe woman partetakers labour daungers gospel clement also rest wet labourfelowes gospell whose name nedeth rehearse inasmuche wrytten boke lyfe shall neuer scraped boke name wrytten dilygences helpe forewarde businesse gospell whose nombre also texte p reioyce lorde alwaye againe saye reioyce let youre softenesse knowen vnto men lorde euen hande careful nothinge prayer supplycacion let youre pericyons manifest vnto god geuynge thanckes peace god whiche passeth vnderstandynge kepe hertes myndes thorow christ iesu cause sake reioyce alwayes euen myddes afflyctions againe eftesones saye reioyce good cheare hottely euer iniquitie wicked rage yet let youre patience modest softenes knowen seen vnto maner men vnto brother also straungers christe beyng prouoked rather good demenoure maye allured vnto felowshyp gospell gentilnesse behauioure wynneth breaketh vngodly couet wise reuenge yet enuy pleasaunt delytes commyng christ hande whiche shall rendre vnto ioyes immortalitie contemnyng commodity worlde shall suffre peynes owne fonde folyshenes lyue parte without care thinge care onely whan christe shall come maye fynde readyly prepared depende entierlye youre harte yf haue nede thinge truste helpe worlde call vpon god continuall supplicacions make moane feruent desire whan require thing geue thankes euer chaunceth prosperitie aduersite beynge certainlye assured wyll also turne aduersitie prosperitie knoweth well ynoughe profytable althoughe aske nothynge yet loueth called vpon suche manner intercession loueth entreated wer enforced godly besechinges peace wherby reconsyled vnto god beyng thing gracious efficacie mannes reason hable perceaue shall strengthen harte conscience terrouts possiblye happen worlde man afraied whiche knoweth god loueth dearly iesus christ therfore lyke woulde haue without care thinges wherwith worlde either flattereth maketh afrayed euen must applye selues diligent endeuours ware iche vertues whiche maye make acceptable god texte p furthermore brother whatsoeuer thinges true soeuer thinges hon whatsoeuer thinges iust soeuer thinges pure soeuer thinges co nyent soeuer thinges honeste reporte vertue prayse lernynge haue ye youre mynde whiche ye haue learned receaued hearde also sene thinges god peace shalbe reioyce lorde greatly nowe last youre reuyued againe wherin ye also carefull ye lacked oportunitie speake necessyte haue learned whatsoeuer estate therwith content lowe hye euery thinges instructed bothe full hongrye bothe haue plentye suffre neade thinges thorowe christ whiche strengthneth nothwithstandinge ye haue well done ye bare parte tribulacion consideracion wherof soeuer thinges true without countrefaicte soeuer honest comelye worthye deteste folyshe vyle trifle soeuer iuste soeuer pure holye soeuer comodious nouryshement concorde soeuer good reporte yf vertue yf prayse bea eth vertue companye let thinges delite studye care let thinges alwayes myndes saye suche lyke whiche lately learned receaued v hearde onely also seen haue taught haue done selfe dede loke therefore haue onely thinges remembraunce doo also dede accordinge see example v suche doo thus god authour peace wyll ready presente helpe concorde none folowers vertues briefe pleased mynde excedynglye accustummed louyng charitablenesse towardes whiche entermitted small space encreaced againe freshe euer towardes howbeit good wil slaked though louynge euer yet wanted oportunitie sende thinges woulde haue done wherefore glade muche myne owne commoditie louinge kyndenesse wherby reioyce made worthilye acceptable god moueth muche poore penurie releued good liberalitie vnacquainted vnskylled matter bycause haue ben greate deale practised learnyng suffre incommodities patientlye haue learned content presente fortune whatsoeuer poore basse amonge poore haue learned excede amonge riche yf want sparing yf haue plentye bestowe vse others playe lyberall geuer lacke surer wealth better felowe haue learned conforme selfe place tymes occasion framed taught abyd e fortune whether waye soeuer nether plentye corrupteth thoughe haue aboundaunce thinges honger throweth downe thoughe haue nothinge put belye nether wealth maketh highe whan haue inede want dyscourageth thoughe haue lesse necessarye lyue withal thinges greue stomake seyng passe vpon fetter whyppes gospelles sake neuer one suffre patientlye ynoughe without grefe stomacke beyng confirmed strengthened iesus christe throughe whose ayde stronge wheras selfe nothing neuerthelesse meane wordes thoughe set stoore kynde lyberalitie excedyngly commende godlynesse haue planted selues felowshyp myne afflicitions whiche god shal also make partaker rewardes certes take vndesyred readynesse good wyll thankefull parte vsed demaunde dueties mannes hande texte p ye philippos knowe also begynnynge gospel departed macedonia congregacio bare parte concernynge geuynge receauynge ye onely thessalonica ye sent afterwarde vnto necessite desire gyftes desyre aboundaunt fru e parte neuertheles receaued haue plenty euen fylled receaued epaphroditus thinges whiche sente odoure swete smell sacrifice accepted pleasaunt ged god shall supplye neade thorowe y glorious tyche iesu christ unto god father prayse euermore amen salute sainetes christ iesu brother whiche grete sain e salute moost whiche emperours housholde grace lorde iesu christ amen philippos witness selues whan fyrst preached gospel christ countreis departed macedonia congregacion communicate vnto meane concernyng matter geuyng receauyng neyther gaue thing loked receaue thing onely gaue owne free mocions aswell whan also whan thessalonica sent myne absence afterwarde againe thinges thought necessarye thessalonian welthyer tha great deale kinder harted fynde faulte reioyce good forewardenes glad rather auauntage myne verely wynneth great gayne christes gospelles sake diminysheth stocke worldely substaunce exchaungeth transitorie rich true rich neuer shall decaye doe require gyftes requyre fruyte apperteigneth vnto prompte vndesired lyberal geuyng somwhat decreased money reckenynges somwhat abated stocke householdes great encreace heauenly rewardes maye surely reckon vpon thouchinge parte nede sorye thoughe frendely liberalitie acceptable vnto haue receaued euery thing afloate lyberall sendyng fullye refreshed thinges epaphroditus brought sente muche howbeit receaued gyft sent men man mooste thankeful oblacion god vnto whome smell sacrifice acceptable wyllynge ministracion gospellyke charitie done vndesired fynallye lyke passe owne habilitie wante nothing euen parte beseche god fulfyll vnto euer wante lyfe asmuche aboundauntlye tyche wyll suffre thinge shall wante vnto necessarye v whiche waxe poore gospelles sake perteyneth glorye christe therfore glorye god father euerlastynglye worlde without ende amen salute accordyng doctrine iesus christe leade godly vpright cleane lyfe christian brother rome commende hartelye vnto onely famyliatly conuersaunt rest also especially emperours housholde haue embraced doctrine christe afrayed professe christe aging lorde maister cruell gracious sauour goodnesse lorde iesus christ alwayes spirite amen ende paraphrase vpon epistle paule philippian argument epistle sainct paule colossian de erasmus roterodame colossian people alia lesse dwellyng nigh vnto laodicians apostle paul selfe seen whiche instructed fayth christ either preachyng archippus ambrose sayth epaphras matter put trust great leopardy people reason false apostle whiche labored bryng pestilent opinion teachyng sonne god meane author saluacion al menne haue accesse entrie vnto father healpe angel men sayd forasmuche tyme olde testament thynges done ministery seruice angel christ sonne god neither comen doune yearth would come beside teacher christes doctrine myngled iewishnes supersticious philosophie obseruyng kepyng certain pointes lawe supersticiously also honouryng sunne moone starres suche smal trinkettes worlde bearyng colossian hand wer also bound biddeth paule remembre theyr profession euidently declaryng whatsoeuer vntil tyme obtained geuen vnto none angel christ creator angel onely head churche saluacion shuld nomans hand sought whiche treatise also defendeth owne authoritie suche laboured empayre whiche geueth diligent warnyng take hede lest deceiued high wordes false apostle forged vision angel meane therof fall either iewishnes el thesupersticion philosophie whiche pointes paule two fyrst chapiter entreateth two exhorteth vertuous godly liuyng namely geuyng rule wife vse selfe towarde husband husband againe vse wife sorte father towarde child child likewyse towarde theyr father seruau te theyr maisters maisters theyr seruautes last partsauyng warneth archippus duetie spent commendacions epistle written prison ephesus sent tychicus paule selfe present epistle saieth latine argumentes shewe also sent thither onesimus selfe writeth also last chapiter greke title recorde sent cytie rome deede thence sent onesimus paule beyng prisoner made christian man paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle apostle sainct paule colossian fyrst chapiter texte paule apostle iesu christ wyll god brother timotheus al saintes whiche colossa brother beleue christ paule ambassadour iesus christ man ordinaunce wyll god father timothe perfite consent preachyng gospel coumpt brother dweller colossa whiche haue confidence iesus christ also accordyng doctrine liue holy life nowe like kynde profession becomen dearely beloued brother texte grace vnto peace god father lorde iesu christ grace peace among god father ye freely reconciled vnto ye may likewyse euen brother haue one comen father one towarde alwaye norishe mutual vnitie concorde texte geue thankes god father lorde iesus christ alwayes praiers haue heard fayth christ iesu loue whiche ye beare saintes hope sake whiche layd vppe store heauen whiche hope ye heard true worde gospel whiche come vnto euen fruiteful groweth also among fro day whiche ye heard experience grace god trueth ye lerned epaphra deare felowe seruaunt whiche faythful minister christ whiche also declared vnto v loue whiche ye haue spirite albeit hath yet hitherto chaunce see yet continual praiers made god father oure lorde iesus christ sake geue thakes benefites bestowed vpon desyre also dayly encrease giftes also preserue epaphra heard fayth wherbywe haue heard fayth christ iesu c trust ye shalbe saued helpe angel free bouteousnes sauiour anoynted hath pleased god father geue v al goodnes annoynted would haue called al shuld receiue helth sauiour elswhere looke saluacion onely perceiued vnderstode cofidence also charitie ioyned ther whiche christ gaue example ye beare towarde good people earnestly mindyng hoope auauntage ye thinke receiue therby hope euerlasting life whiche ye wel knowe layde vp heauen godlynes suerly ito trustof whiche hope ye heard true worde gospel ye broughte throughe preachyng christes gospell whiche ye persuade selfe doctrin suche trueth albeit make great promise suche neuer heard tyme yet forsomuch god author ye thinke cannot true gospel throughout worlde hath dayly enlarged come euery day growyng encreasyng plentifully spreadyng self abroade bringyng foorth fruite good workes whiche freely growe christian charitie hath done growyng styl better better euen synce tyme wherin ye fyrst heard knewe free goodnes god synnes forgeuen whiche beleue gospel theyr right fayth adioyne pure vnfained charitie ye taught dearely beloued felow seruice messenger trust epaphras hath among sincerely done myne office suche sorte iesus christes behalfe preachyng gospel hath pointes found without corrupcion therfore taughtwhiche also declared vnto v loue ye haue spirite againe vnderstand good wyll againe towarde v meanyng suche vsuall good wyll men wishe well theyr frendes acquaintaunce spiritual heauenly fauor wherwith vse loue suche glorye gospel set foorth stablished though bodily iyen neuer sawe texte cause also euer synce day heard haue ceased praye desyre ye might fulfilled knowledge wisedome spiritual vnderstandyng ye might walke worthy lorde al thinges ye may please beyng fruitful al good workes encreasyng knowledge god strengthed might glorious power vnto al pacience long sufferyng ioyfulnes geuyng thankes vnto father hath made v meete partaker inheritauce saintes light whiche hath deliuered v power darkenes hath translated v vnto kyngdome deare sonne haue redempcion bloud euen forgeuenes sinnes whiche image inuisible god fyrst begotten al creature wer thinges created heauen yearth visible inuisible whether maiestie lordship either rule power thinges created thinges thinges haue beyng cause againe one vnworthy fauor heartely loue againe though neuer sawe euen fro day wherin fyrst certifyed fayth charitie dayly prayer callyng vpon god feruent peticions besechyng may please make perfite bryng full suche giftes hath begunne geue ye bothe may moreye might fulfilled knowledge c throughly knowe pleasure beyng taught neither worldely wisedom yet supersticious vaine persuasion men spiritual wisedome policie wherof yehaue already gotten good part would wishe ye lacked nothyng ye may godly perfeccion passe ouer life god honor al pointes also please lettyng good thing vndone doyng meane please geue onely credence gospel beginnyng saluacion godly holye workes made perfite full suffiseth haue learned preachyng gospel god sonne iesus christ author worker saluacion vnlesse knowledge ye growe vppe bring foorth fruites christian charitie continually profityng better better surely constantly manfully standyng neither violence storme persecucion driue right course whose perfourmauce surely ye nede great assistence strength strengthstrengthed al might glorious power c oure owne power cannot assure selfes god whiche must geue ende whole glory suche thinges v valiauntly done may geuen againe vnto whiche goodnes enrycheth v great pacience long sufferyng endure abyde christes gospelles sake suche trouble may meane tyme befal v whiche persecucions suffering inough strong without feare rather besemeth v euen ioyfully good courage vndertake suffer geuyng thankes god father hath vouchesaued call suche honour wheras heretofore ye worshipped deuils idol ye goodnes called vnto felowshippe iewes whiche reason worshipped true god comparison holy whiche hath also vouchsaued cal enheritaunce life euerlastyng hope wherof al thinges whiche world either feare flatter v must despised bothwhiche hath made v mete partaker inheritaunce sainctes light hath geuen wanderyng deepe doungeon ignoraunce light gospel also ye whiche heretofore vnder vile stauishe bondage subiecte vnto tyranny deuil prince darkenes deliuered thence conueighed kyngdome derely beloued sonne thentent ye beyng ioyned body enioy one kingdome wherin suche thral synne haue place therfore hath god sonne made v free sinnes olde life forgeue ye becomen whose benefite mercy ye restored consider good chaunge ye haue made reconciliacion ye membres deuil ye planted christes body whose dignitie great image god father whiche father dwelleth light whervnto man come whiche suche seen man though certaine sorte sonne seen whiche father pointes verye like equal neither sonne lesse wyse lesse might lesse goodnes father late day receiued perfeccions euerlastyngly thyng made image euerlastyng father made borne thynges made whiche onely hath beginnyng therfore selfe begotte sonne sonne withfor thinges created sonne made create al either heauen yearth may seen seen verye angel selfe excepted chiefe whither maiesties lordshippes rule power albeit order power farre excede creature yet passing measure vnder ye ioyned forasmuche whatsoeuer made must maker nedes inferior al thinges onely made christ also gouerned preserued whiche pointe also father like equal sonne begotten creature al thinges al thinges haue theyr beyng without perishe mainteined thus see ye excellencie preeminence christ whiche thing tel lest manne angel thinke texte head body euen congregacion beginnyng first begotten dead thinges might haue preeminence lest perauenture glorious excellent maiestie feare away aspire comevnto fauor god father ye thinke necessarie seeke vpon meane heare againe learne knowe good christ suche sorte chiefe ruler lorde angel sayd nethelesse vouchesaueth also head churche hath ioyned vnto cleaueth coupled vnto euen natural body cleaueth vnto head whatsoeuer therfore alreadye done heade must v comen fyrst rose againe death intent wouldhe beg nnyng first begotten dead c immortall onely selfe ende might enhaunce v membres felowship immortal life loke fyrst fruites grayne offered generally whole heape dede prince author resurreccion shall also rise againe among thynges create chiefe suche sorte yet create made testoryng creature chiefe beyng byrth bounde vnto goodnes oure seconde byrthe baptisme liue euerlastyngly muche beholdyng vnto texte pleased father fulnes dwell reconcile al thinges vnto selfe set peace bloud crosse thinges heauen thinges yearth hath pleased father sonne fulnes godly power goodnes replenished shuld abidethat fulnes dwell c dwel nede borowe thyng synce father neither wyll thing sonne syth father pleasure besemeth v curiously demaunde serche fynce best whatsoeuer wysedome hath decreed wyse say god father thought beste bothe oure weale saluacion owne glory reconcile al thinges vnto ministerie angel owne sonne whiche bloud sheddyng tourmentyng vpon crosse abolishe synne whiche broke peace concorde betwixte heauenly yearthly creature set thinges peace bothe heauenly yerthly makyng christ agre together vnitie one texte whiche sometyme farre enemy myndes set euil workes hath yet reconciled body fleshe death make holy vnblameable without fault owne sight ye continue grou ded stablished fayth moued awaye hoope gospel wherof ye haue heard preached among creature whiche vnder heauen wherof paule made minister numbre reconciled ye becomen ye saye whiche yeres past suche sorte straungers god steede ye worshipped image deuils wilfully dissentyng also vsing selfes cruel aduersaries hath yet selfe reconciled beyng suche neither loked much muche lesse deserued made enemy frendes sonnes ministery aungels bodily death onely begotten sonne purpose pleasure shuld take mortal fleshe vpon betwixte god synners peace hath pleased frely forgeue al offence former li e thentent would sight make holy vnblameable faultles pray lay olde debtes charge cotented surely cotented wyl vpo fre receiuyng vnto fayth gospel ye continually abide profession leanyng vpon sure sounde foundacion selfes stedfast stable neither man angel able moue fro christ ye must hope receiue suche giftes gospel promiseth whet vnto ye gaue credence whiche hath onely preached vnto also nacions contained vnder heauen unstedfastnes fal away fro whiche ye haue allowed impudent shameles point reken coumpte thing vaine belief wherof al worlde agreeth finally flit whose preacher minister paule whiche would leaue forgoe inf e owne countreys law chaunge gospel christ fully persuaded geare heauenly commeth fro god texte ioy sufftynges fulfil whiche behynd passion christ fleshe body sake cogregacion wherof made minister accordyng ordinaunce god ordinaunce geuen vnto warde fulfil worde god ministerie whiche hath hid synce world begunne synce beginnyng generacions opened saiutes god would make knowen glorious rich misterie among gentile rich christ hope glory preache war yng men teachyng men al wysedome make men perfite christ jesu wherin also labor striue eue farfourth streugth worketh mightely throughly persuaded gospel thyng trueth onely farre beyng ashamed repentyng selfe therof wyll also ioyfully suffre coumpte stripe emprisonment chaynes euen matier reioyse glorie tormentynges inow ioye suff riges c endure offence myne suffer weale saye though iewes neuer muche saye naye haue lesse righte benefite gospell haue iewes themselues saye weale suffer christ suffered apostle lothe whiche christ prince maister disdayned christ suffered v onelye owne body also maner suffereth oures eue one supplying fulfilling minister suche thynges mighte affliccions seeme vnperfecte death selfe insufficient affliccions punishmentes head member prince minister maner one punishmetes greater vehemente redounde make fulnes perfeccion saluacion saluacio onely weale also christes whole body whiche churche office committed vnto committed cure ouer sight congregacion christe hath set placed stede hath deliueredfor body sake whiche congregacio vnto custody owne bodye specially porcion whiche gentile receyued gospell intente wt labour supply whiche semed lacke publyshe many hundred yeares tyme hidden gentile teache iewes getiles also haue fayth entry welthy state gospel god long since purposed yet purpose hidden vntill tyme worlde nowe preachyng opened suche forsakyng theyr former vngraciouse lyfe embrace doctrine christ whome hath pleased god declare howe glorious ryches towarde v publyshing long hidden misterie whole worlde perceyueth howe free saluacion whiche men firste thoughte offered onely iewes nowe commen vnto al nacions kepyng moses lawe requyred fayth onelye men doubte promise made gospell stede suche thynges wherin iewes haue foolyshe confidence christ onely sufficient ye haue cause sorye hope ye stande beyng sure ynough also hym glorious whowhome preache warnyns men teaching c hymselfe wyll vndoubtedly perfourme muche hath promised hym preache moses aungels aduertisyng teaching onely iewes also people world doong leauyng nothyng vntouched appertayneth wisdome gospell intent men vnderstand whither circumcised circumcised theyr weale nothyng el set christ iesus bryng whiche fayth mennes myndes suche sorte labour auauncing therof thynke paynfull put selfe many ieopardies perilles dede weightie weakenes able abyde suffer strong mightie whose ayde mayntenaunce actes also whe nede requireth working myracles v bryngeth preaching eredence ii chapiter texte woulde ye knewe howe great care haue laodicia many haue sene person fleshe theyr hertes myght comforted knyt together loue al rich full vnderstanding knowe misterie god father christe whome hydde treasure wysedome knowledge muche haue sayde ye colossian boste self vnto couete ye knowe howe carefull ieopardies put selfe suche haue presently taught gospell vnto also whiche syghte know especially laodicians thoughe neuer sawe bodely iyen yet see co tinuallye iyen hearte glad encrease furtheraunce fearful espye entiernes godly condicions either ieoperdie inconstant wauer selfe greatly anaylable suche neuer sawe know labour paynes take dothe auauntage mythat theyr hertes might comforted c pensyfenes ieopardies affliccions pricked furth enforced consent cleaue together godly charitie lyke member one body knyt surely mortised wherby also menne clearely perceyue certaynely beleue bountifull goodnes god father toward mankynde yea toward al creature aboundatly flowyng abrode openyng nowe throughe iesus christe secrete misterie hath hitherto bene hidden whiche besyde hym onely desyre worldly wysdome neuer great wyse philosopher promisen teacher moses lawe anye suche boste speakyng aungels taughte forasmuche hym alone contayned hydden treasure wysedome fruytful knowledge fountayne maye easly drawe asmuche perfite saluacion requyred texte saye lesse man beguyle entising wordes thoughe absent fleshe yet spirite ioying beholding youre order stedfast fayth christe poyntes ende thought good warne ye diligence take hede least beyng instruct worldly wysdome agaynst playnes christes gospel blynde deceyue false tale beyng yet suche tale haue colourable apparence trouth lykelynes wyse men world wt cap touse subtile reason theyr inuencion wont entangle simple people whiche sorte know among watching maye corrupte fayth albeit absent see presentlye donethoughe absente fleshe c yet mynde among present herte reioysyng see good order condicion lyfe therwith soundnes strength sure confidence whiche ye haue iesus christe whome ye haue wholy commytted selues texte ye haue therfore receyued christ iesu lord euen walkeye hym ye roted buylte hym stablyshed faythe ye haue learned therin plenteous geuyng thankes nowe remayneth ye vpon good beginnyug continue profit ye haue receyued beleued iesus christe lorde goodnes head welspring felicitie set lyfe agree consent fayth profession prouiding alwayes ye baptisme graffed ye lyke wyse abide hym gather strength sure strong foundacion doctrine christes gospell alredy layed labour ye buylde vp ther vpon suche worke suche foundacion mete conuenient take hede ye wauer waye waye euery blaste newe doctrine moueth stade stedfast stable ye haue learned endeuour stande stedfastly also encrease euery daye better better fayth fruites godly lyfe beyng dayly augmented ye maye alwayes haue newe thing gyue god thankes ye must dede thanke well done texte beware lest man sporle philosophy disceitfull vanitie tradicion men ordinaunces worlde christe suche would bring fro simplicitie watche busely watche muste ye syde lykewyse least beyng enchauntedand disceitfull van tie tradicion c royall glyttering appacences theyr phylosophie ye ro sound fayth altred brought vayne deuties men become spoyle praye aduersaries ye shall vn doubtedly ye turne truth gospell beled rule mennes onlye makyng whiche stande suche thinges maye carnal eye sene grosse pointes world wher christes doctrine heauenly spirituall teacheth righte trewe religion whiche standeth myndes meates drinkes bodily apparell keping dayes yet wasshyng handes whiche thynges trewe religion make nothing suche pointes withdraw v rather fro christe deuide v fro welspring whence mete sought grace goodnes texte hym dwelleth fulnes godhead bodely ye complete whiche head rule power whome also ye circumcised circumcision whiche done handes asmuche ye haue put synfull bodye fleshe circumcision christ ye buried hym baptisme whome ye also tysen agayne fayth wrought operacion god whiche raysed hym death hym certayne giftes deriued oute ryuerin dwelleth fulnes godhead bodelye c litle water runneth dyche hym resteth dwelleth corporally hole fulnes godhead yf ye haue hym ye nede seke either shadowes moses lawe subtile conueyaunce worldly wisdome trouth playnly delyuered v al ou sences beare recorde nede haue seke figure doubtfull promise synce ye graffed christe framed one bodye hym shoulde elswher loke haue thyng since lacketh nothyng would haue treasure comen al men hym hym needes must ye made complet whither ye lacke wysdome power welspring wysedome neuer dryed vp heade power rule ther power hyghest order aungels say hym boweth knee iewes paradueture endeuoure bring minde weightye matier haue circumcised though state mannes body suche externe thinges brought v goddes fauour rather persuaded whosoeuer haue christ enioye hym glorie commendacion circumcision haue christe theyr circumcision vayne vnprofitable haue shadow circumcision ye therof soules haue verye truthe sythe iewes circumcision meaneth groce carnall desyers cut al theyr soules loke nothyng heauenly thinges vncircumcised needes must whiche couetous myndes styll labour haue please bealyes whiche wt enuy malice pyne way vayngloriously seke worldly prayse despayre heauenly rewardes ye contrarie christ veryly circumcised circumcisio done mannes handes spirituall kynde circumcision haue ye litle piece onlye carnall man pared awaye cut whole bodye defyled syn corrupted carnal lustes spirituall circumcision christ iesus dying forsoke bodye subiect death rysyng againe receyued body whiche coulde dye ye baptisme throughe spirite god hym spiritually dead castyng synnes olde lyfe deade hym also buried hym whe synfull desyers kylled perfite quyetnes mynde foloweth suche forgoyng bodyes thral sinne whiche sinne isin ye also r se fayth death soule ye christe hym risen agayne free synne desertes ye stedfastly beleue god mightie power restored christe agayne death lyfe also power worketh vpon free remissio sinnes death sone ye shoulde hencefurthe liue subiect sin innocent vprighte life make haste forwarde life shall neuer haue ende thakes god father haue suche thinges whiche sone gyueth nothing auauntaged iewes circumcised vncircumcision gentile hinderauce vncircumcised therfore deadly lacke ye wer wholy gyuen groce wycked desyres therby subiecte death rather ye without grace god lyfe mannes soule ye spiritually deade texte ye ye dead synne vncircumcision youre fleshe hathe q ickened hym hath forgyuen v oure trespaces hath put hande wrytyng agaynst v contayned lawe wryten hathe taken oute waye hath fastened crosse hath spoyled rule power hath made shewe openly hath triumphed ouer owne persone kynde vncircumcision saye sortes v comen whiche god hath holy spirite cutte taken away forgeuing v oure synnes suche sorte forgyuyng oute ieopardie hauyng offence hereafter layed vnto oure charge haue aduisedly sworne obediet moses lawe breache wherof oure aduersary deuyll myght haue action agaynste v agaynst men bounden theyr owne hande wrytingand hath ut h n wry ing aga v c yea olde obligacion ryght wherof deuyll sued v hath christe rased oute assone professed fayth gospell whome offence olde lyfe forgyuen layed mannes charge whatsoeuer myght v ryghte wrytyng requyred hath christe sake payed vpon crosse wrytyng rente torne vtterly cancelled haue nowe anye cause feare tyrannye satan synce christe hath crosse death vanquyshed authour death thereby deliuered v triumphantly subduyng power rule deuylles carying v heauenlye kyngdome thoughe bene ryche price botye declared freely playnly ouerco men vnhar ysed sight bothe men aungels caryed v triumphe shewyng enemyes subdued put lyght ayde aungels men owne myghty power tyme vpon crosse hanged vp royall sygne victorye suche hyghe place whereas euery manne might see onely take hede poynt ye fall youre olde synnes texte let man therfore trouble youre conscience meate drynke piece holy daye newe moone sabboth dayes shadowes thinges come bodye christ feare least disp syng ceremony moses lawe man condempne either meate drynke cleane vncleane puttyng difference betwixt holye daye workyng daye kepyng holy feaste newe moone breakyng reste sabboth daye thiese obseruaunces shadowes long signifieng rudely purtrahing thynges shoulde afterwarde vnfaynedlywhiche shadowes thynges come c exhibite christe wherfore synce haue nowe bodye selfe since haue trouth selfe openly shewed vnto v longer feare shadowes whoso cleaueth christe beyng heauen regardeth nothyng el heauenly thinges walketh furth euen ryght pathwaye rewarde immortall lyfe texte let man make shote wrong marke humblenes holynes aungels thynges whiche neuer saw beyng causeles puft vp fleshly mynd holdeth head whereof body ioyntes couple receyueth nouryshement knyt together encreaseth encrasyng commeth fro god beware therfore lest man callyng backe agayn earthly thynges fa sleyghtly deceyue reward ye haue already begon labour stede heauenly doctrine teachyng small matter stede christes true religion supersticious worshyppyng aungels auaunce exalte hymselfe among simple people certayne fayned vision beyng desyrous worldly gloryein thynges neuer sawe teachyng people suche thynges learned aungels whiche hath owne head hymselfe forged imagened withoute sure truste comparison besemeth euery christian despise al thynges neuer hygh meane season trustyng vpo aungels falleth christe heauenly head whome dependeth whole bodye churche whiche spirituall giftes deriued euery member ioyntes couplynges nouryshed encreased vnto hyghest perfeccion spiritual vnto suche perfeccion besemeth god haue whome christ ioyned coupled texte wherfore yf ye dead christe ordinaunces worlde though ye yet lyued worlde ye led tradicions touche taste ha dle whiche peryshe verye abuse commaundementes doctrine men whiche thynges outwardly haue similitude wisedome supersticion humblenes mynde hurtyng bodye fleshe worshyp vnto neede therof christe visible groce worlde dead lyue nowe heauen ye kynde lyfe lykewyse hym deade vsuages worlde hauyng eye nothyng heauenlye thinges wherto maketh subiect mannes ordinaunces beyng suche prescrybe suche thynges sauer christe groce carnall ordinaunces ye worlde though ye nowe deade suche thinges styll lyued worldlye gyue eare iew prescribyng suche thynges obserued accordyng carnall meanyng moses lawe touche carkas cleane taste meattouche taste ha dle whiche c cleane touche thing holy may lawfully touched secular person ready ye gyue eare vnto tradicios doctrine men whiche labour bryng mynde difference meates obseruyng dayes iewyshe rule godly religion standeth though christes doctrine sufficient meate drynke apparell bryng v goddes fauour bodely nedes vsed long longe abuse weare away stedfast perfeccions soules cannot spet yet suche teache suche doctrine amog fooles vnlearned preted fayned colour wysdome muche supersticion faultie humilitie fyl menes myndes muche made plaine supersticion make angel equal christ faultie humblenes angel loke whiche shuld christ selfe asked lestwyse christ father meates drinkes suche visible thinges geuen compelled hurt body abstaine ende bodyes may holpen kynde apparel wynde wether mainteined succoured ed kynde meates al tymes place without difference whansoeuer muche tyme shalbe thought nedeful iewes whose heartes yet circumcised fro grosse carnal meanyng lawe whiche put suche difference iii chapiter texte ye risen againe christ seke thinges whiche aboue christ sitteth right hande god set affeccion heauenly thinges yearthly thinges base lowe thinges vnbesemyng true mebres christ ye worldly affayres verely dead risen againe christ desyre high euerlastyng treasure commodity sette naught suche vile matter seeke heauely pleasure thinges aboue christ head sitteth right hand god father mete al studyes care membres directed place wheras head present shall head hereafter reigne euer liueth euery man loueth texte ye dead life hid christ god whensoeuer christ whiche life shal shewe selfe shal ye also appeare glory world ye seme dead whiche neither delited worldly wealth yet regarde suche phatalies wherwith worldly people delited wherfore ye liue among men yet liue ye christ god though meane season iudgement world life hidden whattyme christ shall come againe shewe glory glory body worlde shall men see head partaker glory texte mortifie therfore yearthly membres fornicacion vncleanes vnnatural lust euil concupiscence couetousnes whiche worshippyng idol whiche thinges sake wrath god vseth come child vnbelief among ye walked sometyme ye liued put ye also away fro al thinges wrath fiersnes maliciousnes cursed speakyng filthy communicacion mouth meane season diligently endeuour body like vnto high heauenly head whose mebres dye vtterly carnal desyres cannot heauen liue christ deuil hath also body whiche el called body synne membres fornicacion whiche among worldly people eue praised vnclennes vnnatural luste suche desyres filthy mete named desyre hurtful thinges glorye honour vengeance especially desyre money synne among al nighest draweth outragious wickednes worshippyngand uetonsnes whiche worshippyng idol idol sinnes whosoeuer subiecte cannot partaker glory christ farre beyng true child god whiche suche outragious vice corrupted like fiersely raged euen vpon owne people iewes destroiyng disenherityng disobedient child suche like horrible vice life also corrupted tyme ye yet baptisme dead christ liued frowarde desyres led synce christ hath lefte nothyng mortal yearthly meete synce ye borne againe ye cast away filthynes olde former life onely cast away suche great enormity spoke also suche thinges wherin comen sorte wont beare selfes wrath fyersenes maliciousnes cursed speakyng ye onely haue heartes pure suche desyres also mouth cleane fro al filthy communicacion texte lye one seyng ye haue put old man workes haue put newe man whiche renued knowledge image made neither gentile iewe circumcision vncircumcision barbarus sithian bonde free christ thing christ trueth selfe mete ye beyng membres lye one briefe synce ye haue put christ put old yearthly man al workes desyres put new whiche wyl neuer olde reason knowledge god dayly encreaseth florisheth buddeth vpand image made h better greater image christ beyng new selfe builded v new man extinguishyng olde many v planted christes bodye farre gone though newe made againe somuche difference betwixt gentile iewe betwixte circumcised vncircumcised betwixte wylde scithian grecian man athens yet betwixt free bonde among menne suche difference passed vpon god suche thynges regarde christ whiche indifferently comen onely geueth al thinges al men christ ye bondman fredome poore man ryches wylde barbarous ciuilitie vncircumcised circumcision briefe among thinges made equal none disdaine texte therfore clecte god holy beloued put tender mercy kyndnes humblenes minde mekenes long sufferyng bearyng one forgeuyng one haue quarel christ forgaue euen ye wherfore instede vile membres vnbesemyng christ put membres contrary filthy membres rehersed instede putte suche mete god hath chosen holy vouchsaued loue membres wyl say without doubt suche christ selfe taught put execucion say tender mercy ye readynes help weakenes kyndnes ye comen couersacion life tractable humblenes mynd lest ye arrogantly auaunce selfe mekenes lest ye vpon offender vse crueltie long sufferyng leste ye hasty reuenge beare eche one eche forgeue mannes infirmitie thyng among reason wherof one might haue quarel againe besemeth forgeue eche others offence synce christ offended man forgaue v trespaces texte aboue thinges putte loue whiche bonde perfitenes peace god rule heartes whiche peace ye called one body aboue garmentes especially apparel selfes christian charitie farre hurtyng man laboreth euery man good yea good euil perfite sure bonde wherwith body christ ioyned together membres abide fast whiche would el fal sonder charitie wyl folow peace concorde comen peace whiche men speake suche made mainteined mightie power christ stedfastly let alway heartes wynne haue vpper hande let malice pride wrath contencion haue victory god hath called concorde hath purpose reconciled vnto made one body entent ye like membres one body among selfes one mynde texte see ye thankeful let worde christ dwel plenteously al wisedome teache exhorte owne selues psalmes hymnes spiritual songes syngyng grace heartes lorde vnthankeful forgetful goddes great goodnes toward haue peace freely forgeuen v sinnes doeth one brother forgettyng make battel againe brother lytle displeasure striue among selfe preeminence worldly wysedome let worde christ whiche teacheth thinges belongyng perfite godlynes dwel continue pletifully ye sauer growe wise selfe knowe christ acceptable also able one teache way geue warnyng dutie slacke meane season tyme mery ioyful hope bl sse come geuyng praise god psalmes hymnes spiritual songes praisyng god mouth onely also speacially heart suche songes god delited lest thinke great praise god onely mouth make noyse texte whatsoeuer ye worde dede name lord iesu geuyng thankes god father fynally whatsoeuer ye either worde dede make glory lorde iesus life conuersacion sauer expresse resemble whyles ye wyse doyng thing befal whether prosperouse wyse ther either proude dismayed geue thankes god father sonne turneth suche chaunces oure weale auauntage texte ye wyues submitte selues owne husbandes comly lorde ye husbandes loue wyues bitter vnto ye child obey father mother thinges well pleasyng vnto lorde ye wyues submitte selues obediently vnto husbandes besemeth suche haue taken vpo christes name mete goodnes go beyond ye husbandes againe loue wyues ye must remembre suche condicion subiecte vnto yet ye sharpe bitter ye child thinges obedient father mother though commaunde paineful busines vngodly christes wyll pleasure ye texte ye father prouoke child get lest desperate mynde ye seruauntes obedient vnto bodily maisters thinges iye seruice men pleaser singlenes heart fearyng god whatsoeuer ye heartely though ye lorde vnto men knowyng lorde ye shal receiue rewarde inheritauce ye serue lord christ againe ye father abuse authoritie vpon child prouoke cruelnes dispayre ye seruauntes pointes obeye maisters lawe man ye bounde serue onely see loke vpon feare comen sorte heathen seruauntes wonte thinkyng haue done theyr dueties offende theyr master veyng also simple vnfamed heart doyng duetie feare man also feare god seeth mynde ye whatsoeuer ye consider seruice master beyng man deserueth seruice soeuer ye vnto kynde one soeuer coumpte done christ men assuryng selfe ye shall receiue rewarde heauenly inheritaunce though vnkynde maister geue nothyng labor accoumpte among child while ye christes sake seruice vnmete maisters ye serue christ texte doeth synne shal receiue sinne neither respecte person god maister yf seruaut thing offende though among men punyshed shall yet god escape punishment seruaunt well doth duetie albeit haue rewarde men whiche themselues thynke theyr seruauntes nothyng bound haue done theyr dueties yet shal loose theyr rewarde god hand putteth differece betwixte persos betwixt myndes cosidereth mannes condicion wel doth iiii chapiter texte maisters vnto seruauntes whiche iuste equall knowyng ye also haue maister heauen agayne ye maisters abuse authoritie gyuen mennes lawes perfeccion nature exercise tyranny vpo seruauntes gyue iust lawfull departyng sufficiently suche thynges naturall v necessarye make pleasure muche intollerablye oppressing assuring selues ye rather felowes seruice tha maisters asmuche ye haue one commen maister heauen whose hade ye shal fide like fauer selues haue shewed seruates texte cotinue prayer watche wt thakes giuing praying also v god maye open vnto v doore vtteraunce maye speake misterie christe wherfore also bodes maye vtter becommeth speke would ye worthie mebres christes body continue prayer dull heauy people reason surfettyng sober wakefull also geuyng god thankes yt ye desyer god thinges saluacio profitable also gyue thankes dayly giftes intet whe seeth thakfull mindefull maye towarde beneficiall meane tyme ye shal also deiyre god v yt maye please goodnes suche sorte take awaye al impedimentes gospel maye freely preached yt faith openyng mennes heartes misterie maye enter al mennes mindes beyng hitherto hidden ye father would haue knowen vnto touchyng christe without helpe law offereth vnto al people saluacion preaching wherof lye bondes yt nothing lette among al men publish sprede abrode ye gospel christ desirouse freely wtout feare eue comauded texte walke wysely towarde without lose oportunitie vse selues soberly discretly suche christes religio straungers maners nothing appeare yt maye either moue persecute withdrawe theyr myndes fauer gospel synce auoyded ye must nedes heathes conuersaut liue familierly let fynde new profession ye poyntes becomme therby better courteyse namely yf suche thing chauce wherin wtout breache religion ye maye pleasure nowe must specially present tyme endeuour allured profession gospell oportunitie wherof must ianglyng vayne contencions ioste bought rather precious goodes treasure haue gyue ouer honoure departe youre moneye awaye desyer reuenge yf losse suche thinges gospell furthered thinke dede aduauntage great texte let speache alwayes well sauoured poudred salte ye maye knowe howe ye ought answere euery man let speache reprochefull roughe let sauoure courtesy gentlenes poudred salte wysdome remebryng gentle speache rather soupleth fierse stomackes discrecion teacheth whome sobernes ought answer must otherwise vse selfe towarde prince gouernours worlde otherwyse meane men otherwise lowe person one sorte suche gentle sorte suche furnishe otherwise learned otherwise vnlearned suche sorte muste oure language tempered vnto euery mane condicion may promote gospel time better gyue place whome ye intende teache reprochefull wordes gaynsayth teachyng whome thou speakest vnto goeth couertly aboute hurte thy doctrine texte busines shall ye certified tychicus beloued brother faithfull minister felowe seruaunt lorde haue sent vnto purpose myght knowe ye doe might comfort heartes wt one onesimus faithfull beloued brother whiche one shall shewe thinges whiche doyng heree state wryte vnto shal tichicus bearet letter certifie one comen profession well beloued brother faithfull minister felowe seruaunt preaching gospel whome purpose sente thither intent hym ye shoulde knowe done among v hym certified howe ye doe youre myndes maye communicacion refreshed myne also good reporte made tychichus haue sent onesimus whome would ye shoulde esteme iudge olde kynde lyfe synce nowe faythful beloued brother whome cause ye oughte make gentile ye vncircumcised one tourned christe two shall make faythfull reporte suche thinges done among v ferre expedient knowe texte aristarchus prison felowe saluteth marcus barnabas systers sonne touchynge ye receyued commaundementes yf come vnto receyue hym iesus whiche called iustus whiche circumcision onely workefelowes vnto kyngdome god whiche haue bene vnto consolacion aristarchus saluteth albeit iew yet like faith ye make muche hym hym haue christes gospel sake enprisonment felow pertaker mareus also barnabas systers
