sonne ye wel knowe saluteth whome tyme commended vnto comaunding nowe come ye al gentlenes receyue enterteyne iesus also whose surname iustus greteth dede straunge nacion saye iewes yet worthie fauoured preachyng kyngdo god workefelowes vnto affliccions whiche suffer cherefull texte epaphras seruaunte christe one saluteth alwayes laboureth feruently prayer ye maye stande perfite ful al wil god beare hym recorde hath feruet mynde laodicia hierapolis epaphras greeteth whiche one profession christes name also one countrey whose hartelye fauoreth moste feruently maketh prayer god ye helpe maye stedfastly continew ye haue begunne vnperfit christias al suche thinges god requireth perfite full beare hym recorde hath feruent loue towarde toward onely also towarde laodicia hierapolis whiche border nigh vnto texte deare lucas physicion greteth demas salute brother whiche laodicia salute nymphas congregacion whiche house lucas physicion singulerly loue greteth doth also demas whiche yet salute aswell brother laodicia also especially nympha congregacion house texte epistie red make red also congregacion laodicians ye lykewyse reade epistle laodicia assone epistle rehearsed among cause also read congregacion laodicians agayne read ye epistle laodicia wrote timothie maye profite texte saye archippus take hede thy office thou haste receyued lorde thou fulfyll salutacion hand paule remember bondes grace lorde iesu christ amen saye name wordes archippus ruler loke take hede charge thou hast taken hande mannes busynestake hede thy office cure god comitted vnto see thou perfourme thou haste vndertaken whiche shalte therof lorde yelde accoumpte epistle shoulde credite lo subscribe gretynges myne owne hande paules hande saye whome ye wel knowe remeber bondes beare sake lyue suche sorte made ashamed grace iesus alwayes amen finis argument epistle sainct paule colossian de erasmus roterodame colossian people asia lesse dwellyng nigh vnto laodicians apostle paul selfe seen whiche instructed fayth christ either preachyng archippus ambrose sayth epaphras matter put trust great ieopardy people reason false apostle whiche labored bryng pestilent opinion teachyng sonne god meane author saluacion al menne haue accesse entrie vnto father healpe angel men sayd forasmuche tyme olde testament thynges done ministery seruice angel christ sonne god neither comen doune yearth would come beside teacher christes doctrine myngled iewishnes supersticious philosophie obseruyng kepyng certain pointes lawe supersticiously also honouryng sunne moone starres suche smal trinkettes worlde bearyng colossian hand wer also bound biddeth paule remembre theyr profession euidently declaryng whatsoeuer vntil tyme obtained geuen vnto none angel christ creator angel onely head churche saluacion shuld nomans hand sought whiche treatise also defendeth owne authoritie suche laboured empayre whiche geueth diligent warnyng take hede lest deceiued high wordes false apostle forged vision angel meane therof fall either iewishnes el supersticion philosophie whiche pointes paule two fyrst chapiter entreateth two exhorteth vertuous godly liuyng namely geuyng rule wife vse selfe towarde husband husband againe vse wife sorte father towarde child child likewyse towarde theyr father seruau te theyr maisters maisters theyr seruautes last part sauyng warneth archippus duetie spent commendacions epistle written prison ephesus sent tychicus paule selfe present epistle saieth latine argumentes shewe also sent thither onesimus selfe writeth also last chapiter greke title recorde sent cytie rome deede thence sent onesimus paule beyng prisoner made christian man paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle apostle sainct paule colossian fyrst chapiter texte paule apostle iesu christ wyll god brother timothcus al saintes whiche colossa brother beleue christ paule ambassadour iesus christ man ordinaunce wyll god father timothe perfite ronsent preachyng gospel coumpt brother dweller colossa whiche haue confidence iesus christ also accordyng doctrine liue holy life nowe like kynde profession becomen dearely beloued brother texte grace vnto peace god father lorde iesu christ grace peace among god father ye freely reconciled vnto ye may like wyse euen brother haue one comen father one towarde alwaye norishe mutual vnitie concorde texte geue thankes god father lorde iesus christ alwayes praiers haue heard fayth christ iesu loue whiche ye beare faintes hope sake whiche layd vppe store beauen whiche hope ye heard true worde gospel whiche come vnto euen fruiteful groweth also among fro day whiche ye heard experience grace god trueth ye lerned epaphra deare felowe seruaunt whiche faythful minister christ whiche also declared vnto v loue whiche ye haue spirite albeit hath yet hitherto chaunce see yet continual praiers made god father oure lorde iesus christ sake geue thakes benefites bestowed vpon desyre also dayly encrease giftes also preserue epaphra heard fayth wherbywe haue heard fayth christ iesu c trust ye shalbe saued helpe angel free bouteousnes sauiour anoynted hath pleased god father geue v al goodnes annoynted would haue called al shuld receiue helth sauiour elswhere looke saluacion onely perceiued vnderstode cofidence also charitie ioyned ther whiche christ gaue example ye beare towarde good people carnestly mindyng hoope auauntage ye thinke receiue therby hope euerlasting life whiche ye wel knowe layde vp heauen godlynes suerly ito trustof whiche hope ye heard trae worde gospel ye broughte throughe preachyng christes gospell whiche ye persuade selfe doctrin suche trueth albeit make great promise suche neuer heard tyme yet forsomuch god author ye thinke cannot true gospel throughout worlde hath dayly enlarged come euery day growyng encreasyng plentifully spreadyng self abroade bringyng foorth fruite good workes whiche freely growe christian charitie hath done growyng styl better better euen synce tyme wherin ye fyrst heard knewe free goodnes god synnes forgeuen whiche beleue gospel theyr right fayth adioyne pure vnfained charitie ye taught dearely beloued felow seruice messenger trust epaphras hath among sincerely done myne office suche sorte iesus christes behalfe preachyng gospel hath pointes found without corruption therfore taughtwhiche also declared vnto v loue ye haue spirit againe vnderstand good wyll againe towarde v meanyng suche vsuall good wyll men wishe well theyr frendes acquaintaunce spiritual heauenly fauor wherwith vse loue suche glorye gospel set foorth stablished though bodily iyen neuer sawe texte cause also euer synce day heard haue ceased praye desyre ye might fulfilled knowledge wisedome spiritual vnderstandyng ye might walke worthy lorde al thinges ye may please beyng fruitful al good workes encreasyng knowledge god strengthed might glorious power vnto al pacience long sufferyng ioyfulnes geuyng thankes vnto father hath made v meete partaker inheritauce saintes light whiche hath deliuered v power darkeues hath translated v vnto kyngdome deare sonne haue redempcion bloud euen forgeuenes sinnes whiche image inuisible god fyrst begotten al creature wer thinges created heauen yearth visible inuisible whether maiestie lordship either rule power thinges created thinges thinges haue beyng cause againe one vnworthy fauor heartely loue againe though neuer sawe euen fro day wherin fyrst certifyed fayth charitie dayly prayer callyng vpon god feruent peticions besechyng may please make perfite bryng full suche giftes hath begunne geue ye bothe may moreye might fulfilled knowledge c throughly knowe pleasure beyng taught neither worldely wisedom yet supersticious vaine persuasion men spiritual wisedome policie wherof yehaue already gotten good part would wishe ye lacked nothyng ye may godly perfeccion passe ouer life god honor al pointes also please lettyng good thing vndone doyng meane please geue onely credence gospel beginnyng saluacion godly holye workes made perfite full suffiseth haue learned preachyng gospel god sonne iesus christ author worker saluacion vnlesse knowledge ye growe vppe bring foorth fruites christian charitie continually profityng better better surely constantly manfully standyng neither violence storme persecucion driue ye right course whose perfourmauce surely ye nede great assistence strength strengthstrengthed al might glorious power c oure owne power cannot assure selfes god whiche must geue ende whole glory suche thinges v valiauntly done may geuen againe vnto whiche goodnes enrycheth v great pacience long sufferyng endure abyde christes gospelles sake suche trouble may meane tyme befal v whiche persecucions suffering inough strong without feare rather besemeth v euen ioyfully good courage vndertake suffer geuyng thankes god father hath vouchesaued call suche honour wheras heretofore ye worshipped deuils idol ye goodnes called vnto felowshippe iewes whiche reason worshipped true god comparison holy whiche hath also vouchsaued cal enheritaunce life euerlastyng hope wherof al thinges whiche world either feare flatter v must despised bothwhiche hath made v e partaker inheritaunce sainctes light hath geuen wanderyng deepe doungeon ignoraunce light gospel also ye whiche heretofore vnder vile slauishe bondage subiecte vnto tyranny deuil prince darkenes deliuered thence conueighed kyngdome derely beloued sonne thentent ye beyng ioyned body enioy one kingdome wherin suche thral synne haue place therfore hath god sonne made v free sinnes olde life forgeue ye becomen whose benefite mercy ye restored consider good chaunge ye haue made reconciliacion ye membres deuil ye planted christes body whose dignitie great image god father whiche father dwelleth light whervnto man come whiche suche seen man though certaine sorte sonne seen whiche father pointes verye like equal neither sonne lesse wyse lesse might lesse goodnes father late day receiued perfeccions euerlastyngly thyng made image euerlastyng father made borne thynges made whiche onely hath beginnyng therfore selfe begotte sonne sonne withfor thinges created sonne made create al either heauen yearth may seen seen verye angel selfe excepted chiefe whither maiesties lordshippes rule power albeit order power farre excede creature yet ace passing measure vnder ye ioyned forasmuche whatsoeuer made must maker nedes inferior al thinges onely made christ also gouerned preserued whiche pointe also father like equal sonne begotten creature al thinges al thinges haue theyr beyng without perishe mainteined thus see ye excellencie preeminence christ whiche thing tel lest manne angel thinke texte head body euen congregacion beginnyng first begotten dead thinges might haue preeminence lest perauenture glorious excellent maiestie feare away hun aspire come vnto fauor god father ye thinke necessarie seeke vpon meane heare againe learne knowe good christ suche sorte chiefe ruler lorde angel layd nethelesse vouchesaueth also head churche hath ioyned vnto cleaueth coupled vnto euen natural body cleaueth vnto head whatsoeuer therfore alreadye done heade must v comen fyrst rose againe death intent wouldhe beginnyng first begotten dead immortall onely selfe ende might enhaunce v membres felowship immortal life loke fyrst fruites grayne offered generally whole heape dede prince author resurreccion shall also rise againe among thynges create chiefe suche sorte yet create made restoryng creature chiefe beyng byrth bounde vnto goodnes oure seconde byrthe baptisme li e euerlastyngly muche beholdyng vnto texte pleased father fulnes dwell reconcile al thinges vnto selfe set peace bloud crosse thinges heauen thinges yearth hath pleased father sonne fulnes godly power goodnes replenished shuld abidethat fulnes dwell c dwel nede borowe thyng synce father neither wyll thing sonne syth father pleasure besemeth v curiously demaunde serche synce best whatsoeuer wysedome hath decreed wyse say god father thought beste bothe oure weale saluacion owne glory reconcile al thinges vnto ministerie angel owne sonne whiche bloud sheddyng tourmentyng vpon crosse abolishe synne whiche broke peace concorde betwixte heauenly yearthly creature set thinges peace bothe heauenly yerthly makyng christ agre together vnitie one texte whiche sometyme farre enemy myndes set euil workes hath yet reconciled body fleshe death make holy vnblameable without fault owne sight ye continue grou ded stablished fayth moued awaye hoope gospel wherof ye haue heard preached among creature whiche vnder heauen wherof paule made minister numbre reconciled ye becomen ye saye whiche yeres past suche sorte straungers god steede ye worshipped image deuils wilfully dissentyng also vsing selfes cruel aduersaries hath yet selfe reconciled beyng suche neither loked much muche lesse deserued made enemy frendes sonnes ministery aungels bodily death onely begotten sonne purpose pleasure shuld take mortal fleshe vpon betwixte god synners peace hath pleased frely forgeue al offence former life thentent would sight make holy vnblameable faultles pray lay olde debtes charge cotented surely cotented wyl vpo fre receiuyng vnto fayth gospel ye continually abide profession leanyng vpon sure sounde foundacion shewe selfes stedfast stable neither man angel able moue fro christ ye must hope receiue suche giftes gospel promiseth whervn ye gaue credence whiche hath onely preached vnto also nacions contained vnder heauen vnstedfastnes fal away fro whiche ye haue allowed impudent shameles point reken coumpte thing vaine belief wherof al worlde agreeth finally flit whose preacher minister paule whiche would leaue forgoe mine owne countreys law chaunge gospel christ fully persuaded geare heauenly commeth fro god texte ioy suffrynges fulfil whiche behynd passion christ fleshe body sake cogregacion wherof made minister accordyng ordinaunce god ordinaunce geuen vnto warde fulfil worde god ministerie whiche hath hid synce world begunne synce beginnyng generacions opened saintes god would make knowen glorious rich misterie among gentile rich christ hope glory preache warnyng men teachyng men al wysedome make men perfite christ iesu wherin also labor striue eue farfoorth strength worketh mightely throughly persuaded gospel thyng trueth onely farre beyng ashamed repentyng selfe therof wyll also ioyfully suffre coumpte stripe emprisonment chaynes euen matier reioyse glorie tormentynges inow ioy suf rige fo c endure offence myne suffer weale saye though iewes neuer muche saye naye haue lesse righte benefite gospell haue iewes themselues saye weale suffer christ suffered apostle lothe whiche christ prince maister disdayned christ suffered v onelye owne body also maner suffereth oures eue one supplying fulfilling minister suche thynges mighte affliccions seeme vnperfecte death selfe insufficient affliccions punishmentes head member prince minister maner one punishmetes greater vehemente redounde make fulnes perfeccion saluacion saluacio onely ye weale also christes whole body whiche churche office committed vnto committed cure ouer light congregacion christe hath set placed stede hath deliueredfor body sake whiche e congregacio vnto custody owne bodye specially porcion whiche gentile receyued gospell intente wt labour supply whiche semed lacke publyshe many hundred yeares tyme hidden gentile teache iewes getiles also haue fayth entry welthy state gospel god long since purposed yet purpose hidden vntill tyme worlde nowe preachyng opened suche forsakyng theyr former vngraciouse lyfe embrace doctrine christ whome hath pleased god declare howe glorious ryches towarde v publyshing long hidden misterie whole worlde perceyueth howe free saluacion whiche men firste thoughte offered onely iewes nowe commen vnto al nacions kepyng moses lawe requyred fayth onelye men doubte promise made gospell stede suche thynges wherin iewes haue foolyshe confidence christ onely sufficient ye haue cause sorye hope ye stande beyng sure ynough also hym glorious whowhome preache warnyng men teaching c hymselfe wyll vndoubtedly perfourme muche hath promised hym preache moses aungels aduertisyng teaching onely iewes also people world doong leauyng nothyng vntouched appertayneth wisdome gospell intent men vnderstand whither circumcised circumcised theyr weale nothyng el set christ iesus bryng whiche fayth mennes myndes suche sorte labour auauncing therof thynke paynfull put selfe many ieopardies perilles dede weightie weakenes able abyde suffer strong mightie whose ayde mayntenaunce actes also whe nede requireth working myracles v bryngeth preaching credence ii chapiter texte woulde ye knewe howe great care haue laodicia many haue sene person fleshe theyr hertes myght comforted knyt together loue al rich full vnderstanding knowe misterie god father christe whome hydde treasure wysedome knowledge muche haue sayde ye colossian boste self vnto couete ye knowe howe carefull ieopardies put selfe suche haue presently taught gospell vnto also whiche syghte know especially laodicians thoughe neuer sawe bodely iyen yet see co tinuallye iyen hearte glad encrease furtheraunce fearful espye entiernes godly condicions either ieoperdie inconstant wauer selfe greatly auaylable suche neuer sawe know labour paynes take dothe auauntage mythat theyr hertes might comforted c pensyfenes ieopardies affliccions pricked furth enforced consent cleaue together godly charitie lyke member one body knyt surely mortised wherby also menne clearely perceyue certaynely beleue bountifull goodnes god father toward mankynde yea toward al creature aboundatly flowyng abrode openyng nowe throughe iesus christe secrete misterie hath hitherto bene hidden whiche besyde hym onely desyre worldly wysdome neuer great wyse philosopher promisen teacher moses lawe anye suche boste speakyng aungels taughte forasmuche hym alone contayned hydden treasure wysedome fruytful knowledge fountayne maye easly drawe asmuche perfite saluacion requyred texte saye leste man beguyle entising wordes throughe absent fleshe yet spirite ioying beholding youre order stedfast fayth christe poyntes ende thought good warne ye diligence take hede least beyng instruct worldly wysdome agaynst playnes christes gospel blynde deceyue false tale beyng yet suche tale haue colourable apparence trouth lykelynes wyse men world wt capciouse subtile reason theyr inuencion wont entangle simple people whiche sorte know among watching maye corrupte fayth albeit absent see presentlye donethoughe absente fleshe c yet mynde among present herte reioysyng see good order condicion lyfe therwith soundnes strength sure confidence whiche ye haue iesus christe whome ye haue wholy commytted selues texte ye haue therfore receyued christ iesu lord euen walke ye hym ye roted buylte hym stablyshed faythe ye haue learned therin plenteous geuyng thankes nowe remayneth ye vpon good beginnyng continue profit ye haue receyued beleued iesus christe lorde goodnes head welspring felicitie set lyfe agree consent fayth profession prouiding alwayes ye baptisme graffed ye lykewyse abide hym gather strength sure strong foundacion doctrine christes gospell alredy layed labour ye buylde vp ther vpon suche worke suche foundacion mete conuenient take hede ye wauer waye waye euery blaste newe doctrine moueth stade stedfast stable ye haue learned endeuour stande stedfastly also encrease euery daye better better fayth fruites godly lyfe beyng dayly augmented ye maye alwayes haue newe thing gyue god thankes ye must dede thanke well done texte beware lest man spoyle philosophy disceitfull vanitie tradicion men ordinaunces worlde christe suche would bring fro simplicitie watche busely watche muste ye syde lykewyse least beyng enchaunted royall glyttering apparences theyr phylosophie ye fro disceitfull vanitie tradicion c sound fayth altred brought vayne deuises men become spoyle praye aduersaries ye shall vn doubtedly ye turne truth gospell led rule mennes onlye makyng whiche stande suche thinges maye carnal eye sene grosse pointes world wher christes doctrine heauenly spirituall teacheth righte trewe religion whiche standeth myndes meates drinkes bodily apparell keping dayes yet wasshyng handes whiche thynges trewe religion make nothing suche pointes withdraw v rather fro christe deuide v fro welspring whence mete sought grace goodnes texte hym dwelleth fulnes godhead bodely ye complete whiche head rule power whome also ye circumcised circumcision whiche done handes forasmuche ye haue put synfull bodye fleshe circumcision christ ye buried hym baptisme whome ye also rysen agayne fayth wrought operacion god whiche raysed hym death hym certayne giftes deriued oute ryuerin dwelleth fulnes godhead bodelye c litle water runneth dyche hym resteth dwelleth corporally hole fulnes godhead yf ye haue hym ye nede seke either shadowes moses lawe subtile conueyaunce worldly wisdome trouth playnly delyuered v al sences beare recorde nede haue seke figure doubtfull promise synce ye graffed christe framed one bodye hym shoulde elswher loke haue thyng since lacketh nothyng would haue treasure comen al men hym hym needes must ye made complet whither ye lacke wysdome power welspring wysedome neuer dryed vp heade power rule ther power hyghest order aungels say hym boweth knee iewes paradueture endeuoure bring minde weightye matier haue circumcised though state mannes body suche externe thinges brought v goddes fauour rather persuaded whosoeuer haue christ enioye hym glorie commendacion circumcision haue christe theyr circumcision vayne vnprofitable haue shadow circumcision ye therof soules haue verye truthe sythe iewes circumcision meaneth groce carnall desyers cut al theyr soules loke nothyng heauenly thinges vncircumcised needes must whiche couetous myndes styll labour haue please bealyes whiche wt enuy malice pyne away vayngloriously seke worldly prayse despayre heauenly rewardes ye contrarie christ veryly circumcised circumcisio done mannes handes spirituall kynde circumcision haue ye litle piece onlye carnall man pared awaye cut whole bodye defyled syn corrupted carnal lustes spirituall circumcision christ iesus dying forsoke bodye subiect death rysyng againe receyued body whiche coulde dye ye baptisme throughe spirite god hym spiritually dead castyng synnes olde lyfe deade hym also buried hym whe synfull desyers kylled perfite quyetnes mynde foloweth suche forgoyng bodyes thral sinne whiche sinne isin ye ate also rise fayth c death soule ye christe hym risen agayne free synne desertes ye stedfastly beleue god mightie power restored christe agayne death lyfe also power worketh vpon free remissio sinnes death sone ye shoulde hencefurthe liue subiect sin innocent vprighte life make haste forwarde life shall neuer haue ende thakes god father haue suche thinges whiche sone gyueth nothing auauntaged iewes circumcised vncircumcision gentile hinderauce vncircumcised therfore deadly lacke ye wer wholy gyuen groce wycked desyres therby subiecte death rather ye without grace god lyfe mannes soule ye spiritually deade texte ye ye dead synne vncircumcision youre fleshe hathe quickened hym hath forgyuen v oure trespaces hath put hande wrytyng agaynst v contayned lawe wryten hathe taken oute waye hath fastened crosse hath spoyled rule power hath made shewe openly hath triumphed ouer owne persone kynde vncircumcision saye sortes v comen whiche god hath holy spirite cutte taken away forgeuing v oure synnes suche sorte forgyuyng oute ieopardie hauyng offence hereafter layed vnto oure charge haue aduisedly sworne obediet moses lawe breache wherof oure aduersary deuyll myght haue action agaynste v agaynst men bounden theyr owne hande wrytingand hath put handwryting v c yea olde obligacion ryght wherof deuyll sued v hath christe rased oute assone professed fayth gospell whome offence olde lyfe forgyuen ame layed mannes charge whatsoeuer myght v ryghte wrytyng requyred hath christe sake payed vpon crosse wrytyng rente torne vtterly cancelled haue nowe anye cause feare tyrannye satan synce christe hath crosse death vanquyshed authour death thereby deliuered v triumphantly subduyng power rule deuylles carying v heauenlye kyngdome thoughe bene ryche price botye declared freely playnly ouerco men vnharnysed sight bothe men aungels caryed v triumphe shewyng enemyes subdued put flyght ayde aungels men owne myghty power tyme vpon crosse hanged vp royall sygne victorye suche hyghe place whereas euery manne might see onely take hede poynt ye fall youre olde synnes texte let man therfore trouble youre conscience meate drynke piece holy daye newe mooue sabboth dayes shadowes thinges come bodye christ feare least dispisyng ceremony moses lawe man condempne either meate drynke cleane vncleane puttyng difference betwixt holye daye workyng daye kepyng holy feaste newe moone breakyng reste sabboth daye thiese obseruaunces shadowes long signifieng rudely purtrahing thynges shoulde afterwarde vnfaynedlywhiche shadow thynges come c exhibite christe wherfore synce haue nowe bodye selfe since haue trouth selfe openly shewed vnto v longer feare shadowes whoso cleaueth christe beyng heauen regardeth nothyng el heauenly thinges walketh furth euen ryght pathwaye rewarde immortall lyfe texte let man make shote wrong marke humblenes holynes aungels thynges whiche neuer saw beyng causeles puft vp fleshly mynd holdeth head whereof body ioyntes couple receyueth nouryshement knyt together encreaseth encrasyng commeth fro god beware therfore lest man callyng backe agayn earthly thynges fasly sleyghtly deceyue reward ye haue already begon labour stede heauenly doctrine teachyng small matter stede christes true religion supersticious worshyppyng aungels auaunce exalte hymselfe among simple people certayne fayned vision beyng desyrous worldly gloryein thynges neuer sawe teachyng people suche thynges learned aungels whiche hath owne head hymselfe forged imagened withoute sure truste comparison besemeth euery christian despise al thynges neuer hygh meane season trustyng vpo aungels falleth christe heauenly head whome dependeth whole bodye churche whiche spirituall giftes deriued euery member ioyntes couplynges nouryshed encreased vnto hyghest perfeccion spiritual vnto suche perfeccion besemeth god haue whome christ ioyned coupled texte wherfore yf ye dead christe ordinaunces worlde though ye yet lyued worlde ye led tradicious touche taste ha dle whiche peryshe verye abuse commaundementes doctrine men whiche thynges outwardly haue similitude wisedome supersticion humblenes mynde hurtyng bodye fleshe worshyp vnto neede therof christe visible groce worlde dead lyue nowe heauen ye kynde lyfe lykewyse hym deade vsuages worlde hauyng eye nothyng heauenlye thinges wherto maketh subiect mannes ordinaunces beyng suche prescrybe suche thynges sauer christe groce carnall ordinaunces worlde though ye nowe deade suche thinges styll lyued worldlye gyue eare iew prescribyng suche thynges obserued accordyng carnall meanyng moses lawe touche carkas cleane taste meattouche taste ha dle whiche c cleane touche thing holy may lawfully touched secular person ready ye gyue eare vnto tradicios doctrine men whiche labour bryng mynde difference meates obseruyng dayes iewyshe rule godly religion standeth though christes doctrine sufficient meate drynke apparell bryng v goddes fauour bodely nedes vsed long longe abuse weare away stedfast perfeccions soules cannot spet yet suche teache suche doctrine amog fooles vnlearned preted fayned colour wysdome muche supersticion faultie humilitie fyl menes myndes muche made plaine supersticion make angel equal christ faultie humblenes angel loke whiche shuld christ selfe asked lestwyse christ father meates drinkes suche visible thinges geuen compelled hurt body abstaine ende bodyes may holpen kynde apparel wynde wether mainteined succoured fed kynde meates al tymes place without difference whansoeuer muche tyme shalbe thought nedeful iewes whose heartes yet circumcised fro grosse carnal meanyng lawe whiche put suche difference iii chapiter texte ye risen againe christ seke thinges whiche aboue christ sitteth right hande god set affeccion heauenly thinges yearthly thinges base lowe thinges vnbesemyng true mebres christ ye worldly affayres verely dead risen againe christ desyre high euerlastyng treasure commodity sette naught suche vile matter seeke heauely pleasure thinges aboue christ head sitteth right hand god father mete al studyes care membres directed place wheras head present shall head hereafter reigne euer liueth euery man loueth texte ye dead life hid christ god whensoeuer christ whiche life shal shewe selfe shal ye also appeare glory world ye seme dead whiche neither delited worldly wealth yet regarde suche phata y wherwith worldly people delited wherfore ye liue among men yet liue ye christ god though meane season iudgement world life hidden tyme christ shall come againe shewe glory glory body worlde shall men see head partaker glory texte mortifie therfore yearthly membres fornicacion vncleanes vnnatural lust euil concupiscence couetousnes whiche worshippyng idol whiche thinges sake wrath god vseth come child vnbelief among ye walked sometyme ye liued put ye also away fro al thinges wrath fiersnes maliciousnes cursed speakyng filthy communicacion mouth meane season diligently endeuour body like vnto high heauenly head whose mebres dye vtterly carnal desyres cannot heauen liue christ deuil hath also body whiche elswhere called body synne membres fornicacion whiche among worldly people eue praised vnclenues vnnatural luste suche desyres filthy mete named desyre hurtful thinges glorye honour vengeance especially desyre money synne among al nighest draweth outragious wickednes wete worshippyngand couetousnes whiche worshippyng idol idol sinnes whosoeuer subiecte cannot partaker glory christ farre beyng true child god whiche suche outragious vice corrupted like fiersely raged euen vpon owne people iewes destroiyng disenherityng disobedient child suche like horrible vice life also corrupted tyme ye yet baptisme dead christ liued frowarde desyres led synce christ hath lefte nothyng mortal yearthly meete synce ye borne againe ye cast away filthynes olde former life onely cast away suche great enormity spoke also suche thinges wherin comen sorte wont beare selfes wrath fyersenes maliciousnes cursed speakyng ye onely haue heartes pure suche desyres also mouth cleane fro al filthy communicacion texte lye one seyng ye haue put old man workes haue put newe man whiche renued knowledge image made neither gentile iewe circumcision vncircumcision barbarus sithian bonde free christ thing christ trueth selfe mete ye beyng membres lye one briefe synce ye haue put christ put old yearthly man al workes desyres put new whiche wyl neuer olde reason knowledge god dayly encreaseth florisheth buddeth vpand image made better greater image christ beyng new selfe builded v new man extinguishyng olde many v planted christes bodye farre gone though newe made againe somuche difference betwixt gentile iewe betwixte circumcised vncircumcised betwixte wylde scithian grecian man athens yet betwixt free bonde among menne suche difference passed vpon god suche thynges regarde christ whiche indifferently comen onely geueth al thinges al men christ bondman fredome poore man ryches wylde barbarous ciuilitie vncircumcised circumcision briefe among thinges made equal none disdaine texte therfore electe god holy beloued put tender mercy kyndnes humblenes minde mekenes long sufferyng forbearyng one forgeuyng one haue quarel christ forgaue euen ye wherfore stede vile membres vnbesemyng christ put membres contrary filthy membres rehersed stede putte suche mete god hath chosen holy vouchsaued loue membres wyl say without doubt suche christ selfe taught put execucion say tender mercy ye readynes help weakenes kyndnes ye comen couersacion life tractable humblenes mynd lest ye arrogantly auaunce selfe mekenes lest ye vpon offender vse crueltie long sufferyng leste ye hasty reuenge beare eche one eche forgeue mannes infirmitie thyng among reason wherof one might haue quarel againe besemeth forgeue eche others offence synce christ offended man forgaue v trespaces texte aboue thinges putte loue whiche bonde perfitenes peace god rule heartes whiche peace ye called one body aboue garmentes especially apparel selfes christian charitie farre hurtyng man laboreth euery man good yea good euil perfite sure bonde wherwith body christ ioyned together membres abide fast whiche would el fal sonder charitie wyl folow peace concorde comen peace whiche men speake suche made mainteined mightie power christ stedfastly let alway heartes wynne haue vpper hande let malice pride wrath contencion haue victory god hath called concorde hath purpose reconciled vnto made one body entent ye like membres one body among selfes one mynde texte see ye thankeful let worde christ dwel plenteously al wisedome eache exhorte owne selues psalmes hymnes spiritual songes syngyng grace heartes lorde vnthankeful forgetful goddes great goodnes toward haue peace freely forgeuen v sinnes doeth one brother forgettyng make battel againe brother lytle displeasure striue among selfe preeminence worldly wysedome let worde christ whiche teacheth thinges belongyng perfite godlynes dwel continue pletifully ye sauer growe wise selfe knowe christ acceptable also able one teache way geue warnyng dutie slacke meane season tyme mery ioyful hope blisse come geuyng praise god psalmes hymnes spiritual songes praisyng god mouth onely also speacially heart suche songes god delited lest thinke great praise god onely mouth make noyse texte whatsoeuer ye worde dede name lord iesu geuyng thankes god father fynally whatsoeuer ye either worde dede make glory lorde iesus life conuersacion sauer expresse resemble whyles ye wyse doyng thing befal whether prospetouse wyse therwith either proude dismayed geue thankes god father sonne turneth suche chaunces oure weale auauntage texte ye wyues submitte selues owne husbandes comly lorde ye husbandes loue wyues bitter vnto ye child obey father mother thinges well pleasyng vnto lorde ye wyues submitte selues obediently vnto husbandes besemeth suche haue taken vpo christes name mete goodnes go beyond ye husbandes againe loue wyues ye must remembre suche condicion subiecte vnto yet ye sharpe bitter ye child thinges obedient father mother though commaunde paineful busines vngodly christes wyll pleasure ye texte ye father prouoke child anger lest desperate mynde ye seruauntes obedient vnto bodily maisters thinges lye seruice men pleaser singlenes heart fearyng god whatsoeuer ye heartely though ye lorde vnto men knowyng lorde ye shal receiue rewarde inheritauce ye serue lord christ againe ye father abuse authoritie vpon child prouoke cruelnes dispayre ye seruauntes pointes obeye maisters lawe man ye bounde serue onely see loke vpon feare comen orte heathen seruauntes wonte thinkyng haue done theyr dueties offende theyr master beyng also simple vnfained heart doyng duetie feare man also feare god seeth mynde ye whatsoeuer ye consider seruice master beyng man deserueth seruice soeuer ye vnto kynde one soeuer coumpte done christ men assuryng selfe ye shall receiue rewarde heauenly inheritaunce though vnkynde maister geue nothyng labor accoumpte among child while ye christes sake seruice vnmete maisters ye serue christ texte doeth synne shal receiue sinne neither respecte person god maister yf seruaut thing offende though among men punyshed shall yet god escape punishment seruaunt well doth duetie albeit haue rewarde men whiche themselues thynke theyr seruauntes nothyng bound haue done theyr dueties yet shal loose theyr rewarde god hand putteth differece betwixte persos betwixt myndes cosidereth mannes condicion wel doth iiii chapiter texte maisters vnto seruauntes whiche iuste equall knowyng ye also haue maister heauen agayne ye maisters abuse authoritie gyuen mennes lawes perfeccion nature exercise tyranny vpo seruauntes gyue iust lawfull departyng sufficiently suche thynges naturall v necessarye make pleasure muche intollerablye oppressing assuring selues ye rather felowes seruice tha maisters asmuche ye haue one commen maister heauen whose hade ye shal fide like fauer selues haue shewed seruates texte cotinue prayer watche wt thakes giuing praying also v god maye open vnto v doore vtteraunce maye speake misterie christe wherfore also bodes maye vtter becommeth speke would ye worthie mebres christes body continue prayer dull heauy people reason surfettyng sober wakefull also geuyng god thankes ye desyer god thinges saluacio profitable also gyue thankes dayly giftes intet whe seeth thakfull mindefull maye towarde beneficiall meane tyme ye shal also desyre god v yt maye please goodnes suche sorte take awaye al impedimentes gospel maye freely preached faith openyng mennes heartes misterie maye enter al mennes mindes beyng hitherto hidden father would haueknowen vnto touchyng christe without helpe law offereth vnto al people saluacion preaching wherof lye bondes yt nothing lette among al men publish sprede abrode gospel christ desirouse freely wtout feare eue comauded texte walke wysely towarde without lose oportunitie vse selues soberly discretly suche christes religio straungers maners nothing appeare maye either moue persecute withdrawe theyr myndes fauer gospel synce auoyded ye must nedes heathes conuersaut liue familierly let fynde new profession ye poyntes becomme therby better courteyse namely yf suche thing chauce wherin wtout breache religion ye maye pleasure nowe must specially present tyme endeuour allured profession gospell oportunitie wherof must ianglyng vayne contencions loste bought rather precious goodes treasure haue gyue ouer honoure departe youre moneye awaye wrth desyer reuenge yf losse suche thinges gospell furthered thinke dede aduauntage great texte let speache alwayes well sauoured poudred salte ye maye knowe howe ye ought answere euery man let speache reprochefull roughe let sauoure courtesy gentlenes poudred salte wysdome remebryng gentle speache rather soupleth fierse stomackes disc ecion teacheth whome sobernes ought answer must otherwise vse selfe towarde prince gouernours worlde otherwyse meane men otherwise lowe person one sorte suche gentle sorte suche fumishe otherwise learned otherwise vnlearned suche sorte muste oure language tempered vnto euery mane condicion may promote gospel time better gyue place whome ye intende teache reprochefull wordes gayusayth teachyng whome thou speakest vnto goeth couertly aboute hutte thy doctriue texte busines shall ye certified tychicus beloured brother faithfull minister felowe seruaunt lorde haue sent vnto purpose myght knowe ye doe might comfort heartes wt one onesimus faithfull beloued brother whiche one shall shewe thinges whiche doyng heree state wryte vnto shal tichicus bearer letter certifie one comen profession well beloued brother faithfull minister felowe seruaunt preaching gospel whome purpose sente thither intent hym ye shoulde knowe done among v hym certified howe ye doe youre myndes maye communicacion refreshed myne also good reporte made tychichus haue lent onesimus whome would ye shoulde esteme iudge olde kynde lyfe synce nowe faythful beloued brother whome cause ye oughte make gentile ye vncircumcised one tourned christe two shall make faythfull reporte suche thinges done among v ferre expedient knowe texte aristarchus prison felowe saluteth marcus barnabas systers sonne touchynge ye receyued commaundementes yf come vnto receyue hym iesus whiche called iustus whiche circumcision onely workefelowes vnto kyngdome god whiche haue bene vnto consolacion aristarchus saluteth albeit iew yet like faith ye make muche hym hym haue christes gospel sake enprisonment felow pertaker marcus also barnabas systers fo ne ye wel knowe saluteth whome tyme commended vnto comaunding come ye al gentlenes receyue enterteyne iesus also whose surname iustus greteth dede straunge nacion saye iewes yet worthie fauoured preachyng kyngdo god workefelowes vnto affliccions whiche suffer cherefull texte epaphras seruaunte christe one saluteth alwayes laboureth feruently prayer ye maye stande perfite ful al wil god beare hym recorde hath feruet mynde laodicia hierapolis epaphras greeteth whiche one profession christes name also one countrey hartelye fauoreth moste feruently maketh prayer god ye helpe maye stedfastly continew ye haue begunne vnperfit christias al suche thinges god requireth perfite full beare hym recorde hath feruent loue towarde toward onely also towarde laodicia hierapolis whiche border nigh vnto texte deare lucas physicion greteth demas salute brother whiche laodicia salute nymphas congregacion whiche house lucas physicion singulerly loue greteth doth also demas whiche yet salute aswell brother laodicia also especially nympha congregacion house texte epistle red make red also congregacion laodicians ye lykewyse reade epistle laodicia assone epistle rehearsed among cause also read congregacion laodicians agayne read ye epistle laodicia wrote timothie maye profite texte saye archippus take hede thy office thou haste receyued lorde thou fulfyll salutacion hand paule remember bondes grace lorde iesu christ amen saye name wordes archippus ruler loke take hede charge thou hast taken hande mannes busynestake hede thy office cure god comitted vnto see thou perfourme thou haste vndertaken whiche shalte therof lorde yelde accoumpte epistle shoulde credite lo subscribe gretynges myne owne hande paules hande saye whome ye wel knowe remeber bondes beare sake lyue suche sorte made ashamed grace iesus alwayes amen finis argument vpon first epistle paule apostle thessalonian de erasmus roterodame thessalonca principall citie macedonia wherof enhabitauntes countrey called thessalonian whan receaued faith persisted suche constancie suffred accordyng paules example persecucions euen owne citezens glad stomacke without shrynkyng false apostle could turne maner perswasion ordinaunce gospell yet paule beeyng afrayed knewe false apostle ouerth wartnes wel ynough experience inasmuche could go see himselfe sent timotheus whome whan returned paule hanyng reporte theyr constancie prayseth thankes geuyng god matter treateth first second chapiter three instructeth sondrie office godlynesse signifying vnto priuie ynclynges among whiche yet altogether pure vncleane demeanoure lyuyng without suche beyng geuen loyteryng chargeable burthen others sorte busye bodyes disturbe quietnesse theyr congregacion commaundeth correcte moreouer throughly confirmed iudgement yet concernyng resurreccion seyng bewayled theyr dead frendes though perished rather departed vnto better promocions enstructeth confirmeth syde disputed daye lordes commyng though might well haue bene foreknowen tolde vncertayne men paule sayeth shal come sodaynly wha man looketh intent shoulde ready euery moment epistle wrote athene tichicus ministre grekes writinges latine argumentes saye also onesimus baxe hym cumpanye howbeit certayne auctour commune exemplares p ende argument paraphrase erasmus vpon first epistle apostle paule thessalonian chapiter texte paul syluanus timethe unto congregacion thessolonians god father lorde iesus christe grace vnto peace god father lorde iesus christe geue god thankes alwaye makyng mencion prayer without ceasyng call remembrauce worke fayth labour loue ye haue continued hope lorde iesus christe sight god father paul siluanus tymothe vnto congregacion thessalonian cosenting together god father lorde iesus christe wishe vnto grace peace reioyce conuenient good forewardenesse rendre thankes alwayes vnto god making mencion behalfe often talke god holy supplicacions neuer myndes diligently trauayled defend profession fayth exceding labour toke loue beare vnto preacher gospel mafully without shrinking abode al thinges hope expectacion rewardes lorde iesus christe hath promysed lyfe come vnto name sake care displeasure lyfe shall lose hyre well doinges god father seeth vpon respecte shall paye hyre texte knowe brother beloued god howe ye electe gospell came vnto woorde onely also power holy ghost much certaintie ye knowe maner behaued selfes among sake ye became folowers v lorde receyuing woorde muche affliccion ioy holy ghost ye ensample al beleue macedonia achaia sounded woorde lorde macedonia achaia onely fayth also whiche ye haue vnto god spred herselfe abrode quartars nedeth v speake thyng themselfes shewe maner entryng vnto howe ye turned god ymages serue lyuing true god loke sonne heauen aysed death euen iesus whiche deliuereth v wrath come selfes knowe welbeloued brother chaunged persuasion man chosen purpose euen god neither yet haue slenderly preached gospell vnto nothyng hath shewed vnto sauyng bare woordes power god hath confirmed doctrine euen euident miracle holy gost also geue v behinde nothing wise make perfite beleuyng gospel doctrine whatsoeuer iewry atteined men preaching thesame also atteine gospel teaching behalfe sincerely humbly paynefully behaued selfes among tell wel ynough nothing whereby myght wynne vnto christe abode parte shewed selues vnto warde scholar folowed streyght example v yea rather v lorde iesu humbled himselfe lowe suffred al thinges might wynne v vnto himselfe haue hartely embraced ou gospell preaching loue haue suffred affliccions paciently howe many howe greuouse soeuer onely muche boldenesse also muche gladnesse holy goste receyued preaching pledge time fel citie come hath placed himselfe harte hope felicitie al sorowes become swete whatsoeuer layed vpon v gospel christe valiauntnesse fayth passing excellent ensample al faythfull rest macedonia achaia example noble chiefe citie moued allthessalonica mennes mindes sore fame gospel sounded noyse trompet wyde brode published feruencie fayth haue godwa de macedonia achaia also countreys nowe see nede v make reporte godlynesse begynne time speake matter readye theyr owne mynde tell v instructed commune brute tell howe entred firste vnto open gospel doctrine diligent readinesse receyued v etting al peril asyde semed like togod make v englishman ght thessalonian happen vnto sake howe ea ely trayned supersticion forefather wherwith wurshipped image deuils vnto true wurshippe god euer sence tyme abhorre false dead god serue true liuing god trusting vpon promisses passe nothing vpon pleasure lyfe vpon displeasure looke sonne iesus hath deliuered v freely vnto saluacio promised v rewardes lyfe come shal come againe heauen geue opely vnto world thinges hath promised god raysed hym vp againe vnto lyfe ende might also raysed againe vnto lyfe haue fruicion good thinges neuer shall dye life suffre displeasure worlde sake commyng shalbe ioyfully welcome vnto v inasmuche hath clensed v sinnes owne bloude reconciled v vnto god deliuered v eternall punishemente due transgression p chapter texte ye selues brother knowe entraunce vnto howe vayne euen suffred shamefully entreated philippos ye knowe bolde god speake vnto gospell god muche st yuing erhortacion bring errour yet vnclennes neither gyle alowed god gospel committed vnto v euen spake please menne god whiche tryeth hertes neither led conuersacion time flattering woordes ye knowe neither occasion couetousnesse god recorde neither sought prayse menne neither yet might haue autoritie apostle christe tendre among euen norsse cherisheth chrildren affeccioned toward ou good haue dea te vnto gospell god also ou owne soules ye deare vnto v nedeth v make rehersall seing ye selues knowe albeit came vnto bragging staring curiously mincing sorte great wordes setting high philosophie yet entraunce vnto vneffectuall wee suffred many thinges philippos selues knowe shamefully handled many spightefull rebuke also bicause castyng prophecieng spirite damsel possessed yet neuertheles helpe god afraied euen preache gospel christ frelye among also without excedyng great daungier wheras case preached forged vayne thyng neuer haue ben daunger head matter suche men teache theyr owne doctrine whiche haue receaued christ teache theyr owne avauntage intending therby disceaue others theyr owne lucre sake haue autoritie theyr doctrine al drawe themselues quite way sone drede daungier theyr lyues substaunce doctrine wherunto allured couterfaicted ne fayned neyther purposed vnto disceate ne yet vnder colourable pretence haue cloked impure science false apostle haue doen thing frauduletlie pretending outwarde apperaunce one waye purposyng inwardly clene contrarie waye vnder title chryste go owne pelfe maner make themselues apostle like god sonnegod sende v suche preacher hathe chosen v vnto office shoulde syncerely preache gospell committed vnto v euen preache vnto men crepe fauour commendacion menne office god may allowe seeth inward secretes harte accordyng therto estemeth euery man haue flatred man know least nether haue turned worde gospel tractable beleuyng oure owne gayne god himselfe witnesse vnto conscience nether haue hunted prayse men meanes gospell either handes wheras myght haue vsed autoritie brag lesse tha false apostle though teache vayne thinges gayne yet require honoured waited vpon considering becometh apostle christe humbled saluacions sake haue taken vpo v brag loke hygh haue shewed selues gentill sobre among eagrely abusing disciple wt al lenitie bearing weaknesse none otherwise mother nource would chearishe tender age child louingly affected towardes wer hartely desirous impart vnto onlye ghospell god foode soules also bestowe owne life loked reward handes loued entierly hertes none otherwise mother loueth owne child vpbrayd diligence rehearse louing affeccion texte ye remember brother oure laboure trauayle laboured daye nyght would chargeable vnto preached vnto gospel god ye witness god holyly iustly vnblameably behaued selues among beleued ye knowe bare suche affeccion vnto euery one father doth vnto child exhortyng confortynge besechyug ye woulde walke worthy god whiche hath called vnto hys kyngdome glory thys cause thanke god also without ceassynge ye reaceaued v woord wherewith ye learned knowe god ye receaued worde man euen dede word god worketh also beleue remembre brother forsoke laboure trauaile sake thyrsting mynding thyng el saluacion hunted litell rewarde handes wrought handelabour daye night get lyuing withal would burthen none false apostle cloute gospel among wrythe selues muche get haue preached gospel god vnto frely without thing witness god himselfe recorde holily vprightelye vnblameablie haue behaued oure selues towarde beleued know proued experience syncere loue al thinges towardes euery one euen affected father towardes owne child beseching comforting chargyng geue v thing leade lyfe worthy god whiche whan afore tyme voyde godlynesse hath called fayeth studie true godlinesse hathe also temporall affliccions called kingdome glory immortal al well acknowlage goodnesse god cause also redet thankes vnto continuallie kendlyng heartes suche sorte whan came poore basse estate vnto hauyng shewe dignitie set v forwarde yet soone hearde gospell preached v receaued fable word word came fro god dede himselfe spake eue v texte ye brother became folowers congregacyons god whiche iewry chryst iesu ye haue suffered lyke thynges ky smenne oure selues haue suffered iewes kylled lord iesus theyr owne prophetes euen haue persecuted v god please contrary men hynder v speake vnto gentile myght saued fulfil theyr synnes alwaye wrath god come euen vtmost word man weake vneffectual word god effectually mightie sone dronken ydle began worke power might euidently ynough appeare receaued thesame spirite incontinently began folow exaples congregacios god professed iesus christ iewrie christ rest iewes whiche embrace doctrine gospel haue suffred owne countrey menne vnto whome doctrine odious like haue also suffred owne townes men like kylled lorde iesus slewe prophetes bicause could abyde trueth euen also persecute v true gospel preacher blindnes harte prouoke euen wrath god vpon themselues rebell go al men enemyes mankinde men enuie al men saluacion offred faith go draw al men wt destruccio let v sort priuate displeasure enuy gentile wealthe trouble v intent preache gospell vnto gentile wherby myght saued though smal matter haue slayne prophetes byanby christ prophetes except persecute dispatch v waye also may finish whole heape mischeues lay sume totall wickednesse alwayes like manered themselues neuer repent madnesse reason wherof prouoke wrathe god sore vpon despaired forsomuch purposed malice spurne awaie mercy god al possible meanes oppugne gospel whose onely helpe myght deliuered destruccion texte muche brother kept season cocerning bodely presence herte enforced see personally great desyre therfore would haue come vnto paul agayne satan withstode v ou hope ioy crowne reioysing ye presence lorde iesus christes cumming yes ye glory ioy loue brother readinesse promptitude faythe enflamed louyng desyre beyng kepte tyme coulde haue fruicion company wherof wondrefully desirous although neuer absent minde yet could satisfie lone beare towardes except also presentlie se euen bodylyeies wherfore thought ynough send bodye speake letter paul went eftesones come selfe myght throughly confirme conscience satan withstode purposed endeuour wicked iewes hyndred cumyng vnto maruayle though bee desirous thyng world wherwith content myselfe wherof may aduauce myselfe wherof maye perswade myselfe enherite felicitie defie thinges incomparison gospel christ hope ioye crowne among others gentile haue wonne vnto christ also albeit sight worlde yet veryly lorde iesus christ whan enemyes gospell throwen vnder foote triumphe openly kepte cuming ensignes token victory shal bring forthe royall cumpany suche like meane tyme inassured hope thinges frute matier glorye ioye case perseuer vnto ende thinges haue begonne iii chapiter texte wherfore sence coulde lenger forbeare thought good remayne athens alone sent tymothe ou brother minister god helper forth labour gospel christe stablishe comforte concerning oute faith man moued affliccyons ye youre selues knowe euen appoynted thereunto tolde suffer tribulacion euen came passe ye knowe thys cause coulde lenger forbeare sent might haue knowleage faith lest meanes tempter tempted lest ou e labour eue bestowed vayne therfore inasmuche coulde suffre wante longer seeyng coulde come selfe thought good doe moste faythfull companion coulde doe selfe put stede selfe therfore taried still alone athene thence sente tymothe brother tryed minister god helpefelowe office haue doe gospell christ leauer wante comforte deare singular necessarie companion tyme geue occasion thinke vtterly geuen ouer lokyng state thinges verily haue sente hym cause owne chiefly sake myght establishe comforte conscience shewe paynfull affliccions wherewith tossed hereawaye therawaye myne harte nothing discouraged glorye gospell great deale better auaunced leste shoulde dismayed reason myne affliccions whiche heare tell must thinke neweltie though thinges happen preacher gospell asmuche knewe good goe chosen god ende suffring affliccions body myght auaunce name christ behalfe like lord maister euen whan present tolde suffre affliccion gospelles sake tolde see happened like also haue knowen happen nothing hapened vnto vnloked thig tolde afore haue lesse cause discouraged wherfore considering great care take euen whan thing surest coulde quiet long still sent tymothe sayed afore purpose hym well maner present selfe might knowe stedfastnesse fayth might trye yf kepeth continuall watche subuerte good tempted weaker sorte labour loste texte nowe lately timothe came vnto v declared v fayth loue ye haue good remembraunce v alwaye desi yng see v also desyre see therfore brother receiued consolacid al aduersitie necessitie fayth nowe alyue yf ye stande sted fast lord thankes recompence god againe ouer al ioy ioy sake god praying nyght daye exceadyngly might see presently might fulfyll thynges lackyng vnto fayth god hymselfe father lord iesus christ shall gyde oure iourney vnto lord also shall increace make flowe ouer loue one towarde another towarde men euen toward may make heartes stable vnblameable holynes god oure father commyng lord iesus chryst al sayn te whan tymothe late returned v againe brought v mery tydinges shewing persiste aswell constauntly fayth without shrinking also vnfeyned charitie beeyng sondre hathe brought v remembraunce haue v mynde alwayes cotinually euer desirous see v see necessitie sorowe pressed withall heare paciently sence knewe abode constantely fayth whiche whan afrayed nothing afrayed selfe thinke altogether safe fayth continue safe nowe liue thinke selfes deliuered al maner daugter case helpe christ iesu persiste constantly haue begun yrketh suffre euils frutes answerable whose sake abyde whiche thyng asmuche perceyue dede gospel groweth acquayntaunce among gentile dayly thankes worthy great benefite able redre vnto god whose goodnes excellent ioy wherwith reioyce withal harte foreward proceding chaunceth vnto v euen among sorowes god bearyng recorde vnto whose goodnesse bounde continue stedfaste whome oure duetie prayer daye nighte desyre thing ample wise mercy may one tyme see agayne personall presence thing doen nother letter messenger trustie euer hable accomplishe cause sake therfore desirous see entent gospellyke discipline wanting might supplie amende furthermore prayer canot doe meanes wicked persones god himselfe father sonne iesus christe lorde would vouchesafe take awaye lettes open free passage vnto also meane season encreace gyftes may see great comforte thyng shalbe case make aboundaunte plenteouse mutuall charitie among selues among selues also towardes men like also haue certayne excellencie loue towardes beyng ready euen suffre death saluacion would confirme conscience vprightenesse cannot blamed behalfe menne muche rather god father nothing escapeth cumming lorde iesus christe time shall openly appeare sight sainctes euery one hath doen also conscience euery one hath done p iiii chapter texte furthermore beseche brother exhorte lord iesus ye increace euen ye haue receyued v ye ought walke please god ye knowe commaundementes gaue lord iesus christ god euen holynes ye abstaine fornicacyon euery one know kepe vessel holynes honour luste concupiscence doe hethen know god man opresse defraude brother bargayning lord auenger al thinges tolde testified god hath called v vnto vnclennes vnto holynes therfore despiseth despiseth man god whiche hath sente holy spirite among moreouer brother beseche exhorte lorde iesus forasmuche nowe sufficiently taught v sorte ought behaue selues endeuours please god geue diligence perseuer still haue learned also excede selues dayly encreaces forewardenesse knowe remembre preceptes gaue autoritie selfe autoritie lorde iesus christe gaue none thynges commaundement false apostle cloute among ceremoniesthis god euen holynesse moses lawe excellencie vision angel though entraunce vnto saluacion thynges knewe certaynly acceptable vnto god wyll god kepe selues holy vnspotted onely chaste soule also body may abstayne whoredome wherwith body defiled body dwellyng house soule soule inne god lyke necessarie soule pure geaste god decente bodye pure enhabitour soule therfore let euery one knowe howe geue honoure sely carcas frayle vessel kepe cleane vndefiled suffre spotted disease filthy desyres lustes whiche thyng farre vnworthy state christian state nacion people haue knowlage god thinke euery one may lawfully doe lusteth without punishment honest pleasaut body mischiefe lust doubleth mischiefe case man ioyne iniurie brother whan man vsurpeth mannes wyfe let manne therfore eyther case matter vsurpyng ouermuche hymselfe defraude brother inasmuche god wil suffer none thinges vnreuenged seyng baptisme shal onely availe commit offence also make greuouse punishemente lyke haue tolde recorded vnto god hath called v ordinaunce former lyfe entente beyng washen cleane walowed filthinesse mainteyne holynesse puritie lyfe innocencie freely geuen v filthy desyres cast awaye v holy ghoste whiche louer chastitie matter say haue recorded doe recorde preceptes god whosoeuer contemneth contemneth man warning geuer god commaundement maker hath emparted holy spirite vnto purpose inspiracion embrace godlinesse holy spirite euery one worketh dispite filthy lustes polluteth owne body texte touchyng brotherly loue ye nede wryte vnto ye taught god loue one ye thing verily ye doe vnto brother whiche macedonia beseche brother ye encrease ye study quiete medle owne busines worke handes commaunded ye may behaue selues honestly toward without nothing lackyng vnto furthermore concernyng loue christian owe christian thinke necessarie admonishe letter taught immediatelye heauen spirite christ whereof haue tasted ye loue one another whiche thing declare dede loue brother christian loue onelye thessalonica also al macedonia myne exhortacion therfore shall vnto thyng owne accorde admonicion spirite excede selues go forwarde alwayes better better looke geue circumspect hede quietnesse interrupted meanes idle persos suche curious meddler mennes mattiers let euerye one applie owne businesse yf want substaunce wherof lyue let hym prouide owne handes maye bothe helpe hymselfe releue nedie like commaunded intent ye mighte behaue selues honestlye towardes haue professed christ whose handes shame profession either begge vncomelier thyng nede rather let euery one get handes want necessary thyng man easely satisfied content litell texte woulde brother ye shoulde ignoraunte concernyng whiche fallen aslepe ye sorowe whiche haue hope yf beleue iesus dyed rose agayne euen also whiche slepe iesus wyll god bryng agayne hym saye vnto worde lorde shal lyue shall remayne commyng lorde shall come ere slepe lorde hymselfe shall descende heauen showte voyce archangell trompe god dead christ shall aryse fyrst whiche shall lyue eucn shal remayne shall caught vp also cloudes meete lorde ayer shall euer lorde wherfore comforte selues one another wordes finally touchyng mistery resurreccion cannot contet haue ignoraunt leste make importune sorowfull mourning slepe truste promyses ghospell thoughe perished mourne saye example gentile whiche bewayle death theyr frendes haue hope theyr resurreccion death christian nothyng el slepe whiche shall awake agayne commyng christ lyue great deale blissefully shoulde truste thyng come passe membres knowe alreadye perfourmed head beleue verely iesus deade manier man rose agayne immortall life foloweth necessitie ought beleue also god father whiche raysed vp iesus wil also bring professed iesus slept assured truste promyses alyue agayne commyng sonne heade shal wante membres bable vnto humayne fable tell thyng learned christe hymselfe wete whiche shall founde remaining aliue world lordes coming shal presented sight iesus whiche dead afore presented also wil saye shall possible presented buried turned duste euen lorde iesus himselfe voyce aungell soundyng heauen trompette god shal rayse vp warne awake come quickly suche slept hope shall returne agayne vnto lyfe ryse theyr graues doen shall remayne bee founde alyue cumming christ shall sodainly taken vp together raised againe vnto life cloudes may mete lorde ayer thence shal carrye v heauen liue perpetuallie therfore see comfort euery one another sayinges death godly vere sore inasmuche worthy gratulacions reioycinges sorowfull lamentacions v chapter texte fynally tymes season brother neade wryte vnto ye selues knowe perfectly daye lorde shall come euen thefe nyght shal saye peace al thynges safe shal soden destruccyon come vpon sorow commeth vpon woman trauaylyng chylde shal scape ye brother darcaenes daye come thefe haue manier ordre resurreccion inasmuche conuenient knowe tymes season whan thinges shal parte office write vnto vnauayleable euen lord would open suche thyng vnto disciple whan demaunded hym knowe playnlye haue taught daye lorde shal come sodaynely vpon world vnloked euen thefe night breaketh vpon aslepe shall ouerlaye careles moste chiefely whan shall least loked whan suche beleue ghospel shal saye theyr moste ioylytie daungier peace safe lord wyll come theyr destruccion shall come sodainlye vpon like woman childe sodainly payned sorowe trauayle daye commeth loked shall haue waye escape oppression fele sodainly vpon daye shall dreadful daye beyng blynded theyr owne viciousnes leade lyfe night vnto brother dreadefull leste take vnprouyded texte ye chyldren lyght chyldren daye nyght nether darkenes therfore let v slepe let v watche sober slepe slepe night drocken droncken nyght let v whiche daye sober armed brest place fayth loue hope saluacion helmet god hath appoynted v prouoke wrath vnto oure selues obtayne saluacyon meanes oure lord iesu chryst dyed v whether wake slepe lyue together hym wherfore comforte selues together edifye euery one another euen ye folowe christe belong kyngdome darkenes kyngdome light god namely yf oure diligence godlynesse aunswerable profession yf lyue maye appere watche dayelight lye snourtyng darkenesse therfore wil taken vnwares let v sleape haue knowlage christes lyght let v watche sobre taking alwayes circumspect hede comit nothing vnaduisednesse maye offende iyes god men like slepe bodie sleape night wynedrunken drunken night euen yawne slumbre naughtinesse occupied darkenesse soule drunken lustes daliaunces worlde entangled darkenes mynde v vnto daie gospel hath cast light standeth v hande sobre watchyng alwayes prepared ready agaynst sodayne assaulte enemie kepeth continuall watche oure destruccion harnessed spirituall armour steade breste plate put fayth charitie helmet hope eternall saluacion shall nede distruste god ready himselfe defend watching god hath called v doctrine gospell purpose lyuing otherwyse maketh mencion double wrathe vengeaunce god vpon v obeying hym might obteyne saluacion helpe lorde iesus christ suffred death v intet chaunce v lyue maye lyue hym godlynesse hope immortalitie chaunce v dye maye lyue hym neuer dye thintent maye encourage euery one mutuall exhortacions styrre one another goe forwarde like alreadye euen owne accorde texte beseche brother ye knowe laboure among haue ouersight lorde geue exhortacion ye haue hye repucacion thorow loue theyr workes sake peace furthermore beseche brother haue cosideracion labour among haue ouersight teachyng ghospell admonishe thynges ought please christ bounden geue honoure vnto men yet haue regarde aboue others requiting loue bestowe vnto susteynyng many laboures daungiers sake yf reproue faultes tyme yet haue peace worthye hated reproueth man profite texte desyre brother warne vnruelye comforte feble mynded lyfte vp weake pacient towarde men se none recompence euyll euyll vnto man euer folowe whiche good among selues men reioyce euer praye continually thynges geue thankes wyll god thorow christ iesu towarde quenche spirite despyse prophecyinges eramen thynges kepe whiche good abstayne euel apperaunce god peace sanctifie thorowe praye god youre whole spirite soule bodye maye preserued nothyng ye maye blamed commyng lorde iesus christ faythfull whiche called whiche also brother praye v grete brother holy kysse charge lorde epistle red vnto holy brother grace lorde iesus christ amen thus beseche euerye man accordyng habilitie laye helpyng handes forewardyng office admonishe lyue owne lustes disquiet ordre obserue comforte weake harted releue feble gentill paciet towardes men onely towardes christian also straungers christ beware none recompense wrong wrong requite euill dede euill dede truely vnsemyng folowe ecample naughtie persones naughty matier become lyke condicioned vnto rather geue diligence good vnto folkes onely christian vnto christian also vnto maner folkes whether haue deserued deserued beyng certaynly assured yt diligence shall lost christ suertie consideracion wherof whatsoeuer chaunceth vnto reioyce alwayes godlynesse bee safe call vpon god prayer continually without ceassyng geue thankes whatsoeuer befalleth standeth god pleasure shall occasion alwayes rendre thankes vnto father bounteousnes warde iesus christe furthermore standeth hande take hede variaunce rise among reason euery one sondrye sortes giftes vnto one chaunceth gift tongue syng spirite albeit gift basest sorte yet quenche wise cherishe rather yt maye profyte better better vnto chaunceth gifte prophecie declare misticall sence scripture reiecte wyse whatsoeuer spoken suffre one paciently maye go forwarde heare others setence iudgement suche sorte muche molested speakyng let make muche owne giftes contemne another mannes trye al thynges let euery man holde thing iudgeth requisite whatsoeuer hath ye similitude good thyng despised notwithstandyng behoueth abhorre muche euil ought absteyne euen thynges haue shewe euill vnto matter shall parte applie diligent study god auctor peace vnto acceptable lyke consent mynde like speache wordes wholy vse together suche thynges honest bryng passe yt maye perfitely holy vnspotted soule maye answerable vnto spirite body aunswerable soule spirite selfe answerable god nothyng fynde faultie maye styll perseuer state holynesse continually vntil cumming lord iesus christ cause distruste sure promyse hath called vnto holynesse rewardes hymselfe shall finishe hath begonne perfourme hath promised brother helpe forewarde prayer labour go aboute salute brother kysse suche one commune sorte salutours doe geue holye kysse worthy christian loue charge lorde epistle rehearsed al holy brother grace beneuolent fauour lorde iesu christe alwayes amen thus endeth paraphrase vpon first epistle paul apostle thessalonian argument vpon seconde epistle paul apostle thessalonian de erasmus roterodame forasmuche paul coulde haue libertie goe see thessalonian agayne confirmeth conscience epistle myght manfully suffre affliccions layed vpon christes sake seeyng shall want reward aduersaries escape punishmet againe concerning daye lordes cumming wherof touched somewhat farther epistle warneth styrred sayinges affirme though hande thinke signifieth closely empire rome must first dispatched antichriste come moreouer beateth theyr heades earnestly restrayne suche idlenes nice curiositie haue disturbours commune quietnes ordre enforce vnto labour asmuche paul himselfe laboured among owne handes epistle wrote athens thesame men sente farther epistle recorded argumentes ende argumente paraphrase erasmus vpon ii epistle paul thessalonian fyrste chapiter texte paul syluanus timothe vnto congregacion thessalonias god father lord iesus christ grace vnto peace god father lord iesus christ bound thanke god alwayes brother mete fayth groweth exceadyngly euery one swymmeth loue toward another betwene selues selues boast congregacions god ouer pacience fayth persecucyons tribulacyons ye suffer whiche token ryghtewes iudgement god ye counted worthy kyngdome god ye also suffer verely ryghtewes thynge god recompence tribulacion trouble troubled rest v lord iesus shal shewe hymselfe heauen angel hys power flaminge fyre whiche shall rendre vengeaunce vnto knowe god obey gospell lord iesus chryst whiche shalbe punyshed euerlastinge damnacyon presence lorde glorye power shall come glorifyed hys saynctes become maruelous al beleue testimonye beleued euen thesame daye wherfore also praye alwayes god wyll make worthy thys callyng fulfyll delectacyon goodnes woorke fayth power name lorde iesus christ maye glorifyed ye hym accordynge grace god lord iesus christ paul siluanus tymothe vnto company faithfull assembled spirite thessalonica one mynde towardes god father lord iesus chryst bounden render aboundaunt thankes alwayes god aboundaunt liberalytie warde dooe onelye helpe continue stedfaste thinges haue begon also daylye encreace excedinglye faythe loue among selues one muche thynke necessarie kyndle vnto applyeng godlynes example seyng rather make boaste cogregacions god enflame vnto vertue example rehearsing pacience stedfastenes faythe persecucions affliccions suffer iuste iudgemet god may declared hereafter suche tyme whan haue suffred vexacio world glory name shal admit felowshipe hys kingdome contrary wyse shall commit vnto eternal punnyshement haue persecuted malice certaynly thys shall dealing goddes righteousnes pay vnto either parte rewarde worthie dedes punnyshe innocent affliccion bestowe vnto troubled v refreshing comforte v daye whan promisses gospel shall appeare whan lorde iesus shal shew himselfe heauen openly vnto world lowe base degre first commyng waited vpon companyes angelles comelye myghtie prince gentill tractable heale wicked armed horrible fierie flame rendre vengeaunce vnto would knowe god world obeye gospel lorde iesus chryste shall fele experience righteous mightie mercifull gentill set naught leaste maye learne owne punyshmentes perforce confesse thinges true gospel spake inasmuch neuer made end wicked shal suffer paine neuer shal haue ending whan haue loked vpon diuine face lorde maiestie power thei cotemned world rascal vile persone first commyng came saue al men shal come shewe selfe gloryous himselfe onely al membres also godly people intent may appeare wonderful al beleue gospel daye thinges shalbe openly seen al men trusted christ recorde bearing vngodly contemned would beleue daye maye prosperous ioyfull vnto ceasse praye lord continually forasmuche hath pleased call vnto hope thys glorye maye vouchesafe also bee presentlye ready helpe trauaile thitherwarde conuexsacion agreable profession consumate fynishe perfitely goodnesse hath begonne geue strength vnto soules manfullye bearing vexation vngodly maye declare howe myghtye assured hope eternal felycitie whose sake passe euen vpon life body intent like christ glorified father death glorified hym agayne resurreccion name lord iesu christ maye glorified sufferaunce glorified agayn daye commyng accordyng owne desertes according mercy god lorde iesu christe without whose helpe go none effect ii chapiter text beseche brother commyng oure lord iesu chryste shal assemble vnto ye sodenly moued mynde troubled neth r spirite neyther wordes yet letter shulde come v though th daye chryst hande let man deceaue meanes lorde shal come except ther come departyng fyrst synful man opened soone perdicyon aduersary eralted aboue al called god worshipped doth syt temple god boastynge hymselfe bee god remember ye yet tolde thynges nowe ye know holdeth euen myght vttered tyme mistery unquite doeth ready worcke tyll onelye letteth taken wa e th n shall wycked bevttred lorde shal consume spirite hys mouth shall destroye appeareaunce commynge fvrthermore brother besech comyng lorde iesu christ wherof spake littell afore felowship glory wherby membres shalbe fastened vnto head sodaynlye moued mynde though commyng prolonged astonyed myndes nether feyned prophecie ne probable assercio epistle set name though commyng lorde ready hand let deceaue meanes lorde shal come onles departing come first afore wicked man appeare childe perdicion like much vnlike vnto christe muche enemy exalted aboue sone god aboue al called god power deuoutly wurshipped muche shall sitte temple god shewing himselfe god doe remembre wha yet told thinges know let yt christ cummeth dede wicked man saied afore may propre tyme openly practise tyranny vpon sainctes wickednesse worketh crueltie vnderhand deuill wicked menne rageth professours gospell perceyue tellyng nothyng letteth aduersarie christe shewyng himselfe openly meane euery one holde still holdeth vntil kingdome wherwith holden subieccion dispatched quyte waye soone shall come passe shall wicked one shew himselfe abrode openly furnished al kynde iuggling caste wylie disceytes bryng mankynde destruccion rageing deuilish spirite lord iesus shall cheoke mightie blast mouthe bostyng false counterfaite shew diuinitie lorde shall obscure abolishe excellente clearenes cummyng euen monstreous sightes night time vayne appearaunces thinges vanishe goe waye shynyng bright sonne beames texte euen hym whose cumming workyng satan lying power signes woonders deceyuab ene vntyghtewesnes among perish receyued loue trueth might saued therfore god shall sende strong delusion beleue lye might damned whiche beleued trueth pleasure vnrightewesnes bounde geue thankes alwaye god brother beloued lord god hath begynnyng chosen saluacion thorow sanctifyeng spirite thorow beleuyng trueth wherunto called oure gospel obtayn glory lorde iesu christ wylie deceiuer shall cuming furnyshed spirite satan deuil shal practise crueltie intente maye cruelly worke myschiefe shall onely armed puyssaunt great power make men conscience afrayed also lyeng countrefaict caste signes wondres wherin shall pretende folowe christ euen learned enchauntours folowed example moses among egipcians briefe shall kynde fraude shalbe perfitely conyng worke wickednesse howbeit shal availe wise hurting perishe though owne vnbelefe thus obstinate rebellion christ demeriteth reward worthy desertes seing receiued christ might haue saued charitie sake desyrous haue al mene saued trueth sake opened playnly thinges belonged saluacion suffraunce god falsehead taketh place stede trueth tyranny charite destroyour saue thei shal beleue wicked ma lyenges inasmuch thei refused beleue sonne god yt preached nothing truth thus shal come passe yt thei otherwise haue also perished obstinate mysbelefe shall manifestly appeare mennes sight iustly damned forasmuche spightfully forsoke christe gaue credence first woorde craftie deceiuour wicked person stormy tempest lyke shal declare worthy damnacio shall sette forth stedfastnesse clearely reason whereof bounde rendre alwayes thankes vnto god christianly welbeloued brother suffred continue still errour chosed vnto saluacion beginning meanes moses law owne spirite geuer holynes obedience wherwith beleued trueth simply playnly besydes lyke chosed eternally begynning dyd call gospell preaching intent saluacion whiche beleued whan iewes beleued growe glorye lorde iesus christe texte therfore brother stande fast kepe ordinaunces ye haue learned whether oure preachynge epistle oure lorde iesu christ hymselfe god father hath loued v hath geuen v euerlastyng consolacyon good hope thorowe grace comforte youre hertes stablyshe good saying doynge gospell delyuered vnto true right gospell none ought loke therfore stand fast brother holde thinges delyuered vnto learned v eyther preachyng epistle vnto shall parte applie endeuour watching diligence moreouer lord iesus christ himselfe god oure father loued v owne accorde called v vnto saluacion spirite hathe geuen v eternall consolacion euen affliccions loke good hope rewardes life heauen meanes deseruinges owne free mercie conforte harte establishe confirme perseuer goodnes worde dede iii chapter texte furthermore brother praye ye v worde god maye haue passage gloryfyed also maye delyuered vnreasonable froward men al men haue fayth lord faythfull shall stablyshe preserue cuyll haue confydence thorowe lorde warde ye bothe wyl thynges commaunde lorde gyde hertes loue god pacience chryste fvrthermore brother like oure supplicacions god helpe foreward busynesse saluacion euen reaso semblable case set forward thinges goe prayer also like doctrine gospel spedy prosperous encrease among may runne abrode published among menne spedynesse whereof praye maye helpe delyuered suche men peruerse frowarde whiche hyndre withall theyr possible meanes doctrine christe sowen without lette hinderaunce beleue gospell heare gospell yet cause beleue theyr wicked endeuours spurne gospell shall spurne away hath sure protectour euen lord iesus shall make stedfaste vnruly wickednesse kepe euill finishe hath begunne true promisses fayle succoure fayle folowe goodnesse helpe diligent endeuourers thus speake doubt constant stedfastnes haue rather firme trust lyke helpe lord iesu doe gaue commaundemet ye wil doe stil hereafter conclude lord iesus grace gouerne harte may goe right course grow forward charitie god loking iesu christ charitie wil cause
