study continually deserue well men like god bounteonsly good men lokyng christes commyng shall make abyde manfully maner affliccions texte requyre brother name lorde iesu christe ye withdrawe selues euery brother behaueth himselfe inordinately institucion receiued v ye selues know ye ought folow v behaued selues inordinately among neither tooke bread man naught wrought labour sweate nyght daye would chargeable autoritie make selfes eusaple vnto folow v warned yf would worke thesame shoulde cate haue heard saye whiche walke among inordinately workyng beyng busybodyes suche commaunde exhorte lord iesu christ worke quietnesse eate theyr owne bread brother ye wery well doyng yf among contemneth folowe trade lyuing whiche haue prescribed vnto rule gospel ly e carelesly lusteth himselfe ydlenes disquiet commune affaire yet albeit doe naught himselfe busye medler mennes doinges commaunde autoritie lorde iesu christe withdrawe selfes company haue name christian shall yrke folowe example v albeit vsed honour charge apostelship yet greued v neuer whitte brought basse ordre among tooke vpon v men insomuche tooke somuche piece breade man cost forgote dignitie office gatte labour hades working day night thinges necessaryly requisite vse lyuing would burthen man thought vnlawfull v doe apostle doe would vse right myght haue doen would set selues forme ensample men greued folowe whiche selues dede commaunded woorde yf would worke thesame eate deserue liuing watchenight day saluacio idle curiositie curious idleues deserueth refreshing haue hearde among disquiet order worke hauing naught doe theyr owne must nedes medle men busynesse yet spare name whosoeuer commaunde yf leauer doe hertily beseche lorde iesus christe disturbe commune quiet idlenes inasmuche doe naught themselfes hyndre occupied lette quietly worke also getting liuyng owne handes rather greuouse vnto shamles crauinges vnsemelines dede worthy haue nay aske howbeit stadeth christian humanitie doe deserue litle eyther men peraduenture maye amende better therfore brother weary well doyng worthy also vnworthy texte man obey saying sende v woorde letter haue company may ashamed counte enemy warne brother lord peace geue peace alwayes meanes lorde al salutacion paul myue owne hande token epistle wryte grace lorde iesus christe amen despise doe admonicions aswel gaue whan present nowe wryte beeyng absent let punishmet ynough christian charitie may haue lyuing condicions yet let noted put company intente beeyng ashamed may repent amende cast vtter enemy rather admonishe brother went astray mynde haue amended destroyed eschewyng company may loue harte neucrthelesse diuorcement charitie alloweth receiued time hath offended may repent furthermore lord iesus autor peace graunt perpetuall peace affaire lord euer salutacion paul wryte vnto agayne myne owne hande token shall obserue myne epistle written eyther wryte man shall deceyue counterfayte letter fauour beneuolence lorde iesu christe euermore amen p thus endeth paraphrase vpon latter epistle paul apostle thessalonian erasmus roterodame ryght reuerende byshop mooste excellent prynce traiecte philip burgundye sendeth gretyng albeit monethes feldes lye bare barein mooste honourable prelate yet tyme yeare feldes learnynge brynge forthe one profytable croppe none rugged wynter profyte aryseth feldes wherin good studyes sowen thynketh standeth indyfferent reason great porcion cut therout geuen bishop chiefe ploughman husbandrye oure power laye oure helpyng handes furtheraunce gospell parte serue turnes office ought care consyderacion wherof haue doen muche wyllynglye argument matier selfe prouoked therunto haue expounded waye paraphrase two epistle saint paule tymothie one titus wherunto haue added stedde perfyte ende tha wrote philemon bycause lefte alone vndoen beyng hyndermoost though treate lyke matier doe yet nothing paules wrytinge perteigneth offyce byshop three former epistle paynteth wondrefull maner setteth forthe ymage righte true christian prelate qualynes gyftes behoueth garnyshed withall called arduous trauayll dueties doe taketh offyce hande harde mattier playe partes blameles byshop syde howe pernicious daungier ordryng mannes lyfe haue corrupte keper lordes flocke euidetlye appearaut paule geueth commaundement thing instauntlye carefully doeth often rehearsal maketh alwaye one thing howe often beateth mattiers spake afore howe many tymes doeth beseche charge adiure al holy nowe fayre speache promyses nowe feare allurynge people example somtyme himselfe somtyme christ nowe seyng paule afrayed quayling whome instructed owne teachinge whome also ordayned layeng owne handes searched throughly tryed faithfulnes integritie many maner wayes howe muche daungier daye committe office weyghtye importaunce vnto man auenture without good ad uisement tymes past euery citie resident byshop owne yet city howe small porcion folkes thatprofessed christe besydes dayes bloude christ yet feruent reme brauce mennes haries bicause lately sheade heauely fyer geuen men baptisme yet flamyng hoote whiche thinges tell howe bothe seme colde present conuersacio cause sake byshop onely charge ouersyght fewer nowe also suche obedyent without compulsion thynketh therefore matier muche dyfficultie daye playe faithfull vncorrupte byshop onely one man hathe autoritie ouer many tounes muche moost parte ouer besydes dyspensacion teaching gospe l whiche ye chiefest peculiar office byshop burthened administracion secula e office wondrous matter talke euyll worlde christ agree one harde thinge heauenly busynes worldly affaire one concorde seyng great weyghtye mattier doe either bothe saye eyther good byshop profytable prince busye piece worke man tangled bothe wayes ordre mattier leaue paite office vndone eyther touching spiritual charge temporall autoritic content mortall prince offende prince immortall fauour wt courte come fauour heauen tymes past soeuer toke office byshop vpon must hande haue prepared selfe wyllynglye abyde al stormes persecucions yet passeth knowledge saye whether daungier tranquillytie worlde goeth case tranquillitie stormye tempestes dayes althoughe reason altring state thinges possible maner vsynge bysshoppes office shoulde throughly al thinges alwayes one sorte yet thing vtterly condemned varieth example age nether mutable changeinges humayne mattiers doe alwayes permitte byshop brynge passe thing thinketh best doen lyke master shyp bothe experte vigilaunt doeth good somtymes sittyng helme caried awaye wynde wether wyll yet withstandynge shall goe lesse waye syncere perfyte image good byshop wyll haue forme paule certaine directorie alwayes eye lyke stoute gouernour shyppe albeit dryuen parforce goe somtyme great deale right course doeth set eye besydes ye compasse loode sterre lest shoulde chaunce goe quyte ame together althoughe man doe paule al thinges yet somwhat yf folowe example thinges wyll endeuour himselfe thinges best doen shal faile forewardenes christes helpe whose vicegerent lordeshyp without helpe men goeth aboute vayne fare ye well yeare mdxix p argument vpon first epistle paule vnto tymothie erasmus roterodame tymothies mother iewe borne howbeit christian father greke timothee beyng honest manierly towarde yonge man well learned holy scripture paule chosed ministre yet bycause iewes compelled circumcide forasmuch committed vnto timothie dyd also titus cure congregacions coulde goe himselfe instituted office byshop dysciplyne congregacion geuing admonicions dysciple sonne felowe office thintent might doe autoritie doeth often vindicate autoritie apostleshyp vnto selfe paule admonisheth hym reiecte suche woulde brynge iewyshe fable teache thinges pertaine faithe charitie forasmuche ye ordre citie tranquillitie commune wealthe dependeth autoritie prince magistrate woulde onely haue autoritie thoughe ethnykes contemned christianes also commaundeth prayed prescribeth comely bothe men woman vse open congregacion paynteth byshop shoulde hys householde treateth almoost al three firste chapiter warneth receaue iewyshe fable speaketh choyse meates forbyddyng mariage teacheth straightwaies shoulde behaue himselfe towardes olde men towardes yongmen towardes olde woman towardes yougwomen towardes wydowes well riche poore ought founde commune stocke congregacion towardes yonger woman towardes suche yet suspecte age furthermore prescribeth vnto must commaunde maisters seruauntes ryche men admonyshing reiecte possyble meanes contencious sophisticall question haue nothing vayne shewe learnyng epistle wrote laodicea tychicus deacon thus endeth argument paraphrase erasmus vpon fyrst epistle paule apostle timothee first chapter texte p paule apostle iesus christ commyssion god sauioure lorde iesus christ oure hope vnto timothe naturall sonne faith grace mercy peace god oure father lorde iesus christe oure lorde besought abide yll ephesus depatred macedonia euen thou commaunde folowe straunge docrtine uerber geue hede fable endles genealogy brede doute godly edifying whiche faith ende commaundement loue apute herte good conscience fayth vnfayned whiche thinges haue erred turned vnto vayne iangelynge woulde doctours lawe yet vnderstande speake neyther wherof affirme paule apostle messagier lest woulde suspecte goe aboute myne owne busynes humayne affaire messagier moses anye man messagier iesu christ whiche beyng sent late owne person vpon father message dyd faithfullye finyshe busynes hym sent toke message vpon myne owne head nether receaued man onely called vnto appointement euerlastyng god also dryuen perforce vnto commaundement autoritie muche itby co mission god sauiour choyse shyfte inyne handes office payneful whiche enioyned vnto autoritie god onely au toure saluacion euer sonne hathe enioyned v father autoritie doe take enioyned father himselfe whome also bounden vnto saluacion aswell redemed death eternal destruccion also mightye helpe delyuered rageyng tempestes afliccions albeit chaunce set lybertie tyme yet cause shoulde doubte safe preseruacion hauynge christe protectoure whome father hathe appointed bothe example autour oure moost certaynly assured hope lyke whan whypped nayled crosse suffred corporal death howbeit rose anon againe lyfe neuer shall dye euen whan haue bene oppressed present sorowes worlde shall one daye restore v alyue againe immortalitie respectes sake paule beyng streynghtened throughe autoritieto natural sonne mayntenaunce inuincible apostle writeth vnto tymothe true natural sonne haue chosen quod mannes flocke begat selfe bowel myne ye gospel wha yet straugier fro christ parte like expressely resembleth father stedfastnes sinceritie faith pure teaching gospell appeareth euident matier dede suche maye doubted whether myne natural owne vndoubted bogotten sonne therfore great deale dearely beloued vnto tha yf gotten bodily substaunce commune maner men doe bodely substaunce begetteth child shall lyue whyle gospell borne lyue alwayes neuer dye parentes haue peculiar nerer hattie loue suche child mooste lyke fauoured vnto therby doe wer knowe suerly owne muche iust cause haue loue sonne whome begate vnto christ faithe gospell andin faith whome beholde synceritie faithe borne new againe let iewes make boaste pleasure geating one companion childe gotten adopcion moses boaste haue gotten suche sonne faythe gospell vnto christe expedient iewes synagoge hence forthe geue ouer bearing child tyme gospell spreade forthe frutefulnes faith abrode whole vniuersall worlde nowe lyke haue manyfolde cause boaste suche sonne inasmuche maye safely committe vnto office gospell preachinge euen thynke cause shoulde repente hauyng either suche apostle father haue committed parte myne owne office vnto howbeit god hath geue autoritie thus doe soe stande doubte touching charge congregacions appointed onles peraduenture dysturst autoritie god nowe shoulde beyng mooste louyng father wyshe vnto entierly deare beloued sonne thinges elles supreme gouernour lyfe woulde haue v ryche plentuous whiche would fayne haue v growe stronge dailye vntyll growen vnto state christ may voutchesafe knowe v owne lawfull brother therfore wyshe gracegrace mercy peace vnto maye perfytely vnderstande faithfull beleuers saued free benefite christ without helpe moses law onely grace mercye also alwayes ready present helpe succoure hym trauayle amonge many daungerous mutacions thinges ignoraunt combrous stormes lyfe preacher endaungered withall fynally propretye profession wyshe peace concorde loke receyue benefites worlde whose succour vayne nether moses pernicious matier haue trust shadowes sence true lighte gospell shoone clearly forthe ne yet mortall man god father forsaketh faithfully trust sonne iesus christ lorde lyke hath thinges commune father eue fayleth helpe haue one wholy committed selues vnto fidelitie faithfull seruauntes depende together suche maister none compared vnto either goodnesse power thou knowest naturall deare sonne hurly burly whatas besought daungyer lyfes wynne congregacion vnto christe vnknowen vnto howe dilygentlye false apostle watche euery place goe drawe vnto moses lately entred yonglinges haue gathered together vnto gospel none purpose get flocke dysciples selues estimacion among commune people studye enlarge deminions gospelles possession vttermoost power neuertheles maye maynteyne ready gotten shorte forasmuche personally present place must nedes accomplyshe whiche behynde partely sendynge epistle partly ministerie felowe officer consyderacion wherof tyme went againe macedonia necessarie affaire gospel bycause ephesias shoulde vtterly destitute left eue selfe haue autoritie notable vicegerent excellent paynefull office thou seest generall sorte men wonderfullye enclyned bothe supersticion vnto curious artes notwithstandyng glorye gospel muche highly aduaunced aduersaries many cruell nede set fete fast grounde sayethat thou commaunde stande stronglye wherfore thing whan went thence required doe beyng absent eftsones beseche praye doe thou warne corrupte apostle whose name passe ouer aduysedly tyme lest beyng therby prouoked waxe shameles defyle ne subuert pure doctrine gospel taught ephesian new doctrine parte warne faithfull flocke hande geue light eare intendaunce suche false apostle owne peryll teache thinges auayle eternall saluacion worthye gospel christ cloute sorte vnfrutefull iewyshe fable touching supersticious constitucions men auayle rote true godlines perplexe ordre pedegree rehearsed grandefathers great grandefathers great great grandefathers thoughe gyfte saluacion taught gospel deriued vnto v corporall lynage descending sorte degree sondry auncetours rather heauely goodnes powred vntuersally vpon embrace fayth gospel geare preache glorye christ partly selues maye pryce amonge commended noble doctours partly intent forasmuche gospelles doctrine playne symple eyther taken muche greater learned men bycause cloute meignye doubtefull dyfficulties neuer made playne sorte riedles haue exposicion thoughe thinges mooste beste moost playne gospel bryngeth saluacion beleuer small towme kynde mennes doctrine bryngeth question vpon question onely nothing auayleable vnto heauenly godlynes god geueth v throughe faythe also turneth vp syde downe chyefe poynt gospelles religion whosoeuer beleueth purely passeth vpon question knytteth vnknitteth knottes question thing doeth teache men stande doubte curiositie questionyng aduersarye fayeth yf beleue god doe haue quarell promysses yf faythe loue gospel geue saluacion without muche doe purpose mennes phantasy myngled wt cuttynge foreskynne wasshynge handes choyse meates obseruacion dayes make vaunt vnto lawe geuen god yet teache teache greuously learnedly vnderstande summe ende lawe wherto man labour saluacion meanes many wiery obseruacions seyng maye let alone flye streight waye prycke selfe conynglye learned ynough moses lawe hathe atteyned effectes law briefe thing comprehedeth accomplisheth al whole efficacie moses lawe shorte summe loue case procede pure hertethe ende lawe loue vpright conscience vnfeyned faith without holownes perfite syncere loue telleth great deale ryghtelyer doen constitucions howe many soeuer case loue presente nede prescriptes lawe yf present auayleth obseruacion lawe humayne loue many time blotted affeccios standeth many tymes corrupte conuersacion somtymes comprehendeth full entier trust god euangelicall loue propertie neuer deceaueth neuer wauereth neuer ceasse doynge godly geueth respecte none purpose glorye christ comoditie neighbour ne dependeth onely christ pricke forasmuche mysse therfore stedde sure doctrine christ strawe abrode vayne smoke mystes iewishe question thintent might seme gaye doctours law set selues vayne bablyng whan vnderstande specialty thinges speake wherof affirme whole lawe moses although otherwyse dyuerse dyffuse collected christe alone seyng lawe selfe applieth vnto christ shame man professe selfe doctoure lawe interpreteth lawe contrary christes mynde howbeit speake thus though condemned ye law moses texte p knowe lawe good yf man vse lawfully knowynge lawe geuen vnto ryghteous man vnto vnryghteous dysobedient vngodly synners vnholy vncleane murtherers father murtherers mother man ear whormongers defyle theselues mankynde menstealers lyars periured yf eny thing co trarye holsome doctrine accordynge gospel glorye blessed god whiche gospel committed vnto thancke christe iesus lorde hath made stronge counted true put offyce blasphemer persecuter syraunt obtayned mercy dyd ignorauntlye thorowe vnbelefe neuerthelesse grace lorde exceadynge aboundaunt faith loue whiche christ iesu doe bothe knowe acknowledge law good onles vnlawfully vsed abusour lawe expoundeth otherwyse meaneth selfe chiefest purpose lawe lede v vnto christ turneth lawe whiche good owne destruccio lawe draweth folkes awaye christ dyscerneth espieth behalfe law geuen tyme must geuethe law good place gospell parte oughte continue perpetuall strenght vnderstandeth sorte applye grosse lettre lawe vnto spirituall doctrine gospel perceaueth whome christ hath redemed bloude tyrannye synne doe vpon owne accorde mocion loue moses law appointeth haue nede feare admonicion lawe eyther restrayned naughtines stiered duetye doyng dede lawe good vnderstandeth lawe belongeth hathe learned gospell onely hurte bodye also doe good vnto enemyes wherto shoulde horse nede brydle spurre runneth frely well shoulde doe ledde ordred spirite christ runne vncompelled doe al whole law requireth hauyng frely atteyned ryghteousnes abhorte vnryghteousnes therfore lawe feare restrayneth euyll doinges notthe lawe geue vnto righteous man geuen wyse vnto doe wyllynglye gladly whiche lawe requireth althoughe haue wordes law tha lawe ordayned veraylye vnto turne deafe eare towardes lawe nature beyng without loue readyly enclyned al myscheafe guyded owne lustes onles holden backe barre lawe case lawe suffre synne vnpunished tha returne owne dysposicion become openly wer inwardelye saye vniuste rebelles wycked vngodlye dysobediet impure kyllers father mother horemongers defylers themselues mankynde man robbyng theues lyers periured person threatnynges lawe iustlye obiected iewes prone myschiefes restraine slauyshe vyle nature wicked dooinges rehearsed feare punyshement maner naughtines againste excellent lawe gospell whiche moses gaue v blessed god selfe delyuered v onely sonne iesus iewes make boaste law glorious lawe haue muche glorious bragge autor moses wee great deale iuster cause boaste autor god christ preache lawe moses restrayneth certaine sorte great notable crymes punyshement preache lawe gospell whiche dyspatcheth lustes contrarye true godlynes autour preachynge moses lawe leat loke selues dede put trust preache honourable myghtye puyssaunte gospell nedeth none ayde law comitted vnto men god selfe thinke worthye condicion haue weightye matter committed vnto deseruynge goodnesse god vnto whome rendre thankes geuing strenght vnto suche wretched bodye ferre vnmete office glorifye iesus christe lorde whose busynes doe faithfully lyke faithfull seruaunt yet chalenge none commendacion selfe lyke hathe thought faithfull minister preache gospell euen doe syncerelye vnfeynedlye laboure office hathe put trust withal without folowynge example preache moses lawe christes reproche onely seruyng owne gayne glorye selues iesus christ confesse tymes past ledde blyndenes long continued zeale lawe father blasphemer name christ cruell persecutour coulde neuer lynne doynge vyolence persecuted springing glorie gospel onely wt braulinges also eue vnto enprisonynge murtherynge yet hitherto behynde men nothing peraduenture case preferred inasmuche dyd thinges onely symple stickyng lawe throughe errour ignoraunce inasmuche yet called feloweshyp gospell haue professed christ yet beyng enemyes glorye muche desyrous owne doe malicious obstinacie cloute vnprofitable burthen moses lawe cause sake seyng dyd thus onely ignoraunce god mercye vpon wher blynded euery daye feruentlye fought lawe agaynst christ hartylye nowe defende doctrine christ affirmours law stede earnest vehement studye law whiche put awaye grace hathe succeded haboundauntly stedde trustyng lawe faithfull trustyng christ commen place stede malicious hatred iewes charitie towardes men entred whiche haue obteyned bothe example gyfte christ texte p true sayinge meanes worthye receaued v christ iesus came worlde saue synners whome chefe notwithstandynge cause obtayned mercy iesus christ shoulde fyrste longe pacience declare ensample vnto whiche shoulde beleue vnto eternall lyfe vnto god kynge euerlastinge immortall inuysyble wyse onely vonoure prayse euer euer amen commaundement commit vnto thee sonne tymotheus accordynge prophecyes whiche tyme past prophecyed thou shouldest fyght good fyght hauyng faith good conscience haue put awaye nd concernyng faith haue made shypwracke whose nombre hymeneus alexander whome haue delyuered vnto satan maye learne blaspheme iewes haue nothing saye againste althoughe sayde goodnes god without helpe law becommen wicked myscheuous man thinge semeth vnto vncredible moost euident argumentes vndoubtedly true thing renounce withal studious endeuoure embraced saye meting armes iesus christe seyng lawe vneffectuall vnto perfite saluacion made man came owne person worlde thintent throughe death myght geue v perfyte healthe suffring peynes vnrighteousnes myght geue vnto v owne ryghteousnes fynally albeit earnest mayntenoure law father yet doe onely excepte selfe nombre sinner also knowledge euen chiefest among wyll denye myne vncleanesse redoundeth vnto glorye christe lesse deserue mercye excellent clemencye worthye punyshement howe commeth passe christ would onely pardon myne offence declare excedynge gentilnes towardes also enriche many great free gyftes purpose notable example prouoke men hope lyke forgeuenesse fylthily soeuer haue lyued put trust ayde moses lawe set whole faith christes goodnesse continueth v styll vnto euerlastynge lyfe promysses great promyse maker trustye sure man shall put mystrust promyses considereth christ promyse maker case man coulde contemne man hauyng suffred vpon crosse yet let consydre moost highe euerlastyng kynge god father immortall inuisible onely wyse chiefe autor busines sonne geueth v thinges therfore nothyng ought seme incredible almyghtye god promyseth men chalenge themselues parte habilitie geue singuler treasure forasmuche ought haue honour glorye certayne yeares glorye moses lawe age euermore besemeth immortall god haue immortall honour haue sayed true matter dede lyke faithfully behaue selfe busynes appointed vnto euen doe geue commaundement louyng sonne timothye thou folowe thy father example accomplyshyng offyce thou haste taken vpon throughly poynctes goddes busynes thou takest hande wherunto thou wast called promocion man appoinctement commaundemet god vnder baners thou arte souldiour thou shalte receaue rewardes victorie thou seest bande men thou hast committed thy credence thou seest maner aduersaries thou haste doe none oportunitie neglygent slepe thy matter greatest shame worlde wycked parte shrynke himwe haue lyke aduersaries lyke diliget preacher whose wordes thou arte sworne vnto whose name thou hast professed iudgemet thou wouldest proue valeaunt faithful guide spirite christ inspiracion shewed vnto v suc tyme committed autoritie priesthoode vnto layeng handes see therfore thou constauntlye answer aswell iudgement god gauepaul made priest layeng hades without anoputynge faythfull truste haue god maye bothe prayse noble guyde maye reknowledge myne owne sonne excellent warre thou arte occupied see thou applye manfully shalbe case thou kepe syncere perfite fayth vnto faithe ioyne good conscience thou put doubte goddes promysses frame thy selfe vprightenesse lyfe accordynge synceritie thy iudgement purenesse lyfe ought suche efficacie maye onely allowed men also conscience maye vpright god thinges decaye strength faithe humayne questionsfaith conscience appetite thinges defile conscience wheras pretende goe christes affaire haue respecte purposesthe cause decay faith good conscience vnto christ fynallye two clcaue faste one yf one decayed ieoperdie hathe syncere conscience possibly haue syncere faithe howe thing called syncere dead thinge endure wanteth lyfe spirite commeth passe whiche haue naughtie conscience thinges length fall cleane awaye beleuynge thinges gospell teacheth concernynge rewardes eyther innocent lyfe naughtye lyfe example matter haue lately seene muche true ala therfore alexander himeneus inasmuch preaching gospell holde faste helme vpright conscience fallen rockes infidelitie beynge fallen holsome profession christ caryed awaye waues naughtye lustes rayled open spitefull wordes doctrine gospel possybly amended gentyll monicions therfore haue myne owne sentence geuing cutte rest christes bodye rotten membres thintent beyng corrected maye learne throughe shame reproche ceasse wycked spyghtful railynges lesse hurtefull thoughe good themselues pulled vnder rigorous handlyng growen highe wickednes good doone vpon gentyll remedyes therfore onely iudgement god touching thy synceritie onely myne example onely thyne owne profession thou arte souldiour christ also suche mennes abominable example ought kyndle thy harte doe thyne offyce throughly thou shouldest doe ii chapter texte p exhorte therfore aboue thinges prayer supplicacions intercession geuyng thankes men kynges auctorite maye lyue quiete peaceable life godlynes au honesty good accepted syght god sauioure whiche wyll haue men saued come vnto knowledge trueth one god one mediatoure betwene god man euen man christ jesus whiche gaue hym selfe raunsome men shoulde testifyed tyme whenunto ordeyned preacher apostle tell trueth christ lye beynge teacher gentyls wi faith veritie ynoughe without fault thy selfe parte byshop prescri e also vnto necessarye doe ought suche thinges maye appeare worthy euangelical conscience briefe standeth hande professe christ moost ferre om desyre reuengement desyre hurte kynde dyspleasure therfore see thou exhorte thyne begynne first thing doe mornynge vse godlynes worshyp christ first al let praye god put awaye thinges trouble disquiet state religion commune wealthe let aske thinges auayleable godlye doyng tranquillitie commune wealth doen let beseache christe nothing elles suche persecute flocke ayde succoure laste let thankes rendred vnto thinges goddes goodnes haue happened earnest supplicacions made thinges haue yet happened let doen onely christian maner men also lest christian loue shoulde appeare straite laced loue though fauoured none owne sorte set extended abrode moost large maner thexample god bothe good badde lyke beyng parfitely good beneficiall much bestoweth sonne shyne vnto iuste also vniust asmuche god geueth v publique quietnesse meanes ethnike ruler reason thankes rend ed also vncertayne v whether ruler beyng wycked ymage worshypper shall shorte space receyue gospel cause christian loue wyssheth saluacio al iewe loueth iewe newly entred secte loueth lyke greke loueth greke borther loueth brother kynsman loueth kynsman gospellyke loue gospellyke loue loueth godlye christ loueth wycked maye pente turne vnto christ doe sacrifice vnto deuylles curse ou bytterlye contrary wyse cleaue harde fotesteppes christe whan exalted vpon ye crosse reuiled wt spyght full rebuke greuous punyshemente crosse selfe gaue none euyll wordes againe cursed bytterly againe excedynge great crye besought father forgeue praier made onely whole general sorte also especially kinges yea though ethnikes straungiers profession christe publique ordre worlde set autoritie let moue afflicted beaten caste pryson put death rather theyr blyndenes pitied malyce requitte malyce elles shalbe neuer better shall ceassethe chiefe pollicie bringeth christ christian charitie also christian waye pleased christe waye mooste speciall efficacie wherwith woulde haue dryuen selfe thoughe vpon loue lost yet wee wyll geue ouer lyke oure selues al world hath ordre expedyent shoulde dysquyet seyng duetye procure peace euery place power autoritie purpose doeth seruice vnto iustyce god holde vnder euyll doer punishementes kept naughtye one duetie put awaye robberyes martiall power defende publique peace gouerne commune wealthe lawes thinges albeit doe loue christ yet generaltye expedient state commune wealth shoulde dysturbed meanes v lest doctrine gospell shoulde seme sedicious doctrine shoulde begynne runne hatered bycause professe christe bycause hynder publique peace case abuse power vpon v tyme christian man parte forget euyll turnes remembre good turne bounden autoritie bounde defence marciall power yea rather bounden god maye safe sedicions safe robbynge safe battayles leade quiet lyfe without trouble woulde doe well haue remembraunce greate sea myschiefes hurly burly warre bryngeth comodities peace hath many myschiefes beggerly nede necessarie thinges procureth peace bryngeth plentie peace oportunitie vse godlynesse warre teacheth maner wyckednes profession loueth chaste behauiour warre safely chaste shoulde thoughe men moost parte abuse benefyte peace wycked sensuall purpose yet let v vse publique peace seruing god integritie honest manner obeying prince meane season al thinges eyther commaunde v rightely accordinge office elles doe nothing vnto v make v punyshed person wicked person take awaye substaunce yet parte honestye dyminished lade v fetter drawe v away christ slea body sende v ouer hauen immortalitie myght hurte v dede could make v couetous yf coulde make v afrayed deathe yf coulde make v desyrous life could make v ambicious could make v desyrous reuengement yf coulde make v distrust christ therefore prynces neyther vnhonestly slattered sediciously repugned case godlye requisite anye tyme ghospelles behalfe contemne theyr commaundementes yet muste done suche temperauce may perceaue v doe displeasure good wyll vnto godlynes notwithstandynge geue monicion hereof purpose wee farre vnhable matche worldlye power shoulde prouoke puyssaunce vpon v owne harme kinde lenitie shoulde resemble christe oure prince whan coulde alone haue done prynces ruler worlde yet leauer wynne worlde himselfe sufferyng euill repellyng requityng euyll leauer wynne conquest gentle dealynge reuengyng leauer heale destroye leauer entice oppresse waye wonne victorie fashion father pleasure sonne shoulde beare bell awaye example behoueth v folowe case wyll haue oure prayer case wyll haue sacrifice welcome acceptable vnto woulde rather sauioure vnto v vengeaunce taker grea e gentilnes suffred impietie tyll came repentaunce thynge come passe v lyke passyng greate goodnes woulde also haue come passe men yf possible sauiour excludeth none saluation bryngeth lyghte ghospell vnto refuseth wythdraweth hymselfe leat hym blame hymselfe owne blyndnes perisheth perisheth throughe owne faulte phisician doo yf sicke doo refuse holsome medicine verilye long men atteyne saluation suppressyng blyndnesse lyfe paste come lyght euangelycall trueth christe trueth confesseth shalbe safe kynde lyfe soeuer come hym saluation one thynge commeth one one alone offred vnto ther thyng behalfe iewe maye chalenge himselfe owne one god peculya thys sorte people commen god indifferently one reconsyleth mankinde vnto god god man christ jesus conuenient whiche shoulde make arbitreu ente concorde bytwene god menne shoulde haue thynge commen wyth bothe party beyng god myghte make intercessyon god beynge man myghte reduce men agayne fauour doeth man chalenge properly hym selfe commune father sent saue al gaue selfe redemption mete v endeuour meanes hys death maye indifferently auayleable vnto case died euen ethnikes shoulde yrke v offre sacrifice prayer god theyr saluation haue bene doubted tyme christe came vniuersall saluation gentile nowe certaynly manifest proued matier dede christes death belongeth aswell gentile jewes tymes paste iewes parti cie somwhat borne withal bycause fynd fault contemned caste anone god haue playnely protested difference al nation supersticion condicion flee doctrine gospel matier goddes pleasure haue chiefely preacher behalf would haue messagier rest apostle slowlye wyth leasure wyth muche doe admytted gentyles vnto grace ghospell daye wantynge saye entraunce vnto ghospell lawe moses notwithstandyng christe hathe appointed office bothe preacher apostle vnto shoulde preache vnto men eternall saluation without ayde lawe bounden thanke hym none doe take autoritie falslye selfe christe commaunded vayne geare preache thinges speake true preache lyke doctor gentile vse arrogauntly set oute myselfe vanyties greate hyghe title false apostle wont haue tryed selfe vnfeynedly apostle gentile haue trust moses constitucions among doo faithe ghospell castynge eies mystes vayne question plaine symple pure veritie teaching thynges onely make auayleably vnto true godlynes rather vnto priuate lucre vayne ostentacion texte wil therfore men pray euery liftyng vp pure handes without wrathe doubtyng likwyse also woman araye themselfes cumly apparel wyth shamefas nesse discrea e behauiour broyded heare ether golde pearles rostlye araye becommeth woman professe godlynesse throughe good workes let wemen learne silence al subiection suffre woman teache neyther vsurpe aurthoryte ouer man sylence adam fyrste fourmed eue adam also deaceaued woman deceaued subdued transgressyon notwithstandynge thorow bearyng chyldren shal saued yf contynue fayth loue holynes discrecyon nowe thintent maye return purpose communed afore woulde haue men pray onely congregacio also wheresoeuer occasion requyreth ie e praye god place hierusalem samaritanes pray mountaines groaues vnto christian al place pure holy offer vp sacrifice prayer esteme euery place holy teple god whan offre sacrifice lift vp pure hades euery heauen haue nede wishe mercy seate holy place called sanctu sanctoru temple god wyll graciouslye heare euery place wheresoeuer pray vnto nede passe vpon iewyshe synne offrynges ether ceremony sacrifice offer sacrifice christian euery man may sacrificer god respecteth offryng vp beastes perfumynge swete odour pure earnest supplication procedyng pure harte sacrifice moste acceptable vnto god leate iewes washe selues cleane yet oblacions vncleane god alloweth handes clene though washen conscience quiet case mynde wronge yf wyshe well men case soyled spottes fylthye lust couetousnes ambicion thys puritie cleanes maketh christian mannes sacrifice acceptable syghte god kynde sacrifice delighteth offred vnto nowe let woman also praye thexample men yf effemynate affection stomakes let caste fyrst bryng innocencie honest maniers stedde iewyshe cleansynges thys sacrifice doyng let decke soule cleanly bodye entice mennes eies phantisie wyth nakednes theyr persones leat couered vesture suche vesture representeth sobrenes bashfulnes womanlines god forbydde christian woman shoulde come forth among holy congregacion maner apparaill commen sorte vnfaythfull woman wonte goe forth vnto weddynges may game trymmyng selues fyrst greate doo glasse fynely rolled heare enbrodryng golde eyther precyouse stone hangyng eares neckes otherwise sylkes purple aswell set theyr beautie vnto suche loke vpo playe naughtye packes also shewyng iewelles substaunce vpbrayde suche poorer pouertie rather leat apparaill christian woman suche maye answerably like lyuyng may worthyly besemethose wome professe true godlynesse true wourshyppe god gorgyous shewyng haboundaunce ryches good woorkes whiche ryches god hath syngulare delyght whose syght thyng vncleane appeareth vnto worlde excellente gaye asmuche kynde woman naturally geuen vyce muche bablynge nothynge wherein theyr womanlynesse honestely garnyshed sylence conuenient accomplyshe dede thyng professe apparayl learner open companye menne teacher folowers foregoers shewe manner authoritie towardes theyr husbandes vnto ought vnde subieccion leste yf caste brydle shamefastenes begynne make doo open congregacion youre assemblye oughte vsed moste sobre sorte disordred wyth busye hurlye burlye men offyce speake congregacyon namely haue thynge teache auayleable vnto godlynes coclude libertie euery man geueth hys wife let see himselfe allowe woma shal take vpo preache ye comen asseblie people yea although haue habilitie teach lest wiket wer opened weake sexe wold waxe bold admitte shall vsurpe anye kynde autoritie vpon husbandes bounden loue stand awe neuertheles therfore leat kepe silence seat geue reuerente hede theyr husbandes saye leat acknowlege ordre nature lyke office mynde commaunde body obeye euen wyfe bounden depende husbandes commaundement doe turne goddes ordre vp syde downe adam made fyrste eue made sake shamelessye made later goddes wyll haue farther concernyng fall eue fyrste deceaued gaue credence serpent beyng enticed fayrenes apple neglected commaundemet god man could neither deceyued serpentes promise enticement apple onely loue wife drewe perniciouslye nowe howe standeth together whiche husbandes maistres committyng sinne take superiortie vpo teachyng godlynesse let rather aduisedlie knowe olde imbecillitie sexe leauynges wherof together done awaye althoughe synne perdoned baptisme let also consyder dignitie power mannes harte thynke ynoughe afore tyme leader vnto wickednes nowe folower vnto godlynes tymes past went vnto destruction nowe let folowe hym vnto saluation neuerthelesse thus babyshe w mankynde thoughe woulde exclude felowshyp saluation woman also hathe proper offyce wherein yf vse selfe vprightly shalbe companion saluation congregation none offyce doe home hathe doe doe maye atteyne rewarde saluation offended afore tyme deceauyng husbande must amende bearyng godly brynging vp child shalbe done case applye vttermost power beare agayne vnto christe throughe faythe hath borne one already husbande yf enforme tendre age maye seme worthy christ throughe charitie holynes shamefastenes vertues greate matier woman shal doe case good circumspecte housewife whiche haue sayed ought regarded vndoubtedlye matier dede p iii chapter texte true saying man desyre offyce byshoppe desyreth honeste woorke byshoppe therefore muste blamelesse husbande one wyfe dylygente sober discrete keper hospitalitie apte teache geuen ouer much wyne fyghter gredy fylthy lucre gentle abhorrynge fyghtynge abhorrynge coueteousnes one ruleth well owne house one hath chyldren subiection reuerence man rule owne house howe shall care congregacion god maye yonge scholer lest swell fall iudgemente euyll speaker muste also haue good reporte theym whyche wythoute leste fall rebuke snare euyll speaker almost whole thynges thou shalte appoynte vnto sortes people without difference yet matiers weyghtye importaunce loked thou shalte thynke mete put autoritye ouer multitude conueniente whiche precelleth honor also precelle vertues perchaunce many desyrous dignitie weighe selues carke care dignitie hathe annexed vnto desireth thoffice byshoppe none ende ambicion aduauntage tyranne desyreth himselfe pernicious matier wel aduised word bishoppe meaneth word bishoppe name dignitie also name occupacio office carefulnes soudeth interpretacio superintendent one careth comodities behoufes others whoso vnderstandeth desyreth office byshop respectyng nothing elles doo good manye dede desire honest coueteth occasion exercise vertue honoure yet thou shalt commit offyce man excepte thou perceyue hym throughly garnyshed wyth gyftes worthy byshop thintent thou mayst certaynly descerne gyftes lo shall paint fewe wordes ymage ryght byshoppe fyrst behoueth suche vprightnesse lyfe fauite layed hys charge conuenient whiche professeth hym selfe teacher requirour innocency shoulde shewe conuersacion maners teacheth whiche accordyng offyce hath taken hande oughte boldely freely reproue doe amysse shoulde commytte thyng wherein maye blamed selfe geueth credence teacher whose lyfe contrarie doctrine wyll suffer checked hym seeth eyther elles greuous offence vpright innocent easyly possyble wyshed hoped yet truelye muche requisite one man whose doctrine people dependeth cleane without fault asmuch chastitie much commended byshoppe case haue gifte altogether absteine speciallye obserued haue bene husbande one wyfe fyrst mariage maye thoughte ordayned procreation child marye agayne wythoute suspicion incontinent mynde euen among ethnikes reste lette maryeng oftener yf absteyne harder matter dare exacte whole multitude becommeth bysshoppe ferre quite frome maner faulte shoulde voyde also suspicion faulte besydes one man hathe charge ouer manye oughte sobre vigilaunte watche man ieoperdie preset euery side may sluggerd must circuspectly loke hym euery part lest lyeth wayte wha capitayne sleepe couey away christes tentes moreouer must graue sad behauiour al thinges goeth voyde lyghtenesse folishe toying maners decaye hynder teacher reuerence autoritie ynoughe shewe hym selfe gentle courteous towardes owne folkes muste applye hym selfe straungers also maye haue experience hys gentlenesse lyberalitie reporte honest name maye largely spredde abrode also lyke hath vertues commenly moste part men euen peculyarly required bishoppe apte redye teache iewishe fable highe statelye swellyng philosophie woorlde thynges maye make v truelye godly one ryght christias chiefest office good teacher know thinges best teache nexte teache gladly teache getilly teache diligetly teache louyngly teache without statelynes teache seasonably doctrine ghospell suche sorte ouercometh softnes clamourus lowde speakyng albeit tyme prouoked naughtynesse naught enforced speake somthyng somewhat seuerely yet neuer forgetteth christian charitie god forbyd teacher ghospell shoulde example suche madde wynedronken tailers rage intemperauntly agaynst doo amysse scoldyng toungue runne throughe heartes duetie rather heale wyth fatherlye gentylenesse thynges leat hym remembre christian sobrietie temperaunce greate deale auayleable brynge men amendement outragious crueltie let abhorre also stryfe contencion seme malice loue doeth charitie amendeth contencion prouoketh leate abhorre couetousnes seme countrefaite godlynes gaynes sake fynally wylte thou knowe howe oughte behaue himselfe open publique affayres marke howe doeth owne priuate businesse home case shewe hym selfe vigilaunt houskeper yf kepe thyng ordre yf haue obedyent diligent child yf taughte sobre stylnes comely manner maye appeare brought vp vnder godly parent good hope wel hable take publique charge administration owne howseholde busynes gyueth good presidence himselfe householde thyng elles small comune wealthe maister householde nothing elles gouernoure small citie euen wisedome world iudgeth mete haue weyghtier affaire commen wealth commytted vnto gouerne thynges lesse importaunce wyth commendacion conclude maye man hope shal wel gouerne cure whole congregation well tell howe gouerne owne pryuate house howe shall take charge many house hable ynough take charge one meanes shal care great multitude knoweth howe prouyde fewe shall faythfully cure straungers whiche hathe owne negligentlye mysordered shall profytable man ouer goddes congregation profytable humayne congregation nowe thys also marked chosyng byshoppe onelye howe entierly vpryghte hathe behaued hymselfe hys owne pryuate affaire also howe longe sence came professyon christe baptysme dede engraffeth man body christe perfite godlynes chaunceth sodaynlye man baptysme openeth entraunce congregacion case remayneth euery man selfe muste stryue preace marke holynes throughe baptysme borne newe remayneth greate processe tyme muste gather streyngth bygnesse waxe stronge daylye encreases godlynes full growen age therfore diligent hede must taken newe scholer saye none lately called felowshyppe faythe put autoritie ouer weyghtye businesse good graffe yet tender vnmete peraduenture beare greate heauy burthen ieoperdye leste yf man rawe yet suffycientlye confirmed religion aduaunced honoure puffed vp pride begynne perniciously stande hys owne conceipte thoughe chosen company religion thys intent myghte haue preeminence ouer relygion meanes come passe beyng cralled deuilles snare layeth manyfoldely none disceatfully doeth snare ambicion behauyng hym selfe muche statelye honour commytted vnto escape mysreportes euyll speaker whyche wyll thus entreprete couered christian religion vpon purpose lowe estate amonge owne secte myght autoritie honour among christian forsoke v good howre wyll saye chaunged religion aduauntage leauer christian byshoppe lyue lyke pryuate person among v thys maner suspicion shalbe quite long season hath expressed speciall token true godlynes sobrenes hym selfe wyll heare thys obieccion yf woulde saye matter maketh thoughe ethnikes doo mysreporte ynough well taken among myne owne vnto ynoughe respected byshoppe hys fame oughte cleane vnspotted suspicion faulte shoulde small matter well reported among owne vnto nerely familiarly knowen onles well allowed also testimonye wythout whiche see hys true godlynes perfytely yea take occasyon rayse slaunder euery thyng doe nothyng onely appere outwardlye euyll wherefore hede muste warely taken meanes none occasion slaunder geuen straungers professyon maye speake maye hable probablye obiecte onely naughtye faulte also false feyned vpbrayed also shoulde haue good opinion v onelye thys frute commeth maketh glorye christe also shall easyly turne amendemente wickednes case haue good opinion godlynes texte lykewyse must minister honest double tounged geuen vnto much wine nether gredy fylthy lucre holdyng mistery fayth pure conscience let fyrst proued let minister manne hable reproue euen muste theyr wyues hourst euil speaker sobet faithfull al thinges let deacon husbandes one wife rule child well theyr owne housholdes minister well get theym selues good degree greate lyberaltie fayth whiche christ iesu nowe asmuche faultes minister redounde vnto infamye autouts shall ynoughe take circumspecte hede maner man muste thou callest office byshoppe also maner persoues hys houscholde folkes minister membres byshoppes oughte necessarylye answeablye lyke vnto prelate thynges behauyour theyr lyuyng graue manerly voyde faultes commen sorte seruauntes commenly wont geuen muste double tounged gyuen muche wyne gapyng fylthy lucre entred mystery faythe whiche commeth preachynge ghospell suche sorte euidently shewe theyr conuersacion christian pleasure theyr maisters purely good coscience vpryghtnes couersatio token syncere professyon neuerthelesse meanyng shoulde haue admynistracion holy thynges commytted vnto thou shalt haue tryed great whyle haue ledde innocent lyfe long baptisme haue behaued selues faulte layed charge let lengthe admytted holye administration moreouer requyre semblablye lyke sobrenes integritie lyfe byshoppes deacon wyues bycause also haue somwhat ministerie suche maners haue lyke must rekoned husbandes minister vnto haue therfore oughte farre frome faultes commen forte wyues lyght folyshe ne back bytyng raylers intemperate sobre woman bablexs woman slyppie credence faythfull constaunt thynges shorte chastitie deacon oughte behalf aunswetably lyke vnto byshoppes trade lyfe must also husbandes one wyfe lest often mariage shoulde cause suspicion intemperaunce muste shewe owne demenour honest bringyng vp child diligent ordryng theyr housholde woulde proue holy ministerie albeit deacon office infeciour byshoppes apostle office yet euer behaueth hym selfe degree comelye vprightlye preferreth selfe litell vnto hygher office aswell beyng acquaynted wyth practice godlynes selfe hathe better trust hys owne constauncie also men conceyue greater cofidence hys vpryght behauiour hys offyce whan promoted hygher degree euangelicall religion wyll euen excede hym selfe vpryghtenes paynfull diligence euen iesus christes connnen wealthe gouernaunce hath degree offycers certayne ordres wherof fyrste deacon seconde elder byshoppes hyghest apostle lyke seculer commen wealthe called mayor vsed himselfe stowtely wardenshyp agayn promoted beyng mayor iudge alderman behaued hym selfe well mayoraltye euen offyce deacou declareth worthye rowme superintendent apostle texte thynes wryte vnto trustyng come shortely vnto yf taty longe thou mayste yet haue knowledge howe thou oughtest behaue thy selfe house god whiche congregacion lyuyng god pillar grounde trueth without doubte greate mystery godlynes god shewed flesshe iustifyed spirite sene amonge angel preached vnto gentile beleued earth receyued vp glory thynges write vnto derely beloued son though thought come vnto agayne trust shal shortely come agayne see youre congregacion neuertheles case thing chaunce enforced longer ere come trust shall myne entente admonyshe thee meane season letter thou shouldest ignoraunt howe behaue thy selfe iewes temple house god shoulde thus call christian congregation consecrated dedicared vnto lyuyng god shal neuer destroyed stormes errours persecution inasmuche pyller sure post trueth temple ierusalem tymes past maner veneration priestes rite sacrifice temple much holy keapeth misteries couerte shadowes figure cherubin pome granates belle arke suche like fygures sheweth v playnlye whole summe perfite trueth gospel therfore maruayle though thou hearest nothyng prescribed herein maner thynges moyses appointed greate diligence vnto leuites priestes cause passe vpon shadowes asmuche god hath made thynge playnely open vnto v whose sake misticall furniture ordayned tyme cause iewes haue admiration bragge arke anye thynge mooste holye thinges called sanctum sanctorum locked compared misteries haue whether hydde secretes deserue speciall pretogatyue worshyp leat see selues certes misterie ghospelles godlynes controuersie whiche maketh v free maner supersticion temple greatest thyng openly declared whole vniuersall worlde dede shewynge table arke sacrificed beastes christe himselfe shewed preached whiche beynge tyme vnknowen passed vpon become manyfestly open playnlye seen man fleshe handled men spirite hath receyued great power hauing done awaye synnes men hathe throughe onely faythe geuen doeth geue righteousnes lawe hable geue misterie openly manifested wonderfull euen eies aungelles song glory god highe peace vpon earth vnto men good wyll mystery ceasse worshyppe yf publyshed thys mysterye preached openly onelye iewes also gentyles preachyng therof vnfrutefull thynge semed men agaynste ordre nature philosophie mannes eloquence hable perswade symple playne preachyng gospel perswade whole world myraculous wondres witnessynge finally death vpon crosse rose agayne lyfe owne power beyng openly accompanyed angelles ascended heauens shewed v vndoubtedly whether oure hope oughte addressed holy thys mysterie excellente certayne euident thyng yf truely beleue thinge yf worthyly lyue purpose respecte henceforth vnto iewyshe constitucions haue misterie true godlynes doo slyppe backe vnto thynges haue supersticion godlynesse case laden syknes mooste assured remyssyon synnes require learnyng rule true godlynes ought folowe yf loke rewarde immortalitie wherunto maye exalted therfore leat v contented tymothee religyon take leaue iewes vayne prescripcions iiii chapter texte spirite speaketh euydently latter tymes shall departe fayth shal geue hede vnto spirites errour deuylishe doctrine speake faise thorow ipocrisy haue theyr consicences marked au ho eyren forbiddynge mary commaunding abstayne meates god hath created receaued geuyng thankes beleue knowe truth al creature god good nothynge refused yf receaued thakesgeuyng sanctifyed word god prayer thou put brother remembraunce thinges thou shalt good minyster iesu christ hast ben norished vp wordes fayth good doctrine whiche thou hast contynually folowed cast away vngestly olde wiues fable thynges doe beate muche studyous diligence drede peryll whiche nowe gathered doubtful coniectures seyng spirite himselfe foreknowyng thynges come doeth clerely certaynlye sygnyfye hath enspired later tymes shall spring vp whiche shall departe synceritie fayth ghospell teacheth styde backe vnto certayne ieweship repose chief principle godlynes thynges doo onely nothyng anayle vnto godlynes also doo many tymes hurte beyng rebelles agaynst spirite christe shall rather take hede deceauyng spirites beynge turned awaye frome doctrine true god shall geue theyr eares myndes doctrine deuylls outward feyned godlynes shal speake thynges cleane contrarie trueth ghospell shall set selues syght simple people outwarde apperaunce holynes syghte god haue vncleane conscience defyled marked prynted many markes worldely lustes maner men swymme inwardly malicious rancor hatred couetousnes ambicion disease cleane contraryly repugnaunt vnto true godlynes yet intent maye certayne newfangled wondrefull doctrine bryng selues opinion godlynes shall essene example forbydde lauful mariage though wedlocke chastlye kepte honorable god bedde vndefyled shall requyre estemed goddes liue single vnmaried neuertheles infected innumerable pestilent vice free fylthye luste wyues shall also goo drawe men backe agayne make difference meates maner iewes thoughe meate selfe impuritie god hath ordayned kyndes meates thys ende shoulde vse temperately necessarye reliefe oure bodye kepe vp sttength thankinge hym hys gentilues many v haue embraced fayth gospel stedde moses law hauyng wypped awaye mystes iewyshe supersticions broughte lyghte trueth knowynge whatsoeuer created almyghtye god owne nature good yf man vse oughte ende created kynde meate abhorred refused receyued goddes bounteous gyfte thankes geuing thys iewyshe maner sayeng christian eate meate touche thys bodye weare garment daye thyng thyng creature impure vncleane yf conscience hym vseth pure cleane albeit impuritie meate yet hunnes wherwith large god praysed meate holy wordes prayer shoulde made holy pure vncleane maner vayne smoke blowen vnto people suche occupye christes busines vnfaythfully yea rather go gayne see thou auoyde suche maner tryfles teache brother thinges thou hast learned playe good vpryght ministre christe disposing entierly faythfully doctrine ferre dyfferent fro mennes prescribed appoyntementes thus standeth hande doo muche rather bycause thou art called teacher ghospel yet full growen age whiche wonte easylye swerue newe fangles thou hast ben brought vp euen thy youth fayth ghospell good learnyng thy contynuaunce ought make practiced strong thou canst chose lyke thy selfe thyng thou hast hitherto constauntly folowed therefore see thou teache thys doctrine worthy ghospell vnto thyne mennes fable vayne olde wyues tale impertinent misteries euaungelicall fayth myght ryghtly cal lewde tale reiecte rather applye thy selfe exercise true godlines contende woordes moste bablyng frowarde kynde men texte exercise thy selfe rather vnto godlynes bodely exercyse profyteth lytell godlynes profitable vnto al thynges thynge hath promyses lyfe lyfe come thys sure sayinge meanes worthy alowed therfore laboure suffre rebuke beleue lyuyng god sauiour men specially beleue thinges commaund teache let man despyse thy youth vnto beleue ensample worde conuersacyon loue spyrit fayth purenes true godlynes placed inwardly mynde possibl e diffyned sufficiently preseribed externe grosse matter fasting choise meates suche lyke albeit seme somtyme somewhat profitable tyme place prepare bodye dedes godlines yet profitablenes nether perpetual weighty auaile compared inwarde godlynes soule rather suche maner obseruations springeth almoste poyson true tyghte godlynes fastyng profitable place contrariwyse otherwise pestiferous man watchyng holseme deadly hurtfull tyme good passe ouer sabboth daye test laboure coutrary sorte thyng maye wherein wickedly done ydle whan mannes neighbour nede requireth dede charitie godlynes ghospell teacheth whiche grounded vpon syncere faythe true charitie profitable euery tyme euery parte man life declareth briefe summe euer thing desired either lyfe presente hoped lyfe come muche necessarye v seke anye succour anye meanes thyng saye true vndoubted playne worthy receaued men teache peraduentures bothe fele fable whiche speake elles thyng coulde petswade v willyngly gladly suffer sorowes lyfe beare hartie stomacke punishementes done vnto v wicked enprisonmentes deathes onles hope heauenlye succour worlde life immortalitie thys hope haue fexed moses man myght fayle hope lyuyng god whiche helpe euen deade saluation procedeth vnto al vniuersall kynde men especyallye vnto suche haue embraced faith ghospell thynges commaunde teache constauntlye boldelye thou mayest shewe thy selfe autoritie byshoppe beynge assured doctrine proceded christ selfe cause thou shouldest afrayed thou art yonge man althoughe matter weightie importauce thou shouldest geue place frowardnes teache contrarye doctrine let humanitie shewed matter case perill saluacion daungier autoritie muste vsed respected howe many yeares thou hast lyued office thou bearest olde man whosoeuer leadeth entier vpryght life euer sheweth grauitie maners e peryll anye man wyll contemne thou arte yonge man case thy lyfe doctrine suche whiche professe christe may see therin example ghospellike godlines case shal perceaue thy communication image holye conscience case shall espie comen trade thy lyfe modestie purenes case thy deutie perceaue charitie worthye byshop yf thy suffring sorowes see thy mynde stedfastly trust god fynally yf shall see poyntes voyde humayne lustes shall soone reuerence though thou haddest bene olde man long agoe texte p tyll come geue attendaunce readynge exhortacion doctrine despyse gyft geuen thorow prophecye layng handes auctoryte presthode thinges exercyse geue thy selfe vnto maye sene howe thou profytest thinges take hede vnto thy selfe vnto learnynge continue therin yf thou shalt thou shalt saue thy selfe heare truste shorte space see thee helpe onely counsailes also dedes meane tyme whan absente geue dyligent attendaunce thyne offyce muche thou mayest supplye parte well yf stedde sayinge see thou vle readinge holy scripture accordynge teache yf thing amysse exhorte thou yf thou see well occupyed principall poyntes bysshoppes offyce behoueth thee answerable vnto offyce thou hast taken hande whiche committed vnto without aduysement maner make selues apostle elder ambicion fauour men spirite god sygnifieng goddes mouthes prophetes appoineted office autoritie elder incontinently layeng handes vpon committed rowme byshop vnto briefe goddes gyfte thou arte instructe excellent gyftes whiche declare thee worthye honoure therfore two maner charge thou art charged withall bothe thou shouldest answerable goodnes god autoritie committed vnto thee professe christ ydle delycate finefyngred matter requireth watching attendaunce dilygent cotinuaunce wherfore loke thou forecaste thinges thinges continue thinges applye continually bothe thy lyuinge teachinge euery man maye see people waxe bettre bettre first thou thy selfe bchoueth thy godly life shal aduaunce thy godly doctrine specially yf thou constauntly continually without shrynkyng trueth endureth euer countrefaicting lasteth time case thou accoplyshe thinges thou shalt receyue double frute fyrst thou shalte saue thy selfe vprightlye vsyng office comitted vnto thou shalt saue also take hede vnto thy teaching teache rightly lyue wickedly lyke may profitable vnto others vndoubtedly hurtfull vnto selues whose lyfe doctrine bothe corrupte hurtfull two maner wayes purchaceth vnto selfe damnacion ledeth destruccion v chapter texte p rebuke elder rigorously exhorte father yonger brother elder wemen mother yonger systers purenes honoure wyddowes true wyddowes eny widdowe haue child neuews let learne first rule owne house godly recompense elder good acceptable god true wyddowe frendelesse putteth trust god continueth supplicacions praiers nyght daye lyueth pleasure dead euen yet alyue thynges commaunde maye without rebuke yf prouyde hir owne specially hir housholde hath denyed fayth worse infydell albeit must neuer shrinke ye vpright sinceritie doctrine yet heale thinges amysse lytell auayleable teacher admonysher vse softe temperaunce autoritie byshop must holden vp neuertheles maye quyte without apperaunce tyrannye maye appeare euery condicion doeth thing doeth thentent doe good dyspleasure therefore many thou canst brynge amendement lenitie gentilnes expedient enforce rigorous sharpenes man doeth easylye admonysheth yf perceaue selfe loued monysheth suche almoost dysposicio man wytte leauer ledde faire meanes constrayned parforce many tymes thinges obteined faire speche man cannot bring passe crueltie electuarie reprehendynge muste tempred accordynge age state euery one forasmuche allowed onely among wel manered nacions also euen congregacions ye sage wysdoms sake vse thinges also restrainyng wantonnes youthe autoritie shoulde comitted vnto auncientes case elder chaunce offende thinge thunder cruell wordes vpo suspicion informacion lest quicke admonicion exclude fruite required admonicio wylbe double griefe yf admonicio bothe checking procede fro yong rather obserue ye reuerence age exhorte yu woldest admonyshe thy father yf dyd amysse yongmen also bycause thou thy selfe arte yong man monyshe brother towardes correccion ought frelye practised yet none otherwyse maye stande charitie admonishe olde woman wt reuerence gentler wordes euen mother beare age yong woman correcte louinglye systers behaue thy selfe men thou runne smi tre suspicio eyther couetousnes vnchastenes eyther flatterie crueltie nowe wydowes must also haue honour namely wydowes tytle widowes dede saye beyng lefte comfortles without husbande child lyue suche sorte maye desertes worthylye refresshed congregacions helpe relyefe wherof ought bestowed mayntene delycatenes refreshe myserable necessity case lefte wt husbande hathe child childrens child cause shoulde thoughe succourles runne founde congregacion inasmuche hathe home fynde lyuinge well husbande suche oweth duetie vnto let therefore dedycate selfe serue congregacion haue shewed speciall token godlynesse towardes owne famylye muste nedes ordre duetie godlynes pretense congregacion shoulde refuse doe bounden duetie nature nature commaundeth v requite mutual good turues parentes destitute decayed age seyng oure begynnynge lyfe case deathe haue taken awaye v shalbe conuenient v transpose duetie vpon child childrens child duetie enforme suche forte maye learne also wt duetie againe releue suche dyd good thing onely sense nature doeth allowe also great acceptable sight god wydowes double synners onely rebelles vnto god also deafe whan shoulde heare commune iudgement nature whiche euen haue knowledge god moued man wyll saye true wydowe tha yf wydowe doubtles beyng destitutely lefte without comforte husbande child childrens child worldes solac reposed whole hope god loketh maryed e hunteth voluptuous pleasure hathe dedycated selfe wholy god example wydowe anna geuyng selfe prayer night daye worthye comforted refreshed congregacion whiche hathe nowe nothinge doe worlde wydowe absteyneth beyng maried againe maye frelye pre selfe deliciousnes liueth dede lyueth voluptuousnes deade vnto christe vnto whome none lyueth onles lyueth godlye lyfe se thou commaunde thetforc f loue wydowheade doe behaue selues geue none occasion vnto man suspecte euyl thoughe lothe marye againe loue chastitie lyne lybertye beyng free subiectio husbande take ease owne pleasure vpon purpose euery wydowe choseth contynue wydowhead sorte ledeth life home leaue ye iudgemente owne conscience briefe yf woman pretence wydowhead runne congregacion suche wyse geueth ouer care child childrens child suche otherwyse belong vnto famylie thynke together onely vnworthye bysshoppes fauour also iudge rather accompted among denyed faythe gospell worse ethnikes muche haynous forsake profession man hathe taken vpo haue professed hathe denyed faythe abuseth pretense faithe doe thinges repugnaunt doctrine gospell truelye dedes openlye denyeth behalfe doubtles accompted among heathen woman straungiers christ doe onely gouernauce nature beare ye charge family maner wydowe bounden accordynge charitie gospel good euery bodie vttermost power withdraweth bounden duetie euen owne householde allured godlynes gospell doe thing prophane vngodly woman doe throughe affection nature soeuer sedes vertue nature hath engraffed gospelles doctrine taketh awaye setteth forewarde maketh perfite texte p let wyddowe chosen vnder threscore yer olde suche one wyfe one man well reported good workes yf haue brought vp child yf haue lodged stranngers yf haue wasshed sainctes fete yf haue ministred vnto aduersytie yf haue bene cotinually geue vnto al maner good workes yonger wydowes refuse whan haue beg n wexe wanton christ wyl mary hauyng dapnacion haue cast away first faithe also learne goe house house ydle yet ydle onely also triflyuge besybodyes speakynge thinges whiche comly wyll therfore yonger wemen mary beare child gyde house geue none occasion aduersarye speake euyll many alreadye turned backe gone satan yf man woman beleueth haue wyddowes let ministre vnto let congregacion charged maye sufficient wyddowes dede thinge vtterly besemeth gentylnes christian relygion chearyshe louynglye susteyne woman comfortlesly lefte destitute howbeit would done rashely without aduysement lest en e double incommoditie aswell congregacion durthened aboue habilitie entreteynement bestowed vpon yt worthye bryefe chosyng wydowes two thinges chiefely respected age former spent lyfe lest whan one entreteyned fyndynge congregacion returne afterwarde againe vnto mariage great deale shame age easye mattier decerne let none therefore chosen wydo vnder three score yeares olde forasmuche age ought cle gye suspecte incontinene sheweth good hope wyll laste maried againe neuertheles age together throughlye trusted onles approued former conuersacion lyfe marked whether haue bene co ent one husbande euen olde age together boyde incontinencie whether haue good dedes gotten selfe honest estimacion folkes whether haue behaued selfe vprightlye godlye bryngynge vp child whether haue smal power ben herberous sainctes lodged washen fere maner office euen suche smal habilitie habit doe whether haue releued substaunce afflicted pressed extreme pouertye briefe whether haue left good dede vndone lacke dilygence reason congregacion shoulde receyue kepynge woman hathe deserued whiche afore tyme hathe well doynges thus gon myght allowed perpetuallye mynistre vnto congregacion fynallye see thou receyue yonger wydowes suspecte age bettre take profession wydowhead geue ouer wha taken vowe continencie committed vnto fraile flypperye age namely kynde case chastitie lyke let trye home doe yf awaye withall maye lawfully without reproche flee remedye wedlocke haue learned playne experience wha yonger wydowes vpon certaine loue chastitie tyme folowynge eyther ydlenes parchaunce honour title haue addicte selues vnto congregacio forsaking lybertie marieng haue cosecrated selues vnto christ spouse wha olde lust pricketh waxe wylde wanto reproche christ whose yoke desyrous cast take yoke mariage drawe vpo theyr owne selues blotte infamye bycause haue made frustrate faythe seme couenaunt vnto christ blame twoo maner wayes bothe toke profession chastitie vnaduisedlye hauynge sufficientlye tryed strenghtes lept backe whan taken albeit fortune openly marye againe yet verilye lyue syngle suche sorte slaunder congregacio better holden vnder commaundement husbande occupyed charge householde vnder pretence wydowhead sinne licenciouslye taught idlenes inasmuch haue naught doe home straye aboute folkes house wher shame wydowe walke ydle abroade opely men house onely ydle also babling tale teller curious herkeners bablynge curiosytie accustumed copany together pretece widowhead settyng professio easye matter crepe mennes house seke secretes whiche afterwarde clattre shamefully chattring mariage contencion naughtynes abominacion done men householdes cause sake holde surely better yonger wydowes rather maried husbandes autoritie wherof bothe weaker sexe weaker age maye gouerned applye selues bryng forthe child take charge householde rather tha doyng nothing encombre mennes householdes euen stande awe husbande restrayneth licenciousnes sexe age euen charge householde geue free leasure meddle thinges haue naught doe withall conclude let ordre conuersacion meanes none occasion fallyng manyfest reproche none occasion geue satan bewraye slaunder lyfe vnto enemyes christes profession say naye might seme caste ouer muche doubte behalfe myschiefe selfe teacheth v thus beware would narowlye afrayed lest suche thing shoulde chaunce excepte al readye sene chaunce oftener example woman fraye v whan chosen succoure congregacion ouercommen lustes seruynge satan slypped backe maried againe albeit lacke ioynter lette wydowe whose age requireth maried fynde husbande nedeth pouerties sake take profession chastitie suche widowes wantes ought releued kynsfolkes gentyll lyberalitie case haue either men wome professe selues christianes reason christen man christe woman whose godlynes ought succoure euen foryners shoulde suffre owne kynswoman widowe lefte succourles put kept congregacions cost whiche yf burthened euery wydowe shall come passe whan stocke spent vp shall ynoughe kepe true wydowes dede owner relyfe haue none succoure lyue vpon texte p elder rule well worthye double honour specially labour worde teaching scripture saith thou shalt mousel mouthe e treadeth corne labourer worthye rewarde elder receaue none accusacion vnder two thre wytnesses synne rebuke openly also maye feare lyke widowes haue thus deserued oughte honoured accordyng porcion euen elder muche plentuouslye mayntened grauitie maners whiche auncient wysedome whiche vprightenes lyfe whiche thautoritie age gouerne well multitude saye playe ryght elder dede aswell age godlye demenour deserue worthylye beelders oure commen speche vse cal alderman kept nedynes shall quietlye gouerne people hauynge wherof lyue cleane vpon autoritie shall contemned neuerthelesse maner releues ought mooste specially bestowed vpon lanternes vnto people onely vprightenes lyfe also labour dyspensing worde gospell holy doctrine inasmuche chiefest office aboue mooste holsome vnto christian flocke dede loke higher rewarde yet parte comforte meane season yf frute come presentlye vnto labour riche withall lyue vpon right requyte nothing transytorye thinges thinges small worthe vnto geueth thinge ferre greater price labourour ought duetye haue lyuing somuche moses lawe forbyddeth oxe mouthe mous ed longe occupied treadynge corne doubtles besydes humanitie suffre trauailleth gospel preachinge hungre thurste hunteth hyre workeman muche worthye hyre commendacion godlynes yf labour without hyre people great faulte yf grudge releue necessitie deserueth good maye succoured li ell moreouer thou shalte geue prerogatyue autoritie elder thou receyue lyghtly enformacion whome becommeth stande awe lest wyndowe opened also vnto rashelye depraue lyfe elder againste whome ther ought light sinistre suspicio receyued wherby autoritie myght dyminisshed ought herde maketh informacion onles proue obiection two thre witness case apparent muche playne cloked haue offended correccion must moderated thou nether geue place accusours crueltie ne yet escaping without punishement ministre pernicious example commen multitude reproue thou thine owne mouthe openlye rest maye drede bysshoppes checke yf perceiue therby euen elder pardoned case doe thing worthye correccion texte p testifye god lord iesus christ electe angel thou obserue thinges without hastynesse iudgement nothinge parcially la ye handes sodely nether partaker mennes sinnes kepe thy selfe pure drincke lenger water vse lytell wyne thy stomackes sake thine often dyseases mennes synnes open hande goe vnto iudgemente mennes synnes folow lykewyse also good workes manifest hande otherwyse cannot bee hyd prophane iudges bounde prophane lawes relygion corrupte affeccions geue wronge iudgement howe muche vprightenes besemeth byshop either iudgementes puttinge magistrate office monyshed othe whan shall sytte gementes afrayed religion false goddes charge tymothie god father beyng witnesse autour matter practised iesus christe whose ministres electe angelles arbitrours lokers thinges goe aboute practisynge iudgementes thou obserue thinges prescribe vnto thou maiest come hearing cause vpryghtlye vncorruptelye bryngynge sentence fauoure malyce dyspleasure affeccion hath secretlye sowked thee thing selfe dede knowen takynge matter geue right sentence declynynge nether parte parte vprightenes necessarye expresse onely hearing cause also chosynge men thou comittest ecclesiasticall administracion vnto hyghe speciall myschiefe springeth vnto christian people none fountayne whan vnprofytable elles pestilent hurtfull men put office therfore laye handes vpon man without delyberate aduisement standeth hande trye searche man muche long whome thou muste committe thautoritie bysshop vnto yf vse honour committed hun otherwyse ought doe shalbe imputed vnto thee whatsoeuer doeth amysse thou shalte seme haue fauoured naughtines seyng thou knewest whan thou committedest suche trauayle vnto yf haue deceaned yet thou shalte hable escape blameworthines negligece cause thou committedest ieoperdous matter vnto one whome thou hadest tryed ought ynoughe chosing byshop thoughe euyll reported behoueth excellentlie commended many wayes wel doinges ynoughe also byshop set forthe owne innocencie duetie also make good integritie whome ordeyneth thinges therfore see thou kepe thy selfe chaste pure vnto religion wherof thou hast charge thy temperate diet notably perceaued vnto nede warne delicatenes howbeit thou arte warned abstinence ought mesured feblenes bodye suche hable goe aboute office godlynes lyke fatte vnreasonable lustye bodye dothe many tymes holde downe soule myndynge heaue ly thinges euen sycklines bodye oftentymes hyndreth strength soule expresse set forthe selfe frely workes charitie thincke therfore ynough haue kepte abstinence tyme hitherto henceforthe drincke water vse rather moderate wyne concernynge thyne abstynence wyne vnto tyme let practised bycause heate thy freshe youthe nowe thy healthe must loked vnto thou maiest hable accomplyshe doe partes byshop stomake refreshed moderate drinkyng wyne drinking water chiefely decayed thentent therfore thou mayest bothe helpe thy stomake fail seldomer sycklynes thou arte wonte doe vse wyne stedde medycine lest afterwarde whan thy strenght gone thou inforced seke helpe phisicians returne purpose nowe beganne bycause thou shouldest thinke synnes thyne shoulde imputed men synnes manifest tary last iudgemet god runne iudgement theyr owne swynge beyng damned themselues broughte iudgement bothe lyfe doctrine suche men dyffereth manifestlye doctrine christe steade gospellyke godlynes teache iewyshe supersticion lyfe infecte ambicion hastyng hande makyng myscheuous desyres maner men lyke thou mayest lawfully iudge must thou rendre accompte moreouer folkes naughtines closely hydden deprehended man iudgement reserued iudgement god wherin thinges shalbe made naked men faulte thou shalt daungier god lyke case folkes good workes manifest nede commendacion man suche therfore shall euery man accompany himselfe safely lyke ought absteyne companye openly wycked furthermore ordre theyr lyfe subtiltye outwarde shewe godlynes dyssemble malyce theyr harte suche sorte deceaue iudgement man wyll leaue iudgement god christian godlynes ouer muche suspicious vi chapter texte p let many seruauntes vnder yoke counte theyr master worthye honour name god doctrine euyll spoken se haue beleuyng master despyfe brother rather seruyce asmuche beleuinge beloued partaker benefyte fvrthermore parte rebuke lyfe straungiers profession christ rather requisite v prouoke vnto better mynde good turnes kyndle taunting checkes religion ought ordred seme occasion sowyng sedicion suche affaire haue necessarilye doe ethnikes let perceaue v become diligente doe good bycause religion vnprofytable ouerthwarte meanes shalbe easylie allured felowshyp religion therfore many beyng bonde seruauntes haue obteined baptisme let remembre set lybertye manumission lordeshyp synne made free master right autoritie therfore semely vpon trust profession shoulde bristle againste maisters wycked person vnworthye christian shoulde doe seruice vnto let onely consydre master therfore let esteme worthye honour name god gospelles doctrine come euyll reporte hate case shall perceaue men become throughe sturdy vntractable let rather diligent seruice doynge afore glade obeye doynge seruyce good wyll theyr maisters beyng prouoked thinges maye easely receyue gospell preaching muche lesse ought seruauntes haue christian maisters set lesse bicause profession commune saith stedde maisters become brother asmuche withdrawe bounden duetie ethnike maisters behoueth obey christian maisters two maner cosideracions fyrst maisters felowes relygion stoute statelynes takyng loue awful maisters beginnyng beloued threatenyng maisters become good maisters done deseruour ye exactour louyng maister imperious comaundyng maister yt properly bondage doe one good turne texte p thinges reache echorte eny man folowe doctrine enclyne unto wholsome wordes lorde iesu christe doctrine whiche accordyng godlynes puft vp knoweth nothing wasteth braynes aboure quetions stryfe wordes wherof sprynge enuye stryfe raylynges euyll surmy synge vayne dysputacions men h e corrupte mindes robbed trueth whiche thincke lucre godlynesse soche separate thy selfe godlynesse great rychesse yf man conten hath brought nothynge world nether maye cary thing haue fode ruyment must therwith content wythe ryche fall temptacion snare deuyl many folysshe noysom lustes whiche drowne men perdicion destruccion courteousnes money rote euyll whiche whyle lasted erred faith tangled selues many sorowes thou man god flye suche thinges folowe ryghtewesnes godlynes faith loue pacience meaknes fight good fyght faith laye hande eternall lyfe wherunto thou art also called hast professed good profession many witness thinges teache autoritie vnto thinges exhorte slacke doctrine true gospellyke doctrine maketh vnto godlynes lyfe maketh v bothe accepted god beloued men yf man bryng contrarye doctrine vnto geueth himselfe vnto moost true wordes lorde iesu christe obeyeth vnto doctrine whiche beyng agreable vnto gospell calleth men vnto supersticious question vnto office godlynes suche one lesse true knowledge hathe taketh vpon lyke knowledge modest thinge euen nothing hyghe mynded stubburne folyshe ignoraunce taken dysease turned awaye synceritie gospell outrageth triflynge question without consideracion lyfe braullyng wordes lytel auayleable vnto true godlynes rather engendre mischiefe christia godlynes bycause suche maner brablyng strife arryseth enuie whyle dimynisshynge men autoritie seke autoritie vnto selues aryse also cotencions whilest reason hoot chiding wordes
