none wyll geue place vnto aryse also scoldinges often mattre groweth outrage aryse also wycked suspicion god wha thinges ought beleued without questionyng called humayne reasonynges question doubtefull thinges many contagiousnes infected rubbyng scabbe men whose myndes infecte naughtye couetous lustes beyng blynded therwith see trueth gospel conferre doctrine ende rather measure godlynes religion owne gayne woulde haue thing seme moost holye maketh men acceptable god bryng selues best set get mooste auauntage thou mayest wyse thinke men ouercommen dysputacios lacke knowledge stubburne matter albeit perceaue trueth neuer well yet acknowledge bycause profyte comparison thing goe owne purpose sttyue therfore bothe fassion vayne withdrawe thy selfe companie let theim hunt pelfe let make matchaundice gospelles doctrine vnto v plentuous great gaynes yf maye waxe riche godlynes yf maye waxe ryche true goodes soule content thinges suffice vnto necessitie lyfe present inasmuche spedye iournaye lyfe neuer shal dye greate matter heape vp rich yt wyl neuer leaue v purpose carke care heape rich together nother enforced leaue others lyke brought none worlde wt v wha borne shall carye nothing awaye v whan dye spende ryches wastefully vpon pleasure myschiefe hoorde vp fonde folyshenes v measure vse suche thinges bondes nature whan haue competent wherwith clothed fedde require competent diet clothing easylie euery excesse necessitie small thing easeth necessitie gredynes riotous excesse insaciable great winnyng ye losse money augment treasure godlynes great losse lytel sory lucre lose rich immortalitie care rich care godlynes accorde together one whose hertes throughlye occupyed desyre ryche enticed many fylthye matter fall snare many couetous desyres onely folyshe also noysome couctous lustyng commeth without companye bringeth great rowte myschiefes pryde dysdaine ambicion violence dysceate iniurie riot voluptuousnes suche maner pestilence whiche lytell lytell burthen man drowne downe destruccion marrynge shall onely selfe also vnto hathe rule ouer destroyour marrer greater honour beareth muche ferre behoueth spiece myschiefe hyghest autoritie requireth highest integritie nothinge throughly vprightlye done nothing without corrupcion done whosoeuer hathe auarice counsayle whiche ferre dystaunte honestye euen roote sede maner myschiefes ye althoughe rich seme beare certaine wondrefull shewe felycitie men beyng cralled bayte whyle griedie rich haue ben corrupte wt couetous desyres haue wandred astraye synceritie faythe gospel teacheth settyng eye marke shote christe wher seke lyue pleasauntlye haue wrapped selues many sorowes scrapyng muche paynes must kepe muche care whiche yf shoulde fortune taken greuouslye wounde couetous herte belonge suche haue dedycated themselues god mamon thou whiche arte consecrated vnto god slee thinges vnworthye thy professio folowe true rich righteousnes godlynes faythe charitie pacience mekenes ryghteousnes kepe safe withall maner vice godlynes loue god withall thy neighbour goddes sake faithe wherwith hauynge helpe god thou shalt turmoyled care suche thinges charitie doe good vnto withal patience wherby throughe hope immortalitie come thou mayest contynue stedfaste aduersities stormes persecucions mekenes beare gentlye weakenes thinges man possiblye kepe safe thinketh must doe thinges ryches sake thou hast taken vpon maner course thou arte entred excellent great fyght fyght couetousnes faythe small rewarde layed vp mattre taken hande thee riche momentanye false feyned goodes worlde atteyne lyfe euerlastynge pricke marke preace thou withal dylygent endeuour marke god true rewarder thy trauayle hathe called owne iudgement hathe chosen thee byshop ouer people glorye christ taking offyce elder thou dyddest professe many wytnesses thy profession highe excellecie frame thy selfe answerablye lyke vnto thou hast nede muche dyligentlye watche aboute albeit thou passe muche vpon highe rewarde yet passe vpon god loker let expectacion many lokers besyde moue thee let reuerence hyghe offyce thou hast taken hande moue thee texte geue charge sight god quickeneth thinges iesu christ whiche vnder poncius pilare witnessed good witnessyng thou kepe commau dement without spot vnrebukeable vntyll apperyng oure lorde iesus christ whiche apperyng tyme shall shew blessed myghtye onely kinge kynges lorde lordes onely hath immortalitie dwelleth lyghe man attayne whome man hath sene nether se vnto whome honour rule euerlastynge amen eftesones commaunde beseche god father whiche autor lyfe vnto men shall rayse dead lyfe neuer shal dye sonne iesus christ whiche vnder iudge ponce pilate shronke offyce receyued father euen vnto crosse thou behaue thy selfe trauayle committed vnto thee thou geue occasyon thy selfe blotte blame worthynes see thou doe constauntly onely vnto man syght muche rather lokynge commynge oure lorde iesus christe whiche shall shewe againe vnto worlde tymes euen blessed one onely myghtye kyng kynges lorde lordes whiche onely hathe immortalitie himselfe whiche onely dwelleth lyght cannot atteyned vnto whome man hathe yet seene hable see honour power world without ende amen suche excellet autors thyne offyce yu hast thou shouldest despaire nothing thyne autoritie suche parfyte lokers iudges thou haste thou shouldest doe nothing otherwyse thou oughtest doe suche valeaunte protectours thou haste thou shouldest dreade stormes mennes persecucions suche lyberall rewardours thou haste thou shouldest nothing doubte ye promysed rewardes vnto glorye ye gospel referred man shoulde therof chalenge hymselfe prayse texte p charge whiche riche worlde hyemynded trust vncerten rich lyuyng god whiche geueth v abound auntlye thinges enioye doe good riche good workes readye geue gladlye dystribute laynge vp store themselues good foundacion gainst tyme come maye obtaine eternal lyfe timothe saue geuen kepe voyde vngostly vanity voyces opposicions science falsly called whiche science whyle professed erred concernynge faith grace amen haue declared parilous noysome matter professe christ set studie vpo rich yf among sorte haue chaunced vpon riche substaunces whiche presente worlde reconeth men ryche fortunate reuerenceth honoureth halfe goddes commaunde commune sorte hyghe mynded trustyng vpon ryches repose chiefe helping felicitie thinges fyrste vayne incertain yf casualtie take awaye yet lest death despatcheth v let rather trust surely lyuynge god neuer forsoke eyther quicke dead inasmuche vnchaungeable whose lyberalitie commeth whatsoeuer worlde yeldeth vnto v plenteouslye yearely reuenues oure preset vse hoorde vp rich let rather conuerte study ende maye exercyse selues vnto good workes wherby maye made truly ryche let wealthye rather good dedes tha lordely possession haue let possede thoughe commune owne let therwith glad geue vnto nedye dysoayne rest small substaunce let shewe selues gentyll frendly company familiaritie commune sorte lyfe wealthe hathe commonly companyons dysdeyne statelynes let put trust gorgious great buyldinges nothing world longe durable rather true vertues let laye selues stronge good foundacion againe worlde come yt maye atteyne true lyfe saye lyfe euer lasteth thing lyfe race vnto death must laye carefulnes transitorie thinges asyde make spedye haste vnto dilygent studye tymothie eftesones desyre beseche againe kepe faithfully doctrine committed vnto thee suffre defyled humayne learnynges thou canst possyblye doe onles watned thou reiecte chattring vayne byblebable goe bryng selues false estimacion knowledge reason humayne question sophisticall quiddity inasmuche man knowledge consistyng opinion contrarylye repugnaunt amonge selues worthye called knowledge know nothig certainlye whiche doctrine belefe gospel hathe perswaded vnto v furthermore men whyleft goe aboute seme learned wyse throughe humayne reason throughe sophistical wragglinges new learnynges whiche themselues haue deuysed haue wandred astraye fro spnceritie faythe gospel whose propertie beleue dyspute caryed awaye men decree prescripte commaundementes god thintent thou mayest perceaue epistle countrefaicte wyll subscribe wordes myne owne hande thou well knowest grace amen thus endeth paraphrase vpon fyrst epistle tymothie p argument vpon latter epistle vnto tymothee erasmus roterodame forasmuche former epistle paule put tymothee beyng ephesus hope comming agayne vnto could perfourme bicause holde bondes rome coufirmeth lettres discouraged stormes persecution example prepare mynde vnto martirdo perilous time hande quam reason vnder pretence godlynes turne true godlynes vp syde downe prate boastynglye selues thoughe christian religion consisted wordes rather purenesse herte tellyng daye death draweth nere moste part haue forsaken byddeth timothee marcus come rome spedely vnto epistle wrote rome whan eftesones arraigned nero barre thus endeth thargument paraphrase erasmus vpon seconde epistle paule timothee p first chapter texte paule apostle iesu christ wyll god accordynge prompyse lyfe christ iesu timothee hys beloued sonne grace mercy peace god father iesu christ oure lorde thanke god setue fro myne elder pure conscience without ceasynge make mencion prayer nyght day desyryng se myndefull thy reares filled ioye call remebraunce vnfeyned fayth thee dwelt fyrste thy graundemother loys thy mother eunica assured dwelleth also paule embassadour iesu christ called therunto god father declare howe greate felicitie lyfe come whiche promiseth vnto v sonne iesus christe care much losse life tymothee dearebeloued sonne grace mercie peace god father iesus christ oure lorde thanke god whose seruaunte begonne late tyme kepte relygion tradicions myne elder continually vpright pure conscience doe kepe styll serue one god beynge christian ye lately serued iewe though sort throughe whose goodnes chaunced vpo man thou arte thou folowest exaple sincere preaching ghospelles doctrine thine owne deserte lesse hartelye loue thee mine sonne muche forget thee euen whan thou arte absent prayer night daye wherwith accustomed call vpon god commende vnto suche tenderlye loue thou commest alwayes mynde muche desirous see thee especially often remembre thy teares thou sheddest departyng mooste plentuous witness thyne affection mutuall loue towardes reason wherof fylled together full ioye whan commeth mynde howe paynlye thou resemblest sinceritie faythe naturall sonne father lyke ye integritie religio enheritauce euen sinceritie fayth semeth geuen handes thyne elder dwelt stedfastly fyrst thy grademother lois tha thy mother eunica doubt yu wilt become accordigly like neuew right religious gradmother sonne right good mother seing yu hast ben desyrous like tha thy kyndred thy father syde texte wherfore warne thou stiere vp gyfte god puttyng handes god hath geuen v spirite feare power loue sobrenes thou therfore ashamed testimony lorde nether ashamed prysoner suffer thou aduersitie ghospell accordyng power god saued v called v holy calling accordyng dedes accordyng owne purpose grace geue v thorow christ iesu worlde began declared openly appearyng sauiour iesus christ hath put awaye death hath broughte lyft immortalitie vnto lyght thorowe gospel wherunto appoynted preacher apostle teacher gentile cause also suffre thinges neuerthelesse ashamed knowe sure haue put trust able kepe haue committed kepyng agaynst day thinges remebre thou mayest better courage example v thyne elder stiere vp thyne industrye diligence gifte god thou receyuedst laying mine handes whan thou waste ordayned byshop boldely without shrynkynge accomplyshe office commytted vnto thee feare men barkinges rageing crueltie persecutours propertie iewes afrayed thinges present life occasioneth vnto v whiche beleuing gospell made child god hathe geuen ferre maner spirite make v afrayed discouraged feare distrust assured trust innocecie hope promised immortalitie bolde lusty loue free ful courage eue loue trusteth altogether vpo god succour shrinketh neyghbours sake abyde daungier finally spirite suffreth v disturbed mynd causeth v alwaies perseuer thende whole pre ready herte forasmuch tha hast receyued spirit set forth power declare stoutely thyng ye thou hast ashamed thy profession wherby yu preachest crosse death lord iesu christ ashamed disciple apostle though lade wt bondes nothing glorious tha crosse christ gaue saluatio world brake deuiles tirannye hath obteined v immortalitie christes crosse glory cheanes ye willingly suffre ye ghospelles busines sake slaunder glorie rather therefore refuse suffre thynges christ suffred suffre hys sake thou ready also come felowshyppe afflyctions layed vpon v ghospell christe euer chaunceth cause shoulde afrayed matier done oure strengthes succour god feble dede mightye whiche whan lost saued v death hys sonne hauynge done awaye trespass oure former conuersation hathe called v vnto holynes merites beyng enforced hys wil free goodnes bestowed vpon v vpon anye late aduisemente euerlastynge tyme afore makynge thys worlde decreed geue thinges vnto v sonne iesus christ matter newes thing alwayes secret mynde hath lately declared worlde commyng sauiour iesu christe hauyng receyued bodye subiecte death hath dispatched awaye death crosse hys resurreccion hath opened lyfe immortalitie throughe preachynge ghospell whiche promyseth lyke rewardes vnto folowe exaumple christes crosse thys ghospell preachynge committed vnto apostle teacher gentile intent maye learne onely iewes called gyfte god also mankynde vniuersallye forasmuche tyed cheynes ghospelles sake onely nothyng ashamed thys affliccion also esteme pure greate glorye vnto suffre naughtye dedes doyng reproche afflicted glorye christe excellent stormye tyme doeth feare nothyng althoughe weake yet knowe assured haue put faythfull trust hable ynoughe kepe vnto vttermost daye thing haue committed fidelitie throughe ayde bothe gospelles busines saluation also prosperitie christian flocke sauegarde albeit anye thynge thys worlde seme perishe tyme yet whan daye shall come whyche shall expresse myghtie power vnto worlde shall restore wyth greate gayne haue layed life healthe handes hathe put truste dispence doctrine gospell case shall trustye fayth keper wyll fayle trust texte se thou haue ensample holsome wordes thou hast heard fayth loue christ iesu good thing committed thy keping old fast holy gost dwelleth v thou knowest asia turned fro sort phigelus hermogenes lord geue mercy vnto housholde onesiphorus ofte refreshed ashamed chaine rome sought diligently founde lorde graunte vnto hym maye fynde mercye wyth lorde daye howe many thinges ministred vnto ephesus thou knowest well thynge receyued christe haue lykewise commytted vnto thy fydelitie therefore seyng thou haste forme example dispensynge ghospell syncere doctrine whiche thou learnedst beynge grounded tryflynge doubtefull question faythe charitie whiche christ iesus hath bothe taught exhibited vnto v loke diligentlye thou kepe whyche commytted vnto thee thynge commytted vnto thee sincere pure see defyled throughe thy negligence know many goe aboute shall goe aboute corrupte doctrine ghospell loke thou stowtely constauntlye maynteyne whiche thou haste taken hande helpe ghospellike spirit dwelleth v whose ayde shalbe hable easylie contemne also put flyght euer daungiers shall fall wante spirite frayed storme displeasure geue ouer gospel busines suppose vnknowen vnto thee others cleaued vnto asia afterwarde forsoke inasmuche faynt holowe harte throughe occasion countrefaicte gospellinge beganne appere beganne also rome geue ouer among phigellus hermogenes vtter name name euen sounde wordes declare inconstaunt forther hathe name rennynge awaye subtill mercurie parte wishe haue deserued standeth hande praye god rewarder wel done dedes whose pleasure recken doone selfe euer bestowed vpon seruauntes blesse onesiphorus housholde hathe oftentymes wayes bothe comforted refreshed hoote affliccions euen tyme ashamed bondes perceauinge glorious thynge afflicted christes sake thyng afrayed peryll wyth reason ghospelles promysses whan rome dyd onely refuse speake whan pryson also greate diligence soughte woulde rest tyll founde dede founde matier exercise mercie lorde iesus graunte maye likewyse fynde mercie daye wherin euerye one shalbe rewarded accordyng dedes may fynde god benefyciall diligent beneficial myne affliccion wyll make rehersall howe many thynges dyd ephesus seyng thou knowest better lyke shewed himselfe towardes also rome true charitie frayed stormes affliccions p ii chapter texte thou therefore sonne strong grace thorow christ iesu thinges thou hast heard many witness comyt thou faythful men shalbe apte teache also thou therfore suffer afflyctions good souldier iesu christ man warreth entangleth selfe worldly busines maye please hath chosen souldier though man stryue mastery yet crowned except stryue lawfully husbandman laboureth must fyrst receaue fruites consyder saye lorde geue vnderstandyng thynges therfore acccordyng onesiphorus example myne take thou strong stomake vnto thee laying hold vpon goodnes god whiche haue christe iesus beyng prepared armed agaynst periles syncere doctrine ghopell whiche delyuered vnto thee hucker mucker openly manye wytnesses see thou dearelye beloued sonne delyuer likewise handes vnto others published abrode euery bodye auenture thou shalt thynke wilbe faithfull ministres shall appeare apte folowe thyng selues haue receiued also powre purely abrode vnto others thou seest suche appoyntedto ministeries warre set matter aparte leaue nothing vnwrought vndone maye vse feates commendacions christe hath euen maner warre also whose boke thy name written serue hym thou haste taken thyne othe hath made captayne armyes se therefore becometh valiaunt captayne agaynst al sorowes fortune thou shewe thy selfe hartie worthy thyne emperour iesu christ whiche contynued stedfastly offyce commytted vnto hym euen vnto crosse careful ye pelfe man lyueth world cast care al together vpon ye emperour yu altogether mind yt hathe comauded go hertely behoueth v appeare slacke warefare christ tha see comen sort souldiours seculat warres whan hath appoynted kyng emperours warres carefull clothe meate prouision mater emperour taketh vpon hymselfe souldiour hath nothyng make hys trauil acceptable emperour chosen valiaunt faythfull souldiour vnto thys busynes knoweth hys rewarde ready thempoerurs handes case deserue also among suche haue gyuen selues wrastle mastries ynoughe euery one wrastleth wrastle maketh mater howe wrastle stryueth wynne victorie beyng assured crowne readily prepared yea behaueth hym selfe hartilye stowtelye wrastlyng sorte diligent husbandeman whan breaketh vp ground whan donggeth whan soweth whan w deth together worke thinketh labour paynefull hope frute knoweth good grounde wyll yelde season howe muche behoueth v doe whiche occupied ghospelles affaire prouoked wt rewarde immortalitie suffer thynges willynglye worlde speciallye forasmuche haue emperour nother wil deceaue v considre meane similitude lord geue thee vnderstandyng also thinges hereof cometh losse rather whan affliccyons encreace gayne saluation whiche preached ghospel encreaceth also goddes pleasure declare myghtye power haue sene heade maye trust vpon selues texte remember iesus christ sede dauid tose gayne death according gospell wherin suffte trouble euyll doa euen vnto bandes word god bounde therefore suffre thynges electes sake myght also obtayne saluacion christ iesu eternal glory true sayinge yf dead hym shall also lyue hym pacient shall also reigne eny hym al shal denye v beleue yet abyderh faythful cannot denye thinges put remembraunce testifye lorde folowe contencious wordes whiche profite peruerting hearer requisite haue remembraunce thou knowest christe iesus beyng made mortall man sede dauid hath enhaunced glorye ghospell throughe suffrynge rebuke punishemente crosse exalted rewarde immortalitie ghospell preache yet hitherto without shrynkynge beyng neyther afrayed iewes malice gentyles feare ghospelles sake afflicted many displeasure yea euen vnto pryson bondes thoughe euyll dooer doo geue ouer preachyng ghospell bodye bounden yetto toungue preacheth christ could bounden beyng prysoner muche doeth possyblie lye allure many vnto christ sorte euer maketh matier suffre maye encrease gaynes ghospell christ cause sake suffre thynges wyllynglye beyng assured mine owne saluacion also throughe preachynge ghospell shall atteyne saluation god hathe appoynted felicitie whiche saluation offered men throughe moses lawe throughe iesus christe lyke hathe suffred v lykewise becometh v suffre gospelles sake saluacion brother lyke throughe sondry affliction spyghtefull entreatyng exalted glorye heauen euen muste preace ende waye matier vnto manye semeth hard vncredible vnto v ought vndoubted yf bethrough baptisme dead together christ vnto lustes world also yf perseuer professyon baptisme chaunce v turmoyled sorowes world shal come passe yt shal also liue wt christ wete shall copanions immortalitie wt whiche copanyons death yf suffer wyth hym glorie shall vndoubtedly reigne wt also god perfite equitie wil suffre shut felowshippe reygnyng would haue felowes sorowes suffryng yf professe boldely worlde men shall acknowlege v also maiestie shall denye denyeth refuseth crosse shall come passe laste daye shall heare terrible voice knowe put trust owne wealthe distrust shall haue losse concernyng opinion commeth neyther wynnyng losyng therof owne nature true chose lyke hymselfe whether beleue beleue shall come passe hath promysed godly lyfe neuer shal dye vngodlye deathe shall neuer haue ende thys foundacion ghospelles doetrine see thou warne men wythoute disputyng wrangglyng humayne argumentes charge lord iesus autor doctrine witnesse thy monicion yea reue get vngodlynes excepte repent beyng warned manner sadde earnest charge geuyng thou shalt doo good disputing mynde wise stryue wordes maner sophisters couet humayne reasones affirme thinge oughte perceaued faythe matter doeth onely auayle nothyng furtheraunce godlynes also weakeneth strength faythe length subuerteth myndes hearer euerye thinge called question philosophicall reasones thyng set vp throwen ne whereof lawfull doubte ariseth question vpon question nether ende measure questionyng texte study shew thy selfe laudable vnto god workeman neadeth ashamed destributyng word truth iustly vngostly vanites voyces passe thou ouer wylencreace vnto greater vngodlynes wordes shall frete euen disease cancre whose nomber dimeneus philetus nyng truth haue erred saying resurteccion past already doe roy fayth sure ground god standeth styl hath sca e lord knoweth hys let euery man calleth name christ depart iniquitie notwithstandyng great house onely vesselles gold uer also wood yerth honoure dishonour man therfore purge hym selfe suche men shalbe vessel sanctified vnto honouer mete v lorde prepared vnto good workes see thou rather let suche maner wranglynges passe studye shewe thy selfe ghospellyke workeman disputour woorkeman laudable vnto men vnto god behaue thy selfe ghopels affayres hath chosen thee nede ashamed thee shalte thou doe case thou wylte thwyte vayne fonde disputacions teache faith summe total ghospels doctrine yf thou brushe awaye bramble doubtefull question deuyde dystribute worde god wyth vprighte iudgemente propoundyng onely thynges properlye belong matier saluation godlynes moreouer reiecte boldely vayue brablyng wordes whiche yf receyued venome appeareth lytle lytle shall growe alwayes wickednes length mater shall come ende man opinion dysputacions beynge come vre strength ghospels doctrine ouerwhelmed obscured growen vse talke suche men case occupie eares myndes symple wyll alwayes crepe none otherwyse canker bodye ceasseth occupie nere partes lytell lytle tyll haue marred myschiefe muche loked incontinent beginnyng cut rather chearished afore take roote suppose afrayed matter wyth oute cause excepte wee haue readye seene hymeneus philetus thyng afrayed treate matter fayth humaiue disputacions haue ted ferre wyde frome truth ghospell haue denyed chiefe poynte foundacion ghospell saying resurrection already fynished christe none resurreccion loked behalfes wherby maner borne newe lyue agayne child representyng v consyder meane season take awaye resurrection yt feare hope rewardes taken awaye also che abyde sondry sortes godly vngodly myschiefe tolerable beyng subuerted seluessubuerted fayth doctrine perill leftetheyr peruersitie shoulde cleane turne trueth gospel vpside downe though mennes opinion wauer vp downe yet truely foundacion faythe beyng throughe helpe christ cast defenced standeth firme shronken resistences heretikes vnto thys sentence eng auen stone neuer scraped lorde knoweth owne leate euery one departe iniquitie professeth name christe maruayle though departe frome christe neuer syncerely ioyned vnto christe men doctrine ought euery one absteyne haue beleued ghospell pure fayth dede wyshed desyres suche pestilence spryng vp congregation howbeit possiblye suche multitude men must suffer naughtie packes myngled among good yea theyr naughtines turned good godlye beyng vered suche expresse constauncie fayth largelye riche man great house vesselles gold siluer also wood earthe whereof appoynted honest vse vnhonest onely difference suche naturally claye wood turned golde syluer case forasmuche matier wyll nature throughe hys owne vyce hathe made himselfe vessell shame maye helpe god begynne agayne vessell honour contrarywyse folower godlynes hath bene golden vessell house god case throught faulte slyde agayne vnto vngodlynes shalbe vessell shame vnbelefe desyre aduauncemente crueltie luste andsuche lyke deseases mynde make man vessel shame shal vtterly purge hym selfe returne vnto innocencie godlynes doubte shalbe vessell honoure pure vessell fytte excellent good v alwayes ready lorde often nede shall requyre texte lustes youth auoyde folow righteousnes fayth loue peace call lorde pure heart falyshe vnlerned questiones put knowyng gendre stryfe seruaunt lorde must stryue gentile men apte teache one suffre euill mekenes informe resist trueth yf god tyme wyl geue repetaunce knowe truth maye come selues agayne oute snare deuill whiche holden captiue knowe youth prouoked sondrye lustes maye drawe man vncleanesse thou exercisest office elder auoyde lustes youthe rather folowe thynges worthyly beseme thee righteousenes fayth charitie peace professe christe pure herte suche hymeneus haue thou nothynge doe innocencie synneth fayth disputeth charitie statelye peace stryueth shorte receyue folyshe vnlerned question haue ostentacion wisedom knowyng suche nothing elles spryngeth chyding braulyng whylest heate disputacion breaketh oute alwayes matter last groweth vnto rageyng madnesse none wyll geue place rather moste stubburnely defende parte knoweth false taken lesse learned thys kynde men therfore thou shalte meddle whan possyble ouercome christe perswaded worlde waye ouercame sobrenesse gentilnes voyce hearde stretes becometh seruaunt folowe maisters fote steppe abrauler peaceable gentle towardes men man doth perswade ease praysed charitie sobrenes beynge ready rather teache chyde patient suffryng euill prouoker suche one correcteth saddely sharpely resistoures expressyng himselfe meane nothyng elles muche bring amendement man ought despaired rashely maye throughe sobre frendelye correccion god maye geue repentaunce former errours whan darkenesse mynde wyped awaye maye acknowledge embrace trueth impugned laste beyng repentaunte awakyng frome heauye slepe ignoraunce maye rushe deuilles snare whiche vndoubtedlye naughtye lustes wherein beyng catched caried pleasure yea euen vnto persecutyng trueth ghospell p iii chapter texte know last dayes shall come perelous tymes men shalbe louers owne selues couetous bosters proud curssed speaker disobedient father mother vnthankeful vngodly vnkynde trucebreakers false accuser riotous searce despisers whiche good tray tour heady hye myuded gredy vpon volupreousnes louers god hauyng silmilitude godlynes haue denyed power therof suche abhorre sort enter house bryng bondage woman laden synne woman led dyuerse lustes euer learnyng neuer able come vnto knowledge truth therfore requisite arme v onely agaynste persecucions iewes ethnikes also agaynst malice maner men must dissemble ouercome whiche auoided take certayntie spirite sayeth hande shal come passe last dayes shall come moste haynous tymes whan pure godlynes shall growe kynde charitie ghospel wexe colde men shalbe louers onely selues geuen couetousnes money disdaynefull proude cursed speaker disobedient father mother vnthankefull wycked lackynge good towarde owne nere kynted promyse breaker false accusours ryotours vngentyll hater goodnes traitours felowes frendes rashe swellyng louing voluptuousness god tytle appareli ceremony hypocrisye makynge outwarde shewe godlynes whan denye chiefe poynte true godlynes beyng muche pestilent vnder outwarde apperaunce relygion moste fylthy spotted conuersacyon also defyle syncertitie ghospelles doctrine iewishe fable mennes inuentions perchaunce see presente daye tende abhominable sortes behauiours see therefore thou also auoyde suche person thintent thou mayest certaynly doo shall partely paynte oute theyr maners vnto sorte dede wyth settyng fayned religion sluttishe clothes coutrefaicte grauitie countenaunce craftye pale colour conueye selues men house fyrst thyng doo goe aboute inueagle folishe woman maye meanes easylye begyle husbandes euen serpent meanes eue deceaued adam fyrst weaker sexe apte deceaued entangle sadde true godlye matrones lyghte woman whiche professe christe al laden synne forasmuch substauntially endeuour selues vnto perfite godlines wauer caried aboute diuerse lustes beyng content haue learned v whiche sufficient vnto true godlynes often tymes gredye learne newfangles cause prouyde doctours mete owne lustes teache knowe nothyng neuer bring knowledge trueth rather vnder pretence teachyng ghospell cloke moste fylthy lyfe thoughe professe christe openlye yet teache suche geares secretlye cleane contrarie repugnaunte doctrine christe texte iannes iambres stode moses eue also resist trueth men corrupte myndes leude cocernyng fayth shall preuayil longer madnes shalbe vttered vnto euen thou hast sene experience doctrine fashion lyuing purpose fayth long suffryng loue pacience persecution affliction whiche happened vnto antioche comum listra whiche persecution suffered paciently fro al lorde delyuered yea wil lyue gooly christ iesu shall suffre persecution euill men discei er shall waxe wourse wourse disceyue disceyued selues ought seme maruayle yf arise euen nowe whose naughtynes enemye ghospell olde example lyke time paste egipte iannes iambres enchauntementes wente put myraculous wonder credence moses power god euen men also vnder certaine false pretence godlynes resist trueth ghospell beyng desperate men onelye infecte shamefull lustes mynde also depraue syncertitie ghospelles doctrine faythe vnto owne purpose vnto tyme haue dede deceyued henceforthe shal muche preuayle sleyghtes shall come passe madnes shall openly vttred vnto men euen learned enchauntours craftye conueyaunce beyng detected caused contemned laughed scorne whose maners conscience vncleane doctrine possible cleane shorte countrefaicte ware endure alwaies thing countrefaicting hath couered secret tyme doeth bryng forth open lyght thou art farre vnlyke vnto theyr condicions see doctrine ghospell whiche delyuered purely vnto thee thou distribute also purely constauntlye vnto suche doctrine suche also lyfe wherof thou canst best wytnesse whiche hast bene great conue aunt hast experience sene synceritie doctryne demeanour lyfe agreable hertye forewardenes stomake sterted backe nothynge strength faythe coulde moued sorowes lenitie towardes wrong iudgement charitie wherby desyrous doo good euen myne enemy pacience persecucions affliccios thou knowest chaunced vnto antroche icomum listra thou knowwest greuous stormes persecucions haue susteyned aboue mannes strengthe yet lorde hathe delyuered whose ayde continued without shrynkyng neuertheles fortuned vnto either myne owne peculy destenye neyther yet euill dyd purenesse bothe ghospell preachynge also lyuing turmoyled many sorowes yea whosoeuer myne example christes folowe true godlynes must necessarylye example myne prepare selues suffre affliccions world shall neuer without suche mayntenaunce feyned religio shall trouble goe aboute oppresse folowers true godlynes howbeit thys trouble shall aduauntage euen vnto wycked one deceauours prosperitie shall vnto greuous damnacion shall suffre paynes two speciall cause aswell selues swarued trueth also bycause snared others errours case repent leue owne peyne texte continue thou thynges whiche thou hast learned also comitted vnto knowyng thou hast learned muche also chylde thou hast knowen holy scripture whiche able make learned vnto saluacyon thorowe fayth whiche christ iesu scripture geuen inspiration god profitable teache improue amend instruct righte wisues man god maye perfecte prepared vnto good workes see thou continue thynges whiche thou hast learned vpright office comitted vnto asmuche thou knowest doctrine ordinaunce thou hast vndoubted case thou reme brest autor proceded teacher thou learnedst thou hast forgotten holy scripture thou learnedst long go thine elder tender yeares thy fyrst childehode whiche scripture beyng rightly vnderstanden euen without autoritie hable make learned ferre belongeth obteynyng saluation gospel promyseth v obseruacion moses lawe throughe assured faith wherby beleue christe iesu whiche gospel partly teacheth al ready done olde testament telleth expresseth hande shall come yet teacheth none thynge ghospell doeth howbeit sorte haue godlye learned reader reason esteme bokes prophetes moses none effecte gospel published yf spirituall vnderstandyng applyed vnto christe vnto godlynes al whole scripture set forth vnto v man witte inspiration holy gost hath greate profyte eyther teache thynges whiche vnknowen perill saluation reproue whithe agaynste veritie correcte call agayne waye erre ygnoraunce elles ordre informe iewishnes humayne philosophie true innocencie vprightenes lyfe muche auaylable al thinges make office godlynes man dedicated god behynde nothing perfite fullye furnyshed workes christian lyfe iiii chapter texte testifie therfore god lorde iesu christe whiche shall iudge quicke deade apperyng kyngdom preache thou worde feruet season season improue rebuke exhort al long suffryng doctrine tyme wyl come shall suffre holsome doctryne theyr lustes shall whose eare itch get heape teacher shal wtdraw eares fro trueth shalbe turned vnto fable watche thou al thinges suffre affliction worke euangelist fulfyll thyue office vnto vtmost sobre moreouer beseche eftesones god father iesus christ whiche shall iudge quicke ye dead whose sentence man shall escape commyng shall come iudgement lowe estate myghtie terrible whiche suffred selfe iudged hys kyngdome whiche power shalbe hable resiste preache worde ghospel stronglye nether beyng frayed aduersitie lustles prosperitie feruent earnest season season shalbe tyme shall seme season wherin thou mayest haue anye hope good ghospelles busines reproue offender exhorte sluggarde checke still contynueth errour may amended seueritie whiche amended curteous admonicion howbeit checke sharpenes chydyng thou myngle lenitie doctrine lest thou seme either hate case thou thodre wt nothing checkes elles chide without aduisement thou nothynge checke teache withal ease obedient perswaded better wyll man doeth loueth loueth rather vre confyrme conscience forsomuche herafter shalbe sayed haynous perilous tyme wherin shall departe profession ghospell suffre true holsome doctrine christe contrarie lustes worlde lyke moste fylthie corrupt affeccions sondry sortes euen shal get lurkyng themselues sondry new doctours teache godlines iewishe fable man inuentions shall icle eares shal itche folishe desyre rather heare newfangles subtil fyne reason mater profite vnto fable shall conuerte theselues shal turne eares fro trueth gospel endeuour thou thyself muche vnto cleane contrarie maner watche beare euery thing ghospelles sake shewe thy selfe right gospel preacher dede teache fantasy though named gospell preacher yet veryly none texte nowe ready offered tyme departyng hande haue ught good fight haue fulfilled course haue kept faith hence forth layed vp crowne rightwysnes lorde ryghteous iudge shall geue day onelye vnto also loue hys commyng thy diligence thou mayest come shortely vnto ministerie thou exercisest rowme see thou behaue thy selfe thou mayest fullye perswade matter thou teachest fasten throughly conscience lyghtlye shaken shall goe aboute teache contrarye thynges whiche thynge standeth thee hande muche diligently loke shall helpe trauaylles longer sacrifice appoynted christ beginne euen offered vp day afmy death long willyng glad offered vp bothe hauyng good conscience former spent lyfe beyng assured rewarde haue fough ioylye fight haue fynished gospellike course haue done appoynted throughly faithfully haue already played partes nowe behynde knowe sauegarde know crowne due innocencie layed vp store lorde yelde vnto euen emperour whose souldiour haue bene shall yelde lyfe wherein tyme fyghtynge daye wherein euen ryghteous iudge shall rendre vnto euerye one reward accordyng desertes crowne immortalitie prepared also laye holde vpon promysses kepe selues vpryght vndefyled waytynge gladlye commyng among trust thou arte one chiefe doo thy diligence come shortely thou canst pryson hyndreth walke hyther thyther goe aboute ghospelles busines saken al mooste euerye bodye shorte thynges desyrous commende vnto myne owne mouthe ore departyng texte demas hath forsaken loueth preseat worlde departed vnto hessalonic crescens gone galacia itus vnto dalmacia lucas ake arke bryng profitable vnto ministra yon tichicus haue sent ephesus cloke left troada catpus e h com est bryng bokes specially parchement alexander coppersmyth dyd muche euyll lorde rewarde hym accordyng dedes thou ware also hath greatly withstande wordes demas hath forsaken hauyng leauer possesse thys worldes pleasure hope immortal rewarde companion myne affliccions vpon purpose went thessalonica crescens gone hence galacia busines hath titus dalmatia luke onely wt neuer geueth ouer folowyng fortune euer falleth whan thou comest bryng marke thee haue nede seruice haue sent tichicus certaine busines vnto ephesus whan thou comest bring cloke thee left behynde troada carpus maye weare winter prison also renaunt bokes left behynd especially writen perchemet alexander copper smyth hath forsake stormes hath also done much sorow part reuege lord reward hath deserued also thou ware onely assiste also vehemently withstande sayinges texte p first answeringe man assysted al forfoke praye god maye layde charge withstandynge lorde assysted strenghted preaching fulfylled vtmoste gentile shoulde heare delyuered mouthe lyon lord shal delyuer euyll doynge shal kepe vnto heauenly kyngdome prayse euer euer amen fyrst tyme put make answere emperours barre man assysted afrayed forsoke ther fell vpon certaine humayne toye woulde wyshe imputed vnto albeit destitute man helpe lorde forsoke assisted gaue strength ye preaching gospelles faythe perswaded vtmost fame shoulde spreade abrode vnto eares gentyles vpon consyderacion suppose wyll haue tossed aboute throughe dyuerse country length brought vnto rome yt gospelles doctrine spred farther abroade helpe mightier tyranne delyuered moste rageing lyon cheawes myne assured trust moreouer lorde wyll delyuer also hereafter al wyckednesse ked shall shrynke occasion syncerite gospell yf shall suffre death yet wyll preserue seruaunt souldiour vnto heauenly kyngdome vnto whome glorye euermore amen texte p salute prisca aquila housholde onesiphorus erastus abode co thum trophimus haue lefte miletum sicke thy diligence thou maist c wynter eubolus greteth pudence lynus claudya brother lorde iesus christ thy spirite grace amen salute prisilla aquila myne hospte myne hospetes phorus househoulde vnto muche bounden erastus taryed styl corinthum conclude left tromphimus behinde myletus euyll ease doe thou canst come hyther wynter waye make latte iournayeng eubelus greteth well pude claudia rest brother lorde iesus christe hathe alwayes assisted also thy spirite grace amen haue subscribed myne owne hande epistle maye surely credited thus endeth paraphrase vpon later epistle apostle paule tymothie page duplicate page duplicate page duplicate right worshipfull master iohn hale seruaunt leonarde coxe wysheth long prosperouse welfare kynges maiestie aduyse consent moste deare prudente vncle lorde protectoure moste honourable counsayle vpon certaine iuste consideracions put preachours within grace dominion silence space howbeit al vnworthiest yet neuertheles one nombre maiestie licenced declare worde god people thought mete parte let tyme sylence passe ouer onely myne owne pryuate studyes meane tyme wryte thinge myghte lesse frutefull reader tongue afore hearer purpose chose vnto autour venerable antiquitie named marke heremite greke tongue wrytten two ryght vertuouse godly treaty one lawe th spirite thynke iustifyed workes whyle hande translacion master iohn olde man ryght good learnynge frende brought vnto paraphrase erasmus roterdame vpon saincte paules epistle titus whiche certaineyeares gone translated englyshe requiryng woulde peruse againe amende suche faultes therin eyther printer neglygence myne ouersyght place texte paraphrase might easyly perceaued parte paraphrase parte epistle correspondet shewed also first tome volume paraphrase vpon gospelles actes apostle readye printed printer nowe go hande seconde tome wyte paraphrase vpon epistle saincte paule apostle wherefore wyllynge helpe furtheraunce godly entente bryng l ste farthinge treasorye lorde haue loked ouer againe sayde translacion haue amended place wer faulty besyde haue annexed paraphrase texte reader shall trust easyly atteyne therby true vnderstandynge saincte paules mynde whiche labour dedycate vnto mastershyp whome knowe loue god worde synceretly vnto whome knowledge selfe moste hyghlye bounde men vnto chefe onely socourer myne olde age humbly beseching accepte lytle gyfte token faithfull harte trust goddes helpe long sende vnto monimentes myne industrye trust shalbe lesse pleasynge vnto lesse profytable reader p argument vpon epistle paule vnto cy u erasmus roterodame apostle paule made dysciple titus ouersear christian congregacio noble ile crete named candye whome excellent gyftes paul loued tenderly yf bene owne naturall sonne departinge contrey made hym head ouersear faythfull afterwarde wrote epistle lettre vnto citye epirus called nicople lyinge sea coaste clyffe named olde cosmographer leucate clyffe um whiche tyme thinges semeth quiet christian mencion made persecucion epistle putteth tus remembraunce fynishe perfyte tho thinges whiche hymselfe begone among men crete euery citie ne whiche writer doe testifye hundred sho lde ordeyne ouersears whiche nowe call byshoppes apostle named elder cause paule prescribeth vnto true forme byshop shepherd christes flocke furthermore bycause false apostle come also partes whiche went aboute put theyr iewyshe ceremony mennes heddes paule geueth courage strongly confute reiecte thinges sheweth dutye euery persone age lyke dyd tymothie addyng man ought resiste prynces magistrate executynge office power yea though infidel rather tolerate paciently maye sooner suche modestye called folowyng gospell laste wylleth tytus come nicopli afore sent artemas tychicus whiche dysciples crete least paraduenture cretians woulde el thinke selfes destitute conforte heade chiefe ouersear whome call archebysshope paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle paule titus first chapter texte ppaule seruaunte god apostle iesu christ accordyng faithe goddes electe accordynge knowledge trueth whiche godlynes hope eternall lyfe whiche god cannot lye promysed afore worlde began hathe opened worde tyme appoynted thorowe preaching whiche committed vnto accordynge commaundement god saueour titus naturall sonne continue faythe grace mercy peace god father lorde esu christ saueoure paule selfe ye addict seruaunt obeyer moses lawe god father ambassadour sonne iesus christ message ye whole summe yt suche god hath electe attayne euerlastynge saluacion thorowe gospel exhorte obseruacio ye law put confidece workes vnto faythe onely openeth al entryng euerlasting saluacio thorowe fre beneficence iesus christ comission call faythe onely also knowledge trueth among ethnikes ouer heaped inuencions man wysedom among ye iewes hydde wrapped vp ye shadowes mysticall figure ceremonyes charged saye call ye knowledge ye trueth whiche philosopher worlde teache disputinge ye cause natural thinges knowledge trueth copendyously sheweth thinges ryght christian lyfe consisteth ende rewarde wherof lyfe euerlastynge folowe shorte lyfe leade worlde whiche euerlastynge lyfe men ought truste hope great trouble soeuer endure first promysed euerlastynge lyfe mortall man myght bothe deceyued selfe also deceyue god doeth cannot chosen must neades abyde alwayes god nothing surely procede fro onely ye mere trueth bycause promysed dyd promes chauce late afore ye world made fully determined ye diuine vnchau geable decree mynde doeth newe thing hath altered purpose thing secret cause onely knowen godheed would haue couered hyd hitherto would haue opened al ye world tyme ye afore eternall wysedome appointed reuelyng therof neither would yt onely shewed ye iewes shadowe darkened wt mystes figure wil cleare trueth ye preaching gospel declared al withoute dyfferece nacion language whole effecte doctrine gospel preaching wherof haue take vpo myne head comitted comitted men saueour god dyd onely cal occupieng apostle office besyde enioyned charged therwith lawful refuse whiche earnestly commaunded wordes haue spoken man shoulde thynke myne autoritie el autoritie whome haue put stede lyghte estimacion therfore paule beyng beyng suche autorite wryte epistle lettre titus naturall bodyly generacion sead faithe whiche haue shedde whiche well resembleth seame renewed lyke father owne naturall childe wyshe grace peace whome true goodnes dothe come wytte god father sonne iesu christe onely autoure saluacion suche ryches grace peace desire haue child made ryche texte pfor cause lefte crete thou shouldest reforme thinges vnperfecte shouldest ordaine elder euery citie appointed speake nowe sonne titus sith dyd knowe right well nature ylande againe dyd doubte neade faythefull dilygente curate ouersear haue cause lefte crete one representyng myne owne persone bycause busynes gospell calleth place suche thinges haue bene begon orrected thou deputye maye fynishe bycause thou alone art able ouer loke many city ile replenysshed thou shalte ordayne euery citie ouersear byshop dyd bydde whan went thence beware thou admytte man hygh offyce without great dyscression must proued man wh thou shalte betake charge onely knowen testified honestie also must cleare suspicion maner faulte soeuer suche byshop ouersear entente thou mayste better surelyar chose wyll set forth certaine sygnes yea maner paynte texte pif blameles husbande one wyfe hauynge faithfull child whiche slaundred riot ne dysobedyent thou knowe man maners vpright lyuinge faulte proueably layed yf contente one wyfe geuynge token vnchaste lyuynge yf haue child instructe brought vp shew selfes christian onely mouthe also deades innocencie lyuynge say haue none euyl name ryotous dysfolute maners commune sorte yong haue nether dysobedyent parentes suche man shalbe meete haue charge committed shalbe counted worthy occupye rowme bishop must fer wyde bothe vyce suspicion vyce maye tymes readye make answer onely owne selfe also honest conuersacion whole familye faultes child wonte communely reproched father mother nowe whatsoeuer hurteth good name byshop turneth slaunder gospel christ texte byshop must blamelesse stewarde god stubborne angrye geue muche wyne fighter geuen fylthie lucte keper hospitalie one loueth goodnes prudente sobre righteous godly temperate suche cleueth vnto true worde doctrine maye able also exhorte wholsome lernynge improue say necessarye therfore whiche maner standeth goddes steade treasour euangelicall doctrine committed hurded vp faithfully bestowed abrode poyntes without blame far vice mooste communely beare office suche vnder maye vnder wyllynglye withall harte must loke vpon nothinge soule health flocke hathe charge must studye helpe redres amysse oppresse teache compell leade violently pull must rather perswade extorte must ouercome benefytes gentylnes tha lordelynes emperiouse comaundemet setteth mynde thinges must wilfull hye looke full hasty language whiche wyll cause men soner withdrawe theyr harte doctrine come amendement must also meanes auoyde cryme auarice gapyng lucre thinge vyle pestilente euen laye officer muche abhorred byshop whiche spirituall officer infecte couetyse dothe nothing vprightly ought equite done rather byshop must suche one wyl lyberallye bestowe goodes refresshyng neady especiall straungers besyde besemeth byshop loue vertue goodman money must also sobre iust innocent pure lyfe godly obseruacion christian faithe subiect euyll affeccions ferre aboue suche desyres wherwith commune sorte men led vp downe chefely muste fast holder wordes gospell wherin bounde well instructe maye able teache ignoraunt appartayneth saluacion soules maye holsome doctrine exhorte call forewarde suche slow fynally reproue speake truethe texte pfor many vnrewlye talker vanitie dysceauers myndes specyally circumsicion whose mouthes must stopped whiche pe ue ie whole house teachinge thinges whiche ought bycause fylthye lucre doe warne thinges without cause many waywarde parsones brablers deceyuers mennes myndes geuing eare teaching gospel brynge steade vayne vnprofytable fable iewes wherby maye get name learnyng among people also gaynes fable begyle myndes symple folke vnder coloure gospell crepe harte hearer insomuche many tymes corrupte one two ouerturne whole householdes kynreddes teaching shamefull thinges far square veritie gospell yet neuertheles abuse tytle gospell lucre whiche vilaynousely daylye hunt wherefore see thou rebuke sharpely stoppe mouthes yea gentile combred enormite chiefly thou shalt fynde malyciouse secte whiche iewes conuerted christ syncerely professe gospell mengle moses lawe therwith wyll cleane forsake iewyshe supersticion texte pone selues euen prophet owne sayde cretyans alwayes lyats euil beastes owe belyes witnesse true wherfore rebuke thou sharply maye sounde faithe takynge hede iewes fable comaundementes men turne awaye trueth vnto pure thinges pure vnto defyled vnbeleuynge nothinge pure euen mynde conscience defyled nether meruayle haue suche men founde crete feade belyes vaine wordes naughtye wayes sythen many yeares agone poete called epimenedes whiche cretian selfe dyd speake wordes owne countreymen men crete alwayes ar euyl beastes slowe belyes wytnesse trew myght taken worde goddes owne mouthe naturaly lyars feare darken cleare lyght trueth gospell fable noyfull beastes whiche euery place blowe venome symple persones ware slowe belyes whiche leauer false doctryne lyue ydlenes rankly defence gospell suffre hungre many tymes shrewdely handled wherfore rebuke naughtypackes earnestly may one waxe good leuyng trust haue ceremony olde lawe maye geue selfes wholy truethe ye gospel geue selfes lewde tale jewes throughe whiche commaundementes christ let go constitucions men brought steade obsetuacions newe mones kepinges sabbothe circumsicion wasshynges choyse meates dyuersyte clothing beware touche certayne thinges house seuen dayes vncleane many lyke whiche god tyme commaunded kepte jewes partely nacion beyng rebellious vnweyldy ordered might holden kepte vnder multitude preceptes partely thiges shadowes true thinges come nowe none effecte al insomuche yf man wyll contynewe kepe styll maner jewes nothing turne awaye veritie gospel nacion stubbornely dothe rebell againste gospell jewes wyse leue vayne thinges meate saye vncleane eate bodye vncleane touche thus speake awaye dyffereces eyther meates clothinges among trew christian beyng cleane thinges cleane neyther ought thynke thinge god hathe made vse holyar vnholyar one whether meate clothinge suche lyke thing pure christian nothing vncleane jewes whose myndes fylthye nothinge pure cleane muche lawe permytteth cleane seynge haue trust openyng gospel would haue thinges obserued fleshly lyterall sense referred workes soule thing pure whose myndes infected mysbeleue lyfe defyled inordinate waste ambicion couetyse vice texte pthey confesse knowe god deades denye seyng abominable dysobedient vnapte euery good worke vpholde lawe nayle yet wote lawe meaneth haue prep ce circumcysed mynde within vncircumcysed go temple handes fete wasshed soule conscience vnwassed kepe sabbothe holy fro bodyly workes ye meane time haue breaste vnquieted hatered anger infection sowle feare contaminate yf eate eyther porke pigge thinke themselues cleane whan gredy eares ea e foule communication back byting thinke selfes defyled yf touche caren yet abhorre touche hoore thing stolen thinke fowle synne yf vse garment lynen wole mengled together stande amysse owne conceite whan haue theyr breast ouercouered many foule vyces great shame therfore boaste selues alone knowe god seyng deny deedes tha deny whan spotted fylthynes soule vnto moste men abominable yea vnbelefe vntractable fynally whan deades true faythe wherby cause god mercifull v farre worse men seconde chapter texte p speake thou thinges whiche become wholsome learnyng elder men sobrr sage dyserete sounde faithe loue pacieuce bbut let go fable let naughtynes men moue nothing thou remembre thy dutie thou speake thinges deade mete iernynge gospell saye whiche maye make v commendable god pure myndes manner declare disciple christ yu wilt aske thiges thei e would haue theeso speake instructe thou shalt warne elder people sobre watchfull dilygent godly workes ouercome vnlustynes age couragiousnes faith besyde yt graue playing fooles lyke yonge men olde age vse sage maners youthe maye haue renerence awe teache moderate selfes way warde soone angry commune sorte olde men greatly commended onely integrite faithe besyde charitable deades pacience suffrynge aduersities especiall suche happen gospell christ texte p elder wemen lyke wyse suche raymente becometh holynes beyng false accusats geuen muche wyne teache honeste thinges make yonge wemen sobre mynded loue husbandes loue child dyscret chaste housewyfely good obedyente husbandes word god euyil spoken yong men lykewyse exhorte sobre mynded maner thou shalt warne olde wemen go apparayled suche maner becommeth wylbe named christian persones must fynde fautes lyuyng whiche faulte peculiare sex age must geuen ouermuche drinkynge wyne vse wyne must denyed age moderate must teache maydens yong wemen suche thinges honest nycenes neyther euyll fasshions instruete wyse loue theyr husbandes childre sobre chaste kepars house playe good housewyfes hyest prayse wemen knowen subiecte obedyent husbandes name god whose religion professe flaundered thorowe lewde maners sithen see wyues heathen men behaue selfes yghte womanly suche poyntes belongyng womanhed shall vnfaithful say whan see christen wemen worse behalfe wemen seyng becometh al good maners excell thing olde wemen must thyne instruccion teache yong maydens yong wyfes shalte thou thy selfe teache yong men exhortynge sobre moderate affeccions heate youthe ouerthrowe hedlonge vice texte p thinges shewe thy selfe ensample good worckes thy doctrine honestye grauitie wholsome worde cannot rebuked whiche withstandeth maye shamed hauyng euyll thinge saye thou mayest effectuousely perswade thinges firste thou thy selfe example vnto honest doynges al dutie true christian man man doeth soner perswade men folowe doctrine doeth byddeth men thou shalte therfore teache youthe together thy doctryne thou shewe thy selfe lyuely example pure vpright lyfe corrupte maner vyce al thou kepe suche grauitie haue theyr teacher reuerence afeared offende se therfore thou moderate thy lyfe also thy wordes maye nothinge founde maye contemned onely whiche vnder thy lore maye obey also whiche afore gospell maye ashamed euyll saying whan shall se thinges withoute blame euen lye wayte seke meanes get occasion laye somwhat fynde nothing brynge entent passe neyther thyne texte p exhorte seruauntes obedyent vnto owne master please thinges answerynge againe neyther pyckers shewe good faithfulnes maye doe worshyp doctrine god saueour thinges exhorte seruauntes obediente master seruiceable al thinges leste maye seame thorowe profession christian faithe made worse afore naughtines euyll parson shalbe reproched gospell let therfore full answer maysters euyll wylled commaundementes neither must pyekers commune sorte vnthrifty seruauntes professe faythe christe lykewyse declare selfes seruice done maysters dyligent true yea thoughe theyr maisters lytle deserue thorowe honeste behauoure commende set forthe doctrine saueoure god mo men maye drawen folowynge therof whan theyse suche knowledge themselfes christian gentle amyable conuersacion texte p grace god bryngeth saluacion vnto men hath appered teacheth v shoulde deny vngodlynes wordlye lustes liue sobrely righteously godlye presente worlde lokynge blessed hope appearynge glorye great god oure saueour iesu christe whiche gaue selfe v redeme v vnrighteousnes purge v peculyar people vnto selfe feruently geuen vnto good workes thorowe gospell hath shyned bountefulnes exceading great mercy god saueour whiche afore vnknowen hath shyned onely iewes egallye men nowe beyng delyuered burden moses lawe shoulde lyue owne wyll taught baptisme faultes lyfe afore passed forgeuen v swerynge abyde christes doctrine haue one renounced geuen vp wyeked relygion worshypping image al worldly desire shoulde lyue hereafter worlde may appere manifestly truly new borne againe christe made altogether afore tofore seruantes wickednes synne fylthye concupiscence must hence forthe kepe suche moderacion wyse oppressed desyres worldly thinges let v obserue iustyce liuynge good euery man muche lyeth v hurte man maye nowe pure conscience geue honour worshyp god gaue afore deuyls thoughe paraduent punished pouertie infamie reuilynges enprisonement tormentes dyuerse euyls yet let v thynke oure faith godly lyuyng baraine vnfrutefull nether let v hunte rewardes worlde whiche comparison thinges come neyther greate contynua ce let v oke greater rewarde euerlastyng ly e shall chaunce ende worlde whiche membres christ vexed many affliction ignomies god father shall open glorye magnificence true worshyppers misery beyng cleane expussed whiche tyme shal appeare humble gloriouse terrible wycked together father shal appeare glorie lord saueouer iesus christ geuyng vnto membres glorye immortalitie shyneth bycause mistruste promyse entente wittyngly willingly came downe bye amonge v gaue selfe wholly vnto v beyng himselfe without spote synne redemed v pryce blode tyrannye deuyll whome thorowe synfulnes made bonde abolyshing olde iniquites would make vnto newe peculyar people owne example contemne euyls world treade downe entysemetes giftes vnder fete thorow worckes faythe get enheritaunce euerlastynge glorye redemer doth promyse al sincerly kepe holy worde texte p thinges speake exhorte rebuke feruentes commaundynge e man despyse thinges titus whiche great deale wyde fable iewes speake openly exhorte men folowing declyne fall againe syde reproue great autoritie whome doctryne dothe perswade whome faire exhortacion dothe moue sharpe earnest reprehension maye kepe faultes must healed seuerite therfore shewe forthe grauitie autorite byshop behaue thy selfe man maye haue iuste cause despyse dysdayne hye countenaunce must yet often neade requireth thou must shewe thy selfe autorite p thirde chapter texte p warne submitte selues rule power obey officer readye euery good worke speake euyl man fighter gentle shewynge mekenes vnto men would al seruauntes maysters yea though vnfaithful euen suche would haue christe men thy monicio prince vnto ye magistrate vnder though suche rulars vnder selfes vnchristened must wyse take hede vnto ye may maners take occasio alyenate selfe fro gospel would come passe yf head rulars shoulde perceyue reason professio haue take wer ye sediciouse fierse le obedyet comaudemetes would lay thing ye faulte ye gospel withdrawe myndes fro professio therof warne therfore beleue christ neuer al fre lawes prince magistrate must rather bicause thei christias obediet gladly thei comauded ready prompt euery good worke may se honest wyllingly co strayned feare punyshement gouernours comaunde whiche rightful great iniquitie euyl ensample disobey ouer al ye yf comaude rule otherwyse right yf oppresse subiectes ouer hardly yf cal sore vpo yet softenes sufferauce comely man folowers christ whatsoeuer comaude true religio god must therin gladly obey wil peraduenture take awaye goodes groweth greater treasour vertuous lyuing wil banyshe v controy maketh mater christ euery ready coforte seruantes aduenture wil say yf prince heathen worshipper ydolles cotaminate wt open vice enemyes christes faith suche owne harme ieopardye parte codemne yf amende better maye induced amedemet obediece sufferauce exaumples good lyuyng tha rebellio opprobrious wordes let v leaue iudge let v remembre semely v christ praye reuyled far wyde would geue checke checke th n conueniet dysciples al christias dysciples christ contumeliouse louers stryfe debate nay ought rather example whose name professe gentle shewyng myldenes onely vnto honeste men wel deserue also vnto euery good bicause deserue euyl may amende againe haue thorough impacience worse opinion belefe whan geue iust occasion moued v christian charitie suffereth thinges thinges hath good hope texte p selfes also wer somtyme folishe dysebediet deceiued seruyng diuerse lustes voluptuosnes lyuing maliciousnes enuye full hate hating one another wha se suche yt waye must pitie tha abhorte shal soner yf call remebrauce sometyme let v refuse bicause euyl lyuers wycked let v helpe best cease begin lyke v called v fro blyndenes fre clemecie great mercifulnes god may also chauge whan shalbe pleasure howbeit iewes enbrased gospel became christias wer worshipper idolles yet wer afore couersio subiecte greuouse vice beyng fooles inobediet erring fro trueth geue diuerse appetite lustes ful enuye ful malyce grudging one hating another great euyls subiecte euen vnder moses lawe texte kyndnes loue sauiour god manwarde appeared deades righteousnes wrought accordyng mercye saued v fountayne newe brythe renewing holy ghost shedde v aboundantly thorow iesus christ sauiour iustified hys grace made heyres according hope eternall lyfe foles dulleheddes made sobre wise rebelles meke tractable men erryng outt way made knowars trueth seruautes iustes voluptuousnes made glad kepers ryghtuousnes maliciouse made symple courteouse enuiouse men made glad good men hater made well wyllers euen hate v thys haue neither moses lawe yet owne merites free goodnes god coueite men yf possyble reioyse v one commune saluation verite gospel may shine geue lyght men hath geuen lyght v afore wandered lyke blynde men darkenes vnbeleuers styll nowe made open thorow ghospell howe greate goodnes charite god father autor saluation al men darkenes former lyfe put away haue obteyned true lyfe saluation obseruation lawe certayne righteousnes yet small efficacie geue euerlastyng lyfe haue obteined thorowe mere mercie godhed holy fonte baptisme benewe borne agayne graffed christ sonne euerlastyng father beyng renewed spirite haue ceased carnall haue begon spirituall therfore euer altogether bounde god whiche v nothyng deseruing hathe shed aboundantlye spirite whiche lawe coulde geue hath shed holye spirite v iesus christ hath pleased liberally geue v thynges beyng purged hys benefite oure olde synnes endeuour selfes good workes made apte receiue inheritaunce lyfe endureth euer whiche doctrine gospell doeth put v sure hope sence therefore miserable beyng nowe thorow onely mercy lorde delyuered synne hope crowne euerlastyng lyfe christe muste haue pitie vpo go aboute al meanes yt god may also haue mercy texte true saying thinges wyll thou certifie whiche beleue god myght diligent go forwarde good workes thynges good profitable vnto men let christian byshop steade iewishe fable tel thynges people certaine doubted remayneth nothing v couersation fro hence forth shew selfes vnmyndful great benefite yt haue receyued god lyue thinges accordyng godly pleasure el professio christiandome gospel wil nothyng aduaile v wherfore wil thou assure al thinges greatly perteyne vnto purpose confirme therin also whiche haue beleued god free mercifulnes haue bene redemed synnes geue crowne immortalitie whiche vertuouse godly liuinge studye folowe iesu christe nere able maye leade suche lyfe maye seme vnworthy greate profession hir promisses nowe shall declare selues true christian yf curse ethnikes iewes saye euyl yf beneficial al men affection haue piety reioyse helpe men thynges shall onelye ornate commende professyon gospell thynges selfes honeste besyde profytable drawe christe helpe whiche oppressed calamitie chiefe poynte christiantie good men benefites euen wylde beastes ouercome made tame thou shalte therfore suche wise speake preache thynges one dowte whiche mouyng many question seme haue faynte beleue teache thou greate confydence countenaunce greate stedfastnes wordes euery man maye right well perceyue thou arte throwlye persuaded whiche thou doest laboure perswade thinges commethe small frute true religion texte folyshe questyons genealogy braulyng thorowe tyuinges lawe auoyde vnprofitable superfluous folyshe vnconnyng question entangled genealogy contenciouse disputacions rather warre vpon moses lawe whiche folowyng trade iewes styrre vp gette name thereby vantage caste away superfluous vuprofytable lyfe gospell death hurte good lyuynge yf knowe moses graue founde whether iewes say lest raysed vp agayne enchaunters yf knowe howe many yeares matusalem lyued age salomon whan begate roboam moses forbyd eate fleshe swine iewes suppose blode wesell must great diligence purged many folyshe exposicion whereof profiteth tary hasteth rewarde true christian lyfe thynges must rather e cutte awaye declared professe excellente thynges oughte reproued sharplye rebuked ouercome disputacion texte man auctor sectes firste seconde admonicion auoid knowyng suche peruetted synneth euen damned selfe whiche mayntaine suche supersticions haue tofore bene mencioned erre symplenes whan warned therof wyll amende yf purposed malice eyther get name lucre fylthy cause wyll ready defende euen thynges whiche knowe false men whan thou hast twies rebuked yf amende auoyde sedicious incurable persones leste harme whan prouoked woulde doe yf let alone men regarded yea lest may turne worse inconuenience whiche cannot brought better mynde drawe goeth instructe errour auayleth geue oftenar medicine cortectio yf hope remedy errour commynge onelye fraylenes man remedied one two warnynges peruersitie incurable made worse puttyng remedy therefore beyng twyes rebuked abydeth neuertheles styffe opinio let alone froward mynde man quite ouerturned paste remedy neyther hast thou neade laboure condemnynge sythen condemned owne iudgement peryshe lost cast awaye owne faulte cannot laye excuse deceyued went oute waye thorowe ignoraunce man warned myne oure excuse vayne shal one sicke man wil take medicine peraduenture yf contemned passed woulde wexe wyser wyll yet fewer resorte vnto fewer shall contagion madnes infecte texte shall sende artemas vnto tithycus diligente come vnto nic opolis haue determined wynter bryng zenas lawear apollo en theyr iorney diligently nothynge lackyng vnto let oures also learne cell good woorkes farforth nede requireth vnfruteful salu e grete loue v fayth grace amen woulde fayne haue fewe dayes woulde damage christian congregacions crete haue bene late conuerted faith therefore haue nede diligente ouerseat whiche maye buylde vpon foundacion nowe ready layed se therefore thou mete nicopole come afore send artemas tichicus thee thee steade leste thy departing shoulde leue crete destitute orpheline thou shalte neade feare wyll meane tyme go el thou lese thy laboure purposed nexte wynter nicopole whiche citie trace whan zenas sometyme doctor moses law nowe noble preacher ghospell apollo whiche man greatlye approued doctrine christe wyll departe bryng forthward humanite maye see lacke nothyng shalbe necessary iornaye office humanitie exhibited ethnikes doo good maners sake brynge frende onwarde iorney gyue departyng sufficiently bothe vytayles otherthynges necessarye way thynke right men also whiche profelse christe learne vse suche gentyle fashion gyue due thankes deserue shuld make riche greate gyftes geue suche thinges necessarye lyuing whan nede shall requyre seyng whiche knowe christe yet taught nature geue thankes whiche haue done truly vnsemely christian men barayne vnfruteful haue receiued good turne many commende vnto thou agayne comende many loue worldely affeccion euangelicall christian loue whiche commune profession faythe doeth engendre v free beneficence goddes mercy euer amen p thus endeth paraphrase vpon epistle paule titus p argument vpon epistle paule philemon erasmus roterodame philemon grekes writing phrigi borne whiche nacion people vntractable anyshe greekes owne prouerbe maketh often mencion stripe make phrigian amende yet paul reconned philemon one hys speciall frendes bycause godlynes diligence done sayntes seruaunt one onesimus runne away fro rome theuishlye stollen somwhat seruauntes moste parte vsed doe whan hearde paule tyme bondes receiued doctrine gospel serued paule prison lest maister vexed mynde seruauntes runnynge awaye sendeth home agayne wonderfull diligence ciuilitie reconsileth vnto maister seruaunt bene runneagate piker offreth selfe suertie make good soeuer piked runnyng awaye epistle wrote prison sayd onesimus also calleth sonne thus endeth argument p paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle paule philemon p chapter texte paule prysoner christe brother timothee vnto philemon beloued oute helper beloued appia archippus oure felowe souldier congregacion thy house grace vnto peace god oure father lorde iesus christe paule tyme apostle seruaunte iesu christ nowe prysoner also shoulde glad hys prysoner whose ghospelles sake weare bondes punyshement euyil haue done notable badge free valeaunt preacher also felowe ghospellpreacher brother timothee vnto philemon profession commune faith brother singulerly worthye beloued brother onely also companion many affaire partaker office gospel wyfe appia moste welbeloued syster concernyng kynred fayth archippus felowe souldier rest congregacion whiche house grace vnto peace god oure comune father fro sonne lord iesu christ texte thanke god making mencio alwayes prayer heare thy loue fayth whiche thou haste towarde lorde iesu towarde sayntes fellowshyppe thy fayth fruteful knowledge euery good woorke whiche towarde iesus christe haue great ioye consolacion thy loue thee brother sayntes hertes comforted prayer wherwith accustomed sacrifice daylye vnto god undre thankes vnto alwayes thy behalfe ascribe thankefully vnto heare spoken openly men say purenesse thy ryght gospelling charitie yu bearest towardes lord iesus towardes hym also towardes al saintes mebres vnto euer bestowed hys wyl recke done self also beseche augment mercifulnes vpon thee thy faith whiche idle may expresse power dayly enforce pleteousnes releue mo mo office christian charitie thou maye acquaynted tried thynges thou hast hitherto done already occasion v conceaue sure confidence thee dare bolde recken vpon mater greater weyghte whan doe consider christian haue com ne little ioyous euen affliccions smal co forte thou brother waste ready deserue well al men ne thy loue wherwith thou haste refreshed sainctes heartes liicted sorowes worlde thys thy thou declarest selfe ryght brother texte wherfore thoughe myght bolde christ commuande thee whiche dewtye yet loues sake rather beseche though euen olde paul prisoner iesu christ beseche sonne onesimus begotten bondes whiche tyme passed vnprofytable nowe profitable haue sent home agayne thou therefore ue say myne owne bowel woulde fayne haue retayned wt thy steade myght haue ministred vnto bondes ghospell neuertheles without thy mynde woulde nothyng good thou doest necessitie wyllyngly wherfore hauyng experience many matter whereby thou declarest thy selfe true folower christ trusted excedynglye myght obteyne wyll albeit commaunded father sonne apostle disciple namely matter selfe indifferent agreable gospelles doctryne thou professest whiche commaundeth experience felynge mercye lorde forgeuyng debte shoulde lykewyse forgeue yet rather obteyne thyne handes charitie myne authoritie woulde rather desire one brother desyreth another commaunde maister scholar thou shalt disdayne suche desyrour thyng canst thou saye naye desyre yea euen fyrst paule whan speake paule meane mater vnto small olde man muche wonte graunted man age sake thys geare nouelties thee nowe also prisoner makyng desyres euen miserie besecher hath small weight last al prysoner christe iesu suche prisoner ought beare fauour professe doctrine christe man desyreth manye wayes thou couldest saye nay althoughe shoulde entreate anye man nowe entreate thee sonne loue muche renderly begate vnto moses vnto christ world ghospell yea begate hym bondes nowe whan shall shortely goe worlde parentes wonte loue chyldren inwardely begate extreme olde age euen onesimus tymes past whan robbed mayster tunne waye frome hym litell agreably hys owne name wete profytable trustie nowe cleane chaunged sort shal trusly thy profyte herafter also profytable wyth hys seruyce pryson therfore sende home agayne nowe become man yf thou man trust thou art yf olde paule prisoner commendacion standeth effecte thou shall receyue onesimus nowe runneagate seruaunt thynges moost stoore syngularly welbeloued sonne agaynst wyll sende home agayne rather kepe styll cause represent thee vnto bondes doubt inasmuche thou shewest muche charitie towardes others ghospelles sake thou woldest case thou mini also bondes tyed gospelles sake nowe founde vnsought thou mayest ministre vnto beyng absent thy selfe howbeit woulde nothing without thyne aduise yf vsyng myne autoritie shoulde vpon myne owne head although thou wouldest haue taken dede good parte yet thy well doinge haue lesse commendacion yf semed ioyned necessitie sent home agayne maye thy choyse eyther kepe hym sende agayne yf thou sende agayne thy doinge shall haue muche prayse enforced freely thyne owne mynde texte happly therfore departed season thou shouldest receaue euer seruaunt aboue seruasit euen brother beloued specially much vnto fleshe also lord coute therfore felow receaue hym selfe haue done hurt oweth oughte laye charge paul haue writte wt mine hand wyl tecopence say thou owest vnto euen th ne selfe also eue brother let enioy lord cofort bowel lord trusting thyn obedience wrot vnto knowyng thou wylt also say moreouer prepare lodging trust thorow helpe praye shalbe geuen vnto ther salute epaphras felowe prysoner christ iesu marcus atistarcus demas lucas helper grace lorde iesu christe spirite amen doe thynke vpon runnyng awaye hath recompensed fault eing wel doyng hath washed away baptisme hath done away wt teares wootest yu whether come passeby ye dispensacion god prouidence fault might turne good v iudgemetes god secret perchaunce purpose taken away fro thee season yt seruaut season bonde seruice endurethe longer terme lyfe thou mightest receyue euer euer whatsoeuer gospel bringeth forth yu shouldest receiue againe bond seruaut dere brother truely vnto apostle bothe brother derely beloued brother commune faithes sake maketh v elike christ commune enheritaunce sake wherunto called indifferently elike commune father sake commune redemers sake whiche difference betwene lorde seruaunt betwene maister scholar yf cause vnto dearely beloued wt whome haue nothyng commune sauyng kynred spirit much ought dearly beloued vnto vnto besydes bo de spirit also ioyned fleshe thou wouldest loue strau gier thou seest become suche one onesimus nowe thou shalte loue respecte thine owne householde proued suche one yf thou vouchesafe haue thy co panion ghospels affaire thou must take agayne selfe loue deare sonne highly beloued brother partaker bondes ghospell thou must cast hertyly loue hath bene afore tyme besemeth reherse baptised suppose newe man newly borne againe vnto losse thing greue wherof thou woldest haue amedes thou forgeue hym take suertye requyre whatsoeuer hath eyther hurt thee oweth thee bynde fidelitie vnto hande writynge loe thou haste epistle written verye owne hande yf thou thinke trustye suertie leate onesimus alone goe lawe shal paye agayne behalfe whatsoeuer oweth thus muche coulde obteyne thinke yf man disposed reherse preset might iustly require myne owne autoritie wyl make rehersall inasmuch thou arte become christian man doctrine thou owest thyne also thine owne selfe muche lesse wrong thou oughtest recken yf woulde require forgyue soeuer losse onesimus oweth thee howbeit desyre onles thou wilte wyllyngly thyne owne mynde forgeue muche set promise libertie thou shouldest declare thy charitie wel goe brother onesimus hath name fruition lyke loue hym derely woulde al myne hert haue praysed vnto let chaunce haue fruicion thee maner among commune people frend glad frende apostle ioyous disciple expresseth doctrine christ thou seest hartely loue onesimus hath wel deserued loue therfore receyue hym make herte mery herein trouble muche doe put distrust thy charitie vpona certaine abundaunce loue beare vnto sonne dede knowe thyne obedience throughlye well thyne olde diligent doinges doubt thou wilte doe behalf require meane whyle receyue onesimus gentlie eue pledge also prepare lodgyng agaynst come whiche shall long trust god throughe prayer wil restore agayne vnto shall presently thanke thy gentill receyuyng onesimus epaphras thy countreyman saluteth thee whiche felow pryson bondes christ iesus sake moreouer marcus aristarchus demas lucas felowes office imagine beseche onesimus doe grace oure lorde iesus christ alwayes wyth spirite amen p thus endeth paraphrase vpon epistle philemon argument epistleto hebrues gathered de erasmus roterodame nacion resisted gospel christe obstinate mindes iewes bare also speciall malyce agaynste paule partly openly professed himselfe apostle ye heathen whome iewes aborred vnreligious godles partly semed abolishe moses lawe conpted holy desired published thorough worlde stede gospell insomuche euen amonge receyued christes doctrine thought obseruacon lawe ought wyse ioyned coupled gospell wherfore faythfull hierusalem sondrie wayes vexed iniured resisted gospel aduersaries beeing commen officer hauing publike autoritie handes sincere professours gospel caste prison scourged suffred spoyle losse theyr goodes paul therfore coforteth good men example old sainctes moste parte exercised like greuouser calamity vertue therby might tried made excellet chefely conforteth example christe hope heauenly reward declareth christes gospell hath shewed furth hir shyning lyght shadowes moses lawe haue vanished awaie continue longer place repeteth many thynges olde testament applieth vnto christ teacheth ought hope saluacion kepyng lawe geuen tyme vnperfit fayth olde notable holy men whose remebraunce iewes great veneracion chiefely pleased god ende teacheth certayne rule pertaining christian maners p ende argument paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle apostle saincte paule hebrewes fyrst
