chapter texte god tyme past diuersly many wayes spake vnto father prophetes laste dayes hath spoken vnto v owne soune whome hath made e thynges whome also made worlde whiche sonne bryghtenes hys glory ymage hys substaunce rulynge thynges worde hys power hath hys owne persone pourged ou e synnes sytteth ryghte hande maiesty bye beyng muche excellent angel hath heritaunce obtayned excellent name tymes past almyghtie god desyrous tender loue bare towardes v prouyde health saluacion mankynd spake ofterymes diuerslye many wayes prophetes vnto whome appeared shewed hym selfe somtimes clowde somtymes fire otherwhiles softe whistling winde nowe vnder one likenesse nowe vnder somewhiles angel somewhiles secrete inspiracion mynde length laste dayes would manyfestly declare charitie towardes v put v assuraunce dayned speake vnto v angell yet man prphete hys onely sonne iesus christ whome hath eternall appoyntmente determinacion made heyre lorde alonely iewyshe nacion whole worlde hym true sonne lord thinges made heauen earth according father promised psalmes neither merueyle would haue seignory whole world commen betwene hys sonne hym syth made worde made worlde sonne eternal worde euerlastyng father neither made worlde hys sonne instrument seruaunte thynges wrought creacion therof one selfe power father creating iesus christ sonne god godly men oftetymes called child god obey god commaundementes begotte god god father begotten nature father euerlasting bryghtnesse father glory light procedyng light image resemblaunce hys substaunce lyke poyntes equall vnto whome gotten alonely maker creature also gouerneth turneth aboute thinges made created becke almyghty commaundement together almighty god father yet marke whitherto abased selfe cause toke vpo man nature subiecte al iniuries wretched state conditio dying offred vp selfe sacryfice sinnes aulter crosse wheras priest moses lawe woonte pourge synnes offryng beastes bloude purged offence mankynd shedyng owne holy bloude abasyng humblyng hymselfe gate greate glory reliued retourned heauen sate ryght side maiestie god father wherin alwayes egall vnto hym touching diuyne nature maiestie plainly appeared vnto worlde thorowe humilitie somuche semed lowe abiecte loweste nowe greater take prophetes also angel selfes much greater name sonne hath dignitie name seruaunt worde angell vocable worde signifying ministre name agreyng inferio vndoubtedly high great dignitie aungels alwayes assyste father beholde hys visage amonge excell rest dignytie texte vnto aungels sayed tyme thou art sonne thys daye haue begotten agayne wyll hys father shalbe sonne agayne bringeth first begotten sonne world sayeth era aungels god worshyppe hym vnto aungels sayeth maketh angel spyrites mynisters flame fire vnto sonne saith thy seate god shalbe euer euer scepter thy kyngdome ryght scepter thou hast loued ryghtewesnes hated iniquytie wherfore god euen thy god hath anoynted thee oyle gladnes aboue thy felowes vnto aungell dyd god euer geue great honour vouchesafed call hym name sonne wheras speaketh vnto christe misticall psalme wyse thou art sonne haue begotten thee day father shalbe sone made angel nought sonne begate owne proper substaunce lyke euery thing egall vnto hymselfe agayne mistycall psalme bryngeth sonne worlde hauing vpon hym habite man body speaketh manour let al angel god worshyp hym true seruauntes honoured sone egall father adored worshypped holy scripture expresseth dignitie aungels sayeth maketh sayth scripture angel spyrites minister flame fyer angel created haue commen thinges likewise created almighty god made spirites mindes free mortalytie corrupcion man body alwaies burning godly charitie assiste maker quicke nimble minister godly wyll commaudement therin vndoubtedly excell v howe much greater wordes speaketh vnto sonne thy seate god shalde euer euer scep thy kyngdome right scepter ye heare name god geuen vnto sone ye heare howe seare kingdome geuen kingdome saye neuer shall haue ende foloweth psalme thou hast loued ryghtuousnesse hated iniquitie wherfore god euen thy god hath enoynted oyle gladnesse aboue thy felowes ye heare specially enoi ted god father aboue hys felowes eyther men aungels texte thou lorde begynning haste layde foundacion earth heauens workes thy handes shal perishe thou endurest shall wexe olde also doth garment vesture shalt thou chaunge shalbe chaunged thou arte euen thy ye e shall fayle vnto whych aungels sayd tyme sitte right hande tyll make thyne enemyes thy fore stole ministryng spyrites sente minister theyr sake shalbe heyres saluacion agayne marke howe muche autoryt e geuen sonne psalme thou lord sayth prophete begynning haste layed foundacions earth heauens workes thy handes shall peryshe thou endureste shall waxe olde doth garmente vesture shalt thou winde aboute shall sodaynly chaunged thou art euen thy yeares shal fayle aungell wordes euer spoken el redde psalme sytte ryght hand till make thine enmies thy footestole therfore neither autoritie create neither maiestie kindome geue vnto angel howe greate euer spirites appoynted serue often tymes sente worlde assiste suche shalbe thenheritours euerlastyng saluacion vndoubtedly disciple folowers christe ii chapter texte wherfore ought geue erneste e thynges spoken vnto v leste tyme peryshe yf worde spoken angel stedfaste euery transgression disobedience receyued iuste recompence rewarde howe shall escape yf despyse greate saluacion whiche fyrst beganne preached lorde hym selfe confirmed vnto v warde hearde god beating witnesse therto signes wondres also dyuers myracles gyftes holy ghost accordyng hys owne vnto aungels hath subdued world come wherof speake one certayne place witnesseth saing man thou art mind full sonne man thou visitest hym thou madest hym litell lower angel thou haste crowned hym wyth houour glory haste sette hym aboue workes thy handes thou haste putte thynges subieccion vnder hys feete put thynges vnder hym lefte nothing put vnder neuertheles se yet al thinges subdued vnto hym made lesse angel se iesus crowned glory honour suffering death grace god taste death men moreuer haue largely declared dignytie oure sauiour entent greater whome father hath sent worlde saluacion dilygent hede maye geue thynges hath spoken vnto v leste tyme forgette thynges father hath taught shewed v hym highest sent hym greates ambassadoure coulde send hys pleasure shoulde last ambassade legacion neyther hope saluacion despise sette naught elder forefather despised moses prophetes greater ambassadour greater cle encye gentlenesse god towardes v greuouser shall faute oure dysobedience el negligence excepte hys wordes teaching yf al god hath hither commaunded vnto elder hys prophetes aungels shewed vnto moses goddes commaundementes weight autorytie worthely punyshed dysobeyed suche thynges commaunded bycause semeth despyse god despyseth hys messenger howe shall escape punishmente despise sette naught moses comaundementes ready saluacion notable euydeut suche frely brought v moses yet aungels prophetes agaynst whome may suspicion vanitie lying one meanes ymagyned sonne god hym selfe spakenot vnto v farre cloude either dreame waye wherin myght suspicion deceyte legerdemayne openly heard seene handeled conuersaunte alonge tyme amonge men declaryng many moste euydente argumentes proofes sonne god offeryng perfite saluacion vnto al whole worlde thorowe faith gospel belefe great thing beganne first taught preached vnto worlde lord iesus chryst selfe alonely preacher euerlasting saluacion also autoure therof afterward confirmed wytnesses thynges sayde dyd whyles conuersaunte leste theyr preachyng shoulde haue bene small autorytie litle regarded god self cofirmed theyr wordes diuerse signes miracle wonder merueylous gyftes whiche heauenly spirite diuersly dystributed vnto hys thought expediente mannes saluacion thynges appered manyfestly thys done nothing partayning mannes power vertue power god firste hym selfe afterwarde disciple shewed thinges man onely god couered habite mannes body also aungel mistical psalme playnly declareth witnessyng christ wise manne thou art mindfull hym sonne manne thou careste thou haste humbled litle lower angel streight wayes foloweth thou haste crouned glory honour set aboue workes thy handes thou haste putte thynges subieccion vnder hys feete c euer god created e rth decreed hys godly determynacion whatsoeuer shoulde erin shoulde vnder obeysaunce subieccion iesu christe read god gaue seignory lordshippe worlde aungels also conteined aungels sayed thynges put vnder hym excepted nothyng put subieccion prophecie thys psalme partely fulfylled partely accomplished world come yet see thynges vnder subieccion yet wicked rebell greate con ycte bytwene churche worlde thys see nowe fulfylled iesus afflycted wyth diuerse formentes conclusion suffred punyshment crosse man cause asted whych mannes iudgement moste bytter dyspleasaut tasted wyse ouercome therwyth semed made lower aungels neyther subiecte death greife payne see saye iesus nowe crowned wyth great glory honour world perceiueth beyng fau elesse parsonne free synne suffred punyshment death accordyng wyl god wylling thys meanes pronyde mannes safetie hys death punyshment offence hym commytted mere fauour god towardes mankynde woulde hys free beneficence greate lyberalytie haue redemed death moste innocent sone iesus christ coulde promote v felowshyp immortalytie lesse god mere created thynges whose moderation thynges gouerned suffre wholy perishe created made sonnes kyndome yf alone father texte became whome thinges whome thynges brought many sonnes vnto glory make lord theyr saluacion perfecte thorowe affliccions sanctifyeth sanctified one whiche cause sake ashamed call brother sayng wyll declare thy name vnto brother myddes congregacion wyl prayse agayne wyll put ust hym agayne beholde chyldren whome god hath geuen therfore thought mete conuenient vnto almightie god father sonne beyng autoure chiefe causer mennes saluacio tr ed proued many affliccions purchase himselfe thenheritaunce euerlastyng glory also bring wyth hym many chyldren reconciled vnto father hys death therfore toke vpon hym mannes body beyng manne might puryfie pourge manne hys offence priest christ puryfieth men cleansed puryfied touchyng nature man yssue firste parent lyke haue one comen father heauen wherfore sonne god ashamed psalmes call godly folke hys brother speaketh thus foloweth wyll declare thy name vnto brother myddes congregacion wyl praise thee doth openly cal disciple brother againe certaine place wyl put truste nowe parte proued childe truste father hys harte certes sytly father promissed woulde put thynges vnder hys sonnes fecte doubte wyll saue also whome sonne reygneth agayne place prophete esaye lorde calleth disciple child sayeth child god hath geuen heare vocable name kynred texte asmuche child partaker bloude also himselfe lykewise toke parte thorowe death myght expell hym lordshyppe ouer death saye deuyl myght delyuer whiche thorowe feare death theyr lyfe tyme subdu vnto bondage place taketh hym angel seede braham taketh hym wherefore thynges became hym bee made lyke vnto brother myghte bee mercifull faythfull hye prieste thynges concernyng god pourge people synnes fortuned hymselfe bee tempted hable sucker also tempted therefore brother child whome speaketh men whiche consiste haue theyr beyng fleshe bloude hys owne nature heauenly woulde take man fleshe bodye vpon hym therein bee made lyke vnto whome woulde call vnto felowshyp eternall kynred myghte expell hym hadde rule lordeshyppe ouer death saye deuyll sette libertie alwayes subiect vnto seruitude bondage satan thorowe death raigned ouer mankynde whosoeuer bondage subieccio sinne th subiect vnto death christ neuer gaue aungell honour woulde take hys nature vpon hym become brother kinseman according vnto god promise tooke sede abraham borne iewe iewes manne man subiecte vnto incommodities euilles nature thirst hunger heate colde werines payne death thys likenes testifie true kynred nature put v sure beliefe woulde forsake whome suffered great euilles displeasure ioyned vnto hym streighte bonde alyaunce consang itie wherefore conuenient poyntes made lyke vnto whome would haue brother might therby put assuraunce obtayne pardon asmuche tooke vpon hym tho yce hye priest bishop make intercession vnto god purge al people sinnes reconcile mankynde vnto father shoulde seme reason howe would ee mercifull faythfull hys onelye selfe nature also chaunsed hym tryed proued innumerable affliccions worlde intent shoulde appeare readyer succoure whiche bexed euils aduersities iii chapter therfore holy brother partaker celestial calling consider ambassadour ye priest profession christ iesus faythfull vnto hym put offyce euen moses al house looke howe much honoure hath builded house hath house selfe muche honoure counted worthye moses euery house builded man orde ned thynges god moses verelye faythfull hys house minister beare witnes thynges whiche bee spoken afterwarde christe sonne hath rule ouer house whose house yf holde fast confidence reioysyng hope vnto ende wherfore brethre ye purified bloud sonne free goodnesse god called come bee partaker lyfe celestiall thentente maye bee answerable vnto benefites consider howexcellent dignitie iesus christ ambassadour bishop profession say euangelicall fayth howe purely vertuously behaued hymselfe godwarde whome ordeyned whole congregacion lykewyse moyses commended acquited hymselfe faythful minister sinagogue house familie god christ deserued much honour dignitie maker house oughte bee honoured house selfe euerye house buylded man hath ordeyned made thinges god therefore moses conuersaunt house god part member autor original causer therof verely vertuous godly man moses woorthy great autoritie among v behaued hymselfe faithfully house yet minister stewarde sonne mannes house saye christ owne moses brought onely figure shadowes thynges christe afterwardes dysclose open christe maker sonne guided owne house whereof member whiche thorowe fayth gospell bee assembled together vnto hys churche congregacion perseuer beganne wit dooe styll abyde concorde agreaunce house holde fast stedfastely vnto ende faythe whiche spirite christ hath geuen v also glorious hope true natural sonnes god brother christ looke enheritaunce heauen shall nothyng auayle v haue heard doctrine gospell excepte continually liue thereafter yea greatter dayned speake vnto v grieuouser shall punishment texte wherefore holy ghoste saieth daye yf ye heare voyce harden harte prouokyng daye temptacion wildernes youre father tempted proued sawe woorkes fourtye yeare wherefore greued generacion sayed doe alwaye erre theyr harte verely haue knowen wayes sware wrath shal enter reste take heade brother leste time bee frowarde herye subiecte vnto vnbeliefe shoulde departe liuyng god exhorte ye one another daylye called daye leste wexe harde harted thorowe deceitfulnes sinne wherfore ye must call vnto remembraunce holy gost speaketh mistical psalme exhorting people obey voice wordes god leste prouoked dooe grieuouslye punyshe se lude rest quietnes promised today sayeth ye wil heat hys voice harden harte ye murmo ing rebellion ye prouoked god tyme proued pacience wildernes sayeth youre father tempted men woulde proue whether hable punishe trespacers lawe offender felte wrath suche woulde beleue woordes sawe woorkes space fourtie yeres long ledde wildernesse tyme flying oute egipte went vnto lande promised quyetenes wherefore contented nacion sayde selfe doe alwaies erre theyr harte folowing theyr owne lustes neyther haue knowen wayes thys theyr dysobedience sware wrath shoulde neuer entre lande wherin promised rest trauayls theyr iourneys ye haue heard brother god threatenyng father come lande promysed onlesse woulde continually obey commaundementes thorowe baptisme deliuered oure former synnes offence vndoubtedly departed egypte yet shall neuer come vnto immortalitie promissed v heauen excepte styll continue obseruaunce fayth christian charite wee looke backe vnto egypte forsaken yf fall agayne lustes oure olde lyfe shal bee excluded felowshyp participacion heauenly lyfe se therfore bee frowarde harte rebelling commaundementes gospell subiecte vnto vnbelyefe suche wyse returnyng agayne vnto vice forsaken prynce death deuyll departe awaye thy lyuyng god rather daylye exhortacions make ye one strong suffer continually paynes trauayles thys lyfe whereby god tryeth oure pure trewe fayth longe tyme called daye saye longe beare mortall bodye yet doe trauayll pilgrymes straungers wildernesse thys worlde alwayes ieopardye lest v weryed euilles thys lyfe bee ledde asyde thorowe alluremente synne iourneye begonne lyke tymes paste hebrues forefather beeyng wery theyr long trauailing longed auoure pottes whiche lefte behynde egypte texte p made partaker christ kepe sure vnto cude beginuing substaunce long far de day ye heare hys voyce harden harte prouoking herde prouoke howbeit came egipt moses whome displeased fourtie yeres dyspleased sinned whose carkases ouerthrowen deserte whome swa e enter rest vnto obedient see coulde enter vnbelie e certeynly graffed christe baptisme profession faith wise may thorow owne defaut fall neyther shall otherwise come vnto enheritaunce mortalitie promised v excepte kepe sure constauntely vnto ende beginnyng foundation felicitie whiche layed v gospell still goyng forewarde begoonne monyshed thereto thys saying whiche continually spoken vnto v day ye wil heare voice harden heartes prouokyng hearde lordes voyce dysobeying moue hym prouokyng hys wrathe indignacion agaynst howbeit al dyd whiche came egipt vnder conducte moses vnto disobediente geuen come vnto lande flowing milke hony whome dyspleased fourtie yeres offended howbeit entred rest carkases ouerthrowen wildernesse whome elles muche dyspleased sware neuer entre reste promised whiche obeyed voyce god see god sydes trewe bothe perfourmed obedyent promissed disobedient manaced obediente came thereunto pacience coulde entre theyr vnbelyfe incredulitie iiii chapter texte let v feare therfore lest yng promise eu eyng est seme time haue disapointed vnto v declared wel vnto profited heard worde thei whiche heard coupled fayth haue beleued doe entre reste said euen haue sworne wrath shall entre este spake verely longe workes made foundacion thy world layde spake certaine place seuenth daye wise god dyd rest seuenth date al workes place agayne shal entre reste moses vnto oure forefather elder thesame christe nowe vnto v worldely reste whereunto hastened goe vnto reste celestiall lette v therfore feare despise voyce god daylye speaketh vnto v ghospell leste lyke many owne defaulte disapointed hope expectacion rest promised may chaunce v also seme haue bene disappointed haue attained thende hys iourney vnto v shewed muche blisful rest certayn faithfull ambassadour vnto auayled nothyng thei receiued promise rest hitherto heard voice lord thei beleued thei heard haue geuen credence vnto lordes voyce doe enter true rest shalbe free vnquiete busines trouble worldly euils contrary parte denieth shal enter haue beleued saying haue sworne wrath shall entre rest wheras neuertheles first rest god already bene many yeres euen creacion worlde woorkes perfitely finished memorial hereof iewes dooe celebrate resting daye scripture speakyng firste reste whiche chaunced seuenth daye creacion worlde sayth lord rested seuenth day al woorkes agayne place alleaged psalme made mencion seconde reste whiche refreshed hebrues harborow lande palestine weried long trauail iourneying saying shall entre rest texte seeing therfore foloweth shine muste enter therinto whome first preached entred therein vnbeliefes sake appointeth certayn daye long tyme saying dauid rehearsed thys day ye wil heare voyce harden heartes iosue geuen reste woulde afterwarde haue spoken day remayneth therefore yet reste people god entred est hath ceased also hys owne woorkes god dyd hys sith therefore foloweth authority god first entred reste made worlde fewe entred seconde reste theyr vnbelefes sake consideryng also promise shall yet voyde excepte entre therein forasmuche forefather excluded therefro vnto whome reste promised figure shadowes lawe reste thesame yet vnto whome promysed neuer intred againe mistical psalme day appointed mouth dauid many yeares lande palestine possessed day sayed prophete calleth seuenth day butthis daye hath bene nowe oftentimes rehearsed daye ye heare hys voice harden harte yf iesus sonne naue beeyng capitayne certayne entred palestine geuen trewe reste vnto israelite god woulde afterwarde haue made mencion day mouthe dauid el might haue sayde newe reste speakest thou vnto v fence alreadye enioy reste promised reyguyng lande iewrye therefore remaineth certayne restyng daye vnto people god remaineth reste palestine countrey celestiall whitherto hasten iesu christe beeyng captayne yet shall neuer chaunce v attayne thesame excepte wee haue kepte purely withoute violacion resting day gospell abstayning woorkes worlde whosoeuer hath entred true rest god hath nowe likewyse rested woorkes god rested hys created made worlde brought life vnquietnes neyther labour griefes paynes texte let v study therfore enter rest lest eny man falle ensample vnbelefe worde god quyeke myghty operacion sharper two edged swerde entreth euen vnto diuiding sunder soule spirite ioyntes marie discerner thoughtes intentes herte neither creature manifest fight thinges naked open vnto iyes whome speake therefore while yet trauail straungers wildernes lyfe let v stande still let v looke backe continuall endeuoyre feruent desire hasten true rest whereunto capitayne iesus calleth v let long v v fall waye forefather dyd shall haue lesse punyshemente doe likewise offende neyther punishement litle regarded passed christ iesu woorde god threarneth quicke strong operacion sharper twoo edged swerde onelye cuttyng membres bodye also moste inwarde affeccions mynde insomuch cutteth soondre soule spirite disseuereth ioyntes marye beeyng discerner secrete thoughtes entente harte trew parte man thought vnknowen vnto creature neyther heauen vnder yearth whiche manifeste vnto syght al thynges naked open iyes hym vnto muste geue accomptes lyfe time paste mourmuryng hebrues vnknowen vnto god neded swerde destroye onelye commaundemente shall man vnknowen vnto christ hath professed christian lyfe priuely loueth worldly thinges doth pure minde affeccion hasten vnto reste promised texte seyng haue greate hye priest entred heauen euen iesus sonne god let v holde profession hope haue hie priest cannot haue compassion infirmity pointes tempted like yet without synne let u therefore goe boldely vnto seate grace maye obtayne mercie finde grace helpe tyme nede seeyng haue hye priest verely great iesus christ sonne god whiche sacrifice made reconciliacion entred moste secrete parte temple made handes heauen make father mercifull vnto v let v abide stil professio folowing way hath shewed v hastening thynges whiche hath promised let greatenesse feare v mercye rather encourage v trueth dwelleth heauen man conuersaunt earth let v therefore ymagyne haue hye priest canot take compassion infirmitie tempted withall kynde euils oure lyfe y combred howbeit retourned agayne heauen conquerour thentent trustyng hys ayde shoulde weried ouercome affliccions couragiously goe thorowe vnto reste euerlastyng felicitie whych came vnto cause afflicted beaten spytte vpon crucified harmfull person innocent gyltlesse onely pourge v dede hurtfull caytifes inners al oure sinnes iniquity hath tha ged hys affeccion towardes v tourne hym awaye v oure owne vicyous behauioure frowardnesse therfore trustyng hys mercy let v goe vnto hys seate hys terrible appesable seate whych ready helpe destroye v let v come boldly putting doubtes obtaine mercy handes wherby dure synnes maye pardoned grace also geuen maye furnyshe v heauenly gyftes helpe v ofte nede shall require muste desire aydes hym onely whome truste haue ou rewardes v chapter texte euery hye pres e taken amonge men ordained men thinges pertayning god offer giftes sacrifrces sinne haue compassion igno te er e waye asmuch hym selfe also compassed infyrmitie infyrmities sake bounde offer sinnes well hym selfe people man taketh honoure vnto selfe called god aaron fvrthermore vsage amonge iewes euery hye priest chosen amonge men ordayned thys purpose business chaunce betwene god man mediatoure betwene maie make intercession menne wise yf god thyng dyspleased wyth mennes offence may appease wrath giftes sacrifice duely offred hie priest dignity sake hye priesthoode canne suche wise muche god yet free mannes infirmitie tent maye readyer take compassion haue sinned thorowe erroure ignoraunce asmuche hym selfe subiecte vnto infirmitie selfe nature suche sooner sory mennes euils dyspleasures haue selues learned mercy compassion tastyng lyke euils aduersities gladder reamedy mennes errours offence falleth oftentymes hym selfe leastwyse ieopardie fall thys cause moses priest ought well offre sacrifice hys owne synnes offreth people offence nowe christ tommune nature v subiecte vnto paynes death notwithstandyng manour synne experience payne neuer knewe synne furthermore accordyng ordinaunces moses lawe man taketh vpon vsurpeth honourable ministracion hye priest hod hys owne accorde onely taketh hande called thereunto goddes commaundement lykewyse aaron called semeth vn worth honour whoso reason ignoraunce ambiciously desireth digintie man meete rowme ministracion whych intrudeth hym selfe texte euen christ also glorifyed selfe made hye prieste safed vnto hym thou art sonne thys daye haue otten gloryfyed hym saieth also another place thou art prieste euer order melchisedech wh che dayes fleshe offered vp praiers suppsicacions strong criyng teares vnto able saue death heard reuerence thoughe ehe sonne god yet learned obedience thynges whych suffered beyng perfecte cause eternall saluacion vnto al obeyed hym called god hye priest order melchisedech herein also christ gaue v ensample lawfull bishop toke vpon owne accord glorious dignitie hie priest allowed hys father firste acknowledged iesus hys true sonne sayed thou art sonne thys daye haue begotten also orde neth hunanon true lawful hie priest sayeth thou art priest euer ordre melchisedech ye haue hearde howe ordey ed nowe herken howe tempted proued yet mortall body earth offred prayer supplicacions vnto god father could haue preserued punyshment crosse excepte bene desyrous prouyde mannes safetie death hys sonne offred seruent affeccion greate cry plentifull teares hearde reason hys charytie soueraygne dignitie father obteyned hys desyre hys wyll desyre escape punyshment crosse procure v soule health hys death felte greate feare felte torment anguyshe death loue bare towardes mankynde preuayled sonne coulde haue obtayned thyng father desired thus thought conuenyent health beyng afflicted manour euils aduersities geue vnto rule perfite obedience euen punyshement crosse ye aske auayled thys pacience oure priest proued tryed euery waye nothyng shoulde bee lackyng hym saued onely hymselfe cause saluacio folowe thys ensample obedyence obtayned father whiche woulde de hys felowes suffryng affliccions shoulde also partaker hym hys kyngdome sacrifyce duely made called father hye prieste ordre melchisedech texte wherfore woulde speake many thynges harde vttered seyng ye dull hearinge concernyng tyme ye ought reachers yet haue ye neade agayne teache firste princyples worde god become suche haue neade mylke stronge meate euery man fed mylke expert worde ryghtewesnes babe strong meate belongeth parfecte euen reason vse haue theyr wyttes exercysed discerue good euyll nowe melchisedech howe conueniently figured sonne god would largely entreate shalbe harde declare thynges vnto eares receyuable matter weake awaye sermon suche length difficultie herein constrained requyre diligence feruent desyre goe forwarde notwithstandyng haue many yeares professed christe quantitie space tyme ye teacher men yet haue nede bee taught agayne first principle man would saye b c holy scripture whiche wonte taught vnto vnto child thorowe baptisme borne agayne vnto gospell whome behoued nowe strong stablished euangelicall philosophie haue nede yet lyke tendre babe fed mylke lowest doctryne rather meete receyue strong meate higher learnyng yet continewe styll one would saye crepe historye holy scripture ryse vp hydde mysticall vnderstandyng therof nowe one hath nede yet nourished mylke ignoraunt strong ynough heare ryghteousnesse gospell whiche founde thistorye allegory therfore receyuable preachyng wherby taught perfitte ryghteousnesse yet babe christ lately graffed body wise may litle litle aspire greater thinges furthermore strong meate profounde misticall vnderstandyng pertayneth whiche growen become perfitte euen long cotinuall practise haue wyttes exercised discerne good euyll chylde nouryshed mylke lyueth verely yet hathe gotten hymselfe strength eustome age wherby able choose himselfe euery thyng best loketh haue put mylke chyldes meate chawed mouthe vi chapter texte therfore leauing doctrine pertayneth beginning christen men let v go fourthe vnto perfeccion laying agayne foundacion repentaunce dead workes faith towarde god baptisyng doctrine laying handes resurrection death eternall iudgemente doe god permytte cannot lyghted haue tasted heauenly gyfte become partaker holy ghost haue tasted good worde god power worlde come yf fal awaye concernyng selues crucifye sonne god freshe make mo ke ou renued againe repentaunce wherfore let v ought nowe haue ceased lenger child christian philosophie omytting processe wherwith ignoraunt wonte taught first prynciples go forth vnto perfeccion euer stande styll aboute often laying foundacion repentaunce fyrst degre vnto christendome repentaute former lyfe forsake sinne next requyred taught true innocencie soule helth hoped god forthwyth pourged holy baptisme filthynesse oure synnes restored agayne vnto state innocencie receiue holy gost laying hades beleue resurreccion dead come also last iudgement shal awarde eternall felicitie euerlastyng paynes damnacion endughe v haue learned professed beleued thynges shoulde thyng dysagreable reason haue taught forsaide principle behaue selfes hereafter nedefull haue often tymes repeted taught v agayne taught purpose shoulde foundacion edifice whiche buylded haue learned suche principle shalbe partes dilygente endeuoyre may daily encrease vertue godlinesse become great perfite noble building golde syluer precious stone vertues godly workes maye ryse rered vp foundacion layed euen hyghest toppe duetie employe diligence thys ende maye fynishe thyng go aboute god fauorable vnto attemptes without whose ayde mannes endeueyre able bryng nothyng effecte haue begun course trade lyfe ought turne backes make resistence returne vnto thinges forsaken still goe foy warde greater thynges higher perfeccion greatest folye myght manne haue recourse vnto thyng whiche neyther ought ne repeted ministred agayne possible whych haue forsaken darckenesse theyr former life lyghtned doctrine gospell hauing theyr synnes forgeuen thorowe baptysme haue felt free beneficence greate liberalitie god gyfte heauen wherby releaseth synnes geueth v grace lyue well afterwarde laying priestes hand haue bene made partaker holy ghost whome haue begonne beleue blessed promise euerlastyng lyfe take saye foretaste power worlde come possible saye fall agayne thorowe negligence former abominable lyfe renued repentaunce thing hath bene done already baptisme olde manne cast away dedes newe creature commeth bathe water suche requyre renued agayne thorowe repentaunce haue often tymes fallen againe vnto theyr former sinfull lyuyng goe el aboute concernyng selfes crucyfie sonne god freshe make iestyng stocke mocke hym hath died v haue dyed hym baptisme hath rysen agayne wyll neuer dye semblable wyse muste rise againe newe lyfe fall eftsones dead lyfe forsaken meanes prouoke god much vnto wrath indignacio hath bo ntuously shewed hys lyberalitie vpon v industrie diligence ought answerable vnto hys liberalytie bo teous goodnes towardes v hath put v certayne sedes vertue goodnesse therfore also must diligence may growe come good texte earth whyche drinketh rayne cometh oft vpon bry geth forth herbes meete dresse receaueth blessyng god grounde deareth thornes brier reproued nye vnto cursing whose ende burned neuertheles deare frendes trust se better thinges accompany saluacion thoughe thus speake god vnryghteous shoulde forget worke labour procedeth loue loue ye shewe hys name haue ministred vnto saynetes yet mynyster yea de euery one shewe dylygence full stablishyng hope euen vnto ende ye faynte folowers thorowe fayth pacience receyue enheritaunce promyse earth hath dronken rayne falleth oft vpon hath brought forth herbes profytable tyll praysed god barayne kepeth doune strangleth sede whych therin sowed without frute profyte grounde whych good seed receiued hath brought forth thornes thystles yuell ye vnto goddes cursyng whose ende mowed downe u ned thynges speake dearly beloued exhorte wordes haue spoken baren earth maie well applied naye rather haue conceyued better opynyon wherby ascertayned goddes helpe shall attayne saluacion rather damned albeit similitude vsed styre vp desire godly chrystian lyuing lost waxing fainte againe come litle litle vtter confusion god wyll helpe endeuoyre attayne better thynges vnkynde vnrighteous suche wyse wyll forget good dedes labour ye haue susteyned renownte vauntage sake loue name loue ye haue shewed dedeselfe hertofore haue ministred goodes benefites vnto sainctes christes name preached yet ministre thys present furthermore haue spok wordes desyrous ye among whome many fainter would shoulde perseuer doynges onely also dayly profite tyll ye come perfeccion wher haue nowe good hope may haue sure confidence belefe perceyuing styll go forwarde nothing nye daunger thorow slowthful faintnesse fall agayne litle litle theyr oldelyfe rather folowe steppe beleuing christes promyses hauing sure hope heauenly rewardes attayne enheritaunce lyfe immortall whych god hath promised vnto hys kyngdome heauen suche dystrusting goddes promyses loked backe vnto egypte forsaken neuer came vnto lande behest abraham agaynste naturall reason constantly beleued goddes promise obtayned taried texte god made promesse abraham noue greater sweare sware hymselfe saying surely wyll blesse multiply thee dede afterthat taried paciently enioyed promes men verely sweare greater selues othe confyrme thyng ende strife god wylling aboundantly shewe vnto heyres promesse stablenesse hys councell added two immutable thynges whiche vnpossyble god shoulde lye myghte haue strong consslacion whiche h ther haue fled holde fast hope sette v whiche hope holde auere soule sure stedfast hope also cutreth thynges wyth vayle forerunner v entred euen iesus made hye priest euer order melchisedech god thentent hys promyse shoulde better beleued sware othe amonge menne wonte compted surest gage canne sware hymselfe none greater himselfe swere sware thys wise sweare selfe thou dyddest thys thing sparedst thy onely begotten sonne isaac formysake blesse multyplie thy seede starres heauen sande sea shore therefore hadde perceiued constancie thys olde manne sticked sley euen hys owne sonne whome semed al hope spryng posteritie confirmed thyng othe promised hauyng man condescended fasshions manours man men aggrauate theyr othe doswere hym greater haue doubte controuersie amonge selfes discussed ended confi macion othe cause god would notably declare stablenesse hys counsell vnto heyres promyse added othe leste man myght suppose wouldelye bounde hymselfe wyth two bandes fyrst promyse othe thentent also beeyng stablished sure belefe myght haue strong consolacion aduersities thys worlde saye haue sette felicitie pleasure thys presente lyfe haue fled hytherto obteyne hope sette v worlde come whiche hope wee holde fast meane tyme stormes worlde stedfaste sure ancre soule fasteued transitorye thynges heauen stretcheth selfe euen thynges wythin vayle whereas mutacion thynges stable euerlastyng thys warde parte temple iesus christe runnyng thyther v shewing v way hath entred make intercession v vnto father made hye priest euer ordre sayde begynnyng melchisedech vii chapter texte melchisedech kyng salem whiche beyng prieste moste hye god met abraham returned agayne slaughter kinges blessed hym also abraham gaue tythes al thynges fyrst called interpritacion kyng righteousnes kyng salem saye kyng peace withoute father without mother without kynne hathe neyther beginnyng dayes ueyther yet ende lyfe likened vnto sonne god contynueth priest euer nowe sen processe wordes hath broughte v agayne mencion melchisedech lette v consider man reason bare fygure prieste wee reade melchisedech king citie called salem au hye pryest hye god whiche melchisedech mette abraham hys retourne slaughter three kynges blessed hym valiaunte acte vnto whome abraham also gaue tythes hys goodes fyrste melchisedech verye interpretacion name called kynge ryghteousnesse tytle kyngdome called kyng salem saye kyng peace said neyther father mother pedigrew begynning dayes end lyfe hym spoken whiche verelye agreeth wyth sonne god contineweth prieste euer farfoorth eueryethyng agreeth derye well wyth hye pryeste christ ordained kyngdome ryghtuousnesse prynce peace touchyng deitye neither father earth mother whose pedigrew manne hable declare neyther begynnyng shall haue ending whose priesthoode continueth euer purifyeth beleue hym vnto worldes ende nowe let v consider dignitie melchisedech ho farre excelled pristes moses lawe abraham greate patriarke dyd onley vouchesafe receyue blessyng hym sleyne kynges also gaue hym tythes syoyles texte consider man vnto whome also patriarke abraham gaue tithe spoyles verelye child leui whiche receyue thoffice priestes haue commaudement take according lawe tithe people saye theyr brother yea thoughe sprong loynes abraham whose kinred counted among receiued tithe abraham blessed promise man denyeth whiche lesse receyueth blessyng hym whiche greater men dye receiue tithe receiueth tithe witnessed liueth say trueth leuy himselfe also vseth receiue tithe payed tithe abraham yet loynes hys father melchisedech mette abraham lawe moyses commaunded whiche came linage leui shoulde succede ministracion priesthoode receiue tithe theyr brother alonely saye posteritie abraham neither doeth auctoritie dignitie leuites stretch melchisedech alyaunt iewishe nacion receyued tithe abraham auctour whole nacion blessed whome according vnto god promise nacion iewes shoulde issue contouersie lesse receiueth blessing greater whose blesseth doeth allowe hys autoritie whiche done nowe thauctoritie allowe wont remayne superiour eguall inferioure tribe leui receiued tithe also mortall menne themselues whose death thesame auctoritie came vnto sayde melchisedech liueth continueth euer preeminence perpetuall priesthood conclude whereas thauctoritie demaund tithe came leuy chiefe priest vnto priestes yet abraham payed tythes melchisedech semeth leuye also hymselfe made bonde paye tythes notwythstandyng wonte receyue therefore counted lesse authoritie paye tythes vnto leuy leuy inferioure vnto melchisedech vnto whome gaue tythes man wyll saye howe gaue tythes yet borne tyme melchisedech mette abraham forasmuche posteritie manoure counted bee auctoure nacion therfore sayed intelleccion leuy came abraham gaue tithe vnto melchisedech texte nowe therefore perfeccion came priesthood leuites vnder priesthood people receyued lawe neded furthermore another priest shoulde ryle bee called ordre melchisedech ordre aaron yf priesthood bee translated necessitie must lawe translated also whome thinges spoken pertaineth vnto tribe neuer man serued aultare euidente lorde sprong tribe iud tribe spake moses nothing concerning priesthod yet mere euidet thing similitude melchisedech arise priest made lawe carnall commaundemente power endeles lyfe maner doth testifie thou art priest foreuer ordre melchisedeche commaundemente wente afore dissanulled weakenes vnprofitablenesse yf perfyte religion holinesse dyd depende vpon l iticall priesthood semeth vnto iewes lawe geue vnder aaron trybe leuy needed agayne another priest rise writen mystical psalme said instituted ordre aaron order melchisedech seeyng auctoritie fourme lawe ioyned fourme priesthood nedefull priesthood translated fourme fourme lawe bee lyke wyse translated chaunged certes chaunging tribe sufficiently declareth manour fourme priesthood must nedes chaunged whome prophecie psalme speaketh none tribe leut wherof neuer man yet serued aulter euydent lorde iesus sprong trybe iuda moses institute rite auctoritie priesthood made mencion thys priesthoode whiche shoulde bee kynred tribe iuda furthermore priesthood whereof psalme speaketh manoure priesthood moses priesthood doeth appeare manifestly prophecie playnely addeth woordes folowing order melchisedech signifying therby priest vnly e vnto aaron like melchisedech thentente shoulde vnderstande lesse difference betwene one persone betwene rite ceremonte efficacie priesthood meaneth ordre melchisedech nothing el doeth sacrifice beastes prescrybed grosse carnall lawe heauenlye grace bryng v lyfe euerlasting law purifie fleshe washinges diuers purgacions grace purifieth soules sacrifice strength efficacy aaron contineweth euer priesthood euerlastyng sayde melchisedech continueth euer hys priesthoode shall haue ende thynges verelye agreeth christ mistical psalme declareth saying thou art priest euer ordre melchisedech priesthood contineweth season geueth place euerlastyng priesthood mortall hye prieste geueth place vnto immortall certes v perfiter priesthood geueth place vnto perfiter euen vnperfit lawe geueth place perfiter lawe gospell wherby constitucions lawes moses conteyned olde testament dyssanulled strength sufficiente profitable shoulde haue texte lawe brought nothyng perfeccion introduccion better hope whiche drawe uye vnto god therefore better hope thyuge done without oth priestes wer made without othe priest othe sayde vnto hym lorde sware repente thou art priest euer ordre melthisedech cause iesus stabli better testamente god woulde v made perfite lawe broughte nothyng perfeccion neyther geuen purpose yet geuen vayne truelye geuen season thentente shoulde certaine griece stayre bring v length better hope promysed fruitfull lande wherein shoulde lyue quietlyfe kepte commaundementes moses lawe law grosse rewarde thus god prouided grosse capacity menne sensible thinges shoulde litle litle fall vrewith thinges spiritual comaunded ey steale shoulde pourge handeling carayne certayne ceremony lande promised wherein liue quietly yeres vnto v heauen promised may liue euerlasting ioye felicitie meane commaunded loue euen oure enemy theyr prieste deuoutly occupyed sacrifice make intercession vnto god people went inwarde partes vayle priest entred euen heauens pleade cause god father whome made nye vnto ambassadour christ iesu head churche possyble bodye awaye head present reason suche hye prieste haue surer hope iewes meanes theyr hye priestes theyr priestes ordeined without othe oth god would haue made thentente shoulde haue sure confidence hys promise priest whose mediacion hope immortall felicitie promised v othe approued euerlastyng hye prieste god elsewise lye thus speaketh propheticall psalme lorde sware repent thou art priest foreuer ordre melchisedech therefore looke howe muche difference betwene heauen yearth betwene thynges lasteth tyme thinges eternall betwene mortal immortal betwene worldlye thynges heauenlye muche better testamente oure hye pryeste iesus made promiser much certayner promyser promyse among men confyrmed othe certaintye simple promyse texte among manye made priestes suffered endure reason death man endureth euer hath euerlasting priesthode wherfore able also euer saue vttermost come vnto god hym seyng euer lyueth make intercession v suche hye priest became v haue holy haemiesse vndefiled separate sinner made hier heauen nedeth dayly yo der hye priestes offer vp sacryfyce fyrst owne synnes people synnes offered vp himselfe lawe maketh menne priestes whiche haue infirmitie worde oth came synce lawe maketh sonne prieste whiche perfecte euermore moreouer vnder law moses needefull haue manye priestes instituted eyther shoulde execute priestes offyce tournes appoynted eyther death woulde suffer alwayes continue theyr ministracion meanes promiser oftentymes chaunged verye vncertayne hys promise thys prieste one needeth anye successoure reason endureth euer hath continuall priesthood wherfore hable bring vnto saluacio hath begun saue haue hym alwayes redy prieste whose meanes may come vnto god christ liueth euer thintete whensoeuer nede requireth may make intercessio vnto god hath offered sacrifice profite fewe short auaylable men al time hable pacifye god wrath therfore sen lawe heauenlye perfite meete oure hye prieste shoulde also one say godly without deceyte vndefyled farre seperate coumpanye synners lyfted vp aboue heauens needeth dayly offer oppe sacrifice moses priestes first sinnes people sinnes manour atonemakers themselfes nede made one god vnto whome made intercession mennes offence manour sacrifice sundrie sinnes necessitie ofte tymes made hye priest sinne owne toke vnto sinnes whole worlde offered vp sacrifice menne beast hys owne proper persone moses lawe weake vnperfite dyd ordayne suche hye priestes subiect infirmitie ye worde othe spake right declareth better lawe shall succede stede olde ordeineth euery man indifferently sonne god priest euer ready time mete make intercession v neyther death take away neither infirmitie let hym conueniente perfite besecher v viii chapter texte thynges whiche haue spoken pith haue suche hye prieste sitteth ryght hande seate maiestie heauen mynister holye thynges trewe tabernacle whiche god pyght manne euerye hye prieste ordeined offer giftes sacrifice wherfore necessitie man haue somewhat also offer priest earth priestes according lawe offer giftes serue vnto thensaumple shadow heauenly thynges euen answer god geuen vnto moses finishe tabernacle take hede said thou made al thynges accordyng patron whiche shewed thee mount thynges whiche haue largelye entreated chiefe poynte effecte hereafter haue admiracion moses hye prieste synce wee haue one soe excellente poyntes sytteth ryght syde royall seate god heauen entente maye duely make figuratiue sacrifice prescribed moses trewe heauenly sacrifice bee within tabernacle meane figuratyue tabernacle pytched man secrete place true tabernacle pitched almightie god disseuering heauenly thinges earthly furthermore sen euery hye priest wonte ordeyned intente may offer giftes sacrifice god howe possible lawful hie prieste whiche hath nothyng offer nowe earthly priesthood geuen christ lyke manour vnto priest neuer offered ne offereth sacrifice whiche accustoinably offered priestes according prescripcion lawe whiche sacrifice nothing el shadowes certayne figure heauenly temple celestiall sacrifyces whatsoeuer christe euen earth done fleshe spirite came heauen thither redeth thesame compared vnto grossenes moses priesthood woorthely called heauenly god seemeth haue signifyed prescrybyng vnto moses forme buylde temple speaketh thys wise se thou make thinges according patron whiche shewed thee mounte moses sawe spiritual iyes holyer manour temple manour sacrifyces priesthood patron whereof edrew meane season certayn grosse figure thinges till tyme come god woulde haue shadowes geue place vnto trew thynges nowe tyme already presente texte nowe hath obtained priesthode much e cellente mediatour better testamente whiche confirmed better promise yf first testamente faute coulde haue b e found place haue b ne sought seconde rebukyng saieth vnto behold day come sayth lorde finishe vpon house israell vpon house iuda newe testamente lyke testament made father daie toke handes leade lande egypte continued testamente regarded saith lorde testament wyll make house israel dayes saith lorde wyl put lawes theyr myndes theyr hertes wyll write god shalbe people shall teache euery man neighboure euery man brother saying knowe lorde shall knowe leaste moste wil merciful ouer theyr vnrighteousnes sinnes theyr iniquity wyll thinke vpon nomore sayth nowe testamente hath worne oute olde whiche worne ed olde readye vanishe awaye haue heauenly hye priest priesthood worthie conueniente hym much excellent priesthood new testamente gospell excelleth olde moses promise new magnificete greater promise olde bodyes cleansed bloude beastes soules purified bloude christe lande promised promised heauenly rewardes testament heauenly hye priest mediatoure betwene god manne heauenly manoure fyrst testamente bene suche one nothing hadde lacked therein iewes dooe suppose place haue beene soughte seconde superfluous adde anything al thinges perfite nowe god complayneth fyrste testamente vnprofitable promyseth better efficacie speakynge prophete ieremye thys wyse beholde dayes come layeth lorde wyll fynishe vpon house israell vpon house iuda newe testamente lyke testamente whiche made wyth father day toke handes leade oute lande egipte bycause contynued testament againe part regarded sayth lorde thys couenaunte wyll make wyth house israell sayeth lorde wyl graue lawes stone bokes hath bene proued vayne wyll put theyr myndes wryte heartes wyl verely theyr god agayne shall vetely people neyther shall gyue doctrine hande one suche wise euery man shall compelled enstructe hys neyghboure euery one brother sayinge knowe lorde bycause onelye fewe iewes people worlde shall knowe leaste vnto greatest wyll made mercyfull thyntercessyon sonne forgyue theyr synnes trespass neyther wyll thynke vpon theyr wycked dedes ye haue hearde hys wordes promiseth newe testament bycause olde vnprofytable nowe whiche called new say spiritual signifieth olde wytte carnall muste taken awaye dysanulled elles coulde thys testamente called newe excepte whiche worne oute waxen olde nowe worne oute waxen olde nye gone forasmuche draweth lytle lytle ende p ix chapter texte olde testament ver ordinaunces seruynges god worldly holynes foretabernacle made wherin lyght table shew breade whych called holye wythin seconde vayle ther tabernacle whyche called holyest whyche golden seuser arke testament ouerlayde rounde wyth golde wherin golden pot wyth mana andaarons rodde sprong table testament ouer arke cherubins glorie shadowyng scate grace whyche thynges nowe particularly speake man wyll saye religion olde temple vayne religion nay tymes past olde temple also whose religion nowe ende gonne succession euangelicall veritie certayne approued customes prescribed ceremony whiche made vtwarde shewe iuste perfyte liuyng also certain holynesse worldlye holynesse stoode vtwarde thynges visible whiche kynde holynesse semed also great deale among paynyms gentile buyldynge temple suche one parte therof counted holye tyll man came vnto parte whiche semed holyest fyrste place made tabernacle wherin kepte much reuerence lyght table seuen holye lonues whiche called shewe bread reason wonte set shewe holy table parte temple called onely holye bycause seuered vnholy thynges yet verye farre thynges whiche accompted moste holye wythin seconde vayle whiche parted parte temple tabernacle excellencye holynesse called holyest thys conteyned certayne holyer sorte relyques golden censer arcke called arcke testamente couered townde wyth plate golde hauynge golden potte wherin manna reserued monument aunciente myracle wrought tyme hebrues beyng hongry rayned newe kynde meate downe heauen aatons todde whiche wonderfull myracle neuer harde bare leaues cut stemme budded flower wherof afterwarde came almons also table called table testamente bycause commaundementes grauen goddes fyngre ouer thys ymages wynges called cherubynes representing maiestie glorye god whyche ouershadowed mercy seate wynges whiche thinges certayne signification holier thinges afterwardes dysclosed ghospell long speake euery premysses particularly shewe meante sygnified shalbe sufficient v compare theffecte pythe whole matter priesthode christe texte thynges thus ordayned priestes went alwayes fir tabernacle executed seruice bolie thinges second went bye pryest alone euerie yere wythout bloude whych offred hymselfe ignorance people wherewith holy ghost signified way holye thynges yet opened whyle yet first tabernacle standynge whyche simily tude tyme present whyche offred gyftes sacrifice could make minyster perfect pertaynyng conscience wyth meates drinkes diuers washinges iustifyenges fleshe men ordayned vntyl tyme reformacion nowe temple thus deuyded holy reliques bestowed place priestes indifferently whiche executed cetemouies belongynge vnto sacrifice entred dayly fyrst tabernacle seconde whiche holy went hie prieste chiefe dignitie among priestes alone euery yeare oftener wythout bloud beaste whiche offred first owne synnes synnes people edmmytted errour ignoraunce whiche thinges certayne darke fygures holye ghoste sygnified tyme yet open waye entraunce vnto place whiche verye dede holye haue manour earthly infeccion hie byshoppe entred secrete parte temple yet fyrst tabernacle standynge whiche hadde symylytude tymes whiche people certayne grosse ceremonis kepte howe euer iewyshe religion lest shoulde haue fallen greater enormity certayne grosse vulgare ceremony done commen sorte priestes sayd tabernacle gyftes offred beastes kylled offred vp sacrifice whiche thynges certayne similitude purificacion coulde yet make perfitly cleane touching conscience soule wherby god estemeth v vsed althoughe concernynge bodye estymation worlde semed giue cleanesse puritie whatso euer done perteyned chiefly vnto bodye stode choyse meates drinke whereas dede meate neyther purifieth defileth soule stode also diuerse washynges pourgations fleshe whiche instituted intent shoulde gyue manne perfyte ryghtuousnesse bycause people shoulde rudimentes fyrste principle fall vre lytle litle true religion shadowes bee brought veritie made receyuable bettre thynges whyche shoulde opened doctrine ghospell tyme shoulde come haue ye hearde effecte religion reason wherof iewes stande muche awne conceiptes nowe let v compare dignitie hie priest foresayde thynges texte chryste beyng hye prieste good thynges come came greater perfecte tabernacle made handes say thys buildyng nether bloud goates calues bloud enteed holiplace founde eternal redempcion bloud ox goates asshes ng cowe sprinkled purifieth vnclene touching purifing flesh howe much shall bloud christ eternall spirit offred hymself wythou spot god pourge conscience dead workes serue lyuinge god christ beyng hie priest promiser auctour corporal purificacion neither good thynges world whiche haue ende euerlasting heauenly good thinges entred vayle wrought mennes handes tabernacle made wyth handes saye buyldynge whyche menne doe sette vp pull downe agayne verie heauen entred say place verely holy verely farre al infeccion mortalitie brynginge wyth hym bloude goates calues therewith pacifie goddes wrath owne precious bloude whiche shed v aulter crosse wherewyth redemed one nationalonelye mankynde synnes one yeare euer vntyl worldes ende tournynge former myflyuynge know christ muche lyethe folowe hym lyfe conuersation comparison compare domme beaste vnto christe bothe god man bloud ox goates brent asshes younge cowe sprynkeled vpon vncleane persones clenseth touchynge certayne carnall figuratiue puritie holynesse howe muche shall bloude christe corporall fyre thorowe eternall spirite desirous mannes saluation offered brute beaste hym selfe pure vndefyled sacryfyce vnto almyghtye god father puryfie youre bodyes youre conscyence workes whiche dede brynge death vnto soule hys death delyuereth v endlesse death hys mooste pure spirite purifieth spirite whiche vncleane bothe purification bloude yet greate difference bothe death vnequall death bothe spirite one farre vnlyke thynge soeuer done shadowes certayne fygures christ accomplished dede texte cause mediator new testament death chanced redempcion transgressyos vnder first testamente whych called myght receiue promise eternal inheritance testament must also necessytie death hym maketh testament testament taketh aucthorite men dead yet value longe maketh testament aliue whyche cause also nether first testamet dayned wythout bloude bycause olde testament made intercession mediatour bytwene god men broughte people perfyte state innocencie therefore christe succeded rowme became newe mediatoure newe testament thentent synnes taken awaye thorow death whiche first testament coulde abolyshed taken awaye remayned suche wise broughte v oute fauoure almyghtie god onely iewes also tho whosoeuer haue bene called christes felowshippe maye nowe thorowe doctrine gospell receyue promyse hope theternall enheritaunce wheresoeuer thys worde testament hearde must nedes death maketh testamente elles shoulde testamente yf none auctoritie death testatoure makethe auctoritie whiche hathe yet sure strengthe ratifyed longe sayde testatour alyue lyeth hys power altre yf wyll wherefore forasmuche olde testament hadde also name testament ordeyned without bloude death beast suche beaste elswise shoulde haue perished texte moses declared commaudement people according lawe toke bloud calues goates wyth water purple woolle ysope sprynkeled bothe boke people saying thys bloude testamente god hath appoynted vnto moreouer sprinkeled tabernacle bloud also ministeryng vesselies almoste thynges lawe purged wyth bloude wythoute shedynge bloude remyssyon reade boke exodus whan moyses read lawe god vnto people declared vnto reward shoulde loke kepyng punishement dreade yf dyd regarde accordingly thentent couenaunt made betwene god people shoulde confirmed toke cuppe therein myngled bloude calues goates wyth water purple w sprynkled bothe boke oute whiche read lordes commaundementes lykewyse people sope sayeng thys wytnessyng bloude confirmer testament whiche god hathe commaunded kepe onely contented thus doe sprynkeled also bloude tabernacle holy vessel therein whyche vsed sacrifice lykewyse rite approued customes thinges euer purified accordynge vnto prescription moses lawe purified bloude neyther anye remyssion synnes sheddyng bloude texte nede simily tudes heuenly thinges purified wyth thinges heuenly thinges themselfes purified wyth better sacrifice christ entred holye place made handes whyche e similitude true thinges entred heuen appere nowe sight god v offre often hye priest entreth holy place euery yere wyth strange bloud must haue often suffred sence worlde began ende worlde hath apeted put synne slyght offeryng vp hymselfe apoynted vnto men shall dye cometh iudgement euen christe offered take awaye synnes many vnto loke hym shall appere agayne withoute syune vnto luation truely conuenient suche thynges earth represented similitude shadowe heauenly thynges shoulde done suche manour grosse carnall purification veritie come lyght mete heauenly sacrifice selfes made better oblacions cause trewer puritie haue sayde euen christe earth heauenly trewely entred holye place made handes whiche rather supposed holye holy dede maye tourned vnto prophane vse nothyng el certayne shadowes fygures thynges verelye holye entred verye heauen dwellethe god immortall wyth hys holy angel leful byshoppe maketh intercessyon mennes synnes purchasyng hymselfe fauourable audience wyth hys owne bloude whiche mere free charitie shedde v dyd effectuall sacrifice shall nedefull hym euery yeare agayne hye pryest olde testamente entred moste secrete parte temple yearely nether anye marueyll sacryfice made hye prieste moyses lyke efficacye sence bothe subiecte vnto synnes offred vp beastes bloud owne christe bene suche hye prieste sythe hathe soo manye age yeares begonne agayne sence creation worlde shoulde necessytye often tymes haue offred vp sactifyce lyke priestes olde testament dyd nowe suche one sufficieute hym offre vp himselfe sprinkeling blode take awaye synnes age vntill worldes ende done begynnynge woorlde nye ende openly knowen euery man al world defyled synne remeady god onelye bycause shoulde manyfestly appeare howe effectuall pryest greate vertue power one sacrifice pourged greate heape synnes lefte behynde ready easye remedye whych sacrifice shoulde sufficient al menne tyme measure woulde make selfes vn worthye therof toke vpon hym synnes manye yeares byfore put hope saluatyon hym also theyrs would manye yeares beleue ghospel wherefore worlde shoulde loke priest sacrifice pourge synnes appoynted al men shall dye without hope retourne agayne lyfe wherein ofttymes fall ofttymes pourged agayne nothynge loked euerye mannes deathe extreme iudgement wherby endelesse rewardes shalbe adiudged bothe good badde lyke wyse christe dyeng offered vp world takyng vpon moch hym laye mennes synnes bycause woulde punyshed woulde haue nothyng remayne lyfe last iudgement wherin shall appeare agayne vnto world lyke sacrifice appoynted slayne lyke worker myschiefe one worthy punishement glorious persone one knoweth maner synne shall saye appeare blysse saluation beyng nowe purified thorow death perseuer good vertuous lyuyng tyll come agayne offred vp iudge desired good dreadefull wicked p x chapiter texte lawe hauyg shadowe good thinges come fashion thinges themselfes neuer sacrifice offer yere yere comynually make commers thereunto perfect woulde sacryfices eased haue bene offered bicause offerer purged shoulde haue conscience synnes neuertheles sacrifyces mencion made synnes euery yere bloud ox goates cannot take way synnes fvrthermore cause hye priest olde testament coulde lyke reason lawe forasmuche lyuely true fashion onely certayne shadowe good thynges whiche rather sygnyfyed somewhat brought anything effecte could neuer wyth vsuall sacrifice beastes though priestes contynually offred yeare yeare make suche perfite came pacifie god wyth vneffectuall oblacions mediacion weake priestes yf perfeccyon myghte haue bene attayned thereby shoulde sacrifice offreo haue ceased tobe offred sacrifice euer offred agayne mention made freshe former synnes whiche thyng playnly declareth haue confydence one sacrifyce el purpose dyd euerye yeare offre agayne newe sacrifice one pourged synne conscience therof remayned whiche offred bene pourged seyng synne maladie soule bodie grosse bodely sacrifice bloude ox goates wyse take awaye dysease mynde onely spirituall heauenly sacrifyce christe able doe thynge sufficiently whiche thorowe fayth baptisme taketh awaye synnes former lyte neuer manye neuer heynous remayneth feate orse conscience wyl beware fal agayne olde enormyties detestable dedes soo farre wyde trewth god made mercifull reason sactifices oftentymes oftred beynge rather offended therwith required one effectuall sacrifice whiche shoulde contynew euer texte wherfore commeth world saieth sacrifice offering thou wouldest haue body haste thou ordayned offerynges also synne hast thou alowed sayed lo begynnynge booke written thy wyll god aboue sayth sacryfice offeryng burnt sacryfices synne offerynges thou wouldest haue ne e haste yu alowed whyche yet offered lawe sayde lo thy wyll god taketh waye firste estably latter whiche wyll made holy euen offeryng body iesu christ sonne come worlde make god father mercifull vnto sacrifice owne mooste precious bodye speaketh vnto hym mystycall psalme thys wyse sacrifice offerynge thou wouldest haue bodye haste thou ordeyned burnt sacrifice sacrifice accusfomablye offered pourge people synnes thou haste alowed sayed loe sythe begynnynge boke sygnified sacrifyce thy wyll god whan therefore sayeth woordes sacrifyce offerynge burnt sacrifice sacrifice synne thou wouldest haue neyther allowedest thou sacrifice whiche wonte offred accordyng vnto prescription olde lawe immediatlye addeth loe obey wyll god offre sacrifice pleasaunte acceptable vnto thy mynde wordes saye taketh awaye firste priesthode dyspleasaunte vnto god thentent maye stablyshe later ther satisfye goddes wyll pleasure wyll god thus lotheth lawefull sacrifice olde testament greatly desireth newe kynde sacrifice sooth bycause lyked free goodnes towardes v heauenly sonne saye christe shoulde take vpon hym mannes bodye dyeng synnes whole worlde purifie menne one sacrifice duely made synnes suche wise nedeth nothereafter anye blodie sacrifice texte euery pryest ready dayly ministring offeryng often tymes one maner oblacion wyche neuer take away synne man hath offered one sacrifice sinnes set doune euer righte hande god hencefurth tarieth till foe made fote steole one offering hath made perfecte euer sancrified holy ghoste also beareth v record euen tolde thys testamente wyll make vnto dayes sayth lorde wyll putte lawes heartes myndes wll write theyr synnes iniquity wil remebre remission thinges offering synne whosoeuer priest olde testament constrayned dayly ministre oftentymes offre sacrifice agayne whiche howe ofte euer offred neuer cleane take awaye synnes endlesse busynesse bothe partes saye offerer priest oblacion made christe thonely sacrifice offered sinnes al haue wyl beleue promyses sytteth right hande god father tarryeng nothynge el whiche onely remayneth saye haue membres bodye assembled together vntyll length come passe accordyng promysed psalme enemyes rebelles agaynst ghospel made foote stoole meane season nedeth offre selfe agayne v one oblation hath sufficiently perfited euer whiche haue deserued sanctified thoro faith suche wise none olde synnes layed vnto oure charge saye nowe euen holy ghoste hym selfe witnesseth speakyng mouth prophet shewyng long thyng shoulde whiche see alreadye come passe wordes testament wyll make vnto dayes sayeth lorde shall put lawes heartes write myndes synnes iniquity wyll remembre muche lesse wyll take vengeauce furthermore al synnes pardoned euer nede iewishe sacrifice whiche made pourge take awaye synnes texte seyng therefore brother meanes blode iesu haue libertie entre holy place newe lyuyng way whych hath prepared forvs vayle say fleshe seing also haue au hie pryest whych ruler ouer house god let v draw nygh wyth true hert sure faith sprynkeled hertes euil conscince put away washed bodyes wyth pure water let v kepe profession hope without wauering faithfull promised let v consider one another intente may prouoke vnto loue vnto good workes saking felowship haue among selfes manet let v exhort one another muche bycause ye se day draweth nygh seynge therefore brother conscience synnes taken awaye whyche feared v make intercession almyghtie god haue assuraunce gyuen v entre holy place let v trustyng vpo sacred bloud iesu shedde reconciliacion therby opened v awaye entraunce farre dyuerse olde waye saye freshe newe lyuynge euetlastynge waye whiche opened neuer shutte agayne whiche waye beganne vnto v entryng fyrst thorowe vayle saye fleshe godhed couered tyme worlde fleshe assumpted taken vp heauen heuenly thynges opened sythe haue greate pryest promysed god order melehisedeche god hathe made ruler ouer house saye ouer churche chatholyke whiche churche gouerneth ministre thautour lorde thereof lette v also meane tyme goe whither christe hath opened v waye let v goe saye bodely feete temple made stone pure hearte sure belefe obtayne peticion entre heauenly temple fyrst sprinkled touchyng body bloud beast touchyng mynde spirite bloud iesu christ therby purified fro coscience oure olde synnes furthermore washed bodyes pure water baptysme scoureth washeth awaye fylthe soule remayneth perseuer thynges haue begonne kepe stedfastly wythout wauerynge hope immortall lyfe whiche haue professed baptisme trustyng one thynge god promysed faythfull sure promyse cannot deceaue would contynue styll fayth furthermore bycanse made membres one bodye let v cleaue together mutuall charitee agrement consideryng selues muche eche v hath profited profession ghospell bycause enuye hym hath ouergone v despise ouergone left behynde prouoke charitie good workes good example exhortactions gyuyng one whiche thyng shall come passe goyng forewarde oure brother make v desyrouse lyue well vertuouslye also yf perceyuynge anye slacke goyng forewarde doe brotherly carefulnes prycke forthe better thynges alwayes reioysynge whyche goo makynge moche diligence suffring one perishe flocke reason forsaken occasion seruynge thereunto wont leaue good begynnynges let one v al manoure wayes meanes possible styre encourage go forthe ende fyrst beganne thys thynge ought ye muche earnestly doe bycause ye see daye lorde hande whiche gyue euery man rewardes accordyng vnto desertes leaue place oportunitie amende hath bene done amisse whatsoeuer hathbene done shall examyned exacte iudgement suche trespases co mitted erroure frayltie man shall easlye pardoned texte sinne wilfully haue receyued knowledge truth remayneth sacrifice sinnes fearfull lokinge iudgement vyolent fyre whyche shall deuoure aduersaries despyseth os lawe dieth wythout mercye vnder two three wytnesses howe muche soret suppose ye shal b punished whych treadeth vnder ote sonne god co eth bloude testamente sancrified vnholy thing doeth dishonour spirite grace know hym hath said belongeth vnto take vengeance wil recompence sayth lord agayne lorde shall iudge hys people fearfull thinge fall handes lyuynge god haue knowen trueth ghospel beyng taught must hope ought eschewe rewardes good menne shall haue yuell yf wyllyngly fall agayne deadly synnes whiche christ hath washed away pre blou dyed alonely neuer wyll dye agayne remayneth hooste sacrifice v whiche haue eftesones fallen oure olde ly synfull lyuyng wherby synnes maye freely released agayne thorow baptisme remaineth forsoth certaine dreadful loking laste iudgement forthwith cruell tourmentyng fyre whiche reue gement goodnes god despised shal deuoure aduersaries thynk shall scape vnpunished hath despysed lawe ghospell mercifull beneficiall god punyshemente shall haue wyllingly wyttyngly hathe mocked therewith mockethe gospel whiche hath bene called n bre chyldren god wylfullye putteth himselfe numbre deuels seruauntes greate punishement among iewes whosoeuer obeyed pryest teaching commaundementes moises lawe wytte yf commaunded absteyne swynes fleshe dyd notwithstandyng selfe wyl dysobedient frowardenes eate afterwarde beyng firste conuicted two three witness done death without mercye howe muche greater punishement deserueth haue treadeth vnderfo e anye one priest lowe estimacion iesus christ sonne god creuly treadeth hym vnderfote whoso despifeth greate benefite whoso counteth saye bloude beaste holye bloud wherwith newe testament sanctified vnholy thynge specially bloude wherwith pourged made cleane hys olde synnes fynallye whoso dyshonoureth spirite hath obteyned grace ghospell bycause spirite put awaye thorowe hys vycyousnesse trayterouslye gyuethe vp temple god vnto dyuell therefore assure selfes shall escape vnpunished bycause men take punishement suche doe swa ue puritie euangelicall christian lyfe knowe hym hath sayde belongeth take vengeaunce wyll recompence fayth lorde agayne place lorde shall iudge people let synner flatter hym selfe thynke oute danger yf escape handes man reuenger man escape handes god dreadfull thyng fall handes lyuyng god nowe ye praysed ye fyrste began professe ghospell shame rebuke shall fall agayne former lyfe texte call remembraunce dayes passed ye receiued lyght ye endured great fight aduersities partely whyle men wondred gased shame tribulacion doe vnto partely whyle ye became co paignions pass time ye became partaker also affliccions happened bondes toke worth spoyling goodes gladnes knowyng selfes howe ye haue heuen better enduringe substaunce cast away therfore confydence whych hath greater recompence rewarde lest come passe cal vnto youre remembraunce tymes passed whiche ye receiued lyghte doctrine ghospell faythe ye couragyouslye endured dyuerse fyghtes aduersities hope lyfe come partely while suche hate christes doctrine wondered gased shame dyspleasures done vnto partely while thorowe instigation christian charitie ye owne accord became partaker shame affliction done vnto christian el apostle world vtterly contemned lyued rule ghospel ye wyllyngly partaker affliction shame whiche amonge wycked people semed happen reason bondes emprisonment sorye mannes sorowe cou ted mannes iniurie neyther dyd farre forthe onelye declare selfes true christian also gladly suffered spoylyng youre goodes declaryng vndoubtedly dede selfe knowe beleue howe better ryches layde vp heauen whiche neyther pryuie thefe violent robber bereaue yea rather ryches encrease losse worldly gooddes whiche suffre name christe dedes dyd wyth good cause put assuraunce fyrme belefe obteyne christes promise greate rewardes owynge strong fayth vndoubtedly god bothe rightuous bountefull wyll trewly paye tyme conuenient nowe tyme fyght hereafter crownes shalbe gyuen meane season ye haue nede pacience thentent ye haue constauntlye obeyed wyll god ye maye receaue crowne euerlastyng glorye promysed texte ye haue nede pacience ye haue doen wyll god ye myght receiue promyse yet lytle whyle shall come come ta iust shall lyue fayth yf wythdrawe hymselfe soule shall haue pleasure hym wythdrawe selfes vnto dampnacion e pattayn vnto fayth wynuyng soule yet daye come batayle taken awaye ended rewardes shalbe gyuen howbeit farre emperour ascended vp heauen promysed woulde retourne vnto v agayne wyll come longe tarye meane ryghtuous shal lyue fayth neuer much afflicted neuer much lawghed skorne neuer muche deade yet hopynge promyses shall vpholde constaunt mynde howbeit yf abyde styll fayth thorowe extreme desperation withdrawe himselfe profession ghospell soule shall haue pleasure god forbydde reason mystruste withdrawe selues good begynnynges vnto damnation yea rather haue professed fayth therin wyll contynew thentent may wynne lyfe saluation soule accordyng vnto counsell esaye saying ryghtuous shall lyue faith p xi chapter texte fayth sure confydence thynges whych hoped certasute thynges whych sene elder obtayned good reporte fayth vnderstande worlde ordayned worde god thinges sene made thinges whyche sene fayth abell offred vnto god pleteous sacrifice cain whych obtained witnes righteous god testifiyng hys gyftes whych also beyng dead yet speaketh nothynge greately bryngeth good men fauoure god faith sure belefe god argument mynde whych hath conceyued best opinion maye god doubt nothyng wordes though appeare sens man neyther proued mannes reason comon sort men iudge thynges vayne moste lyke vnto dreames whiche nowhere dede conceyued mynde hope thynketh extreme folye beleue suche thynges true wyse shewed vnto eye certes fayth whereby ryghtuouse man lyueth perishe certayne common lyght belefe substaunciall sure foundation thynges whiche perceyued neyther sens argumentacions man neuerthelesse sure hope representeth vnto mynde soule thoughe manifestly sene holden handes persuadeth thynges whych themselfes inuisible moste certayne sure mannes reason su e belefe towardes god authour thereof iewes put confydence theyr workes onely thing maketh v alowed well beloued god v alonely furthermore yf man wyll make rehersall creacion worlde shall fynde oure forefather elder muche remembred theyr laudable vertue godlynes deserued atteined reason commendable fayth fyrst bounden vnto fayth haue sure perceueraunce whole worlde thynges therin couteyned created worde god onely commaundement maker able otherwise perswade inuisible thynges created made thynges visible el thynges made thinges philosopher reasonynge men supposed world neuer made neither begynnynge workeman creatour hym selfe could neither sene ne proued argumentacion mannes witte firmely beleue thoughe sawe ascertayned holy scripture declareth world made commaundement god know right well able thinges lye abell first men deserued haue name rightuous manne therefore praysed bicause beyng prouoked aumple innocente faythfull godward thing made dearly beloued god brother cayn forsoth faith wherby wholy hanged wheras cayn lyke man faithlesse contented thinges earth brought forth owne accorde fode innocency fylled ground offred sacrifice vnto god owne propre goodes god onely accepted sacrifice abell bycause innocent man trusted goodnesse true harte gaped commodity profites world hoped rewarde vertuousnes heauen therfore deserued sacrifice thorow fayth almyghtie god imbracyng gyftes dyd fyre sent heauen testifie rightuous reason goodly testimonye many thousand yeares much renowined spoken menne beyng deade semeth euen liue speake slayne brotherwarde tyme murthered fautelesse sleyne god vnto whome bloude yet cryed vengeaunce earthe texte faith enoch translated se death neither founde god taken hym away fore taken away obtayned good report pleased god without faith anye man please hym commeth god muste beleue god rewarder seke hym neither whit preiudiciall vnto godlye enoch begotten wycked father holye scripture wytnesseth hym conuersaunt familiar wt god euen whe lyued earth pursued faith thinges sene thinges sene yt wytte eternall thinges heuenlye cause taken vp aliue thinges loued deliuered fro death liued sort taken felowshyppe men semed rather lyue heauen earthe semed also vnworthye dye hadde commytted nothyng death worthye thentent men shoulde firste learne example open way immortalitie faith innocet lyuing therfore taken awaye bycause pleased god pleased hym chiefely fayth without whiche man pleaseth hym haue el neuer many good dedes whosoeuer desyreth brought fauour almyghtye god must fyrst beleue god thynges wylleth best muste also beleue god careth worlde hym neyther godly whiche settyng noughte visible good thynges thys worlde searche god inuisible defeated rewardes neuer muche afflicted persecuted lyfe nether wicked persones shall lacke punishementes althoughe seme lyue prosperitie haue worlde therefore enoch maye thanke fayth wote nere whether maye call glory felicitie taken awaye felowshyppe men lyueth god texte fayth noe beyng warned god eschued thynges whych yet sene prepared arcke auyng houshold whych arcke condemned worlde became hei e righteousnes according faith howbeit noe shewed notable example faith towardes god euen forewarned mouthe god howe shoulde come passe kyndes lyuyng creature earth shoulde destroyed thorow inundation water sawe apparent argumentes reason wherby saying god mought proued bycause element fayre cleare people feastyng makyng brydeales without care lawghed heare manassyng wordes prophecie yet surely beleuing would come passe god sayde happe ordeyned arke wherby preserued houshold codened mistrusted wordes god lawghed hym korne madde man framynge sayde arke agaynste commyng floude neyther alonely preserued flould also succeded prayse abell enoch elder muche renowmed rightuousnesse whiche thorowe faith maketh man commendable god texte faith abraham called obtayned go place whych shoulde afterwarde receyue inherytaunce went knowyng whether go faith remoued lande promyse strangcoutrey dwelt tabernacle dyd isaac iacob heires promise loked citie hauing foundacion whose builder maker god nowe howe ofte dyd abraham gyue example notable faith towardes god first nothynge pleasant man hys natyfe countrey yet almyghty god comaunded hym forsake affeccions flyt vnknowne lande made tarieng obeyed streight wayes voyce god prouoked man example put hope comforte probable reason come passe forsaken suche landes patrimonie borne vnto shoulde possesse enheritaunce wot nere lande wherof yet neyther knewe name situation sure truste belefe come passe euer god promysed proceded fayth came lande promysed god matier went forewarde hys mynde neyther wyth hym sonne isaac nephew iacob yet thenheritaunce thys lande promysed alone also ofspring posteritye constrayned oftetymes fyght enemyes isaac muche busynes trouble philistians iacob dryuen thence esau brother coutrey mesopotamia fro
