whence length retourned agayn fayne bye litle pece groud pytche pauillion yet thynges moued abraham whyt haue mystrust god promised lande neyther complayned bannyshed man enheritour neither regarded thynges whiche sene earth heauenly thynges whiche sene otherwise wt eye fayth perceiued lande god meante made promes whiche lande set lytle store thought necessarie therin buyld neither house towne kepe himselfe tabernacle straunger whiche anon shoulde remoue place dyd loke sawe promyses perfourmed forsoothe loked citie whiche stable perpetual whence neuer dryuen againe farre vnlyke cyties whiche men buylde destroye maker buylder wherof god hymselfe texte faith sara also receiued strength conceiue child delyuered child past age iudged hym faithfull whych promised therfore sprang one euen one whiche good deade manye multitude starres skie sand bi sea shore innumerable moreouer wyfe sara bothe olde man husband selfe stricken age matrice lacked natural strength drawe mannes sede vnto retayne dyd neuerthelesse coceyue deliuered isaac mistrusting strength nature yet giuing credence vnto god aungell promysed man chylde nexte yeare gaue eare nature reclaming barking contrarie onely sure belefe god coulde lye god promysed abraham posteritie equall nombre starres sande sea shore yet course nature hope yssue notwithstandyng mystrust therfore one olde man beyng barayne reason age yssued posteritie many numbre starres ye sande sea shore loked sonnes nephewes kynred bloud imitacion faith wherby al ofspring posteritie abraham whiche beleue promise gospel therfore onely abraham also true posteritie suche constaunt fayth death bereaued therof texte died according faith receyued promise saw far beleued saluted confessed straungers pilgremes yearth say thinges declare seke coutrey also bene myndeful countrey whece came leasure haue returned agayne desire better saye heauenly wherefore god hymselfe shamed called god hath prepared cytie dyed yet promysses perfourmed lawe farre fayth beleued greate desyre saluted puttyng lytle trust lande wherein man maye lyue anye long space confessed selfes straungers pylgrymes onely palestyne whole worlde oftetymes call lyfe pilgrimage straunge dwellyng dauid mystical psalme confesseth himselfe pylgryme lande forefather elder yet reigned palestine builded citie verely countre compassed narrowe lymites great parte thereof came possession hebrues ofspryng successours abraham bycause coulde driue olde possessioners neyther dyd moyses entre behelde saluted farre mountayne aboute passe world yet mistrust promyses therefore sence confesse themselues pylgrymes sufficiently declare desyre long countrey countrey seke vnto worlde exile banishement forsoke countrey chaldey whiche sore longed farre myghte haue conueniente recourse thider pleasure therfore longed coutrey better wherin myght liue euer quite exempte deliured greuous sorowes paynes wretched worlde heauenly countrey whiche god called theyr owne loue wherof wylled lyue worlde thoughe therin cause almyghtie god maker soueraigne lorde men calleth himselfe speciallye god abraham isaac iacob properly god haue put whole trust aydes felicitie vnto suche hath prepared earthly celestiall citie whiche reygne alwayes blysse whose sake contemned thynges texte faith abraham offered isaac proued offered hym begotten sonne receiued promisses hym sayd isaac shall thy sede called considered god hable rayse hym agayn death therefore receiued hym also ensample resurreccy faith dyd isaac blesse iacob esau concernynge thynges come also notable exaumple fayth abraham god tryeng howe vnfaynedly trusted hym commaunded hym offre vp sacrifice sonne isaac hys onely sonne whose name posteritie promysed wordes promyser thy sede shall called isaac yet without delaye dyd comauded reasonyng himselfe wise shal haue posteritie sley hym onely resteth hope posteritie consydered mynde god made promyse coulde lye able yf pleased hym reyse deade sonne multiplier stocke euen death beleued resurrection dead therfore gyuen bryng home sonne againe beyng restored lyfe notwithstadyng much father laye dead euen represented certayne figure resurrection iesu christe come also manyfest example mynde hauyng great confidence god isaac saye hys death bedde yet receyued felicitie promysed god yet bolde promyse iacob esau sonnes blessed foreseyng theyr lyues contrarie rewarde eche shoulde haue quycke syght faith seeth euen thinges present whiche farre distant bodely sens texte faith iacob dying blessed bothe sone ioseph bo hymselfe toward toppe scepter faith ioseph dyed remembred departynge child israel gaue commaundement bone came lyke faithe iacob hower death blessed sonnes ioseph ignoraunt come crossynge hys armes layed right hande vpon ephraim beyng left syde lefte hade vpon manasse standynge hys ryghte syde nothynge doubtynge woulde come passe holy ghost tolde shoulde happen faithfull olde man saw greate deale farther time kyssinge toppe sceptre sonne ioseph worshypped christe hym haue soueraigne auctoritie rule ouer men said ioseph falsely accused betrayed brother bare figure neither dyd ioseph growe kynde become vnlike auncestours faith departe world land egipt foresawe come passe god helpe whiche thing semed nothing lykely israel ites shoulde remoue egypt come vnto lande promysed god true doubted herof gaue commau dement translating bone place texte fayth moses borne hyd thre monethes father mother bycause saw proper chylde nether feared kinges commaudemente moreouer moyses newly comen world preserued fayth parentes kyng commaunded al men child borne hebrues streyght wayes done death father mother vewed childe semed anon borne marked greate notable feate euen verie towardnes lykelyhod appeared countenaunce supposyng acceptable pleasure vnto god preserued common weale people contemned kynges commaundement hyd sayde childe thre monethes house done put lytle cofer layde oute vpon ryuers banke nothyng doubtyng god woulde preserue yonglyng endued greate grace conclude feared displease god kynge bycause perceyued suche lyue well vertuouflye howe soeuer worlde go lacke theyr rewarde texte fayth moses great refused called son pharaos daughter chose rather suffre aduersite wyth people god enioye pleasure synne season estemed rebuke christe greater rich treasure egypt respecte vnto rewarde howebeit parentes moyses deserued haue prayse hereof lyke owne propre commendation shotte vp towardes mannes state chosen pharaos dawghter sonne refused honourable kynred bloud royal hauyng leuer confesse selfe hebrue borne suffre comon persecution people god wycked disimulation enioye commodity pleasure thys worlde reckenynge muche happier rich egiptians treasure tyme suffre rebuke aduersities preseruation people therby fygure christ tyme come suffre greater euels sauetie nation fynallye contemned myghte haue sure eye fayth regarded thynges onely whiche farre sens puttyng affyaunce god suffreth vertue goodnes disapointed worthy rewardes texte faith forsoke egypt feared fearcenes kinge endured euen though sene hym whych inuisible faith ordayned passeouer effusion bloude left destroyed first borne shoulde touche moyses puttyng trust ayde god boldlye attempted thynges muche greater enterprise sticked flye oute lande egypte thence conuey people god nothyng fearyng wrath fierce tyrante contemned kynge sawe wt eies regarded threatnynges myghtye prince sawe armes pursuynge nation israelite heles readie sleye neyther lesse boldnesse courage mynde trust vpon inuisible socours inuisible god yf openlye sene hys eye moreouer fayth came vnderstode would come passe reuengyng aungel would raunge thorowe whole lande egypte sley fyrstborne nothyng afrayde people hebrues vnto day aboute tyme destruction ordeyned annuall vse ceremonie eate paschall lambe whose bloude sprynkeled thrasholde haunse dore postes house trustyng vpon sygne feared selues myddes slaughter egipcians texte faith passed red see drie lande egipcians assaied drouned anon reed sea letted hebrues flyeng vertue lyke fayth deuided asonder stroke moyses rodde lefte suche waie middes passed therby wel drye lande meanes people puttynge theyr truste god fled waie safe without harme egyptian beeyng rashe ouer hastie thorowe wrathe entred therin water closed together drowned texte p faith walles ierico fell downe compassed seuen dayes thyng made tymes paste walles iericbo seuen tymes compassed aboute seuenth daye sodaynely fall without violence engyns sounde priestes trompettes crye shoune people suche wise hebrues enuyroned towne entraunce made themeuery man place stode faith capitayne iosua people thorowly persuaded hym selfe god able thynges thyng woulde vndoubtedly come passe whiche promised texte fayth hatlotte raab peryshed disobed ie receiued spyes lodgyng peaceably furthermore also notable example fayth harlotte raab whiche receyued spy lodgyng sent vnto citie hebrues perceyued howe people dearly beloued fauoure god better wyllynge prouide daunger owne lyfe get thanke wycked citizen therfore rewarde faith familie onely preserued fro death shuld perishe wt trustyng strength beleued god would destroye citie pleasute texte shall say tyme wyll shorte tell sed barache samson iephthae dauyd also samuell phetes whych fayth subdued kyngdomes wrought tyghteousues obtayned promyses stopped mouthes lion quenched violence fire escaped edge swearde wekenes wer made strong wared valyant fight turned flyghte armyes alyentes woman receyued dead raysed lyfe agayne seyng among many wonderfull actes oure forefather elder none notably achiued wt aide faithe purpose shoulde stande particuler rehersall shoulde soner lacke tyme example would go forth story captayne gedeon trustynge vpon aydes god feared three hundred men set vpon hooste madianites excedyngly wel fournished men armoure habilimentes warre conclusion dyscomfited put flyght great multitude sownd trompettes noyse pytchers merueylous sodayne appearynge candels suche wyse hebrues neuer drawyng swerdes one slewe barache trusting vpon propheceie woman debora set vpo excedyngly well appoynted hooste captayne selara slewe leauing one man aliue finally put kyng iabin flight anon slayne woman sampson beyng ayded helpe god achiued manye wonderful enterprise philistians defence countrey whiche coulde done greate manye together yet puissaunce strength mannes bodye iephthae albeit vile basterd base fortune countrey yet trustyng vpon goddes helpe merueylous goodly victorie ouer immonites enymyes people dauid besydes many victory god helpe gotten besydes many ieoperdies escaped preseruation almighty god feared beyng younge striplyng wythout armoure encountre wyth goliath well weaponed armed peces ouerthre oke slyng bycause god haue whole glory prayse victorie man samuell withoute anye garde men defende personage gouerned many yeares people israell freely executynge office iudge chief ruler among beyng well assured god woulde rewarde yf man dyd thyng aryght ministracion tyme saye would fayle yf would procede recityng al exaples wyll ouerhyp many noble prophetes puttynge theyr trust god set naught threatnynges tyrantes many men renowmed holines worldly goodes rich ayde god put whole affyauce dyd woderful dedes theyr worthy actes left behynde memorial selues vnto posteritie make brief sumarie rehersal story omittyng name thauctours ascribed vnto theyr fayth yt beyng touchyng thynges vnable dyd helpe god subdue wealthye riche kyngdomes coulde maner feare brought kepyng lawe geuen lokyng theyr reward almyghtie god delayeng promise minished fayth length attayned thynges whiche god promysed vnto elder obteyned faithfull prayer whiche coulde wyse done course nature preseruation delyuered excedyng greate daungers lyon whiche agaynste fiercenesse inuincible either vanquished proued harmles though mouthes beyng stopped el clawes faste bownden power hurt god would haue preserued without anoyaunce cast myddes fyre endured withoute hurte though quenched naturall violence heate therof bodyes agayne protection god escaped awaye safe enemyes swerdes drawen agaynste furthermore god recomfortyng receyued viter desperation exceding greate strength courage mynde insomuche beyng longe taken dead sodaynly acquited selues manfully battayll valiauntly put flyght enemy inuaded moreouer faithe also wemen deserued mother sawe deade child reysed death lyfe agayne texte tacked woulde deliuered myght inherite better resurreccion agayne tried mockinges scourgynges moreouer bondes prysonemente stoned hewen asunder tempted slayne sweard walked vp downe shepe skynnes goates skynnes destitute troubled audvered whiche men world worthy wandred wilderness mountaynes dennes caues yearth beyng racked sore handled diuerse kyndes tourmentes better wyllyng dye suche paynes delyuered condition obeye wycked commaundementes prynces yeldynge greate fayth theyr lyues almyghtye god whiche knew ryght wel receyue agayne vauntage resuttection deade supposynge muche better bye immortalitie losse shorte transitorie lyfe lytle gayne small tyme loose lyfe eternall agayne reason constaunt desyre mayntayne trueth rightuousnes iestynge stockes worlde laughed skorne euerye bodye slaundered madde menne worker myschief onlye put shame theyr faith towardes god also vertue goodnesse tryed scourgynges moreouer bondes emprisonment furthermore stoned hewen sonder torne peces wyth horrible punishemente bodye make ende kynde euyls nat tryed al dyed dynt swerde beynge fully perswaded good men coulde death seuered god agayne suche chaunced make ende tourmentes death wanne nothyng el prolongyng lyues tourmented long martyrdome banished house beyng dryuen oute townes wandred vp downe wyldernesse lyke wilde beastes couered well woulde shepe skynnes goate skynnes hauyng scarcitie necessary vexed cruelnesse persecutours ready assayle euery syde troubled sondrye discomodites misery lyfe beyng vnworthy suffre suche euels aduersities worlde rather worthye haue vertuous holy men suche wyse god moughte seme euen purpose haue taken away company men lest beyng men pure chast conuersation haue ledde lyues among defyled person synners therfore wandered aboute wylde mountaynes hauynge certayne habitacion dwellyng place resorte vnto vsyng dennes caues earth stede house texte al thorow faith obtayned good report receiued promyse bicau god prouided better thing v without v made perf named albeit haue yet obteyned rewarde promysed godly lyuynge whiche rewarde shalbe geuen generall resurreccion bodyes yet haue deserued perpetuall prayse constantnesse fayth man wyll saye hath euery man rewarde gyuen death soothe hath pleased almyghtye god whole bodye christe shall receiue glory immortalitie together membres body suche haue gone v gladly tarye v thende maye wholy ioyntly theyr bodyes felowshyppe theyr brother entre thenheritaunce eternal glory conioyned vnto heade p xii chapter texte wherefore let v also seyuge compassed wyth great mult ytude wytnesses laye waye presseth downe sinne hangeth fast let v run pacience vnto battaill set v loking vnto iesus aucr finisher faith ioye set hym abode erosse despysed shame set downe right hande throne god consyder therefore howe endured suche speaking hym sinner lest ye shoulde werted faint mindes ye haue yet resisted vnto bloud striuing agaynst sinne haue forgotten exhortacyon whych speaketh vnto vnto child soune despise thou chastenyug lorde nether faiute thou art rebuked hym lord loueth hym chasteueth yea sourgeth euery sonne receyueth seyng compassed great companye cloude euen olde testamente witnessed sufferyng suche euels rehearsed beleued promyses god harte let v also encouraged example see caste frome v burthen fardell corporall thynges bodelye lustes whiche letteth mynde laden care desyre thynges celestiall put awaye synne helde v faste euery syde fynally beyng incensed set fyre hope heauenly thinges runne manfully ase set v afflyccions withdrawynge mynde stayed holden backe runnyng course haue begonne neuer castyng eye asyde iesu christe verye cause haue conceyued belefe god wyll fynyshe hath begonne v let v considre waye entred whitherto came whereas myght reason innocent gyltlesse haue escaped death bene much without payne passion without synne yet despysynge ioyes worlde suffred death thentent death greuouser hauyng reproche ioyned therwith suffered death crosse men make muche doo suffre glorious death ye see whiche waye entred nowe whitherto came despisyng lyfe attained immortalitie despisyng settyng naught worldly reproche attayned euerlastyng glorye heauen nowe sytteth ryght hande royall throne god father ye withall haste auaunce youre selfes come partaker glorie thorowe reproche dyuerse paynful affliction lest dyscouraged myndes shoulde tyme thenforcemente wearynesse ceaseto runne raase sette considre selfes youre capytayne neuer knewe anye manoure synne dyd neuer thelesse shewe v example true pacience endure greate rebuke muche shame vylanye suche mysreportes false accusacions let wycked iewes compell hym suffre punyshement crosse ye therfore dysmayed beynge cleane withoute synne suffre lesse dyspleasures persecution better man dye thousande tymes fall agayne former synfull lyfe howbeit haue hytherto suffred small persecution aduersitie haue yet resisted sinne vnto sheadyng bloud whiche synne fierslye assaulteth stryuynge agaynst yet suppose god hath forsaken remembre mercyfull father speakethe vnto vnto child mysticall prouerbes comfortynge swete gentle wordes exhortyng greate valiaunte courage mynde sonne sayth despise thou chastenyng lorde neither despaire thou soeuer rebuketh thee lorde loueth chasteneth euels aduersities lyfe scourgeth euerye sonne receyneth texte ye endure chastenyng god offereth hymselfe vnto vnto sonnes sone father chasteneth ye vnder correccyon wherof al partaker ye bastardes sonnes therefore seynge haue father fleshe whych corrected v gaue reuerence shall nowe much rather subiection vnto father spirites lyue verely feawe day nuttered v theyr pleasure nurtereth v profite intent may minister holines vnto v maner chastening present time semeth ioious greuous neuertheles afterwarde bringeth quiete fruit righteousnes vnto whyche exercised thereby ye paciently endure chastenyng god acknowledgeth sonnes offreth selfe agayne mercyfull louing father doeth exclude thenheritaunce lyfe celestial thynke therfore hated nothyng regarded god bycause ye afflicted euels world nay rather ought argument ye appoynted heyres father enheritaunce father doeth while chasten sonne acknowledgeth owne furthermore syth vertuouse men good lyuers god eyther doth hath dearly loued haue bene temporall affliction taughte true vertue godly lyuyng yf free suche fatherlye correction verely manyfest proofe ye bastardes true natural sonnes haue onelye suffred also gyuen reuerence oure parentes whome begotten touchynge fleshe onely whyles dyd wyth checkes lash teache v common behauiour lyfe striuinge agaynst autoritie interpretyng doynges thoughe howsoeuer dalte wyth v dyd frendelye mynde good zeale towardes v shall muche submytte yelde selfes heauenly father onely auctour bodyes spirites fullye persuaded selfes herein euyls aduersities euer suffreth v afflicted doeth neuertheles fatherly mynde prouyde soule health saluation corporall father cruell agaynst sonne sley preserue make better god chasteneth v worlde thentente maye lyue euer worlde come parentes enstructed v would selfes oftentymes abusyng autoritie enstructed v shorte tyme thynges transitorie suche thynges wyll soone perishe perteyne gettynge mayntenaunce worldlye substaunce yea many tymes hauyng eye owne profyte enstructed v thys ende bycause would holpen obsequious ready deligence father hathe nede v alwayes regardeth commodity singuler profites commodity goeth aboute haue v enryched earthlye goodes neyther haue v succede lyuelod fewe acre lande giue v heauenly gyftes witte holynesse world worlde come euerlastyng blysse felicitie whoso wyll earnestly consydre hym selfe greate excellent profite shall easely awaye wyth temporal grief present life parentes correcte child yt maner chastysyng hath pleasure payne grief tyme presente yet child come mannes state begynne perceiue howe muche good payne dyd greatly reioyse euer beaten chydde lawghynge countenaunce rendre thankes suffred wepyng eye euen calamytie miserye worlde meane tyme while hangeth ouer oure heades vexeth mortall bodyes greuous oure sens payne vexation trouble wherwith oure soules also reason societie haue body dysquieted bryngeth forth quyet swete fruite rightuousnes due season affliction teacheth godlynesse godlines bryngeth ioyes good mynd cleare conscience good mind bryngeth forth immortalitie therfore lette mannes harte fayle godly raase sweate labour greate rewardes hygh excellente rewarde gyuer faythfull texte stretche furthe therfore handes whych let downe weake knee ye haue straight steppe vnto fete leste halting turne waye yea let rather healed folowe peace men holynes without whych man shall se lord loke man destitute grace god lest rote bytternesse springe vp trouble therby many defyled fornica r vncleane person esau whych one messe meate sold birthright ye know afterward would inheritaunce haue obtayned blessynge put founde place repentaunce though sought teares folowe stout wrastelers lustye runner bestyre youre werye handes plucke vp weake foltryng knee runne streygth marke set let foote tournynge hyther thyther wander streyght waye yea rather yf haue wandered anye whit yf ye haue bene heretofore slacke runnyng see ye make amendes newe lustie courage cherefulnesse neither ynough euery man runne behofe takyng care yea rather conioyned peace concorde comon diligence one carefull take hede lest anye runnynge common course fall grace god lest lackyng holynesse whiche becommeth membres christ haue wythout whiche man shal see god one ous vnto bodye vnworthye haue chief game reward set v gyuen hym fynally lest anye roote bytternesse sprynge vp trouble godlye endeuours whiche hasten vnto heauenlye thynges beyng suffred spread abrode defyle greate manye hys infection let fornicatour amonge person otherwise vncleane gyuen vnto bealy suche lustes beastly desyres let runne cause tourne ryghte waye thus commeth passe while regarde suche coloured apparent good thynges ye loose chiefe game euerlastyng rewarde suretye chaunced vnto esau beyng hongrey solde byrthryght pleasure one mease meate purchasynge himselfe perpetuall repentaunce small pleasure endured must remembre thentent maye exaumple howe afterwarde wente aboute haue byrthryghte restored vnto agayne father blessyng put neuer ye better late repentauce althoughe testifyed greate abundaunce teares sorye deedes byttrenesse whiche springeth hatered enuye arrogaunce breaketh brotherly concorde pleasure bodye superfluytie desyres fylthy thynges defyle pure holy liuyng nowe two thynges witte concorde pure lyuing must decaye amonge neither one without amonge vncleane persones synners concorde wherwith god pleased neyther good vpryght lyuyng discorde debate rayneth therfore ought also take good hede leste folyshely exchaunge thenherytaunce kyngdome heauen pleasure worlde thinges wherunto hasten heauenly wherfore muste come pure cleane must continually walke lyght gospell oure holye lyuing must agree holy profession must nedes answerable vnto hye priest lawe conuersation texte ye come vnto mount touched vnto burnynge fyer vnto storme darkenes tempestes wether sounde trompe voyce wordes whych voyce heard wished awaye communicacion spoken could abide commaunded yf beast touche mountaygne shalbe stoned thruste thorowe darte terryble syght whych appeared moses said feare quake ye come vnto mount syon cyrie liuing god celestial dierusalem innumerable syght angeles congregacion firste borne sonnes whych wrytten heuen god iudge spirites iust perfecte men iesus mediator new testamet sprinkeling bloud speaketh better bloude abell ye come vnto mount syna whiche maye touched bodye youre forefather came tyme moyses publyshed lawe vnto burnynge fyre whiche felte perceyued mannes sens vnto storme darkenesse vnto tempestes weddre sounde trompe whiche thynges perceyued care eye voyce wordes although myght haue bene hearde mennes care reason pronounced breath dyd lytle nothyng represent true voyce god yet suche maiestie people hearynge terrible noyse greatly afeard desyred almyghtie god would selfe speake anye vnto moyses would voyce publyshe suche thinges god commaunded el shoulde voyce god haue bene terryble weakenesse mannes eares bene able awaye suche reuerende feare dreade thynges whiche done onely fygure lawe gospell people kepte lofe suffred touche mounte also proclamation made commaundement beast soeuer touched stoned thrust thorowe darte terrible sight thinges shewed vnto corporall sens yt moyses himselfe abashed quaked feare therof howbeit come suche sensible sighte whiche shadowe figure farre better thynges thinges yt haue veritie conteyned herin forasmuche perceiued ye mynd soule bodely sens ye come saye spirituall mounte syon touched spirite handes heauenly ierusalem citie lyuyng god peace euerlasting vnnumerable syght angel heade peares inhabitauntes thereof congregation child god haue lost byrthright csau cleauynge vnto christe haue deserued regestred heauen made citizen god iudge soueraigne personage common wealth spirites soules rightuous men perfite godlynes good lyuynge ioyned companye felowshyp heauen associat iudge iesus hye priest newe testament doth destroy v restore v vnto fauoure bloud whose sprynklyng soules pourged ye whiche speaketh bettre bloud abel bloud desyred vengeauce obteyneth pardon texte se ye despyse hym speaketh escaped refused spake yerth muche shall escape yf turne awaye hym speaketh heauen whose voice shoke yerth hath declared saying yet wyll shake yearth onely also heauen saith yet signifieth remouinge awaye thynges whiche shaken thinges haue ended course thinges whiche shaken moye remayne wherefore yf receyue kyngdom whyche moued haue grace wherby may serue god may please hym reuerence godly feare god consumyng fire mercifully louingly bloud speaketh v oughte beware lest despise speaketh v escaped punishment despysyng worde refused moyses man speakyng earth shall suffre muche greuouser punishment yf tourne awaye christ speakyng vnto v heauen whose voyce shoke earth feare sensible feare synnyng threateneth nowe heauen prophet aggeus yet sayeth shake earth also heauen entent yu earthly men also heauenly thynges maye quake feare sayeth yet signifieth remouyng away thinges shaken thynges saie made men handes temple citie ierusalem thende thinges made mennes handes therfore inasmuche eternall shaken maye contynue iewes glory take pride teple glorye holy citie time shall come thinges shal loke kyngdome see translated remoued place let v therfore thorowe benifite grace holy gost haue begonne endeuour selfes attayne kyngdome heauen whiche nowyse shaken perseuer benifite almyghtie god let v continue heauenly temple serue god suche reuerence feare may puritie minde conscience please requireth hence forth kynde sacrifice forefather afearde thyng while makyng sacrifice wher shuld offend eye men much hede ought take spirituall sacrifice lest thyng whyche maye offende eies almyghtie god tymes past daunger came vnto holy place without due obseruation certayne ceremony much greater peryll shall yf presume come vncleane myndes vnto god bodely fyre kyndled may quenched agayne fyre ful strengthe efficacie also suche one bryngeth nought destruction thyng soeuer lusteth p xiii chapter texte let brotherly loue continue forgetfull lodge straungers therby haue diuerse men lodged angel vnwates remember bondes euen though ye bound selues myndefull aduersitie ye whiche yet body wedlocke honor among men bed vndefyled whorekepers aduouterers god shal iudge let conuersacion without couetcousnes content suche thinges ye haut alredy hath sayd wyl faile nether forsake may boldly say lorde helper feare man maye vnto remembre whyche haue ouersight haue spoken vnto worde god whose fayth se ye folowe consider ende conuersacion let brotherly loue contynue among sen ye membres bodye loue ye suche onely daylye conuersaunt also whiche resorte straungers vnto hospitalitie highlye commended god much hereby abraham deserued receyue vnwares angel lodgyng thought done good tourne pleasure vnto men furthermore christen charitie requireth also calamitie suche prison bondes professyng christe moue lesse selfes lyke case tourment payne elswise afflicted diuerse euels aduersities styre pitie compassion maye hereby appeare haue body subiect selfe euils compassionlesse th se paynes sorowes whiche membres bodye suffre let wedlocke whiche beyng kept oughte due honour euen among heathen people lykewise honour reuerence among let bed matrimonye defiled kynd aduoutry whorekepers aduoutrers god shal iudge let conuersation without couetousnes wise may contente selfes thynges alreadye possesse menne liuyng without prouision care thyng come god made promise vnto iosue iosue al put cofydence trust wil faile saith neither forsake trusting maye boldly saye prophet saith mysticall psalme lorde helper feare man may vnto regarde haue ouersight haue receyued mannes doctrine worde god see lacke nothyng necessarie vnto whose wordes lyke begynnyng gaue credence loke vpon lyuynge marke folowe faithe consyderyng constauntly abyde profession gospell vnto lyues ende gospell taughte ryghte alwayes stedfastly holden obserued texte iesus christe yester daye daye continueth euer caried aboute wyth diuerse strange lernynge good thynge heart stablyshed grace meates whych haue profyted haue pastyme haue aulter whereof maye eate whych serue tabernacle body beastes whose bloude broughte holye place hygh pryeste pourge sinne burnt without tentes therefore iesus also sanctifie people owne bloude suffered without gate let v go futthe therefore vnto mout tentes suffer rebuke wyth hym haue continuyng citie seke one come iesus christ yesterdaye daye euermore shalbe tyme without ende neuer shalbe chaunged shall doctryne continue euer therefore abyde stable stedefast herein menne leanyng vpon sure foundation caryed aboute newe diuerse learnyng lawe moyses taught thyng gospell nowe teacheth fashion poynte foly sticke styll vnto shadowes veritie come lyght yet renewe agayne olde iewyshe religion nowe abrogate dysanulled holdyng opinyon bettue godlye lyuynge standeth meates corporall fode whiche thynges suche haue supersticiously obserued haue nothyng profited therby thattaynyng ryghtuousnesse whoso desyreth attayne perfyte true godlynesse hath onelye shadowe ryghtuousnes stablysheth mynde cleare conscience god lette hym cantinew grace fayth leane vpon foundacion whiche christe hath layde shall wauer iewyshe superstions let iewes counte holy thyng absteyne frome certayne meates euen frome suche offred vp sacrifice also haue muche holyer aulter wherof lawfull eate beyng gyuen yet vnto ceremony lawe knowe grace gospel wher gyuen true soule health saluation accordyng vnto prescription law carkases beastes whose bloude accustomably offred sinne hie priest tabernacle called holy commaundement burned withoute tentes though bloude holy thyng notwithstandynge body thynges vncleane defyled caryed oute burned vnholye place therefore absteine vncleane meates folkes haue shadowe embrace shadowe hath signified neuer holier minde sprynkled bloud neither whit cleaner absteined eatyng body sen soules wholy dysteyned wt sinne viciousnes embrace iesus sacrifice hie priest alludyng figure lawe would crucified without gate citie ierusalem pourge people precious bloude whose exaple must supersticiously deuoutely folowe shall yf also take vp crosse folow goyng fro copainye men fro knot felowship mischeuous person let v likewise go departe fro meadlyng world take pleasure suffre reproch christes sake take fruition worldly glory let v byd earthly cityfare well haue contynuyng citie loke one come whiche celestiall euerlastynge verely goeth citie putteth awaye subdueth thaffections lustes fleshe wholye gyueth himselfe heauenlye contemplation texte hym therefore offre sacrifice laude alwaies god saye frute lippes whych confesse name good destribute forget suche sacrifice god pleased obeye haue ouersyght submit selfes vnto watch soules euen must geue accoptes maye ioye griefe vnprofytable thinge offre vp sacrifyce within walles goe lyke manoure citie oure hye priest christe contynuallye offre certayne sacrifice pleasaunt acceptable vnto god thorowe hym beast corne fildes fruite lyppes lyppes saye alonelye bodye also sowle whiche acknowlage benefytes god towardes v hauynge christes crosse remembraunce tendre thankes remyssion oure synnes manye gyftes endued aulter iewes partaker abyde styll walles loue nothyng whiche carnall nowe learne also kynde sacrifice worthye sacrifice ghospell whiche muste continally make please almyghtie god oure neyghboure holpen benefites yf necessitie ought succour haide goodes substauce suche sacrifice goddes fauour sooner obteyned triflyng obseruaunces constitucions iewes without regarde christian brother obey whiche haue ouersyghte submyttynge youre selfes vnto althoughe euell person long go aboute enforce vngodlynesse doe accordynge office vocation watche youre soules inasmuche prouide soule health saluacion owne peryll bycause shall gyue accomptes ministration vnto almyghtie god whome power commeth shall greatlye ease burthen yf shewe selfes obsequious obedyent vnto thentente euer maye doe righte good gladly rather euell wyll grudgyng bothe greuous vnto also vnto vnprofitable greueth haue taken muche payne without profite thother syde expedient prouoke goddes wrath agaynst thorowe dysobedience texte praye v eust haue good conscience among men desire lyue honestly desyre ye maye restored f er god peace brought agayn death lorde iesus greate shepherd shepe bloude euerlasting testament make perfecte al good workes bryng passe thing whych ye maye plea syght iesus christ prayse euer world endureth amen praye ye vnto god brother semeth ought nombred among good pastours byshoppes whether alowed men cannot tell yet trust haue demeaned selfe honestye good conscience woulde amonge whiche desyrous lyue rule gospell earnestly desyre thentent maye soner restored vnto agayne meane season lykewyse praye maye please god thauctour peace whiche hath raysed agayne death chiefe shepeherd pastour shepe lorde iesus christe relyued entred heauen thorowe bloude make intercession v vnto father whiche bloude hath hallowed newe euerlastyng testament praye say maye please make perfite good workes thentente maye satisfie accomplyshe hys maye please bryng passe thinge whiche ye may pleasaunt acceptable sight thorow sonne iesus christ alwayes present setteth forth oure sacrifice vnto glorie due onely present lyfe also euermore amen nothyng chalege ascribe vnto selfes well doinges gyfte commeth euer doe wherewith god pleased texte beseche brother suffre worde exortacion haue written vnto fewe wordes ye knowe brother timothe lybertie yf become shortly wyll se salute haue ouersyght saintes italy salute grace amen thinges haue written exhortacion desyryng take good parte haue done good mynde purpose haue written vnto fewe wordes purposeth shortly see shal vnderstande timothe present haue sent place retourne shortly wyll come se haue commended suche haue ouersyght furthermore whole companye saynctes good christian italian salute grace fauour god amen p thus endeth paraphrase vpon epistle hebrues right excellent vertuous lady anne duchesse somerset grace moste humble orator iohn olde wisheth true felicitie continuaunce health christ iesu oure saueour consyderyng moste vertuous excellet ladye holy goste playnlie commendynge mouthes moste worthy kinges famous memorie dauyd salomon myghtye effectuous working vertue necessary holsomnes feare god right foundacion groundworke godly wysedome sayeth amonge specyal yes sondry mencioned state persones vehement admi acy praise woman whiche feareth lorde shalbe muche commendacion worthie estemed excellent treasour iewell price farre beyonde vttermoste coastes hauynge sure grounde worke wisedome like dyligent skilfull house wife employeth stocke whole substaunce quality trauaile necessatie dooinges tyme tyme make furniture true religion glory god suppressing vice aduauncement christian vertue reliefe nedy especially householde faithe labour ordrely forcaste well dooinges procedinge vertue vertue thoccasion necessitie matter perswadeth pillers tur ettes heauenly wisedome shynynge glistringe eies beholder declare worthie praise price bee moste notable estymacyon value god man forasmuch experience grace godly frutes vertuous life dooinges hathe dooeth vndenyablye reporte vnfayned feare loue god harte aswell grace moste christian study trauailes faithfull furtheraunce aduauncement syncere worde god liberall reliuing helping moste hartie diligence succouring poore commune patronesse helper nedie succourles settours forth gospell christ later ende thys laste yeare toke hande request grace humble seruaunt speciall good frende edward whitchurch printour translate paraphrase erasmus vpon certain paules epistle whiche lefte vntranslated lacke payne taker matter somuche learned menne appoynted thys purpose translacion finished limited taskes like request haue made like enterpryse translate canonycall epistle peter iude iames iohn encouraged youre grace muche proued clemencie towardes menne generall presentlie bolde dedicate symple doinges rude trauslacion vnto moste noble excellent name thing selfe translacion basse kinde thenglishe phrase accordinge rude commune englishe speache countrey borne worthie youre grace commendacion moniment reknowlaginge moste bounden duetie humble thankes geuinge vnto grace causinge bee called late competent vicatage called cob gton warwike shire humble sute reuerende ministre goddes worde singular frende doctour hugh latymer constaunt memoriall token duetie considre vpon respecte bestowed sure grace youre gracious helping forewardenes towardes shoulde dispence employe contynuall studie labour residence trauailes industry earnest performacion faithfull discharge ecclesiastical charge vocacion office committed vnto content selfe indifferentlye competent small lyuinge though muche reuenues value besechynge grace take moste humble present good benig parte considerynge wante ryches eloquence learnyng caste commune treasoury amonge abundaunt ryche dooinges famous learned men readyly glad obscure vnlearned person poore widow cast two mytes touchyng thys notable learned paraphrast erasmus hys doinges vpon gospelles actes thapostles necessarye holsom playne declaracions christes minde euangelistes opinion many learned bee paraphrase also vpon pistles lesse frutefull ne lesse profytable geue lyght ready instruccion vnto mennes conscience aswell plucke awaye er onyous opynyons redde aduised iudgement teache christ aright banysh pride dronkenes reason tumultes sedicion vproares incontinencie ryot idlenes ruffianynge vagabuncie malyce slaunder vncommely talking lyght tale nuentynge carying deuouring neighbour couetousnes rote al wickednesse whiche horrible vice dayes licentiously vsed practiced hades parte hat gospel like truth liberty almost vtterly chau ged hellishe iniquitie suche deuilles diligent preaching prelacie endeuouryng bring passe therby plante establish romysh antichristianitie disobedience braunches state wickednes agayne partly vnder pretence christen libertie partly vnder colour commune wealth also cause gospel christ rebuke disobedience kyndes vice beare blame false opinion disobedience naughtie lyuing though thoccasyon bolsterour vice redresse hereof erasmus epistle ready strong interpretour many necessary place hable affirme knowing hys life tyme manne subiecte infirmitie imperfeccion according naturall condycion manne himselfe speaketh great doctour hierome homo rat et falli po rat et fallere manne might bothe deceaued deceaue labour rude englishe translacion toke hande none ende doe hartie frendes vndenyable request litell parte whiche learned menne hauyng done certayne seuerall partes paraphrase occasyon lette vntranslated vnlearned might diligent reading englished paraphrase tast according measure theyr faithe swetenes christe vertue true obedyence christen liuyng auoide deuilles subtill iuggling eschewe disobedience sedicious assembling repent light ruffia yng blasphemous carnal gospelling contemne world al painted flatering abhorte muche wickedly vsed brutish lyuing lorde iesus christe onlye autor saluacyon healthe contynue encreace hys moste gracyous gyftes youre grace ende ioyfully preserue youre long prosperous healthe hym amen xv iulie xlix p canonicall epistle p epistle saynct peter ii epistle peter epistle iude epistle iames epistle iohn ii epistle iohn iii epistle iohn argumente erasmus roterodame vpon firste epistle peter peter writeth iewes dwelt coastes getiles iames dyd epistle doubt worthie chief apostle full apostolike autoritie maiestie comprysed fewe woordes full sentence exhorteth meune pacientlye beare euils suffred malice gospell hope reward moreouer admonisheth accordyng prophetes mencioned saynges beyng freely called high dignitie expresse life worthie profession sayth christianitie consisteth title baptisme onely innocencie maners otherwyse afflicted sorowes maketh nothyng glory christe appeare manifestly suffre naughtie dedes furthermore admonisheth come christianitie refuse obey magistrate though ee heathen leste beyng prouoked neyther conuerted christ become fearce cruell also seruauntes denye duetie maisters though heathen office christian goodnes suffre al thynges furthermore admonisheth christian woman contemne husbandes though heathen study owne maners prouoke vnto better warneth husbandes beare wyues absteyne somtymes hauing may apply selues praier prouoketh men alter example christ suffre displeasure ymagine howe requyte wronge wronge deuise howe ouercome euyll doer softenes well doynges matter treateth thre first chaptres beginning fourth exhorteth men vnto newenesse life dissuadeth heathen vice allureth men vnto sobrenesse vnto watching continual prayer aboue vnto mutuall charytie vnto hospitalitie good turnes one agayne enticeth men paciently suffer persecucions layed vpon christes name sake informeth bishop people vnder charge ende reporteth wrote epistle vnto siluanus loste epistle appeareth wrote babilo name churhe saluteth man allowe vnderstanding rome babylon paraphrase erasmus roterodame vpon first epistle peter peter apostle iesu christ dwell stranger thorow pontus galacia cappadocia asia bithinia electe accordyng oreknowledge god father thorowe sanctifying spirite vnto obedience spri e lyng loude iesus christe grace peace multiplyed peter somtyme disciple contynuall g st nowe embassadour apostle iesu christ dwell therein coastes litell asia pontus galacia cappadocia parte properly named asia whiche ephesian haue bithi whome either stormy tempestes warres haue tymes paste scatred abroade place elles whome rageing cruellie hated name christe hathe giltelessy dryuen place father dwelt meanes nowe comfortles amonge stra nge nacions danyshed men beyng dede feare men thrust natyue countrey yet excluded ne banyshed neither depryued frome offyce ghospell preathing god prince al men bestowed chiefly vnto lande nacion iewes suche sorte woulde al haue commune whome soeuer hath chosen lyke neuer better borne leading life hierusalem fet naught doctrine iesus christ euen shal def de man dwelleth amonge vncircumcised prophane gentile stede moses lawe embrace grace ghospell obseruacion lawe wh iewes commonely puffed vp bringeth true saluacion neither kynredde place free eleccion god ryght iewe dede wihche countrey soeue dwell kynred soeuer borne acknowledgeth iesus christe tour true saluacion dyed one nacion people alone whole vniuersall worlde acknowlege endebted tte obseruing lawe vnto free goodnesse god whiche choseth al maner nacions calleth vnto lyberal fredome gospell whome soeuer standeth hys pleasure vntoit neither came late sodaynly hys mynde saue al maner mortal men thys meane ne yet enforced wel doinges helayth vp reward v though merited de reed god father eternal cousaill would ope porte saluacio iewes al nacions vniuersally circucision keping custome sabboth neither choise meates ne yet ceremony moses lawe corporal matter nothing certain shadowes spiritual thinges geue time true sanctificacion spirite spiritual lawe gospel geueth vnto v truly purged dede oure synnes haue obserued prescriptes olde law playnly readily put trust promisses ghospell sprinkling bloud calfe hath hitherto wont done according custome law sprinking precious bloud vndefiled acceptable sacrifice god iesus christ whose vndeserued death wypeth cleane awaye v transgression oure former conuersacion al borne new baptisme restoreth v vnto new life forasmuch baptisme hath exempted v world engraffed v participacion heauenly rewardes pray goodes getting heaping together wherof toylers world thinke theselfes fortunate goodes rather purge v cleane erthly contagious infeccions make v worthy prince heauen christ say grace distrusting owne merites putting confidece ceremony lawe may looke true saluacion fre bounteous liberalitie god purtyng vnfayned trust ghospell besides wishe peace beyng frely reconsiled god bloud christe may haue concorde among selfes hurting body also perdonyng mennes fanites requityng good turnes euill chaunce goodes lyke haue frely receyued god euen stadeth hand apply selfes vnto godly study may waxe riche encreasing vsury good workes onely persisting stedfast haue begonne also going forward dayly better better vntill day come wherin rewarde immortalitie shalbe openly geuen wherof haue conceiued certaine assured hope ghospell christe therby chalenge prayse vnto selues texte blessed god father lorde iesus christe according aboundant mercy begatte v agayne vnto lyuely hope iesus christ rose agayne death iuheritaunce immortall vndefyled perisheth refer ed heauen whiche kept power god thorowe fayth vnto saluacion prepared already shewed last time ye reioyce though season nede requyre ye eu ne thorow manyfold temptacions tryall fayth muche precious golde perysheth though tryed fyre might founde vnto laude glory honour appering iesus christe ye haue seen yet loue hym euen nowe though ye see yet doe beleue reioyce say vnspeakable gloryous receiuing ende fayth euen saluacion soules passing great benefite liberalitie praysed christ cometh vnto v whatsoeuer maketh v truly blessed moses god himselfe father lord iesus christ whan lytle fortunately borne adam say borne synne borne death hath begotten v new againe innocencie hath begotten v vnto life neuer shall dye prouoked merites stiered frely owne mercye wherin chiefly exceadeth hath done ayde moses lawe costeous gyft owne sone iesus christ would haue suffre death thintent el desperate wretch might diliuer v fro tyranny synne death called anon fro death lyfe beyng worlde dead worldly lustes hauing remembraunce tyes resurreccio exaple vprightnes conuersacion might haue assured ready hope also shal exempt sorowes atteine christ vnto euerlasting enheritaunce whiche lyke beyng head hath already atteyned shal al also folowe many engraffed mebres christ made worthy folowing craple called brother chyldre selfe father like suffre commune affliccions haue reward also together wt long sonnes synful adam infortunate enheritaure abode v sone made sonnes god make spedy haste enheritauce heauen besemeth seing borne heauen behold heauely thinges seing borne god folo nothing godlines serue world goe haue rewardes transitory wage slyppery v remayneth happy enheritaunce temperal affliccios neither corrupted death ne defited wearines heauines ne yet fade way age sluttishnes cause v afrayed leste man meane whyle take plenteous heritage handes haue assured fayth full promyse maker hades safely kept layed vp stoare v heauen howbeit suche sort al must assured hope certayne pledge remayne meane time men vpo earth al maner men wt like buto spirite christ geuen stede gage albeit ye time tossed euery syde wt condry stormes sorowes frailtie mais vtterly vnhable himselfe beare yet succour god mighty al thinges preserued owne merites fayth vnfained trust wherby dout fro last time shal confusion humayne matter euill appointed tormeutes shalbe hable body harme good safe fro al inuasions sorowes shal haue fruicio euerlasting rest rewardes lye hidde many time co mune people estimacio thei wurse condicio better seme perish specially sanegarde thei seme florish chiefly goe naught worlde time exercise godlines reward hath time prescribed vnto behoueth preuet meane seaso let ynough v euerlasting felicitie kept safegarde v neither mannor deuil hable take away fro v shrinke fayth wherby ought condene mortal men matter depende wholy heauen let meane seaso fearce folkes rebel god trust aydes world let time stampe stare ouer though wer ouercome left succoutles whan day shal come discourse thiges turned vp side shal tormeted shal reioyce like coquerours yea ought reioyce eue also vndoubted lokig passig great felicitie ought seme vnto greate greuous matter though affliccions griefes shorte shall soone haue ende come blissed neuer shall decaye perchaunce persecucions also shall haue end notwithstanding often come vre borne myghtye stoute stomake without dismaying glory god hope lyfe come suche wyse doeth wysedom god prouiding commodity permitte sinceritie stedfastnes faith may tried sondry assaultes sorowes yf golde elles thing lost would goe naught tryed touche stone also assayed fire thintente maye thenceforth bee muche price exactely fyned much wil god haue faith wherunto high honour duetie belongeth tried sondry experimentes thintent whan shal glister flame sorowes affliccions farre pure glittering golde though neuer fyne may precious syght god matter length may grow cleane contrary condicion thyng semed layed vpon worlde vnto reproche may chaunce vnto prayse semed vnto vilany may turned vnto glory whiche semed layed vpon put dishonestie may turned habudaunce honour day whan iesus chrst whose power worketh nowe secrete meanes shal forth selfe openly vnto men rendre vnto euery man rewarde accordyng hys desartes gloryous thyng praysed christes owne mouthe whan shall heare come blessed father thyng honorable receaued god father felowshippe kyngdome heauen together sonne thys glory although shall comen glory godly folkes yet shall chaunce haboundauntly vnto haue suffered greater thynges vpon earth christes sake whiche rewardes case nome presently apparent strength faythe bee maruclous matter nowe special chiefe prayse good folkes consisteth point neuer sawe christ bodyly eies yet eies fayth see loue wher violence sorowes doeth openly presently grate vpon rewardes kept till daye doe nowe appeare yet puttyng assured confidence hys promisses suffre thynges none stomacke yf glory presently furnyshed iyes neither doe suffre boldenesse also mydle affliccions reioyce vnspeakable ioy beyng ful glory god say well hoping conscience full certayne vnfeyned confidece suffre suche thynges vndeseruedly shall god haboundauntly receyue great fruyte fayth wete eternall saluacion soules great vauntage whan loosyng mortall body immortall soule preserued thus decreed eternal counsayle god menne atteyne saluacion meanes whereby euen christe hymselfe came euerlasting blessednesse texte saluacion haue prophetes enquired searched proheryed grace come vnto searchyng tyme spyryte christe signifie spyrite testified passios happen vnto christ glory folow aftet vnto prophetes also declared vnto selues vnto v shoulde minister thyuges nowe shewed vnto holy ghoste sent doune heauen haue gospel preached vnto thinges angel desyre behold matter chaunce brought passe auentures selfe thyng haue alreadye sene olde prophetes prophecied hand saued faith grace gospell without ayde moses lawe haue diligently sought searched beyng contenteo see myste shoulde come haue also godly curiositie searched spirite christ presently signified vnto secret inspiracion christe suffre vnto excellente glory shoulde byanby aduaunced vnto maner tyme shoulde come passe forsomuche theyr myndes vehemently desirous sauing helth vnto also manifested thynges prophecied beforehand come passe exhibited tymes thynges opened prophecy opened vnto felues dede would haue wisshed see haue chaunced see theyr prophecy spoken thintent apostle certaynly credited declare nowe vnto thynges already done spoken beforehande come passe shoulde also stande doubt spirite christe tymes paste taught secret still inspiracions determined doe lately cumyng doune heauen fyrietongues instructed v thintent preacher al whole worlde thinges come passe preache christ became man foral saluacio sake conuersaunt earth afflicted reproches torment finally nayled crosse suffered death oure sake anon ratsed agayne lyfe exalted vnto heauen glistreth maiestie glory father semed vpon earth vile rascall abiecte thither also exalte mattersinasmuch done vnspeakable counsaill god maruell though prophetes desired see seyng excellently pleasant acceptable sight euen angel selues loke vpon wt beholding wher cannot fulfilled greater benefite offred vnto gredyly ought embrace owne fault atteyne rewarde certayn shalbe dueties behaue selues seme vnworthy promise day loked wil come shal openly bryng forth rewardes godly vngodly wyll come whansoeuer shalbe shal come pleasant happy suche shall fynde readyly prepared contrary parte shall come fearfully shall fynde vnfaithfull sluggardes carelesly mynded texte wherfore gyrde vp loynes myndes sobet trust pefectly grace brought vnto declaryng iesus christ obedient chyldrcu ye geue selues ouer vnto olde lustes whiche ye led whau yet ye ignoraunte christe called holy euen yeholy also maner conuersacion writen ye holy holy ye call father without respecte person iudgeth accordyng euery mannes worke se ye passe tyme pylgremage feare forasmuche chryst woulde haue daye vncertayn vnto v behoueth securitie tyme alwayes hauing loynes myndes girded menne readyly furnished mete theyr lordes comming watchyng sober alwayes stiered vp put mynde certayn sure loking euerlasting felicitie offred vnto men obey gospell yet shalbe possessed length suche tyme lorde iesus christ shall openly shewe hys maiestie vnto al men vnto angelles deuiles howbeit shall come immortalitie onely maner forecast worlde according example iesus deade lustes worlde lyue agayne agayne vnto innocencie contynue stedfastly like laufull right true sonnes trust promise god father prescribed commaundementes neuer slyde agayne olde conuersacion whiche ignoraunce gospelles doctrine endaungered worldly concupiscence conuenient diffre affectes maners dissent profession worlde naught already exempted engraffed vnto christ righteous holy innocent ende chosen called father fountayne al holines like profession al life doinges pure vpright vnblameable father acknowledge sonnes like manered vnto dede thing ment whan spake auncetours leuitici xix chapter holy lord god holy puritie moses lawe could haue ben ynough absteine touching dead bodyes haue fete washen absteine acte matrimony god haue oure conuersacion whole harte fre al spottes synnes dede thinges make v playnly impure sight god although cal vpon god name father crieng helpe al thinges yet lyue filthy conuersacion may trust wilbe mercifull vnto acknowledge child seyng estemeth noman eyther kynred estate sake onely merites conuersacion nether shal iewe pure conscience defiled ne yet shall vncircumcised vnpure leade godly innocent life texte muche ye knowe ye redemed corruptible thynges syluer golde youre vaine conuersacion whiche ye receauch tradicion father precious bloude christe lambe vndefiled without spotte ordeyned hande euen woorlde made declared last tymes sake meanes beleue god raysed vp death glorifyed hym ye myght haue faythe hope towarde god euen ye whiche haue purifyed soules thorowe spirite obeyng truthe brotherly loue vufayned se ye loue one another pure herte feruently ye borne newe mortall seed immortal word god lyueth lasteth euer al flesh grasse glory man floure grasse grasse wyddereth floure falleth awaye worde lorde endureth euer worde gospel preached vnto therfore remayneth desirous haue father mercifull vnto haue vnauoydable iudgemet alwayes eies liue exile order couersacio nothing wherfore father may offended iustly shut inheritauce celestial countrey vnnaturall disobedyent child greater price wherwith christe hath frely redemed muche greater hede ought take lest wilfulnes vnthankefulnes turned agayn former bonde thraldom none myserable bondage bee slaue synne litle money made fre fro theyr maisters bondage become bondme fre men watch al meanes lest theyr vnthankefulnes may drawen agayne bondage commit offence fall old tyranny willingly bond slaues moses lawe rather serue vaine obseruaunces elder deliuered one vnto obey gospel god seing knowe deliuered commune tryfling price golde syluer offring muche holy moses lawe knoweth made cleane bloud calfe sprinkled precious bloud iesus christe like labe cleane without spotte pure vndefiled filthinesse synne offred synnes aultare crosse nether yet done chaunce auentures sonne god appointed make sacrifice euerlastyng makyng worlde might deathe reconcile father vnto v howbeit secret deuice decre goddes purposed mynde many long yeares vnknowen worlde length later time openly manifested new matter set forth mennes eye loke vpon whiche purposed mynde god new geuen saluacion sake vnto christe made man dyed preached bestoweth thus muche wher vayne truste vpon ceremony lawe distrusting selues must put whole trust god father like would haue christe dye wype awaye synnes euen hathe raysed vp death paynfull trauailes life suffred gaue glory immortalitie thentente haue beleued whiche hath done folowing example might also trust surely haue reward bestowed put whole affiauce god hath already perfourmed sonne also vndoubtedly performe al lyue suche sort may worthyly accompted among membres christ whose body engraffed synce regenerate baptisme hym tyme owne lustes say embraceing carnall shadowes thinges stede true ryght thinges since haue clensed soules obseruacion moses purgeing sacrifice haue faith obeyed trueth gospell whiche spyryte christe hath purged conscience must endeuour selues correspondente vnto head christe vprightnes life answerably like vnto concorde body excedyng playne brotherly vnfeyned loue among selues lyke christ loued commen sort carnall maner loue euen loue euery one spiritual loue new kynred requireth new affeccion tyme iewes loued iewes carnall affeccionate loue beyng far maner regenerate mortall earthly seede bodye immortall heauenly sede worde god lyueth endureth euer whose gospel haue beleued shall loue brother heauenly loue moses lawe geuen tyme worde god hathe brought forthe lawe gospel vnto v whiche neuer shall perishe thing procedeth men season thing cometh heauen euerlasting esay sayd al fleshe grasse glory man floure fielde grasse wythered loure fallen awaye worde lorde endureth euer eternall worde eternall father shadowes former lawe tymes past paynted vnto v nowe openly declared preacher gospell onely vnto vnto receyue christe syncere vpright fayth p ii chapter texte wherfore laye syde malicioushes gile fay ednesse enuy backbytyng newe borne babe desyre ye mylke bodye soule without disceite ye may grow vnto saluacion yf ye haue tasted howe gracyous lord ye come vnto liuing stone disa wed men chosen god precyous ye ing stone made spirituall house holy priesthood offer vp spirituall sacrifyces acceptable god iesus christe forasmuche lately borne againe heauenly generacion doctrine gospell caste vice former conuersacion quyte away yf malyce yf deceite yf holowe heartednesse yf enuy yf backebytyng cursed speakyng henceforthe babe newe borne gredely couete mylke body soule mylke knoweth deceyte fitte age harmelesse strong euen mylke ghospels ordinaunce ghospels doctryne hath principle hathe infancye hathe dyet mete weake tendre age hath also farther growinges finally hath perfite growe age first thinges supped lothesomly gredily yea thrustily neyther yet must lyngre continually procede stil vnto thinges perfeccion dede euen straunge thing man borne mother alwaies babe couet nothing el mylke behoueth also ware bigge tyll growe vnto perfite saluacio alwaies sticke still making foundacions ryse lytle lytle vnto perfite buyldyng house case according psalme wryters counsell haue tasted lorde iesus swete requisite bee prouoked taste sette appetite vpon greater thynges humayne buyldynges stone neyther chaunge theyr place ne grow bigger buyldyng standeth vpon liuing stone chiefe principall stone whereof stone conteyneth thynges liuyng eternall iesus christe whiche late psalme writer prophecying cast away menne phariseis holding teple go naught knowledge heauely building howbeit chosen iudgement god muche price nothing hinder may procede forward perfite finishyng buildyng therefore must necessarily goe forewarde encrease vertues vnto christ liuing stone chosen stone stone preciously sette sight god also grounded vpon suche foundacion may builded vpon litle litle vntyll bee made spirituall temple muche holy teple iewes brag temple muche wholy priesthood exercised vsed temple leuites priestes offered vp beastes spirituall temple selues offer vp spirituall sacrifice moste acceptable god spirite bodye doeth delyte spirituall sacrifice nothing mynde rite moses worne preachyng gospell stedde sundrye kyndes brute beastes slea worldly br tish affectes lecherous lustes pryde wrath enuie desyre reuengement ryot couetousnes stedde incense offer pure prayer flying aulter pure herte heauen sacrifice offered al season spirituall temple al tymes acceptably welcome vnto god sacrifice moses ready growen lothesomenes prophet esaye beareth recorde maner sacrifice contynually allowed iesus christ whose commendacion diligent seruice doinges chrystians acceptable vnto father texte wherfore contayned also scripture behold put sion stone layed chiefe corner electe precious beleueth shell confou ded vnto therfore whiche beleue precious vnto whiche beleue stone whiche buylders refused begunne bee head corner stone men stomble rocke wherat offended whiche stomble woorde beleue wheron set ye chosen generacion royall priesthod holy nacio people wonne ye shuld shew vertues hym called darkenes meruelous syght tyme past people nowe people god tyme obtayned mercye haue votayned mercye cause mystrust long ye cleaue fast vnto head chryst long stande harde vpon noble nmoueable ston christ god spake tymes past mouthe esaye beholde put sion ston placed chief corner tryed chosen precious shall put trust hym shall ashamed whiche spake hand se al ready perfourmed selfe one stone precious olsome vnto hurtfull noysome vnto iustly precious grouded surely vpo put whole trust preserued ayde agaynste al stormes tempestes vnto rather sticke still vnto moses vnto haue reiected willyng haue hym put buylding purposed buylde contrary wise reproche destruccion disdeyned haue buylding god wold haue head stone corner might knyt together conteyne wall eithersyde saye sortes people gentile iewes whose strong defence buylding safely preserued assaultes euer aduersaries vnto new buylding stumble ne stumble whosoeuer offended worde gospell beleue seing moses lawe made ready hande ende shoulde beleue gospell sone thing truly performed dede lawe signified shadow therfore haue disallowed christ god hathe also disallowed agayne reiecte christ hath made chosen kynred wherof moses spake tymes past holy nacion peculiar people god hath take selfe wt excellent price like people hebrues deliuered tymes paste moses leading tyranye egipt conueied many daungerous matter lande long hoped vpon preached vnto worlde goodnes god shewed warde euen hauing remembraunce fre liberalitie towardes also glorifie among al men wonderfull power god new meane hauyng conquered enemy saluacion hathe deliuered darkenes ignoraunce vicious lyuing woderful light gospel trueth errours gentile shadowes iewes cleane wyped away vnto therfore hathe chaunced honour persecuted christ surely reckoned vpo selues yet cleane contrary matter turned vpside downe thing chaunced osee sayd come people abiectes say far god peculiar people vnto god people god reiected vnworthy mercy hath felt experience mercy god without helpe circ cision lawe receiued gospel like faith felowship sonne god texte dearlye beloued beseche straungers pylgrems abstayue fleshly iustes whiche fyght agay ste soule se ye haue honeste conuersacyon amonge gentyles backbyte ouyll doc maye se youre good woorkes prayse god daye disitacyon submytte youre selues therfore vnto manner ordynaunce manne lordes sake whether ee vnto kynge vnto e heed vnto rulars vnto sent hym punishment euel dowars laude well wyl god wel doyng ye maye stoppe mouthes foulyshe ignoraunte men fre hauyng libertye cloke malicyousnes euen seruauntes god honoure men loue brotherly felowshipe feate god honoure kyng seruauntes obey master feare onely yf good courteous also though frowarde thake worthy yf man conseyence towarde god endure grefe suffer wronge vndeserued prayse yf whell ye buffe ed fautes ye take paciently yf ye wel ye suffer wrong take paciently thanke god sence ye acknowlege singular liberalitie god towardes whome hathe redemed price bloud hathe reconsyled vnto himselfe deathe sonne whome haue bee membres onely begotten lyuyng stone heauenly buylding whome hathe chosen right child called enheritaunce immortalitie beseche deately beloued frame youre selues holynes life like vnto owne dignitie like vnto gentil goodnes god vnto high rewarde regenerate vnto heauen woorlde foryners straungers make spede thither countrey enheritaunce heauen layed vp stoare called away fro desyre earthlye grosse appetite manner engynes make warre atail agaynste spirite gredyly desyrous heauenly thinges let conuersacion accorde profession maners may allure vnto christe folkes also paganes among whome lyue vnto whome muche requisite geue maner occasion maye rightfully iudge euil ghospelles doctrine yf shoulde perceaue commune custome life bee whit better entier vprightenes manner wel towardes menne may stoppe theyr backbyting reportes wherwith speake euil malice beare christ hate religion whiche suppose wicked supersticion whiche thinges euidently perceaued shal repent also acknowlege owne errour inspired mercye god whan shal please whiche hathe chosen draw also maye godly workes glorifie whome abhorred knew worlde hathe also order owne whiche occasion religio ought disturbed much may sauing glory christ euen christ would haue free synnes shoulde neuertheles suffer euery thing willingly gospelles busynes sake obeying submytting selues vnto christian magistrate vnto heathen magistrate also whether kyng must obey excellent publike autoritie whether ruler muste obey sent trauail abroade king administreth matter comon wealth nether let moue bee heathen thei idolatours acknowledge office necessarye vnto comune wealthe consisteth sondry kyndes men religion beare rule autoritie restrayne offender wicked persones feare punyshement allure bee good rewardes doe theyr duetie haue nede fearing inasmuch owne accorde man lawes require haue nede mannes commendacion rewarde heauen maketh feruent yet requisite also acknowlege hyghe god youre prynce geue none occasion vnto inconsiderate ignoraunce whereby myghte proueably call gospelles profession blame perceaued set naught autoritie whiche doe feare lawes willyngly owne accorde yea habundauntlye doe maye declare youre selues ryght free men dede free owne mind willyngly doeth shoulde doe rightly god forbydde abuse pretence gospelles veritie synne licenciously owe bonde seruice vnto men inasmuche seruauntes god shall submitte youre selues glory sake vnto men gladlre willynglye duetie therfore honour duely belongyng euen heathen either publike office sake beare affinitie sake throughly vnto men lest anye whit offended broughte farther profession gospell yet reason loue specially commune profession hath made brother vnto feare god whose eies man begile concernyng kyng cause afrayed seing dreadfull none euyll doer yet acknowledge hys autoritie thynges exacieth without hynderaunce godlynes demaundeth custome paye exacteth tribute geue free ought magistrate thoughe heathen bonde seruauntes ought vnto maisters seruing baptisme maketh free ought rather greater reuerence acknowledge onely yf good sobre men also sore men harde sharpe men lest peraduenture beyng offended frowarde maners doyng otherwise ought doe laye fauite vnto profession dryuen farther whereunto ought rather encensed allured honest behauiour wyl saye sore mater beare tyrannye prynces sore mater abyde crueltie maisters prynces spoyle exacte punyshe maysters wyth whyppes buffe te teare faultles mater woulde ryghtly seme worthye borne ascribed vnto rather vnto god wickednes deserueth thus muche thynges suffred handes wil god youre goodnes shoulde turne maliciousnes glorie christ suche sorte pacience acceptable god whan beyng afflicted vndeseruedly suffre neuertheles contentedly feare men glory god communely despyght impaciently taken whan men faultye among christian ferre otherwise among like euery one beste euen doeth couet mooste acceptable vnto god inwa ly loueth god muche chearfullye suffreth whatsoeuer pperteyneth glorye god garmercye yf suffre whan buffetted naughtye doynges conscience faulte teacheth thys euery man abyde deserued peynes holde peace whan suffre patiently sorowes done vnto weldoinges come fauour god whose cause sake suffre wyllynglye texte hereunto verely ye called christ also suffered v leuinge v ensample ye shoulde folowe steppe dyd sinne nether gyle founde mouth reuiled reuiled agayne suffered thretened committed vengeaunce hym iudgeth righteouslye whyche hys owne selfe bare sinnes body n tree beinge delyueted synne shoulde lyue vnto righteousnes whose stripe ye healed ye shepe going astray nowe turned vnto shepherd byshop solles innocencie might disdaynfully grudge christe beyng innocent suffred greater haynous peines sake profession vpon condicion called body myghte folow example suffryng hath left vnto entring fotesteppes might thrust vnto euerlastyng glory way atteyned vnto sorowe suffred whiche crucified theues innocent commytted faulte also maner gyle tyme found tongue wha bitterly reuiled gaue none euill wordes rather besought father forgyue whan bounden whan beaten whan nayled crosse threatened vengeaunce referred vengeaunce vnto father whiche iudgeth affeccion accordynge iustice christe meane tyme playng intercessour settour v albeit folowe innocencie yet naughtye synfulnes afore tyme iustely deserued vengeaunce god christe forasmuche indaungered synne yet caryed burthen synnes vpon owne bodye myghte ease v oure burthen offred tree crosse brent offerynge oure synnes hys vndeserued death put awaye deathe due vnto v shoulde meane tyme folowe example death resurreccion beyng dead vnto olde synnes lustes wherunto addicte dyd seruice shoulde lyue henceforth vnto innocencie vnto fountayne innocencie hath consecrated v whiche hathe taken ou e wickednes selfe myght geue righteousnes vnto v offended beaten fault punyshement lyght cruelly vpon accordyng esayes prophecie made whole stripe therfore bounden thanke youre innocencie god imputeth synnes former lyfe bounde thanke bondes scourgeinges woundes crosse death ye scatred tyme lyke shepe withoute keper strayenge one waye euerye mannes phantasye ledde thynkyng myghte lawfullye whatsoeuer lyked youre selfe nowe conuerted youre olde erroure vnto christe iesus shepehearde curate youre soules yf folowe hym sufferynge afflyecyons sorowes wythoute deseruynge shall throughe hys leadynge come vnto glory immortalitie p iii chapter texte likewise ye wiues subiection husbandes euen whych obey word may worde wonne conuersacion wiues behold chast conuersacion coupled feare whose apparel shal outwarde broyded heare hanginge golde ether puttinge gorgeous apparell let hid man heart without corruption spirite rest quiet spirite god thing muche set thys maner olde tyme dyd holy wemen trusted god tier selues obedyente husbandes euen sara obeyed abraham called hym lorde whose daughter ye long ye wel afrayed terrour nowe lyke free men ought allure prynces publyke magistrate euen oughte bonde seruauntes allure maisters vnto fauouryng gospell obedient diligence whych purchaceth frendship euery place dede prouoke occasion perauenture vncureable euen ought wiues also shewe themselues obedyent vnto husbandes onelye yf christian also haue yet embraced doctrine gospell dede maye possiblie come passe suche oure preaching doeth stiere entier vpryghtnes godlynes womanlynes sobrenes chastitie sufferaunce wyfe maye ouercome mollyfie conclusion wynne vnto christ whan shall perceaue theyr wyues maners chaunged baptisme whan shall see examplar true vertue shall peraduenture enflamed affeccion wedlocke lytell forewardyng purpose felowes one bedde would mynd felowes one profession syncere good demeanour hath sharpe pryckes whiche yf man marke nerely bryngeth passe manye tymes carnall loue turned spirituall loue maner loue occasioned welfauourednes beawtie behauiour apparel helpyng fauour beawtie forewarde behauiour occasioned fayre goodlynes entier good hearte shynyng manner therfore behoueth wyues whiche haue professed christe deuise howe maye set forthe themselues pleasautly husbandes eies comune custome theyr heare craftyly broyded puttinge precious stone gold purple rayment trymmyng bodye whiche shewed outwardly thynge shoulde come gayre loue wyues body vse fleshely lust porcion man body rather ought studye theyr husbandes may enticed goodly garnyshed maners loue secret hidden mynde hearte yf shall perceyue pure spotted wt knacke viciousnes shall see contrarie commune maner woman lyght affeccion woman woman communly haue intemperaunce wrath enuye seking preeminence arroganncie ouerthwart bibble bable softe mylde tractable gentyll spirit excellent gorgeous apparell e e god maner decking muste chiefly deserue haue husbandes heartes kynde wooing euen certayne holy woman time past fixed whole hope slyppery transitorye thinges god set forth themselues please husbandes gold precious stone purple sobrenes obedient diligence wherby fearcenes husba de disposition easyly aswaged sara obeyed abraham callyng lorde hys wyfe drudgeing hande mayde submitted selfe vnder subieccion sobrenes sake althoughe fitte man vse lordlynes towardes wife yet autoritie somthynges abuse yet standeth woman modestie obeye place briefe lyke abraham true right sonnes folowe thexample fayth euen saraes daughter resemble excellent good woman maners manly substautialnes mynde trymmyng vp selues good workes reposing youre trust god hauing fruicion ayde cause al afrayed woman frailtie texte lyke wyse ye men dwel according knowlege geuing honour vnto wyfe vnto weker vessel vnto heires also grace lyfe praiers hindered office matrones chast obedience holy maners wyth mylde softenes ouercome husbandes euen parte men wise abuse autoritie towardes wyues playng tyrannes submit theselues vnto rather much lesse lordely towardes make selfes handemaides companion estate thynges euer befalleth let perceiue handsome men lyue withall let wisdome succour frailtie womankynde stronger tha strength hert body much behoueth releue woman infirmitie youre instruction gouernaunce maye made better settyng aparte kynde maye waxe manlye gospellike godlynes christian husbandes haue wyues vse copulacion ought rather endeuour wyues maie theyr copanions fastinge almosededes dooing watching prayeng woman called comune reward eternall lyfe well husbandes maye earnestly set myndes thynges also communely husbandes christian mariage nothing dede lytle geuen vnto voluptuousnes muche vnto godlynes wherin yf bothe party consent thereup refrayne fro bodyly ale prayer shal interrupted prayer sacrifice wherwith god must sacrificed vnto euery daye texte conclusio ye al one mynd one heart loue brethre piteful courte meke rendring euill euill rebuke rebuke contrariwise blesse know ye thereunto called euen ye heires blessing doth l lyfe loueth se good dayes let hym refraine tonge euil pe speake guyle let hym eschewe euil good let hym seke peace ensue eye lorde ouer ryghteous hys eares open prayer agayne face lorde ouer euil therfore lyke men haue one kynd peculiar office ha euen becometh euery one rather remembre selfe hath professed christ ought excel others thinges mater tried honestie howbeit comune office men lyke al haue one self profession like baptisme engraffed one selfe body euen let al concord one self mind let age estate codicio sodry diuerse coutres disseuer sondre thinges among others many time ministre occasion hate contencion behoueth fast ioyned together seyng one baptisme hath regenerated vnto god seyng haue one father heaue inasmuche dependyng one head christe mebres one body forasmuche profession gospell hath made brother indifferently cause sake father heauen hathe called vnto one rewarde immortalitie without differece whether poore whether riche whether bonde seruauntes whether maisters whether husbandes whether wyues whether iewes gentyles behalfe difference therfore oughte dissension highe stately lokyng greate deale shall christian charitie humbleth selfe wynne auctoritie exacteth concorde amonge menne arrogaunt fearce louers selues mebres beastes bodye succour euery one case thyng chaunce one whether good badde euerye one reconeth owne nere kynred bloud knytteth together glad sorye comodities discommodities kynsfolkes much co uenient beyng knytte together manye wayes shoulde expresse consent touched men wealth sorowes lesse shal expressely shewe right brotherly charitie wealthy estate disdeine haue worldes wealth sory euils power succour hygh power autoritie presse despise lower sort wyth familiar gentylnes good wordes apply selues familiarly vnto inferiours may indifferent equalitie christian charitie maye ioyne together state worlde hath disseuered god forbyd desirous reuengement seyng part nourishe concorde brother suche godly also yf possible men good behoueth stryue may good naught stryue pacient suffryng doyng good also meanes like wilde beastes ouercome eue somtymes mollifieth malice men wherin hope amendemet willing therfore requite wrong wrong scoldyng scoldyng shall come passe shalbe euel also folow thexaple ye euil rather recompense good turne wrong good wordes bad ye inuincible goodnes may ouercome ouerthrowe malice god hath called ende haue vpper hand naughtie dedes naughtie wordes speakynge weldoyng vnto men wel speakyng vnto men maye worthyly heare ioyfull word come ye blessed father possesse kingdome euil vnto good tha propretie mad beastes speake euil speake wel excedeth propretie vile tongued ruffios deserue well deserue euill speake well euyll speaker backebytours thoffice christian vertue man thynke harde matter let heare psalme wryttour enspired spirite god commaundeth whoso desirous loue lyfe se good dayes let refrayne tongue euell lette restrayne lyppes speake deceate let eschewe euel doe good let seke peace folowe eies lorde vpon ryghteous eares attentiue vnto prayer contrarywyse countenaunce lorde vpon euyll therefore yf wyll haue god liberally good vnto v let v good vnto men yf wyll escape vengeaunce let v hurte body wyll heare reason man affeccion wyll perchaunce murmuryngly repyne behalfe doe reuenge iniurye vnpunyshed libertie wyl prouoke many mo hurt nothyng shal kepe safe iniurie yf eyther paciently suffre el good wrong none ende harme often wyth wretched encoutryng one reuiling made double reuiling againe iniurie made double iniurie iniurie agayn man resiste naughtinesse shall ceasse least waxe faynt texte moreouer wyll harme ye folowe whyche good yea happy ye trouble happen vnto
