ryghteousnes sake ye afrayed terrour neyther ye troubled sanctifie lorde god heartes redy alwayes geue answere euery man asketh reason hope mekenes feare hauing good conscience backbyte euil doer may ashamed falsely accuse good conuersacyon chryste would couet doe harme yf studye good men hurte man yf anye found vtterly blynd malyce beare vertue throughe ignoraunce persecute praye thing hurt wyll take awaye youre money whiche yf must shortly leaue behynd wyll torment body wyll slea shoulde shortely dye yf thynges forasmuche done vnto godlynes sake shall onely bryng damage vnto also greatly encreace vauntage euell turnes doynge augment rewarde euerlastyng felicitie loseth good meanyng hearte hurted dede whan safe gayne whatsoeuer worlde thynketh losse blessednes whatsoeuer thynke sorowfulnesse therefore bryng passe violence sorowes harme waye whatsoeuer naughtynesse men shall take awaye free large god shall restore agayne excedyng great vauntage yf haue fruicion god haue cause afrayed men threatnynges disquieted violence sorowes neyther troubled mynde myddes stormes affliccions though destitute goddes helpe neither speake cursedly vnto men punyshe throughe ignoraunce rather glorifie lorde god heartes whiche seruauntes turneth thynges best whethersoeuer chaunseth ioye aduersitie therefore euer worthye praysed albeit man alwaies worde mouthe yet affeccion heart maye euery tymes hys enemyes prouoked scoldynges wheresoeuer anye hope shall offre selfe maye drawen vnto christe prompte ready answere whosoeuer desireth knowe confidence throughe hope set naught commodity life suffre incommodities paciently disdeignefully tauntynglye thoughe offended al mildenes reuerence say vsing good conscience owne althoughe hable perswade ynoughe christian speake thinges true worthy christ also speake suche sorte verye reason talke maye declare hande busines respecte glorie christe saluation whiche speake vnto shalbe surest argument make ashamed slaundre conuersation leade accordyng christes doctrine thoughe countrefaict naughty conuersacion countrefaicte vertue althoughe otherwise begile men iuggling yet whan commeth suffring punishementes breaketh bewrayeth self nothing good conscience conscience dependeth wholy god hable chearefully beare thinges farre fro intendyng reuengement goeth also good punished texte better yf wyll god ye suffre well euil asmuche chryst hath suffred sinnes iust vniust bring v vnto god killed pertaining fleshe quickned spirit spirit also went preached vnto spirites prison whych somtyme ben disobedient long suffering god loked day noe arke preparing wherin say viii solles saued water lyke baptisme also saueth v puttynge away fylth fleshe good conscience consenteth god resurreccion iesus christ whyche righte hande god gone heauen aungelles power myght subdued vnto hym let moue harmeles folkes suffre sorowes handes whiche harmedoers rather behalf easely borne whatsoeuer done vnto better wyll god suffre thinges suffre wel doyng euil doyng punysshed euil dedes suffreth hath deserued punyshementes suffre turne glory christe heaped encreace felicitie gloriouse thynge folowe thexample prince thus aduaunced glory god father beyng together without synne taken bounden beaten spytte vpon crucified dyed synnes synne ryghtuous vnryghtuous faultes faultye suffred paynes gladly obeyng father myghte presente v synners cleane without spotte vnto father also folowyng example shoulde lyue harmeles amonge harmedoers beynge made good shoulde suffre wealth naught dyed onely temporall affliccion endowed lyfe euerlastynge beyng redemed synnes shoulde slyde backe agayne christ hath made v cleane delyuered death weakenes humaine body receiued raised life agayne power spirite whyche coulde ouercome wyth affliccions tyme dead body closed graue alyue spirite pearced vnto helles lyke vnto men endued mortall bodye preached doctryne gospell bodylye presence beleued attayned saluacion refused beleue purchaced selues heape eternal damnacion euen body beyng laied aparte spirite went vnto deliuered body lyued helles preached vnto nowe time present wherein receyue rewarde godlines tymes past earing iustice god nether reuenged selues euilles liued faultles among faultye declared suffred condyng punyshementes day noe arke furnisshed floude loked god prouoked mortall mennes wickednes would send vpon beleued abused gentilnes god sawe thing threatned put certayn yeares therfore floude came destroyed except fewe saye moe onely eight person according no counsel went arke drowned floud therefore euen tymes faythe wanted h rewarde god suffred perishe trusted al whole neither vnbeleuers escape vengeauce god although reuengers ynough obeye god punyshement rest refe hym whiche n e ke vnto baptisme vnto thyng floud vnto eternal punishement vnto wicked preached vnto obey gospel ynough noe haue tolde floud come ynough haue shewed meanes myght escape daungier yf throughe repentaunce would haue aswaged wrath god prouoked vpon theselues theyr wickednes let vpryghtenes ynoughe vnto let ynough haue declared vnto rewarde prepared beleue gospel peyne abideth vnbeleuers fewe saued fayth shall layed charge great part men perishe throughe vnbelefe perishe owne faulte sorte wyll god vtter difference betwene good badde baptisme receiued ought preserueth agaynst destruccion wassheth awaye fylthynes bodyes soules baptisme beyng broken promisse withall destroyeth euer wyndeth muche haynous rageing streames wickedness therfore thing saluacion hauing faythe doth bringe destruccion vnbeleuers suche rebellion agaynst fayth notwithstandynge ynough floude baptisme sinnes perished wicked lustes former conuersacion lost onles ther present good conscience also lyfe correspondent benefit god christ died howbeit risen neuer dye vnto v synfulnesses oure former olde lyfe ly sort slayne death christ shoulde afterwarde lyue agayne innocencie neuer slyde backe agayne synnes muche lyeth v shall come passe shall settyng inortalytie apart desi ou sly aspire vnto countrey heauen wt al whole hertes enheritauce wh rof abydeth obey gospel iesus christe rose agayne tha would make long taringe vpon earth coueyed selfe mortall mennes companye vp heauen hauynge fruicion glory immortalitie sitteth father right hande wt body suche body death hath title whyle death goeth swalowe vp innocente vtterly swalowed vp selfe death surely reconeth haue gotten great praye became praye selfe finally christes victorie victorye glory went shewed vnto v case continue styll thyng haue begon sticke harde fotesteppes againste tormentes wicked preuailed nothing pacient suffryng gate victorie trihumpheth raigneth alofte sittyng heauen aboue aungelles whatsoeuer vertue power besydes vnto hathe opened waye heauen way entred maye also thrust thycke treefolde place enheritaunce ready certaine possession wherof hath also entred sake expresse selues worthy saye set study vpon innocencie hath frely geuen good vnto men yea euen euyll punyshe much vnto perteyneth p iiii chapter texte much christ hath suffred v fleshe arme ye selues lykewyse mynde suffereth fleshe ceaseth sinne hence forwarde shoulde lyue muche tyme remayneth fleshe lustes men wyl god suffycient v haue spent tyme past life gentils walkyng wantones lustes excesse wine excesse eating excesse drinking dronkennes abhominable idolatry semeth inconuenient thing ye runne also vnto excesse riot therfore speake euil shall geue accomces ready iudge quicke dead vnto purpose verelie gospel preached also vnto dead shoulde iudged lyke men liue god spirit end al thinges hand muche christe prynce head folowed pleasure thys lyfe throughe suffrynge afflyceions tyme came vnto glorye heauen seing hath conquered aduersaries weapon paciente sufferaunce reason professe selues disciple shoulde arme selues lyke purpose mynde innocencie lyfe surest armour christian pacience fortresse beaten downe gyrded pacience sure man hable hurt whosoeuer deade together christ fleshe hath geuen ouer synfulnes former conuersacion playnly deade humayne desyres nowe tickled gredynes renowme prouoked desyre reuengemente reste hys tyme geuen hym thys sely carkas lyueth together whole wyll god onelye esyre please also lokethe rewarde good conscience vnto referreth vengeaunce takyng wycked whosoe er readily prepared suffre martyrdome touched pleasure worlde thys thynketh selfe god forbydde beyng done vpon crosse christ shoulde goe downe vice haue forsaken beyng appointed vnto euerlastyng felicitie shoulde tombled backe agayne worldes delices whiche shorte also folyshe euen large ynough straunger fro christe haue spent tyme past folyshe lustes whiche prophane heathen filthiely serue beyng addicte geue wantones fleshly lustes dronkenes excessyue bankettynges abomynable image worshyppynges prankes glad haue left behynde v goodnes christe often loke backe shrugge feare remembre suche fylthynes lyfe great blynde darkenes ignoraunce nowe stedde outragious luste chastitie pleasaunte iote temperate fare wynnebybbyng sobrietie supersticious worshypping image true godlynes deuoute worshyppyng lyuyng god vnto mooste acceptable sacrifice maye mynde pure vnspotted vncleanes synne haue theyr blynde darkenes yet styll haue maruaile great chaungeing myndes lyfe thynke scorne riotousnes condemned temperate fa e lyfe whiche floweth ouer kyndes intemperaunce blamed youre honest vprightnes woulde loue companion fylthynes nowe rayle vpon youre lyfe suche yet cause ye shoulde moued raylynlynges neither rayled agayne let ynough haue good conscience god yf possible waye conuerte vnto better ought diligece howbeit sort goe backe syncere vprightnes repent ioyed yf hertes hardened rayle scolde euen agaynst wyshe well referre vengeaunce god whose iudgement mortall man hable escape tyme shall iudge men onely quycke also deade quycke christ hys commyng shall fynde lyuinge bodye deade whiche christes commyng departed lyfe notwithstandyng none lyueth dede lyueth vnto godlynes serue vice fylthye lustes dead vnto god vnto iudgement dead dede shal rendre accopt yf wil repent theyr vice equall indyfferent iudge shall punyshe youre sake paye full rewardes pacient suffraunce dede desirous men reuiue vnto gospellike godlynes cause sake woulde haue grace gospell p ached onelye vnto iewes lyued deuoutly moses lawe onely vnto gentile lyued honestlye lawe nature also vnto dead vtterly buried kyndes naughtines vnto theyr darkenes woulde haue lyght gospell layed woulde haue taughte myldenes pacience also awaking length myght contemne thynges wherin nowe blynde repose felicitie reputed dead bodye men entangled wt affeccios body god myght lyue spirite none alyue dede goddes iudgement sorte deade nothyng long continuaunce worlde ende thynges shall shoretly come voluptuous pleasure shall sone forsake paynefull punishement shall sone haue ende also euerlastyng ioye abydeth euerlasting cormentes abyde texte ye therfore sobre watche vnto prayer aboue thynges haue feruente loue among selues loue shal couer multitude synnes ye berous one another without gr gynge euerye man hath receyued gyfte euen minister one another good minister manifolde grace god man speake let hym talke wordes god man minister let hym habilytie whych god ministreth vnto hym god al thynges maye bec glorified iesus christ prayse dominion euer euer amen therfore stondeth hande meanes daye fynde slugishly napping carelesly snourting riot slouthfulnes rather prepare selues alwayes ready agaynst daye sobre watching continuall prayer shall come vnloked christ shall fynd thee chose come happyly sobrietie acceptable thyng god sure mater watche god doeth gladlye heare prayer set forthe temperaunce watchyng thyng greate deale acceptable embrace euery one continuall vehement loue releuing euery one mutuall good turnes watchefull maye rayse vp drowsye snourtour better learned may instructe lesse learned diligente may warne sluggarde feruente maye prycke vp colde one perfit maye forgeue doeth amysse infirmitie brynnynge charitie towardes neighboure couereth multitude sinnes wherwith endaungered god whiche offende agaynste hym verye well washen awaye doyng good turnes vnto neighbour lyke euery one hath fortune habilitie lette hym studye good vnto hys brother let hath substaunce withal shewe himselfe herberous bestowe vnto haue nede grudgingly nether murmuryng gladly chearefully estemyng himselfe receyue good turne whan geueth suche maner losse substaunce greate gayne god whiche shal repaye al vpheaped mesure thinke moreouer whatsoeuer spende helpynge youre neyghboure good gyfte god geuen ende hauing chaunce iches commytted youre credence shoulde waxe riche vsurye godly workes vnto god hath distributed sondry giftes vnto gyftes let man take vpon haue whiche hath hym selfe let thynke god gyfte whiche would haue distributed vpon doynge good turnes one mutuall loue maye glewed together amonge youre selues might encreace occasion vnto euery one rewarde godlynes let man discotent selfe endued gift let man also stonde owne conceit hath mo quality geuen vnto haue ryche lyberall gentill god bestowe gyftes sondry sortes man lorde whiche hath receaued nothing dispoler thyng disposeth lordes yf faithfully chearefully desirouslye lette hym loke rewarde man inasmuche shall receaue god holsome doctrine chaunce vnto man man haue gyfte fyne learned tongue let abuse vnto gayne vnto pompous statelynes vayne glorye vnto commoditie neighboure glory christe let hearer perceyue wordes wordes god men whiche speaketh nothyng el instrumet voyce god man hable haue ministracion office doctrine let administre gyft chalenge thautoritie vnto selfe ascribe vnto god geueth power strength goe aboute thynge effectually taketh hande shall done intent giftes diuersly distributed office diuersly gone god may glorified euery parte welspring haue al thynges flowynge vnto v moses iesus chryste whatsoeuer father geueth geueth vnto v sonne vnto god therfore shall ascribe dede holpen brother good turne vnto god shall rendre thankes whiche glad brother holpen ministerie totall summe al glorie redoundeth euery parte vnto god father sonne vnto continual glorie dominion euer world without ende amen ought behalfe seke glory behoueth v remembre duetie wherwith may please god concerning rewarde let hym alone put truste shall turne persecutours malice good shal change paynful sorowes gladnesse reproche glorie texte derely beloued maruaile ye proued fire thing trie though straunge thing happened vnto reioyce asmuche ye partaker christes passion hys glorye appereth ye maye mery glad ye rayled vpon name christ happy ye glorye spirite god resteth vpon part euil spoken parte glorified se none punyshed murtherer thefe euyll doer busy body men matter man suffre christian man let hym shamed let hym glorifie god behalfe tyme come iudgement must begin house god first begin v shal ende beleue gospel god righteous scarcely saued shall vngodly sinner appere wherfore let troubled according god commyt soules hym wel vnto faythfull creatour therfore dearly beloued disquieted meane season newe matter though shalbe felowes gether kyngedom heauen tried afliccions worlde gold fire thing ought seme newe matter vnto whyche wente long go triedly proued prophetes lately christe ought easylye borne asmuche see happen comonly vnto tried people god seyng behalfe beyng disciple resemble maister beyng membres resemble heade iesus christe ought glad reioyce lyke doeth vouchesaue haue companion affliccions euen afterwarde wha shal open maiestie vnto al men hauing made ashamed astonied afflicted malice shal reioyce vnspeakeable wirthe may felte expressed wordes meane season yf men reuyle howe sore soeuer afflicted bodye owne naughtye dedes profession christ yet behalfe blessed euen middes tormentes myddes dispightfull handlinge glorious spirite god kyndled againe harmeles harte good conscience sake swete thing suffer wt christ glorious thing suffer christ muche lyeth reuile eue christ himselfe howbeit innocencie pacient suffraunce causeth chaunce vnto glorye god forbydde punished manslaughter theft eyther naughty wordes speaking curious meddlynge thinges perteine nothing cause tormenting maketh marter whosoeuer suffreth none cause called christian nedeth ashamed punishment shame called thefe glorious thig called christia blessed whiche though painful sorte may escape tormentes hell fire affliccions shall endure space moment haue passage geuen vnto ioyes shal neuer haue ende wherunto god admitteth none notably proued tried muche suffring sorowes one shal practise dreadful iudgemet wha tyme mercy past wherat euery one shalbe rewarded accordig deseartes meane iudgemet easye inasmuche beyng purely tried teporal tormetes made worthy felowship christ whiche wil allow nothing thinge pure perfitely scowred drosse nowe tyme iudgement exercised thintent maye euidently appeare doe trulye put truste god whoe doe trulye loue christe dede thinges beynge prosperous quiet estate argumetes true godlines moses ceremony euen hipocrite maye kepe losse goodes reuilinges enprisonmentes stripe death man taketh paciently hath inuincible faith ioyned wt gospellyke charitie vnto let readily prepare selues wil tyme coming reigne wt christ iudgemet shal beginne house god whiche congregacion yf nedefull v clensed whiche beleue gospell liue vprightely ende iudgemet payne abideth haue constaunt belefe gospel continue styl owne wickedness yf tryed whiche single plaines obeye gospell hauynge forsaken pleasure worlde haue geuen ouer selues studye godlynes shall become whome preachinge gospell hath made worse yf whiche lyue iustly knowinge themselues giltie none euyll atchieue without peryll muche doe porte eternall saluacion hope shall wicked mischeuous doer shewe face straight dreadefull iudgement therfore maye wyse hope get saluacion thintent also whiche tormented worlde euyll doynges wyll god must trust selues possible power exercisinge workes godlynes shoulde sorte put soules handes god maker goodnesse wyll suffer peryshe hath made yf continue well doyng deathe yf wyll haue none affiaunce owne merites loke rewarde bounteous lyberalitie p v chapter texte p elder whiche among exhorte also elder witnes affliccios christ also partaker glory shalbe opened fede ye christes flocke asmuche lyeth taking ouersyght compelled therto wyllyngly godly sorte desyre tylthy lucre good minde thoughe ye lordes ouer parisshes ye ensample flocke good wyll chefe sheperde shall appeare ye shall receaue incorruptible crown glorye lykewyse ye yonger submyt selues vnto elder submit selues euery man one another knet youre selues together lowlynes mynde god resisteth proude geueth grace humble endeuour dilygence vnto brother bothe euery one seuerally selues together commune folowynge fotestepes christ may atteyne vnto felowship howbeit reason whiche excede autoritie age excede also study godlynes example maner teaching autoritie dependeth resydue multitude inoughe lyue vpryghtly themselues excepte carefull multitude also vnto graye head augmenteth autoritie vse thinges augmenteth wysedome long proued tried vprightenes lyfe augementeth credence therfore speake elder kepets people beynge elder also selfe whiche haue performed mater dedes thing teache say suffring enprisonmentes stripe name christ sake beyng ready also euen vnto crosse wha wil god shal like maner hauing good hope hath vouchesafe haue suffer sake wil admitte also vnto felowship glorye heauen sone day shal come wherin shal openly declare maiestie vnto world wrastlinges world ende rewardes shalbe brought furthe beseche tormentes sake christ suffred myne affliccions sake wherin folowe lord myne vttermost power shew selues right feders multitude dede chauced euery man lotte watche walke loke euery syde take hede nothing wante vnto flocke whome christ died nether holy consolacion nether holsome doctrine ne example gospellyke lyfe called superint endentes accomplyshe dede thing called fede cure gouerne kepe nothing perishe nothig runne way see doe grudgingly costrained feare either shame necessitie office wt diliget readines gladly wt good wil respectig nothing elles may acceptable god busynes take hande shall receyue euerlastinge rewarde loke rewarde lyfe shame take charge christian people vauntage sake whiche charge man praysed takynge dooeth owne accorde frely without thinge man fallen rewarde heauen hunteth hyre office mennes handes worlde next vnto yf man thoughe set naught lucre yet seketh ambiciously honour dignitie desyrous commaunder beyng desirous reuerenced man shall haue rewarde also god hath receaued rewarde office right bysshop ferre lordinge tirannye administracion bisshop put autoritie ende scrape selfe gayne therby reigne lofte vse pleasure frely doe good therfore elder remebre office behaue selues thinges lyfe maye example vnto people gospellyke conuersacion let learne behauiour set naught lucre let learne defye dysdeignous statelynes let learne hope hyre duty dooing christes handes haue respecte none thing worlde honest acceptable god meane season playe good shepherdes frely without thing neuertheles dede shall doen nothing whan prince shepherdes iesus christ shall thappointed daye openly shew forth selfe whiche gaue selfe wholy shepe keping wherof hath committed vnto credence stede vyle mortal triflyng rewarde shall receyue glorious crowne duetye doinge whiche shal neuer fade therfore wyse take thing vpon selues ought loke prince handes preuent daye whiche woulde haue vncertaine vnto v like parte suche elder shew selues father vnto yonger euen yonger ought parte shewe selues manerly obedient vnto elder lyke elder submitte selues throughe gospellyke charitie vnto men thintent maye doe good euen yong ought abuse gentilnes facilitie elder rather couenient obey wt muche ready diligence abuse lesse autoritie true charitie autoritie nether dysdeinfull youthe outragiouslye fearce set dignitie goeth nothinge may doe good subiecte doeth owne free accorde requireth let men therfore haue gentyll sobrenes fyxed vtterly harte shall occasion nether elder shalbe weary charge yonger greued autoritie god hateth fearce flowtenes stomake men delyght lowe mynded heartes suche deiecte selues bestoweth giftes vnto take nothing vpon selues repelleth forsaketh proude person vnworthy benefites suche humble selues aduaunceth suche exalte selues throweth downe suche truste owne strengthes doeth vouchesafe helpe dystruste theyr owne power depende wholye becke chearyssheth maynteyneth texte p submit selues therfore vnder mightie hande god may exaite tyme come last youre care vpon euer careth sober watche youre aduersatye deuyll roarynge lyon walketh aboute sekynge whome maye deuour whome resyst stedfast faithe knowynge affliccions appointed vnto brerbren worlde god grace whiche hath called v vnto eternall glorye christ iesus shall owne selfe ye haue suffred lytle affliccio make perfecte settle strength stablyshe glorye dominto euer euer amen siluanus faithfull brother vnto suppose haue written breffely exhortinge testifying howe true grace god wherin ye stande congregacion whiche babilon companion eleccion saluteth dothe marcus sonne grete ye one another kysse loue peace al whiche christ iesu amen submitte selues therfore dreade men trust mightie hande god peril leste shoulde troden vnder fote perpetually euer shall aduance exalce lofte whan day rewardes cometh loke waueringly haue distrust aftayed lest tossed ye sourges sorowes thoughe vndefended set naught hable thinges seeth thinges hath charche wil suffer thing peryshe ye comune custoume youthe bet vnto pleasure vnto ryot vnto wantonnesse sobre watche myndes beyng alwayes readilyall prelate maye learne diligence mooste diliget preachinge prelate deuyll attetiue alwayes circuspecte aduersarie saluacio thursteth mannes destruccio sleapeth walketh lyke hungrye roaringlion sekeyng euery place may snatche vp deuour assaieng meanes entraunce vnto sometyme layeng wayte voluptuous pleasure sometyme openly oppugnyng persecucions geue place vnto resiste vnshrinkinge stronge harte wil say haue power mightie hathe charge mightier put whole trust harte vpon aduersaries power shalbe nothinge faithles strong faithfull feble yf shoulde assaulte man man parchaunce might rightly take sore greuous affliccio doeth impugne al whole flocke godly wt like malicious hatred persecuteth christ enuieth men saluacion comune affliccio shalbe easely hable borne stande wt agreable myndes agaist comune enemy matter shal shortly haue ende nether wil god whome proceadeth goodnes leaue succourles meane season wil throughly perfourme thing hathe begonne hath geuen suche stomackes sake afrayed suffer tormetes wherby hath called vnto glory neuer shal haue ende wyll suffer mysse victorie yf wrestle manfully wil helpe wrestlynge wyll garnysshe strengthen establyshe beynge tormented shorte season maye atteine crowne immortalitie ayde get victorye free gyfte shal receyue rewarde nothing wherin may chalenge prayse selues vnto god alone al glorye due onely worlde also al age euer ame present wil write vnto selfe matter suppose wrote vnto late althoughe fewe wordes siluanus faithfull brother doubte delyuered epistle well faithfully desired hartily besought perseuer styl haue begonne nothing alter mynde waye haue entred right true waye vnto saluacion thus ferre haue proceded forewarde goodnes god continue styll stedfastly throughe helpynge ayde tyll attayne vnto victorious rewarde lyfe neuer shall dye congregacion christianes commende vnto euen congregacion whome god hath chosen himselfe together babilon whiche myddes wicked ydolatrours folowe godlynes gospell myddes sylthye corrupte lyuers embrace purenes cleane conuersacion alone selues god hath electe euery place dede fewe howbeit fynely tryed sede encreace congregacion tyme commynge latgely marke saluteth whiche sonne salute euery one kysse sorte geue custumely hartely holy pure true christia mynde doone hearte signe chaste pure vpright louer lyeng countrefaicte token make ende myne epistle lyke sorte beganne grace peace alwayes present al beyng engraffed vnto bodye iesu christ lyue spirite grace maye couple vnto god peace maye glewe together mutual concorde whiche thing god best mightye brynge passe amen p thus endeth paraphrase vpon first epistle peter thapostle p argument vpon later epistle peter thapostle erasmus roterodame epistle appeareth peter wrote whan greatly growe age almost pittes brinke dede maketh mencion death writeth generallye sortes christianes exhortinge purenes lyfe auncient example terrour laste iudgemet frayeng fylthines doeth vehemently blame whiche corrupte myndes symple peruerse doctrine denyeng commynge christ p thus endeth argument p paraphrase erasmus vpon later epistle peter thapostle p first chapter texte p simon peter seruaunt apostle iesus christ whiche haue obtained lyke precious faithe v thorowe rightewesnes god sauioure iesus christ grace vnto peace multiplied thorow knowledge god iesus lorde accordynge godly power hath geuen vnto v al thynges pertayne vnto lyfe godlynesse thorow knowledge hath called v glory vertue geue vnto v excellent great promyses meanes therof ye might partetakers godlye nature yf ye flye corrupcion worldly luste simon peter tymes paste diligent folower moyses law seruaunt embassadour iesus christ whose gospel eue day light wipeth driueth awaye shadowes olde testament write vnto maner men without parciall excepcion either people religio either kynde state yet condicion esteme people kynsfolkes nerely ioyned vnto v whosoeuer haue deserued made like vnto v profession faith gospel haue atteyned true rightuousnes circumcision sacrifice lawe goodnes god deathe sauiour iesu christ hath frely pardoned v olde synnes thentet hence forthe folowe gospellyke righteousnes dooeth consiste ceremony true godlines mynde hath certaine farre greater perfeccio iewes righteousnes whiche nothinge shadowe true righteousnes praye lyke haue yet hitherto gon aboundantlye forwarde grace gospel alwayes somwhat augmentyng thencreaces godlynes drawinge nerer brotherly concorde amonge selues daylye liberall goodnes god woulde vouchesafe make perfite gyftes iewelles encrease much largely grow forewarde knowledge god father sonne lord iesu christ acknowledginge whome eternall lyfe chiefe poynte saluacion acknowledge autor saluacion chalenge parte therof owne desertes strengthes prescripcions moses lawe inasmuche whatsoeuer perteyninge true lyfe whatsoeuer belongeth vnto true godlynes diuine power hath bestowed vnto v without helpe circumcision onely faithe wherby acknowlage god father whome procede thinges iesus christ whome onely haue al thinges geuen vnto v thinges geuen throughe merites free bounteouse gyfte whiche owne accorde hathe called v vnto benefite saluacion voyde glory vertue hath bestowed bothe owne glorye vertue thintent wheras addicte vnto owne vicious naughtines lyke fylthye vyle slaues scrued ydoles shoulde engraffed vnto christe made bothe pure glorious hauing wickednes taken waye wherin fylthily soyled hathe translated vyle naughtines vpon himselfe mighte choose v owne free pleasure ye felowship glory trespass hath taken vpon himselfe might enioye innocencye nowe great matter farre greater muche excellencie promissed v tyme come lawe moses haue often sayed thacknowlageing iesu christ promysed forsoothe albeit perteyne kynredde iewes yet maye made wt companion diuine nature beyng chosen nomber child god possesse thenheritaunce immortal lyfe set study vpon certaine immortalitie vncorrupte conuersacion meane season worlde flee al corrupcion vice naughtie lustes wherwith mynde infected tedeth euerlastinge deathe texte p herunto geue diligence faithe minister vertue vertue knowledge knowledge temperaunce temperaunce pacience pacience godlynesse godlynesse brotherly kyndnesse brotherly kyndnesse loue yf thinges amonge plenteous wyll make ye nether shalbe ydle vnfrutefull knowledge lorde iesus christ lacketh thinges blynde gropeth waye hande hath forgotten pourged olde synnes god hathe geuen innocencye frely inoughe mainteine applyeng withall studious diligence endeuour selues made riche well doinges faithe ydle accompanyed good behauiour nothing doone sayed whiche vertuous let good behauiour entreteyne knowlage maye onely folowe thinges vpright also discerne thinge place amonge whome sorte meanes ought worthilye done let knowledge accompanied temperaunce mynde beynge vnmoueably strong wanton enticementes worlde maye constantlye without shrinkynge folowe thing hathe iudged best vnto temperaunce let pacience ioyned whan doe wel maye chearefully suffer sorowes men flateringe pleasure worlde doe bringe fine fingred nicenes somtymes broken impacient suffring sorowes pacience let godlynes present soeuer doe suffre referre glorye god let godlynes accompanied brotherly charitie like loue god himselfe euen sake maye loue professe god let brotherly charitie augmented vpheaped loue studye doe good men onely godly christian folkes also wicked frutes euangelicall faithe whiche yf haue aboundauntlye shall brynge passe haue acknowledged lorde iesus christ throughe faithe vnprofytable vnfrutefull vnto althoughe haue nothing doe circumcision thinges consisteth whole summe christen godlynes yf want hath professed christ vaine forasmuche slydeth backe light gospell olde former darkenes euen blynde man groapeth waye hande caried aboute hereawaye therawaye throughe ma worldly lustes neither seeth waye come felowship christ beynge vnthankefull also benefite christ whome frely clensed olde transgression yet man forgetfull exceadynge mercye slydeth backe againe texte p wherfore brethre geue diligence make callynge eleccion sure good workes yf ye doe suche thinges ye shall neuer fall yea meanes entringe shalbe ministre vnto aboundantly euerlastinge kyngdome lord sauiour iesus christ wherfore wil negligent put alwayes remembraunce suche thinges thoughe ye knowe selues stablished present trueth notwithstandynge thinke mete longe tabernacle stere vp putting remembraunce asmuche sure shortly must put tabernacle euen lorde iesus christ shewed wyll euer also geue diligence ye maye haue wherwith stere vp remembraunce thinges departinge therfore brother let make lyue securitie careles goodnes god hathe whan deserued nothing called vnto profession gospell hauynge pardoned synnes former lyfe endeuour selues muche goodnes god wherwith hath called wherwith hath chosen n turned destruccion heape damnacion case beyng forgetful bounteous gentilues tombled backe state whence raunsomed owne death procure rather well doinges god seine haue called chosen vaine parte mater lyeth euen yf consyder whence god hathe called thinges hath called rewardes hathe set forthe yf wyll preace therunto meanes whiche haue declared lytell shall neuer slyppe right course godlynes yf preace waye goddes assistinge helpe shalbe plenteouslye present shal succour riche relyefe length beynge conquerours worlde maye atteyne euerlastinge kyngdome lorde sauiour iesu christ possesse treasure heauen whose sake haue set naught treasure earthe rewarde exceadynge great must procured exceadynge greate diligence wherfore wyl neuer cease geue warnynge mater althoughe suppose necessarie seynge doe remembre ought doe also confirmed nowe longe processe godlynes acquainted knowledge trueth great whiche hauynge embraced constantlye folowe yet hitherto notwithstandyng thintent maye watche styll haue begonne recken parte remembringe lordes precepte whiche commaunded beynge conuerted selfe shoulde confirme brother longe lyue among beyng straunger vpon earthe tabernacle sely body stere vp pricke forewarde studye godlynes dede muche knowe shall shortly stripped dwellynge sely bodye chaunge exile earthe fraunchised free citie heauen lorde iesus christ signified vnto whome serue yet hitherto souldier tabernacle nowe therfore shall geue dilygence matter maye meane space surely fixed youre harte often admonicion maye remembre deathe whan warne worde mouthe seyng thinge certaine haue receyued v behoueth swarue texte p haue folowed deccatfull fable opened vnto power commynge lorde iesus christ eye sawe maiestie euen verely receaued god father honour glory came suche voyce excellent glorye deare beloued sonne whome haue delyte voyce hearde come heaue holy mount haue also right sure worde prophecie wherunto yf ye take hede vnto light shyneth darcke place ye well vntil daye dawne day starre aryse heartes ye first knowe prophecye scripture hath priuace enterpretacion scripture came neuer wyll man holy men god speake moued holy ghost doctrine suche gayre philosopher teache whose drifte perswade crafulye conueyed fable humayne subtilties thing selues vnderstande dysagree also amonge selues haue wyse folowed wayes openynge vnto power comminge lorde iesu christ preachinge vnto maiestie whiche haue sene iyes vouchedsafe exhibite vnto certaine owne afore death special token mightie power glorye shall come iudge quicke dead wonderfull felicitie shal geue vnto loue stedfastlye god father endued wholy glorye honour insomuche countenaunce shoone bright sunne clothes white snowe farre mannes iyes coulde abyde beholde heauenly syght came also exceadynge honourable testimonie father voyce whiche brought downe highe vnto glorious maiestie father sorte welbeloued sonne whiche hathe delyghted mynde heare coulde haue ben witnesse geuen eyther fully excellent pronounced prophet father owne maiestie thinges haue sene iyes haue hearde eares whan present holy mount thabor prophetes playne oracle great weightie estimacion among prophecied figuratyue darke shadowes christ much grauitie ought euident declaracion father himselfe sonne prophetes agree father voice yf man doe rightly interprete promisses prepare mennes myndes trueth gospell shadowe couertly poynt thing gospell doeth openly preache therfore doe disallowe iewes beyng vehementlye geuen prophetes prophecienges seke commynge messias steppe somewhat vnto faythe gospel beleue christ shoulde come man shall soner beleue christe come yf parswaded shoulde come therfore good hope beynge yet lightened lyght gospell attentiue vnto prophetes candell appearinge darcke place better haue lyght light tyll sunne come daye dawne dryue awaye darkenes obscure euen candell daye sterre gospell preachinge maye shyne bryght harte whiche declareth sonne hande sayinges prophetes vse profytable yf reade consider scripture prophecyinge hande darkly hydden vnder couerte figure vnderstaden without interpretacio yt euery mannes interpretaccion euery mannes arbitrement prophetes whiche spake thinges hande speake owne braine deuyse owne mynde holy men pure al humaine lustes holy gost inspired harte vsing instrumetes signified mynde vnto v accordingly thing men set forth mannes deuyse may perceaued mannes wytte thing ye set forthe inspiracion holy gost requireth interpretoure inspired lyke spirite applye thing whiche spoken christe vnto worldlye king drawe thing spoken lyfe heauen vnto felicitie worlde interprete thing spoken treasure mynde commodity worlde doe farre swerue misticall meanyng prophecy nether easely perswaded christ come false interpretacion prophecie imagine selues certaine earthlye messias suche one shewed selfe cause acknowledge varieth spirituall ymage prophecye differeth ymagined ydole faslye feyned interpretacion p ii chapter texte p false prophetes also amonge people euen shalbe false teacher amonge whiche preuely shall brynge damnable sectes euen denyinge lorde hathe bought bryng vpon selues swyfte damnacion many shal folowe damnable wayes whome waye trueth shalbe euyll spoken thorowe couetousnes shall fained wordes make marchaundyse whose iudgement farre damnacion slepeth whosoeuer prophecieth thaffeccion owne mynde falsely named prophete whosoeuer interpreteth prophetes sayinge vnto owne couetous appetite false interpretoure tymes past false prophetes euen amonge iewes whiche eyther pyke thanke prince hande elles vauntage sake hatred prophecied thinge whiche spirite god spake assemblyes imagined selues countrefaicting behauiour thoughe ben true prophetes deceaued folyshe people repyned true prophetes lyinges deccasse also shall aryse suche shall falsely boaste selues teacher gospell shall nothinge elles maisters falseheade shall swarue doctrine gospell bringe mennes gloses stede trueth bringeth saluacio shall cloute pernicious sectes owne gayne partaine rather owne glorye owne tyrannye vnto christes afaires shall goe styll great madnesse shall afrayed vnkyndlye denye euen lorde iesus whose bloude redemed whose name professed shall wicked heathen whiche neuer professed christ whiche dooinges shall prouoke vengeaunce god vpon selues shall onely nothinge auayle professed christ shall also pull vpon selues spedy destruccion god taking vengeaunce vpon howbeit small matter yf none lost onely already loste shall also drawe many destruccion false doctrine teacher shall fynde disciple owne bearinge selues boldely vpon shall afrayed rayle vpon gospelles trueth whiche haue receaued v nether shall purely handle worde gospel see maketh nothinge auayleably gredynes beyng bent vnto owne priuate lucre shall begyle simple playnesse feyned communicacion going wynne vnto christe plucke selues greatest gayne see gospel doctrine smally pleasaunt vnto whiche cralled delyces worlde see nyce delycate matter doe wee doe defede synceritie gospelles doctrine constauntly wicked deathes therfore shall defyle true doctrine christ stede shall teache thinges pleasaunt grosse hearer rather holsome thinges purchase theim substaunce renoume worlde god shall couet rather glorye pleasure shal last purchase euerlastinge destruccion bothe selues others throughe shorte tormentes body thrust vnto felicitie neuer shal die beware folow guide excepte wyll goe streight waye destruccion nether let deceaue alofte hyghe estate worlde riche lyue owne ease shall long haue fruicion continuaunce false felicitie lyke godly shal atteyne rewardes god hath alreadye decreed long agoe euen mennes peyne maketh spedy hast vnto nether doeth destruccion slepe shall sodainlye oppresse careles lyue securitie maye deceaue mennes iudgementes beguyle god howsoeuer men ouer whome haue autoritie doe forgeue god afrayed man myght wyll forgeue texte p yf god spared aungels synned cast downe hell delyuered chaynes darcknes punished kept vnto iudgement nether spared olde worlde saued noe eight preacher rightewysnes brought floude vpon worlde vngodly turned city zodom gomor asshes ouerthrew damned made ensample vnto shoulde lyue vngodlye iust lot vexed vnclenly conuersacion wicked delyuered beynge righteous dwelling among seyng hearing vexed righteous soule daye daye vnlawfull dedes lorde knoweth howe delyuer godly temptacion reserue vniuste vnto daye iudgement punyshed che walke flesshe lust vnclennes despyse auctoritie presumpteous stubborne whiche feare speake euyll excell worshippe angel whiche greater bothe power might receaue lorde taylynge iudgement selues brute beastes naturally brought forthe take destroyed speake euyll thinges vnderstande shall pearisshe awne destruccion receaue rewarde vnrightewysnes shoulde spare nowe seyng tymes past spared non angel whiche offended threw downe headlong heauen bounde cheines theuerlastynge darke night caste prison hell reserued ende hauyng sentence damnacion last iudgement may comitted eternal tormetes euermore wyll suffer pryde vnpunyshed men whiche suffred angelles shall thing vnpunyshed doe light gospell manifestlye opened vnto many bounteous benefites frely geuen vnto spared olde world beyng tude without knowledge beyng greued mennes viciousnes whan world vniuersally spotted wicked maners brought floude vpon dispatched al mankynde sauynge noe beyng eyght parson wyll haue saued mightte great multitude mortal men residue hauinge contemned gentle suffraunce god onely makynge arke testified drad vengeaunce almightye wyl punyshe people dayes powryng downe showre brimstone brought many city florisshinge countrey sodome somore asshes marred vtterly remaineth nothing horrible pestilent stinkynge rice testimonye payne abydeth whiche lyke wickednes prouoke wrath god vpon selues lyke vnto owne wickednes owne destruccion euen innocencie lot turned saluacion vnto whome whan abominable felowes intended violence would abhominable rageing lustes oppresse chaste godly man god pulled companye wicked among whome greuous payne lyue asmuche pure chaste bothe eye eares greuous torment godly disposed mynde hea e daily see daily thinges abhorred withall whole hearte sufficiently declared god neuer suffreth man lose rewarde innocencie neither man wickednes vnpunisshed although gentlye beare wt season might repent yea though suffre owne sometime tepted yet wha tyme dlyuer godly sorowes contrarye wyse reserue vngodly daye last iudgement punished eternall tormentes euermore kynde vnrighteousnes shalbe suffred vnpunished shall specially suffre paynes whiche distrustinge promise gospell folowe worlde whiche delectable body seruynge fylthy outragious lustes wherwith defyle whole lyfe euery syde may wicked double wickednes violence contemne set publyke autoritie beyng knacke hardye shameles ashamed tayle vpon suche men dignitie thinges wretched men hardye doe angelles beyng farre excellent power strength althoughe otherwyse wicked yet proceded muche shameles hardynes abyde speake euyll god matter neglected wyll god yet point afrayed offende yelded vnto thautoritie god men beyng vngracions wicked spirites like brute beastes borne thys ende maye bee catched destroyed forasmuche afrayed backbyte mysteporte theyr superiours knowing meane whose sake speake euyll like theyr corrupte condicious procure destruccion selues euen shall peryshe like beastes receyue worthy rewarde theyr wicked life orsomuche reken swete ioyly gaye life cast shame quite away geue selues open daylyght vnto myrthe ryot filthye voluptuous lustes yet haue shame remaynyng doo thynges night texte count pleasure lyue delyeyousty season spottes fylthynesse lyue pleasure theyr deceyuable wayes feastyng scornyng hauing eye ful aduoutry cannot cease synne begylyng vnstable soules deattes haue exercised robbery cursed child haue forsaken ryght waye gone astraye folowyng waye balaam sonne bosor whiche loued rewarde vnryghtewesnesse rebuked hys iniquitye ame dumme beast speaking man voyce forbad madnesse prophete would beleue menne rather filthe spottes filthie glotonous bankettinges wherin wretchedly deceaued thei repose hole sume felicitie vaunt though madde menne bycause haue fruicion commodity thys present life meane tyme riot prouoketh outragious luste whan wyne dronken haue beastly lusting eies nether haue mynde thing elles vpon whoremonging kyndes wikednes whan haue cast awaye reason whan haue ben dronken wyne ceasse naughty skyppe wikednes wikednes muche ynough lyue vngraciously selues except intangle allure men myndes yet cofirmed vertue vnto theyr filthynes perchaunce tolerable offended nothyng riot lecherous lust kynde vice haue like filthyly make away haue euen filthyly doo prouyde make prodigally awaye hauyng mynde wytte practised vnto couetousnes vnto deceate vnto taume euery thing euer auauntage sake lucte curse good godly corrupte money swa ue right waye poynt resemble theyr father balaam sonne bosor whan knewe best yet corrupt wicked see went curse god mercifull vnto couetousnes brought great blyndnes rebuked asse madde doting cast man mynde brute beast speaking man voyce restrayned prophetes madnes seing wt het bodyly eies saw wt eies mynde bicause strik blynd coueiousnes money texte welles without water cloudes caried tempest myst darckenes reserued euer haue spoken greate swellynge wordes vanyty entyse thorowe lustes volupteousnes fleshe cleane escaped euen lyue errour promes libertie themselues bonde seruauntes corrupcion man ouercome vnto brought bondage yf haue escaped fro fylthines world thorow knowledge lord sauiour iesus christe yet tangled agayn therin ouercome latter ende worsse wt beginning bene better haue knowen way rightewesnes haue knowen turne fro holy comaundement geuen vnto hapened vnto vsed spoken true pro erbe dogge turned domet agayn ow washed turned agayn waloing mier promyse certayn wonderfull news doctrine bryng nothyng worthy profession gospel like welles lacke water whereunto manne come athurst fynde nothing mudde claye like vnto mysly clowdes dryuen hither th ther storme wyndes seme would geue rayne vnto thrustye grounde much one droppe holsome doctrine falleth promyse lyght gospelles doctrine wrappe folkes darkenes errours euerlastyng darkenesse abydeth hell whan lyeng woordes speake certayn great hygh matter hope entice snare whiche begynne amende theyr condicions deceaue wrappe delites flesh voluptuous pleasure life promysing wil delyuer fro errour wha selues occupied greatest errours al promysing men deliueraunce synnes whan selues bonde slaues filthynes whosoeuer ouercome whose appoyntement lyueth bonde seruaunt called right auayleth nothyng haue ben frely delyuered fro bondage synnes fall state agayn accorde bondage much vile muche wretched bicause procured without costraynt tasting libertie done amysse gospell preached great parte long errour long ignoraunce whiche hauing acknowlaged preachyng gospell oure lorde sauiour iesu christe haue baptisme renounced filthynes world professed pure heauenly life ouercome agayn lustes wrapped theyr olde vncleanesse theyr baptisme doeth nothing helpe al also worse state knewe christe offence lesse synneth ignoraunce shalbee greuously damned whiche haue enlarged cryme wikednes vice vnthankefulnes therfore ben better haue knowen gospelles doctrine al whiche teacheth innocencye purenes knewe receyued swarue holy commaundement deliuered vnto thing befallen truly vsed bee spoken commune prouerbe dogge losseth vp agayn hath caste vp washen sowe turneth agayn walowe selfe myre lost labour dogge haue purged stomake vomite take agayn cast vp sowe hath washed awaye fowle stynking myre cleane water vayne washen returne soylinges gone iii chapter texte p seconde epistle wryte vnto beately beloued wherwith stete vp sincere mynde puttyng remembraunce ye maye myndfull wordes tolde holy prophetes also commaudement v whiche apostle lorde sauiour thys fyrst vnderstande shall come laste dayes mocker dysceatefulnes wyll walke theyr owne iustes saye promes comming sence father yed thinges continue estate wherin beginnyng thys knowe wylfully heauens greate whyle ago erth oure water appeared vp thorowe water worde god whiche thynges worlde peryshed beyng ouer runne water heauens erth kept hys worde store reserued vnto fyre agaynst daye iudgement perdicyon vngodly men dearely beloued matter beate many wordes vnto euen myne letter warne self thing doubt vprightnesse mynde may haue remembraunce thinge know hold harty chearefulnes constaunt stedfastnes shall e lesse peril hurting vngracious doctrine remebre spoken holy prophetes tymes paste whiche gaue warnyng beware kynde men remembre gaue precept whiche apostle lorde sauiour iesu christ forhad nomanne geue eare stede gospelles truth bring pernicious doctrine therfore knowe fyrst shall come hereafter preacher mocker connyngly furnyshed sleightes subtill deceates beguyle ignoraunt withall whiche shall folowe thynges christe taught v like life shall lustes owne hart shall teache owne appetite thinges shalbe fitte suche maner life inasmuche theyr life filthy shall desyrous lordes commyng cause sake shall perswade bothe selues others shal come agayn saye promysed resurreccion iudgement sondrye sortes rewardes according desertes lyuing whan cometh loked day day vayne shal thinke surely shall neuer come bycause hys commyng put tyme token saye resurreccion father dead one neuer one hathe risen agayn life yet hytherto like sence creacion worlde thinges engendred enterchaungable course dyeng lyuing euen vnto thys tyme remayneth course nature mutacion worlde hathe ben may gather shalbe newnes hereafter like mutacion chaunced tyme loked lyued theyr owne fylthy lustes euen shall nouacion happen whether beleue beleue thys thyng ware suppose rather dissemble knowe heauens created long goe also earthe water wherwith couered made bare great power water also hanging alofte whan mankynde almoste altogether defiled vice god offended sent flood destroyed world tyme reseruing eight person folowed innocecy vniuersall iudgement god exercised tyme pourgeing renewing earth water heauens contynue yet still created reserued fyre whiche shall also purged daye iudgement whan wicked shalbe destroyed fyre like time paste perished water forasmuche thing moste certayn daye shall come maketh matter whether come later sooner standeth v hande prouide euer co meth fynde v vnready conceytes thinke thinges leng thinges shorte vnto god nothing neyther shorte long promisses foloweth appetite v owne eternall vnchaungeable decreed counsail vnto whome nothyng er paste come al thinges present vnto v euer h h promised exhibeteth tune hath appointed hande self elles wt al one whether one day past thousand yeares faithful assurednes doeth performe thing whiche performeth later doeth thyng doeth spedilyer concernyng selfe hathe performed euen nowe thing hathe purposed performe dooeth chaunge purpose maner delayer prorogue put promyse falsly iudge measuring god condicions prescribeth space longer somtymes sake vpon tendre mercye gentilnes woulde haue none perysh desitous haue men repent whiche peryshe haue cause fynde fault wanted space chaunge life better daye shall come vnloked shall come creping vpon men none otherwise thefe night cometh vpon sleape daye shall greate violence fyre heauens shall passe mightie greate force kinde elementes whervpon lower world consisteth shalbe dissolued heate fynally earthe thinges therin conteyned shalbee butned fyre whole nature thinges shalbee cleane purged bee necessitie thinges shalbe pure thinges shall also dissolued whiche offende howe muche standeth v hande diligently endeuour daye maye fynde v throughly purged vpright holynes life studious affayres godlynes meane season muste bee muche spedynes forecaste alwaye readynes whan euer daye shall come whose straight iudgement manne shalbee hable escape whiche shall suffre thyng impure muche heauens must dissolued fyre elementes constrayned melt heate loke accordyng hys promisse new heauens newe earthe haue corrupcion fault whome shalbe corrupt mynde maye haue fruicion vncorrupt texte p dearly beloued ignoraunt one thing howe one daye lorde thousande yeare thousande yeare one daye lorde hath promised slacke men count slacknes pacient v warde asmuch would haue man lost wyll receaue men repentaunce neuertheles day lorde wyll come thefe night whiche daye heauens shall passe awaye maner tempeste elementes shall melte heate carthe also worckes therin shall burne seyng thinges shall perysshe maner person ought ye holy conuersacion godlynes lokyng vasting vnto commynge daye god whome heauens shal perisshe fyre elementes shall melt heare neuertheles accordynge promes loke newe heauen new earth wherin dwelleth rightewesnes wherfore dearly beloued seyng ye loke suche thinges diligent ye maye foude peace without spotte vndefyled suppose longe sufferynge lorde faluacion euen dearely beloued brother paule also accordinge wysedome geuen vnto hath wrytten vnto yea almoost euery epistle speaking suche thinges amonge whiche many thinges harde vnderstande whiche vniearned vnstable peruert also scripture vnto owne destruccion ye therfore beloued seyng ye warned afore hande beware lost ye men also plucked awaye thorowe erroure wycked fal owne stedfastnes growe grace knowledge lorde sauiour iesus christ whome glory bothe nowe euer amen wherfore dearely beloued brother haue fearfull iudgemet alwayes eye geue dilygence whan lorde commeth maye fynde pure vnblameable onely menne whose iudgemetes many tymes deceaued also hi pure dede pure iudgement god althoughe paraduenture long ere daye come construe thoughe woulde come consydre tender sufferaunce lorde wherwith geueth men space repent doeth care mennes saluacion whiche matter mooste deare brother folowe office paule wrote vnto muche habundantly god gaue plenteous gyfte wysedome almost epistle exhorteth loke daye sometyme speakinge suche sorte though daye lorde already hande might rather prycke forwarde studye godlynes daye vncertaine oughte loked thoughe woulde come daye yet suche wyse man prescribe tyme certaine matter paule according high wisedom myngled epistle wheras spake rightly coulde yet ignoraunt inconstaunt person wrest peruerse interpretacion doe scripture owne destruccion thing whiche healthe vnto good maye turned throughe owne faulte venome vnto therfore brother sence many way warned hande bothe paule take hede deceyued fraude abominable men fall awaye substaunciall stedfastnes whiche haue expressed yet hitherto rather geue diligence maye continually encrease goe forewarde giftes knowledge lorde sauiour iesu christe vnto whome glorye bothe lyfe euer worlde without ende amen thus endeth paraphrase vpon seconde epistle thapostle peter lyfe sainct ivde saincte hierome ivdas brother iames lefte behynde litell epistle whiche seuen catholike epistle taketh witnesse boke enoch apocryphe say without autoritie reiecte many howbeit hathe ben taken worthye autoritie bothe aunciencie vse accompted among holy scripture argvment vpon epistle iude erasmus roterodame vehemently displeased many wordes agaynst blynded theyr owne couetous appetite aduersaries gospell whiche thyng notwithstanding ought seme newe matter inasmuch predestinate ende spoken apostle kynde men shall lutkingly crepe among flocke christyanes agaynste sorte armeth may forecast bothe restrayne eyther blamyng saue warnyng geuyng thing possiblye doo yet prepare selues readyly agaynst commyng christ thus endeth argument paraphrase erasmus vpon epistle sainct iude thapostle texte p iudas seruaunt iesus chryste brother iames called sanctified god father preserued iesu christe mercy vnto peace loue multiplied beloued gaue diligence wryte vnto commen saluacyon nedefull write vnto exhorte ye continually laboure faith whiche geuen vnto saynetes certayn vngodly men craftely crept whiche written afore tyme vnto suche iudgement turne grace god vnto wantonues deuye god whiche onely lorde oure lorde iesus christe mynde therfore put remembraunce muche ye knowe thys lorde deiyuered people egypte destroyed afterward beleued angel also kepte theyr first estate lefte toeyr owne habitacion hath reserued euerlastynge chaynes vnder darckenes vnto iudgement greate daye euen sodome gomor cyties aboute lyke maner defiled selues fornycacion folowed straunge sleshe set forthe ensample suffre payne eternall fyer lykewise beynge disceaues dreames defyle flesh despyse rulars speake euill auctorytie yet michael archangell stroue agaynst deuyll disputed abou e body moses burst geue raylynge sentence sayde lorde rebuke speake euyll thynges knowe thinges knowe naturally beastes without reason thinges corrupte selues wo bee vnto haue folowed waye cayn vtterly geuen errour balam lukers sake perisshe treason chore spottes whiche youre kyndnes feaste together without feare fedynge selues cloudes without water caryed wyndes tree withoute frute gatherynge tyme twyse deed plucked vp rote ragynge waues sea fomynge theyr owne shame wandring stertes whome reserued myst darckenes euer enoch seuenth adam prophecyed suche saying beholde lorde shall come thousandes saynctes geue iudgement agaynst menne rebuke vngodly among theyr vngodly dedes whiche haue vngodly commytted cruell speakynges whiche vngodly sinner haue spoken agaynct hym mutmuters complayners walking theyr owne lustes whose mouthes speake proud thynges haue men greate teuerence auauntage ye beloued remembre wordes whiche spoken apostle lorde iesus christ howe tolde begylers laste tyme whiche shoulde walke theyr vngodly lustes maker sectes fleshly hauinge spirite ye dearely beloued editie selues moste holy faythe prayinge holy ghoste kepe selues loue god lokynge mercy lord iesus christ vnto eternall lyfe haue compassion seperatyng saue feare pullyng fyre haue compassion hare fylthy vesture slesh vnto hym able kepe fte synne presente fautles presence hys glory ioye commyng oure lorde iesu christe god oure sauiour thorow iesus christe lorde onely wyse glory maiestie domynion power worldes nowe euer amen iudas thadeus seruaunt iesu christe brother iames write epistle iewes onely newly conuerted men commune whome render mercye god father hathe owne free sanctified hathe also without helpe lawe made godly vngodly idolatours obedient folowers true religion also bounteous goodnes god preserued iesu christ ende shoulde auaunt dongeon euerlasting damnacion like manner free liberall goodnes hathe nowe called vnto saluacion gospell ther nothing wishe vnto fortunate goodnes god would alwayes multiplie giftes mercie peace charitie mercie may absent selues dayly vice former olde life peace may godlynes life nourish concorde haue god charitie may mutuall concorde one mynde andthe charitie gospel maketh one glad others good sory others hurt though self al worldly su eche one bounteously good dearely beloued forasmuche loue gospell maketh thinges commune whether bee good chaunce whether badde namely matter perteyne eternall saluacion great defier write vnto concernyng saluacion wherof lesse carefull myne owne forsomuch brotherly loue pricketh forwarde therunto could forbeare must exhorte epistle stande harde false aposties defence sincere faythe whiche deliuered holye apostle onely labour contynue stedfaste youre faythe also laye youre helping handes vnto bee begyled deceauours possible thinke iewell treasour faythe standeth v hande watche muche warely aboutstaunce thinune hant icall anabaptistes wikedly dreame v turned awaye v deliuered gospelles docttyne vnto purely syncerely euen receyued christe yet haue sorte wiked one thruste selues among meane season vnder pretense religion like woolues haue crepte lordes shepefold settyng selues shewe godlynes dede enemyes true godlines thys gayre disturbe youre myndes though newe matter thus decreed long goe secret counsail god thus spoken shoulde ryse men theyr wiked myschieuousnes shoulde bothe exercise youre godlynes pull condemnacion vpon selues turne free liberall gifte god wherewith hathe frely pardoned v synnes set v free liberty sharpenes lawe occa io wantones ought rather prouoked beneficyall goodnes bothe maynteyne furnyshe innocencie frely geuen godly studious endeuours enflamed charitie gospel good wyll workes ryghteousnes plentiously exactely moses lawe appoynted beefore nowe men abuse libertye geuen vnto filthynes licenciousnes synne fall theyr owne accord backe agayne theyr olde bonde seruitude iesus christ redemed owne bloud denye god professed onely lord maister thinges heauen earthe denye also lorde iesus christ hathe made v free selfe price owne sacred bloude auaileth v nothing bee redemed onles contynue stedfaste thende thinges wherunto called thinke necessary teache seing forgette nothing put remembraunce lest thing knowe slyppe mynde auailed hebrues tymes past nothyng figure tymes nowe iesus trained hard miserable bondage egipcians reade sea libertie euen whome mercifully presetued whan cryed vnto destroyed agayn worse sorte whan distrusted murmured againste god deserte bondage egipte vnto bondage synnes vnto v whiche pharao straight intolerable lorde vnto deuil thesame vnto v vnder whose tyranny owne synnes sake intangled puttyng theyr truste god escaped safely myddes water libertye beleuing gospell haue baptisme escaped satan enterest like made spede one fayth lande promise vnto goodnes god onely vnauaylable also turned heape theyr damnacion euen vnto v auayleth nothyng haue set aparte synnes onles also growe forwarde constaunt myndes better better preace enheritaunce life heauen moreouer would haue remembre also profited euen aungelles selues created companion godhead assone chaunged moste fortunate nature theyr owne wickednes persisted still condicion threwe downe headlong heauen hauyng depryued light heauen damned euerlasting darkenes hel reserued cheynes loced vnto day last iudgement wherin beyng condemned shall commaunded euerlastyng paynes nowe sodome gomorre residue city therunto adioynyng florished pleynteous wealthe thynges abused liberall bounteousnes god vnto riot outragious luste defilyng selues wiked abominable sortes filthines dispatched wrath god consumed fyre heauen thintente myght bee example vnto abuse benefites christ vnto filthynes life shall escape like peyne synne like sorte doe sinne like sorte deluded slouening dreames false pleasure doe defile theyr owne body also set naught theyr ruler autorytie afrayed rayle agaynst vnto thautoryties sake ought reuerece michael tharchangel whan disputacio deuil cocerning body moses yet afrayed opely speake raylingly deuill though moste filthye feende could abyde wicked talkyng moderately tempred curse wyse lorde quod rebuke thee michael afrayed speake cursedly deuill howe muche intolerable thyng afrayed curse speake euyl men set autoritie dignitie ouer mennes peruersitie great haue cause yet speake euyl nayle agaynst thynges vnderstande parte sore cortupte ryot lecherous luste thynges wherin brute beastes quite without reason lyue well temperately meate drynke carnall copulacion matter behaue selues moste vnthriftyly woo bee vnto shall haue commune rewarde happen vpon whose wikednes folowe example set iesus christ eies take example cayn killed owne brother vnto whome myschieuous sore enuie perswaded fyrst al doe murther balaam corrupt lucre went curse people god blessed also chore hauyng stered conspiracie rose moses sworne conspirours horrible example quyte dispatched liue purely chastely embrace gospelike charitie spottes disgraceing company fast geue selues ryotous bankettinges one nether restrayned reuerence feare man lycencious filthynes without respecte rashly folowe thing pleaseth theyr appetite yet dedes professe selues teacher gospell guydes true vertue like vnto cloudes whiche hang loft woulde appeare disposed rayne vpon thyrsty grounde yet drye haue water succour grounde withall rashlye caryed awaye awaye theyr owne vayne lustes beyng lyke vnto tree whiche later ende corne hatuest fayre blossomed make lyeng hope fruite whan muste wyther onely together vnfrutefull also twyes dead neyther haue life selues vnto gospellyke godlynes drawe destruccion nether hope life tree plucked vp rote wherin hope shall spryng agayne inasmuche vnquiet geuen sectes alwayes maner newe vproare dysturbe quietnes congregacyon like vnto outragious waues sea rushe vp hye doe nothyng caste abroade theyr owne rebuke shame much lieth like vnto starres whiche whan pretende shewe light guydes waye yet inasmuch ther raungers folow constauntly whiche streighte led awaye theyr owne affectes hither thyther carye bee symple incircumspecte shipwrake maner startes set selues false feyned light world men shal escape iudgement god although doe nowe presently punysh reserueth eternall darkenes hell men albeit risen vp tymes yet leste thinke new thyng chaunced vnto enoch seuenth adam prophecyed long agoe tormentes must tyme commyng suffre speaketh wise beholde lorde commeth innumerable multitude saynctes practice iudgement agaynste reproue wiked theyr dedes whiche haue wikedly doone thinges haue stubbernely fearcely spoken agaynst naughty synfull lyuers also wiked contumelious persones agaynste god dede seing measure felicitie life pleasure body beare impaciently fortune haue affliccion discommoditie nether afrayed murmure agaynste god theyr querilinges made manne suche sorte shorte life endaungered disease wishing life moste exceadingly long daungier displeasure haue truste lyfe come yet perceaue filthye vile matter theyr myndes yet theyr mouth boasteth certayn greate high matter professeth certayn wonderfull learned loue wisedome onely serue voluptuousnes vilest may also handmaking gaynes whiche thinge dooeth moste princip lly defile doctrine christe speake thinges trueth gospel teacheth thinges pleasaunt acceptable hope get vauntage agaynst poore tyrannes towardes ryche clawbackes malice men shall lesse encombre dearly beloued ye remembre tolde hande tymes paste apostle lord iesu christe namely paule peter tolde v later tymes shoulde rise vp mocker shoulde defyle pure doctrine christe theyr wiked gredynes lyuing rule gospell theyr owne wiked abominable affectes manne maye knowe thys marke wheras lyue spirite christe hauyng contemned earthy thinges set theyr studie vpon heauenly thynges agree one quiet concorde stiere vp dissencions bee worldelinges geuyng selues seruice worldly affectes voyde spirite hunt voluptuous pleasure seke reigne aloft scrape lucre set theyr myndes vpon matter fitte christen concorde rather disturbe tranquilitie flocke bee brought ordre deare brother spirituall see geue diligence maye lyuing stone heaped together buylding god cleauing fast sure foundacion moste holy sacred faithe perswaded godly shoulde want theyr rewardes sore euer afflycted life require rewarde therfore worlde wiked faile theyr deserued tormentes couet reuenge selues therfore make earnest cry ng helpe god continually pure spirituall prayer preserue euery one mutuall concorde mutuall charitie god heareth none one harte nether put distrust turmoyled sondry wayes worlde christes sake loke mercie god exhibited life lyfe neuer shall ende meane season hauyng consideracion persones geue diligence saue al men gently frendely calling agayn vnto better purpose saue feare catched fire hate carcas defiled yearthy affectes wherwith man mynde burthened defiled cote soyled filthe conuenient amende men faultes much gentlie man conuersaunt sely body chose bee vncleane power man leste manne boastingly chalenge prayse selfe glorye might empire power bee onely vnto god sauiour iesus christ lord onely world worldes age come euer euer dede none god alone hable geue thys vnto labour although enuironed sely frayle body world calleth euery side away fro purpose godlynes yet kepe selues innocent still ende onely fynd nothing maners fynde faulte also ordayned sight goddes maiestie displeased nothyng whiche seeth moste inwarde passage myndes whan shall come passe shall reioyce glad commyng lorde iesu christ whan shall make heauy cheare whiche seme meane space lyue swetly thys maye prayer ought bee made earnest desyres thus endeth paraphrase vpon iude argument erasmus vpon epistle sainct iames thapostle iames forasmuche bishop hierusalem writeth also residue iewes wer scattred abroade dwelt throughout al nacions enformyng instructing sondry preceptes howe ordre lyues paraphrase erasmus vpon canonicall epistle iames fyrste chapter texte p iames seruaunt god lord iesus christe sendeth gretinge xii trybes whiche scatered abroade brother count yt exceadynge oye ye fall diuers remptacions knowyng thys trying faithe gendreth pacience let pacience haue parfecte worke ye maye parfect sounde lackynge nothynge eny lacke wysoome let aske hym geueth euen god geueth men indifferently casteth man teeth shalbe geuen let hym aske fayth wauer douteth lyke waue sea whiche tost wyndes caryed vyolence nether let manne thynke shall receaue eny thynge lord wauerynge mynded man vnstable wayes let brother whiche lowe degre reioyce whan eralted agayne let hym ryche reioyce whan made lowe euen flower grasse shal passe away sunne ryseth heat grasse widdereth flower falleth awaye beaw fassion perysheth euen shall ryche manne peryshe hys wayes happy manne eudureth temptacion tryed shall receaue crowne lyfe whiche lorde hathe promysed loue hym iames tymes paste worshipper moses lawe worshipper seruaut god father gospell set forthe requireth bee worshipped spirite sonne iesu christe lorde writeth epistle bothe reconed christes profession namely whoe storme persecucion raised death stephane scattred abroade one waye another kynreddes people iewes dryuen awaye theyr auncetours possession dryuen downe feloweship gospell cast theyr owne house caste congregacion christ wishing vnto true healthe health bodye worlde wisheth healthe christe geueth vnto euen myddle destruccions deathes forasmuche commune profession gospell forasmuche one baptisme maketh v brother seing amonge brother dede ought bee feloweship bothe matter gladnes sadnes sorowfull calamitie abyde woulde greue mynde exceadingly sore assured confidence youre godlynes ignoraunt vnto whtch measure felicity pleasure life banyshment paynfully greuous deathe serueth wretchedest thing may man plucked moste deare frendes driuen olde auncient possession straungers forayn countryes whiche haue reposed wholy blessednes christe loke felicitie thys worlde worlde come behoueth bee moste farre iudgement god sendeth thinges vpon displeasure vpon hys exceading moste pitie purpose doubtles temporall affliccions whiche suffre vndeseruedly pacience myght bothe become notable youre rewarde abundaunte thyntent ofte tossed euery syde sondry stormes sorowes shoulde vnderstande ought caste downe harte though god forsaken rather ought youre harte reioyce euident token god loueth cateth tryeth youre pacience whiche contynue stedfast geue place assaultes sorowes shall doubtles euidently appeare bee sure grounded foundacion gospellike faithe excepte vtterly perswaded reward immortalitie ordayned worlde afflicted glory christes sake would willingly mery chearefull stomakes suffre much sorowes seing god woulde haue saluacion moste chiefly ascribed vnto faithe apperteyneth glory gospell men maye throughly perceaue sure argumentes faithfull truste commune tryflyng nether wauering faithe strong stedfaste inumctble faithe thinge counterfaicte vayne feble moued place whan storme sorowes cometh blustreing muste nedes true sure grounde nether ouercome beaten awaye banyshmente pouertie ne despitefull entreating ne pri oninges ne whippes nether yet deathe self counpted wouderful constancye uynde man paciently suffer vnlucky fortune vnbroken stomacke whan shall playnly perceaue suffer thinges selues bothe greuous bitter chearefull mery oycing harte ken shamefull entreating done vnto profession christes sake highest glorye counte losse goodes richeste wynnynge esteme greuous tormentes body pledge euerlastyng pleasure iudge death thing moste hortible al nothing elles threshold entrie immortalitie come shal vndoubtedly perceaue hope wher wt furnished contene matter comune hope nether proceding man perswatio confirmed inspi acio power god notwithstading like fayth yet throughly alowed onles expresse selfe godlines oflife good turnes towardes neighbour eue pacience shal haue throughly perfite praise onles like strong cheareful suffring sorowes euen costaunt self practising good workes great matter suffre sorowes wt good wil glory christe throughly perfit matter wha man euil done hi self good al deserue also hi yt euil shall come passe beig mebres shalbe coformably like vnto head disciple scholemaister childre vnto father case bee perfect vpright euery point nothing wanting perteyneth perfite absolute furniture godlynes gospell confesse lawe moses demauded also semeth folyshnes wise worlde new kynde philosophy hathe taught v newe wisedome whiche christe heauenly doctor hathe brought worlde philosophie man yet sufficiently cofirmed runne vnto philosopher world doctrine ouer muche tempred myngle mangle suffice accomplishe greate weightie matter aboue power mortall menne prescribed hathe nede celestiall helpe therfore ther heauenly rewarde ordayned measure theyr matter pleasure displeasure worlde bee tyme oppreste sorowes aske counsail men aske helpe men muste aske god helpe heauenly wisedome geueth vnto al iewes also gentile geueth accordyng hys owne lyberall bounteousnes plentifully casteth none teeth hys good turne requireth gramercye v nether nedeth mannes helpyng hande pharisee worde saye lorde doe aske faste twyse weke right godly man prayeth thus vnworthy thy bounteous goodnes worthy wrathe yet loke vpon thy seruant thou nature arte good mercifull therfore man mynded obteyne hym asketh let aske without destrusting without doubt wauering let considre weight affliccios let marke owne power let cosidre god moste best moste mightie whome dependeth putteth hys whole truste helpe god sure stedfast whosoeuer doubteth wauering lye loketh eche syde dependyng god loketh withall menes succour nether beleueth hys whole harte promisses god partly hauing distruste reasoneth selfe humaine argumentes fro concernyng dyuine matter stable waues sea tossed turned nowe hither nowe thyder wynde tyde caryeth euen caryed wi h humayne reason dyuerse sortes opinion become equalitie vnlyke hym self therfore one deceaued thinke shal obteyn thing god whan thinketh euil asketh helpe distrusting hym though ether would lytel good vnto could lytell elles litel true promise sure christian faithe single wauereth waye always beholdeth forsaketh none trusteth hym whether chaunce lyue dye manne whose mynde diuyded two wayes geuynge respecte god thys parte worlde parte euen grounde inconstaunt hys prayer thynges also goeth hauyng one thyng hys mouthe thing harte tyme serueth affected sorte nowe sorte behoueth man turne hys mynde fortune bloweth fro commune sorte men doeth rather le christian low degree pressed sondry lumpes sorowes stretch v harte reioice behalf despised world despised god beyng nothyng offended bassenes state fortune hathe made worthy feloweship saynctes nether excludeth enheruaunce kingdome heauen parte let riche man reioyce selfe thys behalfe muche set amonge worldlinges false goodes thys worlde nowe professing christe despised contemned pryde made hyghe stomaked reason hys vayne goodes nowe beyng caste downe men troden vnder fete rich true goodes god thys meanes shall come passe nether poore mannes lowe degree shall caste hym downe riche mannes prosperitie make hym insolent especially ether theyr partes consider bothe euilles wherewith pore pressed goodes wherin riche set pleasure longe continuaunce hastely vanyshe away none otherwyse flowres herbes whiche like calme south weste wynde thruste forth selues sodaynly dew spryng tyme euen blustrynge northe wynde heate sunne wyther awaye dye somuche flower sprang sunne rysinge delited mennes eies pleasaunte colour seene dye sunne setting tree inasmuch fast set vpo depe rote furnished sure grounded strength longe grene also euermore grene leaue theyr tayre greenesse neither vnreasonable wyndes rugged wynter herbe furnyshed thinges anon hote sunne broken destitute iuyce wherwith nourished fayrenes floure time wha faynteth stalkes doeth nether nourishe ne susteyne floure withereth ageth dyeth falleth away litell delited men eies greate fauour therfore christyan shoulde glorye thynges nether sure grounde longe enduring let rather respecte thinges eternall delectable sight god let rather studie bee braunche alwayes grene herbe lyght hurte dye doest thou see nowe flower sprongen fayre goodly pleasaunte colour swete gorgiousnes grene leaues glistring iuyce youthe hathe anone blaste southe winde heate sunne fading ageing dieng hathe floure sene spring come forewarde best age dye one daye like vnto riche men felicitie nowe ruffleth purple shyneth gold glistereth precious stone hathe great trayne wayting hym caried charet honoured certaine god among men fortune blowe backewarde shall ether bee wyped besydes al goodes banished goe begging lye crieng prison trussed vp tyburne typper fede rauens none thynges happen vnto yet death shall come vnthought vpon sodainly dispatche al galaunt araye parte heathen measure felicitye maner good ouer chei depend vpon fortune chaunce ouer thei nothing elles doeth forsake v whan departe hence thei bee set naught bring destruccion office christian folowe thinges wherby eternall goodes gotten vpon nether fortune nether age nether deathe hath enterest manne blessed riche shall surely blessed profession gospelles sake haue ben spoyled thynges possession yf haue defyed pleasure thys lyfe whiche abundaunce suffre tormentes emprisonmentes christes sake endure hys sake sorowes euen vnto death vnshrinkyng harte interpreting thys wise pressed sorowes thys worlde muche loued god whiche tryeth pacience obedient seruaunte hys owne glorye maye bothe bee example vnto de fie thys worlde hathe valeauntly behaued hym selfe conflicte hathe shewed lesson true vertue fayth maye weare palme crowne oken bowes laurell doe wither also suche sorte receyue hunt rewarde prayse menne crowne immortall lyfe whiche promysed man canne deceaue god selfe hath promysed haue muckred vp greatest substaunce rich haue excelled bodyly strength haue shedde moste bloude hys sake haue defied goodes thys worlde haue valeauntly suffred displeasure worlde texte let man saye tempted tempted god god cannot tempted euyll neyther hym self tempteth man euery man tempted drawne way entysed hys concupiscence lust hathe conceaued bryngeth forth synne synne whe fynyshed bryngeth forth death erre deare brother euery good gyfte euery parfecte gyfte aboue commeth downe father lyghtes whome variablenesse nether chaunged vnto darkenes hys owne begat v worde trueth shoulde fyrste trutes hys creature wherfore deare brother let euery man swyfte beare slowe speake slowe wrath wrathe man worketh whiche ryghteous god wherfore laye aparte al fylthynes superfluytie malicyousnes receaue mekenes worde graffed able saue youre soules whether man loue god purely pleasure worlde dooe trye muche doeth hurly burly affliccions v furnyshed helping ayde god maye nether become tendre nycelynges vayne pleasure ne moued terrible turmoylinges manne moued delices worlde right state mynde man led ye sorow affliccios true godlines hath nothing laie vnto goddes charge getteth victorie getteth victory helpe god ouercomme ouercome hys faulte god doeth geue menne occasyon
