synne thynge geueth according goodnes nouryshment encreace godlines mindes corrupte cralled affeccions turneth thoccasyon theyr owne destruccion god doeth somtymes geue v vse habundaunce goodes commodity life intent prouoked liberall goodnes tendre thankes vnto againe suffreth v somtymes bee afflicted aduersities may make godlines notably seene encreace rewarde matter turne cotrary parte faulte like nature good bee prouoked wt euilles euen doth entice noman vnto euil thing v turneth goodnes god vnto oure euil geueth pleintie meates geueth liquor wyne beyng moderately refreshed shoulde geue prayses maker shall dronken wyne call god vnto lawe wyse let accuse owne mynde whose vicious gredynes entised drewe dronkenes ther certayne readynes vnto vice graffed oure harte fyrste parentes vice sede synne bee receaued harte receaue nourishment mynde hathe ready conceaued synne onles vicious desire dryuen mynde stynking smell groweth waxeth strong litell litell till deadly synne comitted whiche whan nombres consumately done beginneth bring forthe frute self agayne frute bringeth forthe naughtiest frute euen deathe euerlasting heauy frute pleasure delectable outwarde appearauce promysing swete geare wote hydeth vnder bayte pleasure angling hoke death like therfore thys lower worlde hath nothing pure perfite euery parte good thinges corrupt badde thinges gladnes enterchaungeably myngled sadnesse corrupcion enfecteth ayer disease age decayeth strength bodye darkenes hyndreth fauour light euen myndes longe entangled bodyes scarcely thynge partes blessed pure corrupt spotte humaine desire darkenes errour ignoraunce euer naughtynes v ought impute vnto oure selues god pure affeccions put oure truste oure whole harte god breathed oure inwarde power vnto thinges euerlasting heauenly euer shoulde bee layed agaynste v life whether mery sory woulde turne increace godlynes therfore deare brother doe commune sort folish men doeth thintent may excuse theyr synnes pleade maker nature law though autor synne farre errour whiche haue learned gospells philosophie like god owne nature purely moste chiefly good euen doeth nothing procede whiche good yf naughtynes therfore v let v ascribe vnto god vnto oure owne selues yf good thyng yf true lyght yf vndefyled wysedome v let v ascribe wholy vnto god autor yf grosse worlde haue lyght hathe heauenly body especially sunne true knowlage euer v pure syncere affeccion euer v ariseth v nothyng elles synners ignoraunt persones procedeth aboue euer truly good commeth autor goodnes euer lawfull perfite thing thing maketh acceptable vnto god cometh fountayne perfeccion euer truly light father prince true light sendeth vnto v fro self thinges bestoweth vpo oure desertes geueth vnto v frely liberall nature giftes rather rewardes liberall large rather hire right therfore chalenge thing therof vnto v naughtynes let v call vpon mercie god goodnes bicause let v geue thankes vnto liberalitie like owne nature beste euen cannot geue thynges beste lyke vnchaungeable alwayes like hymselfe nothing obscured course darkenes daye taken awaye night folowing caste cloudes goyng betwene humayne wisedome darkened errours opinion man vprighteousnes infected naughty desire mixture euylles course darkenes behoueth v therfore also conforme selues vttermost power according simplicitie geuing selues vnto godly studyes apte receyue giftes maye transformed hym conuenient child resemble nature parent haue vnthirftyly resembled adam prynce grosse corrupt birthe obscured darkenes synnes hath begotten v entangled darkenes lothe heauenly thinges gredy earthy thinges resemble disposicion hym blynde doe al auentures blinde man casteth staffe fall carthy parent father heauen hathe happyly begotten v agayne created newe agayne myght conforme selues like vnto newe b innocencie life knowlage euerlasting trueth earthy father seduced false deceatefull promisses serpent begate v vnto darkenes heauenly father begate v agayne corrupt sede earthye father pure sede eternall trueth speaking worde serpentes worde lyeng worde casie downe manne state innocencie worde gospelles doctrine tr whereby chosen enheritaunce immortalitie called felowe shippe iesu christe sonne god true light preceding moste high light whose doctrine hathe made bright men myndes set free doctrine worlde heauenly worde suche efficacie doeth onlye chaunge v transformeth v vtterly men abhorryng thynges loued muche loue abhorred honoure heauely father worthyed v withal prouoked merites free goodnes wherby determyned euerlasting woulde suche meanes hathe ben hearde tell make newe creature earthe woulde shoulde bee fyrst frutes thys newe estate called amonge fyrste vnto doctrine gospell forasmuche god hathe endued v thys honour frely remayneth conforme oure selues lyke vnto hys hounteous goodnes vttermost power againe frely admitted vnto felicity might fall agayne owne fault onles studie kepe godly forcastes frely geue non effecte v chosen baptisme professing gospelles doctrine felowship sonne god excepte frame oure selues chast cleane maners like vnto profession like euerlastyng lighte hathe geuen v light sonne god muste oure life beare witnes belonge felowship light caste olde manne hys errours affectes hys vice reason ensue cleane contrary thynges heretofore rather seme maisters disciple ambicion perswaded commune people woulde recon better learned moste ful bablyng rather haue ben angrye hym counsailed aright acknowlage faulte rather haue folowed wicked outragious luste ensue thinges bring saluacion deare brother coumpted new man let slow speake swyft heare ready learne manne howbeit let manne rashly ouer hastyly take vpon teacher like voyde peril fall hastye speake euen manne inclined doe iniurie whiche lightly moued hys mynde requisite godly menne bee farre reuengement also euill speaking shalbe safe chyding maketh aunswer shal man wrong whan prouoked angrye among men peraduenture shall seme iuste man requiteth one euil worde one euell dede yet shalbe greate deale wyde iustice god hys sonne hathe taught v speake well backbyte v wishe well wishe euil v doe good doe euil vnto v thinges dooeth letteth tongue runne large whiche warbling membre slyppery hathe wrathe secretly maner lustes like ouerthrowe cheoke sede goddes woorde whan commeth vp bring forthe frute euen doe lette canne bee sowen fielde mynde taketh rote briery place ne marice nether sande fleeteth awaye requireth pure trymme substaunciall grounde therfore ye sede worde gospell cast bring frute frute say season commune frute wherwith bodyes may refreshed eternall saluacion soules make cleane fielde harte onely tumulte euil speaking wrathe also al gredy lustes wherwith man mynde defiled thornes coueteousnes grauell rashenes slyme outragious lust stone pride wilfulnes dede mynde burthened thys geare hable receaue worde gospell knocketh vayne tympane eares onles light depe inwarde partes harte settle myndes shall bee baren shote forthe shewe selfe godly workes texte p se ye doars worde hearer onely deceauing owne selues yf man heare worde declareth hys workes like vnto man beholdynge hys bodely face glasse assone hath toked selfe goeth waye forgetteth immediatly hys fasshyon loked parfayr lawe libertie continueth therin yf forgetfull hearer doar worke shalbe happy hys dede amonge seme deuout refrayneth hys tongue deceaueth owne herte mannes deuocion vayne pure deuocio vndefiled god father visite fatherles widoowes theyr aduersytie kepe hym selfe vnspotted worlde iewes haue lawe harte without boke yet expresse life philosopher learne perfitely lesson howe lyue wel thinke bee ynough farre deceauyng selues felicitie manne speaking lyuing vnto ought ynough newely instructed haue heard gospelles doctrine baptised admitted vnto harder hidden misteries gospelles doctrine haue learned ouer ouer whole philosophie christe hys life ne haue receaued promysse immortall life whiche christe taught muste bee expressed outwarde maners whiche muste bee folowed v vttermoste oure possible power behoueth v dye vnto desire worlde buried hym rise agayne hym vnto innocencye bee caryed heauen finally ought lyue vpon earthe appeare vnworthie rewardes heauen heare howe yeldeth frute whiche heareth worde gospell lightly vnconfiderately moste like vnto man beholdeth hys face glasse beholdeth doeth nothing el beholde chaunge naturall face nether goeth maner away glasse came yea inasmuch went purpose see fauour face thinketh amending faultes hys fauour sone goeth awaye glasse remembreth nothing whiche one sawe selfe glasse gospelles doctrine sheweth blemyshes outbreakinges body layeth disease thy soule thyne eies nether doeth shewe also healethe moses lawe rather vtter sore soule healed lawe concernyng lettre imperfecte frayed menne euyll feare rather caused menne willingly folowe thynges good lawe gospell obteyneth wyllyng bee lybertie loue lawe moses gat perforce lawe gospell maketh perfite begynneth bryngeth nothyng perfectyon whosoeuer therfore diligently behold bothe mynde life glasse doe continually neuer mouing eies example doctrine christe say whosoeuer heareth holy word suche light sorte turnyng self backe care worlde seme forget hearde frameth hys life rule expressing godly workes sticked fast marye soule shall surely blessed heard worde affeccions maners thou hearest christ saye tormente hell fyre abydeth sayeth vnto brother thou foole yet forgetting thou heardest thou arte ready lyght checking worde fight thou hearest rich set naught whiche daunger mothes theues true rich ought layed vp stoare heauen sone thy backe turned fro preacher thou runest al thy forcasting study muckre vp ryches thou carest hoke croke though thou beleuedest godlynes rewarded life among thinke selfe wonderous deuout kepe hys handes stealynge fighting vyces yet refrayne hys tongue backbyting mysreportes scoldinges filthie talkinges nether harte vncleane thinkinges hys deuocion vnprofitable vnfrutefull perchauce punished man lawes talketh whoredome though doe yet become whoremonger god minde hath comitted whoredoe suffreth punishment men coueteth man good may escape vnpunished giltie thefte god hath conceaued thefte minde estemed manifest dedes menne see mynde god loketh vpon inwarde affeccions mynde estemeth v corrupt mynde vsed moste parte hurst tongue among christen people reuiling woorde kynde manslaughter playne true godlynes wise agree racklenes tongue nether yet sufficience vnto christian religion haue absteyned synnyng behoueth also abounde good workes dede bonde seruauntes absteyne euill yea feare punyshment right child becometh haue loue whiche idle loytring matter effectually working putteth forthe selfe frely without compulsion dooe euery good worke woulde saye dedes make v ryght religious dede smell iewes secte set furthe prayse religion palles wyde robe choise meates washinges longe prayer ceremomes sometymes altogether contemned signes warned thinges whiche propre matter godlines thei pernicious ware yf man thinke made religious meane selues without exposicion make man rather hipocrite howbeit obseruing semeth religious deuoute matter among men wickedly repose godlines visible thinges whiche perchaunce signes godlynes cause godlynes seing selues nether good euill onles seme suche either custome opinion menne true godlynes inwarde myndes expresseth selfe farre certaine sure signes ceremony therfore heare true religion god father whiche estemeth iudgement manne doubtles thys pure vndefyled religyon like haue experience proued bothe mercie liberall goodnes god towardes v euen muste agayne bee bothe mercyfull frendely liberall towardes neighbour vpon hope mutuall good turne requited v agayne mere pure vpright loue loking rewarde wel handes none god whiche contente haue reconed bee done selfe euer bestowe sake vpon brother godly pure man among iewes toucheth caryon washed quycke rennyng water god godly pure succoureth fatherles child wydowes theyr trouble releueth hys oppreste brother helpeth nedye money among iewes vncleane eateth swynes fleshe god vncleane whose mynde infected defieled gredye lustes thys worlde manne saye lustes iudgement worlde counted vile poore honestlie set hathe moste possession rich cause theyr speciall carke care get selues moste substaunce money reconed lowete henneharted rascall maketh querell whan wrong done vnto counted foole doeth good turne badde estemed ioly ruffler geueth selfe excessyue ryot counted flyncher foloweth sobrietie taken gaye felowe swelleth haultynes loketh heigth ouer menne lower estimacion counted happye hathe matter succede worlde hys owne purpose floweth delicacy voluptuous pleasure serueth paunche glotonie thinges dede make mannes soule wicked vncleane absteyneth religious manne whosoeuer whosoeuer sight god father hathe exempted v earthy thinges called v heauenly thynges thinges shall perishe casuall vnto thinges eternall hathe taught v esteme worthynes manne thynges good dede haue doe geue respecte none purpose hys glorye whose handes requitall well doynges trusted doeth requite office true godlynes transitorye sone peryshing rewardes thys worlde wonte doe geueth blessednes neuer shall dye homely person poore body thou bestowest thy good turne vpo hable requite yet al farre better bestowe vpon vpon ryche greate power euer whiche requite profit agayne slender one small season reliuing thy pore brother christ layeth vp stoare life euerlasting ii chapter texte brother esteme fayth lord iesus christ lorde glory respecte person yf come company man wearing golden ryng clothed goodly apparell come also poore manne vyle rayment ye haue respect hym weareth gaye clothynge saye vnto syt thou good place saye vnto poore stande thou syt vnder fote stole ye parciall youre selues haue iudged euyll thoughtes harken deare beloued brother hath god chosen pore thys worlde soch rych fayth heyres kyngdome whiche promysed loue hym ye haue despysed pore riche men execute tyrannye vpon drawe iudgement seates speake euyll good name whiche called vpon ouer loueth neighbour goddes sake loueth god neighbour doeth case respecte man greate power rich nobilitie abundauntlie full diuine goodes thys maner iudgement kyng riche man better one iote manne howe basse poore euer bee christe died indifferentlie indifferentlye called thenherytaunce immortalitie therfore brother doe truly put trust promisses lord iesu christ make difference persones estimacion worldly thinges christ selfe touchyng world basse poore yet father shoulde prince glorye promised kingdome heauen wealthie vnto pore come youre company ioly felowe golde ring ruffling gaye apparaill come withall pore manne nether wearing ring hys fyngers clothed pore homely araye caste eies vpon riche man none respecte obseureth pore manne hys gorgrous rayment geue hym honourable place saying sytte thou vvell agayne saye vnto pore manne though lothed cause elles ouer homely apparaill stande thou sitte thou fote stole would harte grudge secretly condemne flattery attribute vnto golde galaunte aray honour due vnto vertue contemnyng lacke chose thinges whiche muche acceptable god true rich soule riche manne riche mannes fynger glisteryng ring precious stone bodye decked silke maketh regarde hym doe regarde pore man hys synceritie fay modestie mynde sobrenes chastitie giftes virtue whiche make man greate gorgious dede doeth iudgement disagree iudgement god heare indifferently welbeloued brother thyng euidentlie appeareth matter dede certaynly true muche euer worlde setteth ryche god hym selfe hathe preferred poore poore meane worlde whiche nether haue seke autor e kingdomes world god hathe let alone riche statelynes chosen sely pore folkes lacke present substaunce yet riche mightye lokynge kyngdome heauen theuerlastynge enherytaunce put truste hym promysed whiche nether deceaue woulde hable performe vnto whome hathe promised wonderfull licitie kinges wealthy folkes dede whiche loue trouly soeuer bee whether bonde seruauntes free men whether riche poore hauing desired riche manne highest se te appoynting pore man lowe fotestoles haue preferred hym whome god setteth lesse contemned sight god bothe rich honourable hathe honour done vnto perchaunce hauyng gotten hys ryches fraude rauine auaunceth himselfe contemned whiche rather poore losse godlynes bee riche hauing spent vp rich releuing pore become poore hys owne accorde myght bee riche godlynes dede euery one vngodly riche withstanding riche worlde rashe agreeing godlynes gospell kynde men moste chiefly repugne gospell christe practice tyranny malice godlynes riche menne accuse drawe iudgement seates riche moste parte speake euill curse holy name lorde iesu christe inuocacion wherof haue atteyned saluacyon reioyce riche yea hate profession muche chat name whiche geueth saluacion honourable vnto euen deathe abominable vnto profession name begonne healthesome vnto may owne faulte fall saluacion promised texte p ye fulfyll royall lawe according scripture thou shalt loue thyne neighbour thy self ye well yf ye regarde one person another ye commit synne rebuked lawe transgressours soeuer shall kepe whole lawe yet fayle one poynt giltie sayde thou shalt commes adulterye say de also thou shalt kyl though thou adultery yet thou thou art become traunsgressour lawe speake ye shalbe iudged lawe libertye shal haue iudgement mercy sheweth mercy merc reioyceth iudgement kynge promiseth rewarde yc dedes accomplysheth lawe royall wherof man ignoraunte seing expreste writing long agooe maner thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe doeth loue neighbor rule preferreth wicked rych manne godly pore man lawe gospell lawe loue soeuer done contracy although forbydden speciall name yet synne lawe doeth secretly reproue hath coinmauded almen al thinges thou oughtest loue thy neyghbour thy selfe soeuer swarueth rule conuicte transgressour lawe nether yet let manne urry fauell selfe wise faule light law broken nothing parte law gospell suche lawe except kept euery parte wholy semeth broken together euery parte inasmuche totall sunnue whole lawe coutcyned loue god neighbour soeuer swarueth charitee rote whole lawe hathe doubtles broken whole lawe offended autor lawe vnto whome become giltie whiche hathe e ed right marke whole lawe appeareth muche e ofte occasion offred man walketh darke careth whether goo ute waye right hande lefte disposed manner errour hathe swarued light therfore hath erie preferred vndeseruing rich man deseruing pore man forasmuche hathe thys behalfe broken la e loue cousen ge ayn naughtynes commonly done againste loue neyghbor nether doeth lyghtly offende god hardy defile lawe parte one commaunded charitie lyke diligence one forbydde euer repugnaunte againste loue neyghboure selfe gaue thys lawe comm ono vvhere ne ordayned thys murther thou absteyne whoredome yet committeste murther haste thou broken whole lawe thou hast broken one parte self one god forbad bothe forebad one cause saye againste loue neyghbour hath forbydden thinges whiche punnyshed lawes thefte murther whoredome manner thinges vtterly contrary loue gospell lawe moses would punnyshe estemed lesse soft sprited pore manne proude stately riche manne would wishe euil neyghbour yet lawe gospell punnysheth therfore according rule frame dedes also alyour comunicacion thoughtes youre harte nothinge tyme varieth loue neyghbour loue lawe libertie lawfull synne meanes euangelical loue causeth wyllyng doo theyr owne accorde thynge mannes lawes constrayne vnwyllyng doe perforce feare peynes accordynge thys lawe therfore frame youre life somuche shall receyue moste high rewarde accomplyshe whiche prescribed vnto contrary wyle shall suffre moste greuous sore punishmentes case one fall hym whome whole lawe dependeth frely pardoned transgression former lyfe gifte heauenly spyrite frely geuen whome onely reconsiled vnto god also glued together mutuall charitie geuen vnto frely geuen without deserumges muche sharpely shall bee punnyshed whiche hauinge experyence selues exceadynge greate mercy god doe shew selues agayne gentil mercifull towardes theyr neyghbour countenaunce shall aske mercye god iudge whiche seruaunt sheweth hym selfe vnmercifull towardes hys felowe seruaunt mouthe shall desire beloued god whiche doeth loue hys neyghbour thou wilt obteyne iudgement myngled mercy loke thou shewe thy selfe mercifull towardes thy neyghbour whether trespasser necessitie dede better decline thys parte leane vnto mercy vnto iudgement inasmuch almost altogether mercye god haue rather righteousnes ought endeuour maye rather fynde god mercifull seuerely strayte hathe saued v hys mercye reason also ready mercye towardes neighbour vnto straytenes many moo wonne softenes gentylnes lyberall goodnes strayte straungenes mercy aduaunceing selfe aboue iudgement maye triumphe thys behalfe whiche hauinge experience iudgement shoulde haue peryshed saued benefite mercy none v falleth daily shall finde god one condemnyng faultes expresseth selfe towardes brother auayleth brother though manne saye hathe faythe yf haue dedes faythe saue hym brother sister naked destitute dayly fode one saye vnto departe peace god sende warmnes fode notwithstandynge ye geue thynges whiche nedefull bodye shall helpe euen faythe haue dedes dead selfe manne wil saye thou hast faythe haue dedes shewe thy faythe thy dedes wyll shewe fayth dedes beleuest thou one god thou doest well deuyls also beleue tremble wilt thou vnderstande thou vayne manne faythe without dedes dead abraham oure father iustified thorow workes offred isaac hys sonne vpon aulter thou seest howe faythe wrought dedes dedes faith made perfect scripture fulfylied whiche sayeth abraham beleued god reputed vnto hym tighte wesnes called frende god ye se howe dedes man iustifyed faythe onely likewise also kaab harlot iustyfyed thorow workes receaued messagers seut another waye bodye without spirite dead euen faythe without woorkes dead also thought profession faythe ynough selfe obteyne saluacion faythe without charytye charitie lyuely thing ceasseth idle expresseth selfe good dedes dooing whersoeuer present want brother shall vayne name faythe praye saue manne faythe fruteles worketh charitie yea faythe title haue sayed shall cierely appeare conference example manne geue fayre wordes brother syster wanteth clothynge dayly sustenaunce saye goe waye peace get heate get youre bely full meate saying geueth none thynges bodye hathe nede thys mannes fayre speakynge vnprofytable pore nedye folkes shall starue colde bee hyngred al hys fayre tale releueth theyr necessitie releueth word mouth dede doeth nothing al like sorte doubtles shall profession faith whiche consisteth worde worketh nothynge dede vee vnauayleable lyeth slugging like deade neither bee called faythe deade corp manne worthye called manne thinge soule vnto body charitie vnto faythe charitie taken aware worde faythe dead matter vneffectuall nether shall good god professe idle faythe thy mouthe fayre wordes vnto poore neighbour ought holpen dede thynke mocked whan manne sayeth vnto get heate get youre bely full meate whan haue nether clothe meate geuen euen semeth mocke god rehearseth euery daye beleue god beleue god whan weth token faythfull belefe like hath vnprofitable charitie loueth lippes forewarde euen hathe vayne faithe beleueth worde onely nowe perchaunce one starteth gooeth disseuer thinges nature moste faste ioyned together nether disseuered sayeth thou haste fayth haue dedes let v bothe contented hys owne porcion let thy faythe suffice ynough haue good dedes yet nothers porcion shalbe sufficient thou boasteste faythe thou haue true tyght faythe requisite thou declare wyth thy dedes yf thou haue deade faythe thou arte neuer better thou crackest thy dedes yet sufficient get crown immortalitie onles procede charitie whiche vnseperable companyon faith bringeth saluacion thing flower boughes tree office charitie v whiche breake forthe theyr tyme declare tree rote quycke whose sappe noryshed therfore whole profite good dedes bee done vpon vayneglory thanke mannes handes feare shame vpon hope lucre lyuely faythe whiche hathe perswaded v geuen vnto god euer geuen hys sake vnto neyghbour rewarde hoped none hande thou pleasest thy selfe thou art perswaded one god errour painymes beleueth ther bee innumerable goddes thou doest ryght thys behalfe thou excellest howbeit doeth good beleue god one god onles thou beleue thou shalt hym obteyne saluacion shalt thou dooe excepte thou couple charytie vnto faythe testifye thy godly woorkes thou bothe beleuest hym thou loueste hym thou beleue god beleue also author saluacyon beleue hys promyses lyue suche sorte thou mayest appeare worthye hys promyses hathe promysed mercye yea vnto thys worlde exercise mercye towardes theyr neyghbour hathe promysed eternall life yea despyse pleasure thys worlde thys shalt thou beleue one god thou shalt also repose al thy whole trust hym elles frute shalt thou haue thy beleuynge deuilles also beleue god beleue iesus sonne god beleue muche tremble quake forasmuche beleue onelye loue hym afrayed punnyshment hande hope rewarde fele hym bee ryghteous woorthye fele mercye seynge cruell agaynste others thou fole thou yet standest thyne owne conceate hauing vayne faythe gooe shall brynge forthe famylyar knowen example teache faythe whiche woorketh loue vnprofitable deade abraham whome oure head auncetour moste chyeflye make vaunte deserued fyrste pryncypall commendacyon faythe god whome reputacyon ryghteousnes attrybuted vnto hym hym faythe vnfrutefully baren onely professe hys mouthe trusted goddes promysses also doubted laye hys onlye sonne isaac vpon thaultar slea hym goddes commaundement whereas ordre nature coulde posterytie bee trusted vpon hym anye laying hold promise god whome knew could raise euen dead agayn lyfe hys pleasure sticked commaunded dedes deserued comendacion righteousnes yea dedes proceded faith ther also workes moses law wherunto trust vayne without faith gospel noble patriarke would haue done seing went readily chearfully sleaynge hys sonne isaac whome loued muche tenderlye borne hys extreme olde age lucky posteryty promised name pronounced righteous euen sacryfyce yea god knewe olde mannes lyuely workynge faythe woulde refuie nothynge occasyon oftred therfore bothe matter dyd helpe eyther faythe encouraged hym feare offre vp hys sonne whome doubted shoulde commaundemente goddes power lyue agayne notable dede set vpon fynall furnyture matter declarynge vnto menne also abraham stedfaste faythe neyther deade commune faithe nother fayneth doubteth whiche stackreth auenture hys onely sonne whome loued syngularly woulde greue hym set naught money christes sake readye leade hys sonne whome father loued dearlier hym selfe vnto death thys notable document faythe manifestly appeareth bee perfite scripture sayed abraham beleued god reckoned vnto hym righteousnes called frende god abraham haue lost frute faithe commendacion righteousnes gtudged goddes commaundement offre vp sonne shall faythe aua le goddes commaundement grudgeth geue cote hys neyghbour starueth colde grudgeth geue meate hungrye drinke thurstye though god would suffre perishe cold hungre geueth somwhat hys substaunce releue hys brother necessitie commendacion righteousnes chaunced olde tyme suche tryed faythe theyr dedes muche lesse trusted vpon vnto professe lawe perfite charitie mercie liberalitie neyghbour muche auayleable god woman harlot straunger commended keping hospitalitie deserued nombred regestre godly people regestre citezens regestre moste tryedlye proued patriarkes rhahab iewe maystres howse baldrye gate lyuyng honest gaynes occupung yet goddes boke hathe worthye commendacion righteousnes faythe persuaded mannes good dedes loste god rewarder namely bestowed vpon good folkes leste respecte god regarding daunger life prouided saue life spy sent messangers guide iewes sente spye stealth way lest perish might haue come smal fauour coutrey folkes hande haue done betrayed spyes rather serue wyll god gayne nether dystrusted bee repayed pleynteous rewarde hym menne likewise abraham worthy praise righteousnes naked faithe faythe tried dedes euen rhahab beleued vayne god iewes true god excepte whan occasion serued declared dedes beleued whole harte otherwise faythe sayed colde charitie vttreth selfe whan matter requireth veryly faythe vayne name faithe like body destitue soule dead vnprofitable euen faithe want working charitie dead vneffectuall iii chapter texte brother euery man maister knowing howe shall receaue greater damnacion many thinges synne manne synue worde perfecte man able also came bodye beholde put byttes horse mouthes may obey v turne body beholde also shippes whiche though greate dryuen fearce windes yer turned smal helme whyther soeuer violente gouernour wyl euen tongue lytell membre also boasteth greate thynges greate profitablenes mannes tongue man teache thynges pertaine true godlynes peril ous pece woorke take thoffice teacher hande fyrste requireth manne bee excellently learned thynges concerne doctrine gospell moste pure affeccions ynough euery man teache vprightly respecteth nothing elles glorye god teacher like may much good loue teacheth euen whose doctrine corrupte whose minde corrupt wicked desire hatred yre desire reuengemet couetousnes ambicion lecherous lustes occupieth roume teacher greate marring people therfore brother couet euery maisters sure herken speake teacher ynow instructe many therfore taketh vpon hym rowme byshop teacher muste often manye tymes examyne selfe whether mete take charge hande let hym thinke thys specially selfe taketh trauaile hande endaungered myghtie peryl shall rendre moste streyght reconyng moste highe iudge teache otherwise becometh hys doctryne throweth abrode hys venome muche wyder perilouslier set forthe autoritye speaker nothyng difficultie euery poynt tempre tongue neuer speake amysse asmuche infirmytie mannes nature suche manne dayly doeth amysse many thynges anye manne canne auoyde escape tongue maye thought perfite mete manne gouerne whole bodye brydie reason hathe beue hable restrayne moste slyppery membre offende thys daunger farther rather beare rowme scholar teacher somwhat rule bely nothynge tempre eye eares somwhat refrayne handes harde matter gouerne tongue perfitely tongue small membre yea yet whole bodye dooeth almoste together depende speche man certayn effectuous excellent thyng importaunce either profite destroying many pearceth myndes hearer engraffeth bryngeth forthe noysome opinion stereth vp aswageth displeasure moueth vnto bataille draweth vnto peace strayneth hearer thys waye waye put brydles horse mouthes maye obey v small bytte turne ye horse whole bodye owne pleasure thing brydled mouthe sitter tameo tongue vnto manne see houge weyghtie substaunce shippes whan sayles spredde abroade carryed water wonderous violence wyndes yet turned litell stearne whither euer shippe maisters mynde gouerneth rother set dryueth stearne sleyght great weyghtie substaunce gouerned leaste parte therfore temperate gouernaunce tongue contemned small membre yea swellinge membre ful bragges entermyngleth destruccion wyde broade stereth vp myghty tumultes onles bee restrayned brydle mynde setteth people kyngdomes together eares one texte p beholde great thyng lytell fyre kyndleth tongue fyre euen worlde wyckednesse tonge set amonge oure member defyleth whole body setteth fyre haue nature selfe set fyre euen hell nature beastes byrdes serpentes thynges sea art meked tamed nature man tonge man came vntutly euyl full deadly poyson therewith blesse god father therwith curse men whiche made ymage simylitude god oute one mouth proceadeth blessyng cursyng brother thinges ought doeth fountayne sende forth one place swete water bytter also fyggetre brethre beare olyue beryes eyther vyne beate figges fountayne geue bothe salt water freshe also eny man wise endued knowledge amonge let hym shew hys workes oute good conuersacyon mekenesse wysedome yf ye haue bytter enuying stryfe hert reioyce nether lyars trueth suche wysdome descendeth aboue earthy naturall deuelyshe enuying stryfe vnstablenes maker euyll workes wysedome aboue fyrste pure peaccable gentil easy cut eated full mercy good frutes without iudgeing without symulacion yea frute ryghtewesnes sowen peace maynteyne peace wyll ye marke lyke example beholde howe litell fyre kyndleth myghtye greate violence matter wherof cometh horrible broade flasshing flame fyre sprong one litel sparke begynnyng myght haue ben holden litel doo whan negligently let alone gathereth strength euery parte groweth farre length suppressed force like vse fyre greate profitable sondry wayes bee rightly occupied principall destruccion bee suffred spreade whither euen mane tongue greate profite extreme destruccion mannes life doe see whiche wrought nature ment sygnificacion would haue mannes tongue bothe maner colour fyre warblinge turnynge flame fire yet membre single playne euyll almost membres worlde heape vice like litell sparke breeder whole flame euen euil euer life procedeth euil tongue worlde like litel fyre mingled greate rooke fewell lytel litell setteth al whole rooke fyre euen tongue mixed membres body restrained infecteth defileth poyson al whole body enflameth al life al maner flame vice fro cradle eue stil last age yet violence mischeyf geue vnto tongue nature whiche hathe geuen monicion empaled compasse teethe lippes vse tongue ought circumspectely loked moderated set fyre fyre hell wherof mynde fyrste infected wicked spirites poyson mynde instrument tongue breaketh maketh man naught starke naught poyson doeth also corrupte contagiousnes miserable myschief possiblie restrained force reason thinge worlde vncurable man diligence make ame maner meane wylde beaste wylde fowle combrous serpente noysome lyuing thinge sea vntruly maye bee made gentyll mannes witte cherishing lyon made tame tigres dragon made gentyll elephantes also made seruice crocodile made tame serpentes made meke eagle gripe made familiare delphines also allured louing yet neuer meane crafte founde mortall manne coulde tame vntemperate tongue whereas hathe ben tymes past tamed tamed euery day al kinde thinges beareth life many vpo earth many sea many ayre myschieuous membre tongue farre outragiously wylde violent nether vntuly also drenched deadly poyson lyon theyr hurt theyr clawes teethe yet haue venome adder armed venome yet haue nother clawes ne horne tongue noysome two maner wayes bothe vntameable madde wildenes deadly venome styngeth afarre scorpion hurte none whome strike thende theyr tayle adder hurte none thrusting theyr small piped toothe yet poyson lesse dreadfull syngle noysome one waye nowe myschief sondrye sortes turneth selfe maner kynde may sore easyly doo harme doeth oftentymes harme whan maketh outwarde shewe goodnes nothynge better nothyng regarde al men godlynes pretence therof dooeth harme moste specyally whan myngleth thynges whiche agree one together bee godly towardes god cruell cursed speaker agaynste hys neyghbour yet notwithstandyng instrument praise god calling father checke mysreporte neighbour whiche made likenes god tongue syng god autor goodnes whan vexe extreme sorowes man though reproche perteyned god made god nother made honest prayses ne hurt wit euil speakynges man maye vnto man ether noysome holsom dode man god reconeth belong vnto therfore lette man beleue god doeth accepte prayses speaketh hys tongue harte whan spueth tongue poison cursed speaking againste neighbour contrary repugnaunt praise disprayse yet matter great diuersitie procede one mouth dede vsed among vngodly among haue professed plain singlenes gospel behoueth thinges maner done shame sounde otherwise tongue harte thynketh seyng haue learned loue god neighbour neighbour god seing haue arned manne ought hurt raungeing nicenes tongue much bydden thexample christ speake well whiche speake shamefully truly lesse hurtfull playnly without conterfaicte dissembling naught cursed speaking set image godlynes elles poyson humlocke myxed wyne venome presently strong uyngled moste holsome matter haue theyr mouthe lorde haue mercie whan selues cruelly rage agaynste theyr brother haue mouthe father whan continually ing theyr tongue wound theyr neighbour whose saluacions sake christ wouded speake muche goodnes god hys owne clemencie saued man whereas goe hastyly aboute dispatch manne vell r tongue talke faste goodnes christe mannekynde warde whan contrary thexample christe sharpen theyr tongue agaynste theyr owne euen christened aduaunce praise sof christe gently answered reuiled whan theyr lye assault doth good professe selues messag er preacher christe whan instrumentes deuill promyse sede heauenly doctrine whan sowe mere poyson herbe ach nite thinges sondry diuersitie one tongue many tymes also one pulpit begynnyng praysyng god burst slauderyng theyr neyghbour infect myndes multitude muche perniciously feyned shewe relygion couer dissemble deadly poyson whiche thruste oute infected harte instrument tongue praye brother dooeth seme like condicioned monstre welles flowe holsome water welles whome taste vpon deadly poyson powre swete water good drinke geue bytter water salte nether may seme maruayle seing moysture runnyng diuerse vaynes sauoureth lyme alome brymstone metal swete ground chaunceth seing communicacion procedeth one harie seynge floweth one tongue farre vnlike selfe among many difference welspringes none founde bringe forth bothe swete sowre water one mouth dooeth one selfe tree bring forth frute sodry taste marke brother doeth figtree swete nature bring forth bitter yuyo beryes doeth vyne tree bryng forthe fygges euery frute lyke vnto hys owne tree hathe verdour iuyce hys owne rote dooeth therfore seme bee lyke monstre one manne shoulde powre one mouthe one tongue bothe godlynes wickednes trueth lyeng saluacion destruccion therfore seing nothing hurtfull wicked tongue nothyng healthfull good learned tongue seing manne seldome founde youerne thys membre poyntes manne ought diligent endeuour chosen many muste take hande trauaille teacher hym behoueth haue bothe mynde quiet tumulte gredye lustes conuersacion dyuorced vncleanes maye teache thynges concerne true godlynes also teache gentilnes doctrine contencious wrangling engendreth nothyng elles faccions fallyng amonge wise thys worlde beareth bell disputeth moste stiffenes opinion busye tongued geueth place bodye nether thys done heater may better whan goeth away getteth maistry maye prowder ouercomen maye lowted meane season commune sorte disagreyng amonge selues thys mynde neither speaker haue sure grounded frute ne yet hearer among professe philosophy gospell euer truly wise endued true wisedom let hym declare hym selfe wyse hyghe stately contencious maner reasonyng let hym testifie goldy entier vpright maners rather wordes lyke faith vnprofitable like charitie vnprofitable doone wordes euen wisedome whiche doeth fyrste trye selfe gentilnes maners chiefe token wherby manne may knowe humayne phylosophy euangelical professours humayne philosophye curious stiffe opynyon fearce philosophie gospell syncere excellent muche lesse high statelynes hathe chief powre consisteth subtill reasonynges syllogismes tricked fyne termes eloquence synceritie life softenes maners geueth place contencious persones allureth suche apte taught nether respecteth thing elles health hearer heauenly wisedome teacheth muste necessaryly haue mynde cleane scowred earthlye lustes muste nedes drawen syncere cleane vessell haue myndes defiled bitter enuying amonge selues haue harte corrupt contencious stubburne ymagynyng haue vpper hande enuye lay awaye rather office teaching seruing owne glory contencious maner lye againste gospelles veritie whiche manne set forthe syncerely onles hys mynde bee free humayne affeccions therfore euer taketh profession hande fele hys mynd infecte humayne loue hate malicious crueltie desire renowme gredy couering money loue uoluptuous pleasure let fyrste diligently purge inward partes hys mynde maye goe pure vnto teachyng moste pure doctrine elles slyppe ouer thynges make rightly vnto godlynes obiecte mystie smoke doubtfull question speake come fauour prince saye theyr owne aduauntage wrest doctrine gospel vnto theyr owne bely busines hunte vayne prayses menne laye heauye burthen vpon mennes shoulder touch wt theyr fyngre stede goddes commaundementes teache ceremony constitucions menne stede gospelles philosophie set forthe new ieweship finally preach selues rather christ mennes wisedome wisedome whiche father sent downe vnto v hys sonne aboue call v studie earthely thynges exalte v vp heauen grosse fleshye wysedome earthye therfore sauoureth earthe yea sensuall wisedome therfore respecteth thynges auayleable vnto thys lyfe vnto life euerlastyng yea deuelyshe wisedome thynspyracyon spyryte god instygacyon deuylles suggeste thynges maye estraunge v syncerytie gospell among professours worldly wisedome see great enuy braullynges fallyng forcasting haue vpper hande greate inconstauncye opynyons maners meane season whole life defiled kinde vicious naughtines contrary wise wisedome whiche procedeth aboue spirite christ fyrst chaste pure defiled wicked affeccions peaceable abhorreth studie contencion moreouer modeste overtwharte besydes tractable curteous grudging geue place vnto hym teacheth better full compassion mercyfull towarde fallen deceaued studieth rather saue spil gently bearyng assaying euery way bring amendemet full good frutes neuer ceasseth good al men co uerting vngodly godlynes callyng againe goe astraye teaching vntaught releuing fallen pricking forewarde outhfull conforting sorowfully afflicted nether meane dooeth damne body forcasting heale da e hauing maner counterfaict ne simulacion vpright syncere mind wishing wel sorte sowe pure quiet doctrine gospell doo reape vnto selues frute euerlastyng lyfe bryng studye heauenly life whome theyr striuinges cruelty shoulde haue caste awaye worldely wisedome hathe also frute hys owne either vayne frute deathe bryngyng frute frute ryghteousnes geueth bothe innocencie worlde afterwarde immortalitie sowed contencion concorde peace vnto embrace peace parte good cher maliciously skirmish seme obstinate wil obey doctrine gospell better hym leaue vnto theyr owne stubburnes case bee hope wyll comme amendemente iiii chapter texte whence commeth warre fightyng among come thei hence euen lustes fyght youre membres ye luste haue ye enuye haue indignacyon cannot obtayne ye fyght warre ye haue ye aske ye aske receaue ye aske mysse euen consume vpon lustes ye aduouterars wemen breke matrimony knowe ye frendshyppe worlde enemy c god whosoeuer therfore wylbe frende worlde made enemie god ether ye thynke scripture sayeth vayne spirite dwelleth v lusteth euen contrary enuy geueth grace wherfore sayeth god resisteth proude geueth grace vnto lowely standeth hand al meanes endeuour selues lyue one concorde myndes bee possiblye done excepte dryue worldly gredye lustes poyson concorde occasion debate vtterly youre myndes saye endaungered suche maner lustes wherof cometh warre wherof cometh fighting stryuyng amonge wherof come tumultes contencions debate christe hathe taught peace concorde wherof cometh discorde serue luste humane gredynes loue gospell gredy lustes dyd kepe warre captaines membres tongue nether teare neighbour ne hande beguyle youre brother yet hitherto reliques youre olde lyfe deprehended haue yet together caste olde manne one manne coueteth glorye gapeth gayne thys manne ymagyneth may reygne alofte manne hunteth voluptuous pleasure while atteine thing euery one vehemently coueteth thrust maketh sure doe enuy hathe obteyned stryue semeth lyke obteine vexed mynde toyled sondrye tumultes care obteyne thinge gredily seke nether man peace selfe gredy desyres omble harte tongue hande membres fight kepe warre wardlye neyghbour yet meane whyle nether insacyable desire satisfyed youre selues fall thynges truly good ought aske god haue nede thing thing apperteyne vnto true felicitie aske worlde whiche ought asked god either aske ye doe aske aske ought wyse ought doe dede either aske hurtfull thynges stede holsome thynges aske wauering distrust elles aske vnto wicked vse saye thing liberally bestowed relief necessitie life may spend satisfieng voluptuous pleasure seing doe thus name shal cal christianes dedes say nay heare title christian see deed whoremonger whore one addicte vnto spouse christ one sworne hys wordes redemed fro tyranny synnes hathe made cleane holy sacred bloud make vnto hym self spowse vnspotted forget profession forget benefite youre bridegrome forget wedlocke trouthplight slide backe againe whorysh loues world doo know god ielous louer wyll bee wholy loued wylbee loued alone maye abyde wowynge worlde bee loued loue whereof hathe delyuered greate price alone sufficient accomplishe thynges cause aske worlde parte youre blessednes doe knowe god hateth halte bothe sydes abyde seruaunte contente serue one onely maister maried manne pacient canne suffre hys enemye goynge wowe hys wyfe come company haue thought possyble please bothe worlde god one doe vnderstande like wife couple selfe whoremonger falleth quite awaye loue husbande euen christian e assaye haue frendshyp agayne worlde doeth vtterly receaue vnfrendshyp god hathe concord worlde therfore take certayntye whosoeuer studyeth loued world maketh selfe enemye vnto god concorde betwene lyght darkenes betwene god belial maried husbande abyde hys wyfe playing whoremonger canne suffre loues wedlocke deuyded partes though haue maryed woman greate possessyon though haue maried gentilwoman borne though haue maryed woman neuer greate wealthe thynges wyll chryste suffre hys spouse whome hathe saued destruccion whome hathe set libertye bondage whome hathe washen fylthynes synne whome whan naked hathe clothed whome whan poore hathe richely endowed many free gyftes haue doo aduouterer deuill thinke written holy scripture naught spirite whiche dwelleth lusteth vnto enuie lawe moses somwhat geuen mannes affeccyons myght without punyshmente hate theyr enemye lawfull set theyr forcastes vpon muckryng vp rich taken vniuste manne requitte violence violence one despightfull worde spirite gospell dwelleth full gelosie may speake enuious requireth wyll bee vehemently loued agayne hys sake haue wife chyldern yea euen lyfe contemned canne abyde haue resting house defyled worldly lustes requireth pure cleane thinges requireth heauenly thynges leapeth backe runneth away offended manne bring sluttish filthynes thys world hys temple howbeit like requireth v certayne exceadynge greate loue greate deale purer loue moses lawe dooeth euen geueth plenteous grace hard matter accomplysh requireth geueth strength thys ende maye easylye doo nothynge harde louing willer hys gyfte shoulde loue rather loue agayne drewe v hys loue fyrst whan turned hym reconciled v agayn vnto hym encrease hys giftes v case geue selues together wholy vnto depend hym onely none haue nothyng doe worlde deuill prynce worlde whan speake world meane nothyng elles wicked gredy lustes vysyble thynges wherin thys worlde promyseth certayne false feyned felicitie great matter required thei greater matter promised hable lyberally geue myghty greate thynges hable also geue encrease strength wil largely geue excellent thinges deserue naught vouchesafe also geue encrease strength bee weake let v distruste oure owne helpes helpes worlde repose whole hope assured confidence hym forsaketh arrogauntly truste theyr owne substaunce succoureth ascribe nothing selues trust wholy goodnes god dede thys thynge lorde spake tymes paste salomon god resisteth stately hygh mynded stoute bestovveth fauour vnto meke poore castavvayes texte submyt youre selues therfore god resyste deuyll wyll flye drawe ye god drawe nye clense youre handes ye synners pourge hertes ye wt ueryng mynded suffer afflyccions mou e wepe let poure laughter tourned mournynge youre ioye heuynes dumble youre selues syght lorde shall lyft vp backbyte one another brother backbyteth hys brother iudgeth brother backbyteth lawe iudgeth lawe thou iudge lawe thou arte obseruer lawe iudge one lawe geuer iudge whiche able saue destroye art thou iudgest another go ye saie date mo owe let v gooe suche cytye contynue yeare bye sell wynne yet cannot ye tell shal happen morowe thinge lyfe euen vapour apeareth lytell tyme vanisheth waye ye ought saye yf lorde wyll yf lyue let v nowe ye reioyce youre boastinges suche reioysing euyll therfore hym knoweth doe good doeth synne god would haue fast ioyned shewe selues obedient wife obeyeth husbande deuill gooe diuorce loue dryue awaye aduouterer deuill iuggling knackes shall geue ouer greuing shalbe afraied see stedfaste constaunt loue youre brydgrome christ therfore disseuer selues whether feare speake faire godly study holy chast purpose apply selues god shall applie selfe agayne whiche waye euer lustes mynde doo leane thider goe affeccions carie vnto honestie vnto heauenlynes goo vnto god drawe enticementes fleshe ryde poste deuil ought euermore make haste one selfe waye wauer hither nowe thider doo acknowlage christe youre brydesgrome requysite cleane therfore yet hitherto soyled filthie puddle synnes make cleane handes absteyne kynde euell dooinges clense harte maner vngodly lustes kepe residence double minde partely louing thinges god partly thinges world dedicate whole hart christ alone seke felicitie world promised heauen sincared vaine pleasure world set naught ioyes neuer shal haue end would truly happy dede suffre sorow world haue ioye euerlastingly mourne thys worlde bee mery euer world endles wepe worlde let folish pernicious laughing turned holsome mourning let outragious ioyousnes chaunged holsoe sadnes let high statelines turned lowe mekenes let manne exalt selfe alofte rather caste downe selues sight god whan deiected shall set vp make true highe estate lesse shall arrogauntly chalenge vnto selues much greater thinges shall frely geue vnto arrogaunce hathe enuye companyon enuye springeth backbytinge moste wicked kynde pryde backbyte thy brother name thou mayest appeare honeste though manne woulde caste myre mannes face hym selfe myght seme fayrer arraye mannes garment fylthynes selfe myght seme trym fylthy thynge brother backbyte brother betwene whome thynges ought bee comune euen yf right hand mayme lefte though shoulde happye felowe membre worse case yet auoyde aduouterie auoyde thefte auoide periurie abhorre backbyting though lyght faulte muche hurtefull couereth selfe cloke relygyon rayleth agaynste man faultes appeareth fyrste abhorre vice whiche mi iketh others fayneth selfe moued enuye malice loue beareth honestie euen venome hathe fayre spoken flatterie backbytynge one maketh folke thinke worse nether present poyson vnto christian concorde nowe backbiteth brother condemneth neyghbour dooeth wronge onlye whome backbiteth also vnto law whome appeareth backbite condemne thy brother faultles forbydden law dooeth face dooest thou damne thynge lawe gospell damneth faultye doest thou bewray thy backbytynge tongue hym ought punnyshed lawe lawe gospell byddeth iudge one condemne one vnder pretense lawe dooe owne affeccions offendour shall haue iudge owne dooest thou take office vpon thee tyme thou goest aboute haue amended wondred vpon therfore euer backbiteth neighbour either condemneth lawe correcteth filthynes backbiteth though muche myngle mangled walowyshe office wherof backbytour taketh vpon hym worlde hathe publike lawes punnyshe faultes parte christian softenes endeuour amendement menne rather iudge one lawe maker whiche hable bothe saue spill thinkest thou kepte secret euery manne doeth offende perchaunce suffreth offendour maye one repent suffreth hym maye time punnyshe greuouslye dooest thou beinge rascall paisgent take vpon thee iudges office dooest thou geue sentence tyme brotherly parte mony h charity desire ye parte well wil er blame backbyte pestilent thing pride iudge thou obey lawe doest thou arrogauntly take vpon thee office law thou goest law thou art keper law iudge lawe goeth lawe goeth god maker law god suffre thinge vnreuenged knoweth ought punnyshed bee punnyshed daunger al sinne none arte thou iudgest thou condemnest thy brother thou thy selfe arte faultie thou goest spill thou arte hable saue fynally thou chalengeste thy selfe aucorytie vpon mannes seruaunte without reproche commune maister leaue owne maister whiche iudgeth according right thou perswadest thy selfe right ambicion hate wrathe malice beareth hande arte many time offended moate thy brother eie whan thou haste beame thyne owne man poysonly backbiteth man name moste farre true praise worthynes manne beareth easyly man weakenes goeth moste forwarde studie true godlynes great studie forcast thinges worlde hauyng neclected heauenly goodes ought lest monyshed incertayntie shortenes life folye set mannes ioye maner goodes whiche euer chaunce yet somtyme sodaynely taken awaye fortune fortune snatche awaye goodes frome owner deathe snatcheth away owner goodes wher learne dayly example thus yet cleane forgetting thys gayre dreame vpon long life though shoulde alwayes lyue heape vp selues rich many yeares lyue vpon whan thys thinge moste incertayn long shall lyue thing moste certain shall lyue longe prepare selues vitayle rather life neuer shall haue ende god fooles face saye daye morowe wyll gooe forthe thys cytie passe tyme one yeare get muche gayne serue v many yeares whan incertayn shall happen nexte daye lyfe selfe moste shorte manye casualty many dyseases make also moste incertayne though compacte death whiske sea lande get pelfe olde age peraduenture shall neuer come whan manne promyse hym selfe lyue much morow whereto put confidence life though stedfaste substaunciall matter thyng life set care ye labour forcast nothing elles truelye smoke appearing shorte tyme quyckly vanyshing away farre therfore maner communicacion fro christian folkes mouthes go wil passe yeare buye sell wyll get wynnynge though owne handes knowe chaunce come rather lyue tyme dependyng goddes saye lorde lende v life dooe thinges ought lightly cared make shorte incertayn life body care ought set vpon thinges make lyfe neuer shall dye yet thys lyfe hath nought truste surely vnto seing subiecte many chaunces many disease ig endaungered many casualty seinge slyppery fugitiue yet enhaunce stomackes puffed vp trusting vpon youthe he though neuer dye right bee stronge hartie truste goddes helpe godly bee chearefull loking heuenly goodes thys bragging cheare stand owne conceate withall goodes fyrste false goodes goodes muste shortly taken wycked also folishe peraduenture thys tolerable perswaded theyr elder nothing remaining man lapped wynding e excusable gredely vse thys life loke none gospelles philosophye hathe taught lyfe contemned ought studyous dilygence make spede heauenly life whyche prepared ryches godly doynges conclude greuous synner whiche whan knoweth gospelles doctrine ought doone yet corrupte euill affection foloweth thinges whiche men folowe knowe christe v chapter texte p go nowe ye ryche men wepe howle youre wretchednes shall come vpon youre ryches corrupte youre garmentes mothea en youre golde siluer ank ed ruste shalbe witnes vnto shall eate youre fleshe fyre ye haue heaped treasure together euen wrathe youre selues youre laste dayes beholde hyer labourer whiche haue reaped downe youre feldes whiche hyre kepte backe fraude yeth cry whiche haue reaped entred eares lorde sabaoth ye haue lyued pleasure erthe bene wanton ye haue nourished heartes daye slaughter ye haue condemned kylled iuste hathe resisted goe nowe ryche men occupye felycitie pleasure lyfe whiche ought loke eternall heauen poste haste worlde awaye synging laye awaye voluptuousnes madde pleasure haue witte wepe howle thinke vpon euerlastinge misery shortely hange ouer imagine time presently come shal shortly come h nde whan rich wherin folishly put confidence twitched awaye shalbe wise late acknowlage gaye possession doe helpe counterfaict felicitie right true euerlasting sorow come rich haue gotten hoke croke cared howe ryches rotten youre clothes endaungered mothes golde siluer ed rust custody nygarde slouening heyre rusting shal beare record youre wickednes rather haue lost wt mowling tha lay ye vse ye poore nedy expense thinges might haue bought euerlasting life shall reste money haue scraped hard earthe g awe guttes soules euen fire shall bee late vayne frette selues repentaunce naughtyly kept money shall double youre sorowe haue naughtly kept haue naughtyly gotten stede mercy god whiche might losse substaunce haue bought haue heaped vp selues wrathe vengeaunce god liberall towardes nedy brother haue also defrauded symple body hys due wage beholde eaper swette reapyng downe youre corne defrauded hys wage cryeth vnto god asketh vengeaunce yea cryeth theyr voyce pearceth eares lorde sabaoth whiche ought also dreadde hable reuenge bigger tha hearde manne iudge whiche parte fauoureth moste wealthy selues helde theyr peace wickednes selfes cryeth vnto iudge god whiche nether afrayed wealthie also reckoneth wronge poore oppressed belong vnto moued sorowfull griefe hungrye thurstye poore mennes swette hatched vp mennes hunger thurste made fatte theyr teeth hacked theyr heade staruen colde killed hungre thurst meane passed lyfe swetely pleasure vpon earthe lyued wantonly fedde soules al kindes voluptuous pleasure keping dayly feastes gorgeously wont doe solene holy day whan meate offring slayne nether thought ynough haue defrauded poore manne haue condemned killed innocente made resystence thought shoulde haue doone without punnyshement alwayes whiche might doo without punnyshment men kynde manslaughter defraude symple theyr lyuynge yet thys crueltie suffice vnreasonable outragiousnes thyrsted theyr blood whan faultles people shamefully handled meate drinke youre stomakes matter beinge turned ersye versye haue fruicion pleasure neuer shall decaye bewayle youre shorte folyshe fyne fyngred pleasure euerlasting tormentes texte pacient therfore brother vnto commyng lord beholde husbande manne wayteth precious frute earthe hathe longe pacience vpon vntill receaue early latter ayne ye also pacye therfore settle youre heartes commynge lorde draweth ye grudge one agaynste another brother l ste ye damned beholde iudge standeth dore take brother prophet ensample suffering aduersitie pacyence spake name lorde beholde counte happye whiche endure ye haue heard pacience ob haue knowen ende lord made lord pytiefull mercyfull aboue thinges brother sweare nether heuen nether earth nether othe let yee yee youre nay naye lest ye fall ypocrisy ed let hym praye mery let hym sing psalmes dysea ed among let call elder congregacion let pray ouer hym anoynt hym oyle name lorde praye faith shal saue sicke lord shal raise hym vp yf haue comitted synnes shalbe forgeuen hym therfore brother cast downe harte sory chaunce haue enuye ryche folkes whiche seme haue thinges would haue deuise reuengement pacientely suffer vnto commyng lorde tyme sowinge shalbe time reaping rewardes youre godlynes doo yet appeare yet sauetie deliuered theyr tyme beholde tyllour grounde labour taketh owne coste hope grounde shal tyme yelde thinge receyued aduauntage yet profite groundes euery place certayne fauourable wether seasonable rayne tyme moysten grounde tilled latter ende kepe corne whan waxeth bigge heate husbande loseth hys labour taketh longe labour vpon good hope frute tyme requireth shoulde appeare vp whiche hathe sowed muche reason paciently suffre displeasure thys lyfe frute immortalyties sake namely seinge rewarde sauetie meane make good sedenes therfore example husbande confirme plucke vp stomackes strongly vpon good sure hope beinge nether desirous reuengement nether wearye well doinge lorde comme bothe take vengeaunce vpon wicked rewarde immortalytie temporall affliccyons nether daye longe shall come soner loked therfore brother let man thynke hym selfe vnfortunate moiled many sorowes nether let manne en hi lyueth harte ease nether suffreth greater griefe forsaken god exercised vnto greater rewardes nether thys manne therfore beloued god lyueth quietnes wyll haue whose godlynes ease mennes misery let therfore vngodly mourning e token malice infydelitie amonge condemned suche kynde sorowfull mournynges fore token mynde wryeth downe vnto desperacyon let shortenes tyme comforte beholde iudge standeth doore rewardes readynes euery one accordinge desertes hys lyfe paste meane tyme garnyshe youre myndes example holy father thinges sholde haue happened none ben matter perchaunce maruaile prophetes suffred greuous matter opened true sayinges god vnto ye wicked like wicked riche men tyme could abyde prophetes sayinges euen canne abyde gospelles doctrine nowe contrary repugnaunt agaynste theyr studyes yet manne bewayleth prophetes chaunce manne thynketh vnhappye suffred emprisonmentes fetter slayne sondrye kyndes tormentes iudge happye slayne righteousnes sake haue hearde tell noble example pacience iob sorte sorowes suffred cruel assaultes satan haue marked hys wrestlyng haue marked hym also getting victorie lordes helpe whose goodnes euery thynge taken hym malyce satan receyued agayne twise muche lorde forsoke stowte champion laying vpon hym many sorowes wolde haue pacience recorded seene yea mercyfull lorde owne nature ready vnto clemencye turneth vnto v mannes malyce heape vauntage felycitie let youre mynde bee pure playne let youre harte youre mouthe gooe bothe together let man feyned wordes deceaue neighbour especyally brother sweare lest lytell litell accustume selues forsweare amonge iewes heathen fidelyties sake othe put betwene amonge christian whiche ought nether distrust manne nether deceaue vayne thyng sweare euer accustumed sweare cousyn garmayne perill forswearyng afrayed onely sweare god humayne affaire lyght matter also absteyne al kynde swearing sweare nether heauen nether earthe thynge commune people esteme holy religious euer dare bolde lye without swearinge dare also sweareth luste brief good manne beleue manne without swearyng naught truste manne though sweare amonge furnyshed gospellike playnesse nether place dystrustinge ne ymagin deceate let youre playne communicacion bee regarded lesse true stedfaste maner othe iewes paganes holy euer bee often confirme thynge confirme youre harte performe dede thinge speake ofte denye thinge denye youre whole hearte nether let thynge elles bee youre hearte youre mouthe speaketh counterfaictynge seing disciple trueth bee manne sore afflicted amonge let hym flee remedy thys worlde rynges inchauntmentes baynes easementes sorowe let hym turne hym prayer lyfte vp hys mynde god assured faithfull trust shall f de present relea se mournyng agayne manne well content prosperitie let enhaunce selfe folishely behaue hym selfe madlye let praise liberall goodnesse god holy songes thankes geuing nowe manne punnyshed syckenes let hym flee remedy witchecrafte let hym spende great sight money vpon phisicions whose curing many tymes suche sorte better pacientlye departe world let hym call vnto elder christian congregacion let make theyr prayer god dyseased annoynte oyle hauyng prayer wytchecrafte heathen wont doe callyng vpon name oure lorde iesu christe kinde enchauntmente effectuall let prayer done trusty faithe god shall heare preserue diseased shall healthe bodye bee restored vnto hym expedient diseased also bee endaungered synnes disease bodye spryng moste parte sorowes mynde shalbe forgeuen hym elder supplicacions faith commendable doe praye hym whome dooe praye texte knowledge fautes one another praye one another ye may healed feruent prayer ryghteous manne auayleth muche helyas man mortall euen prayed hys prayer myght rayne rayned earthe space tore yeares e monethes praied againe heaue gaue ra earth brought forth frute brother erre trueth ano conue e hym let knowe whiche conuerteth synner go ng astraye waye shal saue soule death shall de multytude synnes forasmuche life manne consisteth without light dayly offence shalbe conuenyent vse dayly remedie maye bothe releue euery one mutuall prayer acknowlage euery one hys faulte shall remedy auayleable thou acknowlage thy disease desire helpe supersticious folkes suppose secret hydden efficacie theyr enchauntmentes prayer dede prayer righteous manne muche worthe whiche faithe obteyneth euer desireth god vpon condicyon christe made couenaunt v euer shall aske faythfull trusty confidence shoulde obteyne onles suche thynge beste obteyned would fayne haue doctrine thys matter helyas pure manne mortall manne yet prayer rayned vpon earthe thre yeares sixe monethes prayed agayne myght rayne anone heauens hauynge hearde hys prayer gaue rayne earthe brought forthe frute incase heauen obedient prayer one godly manne though bewytched maruayle god beynge moste readye forgeue pleased prayer many weight brother godly partes christyan loue ease sickenes mannes bodye commune prayer muche indifferent reason shoulde succour diseased mynde greate matter obteyne prayer may somwhat longer deathe happen man man howbeit muste nedes comme one great matter haue aboyded disease minde therfore among erre gospelles veritie ether muche cleauyng lawe moses stubburne folower heathen relygion deliuered elder let man thinke dryuen awaye scoldyng behoueth rather endeuour study ende maye turne ent hys errour euer doeth thus shall doo god greate sacrifice wisheth deathe synner rather may turne lyue man doeth great feate preserueth soule deathe delyuerynge hys brother synnes wherby holden subieccyon deathe nether meane yme shall wante hys rewarde christe shall forgeue hym hys synnes agayne many euer shall kepe brother destruc yon p thus endeth epistle iames apostle argument vpon fyrst epistle thapostle john erasmus roterodam saincte iohn thapostles epistle whiche wrote gospell stile wordes selfe playne argument maketh muche dooe rehersall light darckenes life deathe hare loue often repetinge wordes though taken sayinge nexte whiche sorte open saying plainly example one loue vuorlde nether thinges vvorld yf manne loue vvorlde loue father hym vvorlde c anon father vvorlde vuorlde passeth avuaye often worlde rehearsed fynally hys sayinge lesse compendyous shortenes open plainesse writynge reste thapostles thepistle euidently plaine nedeth argumente like two epistle folowinge whiche ascribed one iohn certayne senior iohn apostle thus endeth argumente paraphrase erasmus vpon firste epistle sainct iohn fyrste chapter texte beginnyng haue herd haue sene eye haue loked vpon oure handes haue handled worde lyfe lyfe appeared haue sene beare witnes shewe vnto eternall life whiche father appeared vnto v whithe haue sene hearde declare vnto ye also maye haue felowshyp v oure felowship maye father sonne iesus christ thys wryte vnto ye maye reioyce youre ioye may full vve write vnto dearely beloued brother stender meane thinges thinges vnknowen newe matter howbeit newe vnto v god euerlasting worde god euen iesus christe bothe god manne whiche alwayes sonne god woulde late sonne mayden hys diuine nature inuisible man eies vouchesafed take vpon hym humayne bodye vouchesafe famyliarly conuersaunte among men might arye v vp darkenes ignoraunce lyght gospelli knowlage myght begynne beholde eies mynde whome haue presentlye f ne eies bodye dede vnbelefe mannes harte required truthe shoulde bee credited grosse outwarde experimentes yet godlynes preferred owne worde whiche neyther sene theyr eye n handled theyr handes yet moste certaynly perswaded beleued sonne god thonly autor mannes saluacyon parte therfore declare whiche haue moste certaynly proued bodyly sences vnto chaunced see yet expedient beleue none ought trust haue life euerlastinge saluacion beleueth gospelles doctrine wherof witness preacher worde manne nether lyght importaunce worde god heauen geueth euerlastyng lyfe geue obedient hearyng vnto deliue ing deathe sinnes euer relygyon euer kynde lyfe shall turne selues vnto matter yt speake speake assured credence wete euen thing continual waitours heard eares saw eies nether sawe afarre passinge loked presently full cause thinge credited two princypall chief sences also bee small matter heare hym teaching prayinge commaundyng wyndes deuilles father sondry tymes bearing witnes vnto sonne sawe hym worke myracles suffre deathe ryse agayne also haue handled handes oures whan rysen agayne deathe thyntente make v beleue steofastlye vayne phantasie euen lame manne alyue agayne whome sene dead caused v handle handes laying fingres shewed v place woundes mannekynde deade bycause thraldome vice synnes suffred deathe wickednes goodnesse myght lyue vnto innocencie doubt also selues whan sawe hym dead whan sawe hym buried whan rose death gaue v sure hope life mankynde maner hope eternall life except caused v see oure cies plucked awaye doubtefulnes fro v manifestly apparent experimentes beinge manne suffred paynes synnes god dooeth frely gene immortall lyfe put theyr faythfull trust hym lyued alwayes father life alwayes determinately purposed v sonne howbeit counsail yet publyshed vnto world albeit nacion iewes yet none loked prophetes oracle dreame meane deathe reigned lyfe laye hydden tixed theyr hope moses worldly wisedome saluacion life people iesus christe worde god father teacher innocencye geuer immortalitie none lyueth lyueth godly nether dooeth escape deathe atreyneth immortalytie leyngth thys iesus christe manifested selfe vnto world hym selfe shewing selfe playnly sens man thrusting selfe conscience menne therfore would haue v lokers witness thinges earthe thintent myght faithfully published preachinge throughout whole vniuersall worlde like iesus haue obteyned lyfe saluacion case perseuer still gospelles doctrine euen shoulde also come v felowshippe company saluacion case geue credence witnesse bearing concernyng thinge neither hearde sawe hym learne preachinge nether vayne witness ne yet vncommaunded v bee faithfull witness recorde vnto men greate daunger head none thinge haue euydent experience sences bodye happye eares eies haue made v beleue yet neuertheles happye geue credence vnto hys witnesse bearer faithe hathe glued v vnto christe made v child god membres christe faith also shall engraffe vnto bodye ioyned v feloweshippe faithe myght make one bodye shall come passe shall bee one mynde amonge selues membres one bodye shall also haue peace league iesus christe hym god hys father whome farre different like sonne moste perfite consent communion al thinges father euen also perfite agrement profession gospell shoulde bee heaped togyther one bodye christe made partaker goodes heade know ioyous happye feloweship yet put remembraunce agayne thinges writing thintent myght reioyce fully euery manne together ioyous hys owne saluacion men felicitie make euery one glad thys dooeth christen charitie cause euery manne must glad mennes commodity owne moe felicitie commune vnto abundaunt shall euery one ioye bee among v shall one mynde stande together substauncially excepte fast glued together mutuall charitie canne possibly haue peace god except answerably like vnto head iesus christe euer hathe ascribeth vnto father euer haue behoueth v ascribe vnto christe christe true lyght procedeth father lyght canne bee membres christe except bee bright nether canne haue lyght onles bee transformed contynue stedfastly vnto ende feloweship trueth innocencye lyght mynde synnes wycked lustes darkenes lyght life darkenes deathe texte tydinges haue hearde hym declare vnto god light darckenes saie haue felowship walke darckenes lye trueth yf walke light euen light haue felowship bloud iesus christ sonne clenseth v synne saye haue synne deceaue selues trueth v knowledge sinnes faythfull iust forgeue v oure synnes clense v vnrightewesnes say haue synned make hym lyar hys worde v matter whiche shewe vnto myght fully reioyce dede whiche haue heard euen hauing heard make comune vnto god forasmuch altogether nature good wise al pure al light life nether ther darkenes v matter standeth sorte haue muche darkenes euen selues case haue light endebted gether vnto whose free liberality deliuered olde synnes deliuered darkenes former ignoraunce haue learned gospelles doctrine liue godly christe heades example manne boast baptisme engraffed body christe hathe therby felowshippe god father meane liueth yet errours vice hys former lyfe dooeth playnly lye seing sayed god farre maner felowship darkenes possibly haue thynge dooe hym lyueth yet still together errour olde vice clene waye thinketh atteyne innocencie meanes christ agayne deceaued thinketh ynough washen baptisme except answerably like vnto professio innocencie life thinketh thus deceaued lieth sayeth christe trueth whiche hathe nothing doo lyers fyrste steppe vnto light manne acknowlage darkenes fyrst stepping forthe manne vnto innocencie acknowlage sinnes ye heare therfore token maye knowe haue true feloweshippe god doubtles euen thie like light voyde darkenes euen shall absteyne example darkenes errours vice framyng conuersacion light gospell yf like sonne hathe high concorde father euen shoulde also lyue innocently one mynde amonge selues father laye traunsgressions olde life vnto charge whiche one doone awaye sorte precious blood sonne iesu christe henceforthe absteyne synne muche v lyethe blood christe hathe washed awaye fylthynes hathe washen away folkes yea hathe washen none acknowlage theyr faultes yf saye endaungered synne deceaue selues lyue errour wandre darkenes christe light whiche trueth v truly v dede would dispatche awaye thys darkenes arrogaunt ignoraunce shall chaunce v receyuing baptisme slyde backe agayne mannes weaknes synne myste obscure light muste beware arrogauncie withdrawe v farther farther leade v agayne light olde darkenes yea muste geue dilygence discrete sobrenes maye admoued vnto light shall dispatche awaye darknes brother perchaunce doo trespasse agaynste brother let eyther forgeue hys trespasse god maye forgeue also trespass done agaynste dede god hathe vpon condicion promysed forgeue v euer haue offended againste forgeue brother fault exacteth hys debte euen vttermoste farthinge whiche hauyng hys lorde mercifull vnto shewed selfe smally mercifull towardes felowe seruaunt saye iudgeth vnworthye mercye god seinge one frely forgaue trespass pardone smale offence vnto hym agaynst whome eyther trespasseth euery daye elles maye trespace man wyll easyly forgeue hym trespasseth agaynste hym whiche wyll remembre howe many wayes offendeth agaynst god agaynst neyghbour hard matter man offende nothing euen verye easye mater amende suche offence forgeuing one forgeue thou thy neighbour thy neyghbour shall forgeue thee agayne god shall euen couenaunt forgeue speake faultes chaunce euen among good yea among men faultes obscure lyght gospelles veritie rather extinguyshe god forbydde manslaughter whoredome sacrilege shoulde chaunce vpon life one chosen among chyldren god nothing allureth mercie god swageth wrath yf man acknowlage faulte god fearce cruel man forgeue acknowlageth faulte muche shall god mercifull man nature readyly bent vnto mercie hath promised v forgeuenes vpon condicion forgeue shalbe forgeuen vnto would forgeue good yet shuld forgeue iust faithful credence see thou accomplyshe prescribed condicion shal forget couenaunt whole harte forgeue neighbour offendeth v god shall also forgeue v onely one synne synnes power geue diligence may voyde vice yf able fully attayne vnto frayltie mannes body yet liberal free goodnes shal make good wantynge strengthes shall cleanse v offence perchaunce suffereth token olde former lyfe remayne stil v purpose acknowlage weakenes dede better content sinner misliketh selfe righteous standeth conceite would saluacion men shoulde ascribed vnto mercy merytes nowe hathe testified mortall manne yearth offendeth thyng yf wyl say haue synne v make wod lyar say agaynst hym gaynesayeth hym must nedes lye ii chapter texte lytle child thynges wryte vnto ye synne yf manne sinne haue aduocate father iesus christ righteous obteyneth grace sinnes sinnes onely also synnes worlde hereby sure know hym yf kepe commaundementes sayeth knowe hym kepeth commaundementes lyar verytie hym whose kepeth worde hym loue god parfecte dede hereby know hym sayeth abydeth hym ought walke walked thynges wryte lytle child synne comitted licenciouslye vpon truste mercye ordayned man shoulde synne muche v lyeth christ hath forgeuen v oure transgression requisite v applie al studious endeuours ende may kepe innocecie vndefiled yet chaunce v slide backe agayne sinne ther cause despayre forgeuenes haue god etreteable haue louing patrone trusty sonne obteyneth whatsoeuer wyll father wisheth hartylye wel vnto v gaue himselfe saue v vtterly botome heartes mislike selues geue diligence agayne better alone hath nothing pardoned maketh intercession synnes membres reconcfleth father whiche offended vnto v causeth hym bee mercyfull vnto v vnto v onely haue embraced h doctrine also vnto mankynde vniuersally yf syncere hearte confesse themselues sinner purpose leade innocente lyfe purposed go forward kepe substauncially baptisme doeth make v free obseruacion moses law purpose shoulde synne afterwarde licencious without punishement shoulde fi mely stycke loue gospell whiche causeth bee done wyllynge many lawes moses gette perforce costrayned comaunded many thinges smal rowme comauded men loue neighbour euen dyd v driueth v loue hym agayne enticeth v prouoketh v kindleth v whosoeuer knoweth god aryght cannot chose loue hym behemetly euery one professeth god hys mouthe knoweth god kyndled flame gospellyke charitie doeth wyllynglye gladly whiche dyd perfitely good euen vnto enemy saluacion neyghbour wyll stycke stad dauger life declareth hymselfe know god make hys boaste knoweth god beinge taught hys principle hath learned misteries fayth beinge baptised hath professed name neither al foloweth example charitie lyar neither hath yet fully learned knowe god asmuche god knowen excepte faythe garnyshed charitie whosoeuer lyar christ whiche trueth selfe dwelleth hym whosoeuer hath christ dwellyng hym liuely membre body faith without loue vayne matter deade bee short loue idle omitteth none thynges knoweth acceptable vnto hym loueth christ sayd would acknowlage hym disciple woulde take vp crosse folow hym walkyng foresteppes perfite charitie therfore obserueth saying declareth dede holdeth fast perfi e ryght euangelical charitie trial herof shal know body haue receyued hys spirit wherto doest make thy vaunt mebre christe thou art baptisme receyued flock christias idle professio fine fingred professio profession maketh true membre christe imitacion professeth mouthe regenerate christ must walke fotesteppes lyued selfe died himselfe gaue himselfe wholy v dyd good folkes gaue reuilynge worde agayne man whan nayled crosse prayed father spake reuilyngly agaynste gospellike perfite charitie whiche ought folowe dedes professe selues christes disciple texte brother write newe commaundement vnto olde commaundemet ye haue beginning olde commaundement worde ye haue heard beginning agayne newe commaundement write vnto true hym true also darkenes past true lighte nowe shyneth saieth howe lyght yet hateth brother darknes euen vntyll tyme loueth brother abydeth lyght none occasion euill hateth brother darkenes walketh darkenes tell whither goeth darkenes hath blynded eye dearely beloued thys commaundement charitie wryte vnto newe commaundemente euen moses lawe declared long agoe rather christe whiche renewed commaundement gospell renewed made peculiarly owne quod commaundement shoulde loue one another haue loued therfore neither new commaundement neither commaundement geue vnto ne yet suche one haue heard hitherto selfe commaundemente gaue vnto begynnyng thautorytie christe yet
