agayne newe write nowe vnto olde commaundement brought vse maners people iewes learned heart thou shalte loue lorde thy god thou shalte loue thy neighbour yet euery one serued gaine christ renewed thys vnto v yea loued v himselfe e loued neighbour loued enemy yea turned way wardly worthy euyll albeit knowe haue heard long ago yet ought renewed tyme tyme often rehersall maye sticke depely youre mynde seing chief matter gospelles profession true commaundement christ performed dede thyng taughte true long hated neighbour long recompenced euill worde euell worde wrong wrong true also synce true sprong vp lighte gospelles doctrine hath dispatched awaye darkenes former life hath taught none acceptable would loue good christes sake loue also bad ende couerted vnto christ folowe doctrine walke lyghte offende darkenes euill lustes hate neighbour powreth darkenes mynd therfore washe hath professed christ geueth ouer hate brother deceaued beleuynge walketh light yet darkenes god remitteth ye forgeueth brother ynoughe haue geuen ouer theft whoredom murdre baptisme except al holowhartednes also plucked quite mind stede hate charitie come place contynueth styll loue hys neyghbour abydeth lyghte christ iesus stombleth walking darknes true charitie farre hurtyng body suffreth thynges turneth thynges good contrarywyse hateth brother although haue geuen ouer offer vnto image although haue geue ouer vsurour churche robber yet styl darkenes seruing owne blynde lustes walketh darkenes neyther seeth strayght waye vnto saluacion althoughe gospell shyne clearely vpon long darkenes hate brother hath blynded eye hate reigneth iudgement blynde text babe write vnto howe sinnes forgeuen name sake write vnto father howe haue knowen begynning wryte vnto yongmen howe ye haue ouercome wicked write vnto lytle child howe ye haue knowen father haue written vnto father howe ye haue knowen begynnyng haue written vnto yonge men ye strong worde god abydeth ye haue ouercome wicked se ye loue world nether thinges worlde man loue worlde loue father worlde lust fleshe lust eies pride life father worlde worlde passeth awaye lust therof fulfylleth god abydeth euer loue euen mother loueth child write purpose partlie reioycynge felicitie partly exhortyng goe foreward better better reioyce deare child haue begotten agayne sede gospel doctrine vnto christ synnes former lyfe pardoned freely pardoned none cause haue professed name lorde iesu christe shoulde also remembre example frelye forgeue euerye one neyghbour write vnto muche processe age grauitie maners godly carefulnesse towardes yonger doeth make worthye name father reioyceing onely endued commune maner wisdome wherby olde men commended almost experyence thinges geue better counsel ignoraunte yong folkes haue reknowledged iesus christe autor saluacion whiche onely greate olde age also hathe bene alwayes wyth father great age knowe eternal fully knowe much diligently preache slenderer age olde folkes remembre kepe mynde many olde auncient thynges kepe mynde al age write vnto yongment strength faith haue ouercome wicked vnruly satan comune sorte yongmen thinketh themselues happie geue lightly place bodyly strength happie reason youre strength mynd could ouercome neither enticementes voluptuous pleasure ne wt terrours ye world men actiuitie florisheth battail actiuitie hath florished nobly assaultes deuils fleshe world write vnto childre although tendernes yeares skilled yet knowlage worldly matter yet haue already atteined thig getteth euerlastig felicitie childre first special toke wit acknowledge father knowe heauenly father regenerate vnto heauen let euery one maynteyne hath encrease hath cause sake bothe reioyce euerye one also warne euery order state acknowledgeyng felicitie geue thankes god youre autour hauyng remembraunce whither must go preace alwayes forewarde vnto perfeccio wil rehearse vnto therfore ye forget haue written vnto father knowe whiche hath nother beginnyng endyng desyre lyfe wyse stiere seyng make haste life neuer shal haue ende haue written vnto yongmen haue ouercome ruflynge nycenesse youth valiaunt strengthe mynde haue constaunte heart kepte worde gospell haue helpe christ ouercome deuill continuall enemye mankynde continue styll victorye contemne styll whyche haue hitherto contemned loue haue begon loue worlde enticeth false imaginacions transitorye goodes frayeth vayne false shewe euilles let thinges fraye whiche euill dede neuer haue ende let thinges catche good dede knowe none ende folowe lyght gospell loue heauenly thynges whiche heauenlye father promyseth vnto regenerate christ flee darknes naughtie lustes wherby worlde layeth bayte countrefaict goodes possiblie loue bothe one serue one none agrement betwene god worlde concorde betwene lyght darknes whosoeuer loueth worlde swarueth loue god father speake worlde god made wherin liue wil nil wiked gredy desire vayne thinges wherein common sort menne repose felicitie forgetting thinges truely good dede cal world place howe farre euer raymente meate title exemteth fro world mind pure desire spake hath world noisomly hurtful thre thinges chefely deceineth folishe vncircumspect folkes withall voluptuous pleasure fleshe enticementes eies hyghe statelynes proude galauntnes lyfe obiecteth certayne iugglinges vayne pleasure clawe sens bodye withall tyme mynde maye meane called awaye studie heauenlye good thynges desyre suche maner good thynges heauenlye spirite suggesteth god father geueth vnto childre truly regenerate christ deuill hath also spirite owne suggesteth pernicious loue thynges neyther true durable vnto haue bent themselues throughly vnto worlde suggesteth naughtye sportes lechery title mebres body withal folishe filthy itching delite suggesteth delite fyne meates drinke please paunche mouth wal suggesteth swetnes idlenes slepe mynde may waxe sluggishe throughe custume suggesteth wanton songes shameles fable anoynt eares withall suggesteth wanton enticementes beawties sondry kyndes thinges beholde delite eies withall suggesteth pompes ioylitie rich occasion ambicion finally allureth mennes myndes euery parte awaye true euerlasting good thinges vnto vayne imaginacions good thinges let entangled desire thinges knowe moued spirite heauenly father spirite worlde worlde lyke consisteth vpon elementes endure time euen geueth nothing whiche shall shortly perishe god like eternall euen geueth freely euerlasting rewardes therefore dependeth vpon succour worlde foloweth certayne felicitie vayne shall shortly taken awaie euen casualtie commeth vnthought vpon plucketh away worlde lest age dispatcheth truly death shall come vn euery man plucketh quite awaye dreame false pleasure whan mater taken awaye pleasure perisheth sorowes come place whan man taken away al gone naught euerlasting torment cometh place beieth vnto father calleth vnto loue heauenly lyfe felicitie shal neuer haue ende geueth knoweth none ende vnhurtfull commodity worlde vsed tyme yea smallye moderately necessitie nature voluptuouse fulfylling pleasure chiefe studye mynde ought turned thynges eternall whereunto vse thynges ought also referred text lytell child last time ye haue hearde howe antichrist shall come euen nowe theremany begonne antichristes already wherby knowe laste tyme went v v yf bene v would doubt haue continued v might appeare werenot v neuertheles ye haue oyntment holy ye knowe thynges haue written vnto though ye knewe trueth thoughe ye knewe knowe also lye commeth trueth lyar denieth iesus christe antichriste denieth father sonne whosoeuer denieth sonne hath father knowledgeth sonne hath father also let therefore abyde ye heard begynnyng felicitie godly men doeth yet appeare shalbe manyfestly opened commyng lorde iesu christ wicked seme lyue meane time swetely worlde euerlastinge sorowe geth ouerthem shortly laste tyme semeth present wherin course thinges turned vpsyde downe shall rayne christe formented nowe christes sake shalbe brought naught whiche nowe rebelles agaynst christe haue hearde antichrist shall come armed mayntenaunce iugglinges worlde shoulde kepe warre christe antichriste ouercomme againe body christe shalbe deliuered euils membres deuill shall laden burthen euilles therfore commynge thys antichrist apostle tolde semeth farre thys worlde hath muche preuayled agaynste doctrine gospell begonne euen nowe readye great sorte deserue name antichrist whose lyfe doctrine theyr hole studye agaynst christ appeare elles antichristes gentilmen husshers last token plage come lesse hurt vnto christes people vtterly straugers christ one conuersaunt castelles become runneagates assault christe christes owne garisons armour countrefaite euen thinges whiche declare christian vertue holynes doctrine auctoritie miracle christ dede went v howbeit matter much trouble conuersaunt among v none enemy christe euen whan dwelling castelles truely bene syde wolde haue continued stil thende v professed christ title behauiour mynde loued worlde vehemently therfore come stormes persecucions whan come flame affliccios haue shewed theselues nowe v extolle v body ouerlayed euil humour open enemy shall lesse hurt holowe harted companion thus christes wyll may euidently appeare belonge bodye christe washen name professe name partaker sacramentes churche true stedfast dispising world sheweth man christian mynde vnbroken vnconquered agaynst al wanton enticemetes agaynst iniuries sheweth man christian vpon occasion shrinketh doctrine christe dyd countrefaicte christianne christian dede expedient openly seperated v lest outward appearaunce seming good harme ware although vnknowen vnto yea withdrewe themselues openly vnccion christ wherof also named saye inspiracion spirite christ sheweth playnly ynough true christian spirituall man iudgeth althynges vnknowen borne al perchaunce woulde repent true saye neither doe wryte thinges vnto thoughe ignoraunt trueth seyng haue spirite christ teacher suffereth ignoraunt thing put remembraunce thyng know thintent myght surely sticke vnto trueth disquieted whan sorowes happen fewer sounder purely clensed quieter nothing taken away body though botche launced though corrupt matter runne knowe christ trueth kynde lyeng cleane contrarie whosoeuer holowharted dissembler christe hath nothing adoe howe faste euer professe mouthe manye facions lyenges lyar maner waye soeuer denieth christe whiche trueth receyueth mixture kinde lye agaynst trueth agaynst christ agaynste christe antichrist none wicked kynde lyeng denye iesus christ many false prophetes iewes whiche denie hym moses prophetes oracle long agoe promise vnto worlde reuenger autor saluacion promyse antichrist wote stede christe doubtles euer one playne antichrist agayne although professe mouthe iesus christe yet lyue sorte though doctrine vayne thoughe rewardes hathe promysed vayne taught pore spirite blessed kyngdome heauen abydeth man applieth al whole forcast end enlarge landes buylde royall house enhauce rente stuffe coafers money gotten hoke crooke aloft autoritie oppresse poore exercise tyrannie doeth cleane contrary vnto christ whose doctrine maketh lyar much hym lyeth christ taught blessed whiche hungre thirst ryghteousnes reposeth felicitie ryot pleasure paunche bely cheare doeth denye christ teacheth meke blessed shall possesse heauenly lande whence cast downe man thinketh happye yf oppressing pore establishe owne wealthe teacheth blessed whiche mourne world euerlasting comforte due vnto man thynges foloweth delicate pleasure worlde doeth denie christ teacheth thei blessed whiche mercifull towardes neyghbours pleaseth selfe owne accorde doeth sorowe better himselfe christe teacheth blessed whiche vexed reuylyng wordes affliccions rightuousnes gospelles sake man forcasteth al maner dissembling wyles please world christ acknowledgeth disciple taketh vp crosse shoulder foloweth man thinketh himselfe neuertheles christen man escape grief christe sayeth vnto vvorlde shall haue oppression shall haue peace yet vnto men christ heauie worlde swete commaundeth good euen vnto mannes enemye doth wrong man without deserte doth lyueth sorte resistingly denie christ mouth sayeth agaynst hys life doth whan sonne taught agaynst maners father sayed heare sayeth manne heare harde geare teacheth heare worlde therfore like resisteth sonne euen doethe repugne agaynste father seynge facion worlde disseuereth himselfe flocke christ hath chosen worlde christe hath nothing doe worlde glueth vnto repugneth agaynste christ playeth antichrist denieth father sonne father sonne vnseperable societie iewe wyll crye open mouthe agaynste acknowlage father sonne acknowlage soeuer thou trespacest agaynst sonne thou trespacest agaynst father sonne neuer taughte thing auctoritie father taketh sonne taketh father therfore estraungeth selfe felowship sonne neither pertaineth body christ whiche catholike churche hath felowshippe god father whiche agreeth thinges sonne see great ieoperdie foles disseuer themselues sonne therefore continue styll gospelles trueth receiued first surely tried apostle let lyeng tale false apostle drawe awaye texte ye hearde begynnyngest remayne ye also shall contynewe sonne father thys promes hath promysed v euen eternall lyfe thinges haue written vnto concerninge disceaue anoyntyng ye haue receaued dwelleth ye nede anye manne teache anoynting teacheth thynges true lye hath taught euen byde therin babe abyde shall appeare may bold made ashamed comming ye know righteous know also euery one doth rightewisenes borne yf continue stedfast thyng whyche delyuered fyrst vnto shal abyde felowship god father sonne iesus anye man thynke harde matter perseuer professynge gospell affliccions wicked thinke vpon rewarde god requireth harde matter rewarde greate promiseth promiseth nether rich kyngdome nether pleasure worlde lyfe euerlastynge byeth byeth good chepe although lose life thinges doe beate vpon put remembraunce many wordes beyng carefull lest wicked gone christ shoulde chaunce beguyle anye wyth theyr iugglynges albeit without warnynge thynke spirite christ selfe teacheth sufficiently haue continuall remembrauncer teacher youre heartes longe continueth styll nede man teache ought auoyde secret teacher sure teacher beinge receyued teacheth thynges like sonne hath also promysed spirite true nature lye therefore perseuer whiche hathe one taught holde ryghte doctrine remembre lacketh nothing persist still vnto commyng christe suppose farre beseche eftesones agayne lytle child persist doctrine spirite whan prince iudge shal appeare conscience good conuersacion maye geue v sure trust maye come forthe ashamed acknowledge v hys dysciples ashamed come syghte mouthe shall call hym mayster lorde yf haue neyther taken heede hys teachynge obeyed commaundement mouth shall call god father yf kynde life longe fro ordinaunces simple baptisme obserued righteousnes maketh v child god shall heare cast deuilles name iesu tolde thynges hande excelled miracle knovve taketh straugers seeth righteousnes gospell persuaded god autor thys righteousnes know also whosoeuer wordes endeuours doynges maners accomplysheth ryghteousnes gospell borne god vnto maye good conscience preace boldenes obedient child wonte preace mercyfull father withall wyll acknowlage lyke hym lyke hym acknowlage iii chapter texte beholde loue father hathe shewed v shoulde bee called dede sonnes god cause world knoweth knoweth hym dearely beloued sonnes god yet doeth appeare shawe knowe shall appeare shalbe lyke hym shall see hym euery man hath hope hym pourgeth hym selfe euen also pure whosoeuer committeth sinne committeth vnryghteousnes also sinne vnrighteousnes ye knowe appeared take away oure synnes hym synne many byde hym sinne whosoeuer sinneth hath sene hym neither knowen hym syncere loue trusty confidence feare awaye see therefore notable loue hath geuen vnto v whiche hauing contemned worlde entisementes terrours perseuer styl gospelles doctrine shoulde named onely faythfull seruauntes onely frendes child god christ taught cal vpo heuely father yf haue nede thynge moste high honour called child god moste high felicitie child god forasmuche cleaue vnto hym constaunt godlynes acknowlaged hym world acknowlegeth v abhorreth curseth v sedicious person meruayle though world acknowlage childre god seing acknowlageth god himselfe denieth sonne iesus let nothing trouble mindes dearely beloued world estemeth rascalles abiecte persones god haue euen nowe thys excellent dignitie sonnes god glad heartes feling selues spirite bondage child vpon assured confidence wherof crye abba father dignitie present dignitie hath yet appeared yet time batayle daye triumphe yet come daye shall declare vnto men howe greate dignitie haue howe greate felicitie haue constauntly shewe themselues child god yet come lyght shalbe comming christ howbeit hold thys vpon sure hope soone shall appeare rendre vnto euery one rewardes accordinge hys dedes worlde companion affliccions shall also companion ioyes lyke hym contempte worlde shalbe lyke hym also maiestie glorye sawe hym thys world afflicted lowe estate shal see euer hygh excellet seynge hym shall also transformed vnto hys iykenes onely myndes also bodyes see hym nowe howebeit myst eye fayth shal see hym maner cannot expressed thyng whiche shalbe perfitely must forcast nowe meane tyme vttermost possible power thintet may like hi glory let v pure fro fylthynes thintent maye see hym lette v clense eies nowe leste shall appeare glisterynge bryght bee vnto v dreadfull amiable fortunatelye sene lyke hym therefore whosoeuer hath thys confidence christe shal companion glory let hym meane time pourge hymselfe godly studyes cleane worldlye affeccions lyke hym maner fylthynes thys worlde together pure heauenlye therefore standeth v hande possible power bend endeuours thys ende nothyng remayne v yearthye dregges leite manne flatter hym selfe sayinge ynough vnto innocency trasgresse none thinges moses lawe forbyddeth thynges punyshed kynges lawes felonye sacrilege adultrie murdre maner synne vtterly eschewed whosoeuer offendeth meane although offende agaynst prescriptes moses yet synneth agaynst lawe gospell whiche greate deale holyer moses law thys cause sake christ came world shew waye whereby comming agayne shoulde become holesome luckye vnto v came take awaye one synne two al synnes onely subiect vnto maner synne purged v frely synne make v lyke manered vnto hymselfe whiche neither lawe mortall man coulde hable baptisme engraffed hys holy sacred body part endeuour meane tyme fall head engraffed owne free mercy shal fall awaye slyde backe agayne oure olde vice abydeth christ perseuereth innocencye wonderous ware shunne sinne may dayly growe vertues made lyke hys head absteyneth sinnes although bee baptised although called christian hath yet sene fully yet knowen hym yf sawe eies fayth greate dignitie chosen numbre sonnes god fylthy shame geuen father deuyll woulde abyde plucked awaye suche bodye departe suche father go kynde vnto fylthy tirannye slyde owne accorde awaye hygh rewardes vnto greate miserie text babe lette man deceyue doeth righteousnes righteous euen righteous committeth sinne deuil deuyl sinneth sence beginning thys purpose appeared sonne god looce workes deuyll whosoeuer borne god synneth hys seed remayneth hym synne borne god child god knowen child deuyll whosoeuer doeth ryghteousnes god neither loueth hys brother babe lette man deceyue flatteryng professyng name christian though ynoughe vnto felicitie iust speaketh iustice mouthe lyfe maners doeth iustice dede iuste lyke christe also shewed himselfe sayinges doynges example iustice truely wholy cleaueth fast vnto absteyneth much possible may vncleanes sinnes purenes maners selfe declareth hym sonne god whiche good nature knoweth synne synneth although haue receyued sacramentes christe yet begotten hys father deuyl whiche prince autor synne whosoeuer foloweth lyke father thing synneth declareth hymselfe sonne god alloweth felowshyppe synnes sent sonne thys intent worlde vanquis woorkes deuyll saye thynges contrarye repugnaunt agaynst charitie gospel adam borne endaungered sinnes god borne agayne sede gospelles doctrine longe strength seede abydeth man synneth neither synne wete loue god byddeth hym naye whiche loue rauisheth hym studye well doyng calleth hym awaye desire offendynge true sonne god resembling playnly behauiour disposicion father head title baptisme sacramentes descerne child god child deuyll puritie lyfe charitie expressyng wyng selfe wel doinges idle sheweth neither sheweth dede loueth brother borne god alyuely membre christes body woulde haue loued membres christe died texte thys tydinges ye beard beginninge ye shoude loue one another cayn whiche wicked slewe hys brother wherefore slewe owne workes euyll hys brother good meruayle brother though worlde hate knowe translated death vnto lyfe loue brother de loueth brother abideth deathe whosoeuer hateth hys brother man slear e knowe man slear hath eternall life abyding hym hereby perceyue loue gaue lyfe v ought gyue oure lyues brother whoso hath thys worldes good seeth brother haue nede shutteth vp compassion hym howe dwelleth loue god hym thys summe christen iustice thys christe gaue first vnto v set forth al thinges vnto shoulde louynge one declare youre selues sone god disciple christ dede hate neghbour step vnto murther malice cleane cotrary repugnaut wt charitie cain sonne god borne deuyll went kynde good maker became lyke deuill beyng strycken enuy first slewe man deadly stynge cayn resembled disposicion father sleaing abell hys brother cause hys hate lyfe alyke therfore contrarye kynde albeit bodely kinred naturall borne brother bothe resemble father abel innocet man kyndled studious mynde well dooinge cain contrariwyse hauinge conceaued hate brother forcasted howe amende himselfe slea brother lyke case wicked coulde abyde godlye deuilles childe coulde abyde childe god euen ought take maruai e brother thoughe men geuen worlde forsake hate giltles let man hate againe forsomuche vowed vnto deathe serue autor deathe imagine howe put deathe parte pitie doe one harme dede charitie gospell hath ledde v awaye studye harme dooinge vnto udie wel dooing token know predestinat vnto euerlasting life exempte tiranny death loue brother loueth bothe wisheth well doeth well body lyueth breathe soule liueth spirite christ wher brotherly loue spirite christ whosoeuer therfore hateth neighbour deade lyueth inwardly although haue faithe yet hath dead faith charitie present doe make fli te hating brother though light faulte hateth brother man lear hath thurst sword hath poisoned hi hath flowen vpon hath cursed onely wished euyll man law doeth damne man laughter god sight already damned manslaughter hath receyued hate one brest much ma ear many kyndes manslaughter slea th sworde suffreth punisshemet euen temporall lawes killeth poyson punisshed euen wicked sticketh brother darte venemous tongue although quitte mannes lawes crime manslaughter yet lawe gospel giltie manslaughter yet hitherto alyue hater wissheth euil vnto yet selfe al ready dead man lyfe safe hath lost euerlastinge lyfe owne murtherour wyll see brother howe muche ought farre desire harme dooing turne eies example christ loued v whan deserued nothinge yea whan deserued deathe spent lyfe v howe muche ought put lyfe daunger saluacio brethre yf occasion require namely succede christ shepherdes rowme co mitted shepe vnto peter keping whan thrise sayed loued h sheweth kynde death might vnderstonde saluacio flocke comitted vnto charge must defended euen losse lyfe wil spende lyfe grudgeth helpe money doeth thinke inoughe yf hurt brother yf speake gently christ declared dedes howe muche loued v seeth brother wat meate clothe drincke lodging hath substaunce releue nede withal moued co passio thoughe poynt charge letteth alone vnsuccoured ca beleued loue god heathe su coureth heathe doest christia succour thine eue christened thou haste professed brotherly loue thou haue truly present doeth ceasse case whan thy brother pyned nede thou callest brother shewest thou token brotherly affeccio texte babe let v loue word neither tong dede verytie hereby know verytie quyet heartes hym hearte condemne v god greater oure hearte knoweth thynges dear ly beloued hearte condemne v haue truste god warde whatsoeuer aske receyue hym kepe hys commaundementes thynges pleasant hys sight commaundement beleue name sonne iesus christ loue one another gaue commaundement kepeth commaundementes dwelleth hereby knowe abydeth v euen spirite hath geuen v babe let v loue one another wordes onely let loue hearte rather tongue let expresse selfe dedes rather speaking let worde brother dayly communicacion yea may true let dedes answerably like communicacion often occasion serueth let v declare true brotherly loue v dede let brother want thing haue whether desire coate meate lodging either coforte teaching admonicion thus doe readie good willes shall knowe token child trueth loue countrefaytlye purely trueth christe selfe vnto whose eye shall proue oure conscience allowed bothe god men dedes men shall knowe dissembled loue among v god loketh vpo puritie harte shal succour brother nede yea releue necessitie maintene riotous prodigalitie shal succour willingly without hope reward returne vnto v therfore nether dayne glory sake menne see mynde mynde knoweth selfe seene vnto eies god menne prayse v naughtie conscience condemne v howsoeuer deceaue men escape iudgement god man heart hathe secret passage fro doubtefull lurking hole nothinge hidden close god pearceth knoweth thinges better knoweth harte made harte hathe eies euery place present euery place dearly beloued yf harte condemne v vnto god yf mynde syncere vprightly playne yf doe mere pure loue doe suche shewe selues towardes neighbour suche one shal god shewe selfe v yf gladly good wyll forgeue brother faulte god shall easyly forgeue synnes also yf readily geue vnto nedy brother often desireth helpe shal sure trusty boldenes aske also god whiche shall perteigne saluacion necessitie nether shall denye askinges yf saye vnto forgeue u trespass vve geue trespasse u yet hate brother inwardly shal owne conscience crye v face askest thou god whiche thou deniest thy neighbour mouthe askest thou couenaunt whan thou thy selfe performest condicion promised forgeue v trespass yea doe heartely forgeue brother trespases saye mouthe forgeue hym yet kepe euyll wyll styll oure hearte oure naughty conscience shall take awaye confidence obteynynge thinge aske god bydde brother gently god spede helpe whan hathe nede helpe maye hope god helpe seinge helped brother turne deafe eare towarde hys commaundement turne deafe eare towardes prayer shamelesnes godlynes desire fauour hym whose commau dementes man doeth pa se vpon obserue comaundementes doe whatsoeuer shall please doe may allowed eies whiche seeth euery thing hereof shall conceaue sure confidence obteyne iewe supersticious law keper saye vnto kepe sabboth dayes washen faste absteyne forbydden meates dooe steale god shall heare thys commaundement talke forsothe shoulde repose whole hope confidence oure saluacion iesu christ sonne god whome father wyll geue thinges frely vnto v thys ynough forsothe must loue eche one according example comaunded whiche commaunded fyrst performe himselfe dede doeth yet truly loue christe hateth membre christe doeth yet loue christe wisheth euil man whome christe died therfore kepeth one commaundement loue kepeth g ue shall fast ioyned christ v againe hys spirite shall dwell oure harte charitie bee warme spirite christ autor hate free geuour brotherly loue layinge thapostles handes powred baptised leapeth backe flyeth awaye charitye happen bee quenched thys token therfore shall perceaue gi te spirit toke baptisme abydeth v brotherly loue contynue v still loke howe muche charitie waxeth colde muche holy gooste withdrawe selfe awaye iiii chapter texte dearely beloued beleue euery spirite proue spirites whether god many false prophetes gone worlde herby shall ye knowe spirite god euery spirite confesseth iesus christ come flesshe god euery spirite whiche confesseth iesus christe come flesshe god spirite antichrist whome ye haue hearde howe come euen nowe already worlde haue geuen token dearely beloued whereby may perceaue whether spirite christ sondry sortes spirites yea dissembling spirites naughtie spirites therfore doe vt erly beleue euery spirite many boast selues haue spirite god trye whether procede god thys worlde hathe also spirite hys owne pretendeth thoughe spirite god spirite god enspireth prophetes manye false prophetes gon worlde falsely saye speake inspiracion spirit god whan ledde spirit worlde therfore haue certayne argument spirit god heare speaker shall vnderstande euery spirite confesseth iesus christe autor euerlasting saluacion promysed long goe vnto worlde ready come hauing receyued humayne body like promysed prophetes god acknowlageth sonne god contrary wise denyeth forasmuche lyer god man doeth truly professe sonne onles enspired father doe onely denye speake woordes openly also lyue sorte though christe example godlynes vnto men though autor perfite saluacion feine messias loked christes doctrine muche variable theyr gredye lustes yf woulde haue fauoured voluptuous pleasure fleshe would haue promysed great substaunce rich woulde haue geuen honour empire world would haue long goe acknowlaged messias forasmuche doeth teache men despise thinges enriceth take vp theyr crosse telleth felicitie must loked worlde come deny olde promysed redemer mankinde bydde loke shoulde promyse co modities bodye goodes worlde nether ynough confesse christ onles confesse wholy entierly dyuideth either takinge awaye diuine nature whiche hath one father humaine nature toke woman hys mother spirit god spirit antichrist whiche spirite ye haue ready hearde come yea come already hathe doe whiche addicte worldly delices fight agaynst spirite christe texte lytell child ye god haue ouercome greater worlde worlde therfore speake worlde worlde heareth god knoweth god heareth v god heareth v herby knowe spirite veritie spirite erroure dearely beloued let v loue one another loue commeth god euery one loueth borne god knoweth god e loueth knoweth god god loue appeared loue god v warde god sent onely begotten sonne worlde might lyue thorowe herein loue loued god loued v sent sonne make agrement synnes cause afrayed sortes men litell child forasmuch god haue spirite haue ouercome antichristes dede youre selues weake dwelleth greater myghtier dwelleth worlde deuill fighteth agaynst hys membres god spirit defendeth forasmuche perteyne fashion worlde haue receyued spirite worlde wisely skilled worlde talke worldely matter doctrine acceptable gear vnto also geuen selues vnto worlde man dooeth lyghtly beleue enemye thinges whiche behemently loueth loue earthie thynges doctrine sauoureth earth god knoweth hym dede knoweth loueth herkeneth vnto v whiche teache heauenly thinges matter worthy god god heareth v abhorreth fro gospelles doctrine biddeth geue away ryches defye voluptuous pleasure reioyce affliccions esteme euen life selfe value righteousnes sake loke rewarde well done dedes resurreccion either beleue shal come woulde haue happen doctryne comaundeth also sincere loue spend euen man life neighbour sake man worldely spirite prouideth owne comoditie al handes yea euen wronging brother token therfore may knowe true spirite god false spirite worlde therfore dearely beloued forasmuche god worlde let v loue eche one let euery one serue neighbour profites rather loue god therfore garnisshed loue borne god doeth truly knowe god voide loue hath yet knowe god god hiselfe loue geueth selfe vnto v often geueth v loue hath declared loue v ward also declare towards neighbour man wil say acknowlage sone charitie wherby doe knowe father loue towardes v forsothe sent onely sonne whiche hath nothing dearer worlde gaue vnto death death shoulde atteyne euerlastyng lyfe also greater notable miracle loue beinge prouoked good turne loued v e notablie loueth louer agayne nothing thankeful haue humanitie except dyd loued worlde turned loue god yet god loued v fyrst hys owne accorde iustly offended oure synnes neyther anye manne vpon yearthe boyde synne coulde reconcile v vnto hym behoueth hym full grace muste make intercession vnto hym offended suche bee malefactor sente hys sonne downe heauen sacrifice hymselfe vnto father thys pure oblacion make hym mercyfull vnto v canne imagined notable thys loue thought feruent imagined plenteous texte dearely beloued yf god loued v oughte also loue one another man hath sene god anye tyme yf loue one another god dwelleth v hys loue perfecte v hereby knowe wee wee dwell hym v hathe geuen v hys spirite haue sene doe testifie father sent sonne bee sauiour worlde whosoeuer confesseth iesus sonne god hym dwelleth god god wee haue knowen beleue loue god hathe v god loue dwelleth loue dwelleth god god hym herein loue perfecte v wee shoulde haue truste daye iudgemente euen wee thys worlde feare loue perfecte loue casteth feare feare hath paynfulnes e feareth perfecte loue loue hym loued v fyrste yf man saye loue god yet hate brother liar howe loueth brother hath sene loue god hath sene commaundement haue whiche loueth god shoulde loue brother also dearely beloued yf god whiche hathe nede v hys owne accorde wyllyngly hath muche loued v ought also hys example loue eche one sonne god shewed hym selfe visiblye vnto v man hath sene god father tyme bodily eies yet perceyued euident token thynges feele hym angrye fele hym mercyfull fele hym absent fele hym presente hable testifie mutuall loue towardes god none argumente yf loue euery one lyke hathe loued v loued v frely without cause loued v thys purpose saue v yf loue eche one wise god loue sayed abydeth v comune loue beare good wil deserueth well loue hym hable requite oure loue testifie good one good turne loue god perfite towardes v loued v accorde loued v straungers loued v whome maner requitall coulde returne hym agayne loued v eue losse onely begotten sone loue neighbour semblable wyse loue god perfite v declaryng also god hymselfe v lyke one spirite knytteth membres body together maketh one body euen spirite god doeth maner glue together knytte bothe v hym euery one dryueth perforce one yf spirite god inspireth heartes loue neighbour stronge v doubtles knowe thys token bothe abyde god god lykewyse v therefore enemie vnto loue denyeth iesus sonne god whiche gaue hymselfe redeme mankind matter euen looker vpo sawe eies hearde eares handled handes matter many way prouedly knowe beare witnes whole worlde god sent sonne saue world death case woulde repent olde errours ordre life henceforthe accordyng rule gospell dyd onely sende hym saue nacion iewes gaue hym also sauiour al whole worlde therfore confesseth iesus sonne god prophetes prophecied shoulde come abydeth god god knoweth trueth embraceth loue acknowlageth loue god towarde doeth expresse neighbour v haue knowen experience beleue harte confesse wyth oure mouthe expresse oure workes dedes god hath bestowed vnto v remaineth shoulde perseuer whiche begonne offende god bothe plucked awaye v wee drawen awaye god god sayed loue therfore continueth styll loue continueth styll god god lykewyse hym mutuall knotte spirite god abideth wyl also haue token geuen whereby maye trye whether loue god bee perfite know owne conscience good dreade daye iudgement wherein shall seperated christe haue folowed christ shall quake shal heare horrible voyce departe looke daye trusty boldenes knowyng selues lyke conuersaunt world euen also worlde toke maner spotte worlde cleansed worlde owne fylthynes drewe muche hym hys purenes euen wee also oure power onely mingled worlde also rather driue teachyng gospell chaste example lyfe vnto christe dreade goddes iudgemente spryngethe euyll conscience feare therfore agreeth loue loue encreaseth assured confidence yf perfite shal dryue quite minde al feare glad often daye iudgemente commeth mynde first hauyng good opinion good god hauing selfe good conscience loue causeth gladnes feare causeth formentynge sorowefulnes moreouer afrayed declareth hymselfe therin yet perfite loue much wateth vnto loue much encreaseth feare afrayed lest shall fynde god iudge mercyfull vnto hym seyng shewed hymselfe vntractable vnto neighbour daye shal openly declare hath bene true louer thys worlde loue god meruaile seyng first loued v coulde hable loue hym excepte drewe v vnto hymselfe hys loue thys therefore loue god hys benefite finally loue god testifie louinge oure neighbour whome wyll loued man wyll saye loue god hateth hys brother lyar wycked moste parte doe onely loue god also beleue god yet al sort loue neighbour either kynsman ailiaunce acquaynted familiar leaste man seeth man lyke beastes loue euery one hys kynd instincte nature howe shall loue god whome hath sene tyme whan hateth hys neyghboure seeth furthermore howe standethe together loueth god passeth vpon commaundementes god man woulde crye loue kyng al setteth naught kynges proclamacions would man beleue hym haue thys speciall commaundement oure emperoure whiche loueth god shoulde also loue hys brother whether bee good badde yf good let hym loue christ hym yf badde let hym loue hym thys ende maye conuerted vnto christ v chapter texte whosoeuer beleueth iesus christ borne god euery one loueth hym whiche begat loueth hym also whiche begotten hym thys knowe loue child god loue god kepe commaundementes thys loue god kepe hys commaundementes hys commaundementes greuous borne god ouercommeth worlde thys victory ouercommeth worlde euen fayth ouercommeth worlde whiche beleueth iesus sonne god iesus christ came water bloud water onely water bloude spirite beareth witnes spirite trueth thre whiche beare recorde heauen father worde holy ghost thre one thre whiche beare recorde earth spirite water bloud thre one yf receyue witnes men witnes god greater thys witnes god greater whiche testifie sonne beleueth sonne god hath witnes himselfe beleueth god hath made hym lyar beleued record god gaue son thys recorde howe god hath geuen vnto v eternall lyfe lyfe hys sonne hath sonne hath lyfe hath sonne god hath lyfe soeuer beleueth iesus christ say must nedes aske al succoures salnacion beleueth hearte borne god called alredy numbre sonnes god dede chose loue ye sonne tha whosoeuer loueth heartely father loueth also ye borne wete brother whome hath one commune father toke proue doe truly loue child god yf first loue god selfe heartely nothing truely loued except loued sake loue god shall euidently appeare yf kepe commaundementes kepe chearfully gladly commaundementes none otherwyse greuous greuous louer greuous goeth post haste suche maner rewardes worlde obiecteth terrible appearaunces euilies pouertie vanyshement slaunder enprisonmentes whippinges deathes great fraye victorie made readye soeuer borne god ouercommeth worlde furniture doeth ouercome worlde rich garisons men engine warre worldly learning ouercome worlde cruelly rageing throughe stedfast onely faithe wherwith committe selues wholy vnto god protectour thy rich snatched awaye yea sayeth faithe thou haste treasure heauen thou art throwen vanished man yea countrey heauen loketh countreyman thy body turmoyled tormentes yea bought euerlasting ioyes death deuised yea shall folowe lyfe neuer shall dye ouercometh worlde lorde riche man philosopher kyng soeuer beleueth verely iesus sonne god beleue hath promised shal nothing moue thee whatsouer worlde purposeth thee ouercame world first atteyned immortalitie came world hauig take mortal body get victorye v shew meane victorye getting cause rewardes certaynely reckoned vpon furniture came armed withall came water bloude euen iesus christe water myght washe v cleane synnes bloude myght geue v immortall lyfe hys owne wyll baptised beinge cleane voyde synne myght frelye geue vnto v innocencye hys owne wyll dye crosse myght open vnto v waye vnto immortalitie dyd onelye testifie two token christ sauiour worlde receyued baptisme synfull man dyed malefactour one onely none among innocent synne spirite also appearynge likenes doue bare recorde father geuen sauyour worlde spirite also trueth father sonne one trueth like one nature three heauen beare recorde vnto christ father worde spirite father whiche sending eftsones voice downe heauen testified openly dearly beloued sonne nothing coulde doe amisse worde whiche hauing done many miracle whiche death resurreccion declared selfe true christ bothe god man peacemaker betwene god men holy gooste whiche descended vpon head whan baptised resurreccion fell vpon disciple three one perfite agrement father autor sonne messanger holy goost remembrauncer three thinges also earthe beare recorde vnto christ humayne spirite whiche put one crosse water bloode ranne syde whan deade three witness doe agree declared god recorde man iohn also bare witnesse yf receyue witnesse men reason witnesse god importaunce v testimonie god father manifest thys vvelbeloued sonne vvhom pleased heare thing spoken plainly fully beleueth truly goddes sonne iesus christ hath reposed al succour lyfe trusting promisses contemneth thinges worlde make shewe whether amiable dreadfull hathe witnesse selfe beareth witnesse vnto sonne god whan throughe thinspiracion spirite christe defieth euen deathes loue beareth trifling witnesse vnto vaine thiges christ hath taught promised trusteth god putteth trust worlde muche maketh god lyer whiche hath promised felicitie vnto woulde herke vnto sonne iesu christ conuersacio teacheth felicitie asked worlde cleaueth vnto comodities lyfe thoughe nothing man remayned deathe bodye father cryeth heare lyfe beleueth sayeth heare worlde whan sonne prayed father whiche beleued shoulde beleue might haue eternall lyfe father voyce heard testifiyng sound trompet prayer allowed father therfore hath geuen v euerlastyng lyfe shewinge whome asked euen sonne iesus christe doctrine soeuer embraceth example whosoeuer foloweth hys promise whosoeuer trusteth vnto bothe possedeth sonne hath life pledge wherof kepeth meane time euen spirite god throughe vndoubted confidence whereof bolde call god father straunger sonne estraunged also lyfe texte thinges haue written vnto beleue name sonne god ye maye knowe howe ye haue eternall lyfe ye maye beleue name sonne god thys trust haue hym yf aske thyng accordinge hys wyll heareth v yf knowe heare v whatsoeuer wee aske knowe haue peticions desire hym man see brother sinne synne vnto death let hym aske shall geue hym lyfe sinne vnto death synne vnto death whiche saye man shoulde praye vnrighteousnes sin ther synne vnto death knowe whosoeuer borne god synneth begotten god kepeth himselfe wicked toucheth hym know god worlde together set wickednes knowe sonne god come hath geuen v mynde knowe hym whiche true wee true sonne iesus christ god eternal lyfe babe kepe selues image amen thinges therfore doe repete beate vnto many wordes lest man shoulde persuade vnto contrarye take sure vndoubted certayntie true whiche haue beleued euerlastynge lyfe ordayned throughe iesus christe whose ioyned felowe heires haue already ryght clayme gage shall haue possession thyng selfe hys tyme therefore beleue sonne god beleue stedfastlye put youre sure trust hym daylye wyll fayle promyses euerlastyng lyfe fayleth nowe euen thys lyfe dede spirite christe geuethe confidence vnto whatsoeuer shal aske name ye sonne obtaine ye aske according hys wyll yf suche come praye woulde haue come saye pure maner hate brother obteyneth nothyng goddes hande neyghbour obteyneth forgeuenes fault aske thinges auaileable lyfe heauen make glorye christ elles moste parte knowe shoulde aske god many tymes holsome thynges desire hurtfull thynges yf spirite christe put v mynde expedient v aske ofte aske thys sorte sure god heareth oure prayer sure wyll frely geue v whatsoeuer shall aske hath promised v hable performe whatsoeuer promiseth wyll performe whatsoeuer holsome v neither shall onely encrease giftes v prouoked therunto oure prayer also wyll pardon v oure daylye offence without whome feblenes man nature scarcely hable endure longe shall onely pardon euery one hys offence yf desire pardon shall also heare brother praying brother offence sinne bee suche sorte doeth quenche brotherly loue althoughe doe somewhat obscure synne cannot bee imputed vn weakenes healed lyght easye remedy whan manne vpon sette malyce persecuteth christen felowshyppe hymselfe hath professed christe pretence religion goeth aboute subuert religio desperate frowardnes suche one deserueth prayer godly menne yet perfite charitie prayeth also suche wyshynge thynges cannot possiblye done manne prayeth deuyll doeth wittynglye throughe malyce oppugne whome god woulde well vnto perhappes prayer also made translated hys affeccion rather shunned doe harme bee releued prayer excepte shewe hope repentaunce suche disease nedeth strong remedy greater bee taken away dayly praiers wherby lighter offence taken away done feble weakenes purposed frowardenes whatsoeuer committed besyde perfite righteousnes sin many difference synnes synne whiche althoughe demynyshe blotte innocencye yet vtterlye quencheth christian charytye whan occasion ouershote worde agaynste oure frende whiche sory ouer shot v whan sodayne angre hath russhed worde wee woulde wyshe myghte bee called backe agayne whan throughe swetenes meate drynke receyuyng wee take somewhat necessitie nature doeth require pardon offence god easie yf bee called vpon mutual prayer suche maner faultes child gentyll parentes doe moste parte wynke whiche woulde suffre greater offence albeit none lyght faulte ought neclected whatsoeuer done amysse euyll bee eschewed godlye folkes yf bee neclected drawethe lytell lytell vnto deathe lyke spedye remidy oughte lighter offence whiche men scarce hable auoyde euen god forbydde whiche hath renounced worlde dedicated hymselfe vnto god shoulde tombled backe agayne anye greate notable cryme professing ye gospel made childre god membres christ conuenient child diffre greatly father membres head therfore throughlye vnderstandeth borne god taketh hede doe euyl deathe selfe kepeth hymselfe haue nothynge doe naughtie lorde deuill serued together worlde lyke christe beynge dead rose agayne lyfe rose agayne lyfe neuer dye euen throughe baptisme dead vnto worlde risen againe newnes lyfe christ mete hym doe thynge agayne whyche christe must dye agayne let affrayed worlde whiche truely borne againe god haue al pith whole heartes receyued seede gospelles doctrine knowe wee truely god whome neyther euyll thynges good thynges thys world seperate christe whole world set together naughtines whiche waye soeuer man turneth hym occasion offred thynges turne v awaye quite innocent vpryghtnes lyfe worldes enchauntmentes sonne god hathe delyuered v whiche came worlde thys cause exempte v contagious infeccion worlde hathe dryuen awaye darkenes oure former ignoraunce hathe geuen v vnderstandyng lyghtened lyght gospell thintent knowe true god free geuer al righteousnes onely nothyng doe worlde hym truely folowe hys doctrine promyses vpryght conscience longe wee hys sonne iesus christe whome sent worlde intent true god whiche onely ought honoured true lyfe whiche onelye oughte bee desyred lytell chyldren yf doo truelye knowe true god beware false goddes vayne image whyche worlde hathe honoure wurshyppeth idole maketh moneye hys god wurshyppeth idole maketh hys bely hys god wurshyppeth idole worldelye honoures sake despysethe commaundementes god manye suche kyndes image beware yf wyll abyde wurshippe true god whyche humble prayer myne vouchesafe make good whose goodnes wee delyuered oure erroures amen thus endeth paraphrase vpon fyrste epistle sainct iohn paraphrase erasmus roterodame vpon seconde epistle iohn text elder electe lady child loue trueth onely also haue knowen trueth truthes sake whiche dwelleth v shall v euer v shall grace mercie peace god father lorde iesus christ sonne father trueth loue reioysed greatly founde thy child walkynge trueth haue receaued commaundement father beseche thee lady thoughe wrote newe commaundement vnto haue beginninge loue one another loue walke commaundement comaundement ye haue heard begynning ye walke init many deceauers entred world confesse iesus christ come flesh deceauer antichrist loke selues lose haue wrought may haue ful reward whosoeuer transgresseth bydeth doctrine christ hathe god endureth doctrine christ hath father sonne come vnto bring learning receaue house nether bid god spede byddeth god spede partaker euil dedes behold haue tolde ye ashamed day lord many thinges write vnto neuerthelesse would wryte paper ynke trust come vnto speake mouth mouth oure ioye maye full sonnes thy electe syster grete amen iohn elder wryte vnto electe lady sonnes also whome loue syncerely nether doe thus alone al haue knowe trueth gospelle nether doe loue cause vnderstande synceritie gospelles profession folowe remayne v shall remayne v euermore grace mercie peace alwayes encreased god father lorde iesu christe vnto perseuer still trueth gospelles doctrine mutuall loue one another wonderfully glad whan perceaued thy sonnes folowing theyr mother godlynes contynued still truthe gospelles doctrine gaue herkenynge vnto false doctours goe turne many awaye father gaue v thys comaundement shoulde geue eare doctrine hys sonne shoulde goe fotesteppes therfore nede nowe ladye instructe thy godlynes new commaundementes let v continue still whiche deliuered begynninge shoulde loue eche one mutual true christian loue beneuolence consent one facion godly life amonge oure selues must procure may lyue one purposed study commaundement god enioined v nothing diligetly mutual loue amonge oure selues true loue amonge wiked among vnlike facions therfore geue new commaundement geue warninge diligently continue still haue already receaued longe goe suffre youre selues subtilties false prophetes plucked awaye dede manye deceauers worlde whiche denye iesus christe whiche shoulde come worlde accordinge prophetes prophecienges teacheth thus deceauer antichriste self christes aduersarie let euery one take hede hym selfe leste forsake whiche hathe well begonne lose frute thinges whiche hathe hitherto done well let v geue diligence may receaue full hyre happeneth perseuer still vnto theende whosoeuer swarueth trueth abydeth still doctrine christe estraunged also god father swarued sonne constauntly foloweth doctrine doinge dearely beloued vnto father sonne one canne neyther forsaken without thys true doctrine whiche haue receaued true recorde bearours begynnyng man come vnto bringeth contrary doctrine carye away gospelles veritie ought onely take hede vnto also ought muche admitted house desyre lodging bidden god spede chauce mete way daunger lest infecte household familiaritie hys lodging requite euill turne lest bidding god spede arise communicacion dede euil communicacio corrupteth good maners shorte saluteth kepeth company maner deceauour semeth companyon euill dooinges geueth courage vnto wicked whan seeth selfe whit regarded whome goeth subuerte geueth outwarde shewe euill vnto though semed fauour naughtynes hym whose familyaritie doeth abhorre many thinges whiche desyrous wryte vnto concerning matter howbeit rather open presentlye put wryting truste shortly come see talke presently mouth mouthe ioy whiche haue conceaued youre constaunt synceritie maye bee pleynteous full whan shall bothe presentlye see beinge absent heare againe shall see eye loue beare towardes thy nephewes thy sister sonnes whiche christian woman commend vnto thende seconde epistle iohn paraphrase de erasmus roterodame vpon third epistle iohn text elder vnto beloued bayus loue trueth beloued wyshe thinges thou prosperedst fatedst well euen thy soule prospereth reioysed greatly brother came testifyed trueth thou walkest trueth haue greater ioye heare howe sonnes walke verytye beloued thou doest faithfully whatsoeuer thou doest brother straungers beare witnes thy loue congregacion whiche brother thou brynge forwardes theyr iourney godly sorte thou shalt well hys name sake went forth toke nothinge gentyls therfore ought receaue myght helper trueth wrote vnto congregacyon diotrephes whiche loueth haue preemynence among receyueth v wherfore come declare hys dedes whiche doeth iestynge v malycious wordes nether therwith content onely himselfe receiueth brother also forbiddeth woulde thrusteth oute congregacion beloued folowe whiche euyll good doeth well god doth euyll seeth god demetrius hath good reporte men trueth selfe yea oure selues also beare recorde ye know oure recorde true many thynges wryte ynke penne wryte vnto trust shall shortly se shall speake mouthe mouth peace vnto louers salute grete louers name elder vnto louynge manne gaius whome loue syncerely dearly beloued doo wishe prayer iesu christ like thy soule doeth prosperouslye well continuynge stedfastly gospelles doctrine euen may also doe prosperously al matter christ thy good spede haue conceaued small pleasure saying brother whiche come vnto v haue made reporte thy synceritie beinge true witnesse bearours thou truly folowest trueth gospell onely profession also thy study thy whole life matter maketh harte glad chaunce heare childre begat gospell vnto christ doe folow trueth delyuered dearly beloued thou art diligentlye good vnto christian whiche come thider straungers thou dooest dede worthy hym truly putteth trust gospel loueth christ haue made reporte thy synceritie whole companye christian thou shouldest doe well thou wouldest bring whome thou receiuedest gently coming forth like gentilnes thither would goe like goe god busines theyr owne deserue entreated loue god hartily thei went forth market encrease theyr owne household pelfe preach name lord iesu christ whose doctrine distribute vnto heathen take nothinge thintente maye bringe frute vnto christe whome labour doe god defende suspicion hastinge hande making dede besemynge v receyue suche oure house prouyde want nothinge necessitie theyr lyfe may behalfe partaker thinges done vnto glorye god christ hathe promised receiueth prophete prophet shoulde haue rewarde prophet haue written hertofore already vnto congregation doe warne howbeit diotrephes withstandeth doeth receyue monicions hauing rather ring leader among low degre pure disciple christ hauing rather autour new herisye true folower olde enangelicall doctrine wherfore come vnto warne hym hys doinges wherof thinketh peraduenture ware naughtie manne chattreth malicious wordes againste v thintent myght take away credence autoritie v among whiche exhorte continue still doctrine gospell nether beinge herewith contente doeth onely receyue brother also forbiddeth woulde receyue disturheth congregacion man frowardnes suche good louinge brother folowe whiche euill good parte suffre nanght folow theyr example child god haue receyued baptisme declareth faithe godlye dedes berne god resembleth disposicion doctrine hys father doveth wickedlye although professe god wordes yet doeth see god truly sene moste purely scowred eies faith lurred darkenes vice therfore auoyde example diotrephes set demetrius thy eye godlynes reported men whiche although would saye nothing yet thinge selfe maketh reporte mannes veetue yea selues hauinge experience hys synceritie beare witnesse hym know beare true witnesse hym also many thinges whiche desyrous thou shouldest knowe thought expedient put wryting trust shall come vnto shortly shall presently commune thinges surely fully peace vnto thy frendes commende vnto salute thou frendes agayne theyr behalfe dilygently name thus endeth third epistle iohn p paraphrase comentarie vpon reuelacion iohn faythfullye translated edmond alen firste chapter texte p reuelacion iesus christ whiche god gaue vnto shewe vnto seruauntes thinges must shortiye come passe whe sent shewed angel vnto seruaunt iohn whiche bare recorde word god restimonye iesus christe thinges sawe happye readeth heare wordes prophesye kepe thinges wrytten therin tyme hande vnto sauiour iesus christe manhode geuen god father onely sufficiencie fulnes grace also knowledge reuelacion suche secret mystery shoulde happen tyme tyme christendome vntyll suche tyme shoulde come againe vnto lattre iudgement whiche secretes sauiour christ dyd reuele open throughe angel vnto electe seruauntes specially vnto holy iohn meane vnto iohn whiche bare wytnes worde god iesus christ dyd recorde suche matter doctrine himselfe sene lerned whiche doctrine shall profytable vnto euery one shall reade vnderstande prophecye far shal endeuer himselfe lyue therafter preparinge appointynge himselfe thorowe true faith christen conuersacion please lorde lyfe whiche shorte transitorye ende therof vncerten texte p iohn seuen congregacions asia grace vnto peace whiche whiche whiche come seuen spirites whiche trone iesus christ whiche faythful witnes first begotten dead lorde ouer kynges earth vnto loued v wasshed v synnes awne bloude made v kynges prestes vnto god father glorye dominion euermore amen lytle asia notable church congregacions set vp institute holy apostle speciallye paule vnto whiche also peter wryteth confirmeth faythe vnto dothe iohn wryte specially consyderacion doctrine shoulde concerne church generally whiche tyme standynge shoulde afterwarde institute thorowe whole world wysheth vnto muche good thincke dyuyfe god whiche onely gyuer good thinges remayneth euer vnmutable ruleth gouerneth thinges wherunto vseth ministracio seruice angel infynyte nombre whiche thing nombre seuen dothe sygnifye accordynge vnto vse holy scripture eternall father holy spirite one god reygneth lord iesus christ appointed ye ruler al thiges heauen earth al sensyble creature gostly ye spirites bodily man nature loue toward mankinde set ye comforte wealth whole world testifyed faithfully vnto al ye world ye wil father gospel accordyng promysed prophetes shoulde founder performer newe testament offered vp dye synnes whole world resurrectio vprisynge againe bodye soule shoulde goe resydue faythfull guyde vnto euerlastynge lyfe whiche lyfe onely hath meryted purchaced thorowe perfyte obedyence vpon erosse vnto death therefore exalted concernynge manhode aboue creature hath receyued moost worthiest hyghest name tytle named eyther world worlde come hath purchaced deserued holy elect child god honour glorye euerlastynge kyngdome also grace rule gouerne selues vertuouslye offre vp dayly continually pleasant sacryfyce thanckes geuynge true faith god thorow iesus christ vnto hym therfore alone parteyneth honour glorye texte p beholde commeth cloudes al eye shal see also pearsed kynreds earth shall wayle ouer euen amen euen despyte wyll mynde crucifyed christ woulde take knowledge kyng yet commeth hyghest maiestye whiche excelleth glorye power otherkynges euer nowe sheweth hym selfe appeareth thorowe fayth vnto electe messias sauiour worlde whiche long desyered loked whan shal come latter daye iudge quycke deade shall iewes vnfaythful whiche despysed first commynge whan came suche humblenes crucyfyeng putting death woulde receyue knowledge hym sauioure messias shall see feare tremblyng shall appeare dreadfull vnto texte p alpha omega begynnynge endynge sayeth lorde almighty whiche whiche whiche come iohn brother companion tribulacion kyngdome pacience iesu christe yle called pathmos word god witnessynge iesus christ doth christ speake declare godly maiestye eternall substaunce almyghtye power without ende begynnynge speaketh maner grecian amonge whiche alpha first letter omega last speaketh iohn euangelist owne parson without worldly boasting reioysyng becommeth christe man honour ryches ye world yet holynes ye himselfe onely ye affliccions persecucios pacience mysery partycypacion ye rightuousnes christ wherof witnes partener sufferyng christes sake thing hapned vnto gospel ye procurement commaundemet domicianus emperour would haue bene honoured god iohn taught onely lyuynge god none el ought honoured called vpon whiche cause iohn banyshed sent pathmos god dyd shewe reuelacion vnto bad wryte meanes thorow wryting set furth ye glorye christ banyshemet tha euer bene able haue done wordes preachinge onely yf styll remayned amonge frendes countrey texte spirite sondaye hearde hynde great voyce bene trempe saying alpha omega first sast thou seest wryt booke sende vnto seuen congregacions whiche asia vnto ephesus vnto smyrna vnto pergamos vnto thiatira vnto sardis vnto philadelphia vnto laodicia lordes daye sondaye whiche holy apostle thoroughe holy goost receyued whytsontyde institute sanctyfyed kept holy christen churche steade iewes sabboth day without necessarye laudable expediente consyderacions eusebius wryteth iohn dyd rule churche ephesus paules death lyke wyse also church asia therfore commauded christ place sende wrytynge vnto forasmuche know best processe tyme myght common vnto church edefyeng instruccion came also passe vnto also wrote gospel delyuered pathmos heretykes whiche began tyme ryse texte p turned backe se voyce spake whan turned sawe seuen golden candelstyckes myddes candelstyckes one lyke vnto sonne man clothed lynnen garment downe fere gyrde aboute pappes golden gyrdle heade heares white whyte woll snowe eye flame fyre fere lyke vnto brasse thoughe brent forna voyce sounde many warers ryght hande scuest rres mouthe went sharpe two edged swearde face shone euen sunne strength sygnifyed seuen golden candelstyckes vii starres shall christ himselfe hereafter declare whiche beyng god yet euery condicion synne excepte lyke vnto v man nature spirite ayde gouernynge present church shall remayne vntyll worldes end clothed innocencye holynes reason wherof made oblacion owne synnes also gyrded heauenly myght power alwayes redy glad helpe faithfull heade full godly heauenly wysedome whiche knoweth thinges euerlastynge loketh fearfull face terryble grim countenaunce al vnfaythfull pleasant louyng countenaunce towarde electe faythfull beleuers ready hote flamynge burnyng fete stampe peces destroye wycked vngodly voyce holy gospell whiche neyther gate hell power vpon earth hell enemyes ouercome thoughe paule begynnyng beyng blynde ignorante thought hoped ye cotrary wicked emperoure nero lykewyse dyuerse withall suche lyke alwayes stryken ouercomme sworde almyghtye worde god vnto godly faythfull ioyfull comfortable syght pleasant delectable bryghtnesse clearnes sonne vnto earthly creature texte p whan sawe fell fete eue dead layde right hande vpon sayinge vnto feare first laste alyue dead beholde alyue euermore haue keyes hell death wryte therfore thinges whiche thou hast sene thinges whiche thinges whiche must fulfylled mysterye seuen starres whiche thou sawest right hande seuen golden candelstyckes seuestarres messenger seuen congregacions seuen candelstyckes whiche thousawest seuen congregacions holy apostle euangelyst dysciple christ loued able suffre abyde presence christes glorified manhode howe wyll wicked enemyes truth godlynes abyde wyll doe howe christ firste laste god man laluacion selfe yet crucified synner rose vp againe death ascended heauen receyued power ouer al creature nedeth interpretacio againe holy congregacions church haue propre peculiar angel leade guyde wayte vpo serue god ordinaunce defende preserue seconde chapter texte p vnto messenger congregacio ephesus wryte thinges sayeth holdeth seuen starres right hande walketh myddes se golden candelstyckes knowe thy worckes thy labour thy pacience howe thou c nest forbeare whiche euyll hast examined whiche saye apostle hast founde lyars hast suffred haste pacience name sake hast labored hast faynted maner churche ephesus paul behaued hym selfe wrought howe tymothye preached taught false prophetes dyd enterpryse sene epistle paule ephesian sufficientlye descrybed erasmus paraphrase epistle reade thereof christen godly story eusebius v boke xxiiii chapter wordes mayst thou vnderstande hyghe prayse commendacion faythe wherof good workes beare sufficient wytnes recorde also noted place men shoulde lyghtly rashely beleue maner doctrine first trye proue whether god ouercome conuince al maner errours false doctrine onely worde god whiche contrary vnto selfe yf one place iustly compared another profytable vnto true perfyte vnderstandynge knowledge god iohns tyme paule come vnto rome certen heretykes ephesus namely cherinthus hebyon marcio lyke also paules time himeneus alexander philetus hermogenes al wer ouercome wt muche adoe thorow long paciece godly bishop ephesus one succedyng another eusebius maketh mencion texte neuertheles haue somwhat thee thou hast left thy first loue remebre therfore f whence art fallen repent doe first workes elles wyl co e vnto shortely wil remoue thy candelsticke place excepte repet thou hast thou hatest dedes nicolaitans dedes also hate let hath eares heare spirite sayeth vnto congregacions ouercommeth wyll geue eate tree lyfe myddes parady e god faintnes coldnes faith doe spring want lacke ryght good workes euen came passe ephesus meanes false apostle paule prophecye vnto myletus cause lorde requireth exhorteth amede threatneth maner al prophetes wyll el punyshe condemne concernynge secte nycholaites reade xxix chapter thirde booke eusebius chronicle whosoeuer thorow true faith loue shall ouercome teptacions assaultes enemy shall receyue enioy euerlastinge reward blisse fruicion god heuenly father pleasant sight ye countenaucethe tree lyfe iesus christ euerlastinge ioye nameth place tree lyfe texte p vnto angel congregacion smyrna wryte thinges sayth first laste dead alyue knowe thy worckes tribulacion pouer ie thou art ryche knowe blasphemy whiche call selues iewes congregacion satan feare none thinges whiche thou shalt suffre beholde deuyll shall caste pryson tempte ye shall haue tribulacion ten dayes faithfull vnto death wyll geue crowne lyfe let hath eares heare spirite sayth congregacions ouercommeth shall hurte seconde death false apostle whiche conuerted iewes vnto faythe also smirna busye vnquiet maynteynyng ci cumcysion iewyshe ceremony whiche trew apostle dysciples paule suche fayne fyght stryue reason wherof church world perplexyte dysquieted place christ speaketh vnto smirna calleth poore affliccions ryche faythe vertue thus teacheth worcke deuyll man whansoeuer thou arte caste perplexyte vexacion pryson faythe truthes sake therfore pacient seyng heauenly father permytteth suche power vnto sathan euen dyd happen citye vnto good bishop polycarpus one iohns dysciples whiche burnt vnfaythfull truth christen faythes sake ye maye reade xiiiithe seconde death xv chapter iiii boke eusebius chronicle seconde deathe vnderstande euerlastynge deathe damnacion first death deathe bodye synne whiche shall delyuered raysedthe fyrste death vp againe thorowe trewe faythe confydence mercye god ioyned perfyght repentaunce texte p messenger congregacion pergamos wryte saythe whiche hath sharpe swearde two edge know thy worckes thou dwellest euen satan seate thou kepest name hast deuyed fayth dayes antipas faithfull wytnes myne whiche ayne amonge satan dwelleth haue fewe thinges thou hast maynteyne doctrine balam whiche taught balake put occasyon synne child israell shoulde eate meate dedycate vnto ydoles commyt fornicacion euen hast thou maynteyne doctrine nicolaitans thing hate conuerted el wyl come vnto thee shortly wyll fyght swearde mouthe let hath eares heare spirite sayeth vnto congregacions ouercommeth wyl geue eat manna byd wyl geue whyte stone stone newe name written whiche man knoweth sauynge receaueth cocerning church reade maner accion worke faith therof al notable city right christe bothe christened vnchristened iewes styre vp cause much sedicion tumult accustomed maner prouoked also lyuetenauntes rome alwayes hate persecute right true christias happened citie vnto deare faithful seruant god antippe wt doubt preached gospel truly syncerely therfore faine suffre death city wher god word codemned al godly men continual perell danger lyues goodes wher doe blesse curse money balaam abhominable fylthines whoredo mainteined suffered ydolatry set vp wher holy matrimonye estimacio without doubte dwelleth deuil small synnes odious hateful vnto god maye repent amende obteyne mercye god thorowe grace ayde god maye withstande ouercome suche damnable outragious enormyties whiche thing yf doe let loke nothinge sure eternall damnacion ought moue harte men feare shrugge maye repent amende lyues manna vnderstande worde god true harty loue cleauemanna faste vnto christ strong stedfast faith whiche thing syngular pleasure delyght vnto godly faithfull poyson vnto vngodly vnfaithfull white stone sygnified eleccion appoyntmentthe whyte stone vnto euerlastyng honour god sainctes bothe worlde worlde come testimonye good conscience feareth god right harty ioye also euerlastynge peace rest sure confydence grace fauoure god vnto euerlastynge lyfe texte p vnto messenger congregacion thiatira wryte saith sonne god whiche hath eye lyke vnto flamme fyre hys fete lyke brasse knowe thy worckes thy loue seruyce fayth thy paciece thy dedes whiche moo last fyrst notwithstandynge haue feawe thinges agaynste thou sufferest woman iesabell whiche called selfe prophetise teache deceaue seruauntes make commyt fornicacyon eate meates offered vp vnto ydoles gaue space repent fornicacyon repented beholde wyll cast bedd comyt fornicacyon great aduersitye excepte u ue theyr dedes wyll kyll chyldren death learne sonne god whiche hath two edged swearde first laste whiche deade yet lyueth hathe seuen starres gouernoure heauen earth one thinge namely messias whiche beginninge world sauiour al faithfull lorde iesus christ thiatira cathedrall churche one notable city lydia churche dothe spirite christ commende prayse well dyuerse vertues also waxing bygge increasyng rebuketh synne heades ouerseets neglygent doe roote reforme certen wyckednes seruice honouring ydols fals goddes hyghe blasphemy doe alwayes accompany wayte vpon ydolatrye whiche thingiesabel sygnified wycked supersticious woman iesabell woman reade first kynges xviii xxii chapter ii ye kynges ix x chapter al posteritie greuously punished god againe reade xiiii chapter ye v boke eusebyus concernynge montanus heresy shalte thou vnderstande place muche better texte cogregacyons shal knowe searcheth reynes hertes wyll geue vnto euery one accordinge vnto worckes vnto saye vnto thyatira many haue learnynge haue knowen dep ne satan saye wyl put vpon none burthen whiche ye haue alreadye holde fast tyll come whosoeuer ouercommeth kepeth worckes vnto ende wyl geue power ouer nacions shal rule wt rodde yron vessel porter shal broke sheuers uen receaued father wyll geue mornynge starre let hathe eares heare sprete sayth congregacions rightuous dreadfull seuere iudgement god shall faithfull knowledge prayse shal kepe selues suche blasphemy preuent wrath indignacio god obey folowe wel muche heare parceaue god one knoweth pryuities harte wycked frutes spryng shall iustyce equite punyshed whiche eyther thiatira el stycke cleaue stedfastly vnto worde wyll god forsakynge wycked fynde refusynge haue thing hym doe woulde haue ouerladen sayeth god outwarde ceremonyes iewyshe ordinaunces faith loue accordynge vnto doctrine gospell agreable vnto shall sufficient bothe saluacion also christen godly lyfe seruice pleaseth whiche wil rewarde whiche seruice also heathen whan see shal confesse knowledge good godly true ryght god seruice beyng ouercome infidelyte mysbelefe shall fynde harte consent vnto receyue shall obedient vnto gospell forsakynge heathnysshe maners al false god seruice euen holy prophetes haue sayde long synce come passe grace mercy god also promysed vnto heathen thorowe christe come also length one harte mynde beholde mornyng starre christ holsome gospell shoulde lyfe thorowe faithe lyfe euerlastynge kyngdome christ heauenly ierusalem receyue fruicion euerlastynge eternall rich god al electe ende geueth earnest exhortacion doe good esche euyll maye obteyne saluacion auoyde damnacion dothe lykewyse place iii chapter texte p wryte vnto messenger congregacion sardis sayeth hathe seuen spirires god seuen starres know thy worckes thou hast name thou lyuest thou art dead awake strength thinges whiche remayne readie dye haue founde thy worckes perfecte god remember therfore thou hast receaued hearde holde fast repente thou shalt watche wyll come e thou shalte knowe houre wyll come vpon al dothe christe speake ful al gyftes holy goost without measure dystributeth gyftes thorow spirite vnto church faythfull ouerseers christe congregacio hipocrisye outwardeshyne godnes thoughe neuer ful pompe solemnitie value god wyll haue faith loue whiche pythe strength lyfe infydelitie death faythe loue must man vse haue selfe lone must also moue men vnto thorow instruccio good example lyfe thorow praier ala great lacke true faith churche whiche thynge maye well perceyued workes fruites sene appeare lytle earnest zeale feruentnes sene furtherynge true vertue godlynes true honour god done pure conscience folowynge practisynge doctrine gospell receyued apostle lytle zeale say professynge folowynge gospell worde lyfe together fewe whiche whan spye thing amysse selues doe earnestlye studye reforme amende inforce selues dilygence lyue godlynes continuallye founde wakynge vertuous exercyses necessarye al faythfull seyng glorious commynge christ shal sodenly come vpo tell howe soone texte p thou hast name sardis whiche haue defyled theyr garmentes shall walke whyte worthye ouercometh shalbe thus clothed whyte araye wyll put name booke lyfe wyl confesse name father angel let hathe eares heare spirite sayth vnto congregacions small nomber amonge whiche doe lyue innocently godlye studyeng dyligently lyue wyll pleasure small nombre worthye great honour wherwith shal also indewe blessed immortalitie eternall saluacion mere grace mercye aboue al desertes whiche vnperfyte yf shoulde tryed examinedthe whyte araye iust iudgement god althoughe thorowe grace shalbe taken acceptable worthye whyte araye dothe sygnifye innocent lyfe without maner blemyshe whiche neyther obteyned lyfe yet vertue power man innocencye purenes christ whiche hath ouerhande thorowe god spirite shalbe dystrybuted vnto faithfull suche wyse shalbe partaker therof texte p wryte vnto angel congregacion philadelphia saythe holy true whiche hathe keye dauid whiche openeth man shutteth shutteth openeth know thy worckes beholde haue set thee ope dore man shut thou hast lytell strength hast kept sayinges hast denyed name beholde make congregacion sathan whiche call selues iewes doe lye beholde wyll make shall come worshpype thy fete shal knowe haue loued thou haste kepte wordes pacience therfore wyll kepe houre temptacion whiche wyll come vpon worlde tempte dwell vpon earthe beholde come shortly holde whiche thou haste man take awaye thy crowne ouercommeth wyll make pyllar temple god shall go nomore wyll wryte vpon name god name cytie god newe ierusalem commeth downe heauen god wy vpon newe name let hath eares heare spirite sayth vnto congregacions perfyght vnderstanding booke lacke dyuers story eyther nothyng elles littell regarded fyrste beginnyng chrystendome el shoulde haue hearde read muche comendacion written churche whiche maye well perceyued dyd wonderfull excellentlye handle selfe faithe doctrine gospell suffred muche also therfore alwaies ouercame assaultes iewes heretykes false teacher whiche length dyd confounde thorowe helpe god proceded went forwarde godlynes whiche thus commended christe place christe himselfe onely hath power thorowe spirite assure stablyshe conscience man true doctrine right faythe also quietnes mynde vnto whome hathe geuen spirite taken instrumentes minister onely accordynge vnto spirite nother wyse cause without spirite onely doth serche iudge secretes man harte suche matter parteynynge vnto faythe relygion god quietnes man conscience well rightly determyned openthe open dore doore wherof speaketh worde god holy gospell whiche churche maye worke bryng passe muche profyte honour vnto god lorde whiche shall conuerted thereby vnto true christen fayth well iewes also heathen shall enemyes god able hynder withall theyr myghte power symple weake soeuer minister god behalfe shall seme appeare worketh strong myghtie ouercome whan shall see tyme shall onely humble brynge downe heathen turne vnto true fayth shall also dysmaye iewes whan shall see theyr honour temple god seruyce vtterly destroyed ouerthrowen word knowledge god onely creator thinges sprede abrode thorowout al world tyme shall compelled confesse onely child abraham whiche circumcised theyr bodyes true faith spirite trueth doe honour inuocate god creator heauen earth god patriarkes offeringe vp vnto euerywhere euerye season continually sacrifice onely lefte offred namely sacrifyce thankes geuynge fayth beyng garnyshed workes godlynes shall appeare made manyfest thorow pacience holy martirs whiche many congregacions haue suffered dayly persecuted tyrannes god sake denyeng false god seruyce beyng greuouslye assaulted thorowout whole world onely philadelphya whiche mencioned named onely example vnto suche lyke vnto wherefore whosoeuer hathe grace constant stedfast faythe let praye vnto god perseueraunce maye obteyne croune whiche god hath promysed vnto suche stedfast postes doe onely stande fast sure also able wyllyng vpholde whole foundacion byldyng churche shall set heuenly tabernacle god shalbe garnyshed name tytles honour euerlastynge blisse whiche shall newe ierusalem heue ly golden citye blyssed holy citizyns shall dwell kyngdome christe texte p vnto messenger congregacion whiche laodicia wryte sayth amen faythfull true wytnesse begynnynge creature god know thy worckes thou art nether colde hotte woulde thou colde hotte thou arte betwene bothe nether colde hotte wyll spewe mouthe thou sayest ryche increasyd goodes haue neade nothinge knowest thou art wretched myserable poore blynde naked councell bye golde tryed fyre thou mayest riche whyte rayment thou mayest clothed thy fylthy nakednesse appeare anoynt thyne eye eye salue thou mayest se manye loue rebuke chasten feruent therfore repent beholde stande dore knocke eny man heare voyce open dore wyll come wyll suppe ouercommeth wil graunt syt seate eue ouercame haue sitten father seate let hath eares heare spirite sayeth vnto congregacions sauiour christe hath many sondry name called amen faithfulnes trueth refuge safegarde faithfull creature begynnynge without begynnynge euerlastyng wysdome god marke hyghly god dyspleased suche indyfferent neyther colde whiche wyll wyll consyderynge earnest wil commau dement god wyll suffer nothynge sake content onely shyne shadowe godlynes onely name faythe obedyence god christ wyll haue feruent earnest zeale namely golde stedfast constante fayth maner affliccion aduersitie whyte garmetes innocencie purenes lyfe whole conuersacion god man bryght clere iyes christen doctrine without manner errour man beyng riche maner may walke god churche worshyp honestye without dread whan mysfortune worlde dothe happen vnto faythfull ought thynke vpon wordes thankefull vnto god true faythe charite alwayes studyeng amende lyues true repentaunce lorde muche ready gyue desyre receyue delyghteth vertuous godly harte gyueth comforte loue hope strengthneth faith maye able continue remayne without dreade grace fauour god ye ryght supper spirite god withal faithfull beleuers world blysse heauen shal fruicion possession goodnes hyghest honour vnspeakable ioye god withal holy sainctes whiche euer haue lyued vertuously fauour god p iiii chapter texte p loked beholde dore open heauen first voyce hearde trompet talkynge whiche sayde come vp hyther wyll shewe thinges must fulfylled herafter immediatly spirite beholde seate set heauen one sate seate sate loke vpon lyke vnto
